It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024

Headline: Sensex ends 400 points higher, Nifty jumps as heavyweight stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 498.58 points to end at 78,540.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 165.95 points to close at 23,753.45.
Content: Benchmark indices closed higher on Monday, adding nearly Rs 3 lakh crore to investor wealth, driven by gains in banking, metal, and real estate stocks. The S&P BSE Sensex rose 498.58 points to settle at 78,540.17, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 165.95 points to close at 23,753.45. "Weekend developments from the latest GST Council meeting influenced sectoral movements. Stocks like ITC surged as the council did not hike taxes on tobacco-related products, contrary to market expectations. However, insurance stocks fell after the council deferred the decision to reduce GST on life and health insurance plans," said Satish Chandra Aluri from Lemonn Markets Desk. "The auto sector also underperformed following the announcement of an 18% GST on all used and old vehicles, including EVs, sold by registered sellers," said he added.  Top gainers included JSW Steel, up 2.36%, ITC with a 2.12% rise, Hindalco gaining 1.87%, Trent advancing 1.73%, and HDFC Bank climbing 1.72%. Meanwhile, Hero MotoCorp dropped 1.50%, Maruti Suzuki fell 0.84%, Honeywell Automation dipped 0.55%, HDFC Life declined 0.53%, and Bajaj Finserv slid 0.43%. "Realty outperformed, followed by PSU Banks and BankNifty, while Media and Auto lagged. Broader markets saw selling pressure, with small caps ending in red, though midcaps held steady," said Aditya Gaggar, Director at Progressive Shares. On the technical front, the Nifty formed a doji candlestick pattern and remained below its 200-day EMA, signaling bearish sentiment. "A sell-on-rise strategy may be beneficial, with expected support for Nifty between 23,510 and 23,400 and resistance near 23,940 and 24,000 in the next session," said VLA Ambala, Co-Founder of Stock Market Today.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 23, 2024Must Watch

Headline: IPOs in 2024: Big ticket listings that failed to impressRecord-breaking IPOs in India coexist with the struggles of billion-dollar listings, reflecting both market resilience and investor caution.
Content: India’s IPO (Initial Public Offering) market has witnessed remarkable growth over the past decade, with companies raising record-breaking funds. Yet, not every debut has sustained its billion-dollar momentum. At least eight IPOs with billion-dollar valuations struggled post-launch, leaving investors counting their losses.BILLION-DOLLAR IPOS THAT LOST THEIR SHINE According to a report by Motilal Oswal, several prominent companies, including Indigo Paints, Ujjivan Small Finance Bank (SFB), Powergrid Infrastructure Investment Trust, and Chemplast Sanmar, have slipped below their debut valuations. Indigo Paints debuted in January 2021 with a $2.03 billion market cap but now stands at $0.82 billion—less than half its initial valuation. Ujjivan SFB went public in December 2019 with a $1.36 billion valuation, but has since dropped to $0.81 billion. Operational challenges, market corrections, and sector-specific headwinds have significantly eroded these valuations. Similarly, Powergrid Infrastructure Investment Trust and Chemplast Sanmar, which debuted with $1.28 billion and $1.14 billion market caps, respectively, now hover below the billion-dollar mark. Other names in this list include Juniper Hotels, TVS Supply Chain Solutions, and TN Mercantile Bank.IPO MARKET RESILIENCE AMID SETBACKS Despite these setbacks, the Indian IPO market has continued to thrive. This year alone, companies raised a record Rs 1.8 lakh crore through 317 IPOs, surpassing the Rs 1.3 lakh crore raised in CY21. The contribution of IPOs to market capitalisation increased to 2.9% in CY24 from 1.4% in CY23, although it still lags behind the highs of CY17 (3.7%) and CY21 (3.4%). E-commerce, telecom, and retail sectors have driven recent IPO success, reflecting India’s growing digital economy and consumer base. Meanwhile, cyclical sectors like capital goods and real estate have seen fluctuating participation due to market dynamics.THE DUALITY OF SUCCESS India’s IPO market showcases both immense potential and inherent risks. While the record fundraising highlights investor confidence, the struggles of once-billion-dollar IPOs remind us that market dynamics can quickly change fortunes. Investors must tread cautiously, balancing optimism with vigilance.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Dec 23, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Mamata Machinery IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Mamata Machinery IPO allotment: Investors who have bid can check their allotment status online by logging in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.
Content: Allotment of shares for Mamata Machinery IPO (initial public offering) is expected to be finalised on Tuesday after the public listing saw massive interest from investors over its 3-day bidding process.  Mamata Machinery IPO was subscribed close to almost 200 times. The IPO saw an overwhelming response, with a subscription rate of 194.95 times by the end of December 23, 2024, the third and final day of bidding. The retail investor category recorded a subscription of 138.08 times, while the qualified institutional buyers (QIB) segment was subscribed 235.88 times. The non-institutional investors (NII) category witnessed the highest interest, with a subscription of 274.38 times. Mamata Machinery IPO opened for bidding on December 19, 2024 looking to raise Rs 179.39 crore through its listing. The price band for the IPO was set between Rs 230 and Rs 243 per share. Investors could apply for a minimum lot size of 61 shares, which required a retail investment of Rs 14,823. Investors who have bid for Mamata Machinery IPO can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.HOW TO CHECK ALLOTMENT STATUS If you’ve applied for the Mamata Machinery IPO, you can check your allotment status online in a few simple steps:STEPS TO CHECK ALLOTMENT THROUGH THE BSE WEBSITE Go to the BSE website by clicking here. Click on 'Equity'. Choose 'Mamata Machinery Limited' from the list. Put in your application number and PAN card ID. Confirm that you're not a robot and submit.STEPS TO CHECK ALLOTMENT THROUGH LINK INTIME LIMITED Visit the Link Intime India Private Ltd website. Select 'Mamata Machinery Limited'. Choose the Application Number/Demat Account/PAN option and enter the details. Enter the Captcha. Click on the 'SUBMIT' option.LATEST GMP FOR MAMATA MACHINERY IPO The Grey Market Premium (GMP) for Mamata Machinery's IPO, as of 6:56 AM on December 24, 2024, stands at Rs 260. Considering the IPO's price band of Rs 243, the estimated listing price is projected to be Rs 503. This figure is calculated by adding the GMP to the cap price of the issue. Based on this estimation, the potential gain per share is approximately 107%. Investors who receive allotments will see the company’s shares debut on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and National Stock Exchange (NSE) on Friday, December 27, 2024.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Stocks to watch today: Wipro, Vedanta, Adani Enterprises, TVS Motor Several companies are expected to remain in focus due to recent developments. Among them are Vedanta, Prestige Estates, Wipro, Adani Enterprises, and TVS Motor.
Content:
The stock market showed signs of recovery, with benchmark indices closing higher on Monday. The S&P BSE Sensex gained 498.58 points, ending at 78,540.17, while the NSE Nifty50 advanced 165.95 points to close at 23,753.45. This rise added nearly Rs 3 lakh crore to investor wealth, driven by positive performance in banking, metal, and real estate stocks. As trading resumes today, several companies are expected to remain in focus due to recent developments. Among them are Vedanta, Prestige Estates, Wipro, Adani Enterprises, and TVS Motor. Vedanta
Vedanta Ltd will turn ex-dividend today, December 24. The company had declared a fourth interim dividend of Rs 8.50 per share, amounting to Rs 3,324 crore. The record date for determining eligible shareholders is today, while the dividend will be paid on January 15, 2025. Prestige Estates
Prestige Estates is in the spotlight as the company, along with RC Group and Valor Estate, is reportedly in advanced discussions to undertake one of Mumbai’s largest cluster redevelopment projects involving public housing colonies. Bharat Forge
Bharat Forge plans to invest $64.50 million in its subsidiary Bharat Forge America Inc., signalling further expansion in its international operations. TVS Motor
TVS Motor has completed its acquisition of an additional 39.11% stake in DriveX, increasing its total holding in the company to 87.38%. This move strengthens TVS Motor’s position in the shared mobility sector. HG Infra
HG Infra’s subsidiary, HG Banaskantha Bess, has entered into a battery energy storage purchase agreement with NTPC Vidyut Vyapar Nigam. This agreement secures procurement of 185 MW/370 MWH on a long-term basis, enhancing its energy storage capabilities. Symphony
Symphony has amended its loan agreement with its Australian arm, Symphony AU Pty. The agreement now includes an increased funding size of AUD 15 million, which will support the company’s international operations. Wipro
Wipro announced that Ranjita Ghosh will take over as its global chief marketing officer starting February 2025. This leadership change is expected to steer the company’s marketing strategies on a global scale. Adani Enterprises
Adani Enterprises has finalised the acquisition of Air Works, India’s largest private aviation maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO) services firm. The deal was completed for an enterprise value of Rs 400 crore, further expanding Adani Group’s footprint in the aviation sector. MIC Electronics
MIC Electronics received approval from the Competent Authority for capacity and capability assessments for GPS-based public address and passenger information systems (PAPIS) and LED destination boards for use in both AC and Non-AC coaches.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open flat as market rally loses steam; TCS gains 1% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.25 points to 78,587.42, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 10.80 points to 23,764.25 as of 9:30 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened flat on Tuesday after having witnessed a brief rally in the previous session, dragged by banking and metal stocks in early trade.  The S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.25 points to 78,587.42, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 10.80 points to 23,764.25 as of 9:30 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that the relief rally witnessed yesterday is unlikely to have a free run up in the coming days. "Two sets of factors-external and internal-will restrain a sustained rally. Externally, the strong dollar and high bond yields in the US will prompt the FIIs to sell on rallies. Internally, the growth and earnings slowdown will be near-term negatives that will restrain the bulls. The high valuations in the market in this challenging macro backdrop cannot favour a PE expansion which can take the market significantly higher," he added.  The top gainers were Tata Consultancy Services, which rose 0.95%, Britannia Industries increasing 0.75%, Tata Motors gaining 0.69%, Infosys advancing 0.49%, and Nestlend up 0.45%. On the downside, JSW Steel fell 0.81%, Shriram Finance declined 0.76%, Trent dropped 0.58%, CIPLA decreased 0.54%, and Tata Steel lost 0.52%. "Investors should prioritise safety over returns in the current context. Fairly valued segments like largecap financials, sectors like pharma and IT which will have stable demand, and fast-growing segments like digital stocks are likely to remain relatively resilient in a challenging environment," said Vijayakumar.  The gainers included Nifty Auto rising 0.28%, Nifty FMCG up 0.26%, Nifty IT increasing 0.35%, Nifty Media advancing 0.05%, Nifty Oil & Gas gaining 0.26%, Nifty Healthcare Index up 0.02%, and Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom rising 0.07%. On the downside, Nifty Bank fell 0.13%, Nifty Financial Services declined 0.08%, Nifty Financial Services 25/50 dropped 0.06%, Nifty Metal decreased 0.58%, Nifty Pharma lost 0.11%, Nifty PSU Bank dipped 0.05%, Nifty Private Bank declined 0.13%, Nifty Realty fell 0.05%, Nifty Consumer Durables dropped 0.19%, Nifty Midsmall Healthcare decreased 0.34%, Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank lost 0.15%, and Nifty Midsmall Financial Services declined 0.42%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024Must Watch

Considering the price band is set at Rs 643, the IPO's anticipated listing price is estimated at Rs 697. This figure is derived by adding the cap price of the issue to the current GMP. Headline: Are stock markets closed on December 25? Check the full 2025 holiday scheduleOn regular weekdays, the stock market operates from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM. A pre-opening session takes place from 9:00 AM to 9:15 AM to set the tone for the trading day.
Content: The stock markets, including the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE), will remain closed on Wednesday, December 25, 2024, in observance of Christmas. This holiday marks the last stock market holiday of the year. Along with Indian markets, major global stock exchanges in countries like the United States, the United Kingdom, and across Europe will also remain closed. Both the BSE and NSE will suspend trading across all segments, including equities, derivatives, and securities lending and borrowing (SLB) on December 25. Furthermore, the commodity markets, including the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) and the National Commodity & Derivatives Exchange (NCDEX), will also remain shut for both morning and evening sessions. Trading will resume as usual on Thursday, December 26, 2024. 2025 stock market holiday calendar The stock market holiday schedule for 2025 includes several national and religious holidays. The markets will close on February 26 for Mahashivratri, March 14 for Holi, and March 31 for Id-Ul-Fitr (Ramadan Eid). In April, there are closures on April 10 for Shri Mahavir Jayanti, April 14 for Dr Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti, and April 18 for Good Friday. Maharashtra Day on May 1 and Independence Day on August 15 are also holidays. Later in August, the market will be shut on August 27 for Ganesh Chaturthi. October has three holidays, including Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti/Dussehra on October 2, Diwali Laxmi Pujan on October 21, and Diwali Balipratipada on October 22. November 5 is reserved for Prakash Gurpurb Sri Guru Nanak Dev. Christmas on December 25 will again mark the final holiday for 2025. In addition, the markets will hold Muhurat Trading on Tuesday, October 21, 2025, during Diwali. The exact timings for this special trading session will be announced later. On regular weekdays, the Indian stock market operates from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM. A pre-opening session takes place from 9:00 AM to 9:15 AM to set the tone for the trading day. The market is closed on Saturdays and Sundays.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Which Indian insurance companies reject claims the least? Report reveals truthPeople don't just put in money but trust when they buy insurance policies to cover for medical emergencies or motor accidents. A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.
Content: People buy general insurance to cover for emergencies so that they do not have to make out-of-pocket hefty payments. They do not just put their money in, but trust while paying premiums. However, not all claims get approved. A recent report reveals that the claim-to-settlement ratio, which shows how many claims were honoured by insurers, in 2022-23 at 86%, which is down from the 87% in FY22. The detailed report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India (IBAI) from data presented by insurance companies reveals that claims repudiation ratio rose to 6% for general insurance, which includes coverage for motor, health, fire and marine cargo. This is the claim rejected by an insurance company as a proportion of the total claims made by its policy buyers. Public sector insurer New India Assurance has the lowest claims repudiation ratio of 0.2%. Other big private insurers with lower rates of claims rejection are HDFC Ergo, Future Generali, Aditya Birla Health and Shriram. Insurance watchdog IRDAI makes it mandatory for insurance companies to put out settlements and rejection data on their websites. The IBAI has collated the data from insurers and put it in a report, which could help people make informed choices about a company's track record while buying insurance policies. In the Policyholder's Handbook, the IBAI has classified the general insurers into four categories -- Public Sector General Insurers, Large Private Sector General Insurers, Other Private Sector Insurers, and Standalone Health Insurers. In the health insurance category too, New India Assurance came on top among the public insurers with a claim-settlement ratio of 95%. Aditya Birla Health, with a claim settlement ratio of 95%, was the best among standalone health insurers. Iffco Tokio and Bajaj Allianz were among the top large private sector general insurers with the best claims-to-settlement ratio of 90% or more, according to the IBAI handbook. What has to be remembered in the case of health insurance is that it is combined data for group (corporate) and individual policies. Claim-rejection rates are historically lower in the case of corporate policies. "Irdai does not give data for individual and group claims separately. Why not? Who is it protecting," asked author-influencer Monika Halan. The real picture will emerge when separate claim-settlement data is available for individual health insurance policies. According to experts, incomplete or false disclosure, consciously or unconsciously, at the time of purchase of policies also contribute to rejection of claims.   In settling motor vehicle own-damage claims too, New India Assurance was the best public insurer with a claim-settlement ratio of 92%. Among large private sector insurers when it came to own-damage claim settlement, Royal Sundaram, Go Digit and SBI General came on top. Future Generali was the top among small insurers. The insurance coverage, be it life or general, is low in India but the tax on insurance premiums, at 18%, is high. In India, insurance penetration is at 30%, and low in comparison to developed countries, like the US, where it is over 90%. Though there is no social security net and government medical infrastructure is rickety, the high 18% GST on insurance premiums defies logic. Many users settle for a smaller cover due to high premiums, experts have told India Today Digital. Several reform measures are needed for the growth of the insurance industry and relief for people so that they can get better cover for themselves. Not just in terms of reduction of tax, there is a need for segregated data on claim-settlement ratios for individual and group policies for people to make an informed choice.Published By: Sushim MukulPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Carraro India IPO: Check GMP, price band and subscription statusCarraro India IPO is a Rs 1,250 crore offer for sale (OFS) consisting of 1.77 crore shares. As this is a pure OFS, the entire proceeds will go to the selling shareholders, and the company will not raise fresh capital.
Content: The Carraro India IPO, which opened for subscription on December 20, has seen a lukewarm response so far. Only 28% of the issue was subscribed to over the first two days. The retail investor segment saw the highest response among the subscription categories, reaching 35%, while no category has been fully subscribed yet. The IPO is a Rs 1,250 crore offer for sale (OFS) consisting of 1.77 crore shares. As this is a pure OFS, the entire proceeds will go to the selling shareholders, and the company will not raise fresh capital.advertisementPRICE BAND AND LOT SIZE The IPO is priced between Rs 668 and Rs 704 per share. Investors can bid for a minimum of 21 shares in a single lot and in multiples thereafter.KEY DATES The IPO closes on December 24, with allotments expected to be finalised on December 26. Shares are likely to list on December 30. Investors are advised to evaluate long-term prospects while considering the IPO amid muted initial subscription trends.GMP UPDATE The grey market premium (GMP) for Carraro India shares remains nil, both before and during the IPO, signaling weak demand in the unofficial market.BROKERAGE VIEWS Despite the subdued response in the grey market, analysts have issued positive recommendations for long-term investors. Bajaj Broking noted the company’s strong financial performance, robust market presence, and favorable industry trends as key reasons to consider the IPO. “Carraro India's ability to sustain growth, innovate, and adapt to changing market dynamics positions it well for future success,” the brokerage added.ABOUT CARRARO INDIA Carraro India manufactures transmission systems, including axles and gears, for agricultural and off-highway vehicles. Its facilities in Pune, Maharashtra, include an 84,000-square-meter driveline manufacturing plant and a 78,000-square-meter gear production unit. For FY24, the company reported a 4% rise in revenue from operations, reaching Rs 1,770 crore, driven by increased product sales. Profit after tax surged 29% year-on-year to Rs 60.58 crore.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Latest subscription status, GMP; listing dateThe IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Senores Pharmaceuticals is set to close for bidding on Tuesday, December 24, 2024, after opening for subscription on Friday. Headline: Sagility India share price rises 5% to hit upper circuit today. Here's why Sagility India debuted on the stock market with an issue price of Rs 30 per share. At its current level, the stock has surged over 63% from the IPO price, underscoring strong investor interest.
Content: Shares of IT-enabled services firm Sagility India (SIL) soared 5% in early trade on Tuesday, hitting the upper circuit at Rs 48.91 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The stock also marked a fresh 52-week high, continuing its strong post-listing performance since debuting in November this year. The rally followed a bullish note from global brokerage JP Morgan, which initiated coverage on Sagility India with an 'overweight' rating and a target price of â‚¹54. This target implies a potential upside of 16% from the previous close. JP Morgan highlighted the company's robust fundamentals, citing an 18% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) in adjusted earnings over FY24-27E, driven by increasing outsourcing in the U.S. healthcare sector. The brokerage noted that Sagility India benefits from deep domain expertise and solid client relationships, which are expected to boost revenue growth. Additionally, the company's strong structural EBIT margins, supported by a higher offshore mix, make it competitive among mid-cap peers. JP Morgan also underlined Sagility’s strategic position in the under-penetrated U.S. healthcare outsourcing market, which stands at just 22% penetration. The brokerage sees Sagility growing its market share by 15%, outperforming the broader healthcare outsourcing market growth rate of 9%. It added that Sagility's focus on non-discretionary operations spending provides a stable revenue profile compared to larger IT and BPO service providers. However, the note flagged key risks, including high client concentration, potential in-sourcing by top clients, regulatory changes in the U.S. healthcare sector, and aggressive adoption of generative AI that could disrupt the market. Sagility India debuted on the stock market with an issue price of Rs 30 per share. At its current level, the stock has surged over 63% from the IPO price, underscoring strong investor interest. The IPO itself saw robust demand, being subscribed 3.2 times, with retail investors leading the charge. Earlier, Jefferies Equity Research also initiated coverage on the company, citing its strong positioning as a leading U.S.-focused business process management firm specialising in healthcare services. Since listing on November 12, Sagility India shares have risen 59%, reflecting optimism over its growth prospects. Analysts tracking the stock have a 'buy' rating, with Bloomberg data indicating an average 12-month price target suggesting a further 13.7% upside.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Apple nears $4 trillion valuation amid AI push and iPhone upgrade hopesApple's strategic push into AI and its resilience in navigating market challenges have positioned the tech giant as a leader in the sector.
Content: Technology giant and iPhone maker Apple is edging closer to an extraordinary milestone, with its market valuation nearing $4 trillion. Investor confidence in the company’s artificial intelligence (AI) advancements and expectations of a new iPhone upgrade cycle have fuelled a 16% surge in its stock since November, adding $500 billion to its market capitalisation. Currently valued at $3.86 trillion, Apple’s market cap surpasses the combined worth of the leading stock indices of Germany and Switzerland. The strong rally reflects the growing optimism about Apple’s evolving AI strategy and its potential to reinvigorate product demand.advertisementAPPLE'S AI PUSHIn December, Apple began incorporating OpenAI’s ChatGPT into its devices, part of its broader initiative to integrate generative AI into its app ecosystem—a strategy announced earlier in June. Analysts view this move as pivotal, particularly in addressing lackluster demand for the iPhone 16 series during the holiday season. In December, Apple began incorporating OpenAI’s ChatGPT into its devices, part of its broader initiative to integrate generative AI into its app ecosystem—a strategy announced earlier in June. Analysts view this move as pivotal, particularly in addressing lackluster demand for the iPhone 16 series during the holiday season. Speaking to news agency Reuters, Tom Forte, an analyst at Maxim Group, attributed the market’s enthusiasm to Apple’s AI progress and the possibility of a “supercycle” of iPhone upgrades. Similarly, Morgan Stanley’s Erik Woodring forecasted a recovery in iPhone sales by 2025, driven by the expanded rollout of Apple’s AI features. Woodring reiterated Apple as Morgan Stanley’s top investment pick for the year ahead. Despite these advancements, Apple’s immediate revenue growth for the fiscal first quarter is projected to remain modest. Meanwhile, its price-to-earnings ratio has reached 33.5, the highest in nearly three years, eclipsing major tech competitors like Microsoft and Nvidia. This elevated valuation has sparked concerns over inflated stock prices, prompting Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway to reduce its Apple holdings. Even with potential headwinds, such as the possibility of new tariffs on Chinese imports under the incoming U.S. administration, analysts remain optimistic. Past exemptions secured by Apple during prior tariff rounds provide hope for minimal disruptions. Apple’s strategic push into AI and its resilience in navigating market challenges have positioned the tech giant as a leader in the sector. As the company inches closer to the historic $4 trillion valuation, it continues to captivate investor confidence and maintain its dominance in the global marketPublished By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Greaves Cotton share price gains over 10% today. What's behind the rally? Greaves Cotton stock price: The company's shares were trading 10.25% higher at Rs 252.70 on the BSE at 12:18 pm.
Content: Shares of Greaves Cotton Ltd surged over 10% on Tuesday, reaching a day's high of Rs 257 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Greaves Cotton shares were trading 10.25% higher at Rs 252.70 on the BSE at 12:18 pm. The rise comes after an announcement that its material subsidiary, Greaves Electric Mobility Limited (GEML), has filed a draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) for its initial public offering (IPO). The development has fuelled significant interest among investors, with the stock already rallying 46% over the past month. In response to the price movement, Greaves Cotton reiterated previous disclosures made on December 1 and December 11, confirming that it currently has no additional updates to share regarding factors influencing the stock’s performance. The IPO proposal for GEML includes a fresh issue of equity shares aggregating up to Rs 1,000 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) by the parent company and Abdul Latif Jameel Green Mobility Solutions DMCC. While the specific pricing and valuation details are yet to be finalized, the company stated that these would be determined based on applicable laws, market conditions, and GEML’s valuation closer to the IPO launch. The IPO filing is a key step for Greaves Electric Mobility, which plays a significant role in Greaves Cotton’s portfolio and has been instrumental in driving its growth. As one of the leading players in India’s electric vehicle space, GEML is strategically positioned to benefit from the growing demand for sustainable mobility solutions. The IPO news highlights Greaves Cotton’s efforts to unlock value in the rapidly expanding electric vehicle market. Investors have responded positively to this announcement, with the strong rally in Greaves Cotton’s share price reflecting optimism about the potential of GEML’s market debut. Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Explained: Why Tata Investment share price jumped 12% todayTata Investment stock price: At 11:53 am, shares of the company were up 11.51% to Rs 7,284 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The surge followed reports that Tata Capital is gearing up for an initial public offering (IPO) worth Rs 15,000 crore.
Content: Shares of Tata Investment Corporation Limited (TICL) rallied 12% in early trade on Tuesday after media reports indicated that the Tata Group has initiated preparations for the IPO of Tata Capital, its flagship financial services arm.  At 11:53 am, shares of Tata Investment were up 11.51% to Rs 7,284 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The surge followed reports that Tata Capital is gearing up for an initial public offering (IPO) worth Rs 15,000 crore. The IPO will aim to comply with regulatory norms and is expected to be one of the largest public offerings in the Indian market. Law firm Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas and investment bank Kotak Mahindra Capital have reportedly been appointed as advisors for the proposed deal. In October, the RBI approved the merger of Tata Capital with Tata Motors Finance Limited (TMFL), creating India’s 12th-largest NBFC. This no-objection approval by the central bank sets the stage for Tata Capital’s public listing. Regulatory filings suggest that Tata Capital could list by September 2024, well ahead of the 2025 deadline. Tata Investment Corporation is one of the largest shareholders of Tata Sons, the holding company for Tata Capital. TICL’s close association with Tata Sons explains the strong investor interest in its shares, given the anticipated value unlock from the Tata Capital IPO. The Tata Group’s most recent IPO, Tata Technologies, delivered a stellar performance in the secondary market. Listed on November 30, 2023, Tata Technologies’ shares debuted with a 140% premium to their issue price of Rs 500. The IPO, entirely an offer for sale (OFS), was subscribed 69.43 times, reflecting robust investor appetite for Tata Group offerings. Tata Technologies was the first IPO from the group in nearly two decades, with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) being the previous IPO in 2004. The Tata Capital IPO marks another milestone for the conglomerate, highlighting its commitment to enhancing transparency and unlocking value for investors. As preparations for the Tata Capital IPO advance, market participants remain optimistic about the potential impact on Tata Group entities. The rally in TICL shares underscores growing anticipation for what could be one of India’s most significant IPOs in recent years.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Who is Aakash Chaudhry? Zerodha, Zomato founders bet on Sparkl EdventureInvestors include Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal and Zerodha founder Nithin Kamath, who have backed the platform that aims to transform personalised learning for students.
Content: Aakash Chaudhry, a well-known name in India’s education sector, has raised $4 million for his new venture, Sparkl Edventure. Investors include Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal and Zerodha founder Nithin Kamath, who have backed the platform that aims to transform personalised learning for students. Sparkl, launched just two months ago, is Chaudhry’s major project since the $1 billion sale of his previous firm, Aakash Educational Services Limited (AESL), to Byju’s in 2021. Chaudhry, who serves as founder and managing director of Sparkl, said the platform’s mission is to deliver one-on-one, personalised tutoring tailored to the unique needs of each student. “Our vision at Sparkl is to empower students with personalised, one-on-one learning that adapts to their individual needs. With the support of visionary leaders like Nithin Kamath and Deepinder Goyal, we are poised to revolutionise the tutoring landscape,” he said in a statement. Sparkl was co-founded by Chaudhry alongside Pavan Chauhan, the co-founder of meritnation.com, and Ritesh Hemrajani. The team aims to leverage artificial intelligence (AI) and expert teaching to meet the demands of students pursuing international curricula like IB, IGCSE, and A-levels. Zerodha founder and Rainmatter head Nithin Kamath expressed his belief in the potential of personalised education to improve learning outcomes. “I’ve been wondering for a long time if students will have different outcomes if they have access to education that is more personalised and customised. When I heard what Aakash and his team were planning, I was convinced that something like this should be available for students. We are happy to join them in this journey,” Kamath said. Deepinder Goyal of Zomato also participated in this funding round, adding to the growing interest in tech-driven education platforms. Sparkl’s co-founder and CEO, Pavan Chauhan, said the platform is focused on delivering a personalised experience for students. “By focusing on IB, IGCSE, and A-level students, we aim to meet the growing demand for specialised and effective learning solutions. The support from Nithin and Deepinder strengthens our resolve to expand our impact globally,” he said. Chaudhry is no stranger to success in the education industry. As the managing director of AESL, he played a key role in growing the brick-and-mortar test preparation giant, which was known for its coaching services in competitive exams like NEET and JEE. Under his leadership, AESL became a household name, ultimately catching the attention of Byju’s, which acquired the firm in 2021 for nearly $1 billion in a cash-and-stock deal.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Sanathan Textiles IPO allotment: Check step-by-step guide to check statusSanathan Textiles IPO: Investors can verify their allotment status through two platforms: the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the KFin Technologies portal. Here's a step-by-step guide:
Content: Sanathan Textiles is set to finalise the allotment of its IPO shares on Tuesday, December 24. Investors who participated in the offering can expect to receive notifications regarding fund debits or IPO mandate revocations by Thursday, December 26. The IPO, which ran from December 19 to December 23, garnered an overwhelming response from investors. The issue, priced between Rs 305 and Rs 321 per share with a lot size of 46 shares, raised Rs 550 crore. This included a fresh issue worth Rs 400 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of â‚¹150 crore. Sanathan Textiles’ IPO was subscribed 35.12 times overall, reflecting robust demand. The qualified institutional buyer (QIB) portion was subscribed 75.62 times, while non-institutional investors (NIIs) booked 42.21 times their allocation. The retail segment saw 8.93 times subscription. The grey market premium (GMP) for Sanathan Textiles currently stands at â‚¹85-90, indicating potential listing gains of around 26-28%. The company’s shares are scheduled to list on both the BSE and NSE on Friday, December 27.HOW TO CHECK SANATHAN TEXTILES IPO ALLOTMENT STATUS Investors can verify their allotment status through two platforms: the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the KFin Technologies portal. Here’s a step-by-step guide:ON THE BSE WEBSITE Visit the BSE allotment page: BSE IPO Allotment. Select "Equity" under the issue type. Choose "Sanathan Textiles Limited" from the issue name dropdown. Enter your application number and PAN ID. Complete the CAPTCHA and click “Search.”ON THE KFIN TECHNOLOGIES PORTAL Go to the KFinTech allotment page: KFin IPO Allotment. Select "Sanathan Textiles Limited" from the IPO dropdown (visible if allotment is finalized). Choose one of the three identification methods: Application number, Demat account number, or PAN ID. Under application type, select either ASBA or non-ASBA. Provide the required details and complete the CAPTCHA. Click "Submit" to view your allotment status.KEY IPO DETAILS Sanathan Textiles, incorporated in 2005, specialises in polyester yarn manufacturing and is a global supplier of cotton yarn. Its business spans three verticals: polyester yarn, cotton yarn, and technical and industrial yarn products. DAM Capital Advisors and ICICI Securities managed the IPO as lead book runners, with KFin Technologies serving as the registrar. The registrar will handle all investor-related queries and ensure a smooth allotment process.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Tata Capital IPO buzz? All you need to knowIf the IPO goes through, it will be the Tata Group's second public offering in two decades. The last one was Tata Technologies' IPO in November last year.
Content: The Tata Group is preparing for a $2 billion initial public offering (IPO) of its financial services arm, Tata Capital, reported The Economic Times. Discussions with investment bankers have already begun, with Kotak Investment Banking taking the lead. The conglomerate is expected to finalise additional bankers for the process by January next year. The IPO comes as part of a regulatory requirement from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). Under RBI guidelines, Tata Sons and Tata Capital, classified as upper-layer non-banking financial companies (NBFCs), are required to list their shares by September 2025. Tata Sons currently holds a 93% stake in Tata Capital.advertisementSECOND IPO FOR TATA IN TWO DECADESIf the IPO goes through, it will be the Tata Group’s second public offering in two decades. The last one was Tata Technologies’ IPO in November last year, which saw investor interest. Before that, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) launched its IPO in 2004, raising Rs 5,500 crore. If the IPO goes through, it will be the Tata Group’s second public offering in two decades. The last one was Tata Technologies’ IPO in November last year, which saw investor interest. Before that, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) launched its IPO in 2004, raising Rs 5,500 crore. Tata Capital’s unlisted shares have already seen strong demand in the unlisted market. Shares that were priced at Rs 450 in December 2023 surged to Rs 1,100 by April this year. The current trading price is around Rs 900, which values the company at approximately Rs 3.5 lakh crore, based on its 3.74 billion outstanding shares at the end of FY24. Tata Capital is the holding company for the Tata Group’s various lending and investment businesses. These include Tata Capital Financial Services, Tata Capital Housing Finance, Tata Cleantech Capital, Tata Securities, Tata Capital Singapore, and a private equity arm. The company plays a key role in the Tata Group’s operations, providing financial support to suppliers, vendors, and dealers associated with the conglomerate. For the financial year ending March 31, 2024, Tata Capital reported a revenue of Rs 18,178 crore, reflecting a 34% increase from FY23. The company also posted a net profit of Rs 3,315 crore, a 12% rise compared to the previous year. Its net worth stood at Rs 23,417 crore as of March 31, 2024.RBI'S CLASSIFICATION  In September 2022, the RBI classified Tata Capital Financial Services as an upper-layer systemically important NBFC. This classification requires the company to comply with stricter regulatory norms, including mandatory listing within three years. Tata Capital raised Rs 593.80 crore in FY23 through a rights issue, offering shares at Rs 125.10 each. The funds have been utilised to strengthen the company’s financial position and expand its lending and advisory businesses.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: 18% GST on used cars: Will it leave you paying more?The decision has sparked debates as it comes at a time when India's used car market is poised for growth. Many believe the move aims to tap into the rapidly expanding sector to boost government revenue.
Content: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council's decision to increase the GST rate on old and used vehicles to 18% has stirred discussions across the country. The revised rate, announced at the 55th GST Council meeting, applies to all old and used vehicles, including electric vehicles (EVs), sold by registered businesses. However, individuals who are not registered under GST remain unaffected by this change. The decision has sparked debates as it comes at a time when India’s used car market is poised for growth. Many believe the move aims to tap into the rapidly expanding sector to boost government revenue.FINANCE MINISTER'S CLARIFICATION SPARKS CONFUSION While the increase in GST aims to streamline tax rates across different types of vehicles, earlier clarification by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on the issue left buyers and sellers unsure about how the new rates would affect them. The Finance Minister said that GST is calculated on the difference between the actual price and the resale price. "It is on that margin, the value between purchased price and resale price. Bought it for Rs 12 lakh, selling it for Rs 9 lakh in the name of a second-hand used vehicle; on the margin only this 18% has been put," the Finance Minister said.  However, the explanation raised questions about how the margin would be determined and whether the increase in GST would ultimately lead to losses for sellers.WHY WAS 18% GST LEVIED ON SALE OF USED CARS Explaining the decision, Amit Malviya, In-charge of the BJP’s National Information & Technology Department, clarified that the 18% GST is calculated only on the margin earned by dealers—the difference between the sale price and purchase price of the vehicle—and not on the total value of the vehicle. “If the margin is negative, no GST is payable. This approach ensures that the tax reflects the value addition by the dealer, which is considered a service under the GST framework,” Malviya said on X. He further added that taxing the dealer’s margin is not new. “This method was also in place during the UPA era as ‘Service Tax’ and continued until 2017.” Previously, old and used petrol, LPG, or CNG vehicles with an engine capacity of 1200 cc or more, as well as diesel vehicles with engines of 1500 cc or more, were already subject to 18% GST since 2018. Similarly, old and used EVs were taxed at 12%. The latest move standardises the GST rate for all old and used vehicles, including EVs, at 18%.BOOMING USED CAR MARKET The timing of this decision aligns with the rapid growth of India’s used car market. According to the Indian Blue Book 2023 report by Das Welt Auto and Car&Bike, the used car market in India was valued at USD 31.33 billion in 2022-23 and is projected to grow to USD 70.48 billion by 2027-28. The report highlights that the market’s average growth rate, which was 6% between FY2017 and FY2022, is expected to jump to 16% between FY2023 and FY2028. Comparatively, the new car market is expected to grow at a much slower pace of 1% to 6% during the same period. Factors such as a growing middle class, higher disposable incomes, and an increasing demand for personal mobility have contributed to the sector’s rapid expansion. The GST increase is expected to impact businesses involved in the sale of old and used vehicles, particularly dealers who claim depreciation on purchased vehicles. While the tax will not affect individuals buying or selling vehicles privately, businesses will need to factor the higher rate into their pricing strategies.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024

Headline: Sensex, Nifty close lower in a choppy session; IT and metal stocks weighThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 67.30 points to close at 78,472.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 23.35 points to end at 23,730.10.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices closed marginally lower on Tuesday, dragged by a decline in IT, metal and public sector banking stocks.  The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 67.30 points to close at 78,472.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 23.35 points to end at 23,730.10.  Aditya Gaggar Director of Progressive Shares said that after a subdued opening, the Index soared higher under the leadership of the Auto and IT counters but however once again, the level of 23,850 worked as a strong hurdle and the Index reversed to settle the trade at 23,727.65 with a loss of 25.80 points. The top gaining stocks were Tata Motors, which rose 1.79%, Adani Enterprises increasing 1.41%, Eicher Motors gaining 1.04%, Nestlend advancing 0.86%, and BPCL up 0.85%. On the downside, Power Grid Corporation fell 1.68%, JSW Steel declined 1.41%, SBI Life Insurance dropped 1.28%, Titan decreased 1.12%, and Infosys lost 1.09%. "Auto and FMCG were the top performers on a sectoral front while Metal and PSU Banks corrected the most. The disparity was seen in the Broader markets where Midcaps moved in tandem with the Frontline Index while Smallcaps marginally outperformed by ending the day in green. The Index is oscillating in a well-maintained range of 23,650-23,850 and a breakout on either sides is necessary for a concrete inference," he added.  In today's trading session, most sectoral indices on the National Stock Exchange painted a predominantly red picture. The steepest declines were witnessed in Nifty Metal and Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank, which fell 0.73% and 0.62% respectively. Nifty IT and Nifty Media both declined 0.45%, while Nifty Midsmall Financial Services dropped 0.39%. Other indices in the red included Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom (-0.31%), Nifty Realty (-0.28%), Nifty Consumer Durables (-0.28%), Nifty Midsmall Healthcare (-0.14%), and Nifty Financial Services (-0.12%). On the brighter side, a few sectors managed to buck the trend, with Nifty Oil & Gas leading the gainers with a 0.54% rise, followed by Nifty FMCG increasing by 0.44%, Nifty Auto edging up by 0.45%, and Nifty Private Bank rising marginally by 0.17%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 24, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Economy rebounds in Q3 with boost from festivals and rural demand: RBIAn article on the 'State of the Economy' in the December bulletin noted that the global economy continues to exhibit resilience with steady growth and moderating inflation.
Content: The Indian economy is recovering from the slowdown in momentum witnessed in the September quarter, driven by strong festival activity and a sustained upswing in rural demand, according to a Reserve Bank of India (RBI) bulletin released on Tuesday. An article on the 'State of the Economy' in the December bulletin noted that the global economy continues to exhibit resilience with steady growth and moderating inflation. "High frequency indicators (HFIs) for the third quarter of 2024-25 indicate that the Indian economy is recovering from the slowdown in momentum witnessed in Q2, driven by strong festival activity and a sustained upswing in rural demand," it said. The article further said the growth trajectory is poised to lift in the second half of 2024-25, driven mainly by resilient domestic private consumption demand. "Supported by record level foodgrains production, rural demand, in particular, is gaining momentum. Sustained government spending on infrastructure is expected to further stimulate economic activity and investment," the authors said. Global headwinds, however, pose risks to the evolving outlook for growth and inflation, said the article authored by a team led by RBI Deputy Governor Michael Debabrata Patra. India's GDP growth slowed to a seven-quarter low of 5.4 per cent during the July-September period of the current fiscal year. The article said that from the expenditure side, the major factor contributing to the decline in the growth rate of the economy is fixed capital formation and from the production side, the main concern is manufacturing. "Undermining both is inflation. The erosion of purchasing power due to repeated inflation shocks and persisting price pressures is starkly reflected in weakening sales growth of listed non-financial nongovernment corporations," it said. Their outlook on demand conditions also remains subdued as no let-up in the incidence of price shocks seems to be in sight; they will increasingly be inclined to pass on input costs to selling prices. Consequently, there is no robust capacity creation by investing in fixed assets. Instead, corporations are churning and utilising existing capacity to meet the inflation-dented consumer demand, the article said. "The result is lacklustre private investment. The slowdown in consumer demand seems to be associated with slower corporate wage growth," it said. 'The authors further said another headwind emerging is the slowing rate of nominal GDP growth, which could hinder fiscal spending, including on capex, to achieve budgetary deficit and debt targets. The article also noted that as per the projections based on the in-house Dynamic Stochastic General Equilibrium (DSGE), real GDP growth is likely to recover to 6.8 per cent and 6.5 per cent in Q3 and Q4 of 2024-25, respectively. Growth for 2025-26 is projected at 6.7 per cent while headline CPI inflation (retail) is projected to average 3.8 per cent in 2025-26. In the December monetary policy, the RBI had projected the GDP growth for 2024-25 at 6.6 per cent with Q3 at 6.8 per cent; and Q4 at 7.2 per cent. GDP growth for the April quarter of 2025-26 was projected at 6.9 per cent; and Q2 at 7.3 per cent. The RBI said the views expressed in the bulletin are of the authors and do not represent the views of the central bank.Published By: Ashutosh AcharyaPublished On: Dec 24, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Understanding GST on used cars: Rules, examples, and exemptionsThe GST Council clarified rules for old vehicle sales, setting an 18 per cent tax on seller margins, exempting private sales and negative margins, and simplifying taxation for used and electric vehicles, ensuring fair application of GST across transactions.
Content:
The Goods and Services Tax (GST) Council, in its 55th meeting, clarified taxation rules for the sale of old and used vehicles, including electric vehicles (EVs). A uniform GST rate of 18 per cent now applies to such sales, replacing the previous variable rates. Importantly, no new taxes have been introduced for these transactions. GST on the sale of old and used vehicles is applicable only to people or businesses registered for GST and engaged in the purchase and resale of such vehicles. Those not registered for GST are not required to pay the tax.advertisementGST CALCULATION ON USED VEHICLE SALESThe Goods and Services Tax (GST) on old and used vehicles is calculated solely on the seller's margin, not the entire sale price. The margin is determined as the difference between the sale price and the vehicle's depreciated or purchase value, according to guidelines issued by the GST Council. The Goods and Services Tax (GST) on old and used vehicles is calculated solely on the seller's margin, not the entire sale price. The margin is determined as the difference between the sale price and the vehicle's depreciated or purchase value, according to guidelines issued by the GST Council. For sellers who have claimed depreciation under Section 32 of the Income Tax Act, GST is applied only on the margin between the sale price and the depreciated value of the vehicle. In cases where the sale price is lower than the depreciated or purchase value, creating a negative margin, no GST is applicable.EXAMPLES OF GST CALCULATION Officials have outlined clear examples to demonstrate how GST is applied under different scenarios: - Negative margin with depreciation Purchase Price: Rs 20 lakhs
Depreciated Value: Rs 12 lakhs
Selling Price: Rs 10 lakhs
Margin: Negative (Rs 10 lakhs - Rs 12 lakhs = -Rs 2 lakhs)
GST Payable: None.
When the sale price is lower than the depreciated value, no GST is payable. - Negative margin without depreciation Purchase Price: Rs 12 lakhs
Selling Price: Rs 10 lakhs
Margin: Negative (Rs 10 lakhs - Rs 12 lakhs = -Rs 2 lakhs)
GST Payable: None.
Even when depreciation is not claimed, GST is not applicable on a negative margin. - Positive margin Purchase Price: Rs 20 lakhs
Selling Price: Rs 22 lakhs
Margin: Rs 2 lakhs (Rs 22 lakhs - Rs 20 lakhs)
GST Payable: 18 per cent of Rs 2 lakhs = Rs 36,000.
GST is applied at a standard rate of 18 per cent when the margin is positive.  KEY TAKEAWAYS A standard 18% Goods and Services Tax (GST) applies to the sale of used vehicles, including electric vehicles (EVs), simplifying the taxation process for such transactions. GST is payable only by sellers registered under GST laws, such as businesses involved in the purchase and resale of vehicles. Private sales between individuals are exempt from GST, ensuring that the tax burden applies only to commercial transactions. The tax is calculated solely on the seller's margin, defined as the difference between the selling price and the vehicle’s depreciated or purchase value. If the margin is negative — meaning the sale price is lower than the vehicle’s depreciated or purchase value — no GST is payable.Published By: Vadapalli Nithin KumarPublished On: Dec 25, 2024READ |  18% GST on used cars: Do you have to pay tax on selling your car?Must Watch

Headline: GST on popcorn: Know how much tax your movie-time snack will attractDuring its 55th meeting, the GST Council clarified the tax treatment for popcorn after a request from Uttar Pradesh to specify the GST rate for popcorn seasoned with salt and spices.
Content: Popcorn has always been the go-to companion for movie lovers, but now, it’s grabbing attention for a different reason—taxes. The announcement by the GST Council on Saturday regarding GST on it has sparked lively debates, with memes flooding social media and consumers questioning if their movie nights just got more expensive.So, how does this impact your popcorn cravings? Let’s break it down.advertisementPopcorn sold loose in cinemas will continue to be taxed at a 5% GST rate, the same as restaurant services, reported news agency PTI citing government sources.However, if popcorn is bundled with a movie ticket, it will be treated as a composite supply. In such cases, the applicable tax rate will be based on the principal item, which is the movie ticket.During its 55th meeting, the GST Council clarified the tax treatment for popcorn after a request from Uttar Pradesh to specify the GST rate for popcorn seasoned with salt and spices.There has been no change in the GST rate for popcorn. Popcorn served in cinemas as a standalone item is considered part of restaurant service and remains taxed at 5%. When mixed with salt and spices, popcorn is classified as namkeen under GST and also attracts a 5% rate. However, if it is pre-packed and labelled, the tax increases to 12%.Caramelised popcorn falls into the category of sugar confectionery, which typically attracts an 18% GST rate. Popcorn has always been the go-to companion for movie lovers, but now, it’s grabbing attention for a different reason—taxes. The announcement by the GST Council on Saturday regarding GST on it has sparked lively debates, with memes flooding social media and consumers questioning if their movie nights just got more expensive.So, how does this impact your popcorn cravings? Let’s break it down.advertisementPopcorn sold loose in cinemas will continue to be taxed at a 5% GST rate, the same as restaurant services, reported news agency PTI citing government sources.However, if popcorn is bundled with a movie ticket, it will be treated as a composite supply. In such cases, the applicable tax rate will be based on the principal item, which is the movie ticket. So, how does this impact your popcorn cravings? Let’s break it down. Popcorn sold loose in cinemas will continue to be taxed at a 5% GST rate, the same as restaurant services, reported news agency PTI citing government sources. However, if popcorn is bundled with a movie ticket, it will be treated as a composite supply. In such cases, the applicable tax rate will be based on the principal item, which is the movie ticket. During its 55th meeting, the GST Council clarified the tax treatment for popcorn after a request from Uttar Pradesh to specify the GST rate for popcorn seasoned with salt and spices. There has been no change in the GST rate for popcorn. Popcorn served in cinemas as a standalone item is considered part of restaurant service and remains taxed at 5%. When mixed with salt and spices, popcorn is classified as namkeen under GST and also attracts a 5% rate. However, if it is pre-packed and labelled, the tax increases to 12%. Caramelised popcorn falls into the category of sugar confectionery, which typically attracts an 18% GST rate. To address disputes over the classification of ready-to-eat popcorn with added salt or spices, the GST Council has recommended issuing a clarification. Under GST rules, the classification of goods, including food items, is guided by the Harmonised System (HS) classification. Developed by the World Customs Organisation (WCO), this system is used by over 200 countries and accounts for more than 98% of global trade. GST rates are determined by the specific classification of a product within the HS framework.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 25, 2024

Headline: DAM Capital Advisors IPO listing: Is strong market debut on cards? Check GMPDAM Capital Advisors IPO received an overwhelming response, being subscribed 81.88 times overall by the close of Day 3 on December 23, 2024.
Content: Shares of DAM Capital Advisors IPO are expected to make their market debut on December 27, 2024 after witnessing a strong interest from investors. DAM Capital Advisors IPO received an overwhelming response, being subscribed 81.88 times overall by the close of Day 3 on December 23, 2024. Breaking it down, the retail investor segment saw subscriptions reach 26.8 times the allocated shares, while the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category attracted a staggering 166.33 times subscription. Meanwhile, the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category was subscribed 98.47 times. The public issue opened for subscription on December 19. DAM Capital Advisors IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 840.25 crore. The entire issue is an Offer for Sale (OFS) of 2.97 crore shares by the selling shareholders, meaning the company will not receive any funds from this offering. The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 269 and Rs 283 per share. The minimum lot size for applications is 53 shares, making the minimum investment for retail investors Rs 14,999.WILL IT MAKE A STRONG DEBUT? The grey market premium (GMP) often serves as a useful hint about how an IPO might perform upon listing. In the case of DAM Capital Advisors IPO, the rising GMP suggests the stock is likely headed for a strong debut. As of 8:32 AM on December 25, 2024, the GMP stood at Rs 170. Considering the price band of Rs 283, the estimated listing price for the IPO is around Rs 453, calculated by adding the cap price to the GMP. This would translate to an anticipated gain of 60.07% per share for investors. Allotment of shares was finalised on Tuesday. DAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment status can be checked by investors through the websites of either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) or Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue. The shares are likely to be listed on both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on Friday, December 27, 2024. The IPO’s book-running lead manager is Nuvama Wealth Management Limited, while Link Intime India Private Ltd serves as the registrar for the issue. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 25, 2024

Headline: Income tax relief in Budget 2025? Economists push for cuts to help save moreEconomists argued that reducing the tax burden would increase disposable income, enabling citizens to save more and spend on essentials. This, in turn, could help revive demand in sectors impacted by weak consumption.
Content: Economists have urged the government to reduce income tax rates and introduce reforms to support savings and economic growth in the upcoming Union Budget 2025, reported The Economic Times. These suggestions were shared during a pre-budget interaction with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, where several prominent economists and experts discussed strategies for navigating economic challenges. One of the key recommendations was to lower income tax rates. Economists argued that reducing the tax burden would increase disposable income, enabling citizens to save more and spend on essentials. This, in turn, could help revive demand in sectors impacted by weak consumption. Suggestions also included rationalising customs tariffs and providing targeted benefits to vulnerable groups. Lower tax rates for lower-income groups, they noted, would directly impact household budgets, improve financial stability, and potentially lift overall consumption levels.ECONOMIC URGE TAX RELIEF WITH PM MODI During the meeting, the Prime Minister reportedly highlighted employment generation as a central focus for government policy. Economists emphasised the importance of improving data quality for better policy decisions and suggested targeted interventions to address weak consumption, inflation, and global uncertainties. The Prime Minister reiterated the government’s vision of a “Viksit Bharat” or a developed India by 2047. He stressed the need for transformative thinking to keep India on a sustainable growth path, particularly during periods of global economic volatility.WEAK CONSUMPTION AND INFLATION Economists said that India’s domestic consumption has struggled to match growth expectations. The country's gross domestic product (GDP) grew by 5.4% in the July-September quarter, its slowest pace in two years, falling short of the central bank’s 7% target for the period. Rising inflation remains a key concern. Inflation in November was above the Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) medium-term target of 4%, putting pressure on household budgets. High prices have reduced disposable income and limited discretionary spending, which economists fear could lead to a demand slowdown. To manage inflation while sustaining growth, economists recommended measures such as direct benefit transfers, public expenditure in rural areas, and incentives for job creation outside the agricultural sector.INCOME TAX REFORMS IN THE PAST The Union Budget 2024-25 introduced significant changes to the income tax regime, offering relief to many taxpayers: Income tax slabs were relaxed for earnings up to Rs 10 lakh. The standard deduction for salaried and pensioners was increased from Rs 50,000 to Rs 75,000. Family pensioners saw their standard deduction rise from Rs 15,000 to Rs 25,000. The employer’s NPS contribution deduction for private-sector employees was increased from 10% to 14%. Industry representatives, including major groups like CII, FICCI, and PHDCCI, have presented several recommendations for the upcoming Budget 2025. They called for comprehensive tax reforms, including the simplification of capital gains tax and streamlined compliance procedures. A reduction in TDS provisions and the establishment of a dedicated dispute resolution mechanism were also proposed. For GST, suggestions included the introduction of a simplified three-rate GST structure, referred to as GST 2.0, and the inclusion of all expenses in the input tax credit chain. Additionally, industry bodies urged for adjustments in direct taxes, such as reduced tax rates for partnership firms and LLPs, the removal of the dividend distribution tax, and relief for share buybacks by treating them as capital gains while allowing deductions for the cost of shares. Customs-related proposals included introducing a single certificate of origin for multiple bills of entry, simplifying the appeal process, and imposing zero customs duty on critical raw materials. These recommendations aim to simplify tax processes, reduce compliance burdens, and boost the ease of doing business in India.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 25, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Insurance penetration in India dipped, but premium collection grewInsurance penetration in India, which is already low, saw a dip for the second successive year, shows the latest report by the insurance industry regulator. This is against the global trend. The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority (IRDAI) report shows growth in premium collection in 2023-24. Insurance companies rejected 11% of all claims in FY24.
Content:
The latest report by India's insurance industry watchdog has revealed that insurance penetration in the country, which was already low, has dipped further to 2.8% in the last financial year. This is in sharp contrast with the global trend. However, there was a 6% increase in premium collection by life insurance companies despite a dip in penetration. The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) released its annual report this week which showed that India's insurance penetration dipped to 3.7% in 2023-24 as compared to 4% in 2022-23. "The insurance penetration for the life insurance industry marginally declined from 3% in the previous year to 2.8% during 2023-24," the IRDAI report said. In the non-life or general insurance industry, the penetration remained at 1%, according to the report. Insurance penetration, a measure of the total amount of premiums paid in a year by the gross domestic product (GDP), shows the popularity of insurance products and the extent to which people are covered.   This dip is worrying as India is a country with already low insurance penetration when compared to developed countries or the global average. This is, in fact, the second successive year of dip in insurance penetration in India. Insurance penetration touched a high of 4.2% in 2021-22 on the back of the Covid pandemic. Globally, insurance penetration has gone up from 6.8% in 2022 to 7% in 2023.INSURANCE COMPANIES SETTLED 83% OF CLAIMS IN 2023-24 What has been the performance of Indian insurers in settling claims in FY24? Going by the IRDAI report, insurers settled about 83% of the total number of claims and rejected about 11% of them. The remaining about 6% were pending for settlement as on March 31, 2024. "The life insurance industry paid total benefits of Rs 5.77 lakh crore in 2023-24, which constitutes 70.22% of the net premium," it said. General and health insurers settled 2.69 crore health insurance claims and paid Rs 83,493 crore towards settlement of health insurance claims. The average amount paid per claim was Rs 31,086.GROWTH IN PREMIUM COLLECTION FOR INSURANCE COMPANIES Though insurance penetration dipped in India, insurance density (per capita premium) grew to $95 in 2023-24 from $92 in 2022-23, according to the IRDAI report.  For the world, it stood at $889. The non-life insurance density increased from $22 to $25, while life insurance density remained stable at
$70, according to the IRDAI report. Despite the negative growth in penetration in India, insurance premium collection saw growth in 2023-24. "The life insurance market in India has recorded consistent premium growth over the years. During 2023-24, the life insurance industry recorded a premium income of Rs 8.30 lakh crore, registering 6.06% growth," said the IRDAI report. Going by the trend, IRDAI expects health insurance premiums to grow by 3% in real terms in 2024.  "With wages and healthcare expenses exceeding CPI
inflation, health insurance pricing is likely to remain elevated," the insurance regulator says.  Private-sector players clocked a growth of 15% in premiums in 2023-24 while public sector life insurers saw a growth of 0.23%.CUT GST RATE TO IMPROVE INSURANCE PENETRATION: PANEL The low penetration and a high 18% GST on insurance premiums has been a worry. A Standing Committee on Finance, headed by Jayant Sinha, recommended that the GST rate on insurance products, especially term and health, should be reduced. The high rate of GST results in a high premium burden, which acts as a deterrent to getting insurance policies, it said in its report, submitted in February. The committee noted there was a need to create mass awareness about the need and benefits of having insurance protection and diverse insurance products. However, in its December meeting, the GST Council postponed any call on reducing tax rates for life and health insurance premiums. There is no two ways about the fact that India needs to better its insurance penetration, which is low and dipping. For this, there needs to be a reduction in taxes and premium rates, and information about insurance products spread among the population.Published By: Yudhajit Published On: Dec 25, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Indo Farm Equipment: All you need to know about last IPO of the yearThe IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 260.15 crore. It consists of a fresh issue of 0.86 crore shares, aggregating to Rs 184.90 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 0.35 crore shares, amounting to Rs 75.25 crore.
Content: Indo Farm Equipment Limited's initial public offering (IPO) will open for bidding on December 31, which is set to be the final public issue of 2024. Here’s everything you need to know about the upcoming IPO and the company behind it. The IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 260.15 crore. It consists of a fresh issue of 0.86 crore shares, aggregating to Rs 184.90 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) of 0.35 crore shares, amounting to Rs 75.25 crore. Indo Farm Equipment IPO will open for subscription on December 31, 2024, and close on January 2, 2025. The allotment of shares is expected to be finalised on January 3, 2025, with the listing likely to occur on January 7, 2025, on the BSE and NSE. The price band for the IPO is set between Rs 204 and Rs 215 per share. Retail investors can apply for a minimum of one lot, which includes 69 shares, requiring an investment of Rs 14,835. For small non-institutional investors (sNII), the minimum application size is 14 lots (966 shares), amounting to Rs 2,07,690. For big non-institutional investors (bNII), the minimum size is 68 lots (4,692 shares), requiring an investment of Rs 10,08,780. Aryaman Financial Services Limited is the book-running lead manager for the issue, while Mas Services Limited is serving as the registrar. Incorporated in 1994, Indo Farm Equipment Limited is engaged in manufacturing tractors, pick-and-carry cranes, and other harvesting equipment. The company operates under two brands: Indo Farm and Indo Power. Their products are exported to several countries, including Nepal, Syria, Sudan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar. The company has been steadily growing its operations, particularly in the agriculture and construction equipment sectors. It aims to expand its reach and increase its market share through this IPO. GMP FOR INFO FARM EQIPMENT As of December 25, 2024, the grey market premium (GMP) for the Indo Farm Equipment IPO is Rs 50. Based on the upper price band of Rs 215, the estimated listing price is Rs 265 per share, indicating an expected gain of 23.26%. Objects of the issue The funds raised from the fresh issue will be used for several purposes: Setting up a new dedicated unit to expand the manufacturing capacity of pick-and-carry cranes. Repaying or prepaying certain borrowings, either in full or in part. Providing additional investment in its NBFC subsidiary, Barota Finance Ltd., to strengthen its capital base for future requirements. General corporate purposes.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 25, 2024

Headline: Sensex, Nifty rally post-Christmas on banking stocks boost; SBI gains 1% The S&P BSE Sensex added 369.59 points to 78,842.46, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 100.05 points to 23,827.70 as of 9:20 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices witnessed a rally in early trade as trading resumed after the Christmas break, driven by a sharp rise in banking sector stocks.  The S&P BSE Sensex added 369.59 points to 78,842.46, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 100.05 points to 23,827.70 as of 9:20 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that RBI’s latest projection of 6.8% GDP growth in Q3 FY 25 based on trends in high frequency data is positive news. "But the downward revision of FY 25 GDP growth to 6.4% from the initial projection of 7.2% growth is a reflection of the poor assessment of the economy by the central bank. Realistically this has to be followed up by a rate cut by the MPC in February. The economy also needs fiscal stimulus now to achieve a growth rate of 6.6% in FY26. Going forward, the  market will be expecting both fiscal and monetary stimulus. These expectations can keep the market in a consolidation phase in the near-term. The market reaction after the Budget and monetary policy will depend on the policy initiatives," he added. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 26, 2024

Headline: Stocks to watch today: Yes Bank, RIL, Ola Electric, BPCL, NalcoFrom new contracts and rating updates to strategic developments, companies such as Yes Bank, RIL, Ola Electric, BPCL, Nalcoare, etc will be in focus for various reasons, making headlines.
Content:
As trading resumes after the Christmas break, several stocks are expected to attract attention in today’s session. From new contracts and rating updates to strategic developments, companies such as Yes Bank, RIL, Ola Electric, BPCL, Nalcoare, etc will be in focus for various reasons, making headlines. Yes Bank
Yes Bank announced that it has received Rs 161 crore from a single trust in the Security Receipts Portfolio. The amount exceeds the materiality threshold set under amended Listing Regulations, prompting disclosure under Regulation 30 of the Listing Regulation. Welspun Corp
Welspun Corp is in focus after its associate company, EPIC, signed multiple contracts worth over Rs 130 crore with Saudi Real Estate Infrastructure Company (Binyah) and Al Rashid Trading and Contracting Company. The contracts, for manufacturing and supplying steel pipes with coating, have a duration of seven months. Their financial impact will be reflected in the first two quarters of FY 2025-2026. Reliance Industries (RIL)
Reliance Industries received a reaffirmation of its top credit ratings. India Ratings and Research Private Limited rated the company’s bank loan facilities and commercial paper as ‘IND AAA with a Stable Outlook/IND A1+’ and ‘IND A1+,’ respectively, on December 24, 2024. Metropolis Healthcare
Metropolis Healthcare has established a wholly-owned subsidiary, Metropolis Clinical Pathology Private Limited, to expand its diagnostic services. Jammu & Kashmir Bank (J&K Bank)
The government of Jammu and Kashmir has appointed Amitava Chatterjee as the new Managing Director and Chief Executive Officer of J&K Bank. Chatterjee, currently Deputy Managing Director at SBI, will take over after Baldev Prakash’s term ends on December 29, 2024. Ola Electric
Ola Electric, India’s largest pure-play EV company, announced that it has expanded its network to 4,000 stores nationwide, marking a fourfold increase. Gland Pharma
The French regulator ASNM completed a Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) inspection of Gland Pharma’s Cenexi Fontenay manufacturing facility, concluding on December 19, 2024. The facility received official notification citing ten observations. Ramky Infrastructure
Ramky Infrastructure reported receiving a letter of acceptance from the Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board. The Rs 215.1-crore project involves managing, operating, and maintaining STPs and connecting interception and diversion for five years. Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL)
BPCL has emerged as the lowest bidder for NTPC’s 150 MW ISTS-connected Solar PV power project. The project is estimated to have a capital outlay of Rs 756.45 crore. REC Limited
REC’s subsidiary, REC Power Development and Consultancy, has incorporated a wholly-owned arm, Rajgarh III Power Transmission. The new entity will handle the Transmission System for Evacuation of Power from RE Projects in Rajgarh SEZ (1500 MW) in Madhya Pradesh, Phase III. Bharat Forge
Bharat Forge disclosed plans to invest €39 million (approximately Rs 345 crore) in its wholly-owned subsidiary, Bharat Forge Global Holding GmbH (BFGH). Nalco
National Aluminium Company Limited (Nalco) has signed a mining lease deed for the amalgamated Utkal-D and Utkal-E coal blocks. This move aims to enhance coal production capacity to 4 million tonnes per annum (MTPA). The lease is valid until April 21, 2051. Amber Enterprises
Amid speculation about the demerger of its electronics division, Amber Enterprises clarified that it evaluates various strategic opportunities, including fund-raising activities, for growth and expansion in the ordinary course of business. Panacea Biotec
Panacea Biotec has received a letter of award from UNICEF for supplying 115 million doses of its bivalent oral polio vaccine (bOPV). The deal is valued at $14.95 million, or approximately Rs 127 crore, for FY25.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Dec 26, 2024Must Watch

Headline: Unimech Aerospace IPO: Check GMP as listing enters last day for biddingThe IPO comprises a fresh issue of 32 lakh shares valued at Rs 250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of an equal number of shares, also worth Rs 250 crore.

The IPO comprises a fresh issue of 32 lakh shares valued at Rs 250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of an equal number of shares, also worth Rs 250 crore.
