Headline: Auto stocks drive Sensex, Nifty gains on 2025's first trading dayStock market rally: The S&P BSE Sensex added 368.40 points to end at 78,507.41, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 98.10 points to close at 23,742.90.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices closed higher after witnessing a brief rally on the first day of trading in 2025 fuelled by a rally in auto sector stocks.   The S&P BSE Sensex added 368.40 points to end at 78,507.41, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 98.10 points to close at 23,742.90.  Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services said that the market started on a positive note on the first day of 2025. "The recovery was broad-based, while the sustainability of the trend will depend on the earnings growth in Q3, where the expectation is positive on a QoQ basis. An uptick in core sector data and prospect of ramp-up in capex spending by the government in the remaining part of the fiscal aided sectors like capital goods, industrials, auto, and power," he added.  The auto sector led the rally as several automakers announced robust sales figures for December 2024, boosting investor sentiment. As a result, auto stocks saw notable gains.  Broad-based buying across multiple sectors also supported the recovery. Among the sectoral indices, Nifty Auto led the gains.  In today's trading session, Maruti Suzuki India emerged as the top gainer on Nifty50, surging 3.01%, followed by Mahindra & Mahindra which rose 2.36%. Larsen & Toubro gained 1.73%, while Bajaj Finance added 1.71%, and Tata Motors advanced 1.31%. On the declining side, Hindustan Aluminium Company Limited led the losses with a drop of 1.40%, followed by Dr. Reddy's Laboratories which fell 1.12%. Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone declined 1.04%, while Oil and Natural Gas Corporation slipped 0.98%, and Tata Steel Limited decreased by 0.85%. most sectoral indices on the Nifty showed positive momentum. Nifty Auto led the advances with a gain of 1.34%, followed by Nifty Media which rose 0.81%. Both Nifty Consumer Durables and Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank gained 0.77%, while Nifty Midsmall Healthcare increased by 0.57%. Nifty Midsmall Financial Services advanced 0.53%, Nifty Private Bank and Nifty Financial Services both added 0.46%, and Nifty Financial Services 25/50 rose 0.48%. Nifty Bank gained 0.39%, Nifty FMCG rose 0.38%, and Nifty Healthcare Index increased by 0.32%. Other gainers included Nifty Oil & Gas (+0.26%), Nifty Pharma (+0.20%), Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom (+0.15%), and Nifty IT (+0.08%). On the declining side, only two indices finished in the red: Nifty Realty fell 1.11%, while Nifty Metal dropped 0.12%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 1, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Check latest GMP as bidding enters final day Indo Farm Equipment IPO opened for bidding on December 31, 2024 and will close for subscription on January 2, 2025.
Content: Investors interested in bidding for the initial public offering (IPO) of Indo Farm Equipment have the last chance to do so on Thursday as the public listing enters its final day for subscription. Indo Farm Equipment IPO opened for bidding on December 31, 2024 and will close for subscription on January 2, 2025. The IPO is structured as a book-built issue, aiming to raise Rs 260.15 crore in total. This includes a fresh issue of 86 lakh shares, bringing in Rs 184.90 crore, and an offer for sale (OFS) involving 35 lakh shares, valued at Rs 75.25 crore. The company has set the price band for the shares between Rs 204 and Rs 215 each. Retail investors can apply for a minimum of one lot, which consists of 69 shares, requiring an investment of Rs 14,835. Small non-institutional investors (sNII) need to apply for a minimum of 14 lots (966 shares) at an investment of Rs 2,07,690. For large non-institutional investors (bNII), the minimum size is 68 lots (4,692 shares), requiring an investment of Rs 10,08,780. The IPO of Indo Farm Equipment witnessed a strong response, being oversubscribed by 54.74 times by the end of Day 2 on January 1, 2025. Retail investors showed strong interest, with subscriptions reaching 46.07 times in this category. Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) subscribed 11.96 times, while the Non-Institutional Investors (NII) segment saw an overwhelming response, recording 132.03 times the shares on offer.LATEST GMP FOR INFO FARM EQIPMENT IPO The grey market premium (GMP) for the Indo Farm Equipment IPO has dropped compared to the previous day when it was Rs 95. As of 7:02 AM on January 2, 2025, the most recent GMP stands at Rs 90. Given the IPO price band of Rs 215, the estimated listing price is expected to be Rs 305, which is the sum of the cap price and the current GMP. This implies an anticipated gain of approximately 41.86% per share upon listing. Aryaman Financial Services Limited has been appointed as the book-running lead manager for the IPO, with Mas Services Limited serving as the registrar. Established in 1994, Indo Farm Equipment Limited specialises in producing tractors, pick-and-carry cranes, and various types of harvesting equipment. The company markets its products under two brands, Indo Farm and Indo Power, and has a significant export footprint, shipping to nations such as Nepal, Syria, Sudan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar. The allotment of shares for this IPO is anticipated to be finalised on January 3, 2025. Following this, the company's shares are expected to be listed on both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on January 7, 2025.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: Stocks to watch today: Tata Motors, Maruti Suzuki, Reliance Power, NMDCAs markets resume trading today, several stocks such as Tata Motors, Maruti Suzuki, Reliance Power, NMDC, Railtel Corporation, etc will be in focus due to various key developments.
Content: stock markets began 2025 on a positive note, with both Sensex and Nifty ending higher on Wednesday. The rally came ahead of the Q3 results season, supported by strong buying in sectors like auto and banking. The BSE Sensex climbed 368.40 points, or 0.47%, to close at 78,507.41, while the NSE Nifty50 added 98.10 points, or 0.41%, settling at 23,742.90. As markets resume trading today, several stocks such as Tata Motors, Maruti Suzuki,  Reliance Power, NMDC, Railtel Corporation, etc will be in focus due to various key developments. Here’s a closer look at the companies that investors will be watching.advertisementTata Motors Tata Motors reported total sales of 2,35,599 vehicles in Q3 FY2024-25 for domestic and international markets, a slight increase from 2,34,981 units in Q3 FY2023-24, marking a 0.26% year-on-year growth. While the commercial vehicles (CV) segment saw a 1% decline with 95,770 units sold, the passenger vehicles (PV) segment grew by 1% year-on-year, with total sales of 1,39,829 units.Maruti Suzuki India India's largest carmaker, Maruti Suzuki, announced a significant 30.3% year-on-year increase in vehicle production in December 2024, with a total of 1,57,654 units produced compared to 1,21,028 units in December 2023.NMDC The state-owned miner NMDC recorded a 5.1% rise in iron ore production in December 2024, with 4.71 million tonnes (MT) produced compared to 4.48 MT in the same month last year. However, its iron ore sales dropped by 6.7% to 3.91 MT from 4.19 MT year-on-year.RailTel Corporation of India RailTel Corporation received a work order worth Rs 78.43 crore from Bharat Coking Coal Limited. The project involves setting up an integrated IT-based security infrastructure and providing related services.Reliance Power Sasan Power Limited, a subsidiary of Reliance Power, has repaid US$150 million to IIFCL, UK, fulfilling its debt obligation on 31 December 2024. This payment improves Sasan Power’s debt metrics and liquidity. Reliance Power also recently raised Rs 1,525 crore through equity-linked warrants via a preferential issue. Sasan Power operates a 3960 MW Ultra Mega Power Plant (UMPP) in Madhya Pradesh.South Indian Bank South Indian Bank reported an 11.94% year-on-year increase in gross advances for the December 2024 quarter, reaching Rs 86,965 crore compared to Rs 77,686 crore last year. Deposits rose by 6.28% to Rs 1,05,378 crore, while its CASA grew by 4.13% year-on-year. The bank stated that the figures are provisional and subject to change.CSB Bank CSB Bank shared its provisional Q3 numbers, showing a 26.5% year-on-year increase in gross advances to Rs 28,914 crore compared to Rs 22,867 crore in Q3 2023. Deposits rose 22.2% year-on-year to Rs 33,406 crore.Supreme Power Equipment Supreme Power Equipment, an SME with a market capitalisation of Rs 607 crore, secured a domestic order worth Rs 3.63 crore from TRANTRANSCO. The company manufactures power and distribution transformers.Ugro Capital Ugro Capital has entered into agreements to acquire shares in MyShubhLife, a Bangalore-based fintech platform. The acquisition is subject to conditions that need to be fulfilled.Ind-Swift Laboratories Ind-Swift Laboratories completed the purchase of 40 bighas of land in Derabassi, Punjab, for Rs 17.72 crore. The company plans to set up a new formulations facility on the acquired land.Atmastco Atmastco, a metal fabrication and EPC firm, announced the issuance of 34.35 lakh equity shares at Rs 250.50 per share, raising up to Rs 86.04 crore. It will also issue 4.80 lakh warrants convertible into equity shares, aggregating Rs 12.02 crore.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher; IT and financial stocks boost early momentumThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 153.84 points to 78,661.25, while the NSE Nifty gained 40.10 points to 23,783.00 as of 9:35 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened marginally higher on Thursday, led by a rise in IT and heavyweight financial sector stocks after having seen a brief rally in the previous session.  The S&P BSE Sensex was up 153.84 points to 78,661.25, while the NSE Nifty gained 40.10 points to 23,783.00 as of 9:35 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that leading indicators available so far do not indicate a pick up in economic growth. "GST collections for December have declined 2.97% MoM indicating continuation of the slowdown. Therefore, Q3 corporate earnings are unlikely to register a rebound. This means investors have to focus on segments which will buck the slowdown like IT, pharma and to some extent financials. Luxury consumption like hotels, jewellery and aviation also are likely to post good results," he added.  The sectoral index of IT gained the most in early trade on Nifty50.  FIIs are likely to continue with their selling strategy since the dollar remains strong and the U.S. bond yields are attractive enough for FIIs to ignore emerging markets in the near-term. While DII buying can support the market at lower levels, that is not sufficient to take the market higher. For higher market levels we will have to wait for indications of growth and earnings recovery.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: GST collection jumps 7.3% YoY to Rs 1.77 lakh crore in DecemberGST revenues from domestic transactions, including the collection from services and goods sold within the country, grew 8.4% YoY to Rs 1.32 lakh crore.
Content:
India's Goods and Services Tax (GST) collection grew 7.3% year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 1.77 lakh crore in December 2024, according to data released by the government on 1 January 2025. However, the figure marked a 3% decline compared to the Rs 1.82 lakh crore collected in November. The latest numbers indicate a steady growth in GST revenues but reflect a slowdown in consumption and a rise in refunds issued during the month. Experts suggest that the subdued growth could be due to a post-festive season slump, with expectations of a rebound in the March quarter.advertisementGST COLLECTIONThe total gross GST revenue for December was split across the following categories:
Central GST (CGST): Rs 32,836 crore
State GST (SGST): Rs 40,499 crore
Integrated GST (IGST): Rs 47,783 crore (including Rs 18,310 crore collected on imports)
Cess: Rs 11,471 crore (including Rs 1,258 crore collected on imports)
 The total gross GST revenue for December was split across the following categories:
Central GST (CGST): Rs 32,836 crore
State GST (SGST): Rs 40,499 crore
Integrated GST (IGST): Rs 47,783 crore (including Rs 18,310 crore collected on imports)
Cess: Rs 11,471 crore (including Rs 1,258 crore collected on imports)
 GST revenues from domestic transactions, including the collection from services and goods sold within the country, grew 8.4% YoY to Rs 1.32 lakh crore. Meanwhile, tax revenues from imports increased by 4% YoY to Rs 44,268 crore. Refunds issued during December surged 31% compared to the same month last year, amounting to Rs 22,490 crore. After adjusting for these refunds, the net GST collection stood at Rs 1.54 lakh crore, up 3.3% YoY.COMPARISON WITH PREVIOUS MONTHS November 2024: GST collections stood at Rs 1.82 lakh crore, reflecting an 8.5% YoY growth. October 2024: The mop-up reached Rs 1.87 lakh crore, marking a 9% YoY increase and the second-highest collection on record. April 2024: The highest-ever monthly GST collection was recorded at Rs 2.10 lakh crore. The steady increase in GST revenues over the year highlights improvements in compliance and economic activity. However, the drop in December’s month-on-month collection compared to November may reflect seasonal factors such as lower post-festive consumption. Refunds issued during December rose sharply by 31% to Rs 22,490 crore, compared to Rs 19,259 crore issued in the same month a year ago. The increase in refunds is likely to have impacted net GST collections.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Standard Glass to Capital Infra: 3 IPOs to raise over Rs 2,200 crore next weekTogether, these IPOs aim to raise over Rs 2,200 crore. The listings include Capital Infra Trust, Standard Glass Lining, and Quadrant Future Tek, with Capital Infra Trust being the largest of the three.
Content: The new year is set to begin with a strong start for India’s IPO market, as three initial public offerings (IPOs) are scheduled to open for bidding next week. Together, these IPOs aim to raise over Rs 2,200 crore. The listings include Capital Infra Trust, Standard Glass Lining, and Quadrant Future Tek, with Capital Infra Trust being the largest of the three. While Standard Glass Lining opens on January 6, both Capital Infra Trust and Quadrant Future Tek will launch their IPOs on January 7.STANDARD GLASS LINING IPO Standard Glass Lining aims to raise Rs 410.05 crore through its book-built issue, comprising a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 210 crore and an offer for sale of Rs 200.05 crore. The company has set a price band of Rs 133-140 per share, with a minimum lot size of 107 shares. Retail investors will need to invest at least Rs 14,980, while small NIIs must invest Rs 2,09,720 (14 lots) and large NIIs Rs 10,03,660 (67 lots). The IPO will remain open from January 6-8, with share allotment on January 9 and listing on January 13. IIFL Securities and Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors are managing the issue, with KFin Technologies as the registrar.QUADRANT FUTURE TEK IPO Quadrant Future Tek's IPO consists entirely of fresh shares, targeting to raise Rs 290 crore. The public issue will be open for subscription from January 7-9, though the price band is yet to be announced. The company plans to finalise the allotment on January 10 and list its shares on both NSE and BSE by January 14. Sundae Capital Advisors is managing the IPO, while Link Intime India Private Ltd will handle the share allotment process.CAPITAL INFRA TRUST INVIT IPO The largest among the three, Capital Infra Trust's InvIT IPO seeks to raise Rs 1,578 crore, split between a fresh issue of Rs 1,077 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 501 crore. The IPO will accept bids from January 7-9, with allotment scheduled for January 10 and listing on January 14. While the price band remains to be announced, the firm has appointed SBI Capital Markets and HDFC Bank as lead managers, with KFin Technologies as the registrar.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why Bajaj Finance share price gained 4% in early tradeBajaj Finance stock price: At 11:05 am, it was the top gainer on the Sensex, up 3.74% to Rs 7,195.
Content: Bajaj Finance shares surged 4% in early trading on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), hitting an intraday high of Rs 7,199. At 11:05 am, Bajaj Finance was the top gainer on the Sensex, up 3.74% to Rs 7,195. The rally in Bajaj Finance shares comes after global brokerage Citi maintained a bullish outlook, reportedly reiterating a ‘Buy’ rating with a target price of Rs 8,150. Citi also placed the stock on a ’90-day catalyst watch,’ citing positive expectations for the company’s Q3 performance. In its report, Citi highlighted marginal improvement in credit costs, projecting them to rise slightly to 2.2-2.25% in Q3. It also forecast a 6% quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) and 7% year-on-year (YoY) growth in assets under management (AUM), driven by strong performance across mortgages, sales financing, securities lending, and new businesses. Additionally, net interest margins (NIMs) are expected to improve by 3-5 basis points. Bajaj Finance’s recent financial performance has been robust. In Q2, its net profit rose 13% YoY and 2.8% QoQ to Rs 4,013 crore, while AUM grew by 28.8% YoY to Rs 3,73,924 crore. Its net interest income (NII) climbed 28% YoY to Rs 14,987 crore. It may b noted that Bajaj Finance shares have gained over 8% in the past month. However, it delivered slightly negative returns over the past year. Analysts remain optimistic about the company’s long-term prospects, highlighting sustainable earnings growth and strong franchise longevity. Headline: Explained: Why Railtel share price gained 7% todayRailTel share price: Despite today's rise, the stock remains well below its 52-week high of Rs 618, recorded on 12 July 2024. Over the past six months, RailTel's share price has fallen by 11%.
Content: Shares of RailTel Corporation of India Ltd surged over 7% in early trading on Thursday, reaching a day’s high of Rs 433.95. The stock opened at Rs 420, higher than its previous close of Rs 404.95. At the time of writing, RailTel shares were trading at Rs 427.65, up 5.61%. The company’s market capitalisation stood at Rs 13,726.54 crore. Despite today’s rise, the stock remains well below its 52-week high of Rs 618, recorded on 12 July 2024. Over the past six months, RailTel’s share price has fallen by 11%. The sharp increase in RailTel’s share price came after the company announced a new order worth Rs 78 crore from Bharat Coking Coal Ltd. In a filing with the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), RailTel said, "This is to inform that RailTel Corporation of India Ltd has received the work order from Bharat Coking Coal Ltd for works amounting to Rs 78,43,30,164 (including tax)." This positive development boosted investor confidence, resulting in strong buying activity during the session. RailTel’s stock showed strength on key technical indicators and the stock traded above its 5-day, 10-day, 20-day, 30-day, and 50-day simple moving averages (SMAs). It remained below its 100-day, 150-day, and 200-day SMAs. The 14-day relative strength index (RSI) stood at 58.50. An RSI below 30 signals oversold conditions, while a value above 70 indicates overbought conditions. On valuation metrics, RailTel has a price-to-equity (P/E) ratio of 53.06 and a price-to-book (P/B) ratio of 7.33. The company’s earnings per share (EPS) stood at Rs 8.13, with a return on equity (RoE) of 13.82%. During the September 2024 quarter, RailTel reported a mixed financial performance as net profit rose 7% year-on-year to Rs 73 crore from Rs 68 crore in the same period last year. Revenue grew 41% to Rs 843 crore, up from Rs 599 crore in Q2 FY23. Operating EBITDA increased by 2% to Rs 129 crore compared to Rs 126 crore in the year-ago quarter. EBITDA margin declined to 15.3% from 21% in the corresponding period last year. RailTel Corporation, a Mini Ratna (Category-1) public sector undertaking (PSU), is a leading player in the information and communications technology (ICT) sector. It is also one of India’s largest neutral telecom infrastructure providers, with a pan-India optic fibre network. As of September 2024, the government held a 72.84% stake in the company.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: SJVN share price: Stock loses momentum, falls over 2% post 8% jump yesterdaySJVN share price: The stock opened the day at Rs 111.45 after closing at Rs 110.90 in the previous session.
Content: Shares of SJVN Limited dropped by over 2% in early trading on Thursday, hitting a day’s low of Rs 108.30. The stock opened the day at Rs 111.45 after closing at Rs 110.90 in the previous session. At the time of writing, SJVN was trading at Rs 108.80, down 1.89%. The company’s market capitalisation stood at Rs 42,795.47 crore. SJVN shares have been volatile. The stock touched its 52-week high of Rs 170.45 on 5 February 2024 but has seen a downward trend since. It reached its 52-week low of Rs 88.85 on 10 January 2024. In the past month, the stock has declined by 4.44%, and over the last six months, it has fallen by 17%. On Wednesday, shares of SJVN rose sharply by 8% in early trade after the company announced a new project in Bihar. This rally was driven by positive market sentiment following the announcement. The company signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Bihar government for the development of the Hathidah Durgawati Pumped Storage Project (PSP). This 1,000 MW project is valued at Rs 5,663 crore and is expected to boost SJVN’s growth prospects. The agreement involves the development of the 1,000 MW Hathidah Durgawati Pumped Storage Project (PSP) in Bihar. This project will operate with a levelised tariff of Rs 9.39 per kWh, calculated at February 2024 prices, with a pumping energy rate of Rs 3 per kWh. The pumped storage facility, which will be built on the Durgawati River in Kaimur district, is designed to provide a peak energy output of 6.325 million units (MU) per day and an annual peak energy generation of 2,308.65 MU. SJVN is actively developing around 12,000 MW of energy storage projects across various Indian states, including Maharashtra, Karnataka, Mizoram, Himachal Pradesh, and Bihar. These initiatives align with the company’s vision of becoming a key player in India’s clean energy transitionPublished By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: Air India launches Wi-Fi service on select domestic flights. Check detailsAir India becomes the first airline within the country to offer in-flight Wi-Fi on domestic routes, starting January 1, 2025, with complimentary internet access for passengers.
Content:
Air India, India’s premier global airline, has become the first in the country to offer in-flight Wi-Fi connectivity on domestic routes. Starting January 1, 2025, passengers flying on select Air India aircraft – Airbus A350, Boeing 787-9, and certain Airbus A321neo models – can enjoy complimentary internet access during their journey, making connectivity in the skies a reality. This groundbreaking move enhances travel experiences for both leisure and business flyers, enabling them to browse, use social media, work, or stay in touch with family and friends.advertisementA NEW ERA OF CONNECTIVITY IN INDIAN AVIATIONRajesh Dogra, Chief Customer Experience Officer at Air India, emphasised the importance of connectivity in modern travel, saying, “Connectivity is now an integral part of modern travel. For some, it is about the convenience and comfort of real-time sharing, while for others, it is about greater productivity and efficiency." Rajesh Dogra, Chief Customer Experience Officer at Air India, emphasised the importance of connectivity in modern travel, saying, “Connectivity is now an integral part of modern travel. For some, it is about the convenience and comfort of real-time sharing, while for others, it is about greater productivity and efficiency." He further stated, "Whatever be one’s purpose, we are confident that our guests will appreciate having the option of connecting to the web and enjoy the new Air India experience on board these aircraft."
 


 The Wi-Fi service is compatible with multiple devices, including laptops, tablets, and smartphones, running iOS or Android. Travellers can connect multiple devices simultaneously, ensuring uninterrupted access throughout their journey. This domestic rollout follows a successful pilot program on international routes, including destinations like New York, London, Paris, and Singapore. The Wi-Fi service remains complimentary for an introductory period on domestic flights, with plans to expand the offering across the airline’s fleet.EASY STEPS TO CONNECT Accessing Wi-Fi is simple: Enable Wi-Fi on your device. Select the ‘Air India Wi-Fi’ network. Enter your PNR and last name on the Air India portal. Enjoy complimentary internet access. While the service depends on factors like satellite connectivity and government restrictions, Air India’s initiative marks a significant leap in enhancing passenger experience. With this move, Air India not only sets a benchmark in Indian aviation but also reaffirms its commitment to innovation and customer satisfaction. Whether for work or leisure, staying connected at 35,000 feet has never been easier!Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Maruti Suzuki share price jumps over 4%. What's behind today's gain? Maruti Suzuki stock price: At 12:04 pm, the stock was trading 4.01% higher at Rs 11,671.55 on BSE, with a market capitalisation of Rs 3.67 lakh crore. This marks a significant rally, as the stock has climbed over 6% in the past two days
Content: Shares of Maruti Suzuki India Ltd surged over 4% in Thursday’s trading session, hitting an intraday high of Rs 11,675 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At 12:04 pm, the stock was trading 4.01% higher at Rs 11,671.55 on BSE, with a market capitalisation of Rs 3.67 lakh crore. This marks a significant rally, as the stock has climbed over 6% in the past two days, buoyed by robust sales figures and positive market sentiment.advertisementWHAT BEHIND TODAY'S RALLY? December 2024 proved to be a strong month for Maruti Suzuki, as total sales rose 29.5% year-on-year (YoY) to 1,78,248 units compared to 1,37,551 units in December 2023. December 2024 proved to be a strong month for Maruti Suzuki, as total sales rose 29.5% year-on-year (YoY) to 1,78,248 units compared to 1,37,551 units in December 2023. Passenger vehicle (PV) sales increased 28.6% to 62,788 units from 48,787 units during the same period. Domestic PV sales also witnessed a 24% growth, reaching 1,30,117 units compared to 1,04,778 units a year earlier. The company’s total production, including passenger and light commercial vehicles, surged 30.15% YoY to 1,55,553 units in December 2024. Additionally, Maruti reported a 10% YoY rise in total sales in November, with 1,81,531 units sold. Despite mixed performance in different segments, Maruti Suzuki has maintained its dominance in the Indian automobile market. Sales in the mini-segment, including models like Alto and S-Presso, stood at 9,750 units in November 2024, slightly lower than the 9,959 units sold in November 2023. Compact car sales, comprising popular models like Baleno, Swift, and WagonR, declined to 61,373 units from 64,679 units during the same period. Global brokerage Citi continues to back Maruti Suzuki, maintaining a ‘Buy’ rating with a target price of Rs 13,500 per share. In the past year, Maruti Suzuki shares have gained 10%, outpacing the Sensex, which rose 9.2% during the same period. Investors remain optimistic about the company’s long-term growth, supported by its strong sales performance and brand legacy. Headline: Missed income tax section 87A rebate? Here's your chance to claim it for FY 2023-24With updates to ITR forms underway, eligible taxpayers can claim Section 87A rebates through revised filings by the extended deadline of January 15, 2025.
Content: The Income Tax Department has introduced significant relief for taxpayers eligible for the Section 87A rebate for FY 2023-24 who were previously unable to claim it. Announced late on December 31, 2024, via the ITR e-filing portal, the department confirmed that eligible taxpayers would soon be able to file revised or belated ITRs through the ITR filing utility or online on the e-filing portal. This development follows an interim directive by the Bombay High Court, which extended the deadline for filing revised and belated ITRs for resident individuals to January 15, 2025. Backend updates to the online ITR forms are underway to facilitate these changes. Under Section 87A of the Income Tax Act, 1961, eligible taxpayers can claim rebates of up to Rs 12,500 under the old tax regime and Rs 25,000 under the new tax regime.KEY UPDATE FOR ELIGIBLE TAXPAYERS On December 31, 2024, the department confirmed that it will soon enable the filing of revised or belated ITRs for eligible taxpayers on the e-filing ITR portal for Forms ITR-2 and ITR-3. These forms allow individuals to declare incomes such as Short-Term Capital Gains (STCG), which were earlier excluded from claiming the 87A rebate. This update addresses a significant issue where taxpayers filing ITRs after July 5, 2024, were barred from claiming the rebate due to changes in the e-filing utility. Many of these taxpayers subsequently received notices, sparking widespread concern amongst professionals and individuals alike.BOMBAY HIGH COURT'S INTERVENTION The Bombay High Court, in an interim order dated December 20, 2024, emphasised that taxpayers eligible for the rebate should not face procedural hurdles. The court directed the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) to extend the deadline for filing revised or belated ITRs, ensuring compliance with statutory rights. While the final judgment is awaited on January 9, 2025, tax professionals have lauded this move as a significant step toward aligning procedural efficiency with legislative intent. This decision not only safeguards taxpayers' rights but also highlights the importance of timely updates to tax systems. As the revised utilities roll out, taxpayers are advised to file accurately within the extended deadline to avoid complications.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Jai Corp share price plummets nearly 20% today. Here's why Jai Corp stock price:  The sharp drop comes after the company disclosed a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), in which it holds a 32% equity stake.
Content: Shares of Jai Corp Ltd nosedived nearly 20% in Thursday's trading session, hitting Rs 250 by 11:32 AM. The sharp drop comes after the company disclosed a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), in which it holds a 32% equity stake. Jai Corp informed stock exchanges that UIHPL plans to convene an extraordinary general meeting (EGM) to seek shareholder approval for the proposed capital reduction. The move is also subject to clearance from the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) and other regulatory bodies. Upon approval, Jai Corp is set to receive approximately Rs 364 crore from the reduction process. The announcement follows recent developments involving Dronagiri Infrastructure Private Limited (DIPL), a subsidiary of UIHPL. DIPL sold a 74% equity stake in Navi Mumbai IIA Private Limited for Rs 1,628.03 crore, with CIDCO retaining the remaining 26%. Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) acquired this stake, finalizing the deal after CIDCO waived its rights of first refusal earlier in December. As part of the capital reduction process, UIHPL will receive a minimum of Rs 1,492.50 crore from DIPL, which may increase depending on interest earnings from surplus funds. Additionally, UIHPL expects Rs 682 crore from redeeming optionally fully convertible debentures in Vinamra Universal Traders Private Limited, bringing the total funds to a minimum of Rs 3,772 crore. UIHPL plans to reduce 99.76% of its share capital, including equity shares and fully compulsorily convertible preference shares, paying an aggregate of Rs 3,746.87 crore to its shareholders on a proportionate basis. This restructuring announcement has triggered heightened investor concerns, as reflected in the recent performance of Jai Corp shares, which have fallen nearly 27% over the past three trading sessions.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: Sensex rallies over 1,000 points: What's behind today's bull run?Stock market rally: The S&P BSE Sensex surged 988.99 points to 79,496.40, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 308.30 points to 308.30 as of 12:50 PM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices continued their new rally on Thursday, with Sensex gaining over 1,000 points in the afternoon session with auto, IT and financial sector stocks witnessing a bull run.  The S&P BSE Sensex surged 988.99 points to 79,496.40, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 308.30 points to 308.30 as of 12:50 PM.  Stock markets have welcomed the new year with a market rally fuelled by a rise in heavyweight financials and auto sector stocks, with the latter seeing robust sales numbers from leading automakers such as Hyundai India, Tata Motors, Mahindra and Mahindra, Maruti Suzuki etc. The top gainers on the Nifty50 included stocks from the financial and auto sectors as it bolstered investor sentiment.  In today's afternoon session, several major companies saw gains on the Nifty50. Bajaj Finserv led the pack with an impressive rise of 8%, followed by Eicher Motors which surged by 6.92%. Bajaj Finance showed strong performance with a 5.84% increase, while Maruti Suzuki India gained 5.06%. Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M) also performed well, climbing by 3.86%. On the downside, Britannia Industries experienced a decline of 0.91%, Sun Pharmaceutical Industries dropped by 0.74%, Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone fell by 0.41%, while Bharat Electronics Limited and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited saw modest declines of 0.29% and 0.17% respectively. In the sectoral roundup today, most indices showed positive momentum with Nifty Auto leading the charge with a robust gain of 2.90%. The financial sector showed strong performance across the board - Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank climbed 2.62%, Nifty Financial Services rose by 1.21%, and its 25/50 variant increased by 1.59%. The IT sector also performed well, with Nifty IT advancing 1.81%, while its midcap counterpart, Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom, gained 0.38%. The banking sector remained stable as Nifty Bank edged up by 0.53% and Nifty Private Bank rose 0.92%. Other gainers included Nifty FMCG (0.94%), Nifty Consumer Durables (0.77%), Nifty Oil & Gas (0.65%), Nifty Metal (0.48%), Nifty Healthcare (0.07%), and Nifty Midsmall Healthcare (0.32%). However, some sectors faced selling pressure - Nifty PSU Bank declined 0.57%, followed by Nifty Pharma dropping 0.05%. Nifty Media, Nifty Realty, and Nifty Media witnessed marginal declines of 0.16%, 0.14%, and 0.16% respectively.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why Eicher Motors share price rallied 7% todayEicher Motors share price: At 12:31 pm, the stock was trading 6.74% higher at Rs 5,214.85 apiece on the Bombay Stock Exchange, marking a significant jump in its market capitalisation to Rs 1.43 lakh crore.
Content: Shares of Eicher Motors, the parent company of Royal Enfield, surged over 7% on Tuesday, driven by robust December sales figures and positive developments in its global operations. At 12:31 pm, the stock was trading 6.74% higher at Rs 5,214.85 apiece on the Bombay Stock Exchange, marking a significant jump in its market capitalisation to Rs 1.43 lakh crore. Eicher Motors reported a 25% year-on-year (YoY) increase in total motorcycle sales for December 2024, delivering 79,466 units compared to 63,387 units in December 2023. The company’s international business stood out, registering a remarkable 90% YoY growth with 11,575 units sold. This surge highlights the growing demand for Royal Enfield motorcycles globally, particularly in markets outside India. B Govindarajan, CEO of Royal Enfield, described 2024 as a transformative year for the company. “We’ve launched some category-defining motorcycles through the year, and the response has been encouraging both in India and international markets. As we gear up for 2025, we aim to sustain this momentum and inspire our riding community globally,” he said. A key driver of Eicher’s international success is its commitment to expanding global operations. Royal Enfield recently commenced operations at its first fully owned CKD (Completely Knocked Down) assembly facility outside India, located in Samut Prakan, Bangkok. The 57,000 sq. ft. plant has an installed capacity of over 30,000 units annually and serves as the sixth CKD facility globally, adding to plants in Argentina, Colombia, Brazil, Bangladesh, and Nepal. Royal Enfield’s premium lineup, including the recently unveiled Flying Flea electric brand, has also captured significant attention. Models like the Classic 650, Hunter 350, and the Himalayan adventure tourer further solidify the company’s position in the mid-size motorcycle segment. Eicher Motors' strong sales figures, global expansion, and innovative product launches have reinforced investor confidence. The stock’s rally reflects optimism for sustained growth as the company continues its push to dominate both domestic and international markets. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: Indo Farm IPO Day 3: What latest GMP and subscription shows on final dayIndo Farm Equipment IPO: By 2:13 pm on Thursday, the issue was subscribed over 150 times, showing the massive interest in the public issue.
Content: Indo Farm Equipment IPO continued to witness strong demand on the third and final day of its bidding process, with strong participation from investors across categories. By 2:13 pm on Thursday, the issue was subscribed over 150 times, showing the massive interest in the public issue. For those looking to place bids, the company has set a price band of Rs 204-215 per share and aims to raise Rs 260.15 crore. This includes a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 184.90 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 35 lakh equity shares. Investors can apply for a minimum lot of 69 shares and in multiples thereafter. At the time of writing this report, retail investors subscribed to their quota over 83 times, while non-institutional investors (NIIs) oversubscribed their portion by 390 times. The qualified institutional buyer (QIB) category saw a subscription of nearly 88 times. The Chandigarh-based Indo Farm Equipment, established in 1994, manufactures tractors, cranes, and harvesting equipment under its brands Indo Farm and Indo Power. The company exports its products to markets including Nepal, Sudan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar, among others. In the grey market, the IPO commanded a premium of Rs 90 per share, indicating a potential listing gain of 42%. However, there has been a slight dip in the GMP over the past few days. Brokerages have largely recommended subscribing to the IPO, citing the company’s experienced management, integrated manufacturing, and global outlook. However, they have flagged inventory risks and operational challenges as concerns. At the upper price band, the IPO is priced at a PE ratio of 66.2 times on FY24 earnings. The company reported a net profit of Rs 15.6 crore on a revenue of Rs 375.95 crore for FY24. Indo Farm Equipment allocated shares worth Rs 78 crore to 11 anchor investors ahead of the IPO. The stock is scheduled to list on the NSE and BSE on January 7, 2025. MAS Services is the registrar, and Aryaman Financial Services is the book-running lead manager for the issuePublished By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: Vodafone Idea likely to launch 5G broadband services in March: ReportVodafone Idea plans to introduce 5G with competitively priced plans that could be up to 15% cheaper at entry levels.
Content: Vodafone Idea is planning to launch its 5G mobile broadband services in March, reported The Economic Times. The company aims to make a mark in a market already dominated by Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel. The company plans to introduce 5G with competitively priced plans that could be up to 15% cheaper at entry levels, added the report. The move is expected to spark a pricing war among telecom operators. Vodafone Idea is likely to focus on India’s top 75 cities and 17 priority circles for the initial rollout. Industrial hubs, known for heavy data usage, are also on the radar. The telco’s strategy is aimed at winning back customers who have migrated to its competitors, which already have extensive 5G networks. “We are gearing up to launch 5G services and are committed to providing the best experience and price,” a Vodafone Idea spokesperson told the publication. The company added that it has sufficient and competitive 5G spectrum in its 17 key markets, which will help improve its 4G coverage and enable a swift 5G rollout. The anticipation of 5G launch helped Vodafone Idea’s shares gain marginally, which were trading at Rs 8.03, up 0.12%, at the time of writing.  Global brokerage Citi recently upgraded Vodafone Idea’s stock to a ‘buy’ rating with a target price of Rs 13, suggesting a potential upside of 64% from the current levels. The upgrade follows a critical bank guarantee waiver by the Department of Telecommunications, providing some relief to the debt-laden telecom operator. Vodafone Idea’s CEO Akshaya Moondra has hinted at keeping 5G base pricing lower than its competitors. During the company’s earnings call for the first quarter of FY25, he mentioned that a final decision on pricing would be made closer to the launch. This approach contrasts with the strategies of Jio and Airtel, which have increased the minimum threshold for 5G services by requiring users to upgrade to higher-value plans. To attract high-value 5G prepaid users, Vodafone Idea may also increase dealer commissions and promotional spending. As per Jefferies, the company spent Rs 3,583 crore (8.4% of sales) on dealer commissions in FY24, higher than Jio’s Rs 3,000 crore (3% of sales). Airtel was the largest spender, with Rs 6,000 crore (4% of sales) allocated for the same purpose.FUNDING AND ROLLOUT PLANS Backed by Rs 24,000 crore in equity funding, Vodafone Idea is expected to raise an additional Rs 25,000 crore in debt. The financial support comes after recent government relief measures, including waivers on bank guarantee requirements. The company has also finalised Rs 30,000 crore worth of contracts with global network vendors such as Nokia, Ericsson, and Samsung to support its 4G expansion and 5G rollout. It plans to deploy around 75,000 5G base stations over three years, with several thousand new sites to be added by March 2025. “We’re excited to supercharge our network and add several thousand new sites by March 2025 for enhanced connectivity and roll out 5G to revolutionise the digital experience for Vi users,” said a Vodafone Idea spokesperson.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Must Watch

Headline: ITR filing: Maximise tax savings for FY 2024-25. Check investment optionsTaxpayers can maximise their tax savings for FY 2024-25 by investing in key exemptions before March 31, 2025.
Content: As the calendar year 2025 begins, there are only three months left in the financial year 2024-25, which ends on March 31. For taxpayers looking to maximise their savings, now is the crucial time to make investments that will help claim tax exemptions for the fiscal year. However, the key to claiming these exemptions lies in making the investments before the financial year ends.advertisementKEY INVESTMENT OPTIONS FOR TAX EXEMPTION IN FY 2024-25To claim tax exemptions for FY 2024-25, the investments must be made in this current financial year, which concludes on March 31, 2025. When filing your income tax return (ITR) before July 31, 2025, you can benefit from various tax-saving options. To claim tax exemptions for FY 2024-25, the investments must be made in this current financial year, which concludes on March 31, 2025. When filing your income tax return (ITR) before July 31, 2025, you can benefit from various tax-saving options. Below are some of the most popular tax-saving instruments to consider: Section 80C (Max Rs 1.5 lakh): You can invest in instruments like the National Savings Certificate (NSC), Public Provident Fund (PPF), and Unit-linked Insurance Plans (ULIPs) to claim a deduction under Section 80C. Section 80CCC (Max Rs 1.5 lakh): Contributions to life insurance-based pension plans also qualify for tax deductions under this section. Section 80CCD(1) (Max Rs 1.5 lakh): Taxpayers can invest in the National Pension Scheme (NPS) to claim deductions under Section 80CCD(1). Section 80D (Max Rs 25,000 for regular citizens, Rs 50,000 for senior citizens): Premiums paid for medical insurance for yourself, your spouse, parents, or children are eligible for tax deductions under Section 80D. Section 80CCD(1B) (Max Rs 50,000): For NPS contributors, this section allows an additional deduction on top of the one available under Section 80CCD(1).DON’T MISS OUT ON POTENTIAL SAVINGS While the new tax regime offers fewer exemptions, certain contributions, like those to the Agniveer Corpus Fund (Section 80CCH), are still eligible for deduction. However, most exemptions apply to the old tax regime, so if you're aiming to claim them, you must opt for the old system. As the end of the financial year approaches, now is the time to act. Make the right investments, maximise your tax deductions, and prepare for a smooth filing of your ITR before the July 31 deadline. Don't let this opportunity slip away!Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Must Watch

Headline: New pension rules from 2025: Now collect EPS anywhere in IndiaFrom January 1, 2025, EPS pensioners can receive pensions from any bank branch nationwide under the new Centralized Pension Payment System.
Content: Starting January 1, 2025, pensioners under the Employees’ Pension Scheme (EPS), 1995, will experience a major shift in how they receive their monthly pension. Thanks to the introduction of the Centralized Pension Payment System (CPPS), pensioners will now be able to collect their pension from any bank branch across India, even if they move to a different city or town. This change aims to provide greater flexibility and ease for retirees, making the process much more convenient.advertisementA REVOLUTIONARY SHIFTThe CPPS is part of the Employee Provident Fund Organization’s (EPFO) modernisation program and will be available under the Centralized IT Enabled System (CITES 2.01). The CPPS is part of the Employee Provident Fund Organization’s (EPFO) modernisation program and will be available under the Centralized IT Enabled System (CITES 2.01). It represents a national-level solution that leverages advanced IT and financial technology to make pension payments faster and more accessible to pensioners across India. The system allows pensioners to access their benefits without the need to transfer their Pension Payment Order (PPO) when relocating or changing banks. This is a significant step forward in modernising the pension disbursement process and will benefit over 78 lakh EPS pensioners. Union Minister Dr. Mansukh Mandaviya praised the initiative, describing it as an important step in updating the EPFO. He stated that the new system would solve long-standing issues faced by pensioners and improve the overall efficiency of the EPFO.A FUTURE OF SEAMLESS PAYMENTS For pensioners, especially those who return to their hometowns post-retirement, this new system offers immense relief. They will no longer have to go through the hassle of transferring their PPOs or wait for pension delivery from a particular bank. In the future, the transition will move towards an Aadhaar-based Payment System (ABPS), further streamlining the process. As the CPPS rolls out, EPS pensioners can look forward to a more seamless and hassle-free experience, marking the beginning of a new chapter in pension disbursement across India.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 2, 2025

Headline: Post office schemes' interest rates unchanged for January-March 2025. Check hereSmall savings schemes will continue to offer unchanged interest rates for the January-March 2025 period, ensuring investors can enjoy stable returns through the quarter.
Content: As we enter the final quarter of FY 2024-25, the government has announced that the interest rates for various small savings schemes, also known as Post office schemes, including Public Provident Fund (PPF), Senior Citizen Savings Scheme (SCSS), Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY), and others, will remain unchanged for the period from January to March 2025. This decision means investors can continue to benefit from the current rates through the end of March 2025.advertisementCURRENT INTEREST RATES FOR POST OFFICE SCHEMESThe interest rates for the final quarter of FY 2024-25 have been confirmed as unchanged from the previous quarter, providing consistency for investors. The current rates for some popular small savings schemes are as follows: The interest rates for the final quarter of FY 2024-25 have been confirmed as unchanged from the previous quarter, providing consistency for investors. The current rates for some popular small savings schemes are as follows: Savings Deposit at 4.0%, 1 Year Time Deposit at 6.9%, 2 Year Time Deposit at 7.0%, 3 Year Time Deposit at 7.1%, and 5 Year Time Deposit at 7.5%. The Senior Citizen Savings Scheme offers a rate of 8.2%, National Savings Certificate provides 7.7%, the Public Provident Fund stands at 7.1%, and Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana also offers 8.2%. Additionally, Kisan Vikas Patra offers 7.5%, maturing in 115 months. The government's decision to keep these rates unchanged ensures stability, allowing investors to maintain confidence in their savings.HOW ARE SMALL SAVINGS SCHEMES RATES SET? The interest rates on post office savings schemes are set based on the recommendations of the Shyamala Gopinath Committee. Rates are typically reviewed and adjusted quarterly, with a focus on keeping them competitive against government bond yields. The central government ensures that the rates offered remain attractive to investors while maintaining the schemes’ security.WHAT LIES AHEAD FOR SMALL SAVINGS SCHEMES? Although the Reserve Bank of India may reduce policy rates in 2025, it’s unlikely that the government will make significant cuts to small savings rates in the immediate future. Given that these schemes are backed by sovereign guarantees, any changes will be gradual and carefully considered, maintaining investor confidence. For now, investors can continue to benefit from stable rates, making these small savings schemes an attractive option for the first quarter of 2025.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty surge nearly 2% as auto stocks drive Dalal Street rally The Sensex climbed 1.8% to end at 79,943.71, while the Nifty gained 1.9% to close at 24,188.65.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices closed with strong gains on Thursday, as the benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty rallied nearly 2%, driven by robust performance in the Auto, financial and IT sectors. The Sensex climbed 1.8% to end at 79,943.71, while the Nifty gained 1.9% to close at 24,188.65. Auto stocks led the rally following upbeat December sales data, with leading players like Maruti Suzuki and Mahindra & Mahindra reporting strong demand for SUVs and year-end discounts. IT stocks also advanced on optimistic brokerage views ahead of Q3 earnings. Satish Chandra Aluri of Lemonn Markets said, “Markets extended gains on improving risk appetite fuelled by Auto, IT, and Financials. Auto shares rallied after sales data allayed concerns over weakening demand, while IT benefited from positive revenue recovery expectations. Likely bargain hunting in quality stocks and anticipation of growth-oriented measures in the upcoming budget also boosted sentiment.” Financials contributed significantly, supported by strong deposit growth updates from banks. Santosh Meena of Swastika Investmart noted, “The market had been oversold for days, but auto sales beating expectations provided a much-needed trigger. Nifty not only crossed the 200-DMA but also surpassed the 50-DMA and 20-DMA, indicating a potential bullish reversal.” The broader market saw mixed action, with mid- and small-cap stocks underperforming the frontline indices. “Despite the strong movement in the Index, mid-caps and small-caps rose by only 1%. However, this could be an ideal time to accumulate value stocks with strong order books,” said VLA Ambala of Stock Market Today. On the technical front, analysts remain optimistic but cautious about a pullback. Aditya Gaggar of Progressive Shares commented, “The bulls dominated, helping Nifty break multiple resistance levels. While a pullback to test support at 24,000 is possible, the next leg of the rally could target 24,700-24,800.” As the markets gear up for Q3 earnings and the Union Budget, experts believe strong earnings delivery will be crucial for sustaining the rally.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Donald Trump's tariff threat: Top experts discuss what it means for IndiaIn an exclusive panel discussion with Rahul Kanwal, News Director at Aajtak & India Today, leading experts shared their insights on what Trump's tariff threats could mean for India's economy, especially after the recent GDP data.
Content:
Donald Trump is set to return to the White House as the 47th President of the United States on January 20, 2025, for his second term and his pre-election rhetoric about increasing tariffs has sparked discussions about potential implications for global trade and India's economy.His threats to impose higher tariffs on countries like China and India have raised eyebrows in global markets. With his controversial labelling of India as the "Tariff King," Indian economists and policymakers are debating the potential implications of these policies on the country's economy.advertisementIn an exclusive panel discussion with Rahul Kanwal, News Director at Aajtak & India Today, leading experts Neelkanth Mishra, Chief Economist at Axis Bank; Rathin Roy, Director and CEO of the National Institute of Public Finance and Policy (NIPFP); and Soumya Kanti Ghosh, Group Chief Economic Advisor at the State Bank of India, shared their insights on what Trump’s tariff threats could mean for India's economy especially after the recent GDP data. The Q2 GDP numbers for the second quarter showed India’s GDP growth for the July-September quarter fell to 5.4%, marking an 18-month low, as per data released by the National Statistics Office (NSO). 

 



India's GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in the July-September quarter.
SHORT-TERM CHALLENGES FOR INDIASpeaking on the potential immediate challenges, Neelkanth Mishra outlined three critical fronts where Trump’s policies could impact India:Immigration policies: Mishra highlighted that Trump’s strong stance on immigration, particularly on H-1B visas, could disrupt the Indian IT sector, which heavily relies on these work permits to send professionals to the US.“We're already seeing that there is a lot of debate within the Republican establishment on what they mean by controlling immigration. Is it legal? Is it illegal? With H-1Bs, is it something bigger,” Mishra said. Trade tariffs: On the trade front, Trump’s threat of imposing reciprocal tariffs could significantly hit India’s exports. “The second front is, of course, trade, where he has threatened tariffs on everyone, including India, on the reciprocal tariffs. If that was to happen, it'd have a direct seven to eight billion dollar impact on our exports,” Mishra added.However, he suggested that these threats might serve as a starting point for negotiations rather than immediate actions.FII outflow: Mishra expressed concerns about the ripple effects of Trump’s likely extension of the 2017 tax cuts, which could worsen the US fiscal deficit and raise bond yields."We've already seen the 10-year bond yields in the US starting to spike. And what that means is that the cost of capital for the rest of the world goes up," said the Chief Economist at Axis Bank. advertisementHe further added that emerging market equity investors are deserting India, which is a major concern. "They're deserting all of emerging markets. In fact, the knee jerk reaction, the Pavlovian instinct for any emerging market investor and for right and understandable reasons is that when you're getting 5% yield on US government bonds, then why would you want to hold China, Brazil and India or other emerging market currencies," he said. Rupee at risk: Neelkanth Mishra, Chief Economist at Axis Bank also explained how the imposition of tariff could lead to unstable rupee and a currency war. “This would push up the global cost of capital, making borrowing more expensive for emerging markets like India,” he explained.

He said that as foreign equity investors retreat, India’s current account deficit will come under pressure, forcing the RBI to intervene more aggressively to stabilise the rupee.”These developments could also trigger a currency war, especially if China devalues the Chinese yuan (CNY) or renminbi (RMB) in response to US tariffs.advertisementA significant depreciation of the Chinese RMB could force the RBI to make tough decisions about the rupee, Mishra warned.MACROECONOMIC VOLATILITY LOOMSRathin Roy echoed Mishra’s concerns, adding that India’s limited role in global exports means that domestic fiscal policies will have a larger impact on the economy than Trump’s tariffs.“India accounts for just 2% of global exports,” Roy explained. “The government’s undershooting of its fiscal plans could pose a far greater risk to the economy than US tariffs.”Roy also highlighted the importance of a calibrated monetary and exchange rate policy. “There’s a fear that the RBI is following a nationalist policy of keeping the rupee artificially strong,” he said. “In these volatile conditions, a well-communicated approach to rupee depreciation could help mitigate investor concerns.”He criticised the lack of clarity in India’s monetary policies and called for better coordination between the RBI and the finance ministry to navigate the expected turbulence.“With the RBI, there is a clear and pleasant lack of clarity on the logic underlying its monetary policy and exchange rate actions.  And the more clarity we get in and the more forward guidance we give on how we are going to implement a policy that we publicly state, I think the more secure we will be in the next year,” Roy advised.advertisementThe RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) maintained the status quo on key interest rates and kept repo rates unchanged for the 11th consecutive time as the central bank’s focus remained on containing inflation. The Reserve Bank also reduced its real GDP growth forecast for 2024-25, projecting it at 6.6% in the December MPC. 

 



GDP outlook for FY25
POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITY FOR INDIADespite the challenges, Soumya Kanti Ghosh identified potential opportunities for India amid Trump’s tariff threats.“During Trump’s first term, the rupee depreciated by 11%, while under Biden, it fell by 29%,” Ghosh pointed out. “Even with the noise around tariffs, India’s export basket has diversified significantly in recent years.”Ghosh highlighted the growing share of value-added exports, such as engineering goods, and India’s expanding trade ties. "A careful look into the competition of the Indian basket in the last three to four years, you will find that there has been a lot of value addition in terms of export share. Also, there has been diversification of the export bucket outside countries of US and even Europe to the more South side. So from that point of view, India has an opportunity," said Ghosh. advertisementHe acknowledged vulnerabilities in price-sensitive sectors like textiles and garments but expressed optimism about India’s ability to leverage the global shift away from China under the "China +1" strategy."If the economic condition remains strong, the rupee will bounce back from the lows and that is going to act as an enabler in terms of the overall export push," Ghosh added. 

 



Global growth at a glance
The potential for Trump’s tariff policies to disrupt global markets, which have remained relatively steady in recent years, was a recurring concern among the experts.Neelkanth Mishra cautioned that rising US bond yields could prompt a reallocation of capital from emerging markets to the US.“The knee-jerk reaction for any emerging market investor, when US bond yields rise to 5%, is to pull out from markets like India, China, and Brazil,” he said. “This could trigger a broader sell-off in emerging market equities and currencies.”Rathin Roy added that a devaluation of the Chinese RMB in response to US tariffs could create a cascading effect on other currencies, including the Indian rupee.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Must Watch

Is it legal? Is it illegal? With H-1Bs, is it something bigger,” Mishra said.  His threats to impose higher tariffs on countries like China and India have raised eyebrows in global markets. With his controversial labelling of India as the "Tariff King," Indian economists and policymakers are debating the potential implications of these policies on the country's economy. In an exclusive panel discussion with Rahul Kanwal, News Director at Aajtak & India Today, leading experts Neelkanth Mishra, Chief Economist at Axis Bank; Rathin Roy, Director and CEO of the National Institute of Public Finance and Policy (NIPFP); and Soumya Kanti Ghosh, Group Chief Economic Advisor at the State Bank of India, shared their insights on what Trump’s tariff threats could mean for India's economy especially after the recent GDP data.  The Q2 GDP numbers for the second quarter showed India’s GDP growth for the July-September quarter fell to 5.4%, marking an 18-month low, as per data released by the National Statistics Office (NSO). 

 



India's GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in the July-September quarter.
SHORT-TERM CHALLENGES FOR INDIA Speaking on the potential immediate challenges, Neelkanth Mishra outlined three critical fronts where Trump’s policies could impact India: Immigration policies: Mishra highlighted that Trump’s strong stance on immigration, particularly on H-1B visas, could disrupt the Indian IT sector, which heavily relies on these work permits to send professionals to the US. “We're already seeing that there is a lot of debate within the Republican establishment on what they mean by controlling immigration. Is it legal? Is it illegal? With H-1Bs, is it something bigger,” Mishra said.  Trade tariffs: On the trade front, Trump’s threat of imposing reciprocal tariffs could significantly hit India’s exports. “The second front is, of course, trade, where he has threatened tariffs on everyone, including India, on the reciprocal tariffs. If that was to happen, it'd have a direct seven to eight billion dollar impact on our exports,” Mishra added. However, he suggested that these threats might serve as a starting point for negotiations rather than immediate actions. FII outflow: Mishra expressed concerns about the ripple effects of Trump’s likely extension of the 2017 tax cuts, which could worsen the US fiscal deficit and raise bond yields. "We've already seen the 10-year bond yields in the US starting to spike. And what that means is that the cost of capital for the rest of the world goes up," said the Chief Economist at Axis Bank.  He further added that emerging market equity investors are deserting India, which is a major concern.  "They're deserting all of emerging markets. In fact, the knee jerk reaction, the Pavlovian instinct for any emerging market investor and for right and understandable reasons is that when you're getting 5% yield on US government bonds, then why would you want to hold China, Brazil and India or other emerging market currencies," he said.  Rupee at risk: Neelkanth Mishra, Chief Economist at Axis Bank also explained how the imposition of tariff could lead to unstable rupee and a currency war.  “This would push up the global cost of capital, making borrowing more expensive for emerging markets like India,” he explained.

He said that as foreign equity investors retreat, India’s current account deficit will come under pressure, forcing the RBI to intervene more aggressively to stabilise the rupee.” These developments could also trigger a currency war, especially if China devalues the Chinese yuan (CNY) or renminbi (RMB) in response to US tariffs. A significant depreciation of the Chinese RMB could force the RBI to make tough decisions about the rupee, Mishra warned.MACROECONOMIC VOLATILITY LOOMS Rathin Roy echoed Mishra’s concerns, adding that India’s limited role in global exports means that domestic fiscal policies will have a larger impact on the economy than Trump’s tariffs. “India accounts for just 2% of global exports,” Roy explained. “The government’s undershooting of its fiscal plans could pose a far greater risk to the economy than US tariffs.” Roy also highlighted the importance of a calibrated monetary and exchange rate policy. “There’s a fear that the RBI is following a nationalist policy of keeping the rupee artificially strong,” he said. “In these volatile conditions, a well-communicated approach to rupee depreciation could help mitigate investor concerns.” He criticised the lack of clarity in India’s monetary policies and called for better coordination between the RBI and the finance ministry to navigate the expected turbulence. “With the RBI, there is a clear and pleasant lack of clarity on the logic underlying its monetary policy and exchange rate actions.  And the more clarity we get in and the more forward guidance we give on how we are going to implement a policy that we publicly state, I think the more secure we will be in the next year,” Roy advised. The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) maintained the status quo on key interest rates and kept repo rates unchanged for the 11th consecutive time as the central bank’s focus remained on containing inflation.  The Reserve Bank also reduced its real GDP growth forecast for 2024-25, projecting it at 6.6% in the December MPC. 

 



GDP outlook for FY25
POTENTIAL OPPORTUNITY FOR INDIA Despite the challenges, Soumya Kanti Ghosh identified potential opportunities for India amid Trump’s tariff threats. “During Trump’s first term, the rupee depreciated by 11%, while under Biden, it fell by 29%,” Ghosh pointed out. “Even with the noise around tariffs, India’s export basket has diversified significantly in recent years.” Ghosh highlighted the growing share of value-added exports, such as engineering goods, and India’s expanding trade ties.  "A careful look into the competition of the Indian basket in the last three to four years, you will find that there has been a lot of value addition in terms of export share. Also, there has been diversification of the export bucket outside countries of US and even Europe to the more South side. So from that point of view, India has an opportunity," said Ghosh.  He acknowledged vulnerabilities in price-sensitive sectors like textiles and garments but expressed optimism about India’s ability to leverage the global shift away from China under the "China +1" strategy. "If the economic condition remains strong, the rupee will bounce back from the lows and that is going to act as an enabler in terms of the overall export push," Ghosh added. 

 



Global growth at a glance
The potential for Trump’s tariff policies to disrupt global markets, which have remained relatively steady in recent years, was a recurring concern among the experts.Neelkanth Mishra cautioned that rising US bond yields could prompt a reallocation of capital from emerging markets to the US.“The knee-jerk reaction for any emerging market investor, when US bond yields rise to 5%, is to pull out from markets like India, China, and Brazil,” he said. “This could trigger a broader sell-off in emerging market equities and currencies.”Rathin Roy added that a devaluation of the Chinese RMB in response to US tariffs could create a cascading effect on other currencies, including the Indian rupee.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 2, 2025Must Watch
