Headline: Explained: Why ITC share price fell by 6% todayA special pre-open session was conducted on the stock exchanges between 9:00 AM and 9:45 AM to determine ITC Hotels' share price.
Content: ITC share price saw a sharp drop of nearly 6% in Monday's early trading, hitting a low of Rs 455. The fall occurred during the price discovery process for ITC Hotels, the soon-to-be-listed demerged hotels business of ITC. A special pre-open session was conducted on the stock exchanges between 9:00 AM and 9:45 AM to determine ITC Hotels' share price. Following this, normal trading in ITC shares resumed at 10:00 AM. Eligible ITC shareholders will receive one ITC Hotels share for every 10 ITC shares they hold. During the pre-open session, ITC shares settled at Rs 455 on the BSE and Rs 455.60 on the NSE, compared to the previous closing prices of Rs 482 and Rs 481.60, respectively. The difference between ITC's closing price on Friday (January 3) and its price during the special session determines the value of ITC Hotels' shares. Based on this, ITC Hotels' share price was discovered at Rs 27 per share on the BSE and Rs 26 per share on the NSE. ITC Hotels will officially list on the stock exchanges in February 2024. Until then, it will appear as a dummy ticker on market indices, with no trading activity allowed. Once listed, the stock will trade independently, and ITC Hotels will be removed from NSE and BSE indices based on its last traded price. However, if the stock hits circuit limits on listing, its exclusion will be delayed.PRICE ESTIMATES FOR ITC HOTELS Market analysts predict that ITC Hotels' share price will likely be in the range of Rs 150 to Rs 175 per share after full trading begins. Systematix, a financial research firm, estimates the stock's value at Rs 150 per share, applying a 25-times EV/EBITDA multiple for FY26 earnings. It notes that ITC Hotels is India’s second-largest hotel chain, operating 140 properties across the country. Systematix also highlights the financials of ITC Hotels. The business accounts for 4% of ITC’s total revenues, 3% of its EBIT, and 10% of its capital employed. Post-demerger, ITC’s return on capital employed (ROCE) is expected to improve from 40% to 43%. ITC Hotels will begin operations as a standalone company with Rs 1,500 crore in cash and no debt. It plans to invest 8-10% of its annual sales in renovations, ongoing projects, and new developments. ITC will continue to hold a 40% stake in ITC Hotels, while the remaining 60% will be distributed among ITC’s shareholders. Analysts have a neutral to positive outlook on ITC shares post-demerger, as the separation allows the conglomerate to focus on its core businesses, including FMCG and tobacco. According to Nuvama’s FMCG research team, the adjustment in ITC’s stock price due to the demerger is expected to be Rs 18 per share. This aligns with market participants’ views that ITC Hotels’ initial trading price will be in the Rs 150-175 range.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 6, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: 7 ways government can boost employmentAs the budget approaches, several measures have been proposed to boost job creation and improve productivity.
Content: With Budget 2025-26 set to be unveiled by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on February 1, the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has outlined a seven-point agenda to boost employment. The proposals aim to capitalise on India’s demographic dividend and strengthen its employment ecosystem.NATIONAL EMPLOYMENT POLICY CII recommends a comprehensive National Employment Policy to integrate existing employment schemes from various ministries and states. This policy would streamline efforts and centralise data through a single employment portal, the National Career Service (NCS).advertisementDATA-DRIVEN EMPLOYMENT INSIGHTS To improve job creation strategies, CII suggests developing a Universal Labour Information Management System (ULIMS) under NCS. This system would provide insights into job opportunities, skills demand, and training programs, aligning them with market needs.INCENTIVES FOR HIRING CII proposes replacing section 80JJAA with a new tax provision to encourage businesses to hire. Employers could avail deductions for new employees, capped at Rs 1 lakh per month for the first three years, fostering job creation.BOOSTING LABOUR-INTENSIVE SECTORS Focused support for employment-heavy sectors like construction, textiles, and tourism is crucial. Synchronising tariff structures, Free Trade Agreements (FTAs), and employment-linked schemes can enhance exports and job opportunities.EMPOWERING RURAL YOUTH A rural internship program for college graduates could strengthen government initiatives in rural areas, utilising young talent to address workforce gaps.INCREASING FEMALE WORKFORCE PARTICIPATION CII emphasises the need for dormitories funded by CSR, crèches in industrial clusters, and formalisation of the care economy. These initiatives, coupled with gender-sensitive employment policies, aim to economically empower women.TAPPING GLOBAL JOB MARKETS CII advocates for an International Mobility Authority under the Ministry of External Affairs to facilitate overseas job opportunities for Indian youth. Programs focusing on global skillsets, cultural training, and foreign languages would enhance employability abroad. CII’s recommendations aim to create a dynamic employment landscape, fostering inclusivity and productivity. If implemented, these measures could unlock India’s potential as a global economic powerhouse.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 6, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Explained: Why Union Bank share price tumbled 7% after Q3 updateUnion Bank stock price: The decline followed a weak quarter-on-quarter (Q-o-Q) performance in its Q3 update. By 1:09 pm, the stock was trading 6.69% lower at Rs 115.75 on the BSE.
Content: Union Bank of India shares fell sharply in Monday’s trade, dropping 7.2% to an intraday low of Rs 114.80 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The decline followed a weak quarter-on-quarter (Q-o-Q) performance in its Q3 update. By 1:09 pm, the stock was trading 6.69% lower at Rs 115.75 on the BSE.WEAK Q3 UPDATE The bank reported a 2.04% Q-o-Q drop in global total deposits to Rs 12,16,562 crore, compared to Rs 12,41,947 crore in the September quarter. Domestic deposits also fell 2.36% to Rs 11,82,623 crore from Rs 12,11,178 crore in the previous quarter. These figures dampened investor sentiment, triggering a sell-off. However, on a positive note, global gross advances rose 2.18% Q-o-Q and 5.93% year-on-year (Y-o-Y) to Rs 9,49,070 crore. Domestic retail, agriculture, and MSME (RAM) advances grew 6.10% Y-o-Y to Rs 5.17 trillion. Total domestic retail advances saw robust growth, rising 16.35% Y-o-Y to over Rs 2.01 trillion. Founded in 1919 and headquartered in Mumbai, Union Bank is one of India’s largest public sector banks. Following its merger with Andhra Bank and Corporation Bank in 2020, it became one of the country’s largest banking entities. Despite recent efforts to improve digital platforms and reduce non-performing assets (NPAs), the bank’s stock performance has lagged. Over the past year, its shares have dipped 0.16%, underperforming the Sensex, which gained 10% in the same period. Headline: Capital Infra Trust IPO: Check latest GMP, price band, and key datesCapital Infra Trust InvIT IPO: The IPO allotment is scheduled for January 10, 2025, with refunds expected to be processed by January 13. Shares will likely be credited to demat accounts on the same day, and the listing is anticipated on January 14 on the BSE and NSE.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Capital Infra Trust InvIT, valued at Rs 1,578 crore, will open for subscription from January 7 to January 9, 2025. The price band for this infrastructure investment trust (InvIT) IPO has been set between Rs 99 and Rs 100 per share, attracting attention from investors eager to explore this new offering. This article will summarise key details such as the latest grey market premium (GMP), IPO structure, important dates, and all keey details about the company. advertisementLATEST GMPCurrently, the Capital Infra Trust IPO shares are trading at a nil premium in the grey market. This indicates that the grey market premium (GMP) is neutral, with no price advantage over the IPO's listing price. Currently, the Capital Infra Trust IPO shares are trading at a nil premium in the grey market. This indicates that the grey market premium (GMP) is neutral, with no price advantage over the IPO's listing price. It may be noted that the GMP has remained unchanged since January 1, reflecting lukewarm demand in the unlisted market. While GMP is often seen as an indicator of market sentiment, investors are advised not to base decisions solely on it, given its volatility.KEY IPO DETAILS  The Rs 1,578 crore public offering consists of a fresh issue of 10.77 crore shares worth Rs 1,077 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 5.01 crore shares, aggregating to Rs 501 crore. Shares will be sold in lots of 150, with a minimum investment of 14 lots (2,100 shares) for small non-institutional investors (sNII), amounting to Rs 2,10,000. For large non-institutional investors (bNII), the minimum requirement is 67 lots (10,050 shares), or Rs 10,05,000. The proceeds from the fresh issue will be used to provide loans to project SPVs for repaying external and unsecured borrowings from the sponsor, Gawar Construction.IMPORTANT DATES The IPO allotment is scheduled for January 10, 2025, with refunds expected to be processed by January 13. Shares will likely be credited to demat accounts on the same day, and the listing is anticipated on January 14 on the BSE and NSE.ALL ABOUT COMPANY Capital Infra Trust, established in September 2023, operates under the sponsorship of Gawar Construction. Specialising in road and highway construction, Gawar Construction has executed over 100 projects since 2008, working with key clients like the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) and the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH). The Trust plans to acquire and manage nine completed revenue-generating assets spanning 682.42 km across seven states. These projects are strategically positioned to drive long-term returns for investors in India’s growing infrastructure sectorPublished By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 6, 2025

Headline: ITR filing: 5 new tax regime features every taxpayer must knowBudget 2024's revamped tax regime offers simplified slabs, higher deductions, and savings up to Rs 17,500 annually, enhancing flexibility and easing tax compliance for taxpayers.
Content: The revamped income tax slabs introduced in Budget 2024 bring significant relief to taxpayers, enabling savings of up to Rs 17,500 annually under the new tax regime. Here's everything you need to know to make informed decisions while filing your ITR in 2025.REVAMPED INCOME TAX SLABS The new tax regime offers simplified and attractive slab rates, with no tax on income up to Rs 3 lakh, 5% for Rs 3–7 lakh, 10% for Rs 7–10 lakh, 15% for Rs 10–12 lakh, 20% for Rs 12–15 lakh, and 30% for income above Rs 15 lakh. These changes aim to enhance flexibility and enable savings, making the new regime more appealing while retaining the old tax regime as an option for those who prefer it.HIGHER STANDARD DEDUCTION FOR SALARIED INDIVIDUALS The standard deduction limit has been increased from Rs 50,000 to Rs 75,000 under the new tax regime. This change offers greater relief to salaried individuals, allowing them to reduce their taxable income further.INCREASED DEDUCTION FOR FAMILY PENSIONERS Family pensioners now benefit from a higher standard deduction limit, which has been raised from Rs 15,000 to Rs 25,000. This move provides additional support to families relying on pension income.ENHANCED NPS CONTRIBUTION BENEFITS For employees under the new tax regime, contributions to the National Pension System (NPS) under Section 80CCD(2) are now tax-free, up to 14% of the basic salary, compared to 10% under the old regime. This encourages greater participation in retirement savings plans.CALCULATING YOUR TAX SAVINGS The revamped tax slabs enable annual savings of up to Rs 17,500 for individuals earning Rs 15 lakh per year. This is achieved through revised slab rates, resulting in savings of Rs 10,000, and an enhanced standard deduction, contributing an additional Rs 7,500, bringing the total savings to Rs 17,500. These updates reflect the government’s intent to simplify tax compliance and provide tangible benefits to taxpayers. By leveraging these changes, individuals can maximise their savings and effectively plan their finances in 2025.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 6, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Will salaried class get any tax relief?With Budget 2025 approaching, the salaried class eagerly anticipates a budget that acknowledges their contributions and eases financial burdens.
Content: The middle class, often called the backbone of the economy, has its eyes set on Budget 2025. With rising living costs and limited disposable income, expectations from the government are higher than ever. Will this budget bring much-needed relief to ease their financial burdens?TAX RELIEF: THE BIGGEST EXPECTATION One of the foremost demands of the middle class is a reduction in tax liabilities. Simplified tax structures and higher exemptions could go a long way in improving disposable incomes. The salaried class also hopes for increased standard deductions to address rising costs, including healthcare and education expenses.AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND INTEREST RELIEF The dream of owning a home remains a challenge for many middle-class families due to high property prices and loan interest rates. Measures like subsidies on housing loans or incentives for first-time homebuyers could make this dream more achievable.CUSHIONING THE IMPACT OF INFLATION Inflation has consistently chipped away at middle-class incomes. Budget 2025 could offer relief through subsidies on essential commodities or measures to stabilise fuel and utility prices. A more robust mechanism to control inflation could significantly ease monthly financial pressures.EMPOWERING THROUGH EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES While tax relief is vital, long-term financial stability stems from consistent income growth. Policies aimed at boosting job creation, skill development, and upskilling initiatives would empower the middle class to adapt to a rapidly changing economy.RETIREMENT, HEALTHCARE, AND WELFARE PRIORITIES Past budgets have seen incremental changes, but a significant overhaul remains elusive. This year, taxpayers are keen to see whether longstanding demands for more comprehensive reforms will be addressed. Provisions supporting retirement planning, healthcare expenses, and family welfare are high on the wish list.FOCUS ON WORK-LIFE DYNAMICS There’s also hope for policies that cater to the evolving work environment, such as deductions for remote work expenses or incentives for skill development. The salaried class looks forward to tax provisions that align with contemporary needs, fostering both personal and professional growth. Will Budget 2025 meet these expectations or fall short? The government’s response will determine its commitment to addressing middle-class priorities. Until then, anticipation continues to build as the nation awaits February 1.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 6, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Standard Glass Lining IPO fully booked on Day 1: Should you subscribe or skip?Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 1: Investors have shown huge interest in the Standard Glass Lining IPO and on its opening day, the IPO was subscribed 7.43 times overall as of latest update.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Standard Glass Lining was fully subscribed within a few hours of opening for bidding on Monday.  Standard Glass Lining (SGLTL) IPO aims to raise Rs 410.05 crore through its book-built issue, comprising a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 210 crore and an offer for sale of Rs 200.05 crore. Investors have shown huge interest in the Standard Glass Lining IPO and on its opening day, January 6, 2025, the IPO was subscribed 7.43 times overall. Among the various categories, retail investors led the charge with a subscription rate of 9.6 times. Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs) also displayed strong interest, subscribing 12.27 times, while the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) segment saw minimal participation, and was subscribed just 0.01 times by 1:24 PM. Price band for Standard Glass Lining IPO has been set at Rs 133-140 per share, with a minimum lot size of 107 shares. Retail investors will need to invest at least Rs 14,980, while small NIIs must invest Rs 2,09,720 (14 lots) and large NIIs Rs 10,03,660 (67 lots).SHOULD YOU SUBSCRIBE? An IPO report from Geojit mentioned that SGLTL’s revenue grew from Rs 240.2 crore in FY22 to Rs 543.7crore in FY24 (CAGR 50.5%), while PAT rose from Rs 25.1 crore to Rs 60 crore (CAGR 55%), aided by its strategic partnerships and inorganic acquisitions. "At the upper price band of Rs.140, SGLTL is available at a P/E of 38.5x (on FY25 Annualised), which appears fairly priced compared to peers. The growing demand for glass-lined equipment in pharmaceuticals and chemicals offers significant growth potential. SGLTL’s healthy margins, consistent revenue growth robust growth outlook, a diverse product portfolio with a focus on customization, and inorganic growth plans support a "Subscribe" rating for the stock on a medium to long-term basis," the report said.  Standard Glass Lining successfully secured Rs 123.02 crore through its anchor investor segment ahead of its IPO launch. The company is led by its promoters, including Nageswara Rao Kandula, Kandula Krishna Veni, Kandula Ramakrishna, Venkata Mohana Rao Katragadda, Kudaravalli Punna Rao, and M/s S2 Engineering Services, reflecting a strong leadership team.  The IPO is being managed by IIFL Securities Ltd and Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors Limited as the book-running lead managers. Meanwhile, KFin Technologies Limited has been appointed as the registrar for handling the allotment and refund process.LATEST GMP The grey market premium (GMP) for Standard Glass Lining's IPO has remained steady in recent days, showing no fluctuations. As of January 6, 2025, at 12:24 PM, the GMP stood at Rs 96. With a price band set at Rs 140, the anticipated listing price for the IPO is around Rs 236, calculated by adding the cap price and the current GMP. This projection suggests a potential gain of approximately 68.57% per share. The company plans to finalise the allotment on January 10 and list its shares on both NSE and BSE by January 14. Headline: Why did Sensex, Nifty crash today? 5 reasons why stock market is down Stock market crash today: Sensex and Nifty tumbled sharply during the trading session as Dalal Street saw a massive spike in volatility. Below are the key factors that have negatively impacted the stock market today.
Content:
Domestic stock markets nosedived on Monday, with benchmark indices witnessing sharp losses.  The S&P BSE Sensex plummeted as much as 1,200 points, while the NSE Nifty50 fell well over 2% to hit an intraday low of 23,601.50. At around 1:34 pm, the Sensex was down 1179.72 points to 78,035.88 and the Nifty50 tumbled 363.20 points to trade at 23,641.55.  The downturn was driven by a combination of domestic and global factors, triggering a broad sell-off across sectors. Volatility spiked as the Nifty50’s volatility index rose to 14.5, indicating heightened nervousness among investors. Broader market indices, including Nifty Smallcap100 and Midcap100, faced steep declines of 2.60% and 2.40%, respectively. The sell-off was particularly severe in PSU banking, metals, and realty sectors, with no sector managing to stay in the green. Experts have identified multiple reasons behind the market crash, ranging from the detection of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) cases in India to weak global cues and ongoing FPI outflows. Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, noted, “The market is likely to be influenced by the negative factors impacting FII flows and some positive domestic factors which can support the market.”WEAK GLOBAL CUES Global economic conditions remain unfavourable, with a high dollar index at 109 and the 10-year US bond yield at 4.62%. Dr. Vijayakumar explained, “The FIIs are likely to continue selling till the yields decline and the dollar stabilises.” These global challenges are weighing heavily on Indian markets.SECTORAL SELL-OFFSectoral indices on the Nifty were deep in the red, with Nifty PSU Bank falling 3.63%. Nifty Metal and Realty also saw sharp declines, dropping 2.98% and 2.77%, respectively. Broader indices, including Nifty Smallcap100, took a heavy hit as selling pressure mounted across the board.WEAK Q3 BUSINESS UPDATES Concerns over weak business updates from key sectors, particularly banking and FMCG, have further dampened sentiment. Chowdhury noted, “Markets have been under pressure primarily due to weak business updates by companies, especially banks and some FMCG stocks.”FPI SELLING AND RISING DOLLAR 
Persistent FPI selling and a strengthening dollar have exacerbated the market downturn. Manish Jain, Director at Mirae Asset Capital Markets, highlighted the challenges: “The government’s capex spending remains elusive, while depreciation of the Rupee has intensified, and a revival in consumption is still not evident. The market is waiting for strong positive triggers which are still missing.”VIRUS SCARE Last but not least, the discovery of two HMPV cases in Bengaluru sparked panic among investors. Although the virus is not expected to have the same impact as Covid-19, it led to a knee-jerk reaction in the markets. Manish Chowdhury, Head of Research at StoxBox, remarked, “Market sentiment may have turned a little sour due to initial HMPV cases found in India, but its impact may be limited as the fatality seems to be lower compared to the Covid virus.” With corporate earnings, the upcoming budget, and global trade policies on the horizon, market volatility is likely to remain elevated in the near term. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 6, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Table Space co-founder Amit Banerji dies of heart attackAmit Banerji, founder and CEO of Table Space, passed away suddenly at 44, leaving a lasting impact on the startup ecosystem and his company's growth.
Content: Amit Banerji, the founder, chairman, and CEO of managed workspace provider Table Space, tragically passed away from a heart attack on Monday morning, reported VCCircle. His untimely death was confirmed by the company in an official statement. "It is with deep sadness that we announce the passing of Mr. Amit Banerji, our Founder, Chairman, and CEO. His impact on the company, its people and the industry will be lasting, and he will be profoundly missed by his family, friends and partners," the statement read. Banerji, aged 44, was a seasoned professional with vast experience in the technology and real estate sectors. Before founding Table Space in 2017, he worked at Accenture for over 13 years, leaving as its managing director of corporate real estate in India. He co-founded Table Space alongside Karan Chopra, with a vision to provide innovative and flexible workspace solutions. Under Banerji's leadership, Table Space grew rapidly, with Banerji playing a pivotal role in business planning, negotiations, and asset management. The company, aiming for a valuation of $2.5 billion in its upcoming IPO, raised around $330 million in several funding rounds, including a significant commitment from Hillhouse Capital. As of FY24, Table Space reported a 35% increase in revenue, with a notable rise in both occupancy rates and leasable areas. Despite this significant growth, the company will undoubtedly feel the impact of Banerji's loss as it moves forward with plans for its IPO. Banerji’s untimely death joins a tragic trend of premature losses in the entrepreneurial world, with Rohan Malhotra, co-founder of Good Capital, passing away at 44 last year, Ambareesh Murty, co-founder of Pepperfry, at 51 in 2023, and Rohan Mirchandani, co-founder of Epigamia, who also died of a heart attack last month.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 6, 2025

Headline: Ritesh Agarwal explains how OYO is shifting focus to family-friendly staysKnown for being couple-friendly, even for unmarried couples, OYO has been working over the past few months to rebrand itself as a more family-oriented platform.
Content: Social media has been buzzing about OYO revising its check-in policy for unmarried couples in Meerut. According to the new policy, OYO has empowered its partner hotels to decide whether to accept or decline bookings from couples based on their judgement, aligning with local social sensibilities. Known for being couple-friendly, even for unmarried couples, OYO has been working over the past few months to rebrand itself as a more family-oriented platform. In an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, OYO founder Ritesh Agarwal discussed the brand’s image transformation and the need to shift its focus. During the promotions of Shark Tank India 4, where Agarwal returns as one of the sharks (investors), the entrepreneur addressed OYO's branding, which has been largely associated with couple stays — something he described as a 'social media-created perspective.' He also highlighted their recent advertisement, which aimed to challenge this perception and promoted its partner hotels to be better suited for families. Agarwal shared that, according to their data, most of OYO’s bookings have always come from families or business travellers. "It’s been quite interesting because, based on our data, a significant portion of our business — almost 70-80% — comes from families or business travellers. However, there is a social media perception, mainly fuelled by certain memes, which has created a new context. We appreciate this because that (couple stays) has been a challenge for our society too," Agarwal told India Today Digital.  The founder also discussed OYO’s branding evolution to a more premium image, particularly after recognising the potential of religious tourism. "We launched 80 hotels in Ayodhya and have partners in Varanasi, Rameshwaram, Ajmer, and other religious destinations across the country, all of which are growing rapidly. As our brands grew, we realised the value of confronting the branding challenge head-on. Rather than whispering about the assumptions created by memes, we wanted to address them directly. The reality is different, and I believe brands should be bold. If there are misconceptions, they should not hesitate to communicate openly with customers. You need to convey the message and help them understand. Only then can both parties benefit," the OYO founder said.  Agarwal further shared that the new branding strategy had proven successful, with the company seeing the highest app downloads, repeat rates, and hotel openings in the last three years. "We really got a lot of love," he said. When asked if the memes on social media ever caused him embarrassment or made him feel bad about how his company was perceived, Agarwal responded, "Not at all. OYO is a highly respected brand in the corporate world, and we've won several 'Best Corporate' awards. The platform is used by families in central India, from Orissa to Uttar Pradesh, and they don’t have that perception at all. The whole thing has been a social media phenomenon, mainly in urban cities. Even when we released the new ad, it was targeted specifically at urban cities. We didn’t even air it on TV; it was just a digital message. This issue is primarily a big-city problem, but it’s rapidly changing thanks to our company-managed hotels." Shark Tank India 4 starts streaming today on SonyLIV. In addition to Ritesh Agarwal, the other sharks on the show include Anupam Mittal (Shaadi.com), Aman Gupta (boAt), Namita Thapar (Emcure), Peyush Bansal (Lenskart), Vineeta Singh (Sugar), Azhar Iqubal (Inshorts), Varun Dua (ACKO), Kunal Bahl (Snapdeal), and Viraj Bahl (Veeba).Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 6, 2025

Headline: EPFO 3.0 launch date announced: Check ATM withdrawal feature, other detailsEPFO 3.0, launching by June 2025, will offer ATM-based withdrawals, flexible contributions, and improved features, transforming retirement fund management.
Content: In a significant move for millions of Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) members, the government is preparing to launch the highly anticipated EPFO 3.0 by June 2025. Aimed at enhancing efficiency, accessibility, and user experience, this new software is set to transform the way employees manage their retirement savings.ENHANCED FEATURES AND ACCESSIBILITY Union Labour Minister Mansukh Mandaviya revealed that EPFO 3.0 will bring a host of features aimed at streamlining the EPF processes. One of the standout features of the new system will be a more user-friendly website interface, making it easier for members to navigate and manage their accounts. The system will offer a level of efficiency similar to that of banking systems in India, allowing employees to access their retirement funds seamlessly.ATM CARD FOR EPF MEMBERS One of the most anticipated features of EPFO 3.0 is the introduction of ATM cards for EPF members. Once the system is launched, employees will be able to withdraw their EPF savings directly from ATMs, enhancing accessibility and allowing them to address financial emergencies more conveniently. The first phase of website and system upgrades is expected to be completed by the end of January 2025.PENSION SCHEME FLEXIBILITY AND WITHDRAWAL GUIDELINES In addition to ATM withdrawals, the EPFO is exploring changes to the Employees' Pension Scheme (EPS), offering employees the flexibility to adjust their contribution levels. The current system mandates a 12% contribution from both the employee and employer, but with the proposed change, employees may have the option to contribute more or less, based on their preferences.A NEW ERA FOR EPF MEMBERS With these exciting changes on the horizon, EPFO 3.0 is poised to make managing retirement savings more convenient and efficient than ever before. The expected improvements will not only benefit employees but will also help address unforeseen financial needs, marking a new era in India’s retirement savings ecosystem. As 2025 approaches, all eyes will be on the implementation of these revolutionary changes.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 6, 2025

Headline: IT giant Infosys defers annual salary hikes to Q4. 3 reasons whyInfosys postpones annual salary hike: The ongoing macroeconomic uncertainty has left IT companies grappling with subdued discretionary spending, delayed client budgets, and rising cost pressures.
Content: India’s second-largest IT services provider, Infosys, has postponed its annual salary increments to the fourth quarter of the current financial year (Q4FY25), reported moneycontrol.com. The company last implemented pay hikes in November 2023. Typically, scheduled earlier in the year, this delay in wage hikes signals broader challenges in the global demand environment, particularly for discretionary IT services. The ongoing macroeconomic uncertainty has left IT companies grappling with subdued discretionary spending, delayed client budgets, and rising cost pressures.advertisementINDUSTRY-WIDE COST MANAGEMENT Infosys is not the only IT giant adopting such measures. Rivals such as HCLTech, LTIMindtree, and L&T Tech Services also chose to skip salary increments during the second quarter to curb expenses and maintain profitability, added the report.  As part of its phased approach, Infosys had earlier announced plans to implement wage hikes partially in January and fully by April, as confirmed by Chief Financial Officer Jayesh Sanghrajka during the company’s Q2 earnings call.EARNINGS UNCERTAINTY In Q2FY25, Infosys reported a 2.2% quarter-on-quarter rise in net profit, reaching Rs 6,506 crore. While this represented modest growth, it fell short of market expectations. Margins saw a slight improvement of 10 basis points, aided by reduced onsite costs, better utilisation rates, and enhanced operational efficiencies. Despite these gains, analysts from Motilal Oswal Financial Services anticipated margin pressures in the December quarter due to seasonal furloughs and fewer working days. However, cost-saving initiatives like subcontractor optimisation, pricing improvements, and Infosys’ margin improvement plan, Project Maximus, may help offset these challenges.STAGNANT JOB MARKET The delayed salary hikes are unlikely to trigger significant attrition, analysts noted, given the stagnant job market in the IT sector, said analysts quoted in the moneycontrol.com report. Selective salary increments for top performers, especially those in high-demand areas like artificial intelligence, continue within certain delivery teams. For many employees, retaining their positions is seen as a bonus in the current economic climate. As Infosys and its peers navigate these turbulent times, cost management remains a key priority to sustain profitability while adapting to evolving global market conditions.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 6, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Sensex slides 1,200 points as HMPV scare derails Dalal StreetThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 1258.12 points to close at 77,964.99, while the NSE Nifty50 nosedived 388.70 points to end at 23,616.05.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices tanked on Monday as HMPV virus scare spooked investors, triggering a massive sell-off, resulting in Sensex and Nifty closing 1.5 % lower.  The S&P BSE Sensex slipped 1258.12 points to close at 77,964.99, while the NSE Nifty50 nosedived 388.70 points to end at 23,616.05.  Santosh Meena, Head of Research, Swastika Investmart said that the Indian equity markets are witnessing a sharp decline today, with both Nifty and Bank Nifty slipping below their 200-day moving averages (DMA). "The sell-off can be attributed to a rise in foreign institutional investor (FII) selling and concerns surrounding the upcoming Q3 earnings season. Additionally, fears related to the new HMPV virus have added to the bearish sentiment, triggering fresh rounds of selling after the recent counter-trend pullback rally," he added.  The overall market structure appears weak; however, there remains a glimmer of hope for the bulls. One key factor is the lack of consistent follow-through in either direction, suggesting a degree of indecision. Furthermore, both Nifty and Bank Nifty are currently trading near their crucial support levels of 23,500 and 49,700, respectively, which could provide some respite to the bulls. Stock markets bled today, but some stocks still managed to gain.  Apollo Hospitals Enterprise emerged as the top gainer, rising 1.94%, followed by Tata Consumer Products which advanced 1.12%. Titan Company gained 0.72%, while HCL Technologies added a modest 0.10%, and ICICI Bank edged up by 0.08%. Tata Steel faced the steepest decline of 4.60% on Nifty50, followed by Trent Limited which fell 4.35%. Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited dropped 3.68%, while NTPC Limited declined 3.63%, and Adani Enterprises Limited decreased by 3.61%. "We can expect Nifty to gain support between 23,470 and 23,200 and notice resistance between 23,650 and 23,720 in the next intraday session. Notably, the overall sentiment will remain bearish, and we could expect the price to test the 22,900 level. In this situation, I suggest adopting a sell-on-rise approach while short-term and mid-term investors should continue to hedge their positions," said VLA Ambala, Co-Founder of Stock Market Today.  Market volatility spiked significantly, as reflected in the India VIX, which surged 15.58%. The broader markets faced severe selling pressure, with Nifty Smallcap100 taking a bigger hit, plunging 3.20%, while Nifty Midcap100 declined sharply by 2.70%. In a brutal sell-off today, all sectoral indices on the Nifty plunged into the red, with no sectors managing to escape the bloodbath. Nifty PSU Bank took the hardest hit plummeting 4.00%. Nifty Metal crashed 3.14%, closely followed by Nifty Realty which tumbled 3.16%. The banking sector faced severe pressure with Nifty while Nifty Bank fell 2.09% and Nifty Private Bank dropped 2.11%. Energy stocks weren't spared either, as Nifty Oil & Gas sank 2.89%. Nifty Media declined sharply by 2.71%, while Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank fell 2.75%. Nifty Auto lost 2.18%, and Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom decreased 2.18%. The financial services pack showed significant weakness with Nifty Financial Services 25/50 dropping 1.90%, Nifty Financial Services falling 1.76%, and Nifty Midsmall Financial Services declining 3.39%. Consumer-focused sectors also faced selling pressure, with Nifty Consumer Durables down 1.65% and Nifty FMCG falling 1.91%. Nifty IT showed the smallest decline of 0.12%, but couldn't escape the negative territory.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 6, 2025Must Watch

Headline: ITR filing: Why you should declare foreign assets by January 15Indian residents must disclose foreign assets and income in their ITRs by January 15, 2025, to maintain compliance and avoid penalties.
Content: The deadline for Indian residents to report their foreign assets and income in their Income Tax Returns (ITRs) is fast approaching. By January 15, 2025, taxpayers must disclose any overseas financial accounts, income, and assets as part of their tax filing process for the Assessment Year 2024-25.SOURCES OF FOREIGN ACCOUNT INFORMATION To ensure compliance, the Indian government and its law enforcement agencies gather detailed information on financial accounts held by Indian residents abroad through two key international frameworks: FATCA (Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act) and CRS (Common Reporting Standard). These sources allow the Indian Income Tax Department to monitor the global income of taxpayers and track those who may not be fully transparent in their disclosures.UNDERSTANDING FATCA AND CRS FATCA is a US law that compels foreign financial institutions to report accounts held by U.S. taxpayers to the IRS. On the other hand, CRS is an initiative by the OECD (Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development), requiring global financial institutions to disclose foreign-held financial account information to the relevant tax authorities. Both frameworks play a crucial role in promoting global tax transparency and preventing tax evasion.DISCLOSURE REQUIREMENTS FOR INDIAN TAXPAYERS Under the Indian Income-tax Act, 1961, residents must report their foreign assets and income in their ITRs. To ensure proper reporting, foreign assets must be declared using Schedule FA, while income from abroad is reported via Schedule FSI. Additionally, taxpayers can claim tax relief for taxes paid abroad through Schedule TR.EXTENDED ITR FILING DEADLINE The Income Tax Department has extended the deadline for filing belated and revised ITRs for fiscal year 2023-24 from December 31, 2024, to January 15, 2025. This extension allows taxpayers with foreign assets or income to update their filings, ensuring full compliance with Indian tax laws before the final date. As the deadline draws near, it’s crucial for taxpayers with foreign assets and income to ensure they meet the reporting requirements. Failing to disclose foreign assets or income can result in penalties and legal consequences. The government’s push for transparency through FATCA and CRS will continue to shape the tax landscape, making it imperative for taxpayers to be vigilant about their obligations.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 6, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Stocks to watch today: Vodafone Idea, RIL, Adani Power, Indo Farm EquipmentStocks of Indo Farm Equipment, RIL, Adani Power, Mobikwik, BPCL, RIL, Bharti Airtel, Coal India, among others, are expected to remain in focus as trading resumes today, January 7, 2025.

Headline: Stock market today: Will volatility continue to haunt Dalal Street?Concerns over the HMPV virus and foreign institutional investors (FIIs) pulling out funds triggered a massive sell-off, leaving the Sensex and Nifty both over 1.5% lower.
Content: The stock market witnessed a crash on Monday that left the Dalal Street bleeding as investors' wealth declined significantly. The week began with heavy selling pressure, dragging all sectoral indices into the red. Concerns over the HMPV virus and foreign institutional investors (FIIs) pulling out funds triggered a massive sell-off, leaving the Sensex and Nifty both over 1.5% lower. The S&P BSE Sensex plunged 1,258.12 points to close at 77,964.99, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 388.70 points to end at 23,616.05. Nifty PSU Bank bore the brunt, plummeting by 4%, marking its worst performance since June 2024. Nifty Metal and Nifty Realty followed with losses of 3.14% and 3.16%, respectively. Broader market indices also suffered sharp declines. Nifty Smallcap100 plunged 3.20%, while Nifty Midcap100 fell by 2.70%. Meanwhile, the India VIX, a measure of market volatility, spiked 15.58%, reflecting investor anxiety. The market fall marked one of the steepest single-day declines in recent months. REASON FOR MARKET CRASH  "The sell-off was largely attributed to continued foreign institutional investor (FII) outflows and confirmation of HMPV cases in India coincided with reports of a virus outbreak in China, leading to heightened investor caution," said Vaibhav Vidwani, Research Analyst at Bonanza. Analysts also pointed to other factors that contributed to the market crash. Among these were weak business updates from key sectors, particularly banks and FMCG companies, and concerns over tightening liquidity in the banking sector. "The main concern of the market pressure has been the firms' poor business updates, particularly those from banks and FMCG stocks. The banking sector is currently navigating a landscape of tightening liquidity and slowing deposit growth. A stronger dollar and ongoing FPI selling have made the market decline worse. The strength of the US dollar and rising bond yields created a challenging environment for emerging markets," said CA Jashan Arora, Director, Master Trust Group.WHAT TO EXPECT TODAY Market volatility is expected to persist on Tuesday, fuelled by ongoing concerns over the HMPV virus, upcoming corporate earnings reports, and macroeconomic factors such as the Union Budget and global trade policy shifts. Ajit Mishra, SVP, Research at Religare Broking Ltd, highlighted the challenges ahead and said, "The pullback in the Nifty index, coupled with a spike in volatility (India VIX), has disrupted the recovery trend, signalling potential challenges ahead. The banking sector's recent underperformance, combined with weakness in the midcap and smallcap segments, has intensified the bearish sentiment." He further added that the pharma and healthcare sectors are expected to maintain their resilience, while other sectors may continue to face downward pressure.  "We can expect Nifty to gain support between 23,470 and 23,200 and notice resistance between 23,650 and 23,720 in the next intraday session. Notably, the overall sentiment will remain bearish, and we could expect the price to test the 22,900 level. In this situation, I suggest adopting a sell-on-rise approach while short-term and mid-term investors should continue to hedge their positions," said VLA Ambala, Co-Founder of Stock Market Today. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 7, 2025

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher as Dalal Street rebounds from HMPV virus scareStock market rebounds: The S&P BSE Sensex surged 369.05 points to 78,334.04, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 151.40 points to 23,767.50 as of 9:20 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened higher on Tuesday with Sensex and Nifty recovering over 0.5%, driven by gains in banking, financials and energy sector stocks.  The S&P BSE Sensex surged 369.05 points to 78,334.04, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 151.40 points to 23,767.50 as of 9:20 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that the 1.6% cut in Nifty yesterday appears to be an overreaction to the HMPV virus concerns. "FII selling of Rs 2575 crores was overwhelmed by the DII buying of Rs 5750 crores. In spite of that, the Nifty corrected by 388 points, which means the correction was triggered by short selling by bears trying to exploit the negative sentiments. The resilience of the Pharma and health care stocks also indicate the influence of the virus concerns on the market. The fact that momentum stocks were on the back foot yesterday indicates lack of confidence by the bulls in the context of negative sentiments," he added.  Clarification by the government that there is no room for undue concern from the virus, which is not new, can facilitate a rebound in the market, led by momentum stocks. Investors can use the dip to buy fundamentally strong beaten down stocks in automobiles and financials.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 7, 2025

Headline: Indo Farm Equipment IPO listing: Will it make a strong market debut? Indo Farm Equipment share price: The Indo Farm Equipment IPO saw bumper investor interest, achieving one of the highest subscription rates in recent times on its final day.
Content: Shares of Indo Farm Equipment Limited are set to make their debut on Dalal Street on Tuesday amid the stock market going through a turbulent time with Sensex and Nifty falling sharply in the previous session.  Allotment of shares for Indo Farm Equipment was completed on January 3, after the public listing received massive subscription numbers at the end of its 3-day bidding process. The Indo Farm Equipment IPO saw bumper investor interest, achieving one of the highest subscription rates in recent times on its final day. Indo Farm Equipment IPO was subscribed 227.67 times overall. In the retail category, it received 101.79 times the bids, while the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) segment was subscribed 242.4 times. The Non-Institutional Investors (NII) category saw exceptional demand, with a subscription rate of 501.75 times. Indo Farm Equipment IPO opened for bidding on December 31, 2024 and closed for subscription on January 2, 2025.STRONG MARKET DEBUT ON CARDS? "Considering renewed market sentiments and massive subscription demand, we expect the company can list with strong listing gains over and above 40% on its issue price. We believe the expected listing gain is justified as investors believe healthy growth post expansion of pick and carry cranes capacities and strengthen its dealer network," said Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.  "We recommend conservative allotted investors can think of booking profits above our expectations. While long term investors should consider to HOLD IT FOR LONG TERM despite knowing short term volatility post listing & risk in the markets. For non-allotted investors, we advise to accumulate if we get dips post listing due to profit booking attempts," he added. INDO FARM EQUIPMENT LATEST GMP The GMP has seen a decline and as of January 7, 2025, at 5:04 AM, the latest GMP stood at Rs 76. With the IPO's price band set at Rs 215, the estimated listing price is Rs 291, calculated by adding the cap price and the current GMP. This suggests a potential gain of 35.35% per share. The IPO had a price band of Rs 204-215 per share and aimed to raise Rs 260.15 crore. It offered 84,70,000 shares but has received bid for 1,92,83,39,964 shares, raking in Rs 41,459.31 crore. Indo Farm Equipment, established in 1994, manufactures tractors, cranes, and harvesting equipment under its brands Indo Farm and Indo Power. The company exports its products to markets including Nepal, Sudan, Bangladesh, and Myanmar, among others. Despite these strong figures, the listing did not match grey market predictions, which had anticipated a 35% premium. Instead, the shares settled at approximately 20% above the IPO price, delivering a solid but not exceptional performance. Investors showed overwhelming interest in the Indo Farm Equipment IPO, which turned out to be one of the most heavily subscribed offerings in recent memory, especially on the final day. Retail investors submitted bids 101.79 times their allotted portion, while the Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) category recorded 242.4 times subscription. Headline: Capital Infra Trust InvIT IPO opens for bidding. Check key dates, price bandThe IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 1,578 crore, which includes a fresh issue of 10.77 crore shares amounting to Rs 1,077 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 5.01 crore shares aggregating to Rs 501 crore.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Capital Infra Trust InvIT has opened for bidding, providing investors with an opportunity to subscribe to this infrastructure investment trust. The IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 1,578 crore, which includes a fresh issue of 10.77 crore shares amounting to Rs 1,077 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 5.01 crore shares aggregating to Rs 501 crore. The bidding for the IPO will remain open until January 9, 2025. Following the closure of the bidding process, the allotment of shares is expected to be finalised on January 10, 2025. The price band for the IPO has been set at Rs 99 to Rs 100 per share, with the minimum investment lot size set at 150 shares. For retail investors, the minimum investment amount is Rs 15,000. For non-institutional investors (NII), the investment requirements differ: Small NII (sNII): Minimum of 14 lots (2,100 shares), amounting to Rs 2,10,000. Big NII (bNII): Minimum of 67 lots (10,050 shares), amounting to Rs 10,05,000.CAPITAL INFRA TRUST INVIT REVIEW Capital Infra Trust was established in September 2023 as an infrastructure investment trust (InvIT) sponsored by Gawar Construction Limited, a company known for its expertise in building roads and highways across 19 Indian states. The trust was created to make investments and carry out activities permitted under the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) InvIT Regulations. Gawar Construction Limited has a history of working on projects for various government organisations, including the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI), Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH), Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA), and the Central Public Works Department (CPWD). Capital Infra Trust InvIT has already raised Rs 710.10 crore from anchor investors ahead of the public offering. The IPO is managed by SBI Capital Markets Limited and HDFC Bank Limited as the book-running lead managers, while KFin Technologies Limited serves as the registrar.GREY MARKET PREMIUM (GMP) As of the latest update on January 7, 2025, the grey market premium (GMP) for the IPO stands at Rs 0. This indicates that the market expects the shares to list near the upper end of the price band, around Rs 100 per share. With the GMP at Rs 0, the estimated listing price aligns with the cap price of the IPO, suggesting no immediate gain or loss per share. The shares of Capital Infra Trust InvIT are slated to list on both the BSE and NSE on January 14, 2025.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 7, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Trade Unions join pre-budget discussions with Nirmala SitharamanFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman held pre-Budget talks with trade unions to shape the Union Budget 2025-26, focusing on economic challenges and growth ahead of its February 1 presentation.
Content:
Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman chaired the eighth Pre-Budget Consultation meeting with representatives from trade unions in New Delhi on January 6, 2025. This consultation aimed to gather inputs for the upcoming Union Budget 2025-26 and explore the concerns and expectations of trade unions. The meeting is part of the government’s annual tradition of involving diverse stakeholders in shaping economic policies and ensuring equitable resource allocation.advertisementKEY PARTICIPANTS IN THE CONSULTATIONThe meeting saw the presence of Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary, top Finance Ministry officials, and representatives from the Labour Ministry. Amongst those present were the Finance Secretary, Secretaries from the Department of Economic Affairs and Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM), and the Chief Economic Adviser. The meeting saw the presence of Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary, top Finance Ministry officials, and representatives from the Labour Ministry. Amongst those present were the Finance Secretary, Secretaries from the Department of Economic Affairs and Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM), and the Chief Economic Adviser. The discussion emphasised the government’s commitment to incorporating feedback from key sectors to address economic challenges and foster growth.A BROADER CONSULTATION DRIVE This consultation follows a series of pre-Budget meetings chaired by Sitharaman. On January 2, she met with stakeholders from the financial sector and capital markets. Earlier engagements included consultations with representatives from Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs), farmers’ associations, economists, and industry leaders. These discussions highlight the government’s collaborative approach to shaping policies for the nation’s economic future. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has also taken an active role in Budget preparations. Last week, he held discussions with eminent economists and thought leaders at NITI Aayog to gather insights and strategies for steering India’s economic growth.ANTICIPATION FOR THE FEBRUARY 1 BUDGET The Union Budget 2025-26, scheduled for presentation on February 1, will be Nirmala Sitharaman’s eighth. Stakeholders are keenly anticipating measures to tackle economic challenges, drive growth, and set a progressive vision. The consultation meetings reflect the government’s commitment to delivering a balanced Budget and a promising economic future for India.

Headline: Stock market recovers after yesterday's crash. What's next on Dalal Street?Stock market recovery today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 254.11 points to 78,219.10 at 11:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 115.75 points to trade at 23,735.10.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices registered a decent recovery on Tuesday after crashing in the previous session. The S&P BSE Sensex was up 254.11 points to 78,219.10 at 11:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 115.75 points to trade at 23,735.10. Most other broader market indices, including small and midcaps, also registered gains. Despite today’s recovery in early trade, there are visible signs of volatility on Dalal Street due to a slew of factors such as FII selling, strengthening dollar, Q3 results and a few other factors. Additionally, the first GDP advance estimates for FY25 will be released today and economists have indicated that growth could slow down to a four-year low. Given the uncertainty on Dalal Street, experts have offered some insights on what factors are triggering volatility and how retail traders can navigate this turbulent phase. Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd, said, “Nifty's Monday decline was driven by persistent selling from FIIs, who offloaded Rs 2,575 crore worth of shares, pushing the index below its 200-DMA at 23,907.” “Key catalysts for heightened volatility include FIIs selling Rs 7,078.30 crore of Indian equities in January, a record-low Rupee at 85.85, a spike in oil prices to $74.75 per barrel, and elevated US Treasury yields,” he added. “As the market awaits US NFP data and TCS's Q3 results, Nifty's direction remains uncertain amidst global and domestic pressures,” he noted, indicating that investors should remain cautious for the time being. Meanwhile, Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, said the 1.6% cut in Nifty yesterday appears to be an “overreaction to the HMPV virus concerns”. “FII selling of Rs 2,575 crore was overwhelmed by the DII buying of Rs 5,750 crore. In spite of that, the Nifty corrected by 388 points, which means the correction was triggered by short selling by bears trying to exploit the negative sentiments,” Vijayakumar explained. “The fact that momentum stocks were on the back foot yesterday indicates lack of confidence by the bulls in the context of negative sentiments. Clarification by the government that there is no room for undue concern from the virus, which is not new, can facilitate a rebound in the market, led by momentum stocks,” Vijayakumar said. “Investors can use the dip to buy fundamentally strong beaten down stocks in automobiles and financials." Headline: Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 2: Check GMP, price band, subscription Standard Glass Lining IPO Day 2: Price band for Standard Glass Lining IPO has been set at Rs 133-140 per share, with a minimum lot size of 107 shares.
Content: The bidding process for Standard Glass Lining IPO entered its second day after having been oversubscribed over 13 times on the first day of subscription.  Standard Glass Lining IPO opened for bidding on January 6 and interested investors can subscribe to the public listing until Januay 8, 2024.  The IPO of Standard Glass Lining has seen strong interest, with an overall subscription rate of 17.35 times as of 10:39 AM on January 7, 2025, which is the second day of bidding. Retail investors have shown the highest interest, with their category being oversubscribed by 18.98 times. The Non-Institutional Investors (NII) segment recorded an even more impressive response, being subscribed 34.27 times. Meanwhile, Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) have subscribed to the issue at a more modest rate of 1.81 times Price band for Standard Glass Lining IPO has been set at Rs 133-140 per share, with a minimum lot size of 107 shares. Retail investors will need to invest at least Rs 14,980, while small NIIs must invest Rs 2,09,720 (14 lots) and large NIIs Rs 10,03,660 (67 lots).SHOULD YOU SUBSCRIBE? "At the upper price band of Rs.140, SGLTL is available at a P/E of 38.5x (on FY25 Annualised), which appears fairly priced compared to peers. The growing demand for glass-lined equipment in pharmaceuticals and chemicals offers significant growth potential. SGLTL’s healthy margins, consistent revenue growth robust growth outlook, a diverse product portfolio with a focus on customisation, and inorganic growth plans support a "Subscribe" rating for the stock on a medium to long-term basis," said an IPO report from Geojit.LATEST GMP  The latest grey market premium (GMP) for the Standard Glass Lining IPO is Rs 93 as of 8:59 AM on January 7, 2025. Considering the IPO's price band of Rs 140, the estimated listing price is projected at Rs 233. This figure is calculated by adding the GMP to the upper end of the price band. Based on this estimation, the potential gain per share stands at approximately 66.43%. Standard Glass Lining successfully secured Rs 123.02 crore through its anchor investor segment ahead of its IPO launch. The company is led by its promoters, including Nageswara Rao Kandula, Kandula Krishna Veni, Kandula Ramakrishna, Venkata Mohana Rao Katragadda, Kudaravalli Punna Rao, and M/s S2 Engineering Services, reflecting a strong leadership team. The IPO is being managed by IIFL Securities Ltd and Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors Limited as the book-running lead managers. Meanwhile, KFin Technologies Limited has been appointed as the registrar for handling the allotment and refund process. The company plans to finalise the allotment on January 10 and list its shares on both NSE and BSE by January 14. Headline: Explained: Why Biocon share price jumped over 7% todayBiocon stock price: At around 10:45 am, shares of the company were trading 7.22% higher at Rs 384.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Content: Shares of Biocon surged over 7% in early trade on January 7, following an upgrade from international brokerage Jefferies. The firm raised its rating on Biocon to 'underperform' and increased its target price by 43% to Rs 400, citing positive developments around the regulatory approval of the company’s manufacturing facility in Bengaluru. The new target price suggests an upside potential of approximately 12% from Monday’s closing price. At 10:45 am, Biocon shares were trading 7.22% higher at Rs 384.50 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).advertisementBIG FDA BOOST  The key trigger for the rally was the US Food and Drug Administration’s (US FDA) approval of Biocon’s biologics unit in Bengaluru, which received a “Voluntary Action Indicated” (VAI) status. The VAI classification signals that while minor issues were noted during the inspection, they do not require further regulatory actions. The development clears the path for Biocon to continue its operations without any disruptions. Investors now turn their focus to the regulatory approval process for Biocon’s Malaysia manufacturing unit, which remains a critical factor for the company’s growth outlook.BIOSIMILAR STELARA BOOST In addition to the Bengaluru unit approval, Jefferies highlighted Biocon’s recent milestone in securing US FDA approval for its biosimilar version of Janssen’s Stelara, a top-selling drug used to treat autoimmune disorders. Biocon plans to launch the biosimilar, branded as Yesintek, in February 2025. Stelara generated $7 billion in US sales in 2023, and Biocon aims to tap into this lucrative market. While competition in the biosimilar space is intense, with five other FDA-approved versions expected to launch in FY25, Jefferies sees strong growth potential for Biocon’s biologics business. Analysts believe the Stelara biosimilar approval significantly enhances Biocon’s revenue and profitability visibility. With these developments, Biocon can capitalise on regulatory clearances and expand its biologics portfolio, driving investor confidence and fuelling the stock’s upward momentum. Headline: Zomato shares slide 5% today as Jefferies cuts target price. 3 things to knowAt 10:33 am, Zomato's stock price was down 4.19% to Rs 253.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, the shares of Zomato hit an intra-day low of Rs 251.55.
Content: Foreign brokerage Jefferies has downgraded Zomato from a ‘Buy’ to a ‘Hold’ rating, slashing its target price to Rs 275 from Rs 335, citing increased competition in the quick commerce segment. The revised target reflects limited upside from Monday’s closing price of Rs 264.65 per share. At 10:33 am, shares of Zomato were down 4.19% to Rs 253.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, the stock hit an intra-day low of Rs 251.55.advertisementWHY JEFFERIES CUT ZOMATO’S TARGET PRICE? Jefferies highlighted that rising competition is expected to weigh on profitability, predicting a year of consolidation for Zomato’s stock, which delivered a 98.76% return over the past year. The brokerage also cut its FY26-27 consolidated EBITDA estimates by 12-15% and halved its valuation multiple for Blinkit to 6x.WHAT ABOUT OTHER BROKERAGES? Meanwhile, Elara Securities noted that success in the quick commerce space depends on strengthening verticals, agile market entry, and competitive offerings. It remains optimistic about Blinkit’s market leadership, citing higher average order values and larger assortments despite rising competition from Swiggy’s Instamart. Brokerage firm Anand Rathi sees room for multiple players to coexist in the quick commerce market. It initiated coverage on both Zomato and Swiggy with ‘Buy’ ratings, setting 12-month target prices of Rs 385 and Rs 705, respectively.ZOMATO VS SWIGGY While Zomato leads in market share and revenue, the brokerage acknowledged Swiggy’s growth through initiatives like its 10-minute food delivery service and QC expansion. The firm also noted that the quick commerce segment’s current revenue primarily comes from top-tier cities but is rapidly expanding into Tier 2 and Tier 3 locations. Blinkit has scaled operations to 45-50 cities and aims to surpass 1,000 stores by FY25. Similarly, Swiggy’s Instamart has grown to 54 cities, with plans to reach 75 cities and 1,000 dark stores by FY25-end. Headline: Delta Autocorp IPO opens today: Check GMP, price band and other detailsDelta Autocorp IPO open for bidding: The IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 54.60 crore, comprising a fresh issue of 38.88 lakh shares amounting to Rs 50.54 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 3.12 lakh shares, aggregating to Rs 4.06 crore.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Delta Autocorp Limited, a small and medium enterprise (SME), opened for bidding today. The IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 54.60 crore, comprising a fresh issue of 38.88 lakh shares amounting to Rs 50.54 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 3.12 lakh shares, aggregating to Rs 4.06 crore. The bidding for the Delta Autocorp IPO will remain open until January 9, 2025. The allotment of shares is expected to be finalised on January 10, 2025, with the shares likely to list on the NSE SME platform on January 14, 2025. The IPO price band is set at Rs 123 to Rs 130 per share, with a minimum lot size of 1,000 shares. For retail investors, the minimum investment required is Rs 1,30,000. For high-net-worth individuals (HNI), the minimum investment is 2 lots (2,000 shares), amounting to Rs 2,60,000.COMPANY OVERVIEW Incorporated in 2016, Delta Autocorp Limited is engaged in the manufacturing and sale of electric 2-wheelers and 3-wheelers. The company operates under the brand name "Deltic" and initially focused on developing electric 3-wheeler prototypes. A major milestone for Delta Autocorp came in 2017 with the launch of its first E-Rickshaw, which offers an impressive mileage of over 150 km. This innovation has positioned the company as a prominent player in the growing electric vehicle (EV) market. Delta Autocorp has already raised Rs 15.21 crore from anchor investors, reflecting positive initial interest in the IPO. The estimated market capitalisation of Delta Autocorp post-IPO is Rs 198.77 crore.GREY MARKET PREMIUM (GMP) As of the latest update on January 7, 2025 (09:01 AM), the grey market premium (GMP) for the Delta Autocorp IPO stands at Rs 110, indicating strong demand in the unofficial market. Based on the GMP and the upper end of the price band (Rs 130), the estimated listing price is Rs 240 per share. This represents an expected gain of 84.62% per share, making it an attractive prospect for investors seeking short-term returns. The IPO is managed by GYR Capital Advisors Private Limited as the book-running lead manager, and the registrar for the issue is Link Intime India Private Ltd. Giriraj Stock Broking Private Limited is the market maker for the IPO.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 7, 2025

Headline: Will Q3 results deepen Dalal Street sell-off? 3 stocks to watch amid uncertaintySensex and Nifty plunged over 1.5%, and the Nifty PSU Bank suffered a loss of close to 4% in Monday's bloodbath on Dalal Street, reflecting weak investor sentiment, dampened market conditions and uncertainty.
Content: Dalal Street is facing increased volatility after Sensex, Nifty opened higher, showing signs of recovery on Tuesday after they crashed in the previous session, raising questions about whether stock markets will see further downside as companies prepare to announce their Q3 FY24 results. Sensex and Nifty plunged over 1.5%, and the Nifty PSU Bank suffered a loss of close to 4% in Monday's bloodbath on Dalal Street, reflecting weak investor sentiment, dampened market conditions and uncertainty.advertisementFURTHER DOWNSIDE EXPECTED?The sudden drop in key indices on Monday has disrupted the recovery trend in Indian markets. Analysts warn that rising volatility (India VIX) and sectoral weaknesses may lead to more selling pressure in the coming days. Ajit Mishra, SVP of Research at Religare Broking Ltd, shared insights on the situation.  The sudden drop in key indices on Monday has disrupted the recovery trend in Indian markets. Analysts warn that rising volatility (India VIX) and sectoral weaknesses may lead to more selling pressure in the coming days. Ajit Mishra, SVP of Research at Religare Broking Ltd, shared insights on the situation.  "The Nifty index's pullback on Monday, coupled with a rise in volatility, has disrupted the recovery trend, signalling potential challenges ahead. Weakness in the banking sector, along with declines in midcap and smallcap stocks, has amplified bearish sentiment. On the other hand, the pharma and healthcare sectors are expected to demonstrate resilience, while other sectors may remain under pressure. Traders are advised to realign their positions accordingly. Key levels to watch include support at 23,250 in Nifty and resistance in the 23,950-24,250 zone," said Mishra. FACTORS BEHIND MARKET VOLATILITY Several factors have contributed to the current market volatility: Disappointing quarterly updates: A few large-cap companies, particularly in the banking sector, have shared weaker-than-expected Q3 updates ahead of the results season. HMPV spooks investors: Increasing cases of the HMPV virus in India have added to investor worries. Foreign Institutional Investor (FII) outflows: FIIs have been consistent net sellers in Indian equities, offloading shares worth Rs 7,078 crore in December 2024. "Market sentiment has been dampened by a few disappointing quarterly updates, particularly from the banking sector, ahead of the earnings season, coupled with concerns over rising HMPV virus cases in India. Additionally, persistent foreign fund outflows are adding to the pressure. We believe that only strong earnings results can shift the market tone toward a sustained recovery; otherwise, the corrective trend is likely to persist, interspersed with occasional intermediate bounces," added Mishra. Amid the volatile backdrop, some stocks are showing clear trends, providing opportunities for both traders and investors. Below are specific stock recommendations from Dr Ravi Singh, SVP - Retail Research at Religare Broking, detailing potential moves based on current market conditions:Piramal Enterprises Limited (PEL) Analysis: The stock recently failed to sustain gains after breaking out in December and has now formed a bearish flag pattern. Recommendation: Sell January Futures at the current market price of Rs 1,054, with a stop-loss at Rs 1,087. Target: Rs 1,000 to Rs 980.Godrej Consumer Products (GODREJCP) Analysis: Godrej Consumer has shown resilience, rebounding strongly from the Rs 1,080-1,100 range. This indicates potential gains in the short to medium term. Recommendation: Buy in the price range of Rs 1,130-1,140, with a stop-loss below Rs 1,112. Target: Rs 1,190 to Rs 1,210.Cummins India (CUMMINSIND) Analysis: The stock recently broke below its critical support level of Rs 3,260, indicating a bearish trend. Recommendation: Sell January Futures at the current market price of Rs 3,180, with a stop-loss at Rs 3,240. Target: Rs 3,100. According to Singh, the market is likely to remain volatile until clear signals emerge from Q3 earnings reports. He said, "Given the current market weakness, we anticipate heightened volatility in the coming days. However, amid this uncertainty, select stocks could present opportunities for gains."
