Headline: Explained: Why MobiKwik share price jumped nearly 12% despite reporting Q2 lossMobikwik stock price today: The sharp rally came despite the company reporting a consolidated net loss of Rs 3.59 crore in Q2 FY25, compared to a profit of Rs 5.23 crore in Q2 FY24.
Content: Shares of One Mobikwik Systems, the parent company of fintech firm Mobikwik, surged nearly 8% on Tuesday, reaching an intraday high of Rs 602.30. The sharp rally came despite the company reporting a consolidated net loss of Rs 3.59 crore in Q2 FY25, compared to a profit of Rs 5.23 crore in Q2 FY24.  At around 1:45 pm, shares of the company were trading 11.47% higher at Rs 622.10 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Investors appeared optimistic as Mobikwik’s Q2 FY25 loss narrowed from Rs 6.62 crore in the previous quarter, signalling improving financial health. The company attributed the loss to ongoing investments in its business aimed at driving future growth.WHY MOBIKWIK SHARES ARE ON THE RISE?  Mobikwik’s revenue from operations saw a significant jump, rising 42.86% year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 290.65 crore from Rs 203.45 crore in Q2 FY24. The fintech company also reported a 267.3% YoY growth in Payments GMV (Gross Merchandise Value), driven by the rapid expansion of its payments business. The company’s EBITDA for the quarter stood at Rs 6.8 crore, which it attributed to improvements in contribution margin and optimized costs. This marked a positive development, as the business appears to be balancing growth initiatives with financial discipline. Mobikwik, a 15-year-old Gurugram-based fintech, has been a pioneer in digital payment innovations. Its latest product, Pocket UPI, allows users to make UPI transactions through their Mobikwik wallet instead of directly linking to a bank account, offering a seamless payment experience. The upbeat revenue growth and strong GMV expansion likely reassured investors about the company’s long-term potential, overshadowing the reported loss. Today’s stock surge reflects market confidence in Mobikwik’s strategic investments and its ability to capture a larger share of India’s booming digital payments marketPublished By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 7, 2025

Headline: SBI Har Ghar Lakhpati Scheme: Eligibility, features and interest rates explained SBI's Har Ghar Lakhpati RD helps individuals achieve Rs 1 lakh with small monthly investments and attractive returns.
Content: Imagine turning small monthly savings into Rs 1 lakh without the hassle of complex investment plans. SBI’s Har Ghar Lakhpati Recurring Deposit (RD) scheme promises exactly that—a simple, goal-oriented saving strategy for everyone.WHAT IS HAR GHAR LAKHPATI SCHEME? Launched by the State Bank of India, Har Ghar Lakhpati is a pre-calculated RD scheme designed to help individuals and families reach financial milestones. This initiative aims to make savings accessible and inclusive, empowering people to cultivate disciplined financial habits. The scheme is open to adults and minors, ensuring everyone can work toward their aspirations.FLEXIBLE TENURE AND ATTRACTIVE RETURNS The scheme offers flexibility in tenure, ranging from 12 months to 120 months (1 to 10 years), allowing customers to align their savings with personal goals such as weddings, home purchases, etc. The interest rates are competitive, with general citizens earning up to 7% for tenures beyond two years. Senior citizens enjoy even better rates, reaching 7.25% for specific terms.SIMPLE MONTHLY INVESTMENTS The Har Ghar Lakhpati RD enables you to achieve Rs 1 lakh by making small monthly investments. For general citizens, an investment of Rs 2,500 per month for three years at 6.75% interest or Rs 1,407 per month for five years at 6.50% can help reach the goal. Senior citizens can achieve the same by investing Rs 2,480 monthly for three years at 7.25% or Rs 1,389 monthly for five years at 7%.KEY FEATURES AND PENALTIES The scheme allows joint accounts and minors aged 10+ to open accounts independently. Opening an account is simple—visit an SBI branch or use online services. With this plan, saving for your dreams becomes effortless and reliable. Early withdrawals and missed instalments attract nominal penalties, ensuring discipline while remaining customer-friendly. SBI’s Har Ghar Lakhpati RD, with its flexible tenures and attractive returns, is an ideal solution for achieving your financial goals effortlessly. Begin with small investments today and take the first step toward realising your dreams!Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 7, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Will new income tax regime steal the spotlight again?Budget 2025 tax expectations: The upcoming budget may focus on the new income tax regime yet again to increase its appeal compared to the old tax regime.
Content: With the Union Budget 2025 less than a month away, industry bodies are urging Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to deliver substantial personal tax relief to individual taxpayers. Rising inflation and increasing living costs have amplified the demand for measures that could ease financial strain. Taxpayers are hopeful for adjustments that would enhance their disposable income and support economic growth. The government is likely to focus on spurring consumption, particularly in light of the sluggish GDP growth reported for the second quarter. Industry experts expect measures aimed at reducing the tax burden on salaried and middle-class individuals, which could, in turn, drive household savings and consumption. The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has recommended lowering marginal tax rates for individuals earning up to Rs 20 lakh annually, noting that such a move could stimulate a positive consumption cycle, foster growth, and boost tax revenue.WILL NEW INCOME TAX REGIME GET SWEETER?  The upcoming budget may focus on the new income tax regime yet again to increase its appeal compared to the old tax regime. Proposals under consideration include raising the income exemption threshold from Rs 7 lakh to Rs 8 lakh or higher and increasing the standard deduction for salaried individuals from Rs 75,000 to Rs 1 lakh. Additional family-oriented tax benefits, such as deductions for educational expenses and medical insurance premiums, are also being speculated. There’s discussion around revising concessional tax rates for income brackets between Rs 7 lakh and Rs 15 lakh, potentially offering significant relief to middle-income taxpayers and encouraging a shift toward the New Tax Regime.END OF THE ROAD FOR OLD TAX REGIME?  While the new tax regime may get more benefits, there has been chatter around the possibility of the old tax regime facing the axe. However, the old tax regime still remains popular for its established deductions and exemptions.  Experts have suggested raising the Section 80C deduction limit from Rs 1.5 lakh to Rs 2 lakh and increasing the housing loan interest deduction under Section 24(b) from Rs 2 lakh to Rs 3 lakh. Higher deductions under Sections 80D and 80DD for medical insurance and disabled dependents are also on the table. CII President Sanjiv Puri has called for reducing personal income tax rates for individuals earning up to Rs 20 lakh annually to stimulate consumption and economic growth. Similarly, Supreme Court advocate Tushar Kumar suggested rationalising tax slabs and introducing new deductions to boost disposable income. Former Infosys CFO TV Mohandas Pai highlighted the need for tax reforms to address inflation and rising living costs, while FICCI Vice President Vijay Sankar and PHDCCI President Hemant Jain highlighted the importance of supporting the middle class to boost consumer demand and alleviate inflationary pressures.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 7, 2025

Headline: ITR filing: Technical glitch keeps Section 87A rebate unavailable for taxpayersTaxpayers remain unable to claim the Section 87A rebate on STCG income due to outdated ITR processing logic, even after recent updates to filing forms by the Income Tax Department.
Content: Despite recent updates to ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms by the Income Tax Department on January 4, 2025, taxpayers are still unable to claim the Section 87A tax rebate on short-term capital gains (STCG). The delay in updating the ITR processing software has left many eligible taxpayers struggling to claim their rightful rebates, with the January 15, 2025, deadline for filing revised or belated returns fast approaching.advertisementITR UPDATES AND SECTION 87A REBATE ISSUES The updated ITR forms were expected to resolve earlier glitches preventing taxpayers from claiming the Section 87A rebate on short-term capital gains (STCG) income. However, while the e-filing utility now accepts the claims, the processing software still rejects them due to outdated logic last revised on July 5, 2024. The updated ITR forms were expected to resolve earlier glitches preventing taxpayers from claiming the Section 87A rebate on short-term capital gains (STCG) income. However, while the e-filing utility now accepts the claims, the processing software still rejects them due to outdated logic last revised on July 5, 2024. Under Section 87A, eligible taxpayers can claim rebates of up to Rs 25,000 under the new tax regime or Rs 12,500 under the old regime. Chartered accountants have reported that the JSON schema, which governs ITR processing, has not been updated. This oversight means taxpayers filing revised ITRs will still face rejection if they claim the rebate on STCG income. Chartered Accountant Himank Singla, while speaking to The Economic Times, explained, “The ITR forms were updated for belated and revised filings, but the underlying processing logic remains unchanged. Filing a revised return now serves no purpose as the rebate claim will still be denied.” Many tax professionals recommend waiting for the Bombay High Court’s hearing on January 9, 2025, for clarity. The court had earlier directed the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) to extend the deadline and update utilities to accommodate the rebate claims. With just days left before the revised ITR filing deadline, taxpayers face uncertainty and higher liabilities due to outdated processing systems. Clear communication and swift updates from the Income Tax Department are urgently needed to address these challenges and provide relief to eligible taxpayers.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 7, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Is Zomato's dream stock market run over? Zomato's share price has declined over 9% in the past 5 trading sessions and over 14% in a month. At around 12:05 pm, shares of the company were trading 4.38% lower at Rs 253.05.
Content: Shares of Zomato fell over 5% in early trade on Tuesday, extending its weak market run after a period of strong gains. Zomato shares have declined over 9% in the past 5 trading sessions and over 14% in a month. At around 12:05 pm, shares of the company were trading 4.38% lower at Rs 253.05. The shares of the company fell after foreign brokerage Jefferies downgraded the stock from "buy" to "hold." The brokerage also reduced its target price for the food delivery giant by 18% to Rs 275, down from Rs 335, reflecting concerns over intensified competition in the quick commerce segment. The revised target price aligns closely with Zomato’s Monday closing of Rs 264.6, marking a 13% decline from its recent high of Rs 304.IS ZOMATO’S DREAM MARKET RALLY OVER? Jefferies cited heightened competition from Swiggy’s Instamart, Zepto, and Amazon as potential headwinds for Blinkit, Zomato’s quick commerce arm, which could impact profitability. Despite Zomato’s impressive 2024 rally—with shares doubling in value—Jefferies expects 2025 to be a year of consolidation. It revised its EBITDA estimates for FY26-27 downward by 12-15%, halving Blinkit’s valuation multiple to six times. Jefferies also trimmed its FY26-27 EPS forecasts by 20-21%, pointing to possible risks from aggressive discounting and competition. Meanwhile, Bernstein retained an "outperform" rating on Zomato, setting a target price of Rs 335. The firm lauded Zomato’s leadership in food delivery and quick commerce, highlighting its strong user acquisition strategy and expanding addressable market through initiatives like Dine Out. Bernstein anticipates quick commerce growth of 75-100% year-over-year, positioning Zomato as a major beneficiary. Elara Securities also highlighted Blinkit’s industry-leading position due to higher average order values, larger assortments, and competitive take rates. It noted that Blinkit has scaled operations to 45-50 cities, targeting 1,000 stores by the end of FY25. Anand Rathi offered a more balanced view, suggesting that multiple players can coexist in the quick commerce segment. The firm initiated coverage on Zomato and Swiggy with "buy" ratings and set 12-month target prices of Rs 385 and Rs 705, respectively. It highlighted Zomato’s market leadership but acknowledged Swiggy’s aggressive expansion plans, including its 10-minute food delivery service, Bolt. With competition intensifying in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities, Zomato and its rivals are exploring new markets to drive growth. While analysts have varying views, all agree that Zomato faces the challenge of maintaining its position amid rising competition. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 7, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why Paras Defence share price surged 10% todayParas Defence and Space Technologies Ltd designs, develops, manufactures, and tests a range of products for the defence and space sectors.
Content: Shares of Paras Defence and Space Technologies Ltd jumped sharply on Tuesday, gaining 10% to hit its upper price band of Rs 1,066.50. The surge came after the company announced it had received a key licence from the Indian government to manufacture advanced light machine guns. In a filing with the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), Paras Defence said, "We are pleased to inform you that M/s. Paras Defence and Space Technologies Ltd has been granted a licence under the Arms Act, 1959. This licence authorises the company to manufacture MK-46 and MK-48 Belt-fed Light Machine Gun (LMG) – Modernised Enhanced and Redefined LMG – with a proposed annual capacity of 6,000 numbers each." This development is seen as a major step forward for the company in expanding its presence in India’s defence manufacturing sector and resulted in heavy trading on Paras Defence's stock today. Approximately 23,000 shares were traded on the BSE at the time of reporting, significantly higher than the two-week average volume of 14,000 shares. The turnover for the day stood at Rs 2.39 crore, with the company’s market capitalisation reaching Rs 4,186.51 crore. On the technical front, the stock is showing mixed signals. It is trading above its 5-day, 10-day, and 50-day simple moving averages (SMAs) but remains below the 20-day, 30-day, 100-day, 150-day, and 200-day SMAs. The stock’s 14-day relative strength index (RSI) is at 50.59, which suggests it is in neutral territory. A value below 30 indicates an oversold condition, while a value above 70 is considered overbought. According to BSE data, the stock has a price-to-equity (P/E) ratio of 81.78, indicating it is trading at a premium compared to industry peers. The price-to-book (P/B) value stands at 8.45. Earnings per share (EPS) is reported at Rs 12.66, with a return on equity (RoE) of 10.34%. Paras Defence and Space Technologies Ltd designs, develops, manufactures, and tests a range of products for the defence and space sectors. As of September 2024, promoters held a 58.94% stake in the company.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 7, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: How new tax regime evolved over the years and what's next?As Budget 2025 nears, more changes to the new tax regime are expected to simplify taxes and benefit salaried employees and pensioners.
Content: As the Union Budget 2025 approaches, there is increasing anticipation regarding potential incentives aimed at encouraging taxpayers to opt for the new tax regime. With the government's continued focus on simplifying the tax system, the upcoming budget could bring further modifications to make this framework even more appealing.EVOLUTION OF THE NEW TAX REGIME: A TIMELINE The new tax regime, introduced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in Budget 2020, was designed to simplify the taxation process by reducing tax rates and eliminating most exemptions and deductions. This alternative tax structure offered six taxable slabs, with the promise of lower tax rates for those willing to forgo traditional tax benefits. Initial Structure: Budget 2020 In the 2020 Budget, Sitharaman unveiled a tax system with six slabs. For example, an individual earning Rs 15 lakh annually would now pay Rs 1.95 lakh in taxes, compared to Rs 2.73 lakh under the old regime. The key takeaway was that taxpayers could still choose between the old and new tax structures. Modifications in Budget 2021-2023 While the new tax regime remained mostly unchanged in the 2021 and 2022 budgets, Budget 2023 brought significant updates. The new tax regime became the default option on the ITR e-filing portal. Taxpayers can still opt for the old tax regime, but they must specify their choice before submitting their returns. Key changes included: A tax exemption for individuals earning up to Rs 7 lakh annually. A reduction in the number of tax slabs from six to five. An increase in the basic exemption limit from Rs 2.5 lakh to Rs 3 lakh. The introduction of a standard deduction of Rs 50,000 for salaried individuals. Budget 2024: A boost for salaried employees In Budget 2024, Sitharaman introduced further modifications, particularly benefiting salaried employees and pensioners. The standard deduction was raised to Rs 75,000, and private-sector employees became eligible for a deduction of up to 14% of their basic salary for investments in the National Pension System (NPS). The Budget 2025 outlook As the Budget 2025 is set to address the financial concerns of the middle class, taxpayers expect more favourable changes to the new tax regime. With increased participation and evolving benefits, it seems that this system will continue to be a focal point for future tax reforms. With each passing year, the new tax regime evolves to provide more relief to taxpayers. As the budget draws closer, one can expect these changes to not only make compliance easier but also offer significant savings to the taxpayer.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 7, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Junior employees at HCLTech to get up to 4% salary increase: ReportRecently, Infosys, a major competitor, announced 90% performance bonuses for the second quarter ending September.
Content: HCLTech, India’s third-largest IT services firm, has plans to announce salary increases for its junior employees, reported The Economic Times. According to two sources mentioned in the report, the hikes range from 1% to 4%, depending on performance. "Salary increases have been rolled out for employees at the junior levels—E0, E1, and E2. The average hike is between 1% and 2%, while top performers have received raises of around 3% to 4%," a source was quoted as per the report. However, another source noted that these hikes are below earlier expectations. "We were expecting an average increase of about 7%, with the best performers getting increments between 12% and 15%," they explained. The salary adjustments have been implemented for the third quarter, covering the period from October to December 2024. Letters detailing the new salary structures were sent to eligible employees in the last week of December. Junior employees at HCLTech, categorised under the E0, E1, and E2 levels, typically have experience of up to 10 years. Employees in mid- and senior-level roles, categorised as E3 and above, have not received any salary increases so far. HCLTech has not yet announced anything on salary hikes for junior employees and India Today Digital was not able to verify this. The company is scheduled to announce its financial results for the third quarter on 13 January 2025. The technology services industry, valued at $254 billion, is facing a challenging environment. Companies are dealing with slower client spending, which has made cost management a priority. These factors have led to delays in salary increases and bonuses across the sector. Recently, Infosys, a major competitor, announced 90% performance bonuses for the second quarter ending September. However, Infosys and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) are reported to have delayed their annual salary hikes for the fiscal year 2025. These increases are now expected to be announced in the last quarter, between January and March 2025. The decision to implement salary hikes is expected to affect profit margins for HCLTech and other companies in the October–December quarter. According to industry reports, firms like Wipro, LTIMindtree, and L&T Technology Services (LTTS) are likely to experience margin pressure due to similar wage increases. On the other hand, companies that have delayed salary hikes, such as Infosys and TCS, may see stable or improved margins for the same period. The third-quarter earnings season will begin with TCS releasing its results on 9 January, followed by Infosys on 16 January. Wipro and Tech Mahindra are scheduled to announce their results on 17 January. HCLTech’s results on 13 January will be closely watched, as the company is expected to lead the growth among tier-I IT services firms for the quarter.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 7, 2025Must Watch

Headline: ITR filing: Submit these investment proofs to claim deductions and save on TDSSubmit proofs promptly to reduce TDS, maximise tax savings, and ensure smooth compliance before filing your ITR.
Content: With the financial year-end approaching, employers are reminding salaried employees to submit investment and expenditure proofs to claim tax-saving benefits. This annual ritual helps reduce TDS (Tax Deducted at Source) on salaries. If you're unsure about the process or whether it applies to you, here's a clear breakdown.WHO NEEDS TO SUBMIT PROOFS? Employees opting for the old tax regime must submit proof of eligible investments and expenses to claim deductions and exemptions. These include House Rent Allowance (HRA), Section 80C investments, health insurance premiums, home loan interest, and more. On the other hand, employees under the new tax regime are exempt from this requirement as most deductions are unavailable in this regime.KEY DEDUCTIONS UNDER THE OLD TAX REGIME HRA exemption: Submit rent receipts and agreements. For annual rent exceeding Rs 1 lakh, your landlord’s PAN is mandatory. Section 80C deductions: Investments like PPF, ELSS, and NPS, or expenses such as school fees and housing loan repayments, can reduce taxable income by up to Rs 1.5 lakh. Health insurance (Section 80D): Claim up to Rs 1 lakh for premiums paid for self and parents. Home loan interest (Section 24B): Deduction up to Rs 2 lakh is allowed for interest paid on a home loan.TDS ON SALARY: HOW IT WORKS Employers calculate total tax liability based on your income and declared investments. If proofs aren’t submitted on time, they deduct full tax without accounting for deductions. However, you can still claim these while filing your ITR, though this might invite scrutiny and delay refunds.SWITCHING TAX REGIMES Employees can switch between tax regimes during ITR filing. Ensure timely filing (by July 31, 2025, for FY 2024-25) to claim the old regime and maintain all documents for verification. Submitting tax-saving proofs on time not only reduces TDS but also streamlines your tax compliance. While the new tax regime simplifies filing, the old regime remains advantageous for those with significant investments and expenses. Act early, submit proofs, and make the most of your hard-earned money!Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 7, 2025Must Watch

Headline: India's GDP growth estimated to slow sharply to 6.4% in FY25 from 8.2% in FY24The slowdown in the government's first advance estimates highlights a more tempered pace of economic activity and indicates that the economy could grow at the slowest pace in four years.
Content:
India’s GDP growth is projected to slow sharply to 6.4% in FY25, down from 8.2% in FY24, according to the first advance estimates released by the National Statistics Office (NSO). The slowdown in the first advance estimates highlights a more tempered pace of economic activity and indicates that the economy could grow at the slowest pace in four years.  "Real GDP has been estimated to grow by 6.4% in FY 2024-25 as compared to the growth rate of 8.2% in Provisional Estimate (PE) of GDP for FY 2023-24. Nominal GDP has witnessed a growth rate of 9.7% in FY 2024-25 over the growth rate of 9.6% in FY 2023-24," said the NSO data.  It may be noted that the projection is even lower than the recent Reserve Bank estimate of 6.6% for the current fiscal year ending March 2025. The advance estimate, which plays a crucial role in Budget calculations, follows the July-September quarter shocker of 5.4% GDP growth. This surprising figure prompted the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) to revise its growth forecast for the current fiscal year to 6.6%, down from the earlier 7.2%. Real GDP at constant prices is estimated to rise to Rs 184.88 lakh crore in FY25, from Rs 173.82 lakh crore in FY24. Nominal GDP at current prices is projected to grow by 9.7%, reaching Rs 324.11 lakh crore, compared to Rs 295.36 lakh crore last year.
 


Real Gross Value Added (GVA) is expected to grow at 6.4%, a deceleration from 7.2% in FY24.Despite the slowdown, key sectors show promise. Agriculture and allied activities are forecast to grow by 3.8%, up from 1.4% in FY24. The construction sector is projected to expand by 8.6%, while financial, real estate, and professional services are expected to grow by 7.3%.Private Final Consumption Expenditure (PFCE), a key indicator of household spending, is anticipated to grow by 7.3% in FY25, compared to 4.0% in FY24. Meanwhile, Government Final Consumption Expenditure (GFCE) is estimated to rebound with a growth rate of 4.1%, up from 2.5% last fiscal.These estimates highlight that while growth will decelerate, some sectors are likely to remain resilient, offering hope for continued economic activity even amid slower overall growth.Published By: Anuja JhaPublished On: Jan 7, 2025

Headline: Sensex, Nifty recover after Monday's slump; RIL gains 2% The S&P BSE Sensex added 234.12 points to close at 78,199.11, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 91.85 points to end at 23,707.90.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices closed higher on Tuesday, driven by gains in energy and metal sector stocks. Despite the respite, markets continue to face significant selling pressure during recovery attempts, indicating that bears remain in control. "On a positive note, the dip in the volatility index (India VIX) reflects reduced nervousness among the participants. Given these mixed signals, we recommend maintaining a "sell on rise" strategy in the index unless it decisively surpasses the resistance at 24,250. Additionally, the start of the earnings season is expected to create stock-specific opportunities, so traders should focus on selective positioning and prioritise risk management," said Mishra.  Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) led the pack of stocks that gained on Nifty50 with a 3.79% increase, followed by SBI Life Insurance showing strength at 2.62%. HDFC Life Insurance continued the positive trend with a 2.31% uptick, while Tata Motors and Adani Enterprises gained 2.09% and 2.03% respectively. On the downside, Trent Limited faced the steepest decline of 2.20%, with Holtech Limited dropping by 1.86%. Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) slipped 1.56%, while Eicher Motors fell 1.43%, and Tech Mahindra showed a marginal decline of 0.99%. In today's trading session, most sectoral indices on the Nifty showed positive momentum, with Nifty Oil & Gas emerging as the top performer with a robust gain of 1.64%. The media sector also had a strong showing, with Nifty Media climbing 1.36%, while Nifty Metal advanced by 1.24%. The healthcare segment showed strength, with Nifty Healthcare Index rising 0.94%, and Nifty Realty moved up by 0.80%. Nifty Bank and Nifty Financial Services posted modest gains of 0.56% and 0.48% respectively. Nifty Consumer Durables edged up by 0.37%, while Nifty FMCG and Nifty Private Bank saw minimal movement with gains of 0.01% and 0.38%. The midcap segments performed well, with Nifty Midsmall Healthcare rising 1.55%, Nifty Midsmall Services gaining 0.97%, and Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom up by 0.95%. In contrast, only Nifty IT stood out as the sole loser among the sectors, declining by 0.68%, while Nifty Auto remained unchanged at 0.00%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 7, 2025Must Watch

Headline: HDFC Bank introduces revised lending and FD rates. Check detailsHDFC Bank lowers MCLR by up to 5 bps, revises FD rates, offering financial relief and flexibility for borrowers and depositors.
Content: HDFC Bank, one of India’s largest private banks, has reduced its Marginal Cost of Funds-Based Lending Rate (MCLR) by up to 5 basis points across select tenures. Effective from January 7, 2025, this revision brings MCLR rates to between 9.15% and 9.45%, offering relief to borrowers.REVISED MCLR RATES The updated MCLR rates are set at 9.15% for overnight, 9.20% for one month, 9.30% for three months, 9.40% for six months and one year, and 9.45% for two and three-year tenors.advertisementUNDERSTANDING MCLR AND ITS IMPACTMCLR, introduced by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) in 2016, replaced the base rate system to make lending rates more dynamic. It represents the minimum rate below which banks cannot lend. Changes in MCLR directly affect loan EMIs, making them higher or lower depending on rate revisions. MCLR, introduced by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) in 2016, replaced the base rate system to make lending rates more dynamic. It represents the minimum rate below which banks cannot lend. Changes in MCLR directly affect loan EMIs, making them higher or lower depending on rate revisions. Borrowers under older regimes like the base rate or Benchmark Prime Lending Rate (BPLR), implemented before 2016, remain unaffected by MCLR changes unless they switch to the new system. Currently, HDFC Bank's Benchmark PLR stands at 17.95%, while the base rate is 9.45%, effective since September 2024.OTHER LENDING AND DEPOSIT RATES HDFC Bank has also revised its interest rates on bulk fixed deposits of Rs 3 crore to less than Rs 5 crore. Post-revision, FDs offer 4.75% to 7.40% for the general public and up to 7.90% for senior citizens, depending on the tenor. With this rate cut, HDFC Bank provides some financial relief to borrowers navigating fluctuating interest rates. Whether you're planning to take a loan or invest in fixed deposits, staying informed about these changes ensures smarter financial decisions. This move not only highlights the dynamism of India's banking sector but also underscores the importance of adapting to evolving financial landscapes.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 7, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Indobell Insulation IPO Day 3: Check latest subscription status and GMPIndobell Insulation IPO: The Rs 10.14 crore initial public offering was fully subscribed on the first day itself and continues to attract bids as it enters its final day today, January 8.
Content: The Indobell Insulation IPO, which opened for subscription on January 6, has garnered strong interest from investors. This fixed-price issue, priced at Rs 46 per share, comprises a fresh issuance of 22.05 lakh shares. Retail investors need to apply for a minimum lot of 3,000 shares, translating to an investment of Rs 1,38,000. The IPO will close for subscription by the end of today, and allotment is scheduled for January 9. Shares are expected to list on the BSE SME platform on January 13.LATEST SUBSCRIPTION STATUS As of 10:23 am on the third day of bidding, the Indobell Insulation IPO was subscribed 6.18 times. The retail segment received overwhelming interest, with the portion subscribed 11.2 times, while the non-institutional investor (NII) segment saw a subscription of 1.15 times.CHECK GREY MARKET PREMIUM (GMP) Despite the robust subscription numbers, the grey market premium (GMP) for Indobell Insulation IPO stood at nil today. This indicates that the shares are trading at par with the issue price of â‚¹46 apiece in the unofficial market, suggesting that the stock is unlikely to list at a premium. Indobell Insulation manufactures and supplies a range of insulation products, including nodulated wool, granulated wool, and prefabricated thermal insulation jackets. Its products cater to residential, commercial, and industrial applications. In Fiscal 2024, the company’s revenue declined by 15% to Rs 17.98 crore from Rs 21.05 crore in Fiscal 2023. Headline: Sensex, Nifty open lower amid weak sentiments; Reliance jumps 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 141.64 points to 78,057.47 at 10:09 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 42.60 points lower at 23,665.30.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices fell on Wednesday as government data estimated economic growth in FY25 to decelerate to 6.4%, much lower than the 8.2% in FY24. The S&P BSE Sensex was down 141.64 points to 78,057.47 at 10:09 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 42.60 points lower at 23,665.30. All the other broader market indices were also trading in the red as the situation remains volatile on Dalal Street. High-weightage Nifty IT, Nifty Bank and Nifty Financial were all trading in negative territory. However, shares of Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) rose over 2% and helped counter the negative trend. The top five gainers on the Nifty50 were Reliance Industries Limited, Dr Reddy’s Laboratories, ONGC, Axis Bank and BPCL. On the other hand, the top losers were Trent, Shriram Finance, Titan, BEL and Adani Ports. Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services also highlighted that the trend of strong US macros weakening emerging markets is continuing. “The US 10-year bond yield has spiked to 4.67% on better-than-expected jobs numbers and indications of the services sector doing very well. This means the Fed may hold rates in January leading to further strengthening of the dollar and rising bond yields,” he said. Vijayakumar added that the fall out of this on the Indian macros is that the RBI may hold rates in February against the market expectation of a cut. “In this macro setting, FIIs are likely to continue selling, putting pressure on the market. Large caps, despite fair valuations, may continue to be on the defensive,” he said and advised investors to take a slightly long-term view of the market and buy largecaps in financials, IT, pharmaceuticals and select autos. “These segments will bounce back in a few months when macros turn positive for India."Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Explained: Why Ola Electric share price fell over 5% todayOla Electric stock price: The shares of the company hit a low of Rs 75.36 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), down 4.8% during the session. At around 11:35 am, shares of the company recovered slightly, but were still trading 1.47% lower at Rs 78.
Content: Shares of Ola Electric Mobility Ltd declined over 5% during Wednesday’s trading session after the company received an administrative warning from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) for non-compliance with disclosure norms. The stock hit a low of Rs 75.36 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), down 4.8% during the session. At around 11:35 am, shares of the company recovered slightly, but were still trading 1.47% lower at Rs 78. It may be noted that Ola Electric shares have fallen over 15% in a month and 11% in the past five trading sessions.WHY DID OLA GET SEBI WARNING? The market regulator took issue with a material announcement made by Ola Electric’s promoter and Chairman-cum-Managing Director Bhavish Aggarwal on X (formerly Twitter) at 9:58 am on December 2, 2024. Sebi noted that the company informed stock exchanges about the same only after several hours, at 1:36 pm (BSE) and 1:41 pm (NSE). "It is observed that whereas the aforesaid information was disseminated on the stock exchanges by you at 1:36 PM (BSE) and 1:41 PM (NSE) on December 2, 2024, it was announced beforehand on X (formerly Twitter) at 9:58 AM on December 2, 2024 by Bhavish Aggarwal, your promoter and Chairman-cum-Managing Director," the Sebi letter read. The market regulator highlighted that this action violated Regulation 30(6)(ii) of the Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements (LODR), which mandates listed entities to disclose all material information to stock exchanges first and within 12 hours of the event’s occurrence. The regulator also cited Regulation 4(1)(d) of the LODR, which requires listed entities to provide timely and adequate information to stock exchanges and investors. "By making the aforesaid announcement first on a social media platform instead of disseminating it on the stock exchanges, you have failed to take into consideration the interest of all your stakeholders and follow your obligations in letter and spirit," Sebi added. The market regulator issued a stern warning, urging the company to enhance its compliance standards and avoid similar violations in the future. Sebi added that non-compliance could lead to enforcement action under the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992. Additionally, Sebi directed Ola Electric to present the matter and its corrective steps to the Board of Directors and disclose this communication to stock exchangesPublished By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 8, 2025

Headline: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Day 2: Check latest subscription, GMP and price band Quadrant Future Tek IPO: The grey market premium (GMP) for Quadrant Future Tek IPO stood at Rs 210 as of Wednesday, signalling a premium of approximately 73% over the issue's upper price band of Rs 290.

Headline: Explained: Why Indo Farm Equipment share price rose over 7% in early tradeOn January 7, Indo Farm Equipment's shares closed with a premium of over 27% against the issue price of Rs 215.
Content: Shares of Indo Farm Equipment gained momentum on Wednesday, rising over 7% to hit an intraday high of Rs 292.30 in early trade. The surge follows the company’s strong stock market debut in the previous session. However, the early gains were short-lived as profit booking pulled the share price down within an hour. By 10:39 am, the stock was trading at Rs 276.50, just 1.39% higher than its previous closing price of Rs 272.70. On January 7, Indo Farm Equipment’s shares closed with a premium of over 27% against the issue price of Rs 215. The stock opened at Rs 258.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), reflecting a 20.18% premium. It surged 33.44% during the session to hit Rs 286.90 before closing at Rs 272.70, marking a gain of 26.83%. On the NSE, the stock debuted at Rs 256, up 19%, and ended the day at Rs 273.69, a 27.29% gain. The Rs 260-crore initial public offering (IPO) of Indo Farm Equipment received an overwhelming 227.57 times subscription on its final bidding day. Priced in the range of Rs 204-215 per share, the IPO comprised a fresh issue of 86 lakh equity shares and an offer for sale (OFS) of 35 lakh shares by promoter Ranbir Singh Khadwalia. Proceeds from the IPO will be used to expand the company’s manufacturing capacity for pick-and-carry cranes, repay debt, and enhance its capital base by investing in its NBFC subsidiary, Barota Finance. Indo Farm Equipment is a leading manufacturer of tractors, pick-and-carry cranes, and other farm equipment, which has positioned it for growth in India’s agricultural and construction sectors.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 8, 2025

Content: Delta Autocorp Ltd. has launched its initial public offering (IPO), aiming to raise Rs 54.60 crore. The IPO opened for subscription on Tuesday and has already been subscribed 13.81 times as of the end of Day 1. By Wednesday afternoon, subscription levels continued to rise, with the issue subscribed 29.54 times as of 12:33 pm.advertisementDELTA AUTOCORP IPO SUBSCRIPTION STATUSAs of Day 2, the subscription status for Delta Autocorp’s IPO shows strong demand. Retail investors have subscribed to the issue 51.08 times, while Non-Institutional Buyers have shown robust interest, subscribing 17.63 times. However, Qualified Institutional Buyers have shown relatively lower participation, subscribing only 0.78 times.LATEST GMP As of Day 2, the subscription status for Delta Autocorp’s IPO shows strong demand. Retail investors have subscribed to the issue 51.08 times, while Non-Institutional Buyers have shown robust interest, subscribing 17.63 times. However, Qualified Institutional Buyers have shown relatively lower participation, subscribing only 0.78 times.LATEST GMP The Grey Market Premium (GMP) for the Delta Autocorp IPO is currently Rs 110. With the price band set at Rs 130 per share, the expected listing price for the IPO is Rs 240, reflecting a potential gain of around 84.62% from the issue price.KEY IPO DETAILS  The Delta Autocorp IPO is open for subscription until January 9, with the allotment set for January 10 and shares expected to be credited to Demat accounts by January 13. Founded in 2016, Delta Autocorp Ltd. is a key player in the electric vehicle market, specializing in the design, manufacturing, and sale of electric 2-wheelers and 3-wheelers under the brand name 'Deltic'. The company’s portfolio includes electric scooters and 3-wheelers, targeting tier-2 and tier-3 towns. Delta Autocorp operates through a network of over 300 dealers across 25 states and Union Territories. The IPO proceeds will be used to set up a fabrication and painting plant for electric three-wheelers, fund new product development, and meet working capital requirements. Delta Autocorp has shown steady financial growth, reporting a revenue of Rs 45.27 crore for the period ending October 31, 2024. In FY24, the company posted a net profit of Rs 8.2 crore, up from Rs 5.13 crore in FY23Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 8, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Salaried earners up to Rs 15 lakh may get tax relief. Details hereBudget 2025-26 may offer tax benefits for incomes up to Rs 15 lakh, boosting disposable income and driving economic growth.
Content: The upcoming Budget 2025-26 is likely to introduce significant tax benefits aimed at individuals earning up to Rs 15 lakh annually. These measures are expected to increase disposable incomes, spurring consumption in urban areas where most taxpayers reside. Sources indicate that the government is eyeing tweaks to the new income tax regime, introduced in FY 2020-21, which has attracted over 70% of taxpayers due to its simplified structure and regular enhancements.advertisementPROPOSED CHANGES IN TAX STRUCTURECurrently, under the new regime, income up to Rs 3 lakh is tax-free, while earnings between Rs 3 lakh and Rs 6 lakh are taxed at 5%, Rs 6-9 lakh at 10%, Rs 9–12 lakh at 15%, Rs 12–15 lakh at 20%, and above Rs 15 lakh at 30%. A standard deduction of Rs 75,000 ensures that incomes up to Rs 7.75 lakh are tax-free. Currently, under the new regime, income up to Rs 3 lakh is tax-free, while earnings between Rs 3 lakh and Rs 6 lakh are taxed at 5%, Rs 6-9 lakh at 10%, Rs 9–12 lakh at 15%, Rs 12–15 lakh at 20%, and above Rs 15 lakh at 30%. A standard deduction of Rs 75,000 ensures that incomes up to Rs 7.75 lakh are tax-free. Reports suggest that the basic exemption limit might increase from Rs 3 lakh to Rs 4 lakh, with corresponding adjustments to other slabs. For example, the 5% slab may cover incomes from Rs 4 lakh to Rs 7 lakh, making the tax regime more beneficial for earners up to Rs 14 lakh.BOOSTING SPENDING POWER AMID INFLATION The government’s focus appears to be on easing the burden on individuals earning Rs 13–14 lakh annually, especially in urban areas, where inflation has eroded purchasing power, according to sources. The changes aim to provide relief to urban taxpayers, who face rising inflation and form the bulk of the consumption-driven economy. Experts believe that revising tax slabs by raising thresholds by Rs 1 lakh each could significantly lower tax burdens, encouraging higher spending. Sudhir Kapadia, EY India Tax & Regulatory Services partner, while speaking to Financial Express, stated, “Majority of income taxpayers live in urban areas where most of the consumption also takes place. Given that inflation is hurting people in the lower income strata, each IT slabs can be raised by 1 lakh each.” He added, “To boost consumption, especially in urban areas (where the majority of income taxpayers reside), expanding slabs at lower and middle-income levels, that is, up to 20% tax bracket should be considered.”RISING TAX REVENUES SUPPORT REFORMS With personal income tax collections rising 25% to Rs 7.41 lakh crore during April-November FY25, the government is in a strong position to implement these reforms. Unlike corporate taxes, personal tax receipts have consistently surpassed targets, providing fiscal space for relief measures. The anticipated changes could be a game-changer, delivering much-needed relief to taxpayers while stimulating economic activity. If implemented, Budget 2025-26 could mark a win-win for individuals and the broader economy alike.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Zomato share price tumbles 3% today as poor market run continues. What's next?  Zomato's shares had already fallen nearly 5% in the previous session, contributing to an 11% drop over the past five trading days. Over the last month, the stock has lost more than 16% of its value.
Content: Shares of food delivery giant Zomato extended their decline for the fourth consecutive session, falling over 3% in early trade on Wednesday. The stock hit an intraday low of Rs 244.25 after opening at Rs 251.50. By 11:45 am, shares were down 2.24%, trading at Rs 246.85.Zomato’s shares had already fallen nearly 5% in the previous session, contributing to an 11% drop over the past five trading days. The firm flagged rising competition from Swiggy’s Instamart, Zepto, and Amazon as potential risks for Blinkit, Zomato’s quick commerce arm, which could pressure profitability.Despite Zomato’s strong performance in 2024, with shares doubling in value, Jefferies expects 2025 to be a year of consolidation. The brokerage cut its EBITDA estimates for FY26-27 by 12-15% and halved Blinkit’s valuation multiple to six times. It also reduced FY26-27 EPS forecasts by 20-21%, highlighting risks from aggressive discounting and stiff competition.Meanwhile, Bernstein retained an “outperform” rating with a target price of Rs 335, praising Zomato’s leadership in food delivery and quick commerce. Bernstein expects quick commerce to grow 75-100% year-over-year, positioning Zomato as a major beneficiary. Analysts agree that Zomato faces stiff competition as it seeks to maintain its market leadership, especially in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities. Headline: 'Real money is with Gujjus': Nithin Kamath on equity trade dominanceNithin Kamath revealed Mumbai and Ahmedabad drive 80% of equity trades, despite Gujarat having only 8% of registered investors.
Content:
In a fascinating revelation about India's equity market, Nithin Kamath, CEO of Zerodha, shared that Mumbai and Ahmedabad together dominate, contributing 80% of the country's equity delivery trades. Kamath wrote on X, “Ahmedabad and Mumbai account for 80% of equity delivery trades. Let that sink in. Essentially, the real money is with Gujjus.” He added,“Gujarat accounts for just 8% of the total registered investors, and the share has been falling.”
 


 According to Kamath's analysis, Mumbai contributed 64.28% of equity trade deliveries in November 2024, while Ahmedabad added another 17.53%. These figures underscore the dominance of these two cities in the financial landscape, largely driven by the Gujarati community’s financial prowess.GUJARATIS: THE FINANCIAL POWERHOUSES Kamath’s tweet acknowledged the Gujarati community’s deep-rooted business acumen, calling them the custodians of "real money" in the stock market. Interestingly, Gujarat, despite its outsized influence in equity trades, represents only 8% of India's total registered investors—a share that has been declining. Kamath also highlighted Gujarat’s significant participation in IPOs, which accounted for nearly 40% of all IPO activity last year.CITY-WISE TURNOVER INSIGHTS Expanding on city-wise turnover in the cash segments of BSE and NSE, Kamath noted that Ahmedabad leads, followed by Bengaluru, Vadodara, Bhubaneswar, and Chennai. Maharashtra, however, retains the top spot for the highest number of registered investors, with 1.48 crore as of December 2023. Uttar Pradesh has emerged as the second-largest state in this metric, overtaking Gujarat, with 89.47 lakh registered investors compared to Gujarat’s 76.68 lakh.REACTIONS SPARK INTEREST Kamath’s observations sparked engaging reactions. Kunal Shah, founder of CRED, responded with the iconic phrase 'Risk hai to Ishq hai' from Scam 1992, referencing Gujaratis’ bold and calculated risk-taking nature.
 


 CoinDCX playfully noted the entrepreneurial spirit of Gujarati kids, saying while children elsewhere learn A for Apple, B for Ball, and C for Cat, Gujarati kids grow up with A for Absolute Return, B for Blue Chip Tokens, C for Call Option, and D for Dalal Street.

Headline: Explained: Why Spandana Sphoorty share price surged over 15% todaySpandana Sphoorty stock price: At around 10 am, Spandana Sphoorty shares were trading at Rs 461.40 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a remarkable 35% gain in just two days. Content: Shares of Spandana Sphoorty Financial surged more than 15% on January 8, hitting an intraday high of Rs 472, driven by a significant influx of trading volumes. As the stock experienced heavy trading activity, the exchanges sought clarification from the company regarding the price movement. At around 10 am, Spandana Sphoorty shares were trading at Rs 461.40 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), marking a remarkable 35% gain in just two days. By 12:56 pm, the stock had risen 14.62% to Rs 459, signalling strong investor interest. Today's surge came after the stock's 20% upper circuit hit in the previous session, which also saw high trading volumes, the highest in the last 10 weeks. The upswing in the stock price began after well-known chartist Sushil Kedia from Kedianomics predicted that the stock, then priced just over Rs 300, could deliver six-fold returns in the future, potentially reaching levels of Rs 1,800. Kedia told CNBC Awaaz that while he doesn’t recommend immediate action, he is watching for an ideal “buy” signal. Meanwhile, Osho Krishan, Senior Research Analyst at Angel One told Business Today about the positive development in the stock, noting the large volume-backed 35% surge this week. He suggested that aggressive traders could consider accumulating the stock, with immediate resistance levels around Rs 550-600 and support near Rs 400. The stock's sharp rise follows a challenging period for Spandana Sphoorty, which had faced pressure due to a deterioration in its microfinance asset quality and profitability. The company reported a significant increase in its gross stage 3 (GS3) loans, from 1.7% in Q4 FY24 to 5.3% in Q2 FY25, reflecting the ongoing challenges in its business operations. Headline: Budget 2025: Can you expect Rs 10 lakh tax-free income?As Budget 2025 nears, the Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh calls for tax reforms, pension hikes, and worker benefits to ease middle-class burdens.
Content: As the Union Budget 2025 approaches, expectations are mounting for significant tax reforms and economic relief measures. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to present the budget on February 1, 2025, with the middle class hoping for an increase in the tax-free income threshold, amongst other proposals.RSS-BACKED BMS PUSHES FOR BOLD REFORMS The Bharatiya Mazdoor Sangh (BMS), affiliated with the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS), has called for substantial changes during pre-budget discussions. The organisation proposed raising the tax-free income limit to Rs 10 lakh while retaining current exemptions. Additionally, the BMS urged the government to constitute the 8th Pay Commission and exempt pensioners from income tax on pensions. Other key demands include extending the MGNREGA program to provide 200 workdays per family annually, implementing a stimulus package for agriculture and allied industries, and expediting GST refunds. The BMS also stressed the need for a comprehensive manufacturing strategy to reduce dependence on Chinese imports.FOCUS ON PENSION AND WORKER WELFARE The BMS has advocated increasing the minimum pension for EPS-95 beneficiaries from Rs 1,000 to Rs 5,000, with a future target of 50% of the government’s minimum wages, linked to the Variable Dearness Allowance (VDA). They also suggested expanding the Ayushman Bharat scheme to EPS-95 pensioners and introducing universal old-age pensions. Recommendations to improve worker welfare include extending gratuity calculations to 30 days per year, funding industrial boards like the beedi and contract labour boards, and prioritising the Old Pension Scheme (OPS) over the New Pension Scheme (NPS). With the Union Budget just weeks away, the middle class and worker groups are eagerly anticipating the government’s response to these bold proposals. If adopted, these measures could offer substantial financial relief and bolster India’s economic framework. Whether Budget 2025 will meet these expectations is yet to be seen.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Sensex tumbles 600 points today. 3 reasons why stock market is falling Stock market today: Multiple factors were behind today's nervousness on Dalal Street, including weaker growth estimates for FY25, worries over Q3 corporate earnings and the likelihood of fewer US rate cuts.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices tumbled again on Wednesday as the turbulent run on Dalal Street continued after a 1-session gain. The S&P BSE Sensex fell 553.10 points to 77,646.01 at 1:11 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 163.05 points to trade at 23,544.85. Multiple factors were behind today’s nervousness on Dalal Street, including weaker growth estimates for FY25, worries over Q3 corporate earnings and the likelihood of fewer US rate cuts.advertisementQ3 CORPORATE EARNINGSOne of the key triggers behind today’s decline is nervousness among investors over the outcome of Q3 corporate earnings. Early trends suggest that the earnings season will be subdued and it has already started hurting investor sentiments. One of the key triggers behind today’s decline is nervousness among investors over the outcome of Q3 corporate earnings. Early trends suggest that the earnings season will be subdued and it has already started hurting investor sentiments. It is worth noting that recent quarterly updates from companies including Dabur India  and Hero MotoCorp  did not give the market hope that corporate profit growth in the December quarter would be any better than the previous quarter, which was the worst in four years. Kranthi Bathini, director of equity strategy at Wealthmills Securities, told news agency Reuters that the business updates from companies have heightened worries of earnings moderation, which is “weighing on sentiment and triggering a drop in domestic equities ahead of the results season”.FEWER US RATE CUTS LIKELY Another reason behind today’s decline was a sharp tumble in technology and financial stocks, which fell after US data signalled at a stable economy and labour market, diminishing prospects of future rate cuts by the Federal Reserve. The Nifty IT index was down 0.5% during the session; Nifty Bank and Nifty Financial Services indices also fell sharply during the session and pulled down the benchmark indices. It was only due to heavyweight stock Reliance, which rose 2%, that the losses were limited on Dalal Street.GDP GROWTH ESTIMATE SLIPS A day ago, the first advance estimates released by the government indicated that GDP growth in FY25 may slow down sharply to 6.4%, marking a 4-year low. The growth estimate for FY25 is also sharply lower than FY24’s 8.2%. This may have led to some nervousness on Dalal Street. However, analysts said that it may not be a major trigger behind today’s weakness. Trivesh D, COO at Tradejini, said, “Markets often anticipate economic data, reacting to expected changes before the official figures are out. The forecasted GDP slowdown is not new information for investors; thus, the impact on equity markets might have already been absorbed.” “If not entirely, only minor movements may follow, unless there’s a further downward revision in growth expectations,” he added.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Must Watch

Headline: India's power output growth in 2024 slowest since pandemic: ReportThe deceleration was especially pronounced in the second half of the year, where power generation rose by only 2.3%, compared to a 9.6% rise in the first half.
Content: Electricity generation in 2024 grew at its slowest pace since the Covid-19 pandemic, reflecting a broader economic slowdown, reported news agency Reuters, quoting data from Grid-India.  The report noted that power output increased by 5.8% year-on-year to 1,824.13 billion kilowatt-hours (kWh). The deceleration was especially pronounced in the second half of the year, where power generation rose by only 2.3%, compared to a 9.6% rise in the first half. The slower growth aligns with the country’s economic performance, which saw its slowest expansion in nearly two years during the July-September quarter. December brought little relief, with India’s manufacturing sector posting its weakest monthly growth for the year due to subdued demand. However, analysts anticipate a rebound in 2025, driven by rising industrial production and higher residential electricity use during adverse weather conditions. “Electricity demand picked up in December with colder weather boosting heating system usage,” Sooraj Narayan, head of Asia-Pacific power modeling at Wood Mackenzie, told the news agency. “We expect a demand growth rate of 6% to 7% in 2025, supported by increased industrial activity.” Renewable energy contributed 12.1% of India’s total power generation in 2024, helping to reduce the share of coal to 74.4% from 75% in 2023. This marked the first drop in coal’s share in three years. Despite this progress, renewable growth slowed, with solar output rising just 18.4%, the lowest rate since India’s 2015 climate commitments. Wind power output also declined for the first time since 2020. Hydropower output recovered, rising 4% after a sharp 13.7% drop in 2023, but its overall share fell to 8.6%. Meanwhile, natural gas-fired power, which rose 17.3% last year, is expected to decline in 2025 due to higher projected gas prices, according to Energy Aspects senior LNG analyst Kesher Sumeet.With inputs from ReutersPublished By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty end lower in volatile session; Reliance jumps nearly 2%Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 50.62 points lower to 78,148.49 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 18.95 points to 23,688.95.
Content:
Benchmark stock market indices ended on a negative note in a largely volatile session, triggered by worries of weak Q3 corporate earnings. The S&P BSE Sensex ended 50.62 points lower to 78,148.49 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 18.95 points to 23,688.95. It may be noted that both the benchmark indices fell about 0.8% during the session, but pared losses in the last few hours. One of the biggest reasons for the volatility was recent business updates from companies, which have suggested that profit growth is unlikely to be any better. Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services, said, “Slowing economic growth projections and caution ahead of Q3 numbers added volatility in the market.” “However, the market witnessed a recovery from the day’s low owing to an accumulation of beaten-down blue-chip stocks and in expectation of government reforms in the upcoming budget to lift the tepid economy,” Nair added. “The near-term sentiment is likely to be subdued due to the rise in US bond yield and fear of fewer rate cuts by the Fed." Meanwhile, Vatsal Bhuva, Technical Analyst at LKP Securities, said, "The Nifty index is trading within a range of 23,500 to 24,200. In Wednesday's session, it formed a hammer candlestick on the daily chart, closing near its 200-day EMA, thereby strengthening the 23,500 support level." "A decisive move will require the index to close below 23,500, which could lead to heightened selling pressure, or sustain above 24,000 to pave the way for a potential rally toward 24,500. Monitoring these crucial levels is essential to identify the next trend in the index," he added.

Headline: PAN card fraud: Know details, how to stay safe from phishing scamA new phishing scam claiming PAN card updates is targeting India Post Payments Bank customers, with PIB urging caution.
Content:
A new phishing scam is currently making the rounds, targeting customers of India Post Payments Bank (IPPB). Victims are receiving fraudulent messages claiming that their PAN card details must be updated to avoid account blockage. These deceptive messages often contain suspicious links, which direct users to scammers looking to steal sensitive information. The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has stepped in to clarify the situation, labelling the message as fake. In an official post on X, PIB warned, "Claim: The customer's India Post Payments bank account will be blocked within 24 hours if their PAN card is not updated. This claim is #Fake."
 


 The government’s fact-check team highlighted that India Post will never send such messages, urging the public to be cautious and avoid clicking on any links.HOW THE SCAM WORKS Phishing is an online scam where cybercriminals impersonate trusted organisations to steal sensitive data like passwords, account numbers, or PINs. In this case, scammers prey on fear, sending messages that threaten account blockage unless PAN details are updated immediately. These messages might seem authentic, but they are part of a larger scam designed to deceive and exploit victims.PROTECT YOURSELF FROM PHISHING SCAMS IPPB has also shared important safety tips to help customers protect themselves. The bank encourages individuals to regularly update their passwords, avoid clicking on suspicious links, and be wary of fake customer care numbers. They also advise customers to closely monitor their bank accounts for any unauthorised activity. Additionally, users should exercise caution when using public Wi-Fi and always verify the authenticity of communications from financial institutions. As digital banking evolves, scammers are finding new ways to trick users. To stay safe, it’s crucial to stay informed and practice smart online security. When in doubt, always double-check the source and never share your personal or bank details through unsecured platforms. As scams become more sophisticated, it is crucial for users to stay informed and exercise vigilance. By following these simple steps, you can protect yourself from falling victim to these increasingly common online frauds. Stay smart, stay secure!Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Trending Reel
