Headline: Swiggy launches new standalone app SNACC. Here's all you need to know The app, which is currently available in select Bengaluru neighbourhoods, is aimed at urban consumers who prioritise speed and convenience when it comes to food delivery.
Content: Bengaluru-based food delivery company Swiggy has launched a new app called SNACC, which is focused on delivering snacks, beverages, and quick meals within 10 to 15 minutes. The app, which is currently available in select Bengaluru neighbourhoods, is aimed at urban consumers who prioritise speed and convenience when it comes to food delivery. The SNACC app offers a menu that includes breakfast options, light meals, and a variety of beverages, perfect for those seeking a fast, hassle-free dining experience. The app can be downloaded on both Android and iOS platforms, signaling Swiggy’s foray into the ultra-fast food delivery space, a market segment that's growing rapidly. This launch marks a shift from Swiggy's traditional model, where innovations were integrated into its main app, which has grown increasingly cluttered and difficult to navigate. By creating SNACC as a standalone platform, the company aims to streamline the delivery process for those looking for quick bites without the distractions of larger food orders. SNACC expands on Swiggy’s existing success with its rapid delivery arm, Bolt, which promises 15-minute deliveries by partnering with restaurants that can meet strict delivery time requirements. Unlike Bolt, however, SNACC operates from a centralised hub stocked with ready-to-serve products, enabling even faster and more reliable service. With this move, Swiggy is entering a competitive arena, where rivals like Zepto Cafe and Blinkit Bistro are already making waves in the rapid food delivery market. These platforms have capitalised on the increasing demand for quick, convenient food options, especially among India’s millennials and Gen Z consumers. India’s rapid food delivery market has seen significant growth, driven by changing consumer preferences and the widespread adoption of digital services. However, the sector faces its share of challenges, including high operational costs and the pressure to deliver quality food while meeting tight delivery windows.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: GDP growth in FY25 may hit 4-year low. Is Indian economy losing steam?While a slowdown in the ongoing financial year was anticipated, the steep downward revision in GDP growth for FY25 has taken many by surprise.
Content: India’s economic growth is expected to slow sharply to 6.4% in FY25, according to the first advance estimates released by the government. The  projection marks a considerable drop from the 8.2% growth achieved in FY24 and represents the slowest pace of expansion in four years. The estimate is also lower than the Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) revised annual growth forecast of 6.6%, raising concerns across sectors. While a slowdown in the ongoing financial year was anticipated, the steep downward revision has taken many by surprise. So, what factors are driving this deceleration in GDP growth?advertisementSECTORAL GROWTH MODERATIONDr. Manoranjan Sharma, Chief Economist at Infomerics Ratings, explained, “India’s GDP is expected to grow by 6.4% in FY25 over 7.2% in FY24. This slowest growth rate since the pandemic manifests moderation across key sectors and constitutes a significant drop from the 8.2% growth in FY24.”While agriculture is poised for a noticeable improvement with a growth projection of 3.8% compared to 1.4% last year, other key sectors are forecast to slow. Manufacturing growth is projected to fall to 5.3% from 9.9%, while mining is expected to grow at 2.9% compared to 7.1%.Similarly, the construction sector is set to grow at 8.6%, down from 9.9%, and electricity growth is estimated at 6.8%, lower than the previous year’s 7.5%.The top contributors to GDP, such as manufacturing, trade and hotels, and financial services and real estate, are all expected to witness slower growth in FY25. Urban consumption has also been hit hard, with inflation eroding the purchasing power of the urban poor.“Decelerating GDP growth, together with persistent inflation, would make the RBI’s task of managing the growth-inflation trade-off odious,” added Dr. Sharma.CHANGING CONSUMER PREFERENCES Dr. Manoranjan Sharma, Chief Economist at Infomerics Ratings, explained, “India’s GDP is expected to grow by 6.4% in FY25 over 7.2% in FY24. This slowest growth rate since the pandemic manifests moderation across key sectors and constitutes a significant drop from the 8.2% growth in FY24.”While agriculture is poised for a noticeable improvement with a growth projection of 3.8% compared to 1.4% last year, other key sectors are forecast to slow. Manufacturing growth is projected to fall to 5.3% from 9.9%, while mining is expected to grow at 2.9% compared to 7.1%. While agriculture is poised for a noticeable improvement with a growth projection of 3.8% compared to 1.4% last year, other key sectors are forecast to slow. Manufacturing growth is projected to fall to 5.3% from 9.9%, while mining is expected to grow at 2.9% compared to 7.1%. Similarly, the construction sector is set to grow at 8.6%, down from 9.9%, and electricity growth is estimated at 6.8%, lower than the previous year’s 7.5%. The top contributors to GDP, such as manufacturing, trade and hotels, and financial services and real estate, are all expected to witness slower growth in FY25. Urban consumption has also been hit hard, with inflation eroding the purchasing power of the urban poor. “Decelerating GDP growth, together with persistent inflation, would make the RBI’s task of managing the growth-inflation trade-off odious,” added Dr. Sharma.CHANGING CONSUMER PREFERENCES Dr. VP Singh, a director at Great Lakes Institute of Management, highlighted the impact of evolving consumer behaviour on economic growth. “Premiumisation is the flavour of the day. The industry will have to quickly adapt to changing tastes,” he noted. Singh pointed out that subdued sales in the FMCG and auto sectors are not merely a result of low incomes. “The entry of brands like MG Hector and KIA in 2018 and the surge in Parle-G sales during COVID indicate that poor sales stem more from shifting preferences than income constraints,” he said. These shifts in consumer behaviour underline a broader transition in India’s consumption landscape, which may weigh on GDP growth in the short term but could offer opportunities for industries willing to adapt quickly. “The country is undergoing a change in preferences, and the industry will soon incorporate these changes, leading to more robust GDP growth,” Singh added.IMPACT ON STOCK MARKETS AND BROADER ECONOMY Ajit Mishra, SVP, Research, Religare Broking Ltd, highlighted the potential market impact of the revised GDP forecast. “India’s GDP growth projection of 6.4% for FY25 could temper investor sentiment, as lower growth expectations might lead to reduced corporate earnings forecasts, prompting portfolio adjustments,” he said. Sectors closely tied to economic growth, particularly manufacturing, may see notable declines. However, Mishra suggested that “effective government fiscal measures or potential interest rate cuts by the RBI could offer some relief.” A sustained slowdown in GDP growth could also affect foreign institutional investor (FII) sentiment. Mishra noted, “Slower economic growth often raises concerns about corporate profitability and market stability. If FIIs identify more favourable opportunities elsewhere, they may reduce their exposure to Indian equities.” That said, India’s long-term appeal remains intact due to its demographic advantage, strong consumption trends, and resilient financial markets. External factors such as global economic conditions and geopolitical tensions will also play a role in shaping FII behaviour. Nominal GDP is expected to grow by 9.7% in FY25, slightly higher than the 9.6% seen in FY24. However, the broader economic outlook will rely heavily on the government’s fiscal policies and the RBI’s approach to managing inflation and growth.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Must Watch

Headline: RBI's new credit reporting rules: Check how it will affect loan borrowersFrom January 1, 2025, RBI's bi-monthly credit updates aim to boost credit scores, empower borrowers, and improve lender risk assessments.
Content: Starting January 1, 2025, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has mandated lenders to update credit bureau records every 15 days, a shift from the previous monthly cycle. This new regulation aims to provide a more accurate reflection of borrowers' financial activities, enhancing credit score precision and streamlining financial assessments.TIMELY UPDATES FOR BETTER CREDIT SCORES Under the older system, credit bureaus relied on monthly updates from lenders, leading to delays in capturing borrowers' repayment behaviour. For instance, timely payments or loan closures often went unrecognised until the next update, potentially impacting borrowers' credit scores and limiting their access to favourable loan terms. The new 15-day cycle ensures faster updates, allowing borrowers’ financial activities to be reflected in real-time, thereby improving their chances of securing better credit opportunities.IMPROVED CREDIT RISK ASSESSMENT The bi-monthly update system benefits lenders by offering more current credit data. This enables them to assess credit risk accurately, identify potential defaulters sooner, and reward responsible borrowers promptly. With up-to-date information, lenders can make well-informed decisions when evaluating loan applications, fostering responsible borrowing habits and reducing default rates.KEY BENEFITS OF THE NEW REGULATION Timely updates: Borrowers' credit histories will now reflect their financial activities more quickly, benefiting those with consistent repayment habits. Enhanced credit access: Accurate credit scores allow responsible borrowers to access loans faster and on better terms. Consumer empowerment: Real-time updates offer borrowers greater insight into their financial health, promoting informed decision-making. Lender confidence: Frequent updates improve risk management, providing a clearer picture of borrowers' financial behaviour. With the new bi-monthly updates, borrowers gain from quicker acknowledgement of their financial behaviours, while lenders benefit from improved risk assessment tools. This regulatory change not only strengthens trust in India's lending system but also empowers consumers and promotes a more equitable financial environment.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Easier ITR filing and tax dispute reduction expected, says reportBudget 2025 aims to simplify tax filing, reduce disputes, and foster a transparent, taxpayer-friendly system.
Content: The upcoming Union Budget 2025-26 is poised to introduce significant changes to India's tax landscape, aiming to simplify income tax filing and address longstanding tax disputes. According to a Bloomberg report, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is expected to unveil a comprehensive overhaul of the Income Tax Act, 1961, a move that has been in the works for several months.advertisementKEY FOCUS: SIMPLIFYING TAX FILINGThe proposed reforms, which may be open for public consultation by mid-January, are designed to streamline the income tax return (ITR) filing process. The proposed reforms, which may be open for public consultation by mid-January, are designed to streamline the income tax return (ITR) filing process. The initiative includes simplifying tax computation structures with formulas, unifying the definitions of the assessment year and financial year, and introducing tabular formats for taxpayer clarity. While the changes aim to make tax compliance easier, the government has indicated that tax rates and policies will remain unchanged. The demand for a simpler tax regime has grown, especially with tax disputes ballooning to Rs 10.5 lakh crore by the fiscal year ending March 2023. The proposed changes aim to address these disputes and provide clarity to taxpayers, reducing litigation and improving compliance.STEPS TOWARD REFORM In her July 2024 Budget speech, Sitharaman highlighted the government’s commitment to simplifying taxation. Measures like the introduction of exemption-free tax regimes for corporations and individuals have already garnered positive feedback, with 58% of corporate tax revenue in 2022-23 coming from the simplified regime. Similarly, over two-thirds of taxpayers have adopted the new system. The Income Tax Department has also received over 6,500 suggestions from stakeholders, reflecting widespread public engagement in shaping the reforms.A MORE TRANSPARENT TAX REGIME As India prepares for Budget 2025, these reforms signal a step toward a more transparent and taxpayer-friendly system. By reducing complexity and fostering clarity, the government aims to create a tax framework that promotes trust and compliance. With these anticipated changes, taxpayers can look forward to a smoother filing experience and fewer disputes.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: What is Economic Survey, when it's released, and why it mattersThe Economic Survey offers key insights into India's economy, guiding the Union Budget and future growth.
Content: As the Union Budget 2025 approaches, the Economic Survey takes centre stage in shaping the country’s financial outlook. Scheduled for presentation on January 31, a day before the budget, the Economic Survey provides essential insights into India’s economic health and sets the stage for the government’s fiscal plans.WHAT IS THE ECONOMIC SURVEY? The Economic Survey is a comprehensive review of India’s economic performance over the past fiscal year. It covers critical sectors such as agriculture, industry, and services, along with key economic indicators like GDP growth, inflation, employment rates, fiscal deficit, and more. The document, prepared by the Department of Economic Affairs under the supervision of the Chief Economic Advisor, V Anantha Nageswaran, includes policy recommendations to address economic challenges and promote growth. The survey is divided into two main sections: Part A reviews the country’s economic status, focusing on current fiscal trends, while Part B addresses socio-economic issues like education, poverty, climate change, and social security. Projections for GDP, inflation, forex reserves, and trade deficits are also included. The theme of this year’s Economic Survey is expected to focus on deregulation, which will likely influence the upcoming budget discussions.WHY IS THE ECONOMIC SURVEY IMPORTANT? The Economic Survey plays a pivotal role in shaping the Union Budget by offering a clear and unbiased assessment of the economy. It aids policymakers in making informed decisions and helps stakeholders such as investors and businesses with key economic data for strategic planning. The survey is not only a pre-budget tool but also an important benchmark for evaluating economic progress and setting future growth targets.HISTORICAL CONTEXT AND CONTINUED RELEVANCE Historically, the Economic Survey was presented alongside the Union Budget, but since 1964, it has been released a day before the budget. This document continues to be essential in guiding India’s economic policy and providing transparency to the nation’s financial landscape. As we await the Union Budget 2025, the Economic Survey offers valuable foresight, shaping not just the budget but the economic roadmap for the year ahead.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 8, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Instant loans for housewives: A step-by-step guideInstant personal loans offer housewives quick financial relief with easy application, affordable rates, and fast approval.
Content: Instant personal loans offer housewives quick financial relief with easy application, affordable rates, and fast approval. Being a homemaker is no easy task. Managing a household, caring for children, and supporting family members emotionally can be overwhelming, especially when unexpected expenses arise. In such times, instant personal loans can provide much-needed financial relief. This article offers a guide for housewives looking to secure instant loans and handle financial crises with ease.advertisementWHAT ARE INSTANT PERSONAL LOANS? Instant personal loans are short-term, unsecured loans designed to provide quick financial assistance. Unlike traditional loans, which require lengthy paperwork and approval processes, instant loans are processed through online platforms that make application and approval faster. With just a few clicks, housewives can apply for a loan and receive funds in their bank accounts within hours.KEY FEATURES OF INSTANT PERSONAL LOANS FOR HOUSEWIVES Affordable interest rates: Loans designed for women often come with lower interest rates, making them more affordable and easier to manage. Low processing fees: Financial institutions usually charge lower processing fees for loans targeted at women, which are clearly stated upfront. No collateral required: Instant loans do not require any collateral, reducing stress for housewives looking for financial assistance without risking valuable assets. Quick disbursement: Once approved, the loan amount is transferred to the borrower’s account within hours, providing immediate relief.REQUIRED DOCUMENTS Applying for an instant personal loan is a simple process that requires minimal documentation. You will need to provide basic identity proof, such as an Aadhaar card, passport, PAN card, or voter’s ID, along with address proof, which can include an Aadhaar card, passport, utility bill, or voter’s ID.HOW TO APPLY FOR INSTANT PERSONAL LOANS Applying for an instant personal loan is simple. Visit the website or mobile app of your chosen bank or lender. Log in with your registered mobile number. Select the option for an instant personal loan. Fill out the required details and upload the necessary documents. Once approved, the loan amount will be credited to your account.CONSIDERATIONS BEFORE APPLYING Before applying for an instant loan, ensure you consider the following: Repayment period: These loans typically come with a short repayment term, so choose one that suits your budget. Eligibility: Ensure you meet the eligibility criteria to avoid rejection, which can negatively impact your credit score. Terms & conditions: Always read the fine print to understand loan charges and conditions. Instant loans offer housewives a quick solution to financial challenges. By exploring online platforms and microfinance options, they can access funds for unplanned expenses and make informed decisions that align with their financial needs.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 8, 2025

Headline: Microsoft plans job cuts in 2025, targets low-performing employeesMicrosoft layoffs: In 2023, the company cut an estimated 10,000 jobs, amounting to roughly 5% of its global workforce.
Content: Microsoft is planning to cut jobs in 2025, focusing on employees who are not meeting performance expectations across several divisions, including its security unit. According to a report by Business Insider, this decision aligns with the company’s efforts to strengthen its performance management approach, similar to strategies adopted by other tech giants. A Microsoft spokesperson confirmed the move but did not reveal how many employees would be affected. “At Microsoft, we focus on high-performance talent. We’re always working on helping people learn and grow. When people are not performing, we take appropriate action,” the spokesperson said as mentioned in the report. While the layoffs are aimed at addressing underperformance, the company often refills roles left vacant by such cuts. This means Microsoft’s total workforce may not see a major decline. As of June 2024, the company had approximately 228,000 full-time employees. Managers have reportedly spent several months reviewing the performance of staff at all levels, including senior positions. The layoffs, described as wide-reaching, will also include employees in the company’s security division. Microsoft has conducted several rounds of layoffs in recent years. In 2023, the company cut an estimated 10,000 jobs, amounting to roughly 5% of its global workforce. During the same year, its Xbox gaming division also experienced a smaller number of layoffs. In 2024, Microsoft dismissed nearly 2,000 employees in its gaming division following the acquisition of Activision Blizzard. Later that year, the company targeted 1,500 roles in its Azure cloud computing business, though the final count of job losses reached about 1,000. These steps reflect the tech industry’s broader trend of prioritising efficiency and high performance as companies navigate economic uncertainties and evolving market demands. Meanwhile, Microsoft is continuing to expand its footprint in India. Chairman and CEO Satya Nadella recently announced an initiative to train 500,000 people in rural areas of India in artificial intelligence (AI) skills. This programme is being carried out in partnership with India’s Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY). The announcement was made during Nadella’s visit to New Delhi as part of the Microsoft AI Tour. He highlighted the importance of AI in empowering communities and enhancing human skills. “There’s tremendous progress in AI skilling in India,” Nadella said, pointing to the country’s growing influence in the AI landscape.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Stocks to watch today: TCS, Tata Motors, IREDA, BHEL, NTPC Green EnergyStocks such as TCS, Tata Motors, IREDA, BHEL, Tata Elxsi, etc are expected to remain in focus due to various developments and announcements.

This development could weigh on the company’s stock performance.PRATAAP SNACKS Snack manufacturer Prataap Snacks received an open offer from Authum Investment & Infrastructure and Mahi Madhusudan Kela to acquire a 26% stake in the company for over Rs 544 crore.OTHER STOCKS TO WATCH Money Boxx: The company opened a new branch in Bhagalpur to expand its reach. Lupin: Received an Establishment Inspection Report (EIR) from the US FDA for its Pithampur unit, classified as Voluntary Action Indicated (VAI). Headline: Standard Glass Lining IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusStandard Glass Lining IPO allotment: Investors can check the allotment status through two primary methods: the BSE website or the KFin Technologies portal.
Content: The allotment status for the Standard Glass Lining Technology IPO is expected to be finalised on Thursday, January 9, after the public listing received massive investor interest during its three-day bidding period. Successful applicants will begin receiving notifications about the status of their applications, including fund debits or revocations, by Friday or over the weekend. The IPO of Standard Glass Lining Technology, a Hyderabad-based engineering equipment manufacturer, was open for subscription from January 6 to January 8. The shares were offered at a price band of Rs 133-140 per share, with a lot size of 107 shares. The company raised Rs 410.05 crore through the IPO, which included a fresh share issue worth Rs 210 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of Rs 200.05 crore. The IPO received an overwhelming response, with a total subscription of 185.48 times, translating to bids worth Rs 53,238.58 crore. Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) section was subscribed 327.76 times, Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs) subscribed 275.21 times, and Retail Investors bid 65.71 times for the IPO. HOW TO CHECK ALLOTMENT STATUS Investors can check the allotment status through two primary methods: the BSE website or the KFin Technologies portal. Via BSE Website: Visit the BSE website by clicking here Select Equity under issue type. Choose Standard Glass Lining Technology Limited from the dropdown menu under issue name. Enter your application number and PAN ID. Complete the captcha and click Search.Via KFin Technologies Portal: Visit the registrar, KFin Technologies website Select the IPO name from the dropdown (visible after finalisation). Choose an identification method: Application number, Demat account number, or PAN ID. Specify the application type (ASBA or non-ASBA). Enter the relevant details, complete the captcha, and hit Submit.LATEST GMP The grey market premium (GMP) for the IPO has remained strong despite market volatility. The latest GMP, as of January 9, 2025, is Rs 91. Based on the upper price band of Rs 140, the estimated listing price of the shares is Rs 231, reflecting an expected gain of 65%. Incorporated in September 2012, Standard Glass Lining Technology manufactures engineering equipment for the pharmaceutical and chemical industries in India. The company provides end-to-end solutions, including design, engineering, manufacturing, installation, and operational support for its clients. The shares of Standard Glass Lining Technology are expected to be listed on both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) on Monday, January 13, 2025. IIFL Securities and Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors acted as the book-running lead managers for the issue, while KFin Technologies served as the registrar. As the registrar, KFin Technologies is responsible for managing the allotment process, crediting shares to successful applicants, processing refunds, and addressing investor queries. It ensures the allotment process adheres to Sebi guidelines and timelines.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 9, 2025

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open lower in early trade; bank stocks drag ahead of Q3 resultsThe S&P BSE Sensex tumbled 245.54 points to 77,902.95, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 76.35 points to 23,612.60 as of 9:30 AM.
Content:
Benchmark stock market indices fell in early trade on Thursday, dragged by a decline in banking and heavyweight financial stocks as volatility continued to plague the market. The S&P BSE Sensex tumbled 245.54 points to 77,902.95, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 76.35 points to 23,612.60 as of 9:30 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that so far in January FIIs have sold equity for Rs 10419 crores. "With the dollar index at 109 and the 10-year bond yield at 4.67% FIIs are likely to continue with their selling strategy putting pressure on the market in the near-term," he added.  Hindalco Industries led the gainers on Nifty50 with a rise of 1.56%, followed by Kotak Mahindra Bank which advanced 1.25%. Bajaj Auto showed positive momentum with a 0.96% increase, while Infosys and Mahindra & Mahindra registered modest gains of 0.35% and 0.32% respectively. On the declining side, Apollo Hospitals Enterprise saw the steepest fall of 1.82%, while Trent Limited dropped 1.63%. Larsen & Toubro (L&T) declined by 1.37%, and UltraTech Cement fell 1.09%. Grasim Industries rounded out the losers with a decline of 1.07%. The mixed performance reflects the day's cautious trading sentiment in the Indian equity market.

"With the Q3 results season starting from today there will be market reaction to results. The results of TCS will give an indication of what is in store for the IT sector. The strength of the U.S. economy and the depreciation of rupee will be tailwinds for the IT sector. Premium segments like hotels, jewellery, automobiles catering to the premium market and airlines are likely to report good numbers. Expectations from President Trump’s policy decisions and the Indian union Budget proposals will keep the market volatile in the coming days," said Vijayakumar.  Coming to sectoral indices in today's early market action, Nifty Realty took the biggest hit, down 1.31%. Nifty Consumer Durables also faced significant pressure, declining 0.88%, while Nifty Pharma dropped 0.58%. The financial sector showed weakness, with Nifty Financial Services falling 0.41% and Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank declining 0.57%. Nifty Metal slipped 0.45%, while Nifty Auto declined 0.38%. The healthcare segments weren't spared either, with Nifty Healthcare Index down 0.66% and Nifty Midsmall Healthcare falling 0.65%. Nifty Oil & Gas retreated by 0.52%, while Nifty Midsmall Services and Nifty IT showed relatively smaller declines of 0.36% and 0.18% respectively. Nifty Bank and Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom both fell by 0.23%. Only three indices managed to stay in the green - Nifty Media stood out as the top gainer, advancing 1.16%, while Nifty FMCG and Nifty Private Bank both edged up slightly by 0.06%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Must Watch

Headline: TCS to declare interim dividend today: Know record date and past dividendsTCS has already declared dividends totalling Rs 20 per share for FY25, with Rs 10 each announced in the first and second quarters.
Content: Tata Consultancy Services Ltd (TCS), one of India's largest IT services companies, is set to announce its third interim dividend and financial results for Q3 FY25 today. The announcements are expected after stock market hours. TCS will also hold a media briefing at 5:30 pm, followed by a conference call with analysts and investors at 7 pm. TCS has already declared dividends totalling Rs 20 per share for FY25, with Rs 10 each announced in the first and second quarters. If the third interim dividend is declared, it will be payable to eligible shareholders whose names appear as beneficial owners in the records of depositories as of the record date, which is Friday, January 17, 2025. Last year, TCS declared a final dividend of Rs 28 per share for FY24 along with its Q4 results in April. For FY24, TCS had also announced an interim dividend of Rs 9 per share and a special dividend of Rs 18 per share following its Q3 results. In the first and second quarters of FY24, the company announced interim dividends of Rs 9 each. In addition to the dividends, TCS undertook a share buyback programme worth Rs 17,000 crore in FY24. The total amount distributed to shareholders, including dividends and buybacks, was Rs 46,223 crore for FY24.HISTORICAL DIVIDEND PAYOUTS For FY23, TCS declared a final dividend of Rs 24 per share, with cumulative payouts for the year amounting to Rs 115 per share. This translated to Rs 33,306 crore in total dividends and a dividend yield of 3.59%. In earlier years, the company paid dividends of Rs 43 per share (Rs 7,686 crore) in FY22, Rs 38 per share (Rs 8,510 crore) in FY21, and Rs 72 per share (Rs 25,125 crore) in FY20. These consistent payouts underscore TCS’s commitment to returning value to its shareholders.Q3 FY25 PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS For the third quarter of FY25, market analysts expect TCS to show flat constant currency (CC) revenue growth, with a slight decline in dollar revenue. This is mainly due to seasonal factors like furloughs and a lower contribution from the BSNL contract. However, analysts predict that operational efficiencies and a reversal of one-off costs from earlier quarters will partially offset these impacts. Margins are expected to improve by 20-40 basis points during the quarter. Analysts at Nuvama forecast TCS's profit after tax at Rs 12,390 crore, with revenue reaching Rs 64,129 crore. The firm predicts a 0.1% sequential CC revenue growth, a 0.8% decline in dollar revenue, and stable deal wins. Nuvama also highlighted key areas to watch, including the company’s outlook on the BSNL contract and its future margin guidance.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Explained: Why SRF and Navin Fluorine share price surged up to 14% todaySRF and Navin Fluorine stock price today: SRF Ltd's shares soared by 13.8% to a day's high of Rs 2,678.95 on the BSE in early trade, while Navin Fluorine International's shares surged 13.9% to Rs 3,974.15.
Content: Shares of chemical companies SRF Ltd and Navin Fluorine International saw a sharp surge of up to 14% on Thursday, following a report from brokerage firm Equirus Capital. The report highlighted a substantial rise in global refrigerant gas prices, propelling investor interest in the two firms.The rally was triggered by supply constraints in key refrigerant gases, R32 and R125, as noted by a leading US distributor with significant market quotas. These supply issues have put pressure on the Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) sector, which heavily relies on these gases for its operations.advertisementOn Thursday, SRF Ltd’s shares soared by 13.8% to a day’s high of Rs 2,678.95 on the BSE, while Navin Fluorine International’s shares surged 13.9% to Rs 3,974.15. Shares of chemical companies SRF Ltd and Navin Fluorine International saw a sharp surge of up to 14% on Thursday, following a report from brokerage firm Equirus Capital. The report highlighted a substantial rise in global refrigerant gas prices, propelling investor interest in the two firms. The rally was triggered by supply constraints in key refrigerant gases, R32 and R125, as noted by a leading US distributor with significant market quotas. These supply issues have put pressure on the Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning (HVAC) sector, which heavily relies on these gases for its operations. On Thursday, SRF Ltd’s shares soared by 13.8% to a day’s high of Rs 2,678.95 on the BSE, while Navin Fluorine International’s shares surged 13.9% to Rs 3,974.15. According to Equirus Capital, the tightening global supply of refrigerant gases has pushed prices higher, creating significant financial opportunities for manufacturers like SRF and Navin Fluorine. Analysts pointed out that SRF is particularly well-positioned, with an annual production capacity of 29,000 to 30,000 tons of R32 and about 7,000 tons of R125. The report estimated that for every $1/kg increase in R32 prices, SRF’s EBITDA could grow by Rs 260 crore, while a similar rise in R125 prices could add Rs 60 crore to its EBITDA. Navin Fluorine, which currently produces 4,500 tons of R32 annually, also stands to benefit. The company’s plans to double its R32 production capacity to 9,000 tons by February 2025 could further enhance its profitability. Equirus projected that starting February 2025, every $1/kg increase in R32 prices could add Rs 77 crore to Navin Fluorine’s EBITDA. The price increase highlights a growing demand-supply imbalance in the refrigerant gas market, which remains crucial for the HVAC industry. With strong production capacities and planned expansions, analysts believe that both SRF and Navin Fluorine are well-positioned to capitalise on this trend. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 9, 2025

Headline: Sensex falls 500 points, Nifty tumbles: Why is the stock market down today?Stock market today: Around 11:05 am, Sensex was trading 448.21 points lower at 77,700.28 and Nifty was down 142.85 points to 23,546.10

Most of the broader market indices also fell during early trade as volatility rose due to concerns over the possibility of weak profit growth in the third quarter.Q3 RESULTS KEEP D-STREET ON EDGE It may be noted that Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is set to kick off the Q3 earnings season today and several analysts have noted that the IT giant could witness a sequential slowdown. Alongside TCS, Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency, Tata Elxsi, GTPL Hathway, Mishka Exim, Padam Cotton Yarns, Teamo Productions HQ, Vivo Bio Tech and Yash Highvoltage will also report September to December 2024 period results today. Headline: Quadrant Future Tek IPO closes today: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPQuadrant Future Tek IPO (initial public offering) is a completely fresh equity issue of 1 crore shares. Investors can bid for the public issue at a price band of Rs 275-290 per share, with a minimum lot size of 50 shares.
Content: The Rs 290 crore IPO of Quadrant Future Tek Limited will close for bidding on Thursday after having received over 50 times subscription in the first two days.  Quadrant Future Tek IPO (initial public offering) is a completely fresh equity issue of 1 crore shares. Investors can bid for the public issue at a price band of Rs 275-290 per share, with a minimum lot size of 50 shares. It opened for subscription on January 6, 2024.  The Quadrant Future Tek IPO has seen strong interest from investors, being oversubscribed 65.49 times by the latest update on January 9, 2025, the third and final day of bidding. In the retail investor category, the subscription reached 171.99 times, while the non-institutional investor (NII) category recorded a subscription of 124.43 times. However, the qualified institutional buyers (QIB) segment witnessed relatively subdued participation, with a subscription rate of just 0.52 times.LATEST GMP The grey market premium (GMP) for the IPO has remained stable in recent updates. As of 9:29 AM on January 9, 2025, the GMP was Rs 210. Given the IPO price band, which is capped at Rs 290, the estimated listing price is expected to be around Rs 500, combining the cap price and the GMP. This implies an anticipated gain of approximately 72.41% per share from the IPO’s upper price band.SHOULD YOU SUBSCRIBE? "At the upper price band of Rs.290,QFTL is available at a P/E of 78.8x (FY24), which appears expensive compared to peers. However, company’s entry into Train Control Systems, and government support for railway modernization are positives. Despite concerns over negative PAT and limited experience in Train Control Systems, we recommend subscribe on a short term basis for high risk investors," said an IPO report from Geojit.  Quadrant Future Tek specialises in developing next-generation Train Control and Signaling Systems under the Indian Railways’ KAVACH project. It also manufactures specialty cables for railway and naval defense sectors. The IPO proceeds will fund long-term working capital needs, capital expenditure, loan repayments, and general corporate purposes. The allotment is scheduled for January 10, with the listing expected on January 14. Headline: Jobs in 2030: Do you need to learn AI? Check fastest growing and declining jobs The report examines the macro trends that will affect jobs, skills, and workforce transformation between 2025 and 2030.
Content:
The World Economic Forum (WEF) has published its latest Future of Jobs Report 2025, offering insights into how the global labour market will evolve by 2030. The report highlights the key trends shaping the workforce and the strategies businesses plan to adapt to respond to these changes. The WEF’s report is based on inputs from over 1,000 leading global employers representing more than 14 million workers across 22 industry clusters and 55 economies worldwide. It examines the macro trends that will affect jobs, skills, and workforce transformation between 2025 and 2030. “Technological change, the green transition, economic uncertainty, geoeconomic fragmentation, and demographic shifts are reshaping the labour market,” the report said. The report predicts that 170 million new jobs will be created globally by 2030, while 92 million jobs will be displaced. This translates to a net gain of 78 million jobs in the next decade.FASTEST-GROWING JOB ROLES

 



Fastest growing jobs (Source: WEF Report)
 The rise of technology and digital access is driving demand for certain roles. According to the WEF report, the top five fastest-growing jobs by 2030 include Big Data Specialists, FinTech Engineers, AI & Machine Learning Specialists, Software & Applications Developers, and Security Management Specialists.  "According to the surveyed executives, the fastestgrowing job roles by 2030, in percentage terms, tend to be driven by technological developments, such as advancements in AI and robotics and increasing digital access," the report mentioned.  These roles are experiencing rapid growth due to advancements in artificial intelligence, robotics, and digital technologies. Businesses are increasingly adopting these tools to enhance efficiency and innovation.FASTEST-DECLINING JOB ROLES

 



Fastest declining jobs (Source: WEF Report)
 On the other hand, traditional roles are expected to see significant declines, primarily due to automation and digitalisation. The top five fastest-declining jobs by 2030 are Postal Service Clerks, Bank Tellers & Related Clerks, Data Entry Clerks, Cashiers & Ticket Clerks and Administrative Assistants and Executive Secretaries.  "By contrast, respondents expect the fastest declining roles to include various clerical roles, such as Cashiers and Ticket Clerks, alongside Administrative Assistants and Executive Secretaries, Printing Workers, and Accountants and Auditors," said the WEF report on jobs.  These roles are being phased out as automation, AI, and autonomous systems streamline routine tasks. Other contributing factors include slower economic growth and aging populations. Interestingly, farm workers are set to experience the largest job growth, with an additional 35 million jobs anticipated by 2030. This increase is driven by the green transition, which focuses on reducing carbon emissions and adapting to climate change. Other factors include broader digital access and the rising cost of living. Farm workers currently account for over 200 million jobs globally. As the workforce transforms, the demand for new skills will grow. Employers are focusing on reskilling and upskilling employees to adapt to technological advancements and shifting job markets. The report highlights that businesses must adopt proactive strategies to prepare for these changes, while employees should consider continuous learning to remain relevant in the evolving job landscape.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 9, 2025

Headline: Why Donald Trump wants to purchase Greenland, regain control of Panama CanalGreenland, a resource-rich Arctic gem, remains an ambitious dream amidst Trump's territorial aspirations.
Content: President-elect Donald Trump has reignited interest in Greenland, proposing it as a valuable strategic addition to the U.S. territory. While the idea may sound audacious, it has sparked discussions about the island’s value, strategic significance, and feasibility of such a purchase.GREENLAND’S PRICE TAG: FROM HISTORY TO MODERN ESTIMATES Trump’s fascination with Greenland isn’t without precedent. In 1946, President Harry Truman offered $100 million in gold—equivalent to $1.3 billion today—to purchase the icy expanse. Modern estimates, however, paint a vastly different picture. Greenland’s mineral wealth, including rare earth metals, copper, and cobalt, coupled with its strategic Arctic location, has pushed valuations between $230 million (based on Alaska’s 1867 price) to over $1.1 trillion. When accounting for infrastructure and economic integration, the total cost could soar to $1.5 trillion. Furthermore, compensating Greenland’s 57,000 residents for such a transition could add another $5.7 billion to $57 billion, depending on payout schemes.STRATEGIC IMPORTANCE  Trump has underscored Greenland’s strategic value, highlighting its role in Arctic trade routes and its proximity to geopolitical rivals Russia and China. However, Greenlandic and Danish leaders have firmly rejected the idea. Greenland’s Prime Minister Mute Egede stated, “Greenland belongs to the people of Greenland. Our future is ours to shape.” while Denmark’s Mette Frederiksen highlighted respect for the island’s autonomy. Acquiring Greenland would require navigating complex international laws that prioritise self-determination, Greenlandic and Danish approval, and a robust treaty negotiation process. While Trump’s vision may remain an ambitious dream, Greenland’s significance as a resource-rich, strategically located island highlights its growing importance on the global stage. Whether for its minerals or its position in Arctic trade, Greenland’s future remains firmly in the hands of its people.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Capital Infra Trust InvIT IPO: Check latest GMP, subscription status on Day 3Capital Infra Trust InvIT IPO: The grey market premium (GMP) for the Capital Infra Trust InvIT IPO stood at Rs 0 on Thursday, indicating that the units were trading at their issue price of Rs 100 without any premium or discount in the grey market.
Content: The Capital Infra Trust IPO, the first InvIT public offering of 2025, is set to close today, January 9. Sponsored by Gawar Construction, a prominent player in the road and highway construction sector, the IPO has a price range of Rs 99-100 per unit. The offering aims to raise Rs 1,578 crore, including a fresh issue of Rs 1,077 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 501 crore. With infrastructure playing a key role in India's growth, the IPO has generated considerable market attention.LATEST GMP  The grey market premium (GMP) for the Capital Infra Trust InvIT IPO stood at Rs 0 on Thursday, indicating that the units were trading at their issue price of Rs 100 without any premium or discount in the grey market. According to investorgain.com, the GMP trend for the past nine sessions has shown no significant changes, and experts believe this stability is likely to persist until the listing day. The absence of a GMP premium suggests a cautious investor sentiment, with many waiting to see how the units perform post-listing. While a positive GMP often indicates strong demand in the grey market, the flat trend in this case may reflect broader concerns over sector-specific risks and market conditions.SUBSCRIPTION STATUS ON DAY 3  At around 12:10 pm on day 3 of the bidding process, the Capital Infra Trust InvIT IPO had been subscribed by 86%. In total, bids have been placed for 2,36,96,850 units out of the total 8,83,83,750 units available, according to data from the NSE. On the first day of bidding, the IPO saw a subscription rate of 39%, reflecting a steady but cautious uptake. Market analysts have noted that the offering's focus on infrastructure, particularly roads and highways, aligns well with India's growing infrastructure development needs. The proceeds from the fresh issue will be used to repay external debts and unsecured loans, strengthening the project funding capabilities of the Trust's Special Purpose Vehicles (SPVs). Headline: 'How long can you stare at wife?' L&T chief wants employees to work on SundaysThe debate about work hours in India has gained traction recently, especially in the tech and corporate sectors after Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy's suggestion of a 70-hour work week.
Content:
If work-life balance had a face, it might be raising an eyebrow after hearing the latest comments from L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan. After Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy’s suggestion of a 70-hour work week sparked online debates, Subrahmanyan has taken it a step further, saying employees should clock 90 hours a week and maybe even give up Sundays. In a comment that’s now gone viral, Subrahmanyan asked employees, “How long can you stare at your wife?” urging them to spend less time at home and more at the office. Subrahmanyan’s comments came during an employee interaction where he was questioned about L&T's six-day workweek policy.
L&T Chairman says “ he regrets he’s not able to make us work on Sunday and Sunday’s, 90hrs a week” in a response to his employee remarks 
byu/5seb4C inIndiaCareers
 Responding to the query about why employees are required to work on Saturdays, Subrahmanyan expressed regret that he couldn’t mandate Sunday as a working day as well. In a video circulating on Reddit, he said, "I regret I am not able to make you work on Sundays. If I can make you work on Sundays, I will be more happy, because I work on Sundays." Subrahmanyan further questioned what employees do while staying at home. "What do you do sitting at home? How long can you stare at your wife?" he asked. "Come on, get to the office and start working." To support his views, Subrahmanyan shared an anecdote about a conversation he had with a Chinese individual. According to him, the person claimed that China could surpass the United States because Chinese workers put in 90 hours a week compared to the 50 hours worked by Americans. "So that’s the answer for you. If you have got to be on top of the world, you have to work 90 hours a week. Get going, guys. Come on," Subrahmanyan said in the undated video. The video, which was first shared on Reddit, has gone viral, drawing criticism from netizens. Many users found Subrahmanyan’s comments inappropriate and compared them to the remarks made by Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy last year. Murthy had suggested that young Indians should work 70 hours a week to help build the nation, which also faced widespread backlash. In the Reddit comments section, some users questioned Subrahmanyan’s understanding of work-life balance, while others criticised the broader culture of promoting overwork. Many felt his remarks trivialised employees' personal lives, with the comment about staring at one’s wife particularly drawing sharp responses.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Must Watch

Headline: These cash transactions may trigger 100% penalties. Details hereThe Income Tax Department warns against excessive cash transactions, as violations can lead to heavy penalties.
Content: The Income Tax Department has issued a fresh reminder urging taxpayers to limit their use of cash in daily transactions. Cash remains popular in India due to its convenience, but certain cash dealings can lead to hefty penalties under the Income Tax Act, 1961. If cash transactions exceed specific thresholds, taxpayers may face disallowed deductions and penalties equal to the cash amount involved. Here’s a closer look at the rules you need to know to avoid penalties.CASH TRANSACTION LIMITS AND PENALTIES Loans, deposits, and advances (Section 269SS): You cannot accept loans, deposits, or specified sums in cash if the total amount is Rs 20,000 or more. Violating this limit attracts a penalty under Section 271D, equal to the cash accepted. However, exceptions include transactions involving the government, banks, and notified institutions. Receiving cash above Rs 2 lakh (Section 269ST): No individual can accept cash exceeding Rs 2 lakh from one person in a day, for a single transaction, or multiple transactions linked to one event. This rule applies even to fees, donations, or related-party transactions. Breaching this limit leads to a penalty under Section 271DA, equal to the amount received. Repayment of loans and deposits (Section 269T): Repaying loans, deposits, or specified advances in cash above Rs 20,000 is prohibited. Violations result in penalties under Section 271E, equal to the amount repaid in cash. Exceptions include repayments to government bodies, banks, or notified institutions.PROMOTING DIGITAL PAYMENTS To reduce reliance on cash, businesses with turnover exceeding Rs 50 crore must facilitate digital payment methods like UPI, NEFT, and RTGS. Failing to comply results in a Rs 5,000 daily penalty under Section 271DB. The government aims to reduce the risks of unaccounted money by discouraging cash transactions. By understanding these rules, taxpayers can avoid penalties and adopt digital financial systems for seamless and compliant transactions. Remember, staying informed about cash regulations can save you from unnecessary financial setbacks. Say “yes” to digital and “no” to cash!Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Paytm leads India payments from disruption to monetisation: BernsteinBernstein's analysis underscores Paytm's potential for sustainable growth and profitability, citing key drivers of its success.
Content: Brokerage firm Bernstein’s latest report positions Paytm as a leading player in India’s digital payments ecosystem. Assigning the company an "Outperform" rating with a target price of Rs 1,100, the report titled, ‘India Payments: From Disruption to Monetisation – Can Payments Be Profitable?’, highlights Paytm’s ability to monetise its core payments business despite the challenges posed by the zero-MDR (Merchant Discount Rate) environment. Bernstein’s analysis underscores Paytm’s potential for sustainable growth and profitability, citing key drivers of its success. The report points to Paytm’s strategic leverage of the growing adoption of credit payments on UPI rails, which typically offer higher margins compared to debit payments. RuPay credit card transactions through UPI now represent 30% of all credit card transactions, up sharply from just 10% in FY24. This shift toward credit-based payments has significantly bolstered Paytm’s profitability in the payments space. Bernstein also highlights the exponential growth in payment volumes through UPI, which continues to expand at an impressive rate of 40-50% year-on-year. Cashless payments now account for 50% of private consumption expenditure in India. Bernstein predicts that this could rise to 2-3 times private consumption expenditure, mirroring trends observed in markets like China. Paytm’s scale and reach in India position it well to capitalize on this massive growth opportunity. Paytm’s innovative revenue streams, such as devices like soundboxes, have emerged as a significant contributor to its margins. According to the report, nearly 50% of Paytm’s payment margins come from device-related revenues, showcasing the company’s ability to effectively monetise its growing payment volumes. Bernstein notes that such innovations have positioned Paytm ahead of its competitors in terms of sustainable profitability. The report also emphasises Paytm’s increased operating leverage resulting from higher transaction volumes. As cashless transactions continue to grow, the company is expected to benefit from economies of scale, allowing it to cover costs more efficiently. This increased operational efficiency further strengthens Paytm’s profitability. In addition to leveraging RuPay credit cards, Paytm has expanded its credit-based solutions to include UPI-linked credit lines and Buy Now Pay Later (BNPL) offerings. These innovative solutions enable Paytm to tap into new revenue streams and enhance its profit margins, highlighting its ability to adapt to changing consumer preferences and market trends. Bernstein’s analysis portrays Paytm as a leader in India’s transition from payment disruption to monetisation. With diversified revenue streams, innovative products, and an ever-growing market share, Paytm is well-positioned to remain at the forefront of India’s digital payments revolution, the report indicated. The report also underscored the company’s potential to drive long-term profitability while maintaining its leadership in one of the world’s most dynamic fintech ecosystems.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Must Watch

Headline: TCS Q3 Results: Profit rises 12% to Rs 12,380 crore; special dividend announcedTCS Q3 results: TCS's revenue for the quarter stood at Rs 63,973 crore, marking a 5.6% YoY increase (4.5% in constant currency). The operating margin was 24.5%, reflecting a YoY decline of 50 basis points but a sequential improvement of 40 basis points. The net margin for the quarter was 19.4%.
Content: India’s largest IT services firm, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), reported a 12% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit for the December quarter, reaching Rs 12,380 crore, in line with market expectations. The company had posted a net profit of Rs 11,058 crore during the same period last year. TCS’s revenue for the quarter stood at Rs 63,973 crore, marking a 5.6% YoY increase (4.5% in constant currency). The operating margin was 24.5%, reflecting a YoY decline of 50 basis points but a sequential improvement of 40 basis points. The net margin for the quarter was 19.4%. K Krithivasan, CEO and MD, highlighted robust deal wins and growth across industries, adding that signs of revival in discretionary spending boost long-term confidence. CFO Samir Seksaria noted improved margins and strong cash flows, with net cash from operations at Rs 13,032 crore, amounting to 105.3% of net income. The company’s workforce strength stood at 607,354, with an IT services attrition rate of 13% on a last-twelve-month basis. Women accounted for 35.3% of the workforce, representing 152 nationalities.BIG DIVIDEND ANNOUNCED Additionally, TCS announced a total dividend of Rs 76 per share, including a special dividend of Rs 66 per share. The record date for the dividend is January 17, 2025, and the payment date is February 3, 2025. "We would like to inform you that at the Board Meeting held today, the Directors have declared a third interim dividend of Rs 10 and a special dividend of Rs 66 per Equity Share of INR 1 each of the company," said the company's press release.  It may be noted that the third interim dividend and the special dividend shall be paid on February 3, 2025, to the equity shareholders of the company.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 9, 2025

Headline: Sensex closes 500 points lower: Key reasons behind market volatility todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 528.28 points to close at 77,620.21, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 162.45 points to end at 23,526.50.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices closed lower on Thursday, dragged by a decline in IT, banking, financial and energy sector stocks as volatility prevailed.  The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 528.28 points to close at 77,620.21, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 162.45 points to end at 23,526.50.  Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services aid that the Indian stock market mirrored the decline across its Asian peers, with cautious investor sentiment driven by a sell-off in US bonds. 'The US 10-year Treasury yield surged to its highest level since April 2024, signalling expectation of fewer rate cuts by the Fed. Further, disappointing inflation data from China added pressure, indicating that recent stimulus measures have failed to rejuvenate one of the world's largest consumer markets," he added. Bajaj Auto emerged as the top gainer, surging 2.11%, while Nestle India showed strong momentum with a 1.76% increase. Hindustan Unilever continued the positive trend, climbing 1.62%, followed by Mahindra & Mahindra which gained 1.48%, and Britannia Industries which rose 1.28%. Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) led the declines with a drop of 2.59%, followed by Shriram Finance which fell 2.41%. Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) declined 2.00%, while Coal India slipped 1.95%. Tata Steel rounded out the major losers, falling 1.90%. Domestically, the FMCG sector outperformed, while other sectors declined, anticipating only modest improvement in Q3 earnings estimates, cautioning against high expectations. The day's trading showed a clear split between consumer goods companies gaining ground while energy and industrial stocks faced selling pressure. VLA Ambala, Co-Founder of Stock Market Today said that during the early trading hours, Rupee hit a new low of 85.93 against the dollar, prompted by strong dollar demand amid rising yields on the US treasury notes.  "The top-line growth of the listed firms could remain subdued for the seventh quarter in a row while y-o-y margins could face pressure with a subdued 10% growth for the third consecutive quarter," she added.  Market trends indicate that certain sectors, including automobiles, banking, consumer staples, oil, and construction materials, may deliver subdued profits with limited growth, possibly remaining in the single digits. In contrast, industries like pharmaceuticals, real estate, capital goods, and telecommunications are expected to show robust growth in profit after tax (PAT). Despite these sectoral variations, the overall market sentiment is likely to remain weak, mainly due to continued selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs). So far this month, FIIs have sold shares worth Rs 11,931.91 crore, while domestic institutional investors (DIIs) have managed to counterbalance the selling pressure by investing Rs 12,614.32 crore. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: What women taxpayers can expectWomen taxpayers hope the Union Budget 2025 will offer tax relief, credit access, and support for education, entrepreneurship, and retirement.
Content: As India gears up for the Union Budget 2025, women taxpayers are hopeful of policies that recognise their growing financial participation and empowerment. Over the years, the government has taken several steps to ease the tax burden and provide better financial opportunities for women. With more women entering the workforce and managing personal finances, this budget is expected to bring forth measures that foster greater financial independence and security.advertisementA BOOST TO WOMEN ENTREPRENEURSWith the rise of women entrepreneurs and their growing contribution to the economy, the Union Budget 2025 is expected to introduce tax reliefs that encourage female-led businesses. With the rise of women entrepreneurs and their growing contribution to the economy, the Union Budget 2025 is expected to introduce tax reliefs that encourage female-led businesses. Simplified tax compliance procedures, along with incentives for women to invest in startups, could be a key feature. Women-owned small and medium enterprises (SMEs) may benefit from lower tax rates, easier access to financial resources, and a more conducive environment for business growth. These changes could significantly lower barriers for women entrepreneurs to thrive. Ridhima Kansal, Director of Rosemoore, believes that with the Union Budget 2025 approaching, women taxpayers are hopeful for measures that reduce their tax burden and enhance financial empowerment. She anticipates higher exemptions for retirement plans, education loans, and housing ETFs, as well as tax relief on restructuring costs to encourage greater female workforce participation.EASIER ACCESS TO CREDIT AND TAX INCENTIVES A significant focus of the upcoming budget is likely to be improving access to credit for women. Financial inclusion is a key priority, and the government may introduce schemes aimed at making credit more accessible to women entrepreneurs and self-employed individuals. Simplified loan processes and lower interest rates could be on the cards, enabling women to expand their businesses or pursue their professional goals. Additionally, targeted tax incentives for women could help reduce their financial burden. Expect possible tax breaks or rebates for women in higher income brackets, along with deductions for those investing in specific long-term savings plans. These measures will help women better plan for their future, particularly in terms of financial independence. Dimple Motwani, Co-Founder, Posh Pitara, stated, “Initiatives such as easier access to credit, targeted tax incentives, and streamlined compliance processes would go a long way in helping women-owned ventures flourish.” She further highlighted that government-backed skill-development mentorship programs could significantly empower women to innovate and compete on a global scale.RETIREMENT PLANS  As women increasingly take on roles as primary earners and caregivers, retirement security becomes more crucial. The budget might include provisions for better retirement plans tailored to women’s needs, including higher contributions or tax-free growth options. Such steps would ensure that women are better prepared for their golden years.HOUSING LOANS Another area of focus could be affordable housing. Women buyers may benefit from enhanced tax exemptions on home loans, making homeownership a more achievable goal. These initiatives would also encourage women to invest in long-term assets, contributing to their overall wealth-building strategy.EDUCATION LOANS AND EMPOWERMENT Education remains one of the most empowering tools for women. In line with the government’s ongoing push for women’s education, the budget could feature favourable tax incentives for education loans. This would not only make higher education more accessible but also equip women with the skills to thrive in a competitive job market. Mamta Shekhawat, the founder of Gradding.com, mentioned, “This budget is crucial as it presents an opportunity to empower women by creating a more equitable tax framework. Besides, it not only fosters economic independence but also removes barriers that limit women's potential.” The Union Budget 2025 has the potential to create a more inclusive financial ecosystem for women. With an emphasis on credit access, tax relief, and long-term financial planning, women taxpayers can look forward to more opportunities that foster growth, security, and independence.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: PPF 2025: Benefits, interest rates, and other details PPF is a secure, tax-free savings option ideal for risk-averse investors seeking long-term financial growth.
Content: The Public Provident Fund (PPF) remains one of India’s most trusted investment options, offering a government-backed platform for secure and tax-efficient wealth creation. With a blend of long-term stability, flexibility, and attractive tax benefits, PPF is a popular choice for risk-averse investors looking to plan their financial future.KEY FEATURES AND BENEFITS OF PPF PPF offers unmatched benefits for those seeking a reliable savings scheme. You can start investing with as little as Rs 500 annually, up to a maximum of Rs 1.5 lakh per year. The 15-year lock-in period ensures disciplined savings, and upon maturity, investors have the option to extend the tenure in 5-year blocks, making it a versatile tool for long-term wealth accumulation. One of its standout features is the tax treatment under the Exempt-Exempt-Exempt (EEE) regime, where the principal amount, interest earned, and maturity withdrawals are all tax-free. This makes PPF one of the most tax-efficient and attractive investment options for individuals.CURRENT INTEREST RATES AND WITHDRAWAL RULES As of January 2025, the PPF interest rate stands at 7.1% per annum, compounded annually. The rate is subject to quarterly revisions by the government, ensuring fair returns in line with market trends. Withdrawals are allowed after five years, subject to certain conditions. Upon maturity, investors can either withdraw the entire amount, retain the balance to earn interest, or extend the account in 5-year increments with or without additional deposits.INVESTING IN PPF: A SMART MOVE FOR THE FUTURE Opening a PPF account is simple and can be done through post offices, authorised bank branches, or online platforms. Regular contributions throughout the year can maximise interest earnings, encouraging disciplined financial planning. For instance, if you invest Rs 1.5 lakh annually at 7.1% interest over 15 years, you can accumulate approximately Rs 40.68 lakh, with Rs 18.18 lakh as interest earned. In other words, PPF stands as a reliable and tax-efficient investment option, providing individuals with a secure path to long-term financial growth and stability.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Wall Street prepares for 200,000 job cuts as AI takes over: ReportAI's rise may cost 200,000 Wall Street jobs, boosting efficiency, profits, and reshaping roles in finance.
Content: As artificial intelligence (AI) continues to advance, the financial industry is bracing for significant job losses. Wall Street banks, including industry giants like Citigroup, JPMorgan, and Goldman Sachs, are expected to cut up to 200,000 jobs over the next three to five years. The reason? AI is rapidly taking over tasks traditionally performed by human workers, particularly in back-office, middle-office, and operations roles. This shift is not just about cutting costs—it’s also about boosting productivity and profits.advertisementAI's IMPACT ON BANKING JOBSThe job cuts are largely expected to impact positions involving routine and repetitive tasks, such as customer service and know-your-customer (KYC) roles. The job cuts are largely expected to impact positions involving routine and repetitive tasks, such as customer service and know-your-customer (KYC) roles. According to Bloomberg Intelligence (BI), AI tools will streamline operations, leading to fewer human workers required for these functions. However, it’s important to note that while jobs will be transformed, they won’t be entirely eliminated. Tomasz Noetzel, BI’s senior analyst, pointed out that AI’s impact would primarily result in workforce transformation, not total job loss. The role of AI in customer service is particularly noteworthy, as bots are expected to handle more of the client-facing tasks, reducing the need for human intervention. Jobs that demand higher-level cognitive skills may be less vulnerable, but the overall trend is clear: the banking workforce will need to adapt to new technological realities.FINANCIAL GAINS DESPITE JOB LOSSES Despite the potential loss of jobs, the rise of AI is expected to have a positive effect on banks’ earnings. According to BI’s report, AI could increase bank profits by 12% to 17% by 2027, contributing as much as $180 billion to the industry’s bottom line. Eight out of ten surveyed respondents believe that generative AI will boost productivity and revenue generation by at least 5% in the next three to five years. While this transformation brings efficiency, it also prompts significant concerns about the future of work in banking.THE FUTURE OF WORK: A NEW ERA The rise of AI may lead to fewer jobs in traditional roles, but as industry leaders like JPMorgan’s Jamie Dimon suggest, this shift will also improve the quality of life for workers, making their roles more efficient and less mundane. AI may eliminate certain positions, but it could also bring a future where work-life balance is vastly improved. As the banking sector adapts to this new technological wave, one thing is certain: the future of finance will be shaped by AI, with far-reaching consequences for both jobs and productivity.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 9, 2025Must Watch

Headline: TCS Q3 FY25 results: IT giant announces special dividend. Check detailsThe TCS Board of Directors declared a third interim dividend of Rs 10 per equity share and a special dividend for Q3 FY25.
Content: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), India’s largest IT services company, has announced its financial results for the third quarter of FY25, along with a special dividend for its shareholders. The company released the results following a board meeting held on Thursday, January 9, 2025. The TCS Board of Directors declared a third interim dividend of Rs 10 per equity share and a special dividend of Rs 66 per equity share. This special dividend comes as a reward to shareholders. "We would like to inform you that at the Board Meeting held today, the Directors have declared a third interim dividend of INR 10 and a special dividend of INR 66 per Equity Share of INR 1 each of the Company," said TCS in an exchange filing.  According to the official filing, the dividends will be paid on Monday, February 3, 2025, to shareholders whose names appear on the company’s register or in the records of the depositories as beneficial owners as of the record date, January 17, 2025.FINANCIAL RESULTS TCS reported a 12% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit for the December quarter, reaching Rs 12,380 crore, in line with market expectations. The company had posted a net profit of Rs 11,058 crore during the same period last year. TCS’s revenue for the quarter stood at Rs 63,973 crore, marking a 5.6% YoY increase (4.5% in constant currency). The operating margin was 24.5%, reflecting a YoY decline of 50 basis points but a sequential improvement of 40 basis points. The net margin for the quarter was 19.4%. K Krithivasan, CEO and MD, highlighted robust deal wins and growth across industries, adding that signs of revival in discretionary spending boost long-term confidence. CFO Samir Seksaria noted improved margins and strong cash flows, with net cash from operations at Rs 13,032 crore, amounting to 105.3% of net income. The company’s workforce strength stood at 607,354, with an IT services attrition rate of 13% on a last-twelve-month basis. Women accounted for 35.3% of the workforce, representing 152 nationalities.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 9, 2025

Headline: National Savings Certificate: Know the latest rate and tax benefitsNSCs are government-backed investments that provide attractive interest rates, tax benefits, and a five-year maturity, making them ideal for risk-averse investors.
Content: In an era of fluctuating investment options, the National Savings Certificate (NSC) continues to shine as a safe and tax-efficient avenue for wealth creation. Backed by the government, NSC offers stable returns and numerous benefits, making it a preferred choice for risk-averse investors.WHAT ARE NATIONAL SAVINGS CERTIFICATES? NSCs are fixed-income investment instruments introduced by the Government of India to encourage small savings among individuals. These certificates not only provide assured returns but also help investors save on taxes under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act. With a maturity period of five years, NSCs are a reliable option for those looking to build a secure financial future.INTEREST RATE FOR JANUARY-MARCH 2025 For the January-March 2025 quarter, the interest rate on NSCs remains at 7.7% per annum, compounded annually. The rate is unchanged from the previous quarter, as per the announcement by the Department of Economic Affairs on December 31, 2024. This steady rate ensures consistent and attractive returns for investors. Upon maturity, the investment grows significantly, providing both principal and interest.KEY FEATURES OF NSC INVESTMENTS Eligibility: NSCs can be purchased by individuals, joint account holders (up to three adults), and guardians on behalf of minors or persons of unsound mind. Minors above 10 years can open an account in their own name. Investment limits: The minimum deposit is Rs 1,000, with further investments in multiples of Rs 100. There is no upper limit, and investors can open multiple accounts under the scheme. Pledging and transfer: NSC accounts can be pledged as security to authorities such as banks, cooperative societies, and housing finance companies. Transfers are allowed under specific conditions, such as the death of the account holder or by court order.TAX BENEFITS NSC deposits qualify for a deduction under Section 80C, up to Rs 1.5 lakh per financial year. In comparison to tax-saving fixed deposits, which offer rates ranging from 6.5% to 7.75% depending on the bank, NSC’s 7.7% rate remains highly competitive, especially for those seeking stable returns.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 9, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: How India's wealth shifted to the pockets of top 1%About 11.4 per cent of India's total wealth was in the hands of the people in the bottom 50 per cent bracket in the year 1961, this nearly halved to 6.5 per cent in the year 2023, according to the World Inequality Database.
Content:
To raise the spending power of the middle class, the Centre in the 2023-24 Budget extended full rebate up to an income of Rs 7 lakh, raising it from Rs 5 lakh under the new tax regime. However, mere tax deductions have had little impact on income and wealth inequality in India, which has only broadened in the last six decades.  Income is the money one earns over a period of time, while wealth is the total value of assets minus debts. About 11.4 per cent of India’s total wealth was in the hands of people in the bottom 50 per cent bracket in the year 1961; this nearly halved to 6.5 per cent in the year 2023, according to the World Inequality Database.  Over the same duration, the wealth of people in the top 10 per cent rose from 44.9 to 64.6 per cent and the wealth of those in the top 0.1 per cent rose from a mere 3.2 per cent to a humongous 29 per cent. Most of the wealth lost was from the people in the middle 40 per cent group — falling from 43.7 to 29 per cent.
 


INCOME AND WEALTH INEQUALITY Gradual income inequality has translated into a more stark wealth inequality in the country. While 57.7 per cent of income is in the hands of the top 10 per cent of people, 65 per cent of wealth lies with them. In contrast, only 15 per cent of income and 6.4 per cent of the country's wealth are within the bottom 50 per cent of people. 
 


WHO IS EARNING WHAT? The annual income of an average Indian in 2022-23 was Rs 2.35 lakh. The bottom 50 per cent earned only Rs 71,163, the middle 40 per cent Rs 1.65 lakh, the top 10 per cent Rs 13.53 lakh, the top one per cent Rs 53 lakh, and the top 0.1 per cent Rs 2.25 crore. The top 0.01 per cent or nearly 92,234 people earned Rs 10.18 crore and the top 0.001 per cent earned Rs 48.52 crore. This means that the top 1 per cent of people have 75 times more income and 313 times more wealth than the bottom 50 per cent of people in India.
 


THE WAY AHEAD The World Inequality Lab suggests the skewed wealth distribution is a good reason to consider restructuring the tax code to account for both income and wealth. Moreover, it suggests that broad-based public investments in health, education and nutrition are needed to enable the average Indian, and not just the elites, to meaningfully benefit from the ongoing wave of globalisation. It adds that besides serving as a tool to fight inequality, a “super tax” of two per cent on the net wealth of the 167 wealthiest families in 2022-23 would yield 0.5 per cent of national income in revenues and create valuable fiscal space to facilitate such investments. Published By: Vivek Published On: Jan 9, 2025Tune InALSO READ |  Budget 2025: Does old tax regime still make sense or should it be scrapped?Must Watch

Headline: Quadrant Future Tek IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing dateQuadrant Future Tek IPO allotment: Investors who have bid for the IPO can check their allotment status online.
