Headline: L&T defends chairman SN Subrahmanyan's call for 90-hour work weeks amid backlashThe company said that achieving extraordinary results requires extraordinary effort, particularly in a time when India is striving for progress.
Content: Larsen & Toubro (L&T) has stepped forward to defend its chairman, SN Subrahmanyan, following widespread criticism of his comments advocating for employees to work on Sundays and 90 hours a week. The company said that achieving extraordinary results requires extraordinary effort, particularly in a time when India is striving for progress. “Nation-building is at the core of our mandate. For over eight decades, we have been shaping India’s infrastructure, industries, and technological capabilities. We believe this is India’s decade, a time demanding collective dedication and effort to drive progress and realise our shared vision of becoming a developed nation,” said an L&T spokesperson. “The chairman’s remarks reflect this larger ambition.” During a recent interaction with employees, Subrahmanyan addressed the company’s six-day work week and expressed his belief in a more demanding schedule. “I regret I am not able to make you work on Sundays. If I can make you work on Sundays, I will be more happy, because I work on Sundays,” he said. He went on to make a contentious remark, asking, “What do you do sitting at home? How long can you stare at your wife? Come on, get to the office and start working.” Subrahmanyan also recounted a conversation with a Chinese individual who suggested that China could outpace the United States because Chinese workers clocked 90 hours a week, compared to the 50 hours worked by Americans. Using this as an example, he told employees, “If you have got to be on top of the world, you have to work 90 hours a week. Get going, guys.” The remarks, shared in an undated video that surfaced on Reddit, sparked widespread criticism online. Many users found the comments inappropriate and questioned the work-life balance implications. Critics drew parallels between Subrahmanyan’s statements and earlier remarks made by Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy, who had suggested that young Indians should work 70 hours a week to contribute to the nation’s growth. Murthy’s comments also faced backlash, with many arguing that such work expectations were unrealistic and harmful. The statements have reignited the ongoing debate on work-life balance in corporate India.  Shares of L&T closed 1.71% lower on Thursday at Rs 3,535.00. The stock has fallen 4.53% in the past five days, 9.89% in the last month and 0.3% in the past year. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher as TCS leads IT rally with 5% jump in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 206.33 points to 77,826.54, while the NSE Nifty50 added 45.90 points to 23,572.40 as of 9:19 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened higher on Friday, fuelled by a surge in IT sector stocks with TCS leading from the front, gaining nearly 5% in early trade on the back of good Q3 FY25 results.  The S&P BSE Sensex gained 206.33 points to 77,826.54, while the NSE Nifty50 added 45.90 points to 23,572.40 as of 9:19 AM. Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that in the context of the looming uncertainty regarding President Trump’s likely actions, the market is unlikely to rally in the near-term. "There appears to be no respite to the sustained FII selling which touched Rs 7170 crores yesterday. This will continue to put pressure on the market. Since the results season has started the market will witness lots of stock-specific action in response to the results. Results of TCS indicate that the IT sector will continue to remain resilient," he added. Banking giants are expected to report strong results; however, the sector might not react positively due to ongoing selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs). On the other hand, pharmaceutical companies and specific automobile stocks, such as Eicher Motors, Mahindra & Mahindra, and Bajaj Auto, could emerge as strong performers even in a subdued market environment. IT stocks led the gains on Nifty50 with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) surging 3.92%, followed by Tech Mahindra which gained 2.19%. Wipro added to the tech sector's strong performance with a 1.80% increase, while Infosys rose by 1.32%. Mahindra & Mahindra also showed positive momentum with a 0.69% uptick. On the declining side, Shriram Finance faced the steepest fall of 2.90%, while IndusInd Bank dropped 2.06%. Adani Enterprises declined by 1.54%, followed by Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) which fell 1.44%. NTPC rounded out the major losers with a decline of 1.19%. In a broadly negative trading session, Nifty IT emerged as the lone bright spot, standing out with a gain of 2.06% while all other sectoral indices ended in the red.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex tumbles 500 points again. Why is the stock market down today?Sensex and Nifty tumbled in early trade amid rising volatility despite strong IT gains. What's pulling the markets down further?
Content: Benchmark stock market indices continued their weak run on Friday and are set to end the week on a negative note. With that said, here are three reasons why the stock market is falling today:Q3 EARNINGS WORRIES Even as TCS opened the Q3 earnings season on a positive note, the broader sentiment surrounding the third quarter results remains negative. For instance, Tata Elxsi shares fell over 7% today after reporting Q3 results as it missed street estimates. Several analysts have indicated that the Q3 results are unlikely to see any major improvement in comparison to the previous quarter and this is likely to dampen the mood on Dalal Street. Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, said, “Since the results season has started the market will witness lots of stock-specific action in response to the results.”ANXIETY OVER DONALD TRUMP’S ACTIONS Another major factor behind the nervousness among investors is growing anxiety over Donald Trump’s likely actions when he takes charge as US President. Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd, said, “Uncertainty around US Federal Reserve rate plans and President-elect Trump's policies continues to fuel market pessimism.” Vijayakumar also agreed and said, “In the context of the looming uncertainty regarding President Trump’s likely actions, the market is unlikely to rally in the near-term.”CONTINUED FII SELLING Last but not least, sustained selling by foreign institutional investors has kept the mood tense on Dalal Street. “There appears to be no respite to the sustained FII selling which touched Rs 7170 crores yesterday. Headline: Explained: Why Adani Wilmar share price fell over 9% today Adani Wilmar share price: The stock has been under pressure recently, falling nearly 10% over the past five trading sessions and losing 12.28% over the last six months.
Content: The share price of Adani Wilmar Ltd dropped sharply in early trade on Friday, falling over 9%. At the time of writing, the stock was trading at Rs 292.90, reflecting a 9.45% decline. The fall in shares came as the company’s two-day offer for sale (OFS) by promoter Adani Commodities LLP began. The stock has been under pressure recently, falling nearly 10% over the past five trading sessions and losing 12.28% over the last six months. The OFS floor price was set at Rs 275, a 15.11% discount to Thursday’s closing price of Rs 323.95 on the BSE. This steep discount weighed heavily on the stock, causing it to fall 9% during early trading. Over the past year, the stock has declined by 18.69%, and it has lost 47% of its value in the last two years. Adani Commodities LLP is offering up to 17,54,56,612 shares, which accounts for 13.50% of the total issued and paid-up equity share capital of Adani Wilmar. The OFS is open to non-retail investors today, while retail investors will have the opportunity to participate on Monday, January 13. Non-retail investors can also choose to carry forward their unallotted bids to Monday for allocation from the unsubscribed portion of the retail category. Additionally, Adani Commodities LLP has announced the option to sell up to 8,44,79,110 more shares, which represents 6.50% of the company’s equity share capital. If the oversubscription option is fully exercised, the total number of shares offered, including the base size and additional shares, will represent 20% of Adani Wilmar’s equity share capital. This amounts to 25,99,35,722 shares in total. Adani Enterprises, the parent company, plans to eventually sell its entire 44% stake in Adani Wilmar for an estimated $2.2 billion. Analysts believe this strategic move is aimed at improving liquidity within Adani Enterprises. Ventura Securities recently highlighted the potential benefits of this transaction. It suggested that the proceeds could be leveraged to secure additional debt, creating a corpus of Rs 50,000–52,000 crore. This would enable the group to strengthen its overall financial position and capital management. Adani Wilmar informed stock exchanges that the OFS is partly being undertaken to comply with regulatory requirements. As per Rule 19(2)(b) and Rule 19A of the Securities Contracts (Regulation) Rules, 1957, and Regulation 38 of Sebi's Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements, the company needs to meet the minimum public shareholding norms.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 10, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: What is joint taxation for married couples?The ICAI's Budget 2025 proposal for joint taxation of married couples aims to ease financial stress, boost compliance, and modernise India's tax system with higher exemptions and flexible slabs.
Content: Union Budget 2025 could mark a groundbreaking shift in taxation with the potential introduction of a joint taxation system for married couples. The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has proposed allowing couples to file income tax returns (ITRs) jointly under the New Tax Regime, providing relief to families with sole breadwinners and incentivising better tax compliance. This system, already popular in developed nations like the United States and the United Kingdom, could alleviate financial stress and simplify tax planning for Indian families.advertisementKEY FEATURES AND PROPOSED TAX SLABS  The ICAI's recommendations include a new set of tax slabs for joint filing, with no tax on income up to Rs 6 lakh, 5% for Rs 6–14 lakh, 10% for Rs 14–20 lakh, 15% for Rs 20–24 lakh, 20% for Rs 24–30 lakh, and 30% for income above Rs 30 lakh. Under this scheme, the basic exemption limit doubles to Rs 6 lakh for couples, compared to Rs 3 lakh for individual taxpayers under the current New Tax Regime. Salaried couples will benefit from individual standard deductions, while the surcharge threshold is proposed to increase from Rs 50 lakh to Rs 1 crore, with progressive surcharge rates applied to higher income brackets.HOW JOINT TAXATION BENEFITS FAMILIES  For households with a single earning member, the proposed joint taxation system addresses financial challenges by offering higher exemption limits and lower effective tax rates. This initiative aligns with global trends, recognising shared household responsibilities and reducing tax liability for middle-income families. Additionally, it could curb tax evasion practices such as income splitting by shifting tax liabilities to a unified framework. Dr. Suresh Surana, while speaking to Business Today, mentioned that ICAI's proposal seeks to ease financial pressures on families, particularly single-earner households. Taxpayers can opt for the default regime under Section 115BAC with a Rs 2.5 lakh exemption limit or Rs 3 lakh under the new regime, while dual-income couples can benefit individually.A STEP TOWARD MODERNISED TAXATION  The joint taxation proposal, if implemented, could transform India's tax landscape, aligning it with progressive global practices. By supporting families through flexible tax structures, this system could ease financial burdens, enhance compliance, and foster fairness in personal tax filings. As Budget 2025 nears, all eyes are on the government to see if this visionary reform becomes a reality, potentially changing the way Indian families plan their finances forever.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 10, 2025

Headline: Tata Elxsi share price down 8%. Why did it hit 52-week low after Q3 results?Tata Elxsi stock price: At 10:40 a.m., Tata Elxsi's share price was down 7% at Rs 5992.95. In early trade, the stock hit a 52-week low of Rs 5,924.
Content: Shares of Tata Elxsi fell sharply on Friday, plunging over 8% in intraday trade to hit a 52-week low after the company reported a subdued performance for the December quarter. At 10:40 am, Tata Elxsi share price was down 7% at Rs 5992.95. The stock had hit a 52-week low of Rs 5,924 in early trade.WEAK Q3 RESULTS Analysts attributed the decline to weaker-than-expected results across key business verticals and margin pressures stemming from currency fluctuations and salary hikes. The company’s transportation vertical witnessed modest growth, driven by large deal wins in Asia and Japan. However, the automotive segment in Europe and the US faced significant challenges, impacting the overall performance. Additionally, adverse currency movements and salary hikes weighed on the margins. Kotak Institutional Equities commented on the company’s weak quarterly performance, stating, “Tata Elxsi’s Q3 performance was weak, missing moderate expectations. Weakness was across verticals with a modest uptick in the healthcare vertical, while the transportation and media verticals were muted. EBIT margin declined 160 bps QoQ to 23.5%, impacted by a wage hike and currency headwinds.” The brokerage firm also noted that the near-term outlook remains subdued, primarily due to challenges in the automotive vertical, despite some positive signs in other segments.ANALYSTS CAUTIOUS Kotak revised its FY2025-27 EPS estimates downward by 7-11% and maintained a ‘Sell’ rating, lowering the fair value target to Rs 5,400 from Rs 5,600. Arihant Capital Markets highlighted the company’s growth strategies and said, "Tata Elxsi aims to drive growth in India, Japan, and emerging markets while addressing challenges in Europe and anticipating recovery in the US. The company remains focused on operational efficiency, deal momentum in Media and Healthcare, and expanding in high-growth areas like connected vehicles and digital engineering.” While Tata Elxsi’s focus on emerging markets and operational efficiency offers hope, analysts remain cautious about the near-term demand outlook, especially in the automotive sector. Investors should closely monitor the company’s progress in overcoming these challenges and driving growth in key markets. Headline: TCS, Infosys, HCLTech rise up to 4%. Why IT stocks are rising today?All the sectoral indices were in red but the IT sectoral index stood tall amid the bearish sentiment in the market and was the reason behind Sensex and Nifty opening higher today.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices settled lower after opening higher on Friday, reflecting high volatility in the market, with Sensex and Nifty falling nearly 0.5%. The S&P BSE Sensex fell 284.92 points to 77,335.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 106.30 points to 23,420.20 as of 10:25 AM.  All the sectoral indices were in red but the IT sectoral index stood tall amid the bearish sentiment in the market and was the reason behind Sensex and Nifty opening higher today.  The early upward market momentum was driven by IT stocks led by TCS which surged close to 5% on the back of strong Q3 results for FY25 which the firm announced after market hours on Thursday. Strong Q3 results from TCS buoyed the IT sector stocks, helping it remain in green when all the sectoral indices struggled in early trade.  India’s largest IT services firm, TCS, reported a 12% year-on-year rise in consolidated net profit for the December quarter, reaching Rs 12,380 crore, in line with market expectations. TCS’s revenue for the quarter stood at Rs 63,973 crore, marking a 5.6% YoY increase (4.5% in constant currency).   Nifty IT was up 2.16% as of 10:30 AM while other indices fell. Nifty Media took the biggest brunt falling close to 3%.  "Since the results season has started the market will witness lots of stock-specific action in response to the results. Results of TCS indicate that the IT sector will continue to remain resilient," said Dr V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services.  In a strong showing by the IT sector, Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) led the pack with a substantial gain of 4.40%, followed by Larsen & Toubro Infotech (LTI Mindtree) which rose 3.50%. Tech Mahindra posted a healthy increase of 2.34%, while Wipro advanced by 1.97%. Persistent Systems gained 1.58%, and Mphasis climbed 1.31%. Infosys showed positive momentum with a 1.13% increase, while HCL Technologies rounded out the gains with a 0.77% rise. The overall Nifty IT index reflected this robust performance, moving up by 2.08%. Most of the other broader market indices were also trading in negative territory as volatility continued to rise during the session.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 10, 2025

Headline: L&T chairman earned 534.57 times median salary of peers in FY24. Check detailsLarsen & Toubro (L&T) Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's remarks on the 90-hour workweek have been a topic of debate. Amid all this, his salary for FY24 has attracted eyeballs, which is 534.57 times the median salary of peers.
Content:
Larsen & Toubro (L&T) Chairman SN Subrahmanyan has been at the centre of a heated debate after his comments suggesting a 90-hour work week sparked controversy. Amid this uproar, his salary details for the fiscal year 2023-24 have drawn huge attention. Subrahmanyan earned Rs 51.05 crore during the period, a figure that is 534.57 times the median salary of L&T employees, which stands at Rs 9.55 lakh.advertisementBreakdown of Subrahmanyan's SalaryAccording to L&T’s Integrated Annual Report for 2023-24, the breakdown of Subrahmanyan’s Rs 51 crore salary is as follows:
Salary: Rs 3.60 crore
Perquisites: Rs 1.67 crore
Retirement Benefits: Rs 10.50 crore
Commission: Rs 35.28 crore
 According to L&T’s Integrated Annual Report for 2023-24, the breakdown of Subrahmanyan’s Rs 51 crore salary is as follows:
Salary: Rs 3.60 crore
Perquisites: Rs 1.67 crore
Retirement Benefits: Rs 10.50 crore
Commission: Rs 35.28 crore
 His total remuneration of Rs 51.05 crore marks an increase of 43.11% from the previous year. The debate began when Subrahmanyan addressed employees during a recent town hall, defending the company’s six-day work week and advocating for an even more demanding schedule. “I regret I am not able to make you work on Sundays. If I can make you work on Sundays, I will be more happy, because I work on Sundays,” Subrahmanyan remarked in an undated video that surfaced on social media. He also made a contentious comment, saying, “What do you do sitting at home? How long can you stare at your wife? Come on, get to the office and start working.” Subrahmanyan further recounted a conversation with a Chinese individual, who told him that Chinese workers put in 90 hours a week compared to the 50 hours clocked by Americans. Using this as an example, he said to employees, “If you have got to be on top of the world, you have to work 90 hours a week. Get going, guys.” The remarks were met with widespread criticism, with social media users and notable personalities calling out the chairman for his comments. Actress Deepika Padukone and billionaire Harsh Goenka were among those who voiced disapproval. Some users highlighted the disparity between Subrahmanyan’s earnings and the average employee's salary, while others drew parallels to Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy, who had earlier suggested a 70-hour work week for young Indians. One social media user commented, “And here I'm thinking L&T is a good company; seems like everyone's following Narayana Murthy's footsteps.” Another user remarked, “So unfortunate, we have such business leaders. I think we must call them ‘leaders in baby diapers.’” Some users noted that such remarks would never be directed at employees working in countries outside India. In response to the backlash, an L&T spokesperson issued a statement defending Subrahmanyan’s comments. “At L&T, nation-building is at the core of our mandate. The Chairman’s remarks reflect this larger ambition, emphasising that extraordinary outcomes require extraordinary effort,” the spokesperson said.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Must Watch

Headline: How to link and use your credit card for UPI transactions. A simple guideUPI integration with credit cards simplifies payments offering instant, secure, and contactless transactions.
Content: In December 2024, Unified Payments Interface (UPI) transactions reached an all-time high of 16.73 billion, a remarkable 8% increase from the previous month. With digital payments becoming more popular, the integration of credit cards with UPI is set to revolutionise the way we make payments. This convenient, hassle-free option allows users to make payments with their credit card through UPI-enabled apps, providing even greater ease for managing finances.advertisementHOW TO LINK YOUR CREDIT CARD WITH UPITo begin using your credit card for UPI payments, the first step is to download a UPI-enabled app such as BHIM or PhonePe. Once installed, navigate to the 'add payment method' section and select 'credit card' to link your card. To begin using your credit card for UPI payments, the first step is to download a UPI-enabled app such as BHIM or PhonePe. Once installed, navigate to the 'add payment method' section and select 'credit card' to link your card. You'll need to enter your card number, CVV, and expiration date. A one-time password (OTP) will be sent to your registered phone number for verification. After linking, you'll be prompted to create a UPI ID, which allows you to send and receive money via UPI. This ID can be used for transactions such as paying bills or transferring funds, making it a flexible payment option.HOW TO MAKE CREDIT CARD PAYMENTS USING UPI Once your credit card is linked to your UPI account, making payments is simple. You can scan a QR code or select options such as 'pay phone number' or 'pay contacts'. After entering the amount, select your credit card as the payment method, enter your PIN, and complete the transaction. Currently, only RuPay credit cards can be linked to UPI, with 22 banks offering this feature, including Punjab National Bank, Union Bank of India, Indian Bank, HDFC Bank, Canara Bank, Axis Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Yes Bank, SBI Cards, ICICI Bank, IDFC Bank and IndusInd Bank. Popular UPI apps like BHIM, Paytm, and Google Pay support linking RuPay cards, making it widely accessible.ADVANTAGES OF USING UPI FOR CREDIT CARD PAYMENTS Using UPI for credit card payments offers several advantages, such as immediate transfers and the convenience of contactless payments. Additionally, there are no additional fees for using this method, and users can make payments without having to manually enter their credit card details each time. However, it’s essential to use your credit card judiciously and avoid exceeding your credit limit. Secure your transactions by using strong PINs and downloading UPI apps only from trusted sources to safeguard your personal information. With the ease and security of UPI-linked credit card payments, managing your finances has never been more seamless—just remember to use this powerful tool wisely and stay in control of your spending.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty in volatile territory: What should stock market investors do? Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty rebounded on IT gains, but volatility persists amid FII outflows and global uncertainty. Here's what's driving the market and how investors should tackle it.
Content:
Benchmark market indices struggled to find direction amid extreme volatility, with strong gains in information technology (IT) stocks providing some relief. The S&P BSE Sensex rose 227.35 points to 77,847.56 by 11:39 am, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 51.20 points to 23,577.70. Despite the rebound, sharp swings between gains and losses continued to dominate trading, leaving investors on edge. Broader market indices remained firmly in negative territory, highlighting persistent uncertainty on Dalal Street. Heavyweight IT stocks, including TCS, Infosys, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra, surged up to 5%, lending support to the indices. However, market experts warned that deeper concerns, such as global uncertainty and sustained FII outflows, are still weighing heavily on investor sentiment. In this article, we will discuss the key factors driving market volatility and explore strategies investors can use to navigate these turbulent times.REASONS BEHIND MARKET VOLATILITY One of the primary reasons for today’s market swings is investor anxiety over the potential policy actions of US President-elect Donald Trump. Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research) at Mehta Equities Ltd, explained, “Uncertainty around US Federal Reserve rate plans and President-elect Trump’s policies continues to fuel market pessimism.” Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, echoed this sentiment, adding, “In the context of the looming uncertainty regarding President Trump’s likely actions, the market is unlikely to rally in the near-term.” Additionally, sustained selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs) has kept the market under pressure. FIIs pulled out Rs 7,170 crore yesterday, continuing a recent trend of large outflows. Anticipation of weaker Q3 corporate earnings has also contributed to heightened volatility. Vijayakumar pointed out that while IT companies like TCS delivered strong results, broader earnings expectations remain subdued, particularly in sectors like automotive and consumer goods.WHAT SHOULD INVESTORS DO?  Analysts advise investors to remain cautious and focus on stock-specific opportunities rather than broad market movements. “TCS’s results indicate that the IT sector will remain resilient,” said Vijayakumar. “Banking majors are likely to report good results, but the sector’s performance may be muted due to continued FII selling.” For those looking to invest during this volatile phase, Vijayakumar recommended focusing on sectors with strong growth potential. “Pharma and select auto stocks like Eicher Motors, Mahindra & Mahindra (M&M), and Bajaj Auto are potential outperformers in a weak market,” he added. Simply put, while the market’s rebound offers some relief, investors should remain vigilant and consider sector-specific opportunities as uncertainty continues to dominate global and domestic markets.(Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. Headline: GST filing delayed as portal glitches persist. Deadline extension expectedGST return filing faces delays due to GSTN portal glitches, with a potential deadline extension expected to ease compliance challenges.
Content:
Businesses across India face a potential delay in filing their GSTR-1 returns as the Goods and Services Tax Network (GSTN) portal encounters technical difficulties. With the January 11, 2025, deadline for December 2024 returns fast approaching, taxpayers and professionals are calling for urgent action. On 10 January, GSTN wrote on X, “GST portal is currently experiencing technical issues and is under maintenance. We expect the portal to be operational by 12:00 noon. CBIC is being sent an incident report to consider an extension of the filing date. Thank you for your understanding and patience!”

advertisementTECHNICAL ISSUES DISRUPT FILING PROCESSThe GSTN portal, essential for filing GST returns, has been under maintenance due to technical glitches. While the system is expected to be operational by noon on January 10, 2025, the disruption has hindered critical processes such as filing GSTR-1 returns, accessing older data, and replying to notices. The GSTN portal, essential for filing GST returns, has been under maintenance due to technical glitches. While the system is expected to be operational by noon on January 10, 2025, the disruption has hindered critical processes such as filing GSTR-1 returns, accessing older data, and replying to notices. Many tax experts have stressed the importance of having backup plans to avoid such disruptions from impacting the tax filing process.CALL FOR DEADLINE EXTENSION The Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) has yet to release a formal notification regarding an extension of the GSTR-1 filing deadline. However, GSTN has submitted an incident report to CBIC, requesting a possible extension. Industry experts suggest extending the deadline to January 13, 2025, to accommodate affected taxpayers, especially as January 11 falls on a Saturday, a non-working day for many multinational companies.IMPACT ON INPUT TAX CREDIT  Delays in filing GSTR-1 can have a cascading effect on businesses. GSTR-1 data is crucial for generating GSTR-2B, which enables buyers to claim Input Tax Credit (ITC). A delay in GSTR-1 filing postpones GSTR-2B generation, potentially depriving buyers of timely ITC claims. This could lead to cash flow disruptions for companies with significant input purchases, as they may need to pay GST liabilities in cash until ITC is credited in subsequent periods. As businesses await a formal announcement from CBIC, the hope is for swift resolution and a more resilient system to ensure seamless tax compliance. For now, taxpayers and professionals alike remain on edge, navigating these unforeseen challenges.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Blinkit launches Bistro app for 10-minute food deliveryBlinkit's Bistro delivers canteen-style food in 10 minutes, rivalling Swiggy's Snacc and Zepto Cafe.
Content:
In a bid to redefine fast food delivery, Blinkit has launched its new venture, Bistro, aimed at offering high-quality, canteen-style food delivered to your doorstep in just 10 minutes. On 10 January, Blinkit CEO Albinder Dhandsa wrote on X, “Introducing Bistro - Blinkit’s new 10-minute food offering. Bistro is a new app, outside of Blinkit and Zomato. This service is currently live across a few locations in Gurugram to help us find product market fit.”
 


 The new service, which operates through a dedicated app outside Blinkit and Zomato, is currently live in select locations across Gurugram, marking the brand’s first steps toward finding a sustainable product-market fit.A NEW APPROACH TO FAST FOOD Unlike conventional food delivery services, Bistro stands out by prioritising freshness and quality, says Albinder Dhandsa. The app delivers meals made without preservatives, food processors, or microwaves, he mentioned. The company is investing heavily in research, infrastructure, and R&D to create dishes within five minutes or less, stated the CEO. RISING COMPETITION IN QUICK FOOD DELIVERY Bistro is entering an increasingly competitive market, with several other players attempting to capture the quick-food delivery segment. Swiggy, for instance, has introduced Snacc, a 15-minute delivery service offering a wide variety of snacks, beverages, and light meals. Similarly, Zepto Cafe, part of the grocery delivery service Zepto, also focusses on delivering food quickly, aiming to provide a diverse selection of pre-made meals and snacks in record time. These developments highlight a shift towards more efficient, ultra-fast food delivery services, reflecting the growing demand for convenience and quality.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Paytm sees strong institutional growth: Mutual fund stake surges by 3.3%, total holdings up 4%Paytm's progress toward achieving EBITDA before ESOP breakeven by Q4 FY2025 further reinforces its strong fundamentals and appeal to institutional investors.
Content: Paytm’s Q3 FY2025 shareholding report highlights a significant 4% rise in institutional ownership, now totaling 68%. This growth demonstrates the increasing confidence of both domestic and global investors in the company’s financial trajectory and innovative business model in India’s thriving fintech landscape. Domestic mutual funds emerged as key contributors to this rise, boosting their stake by 3.3% to 11.2%. Among the notable changes, Motilal Oswal Mutual Fund increased its holding to 2.1%, showcasing strong faith in Paytm’s growth prospects. Nippon Mutual Fund maintained its consistent position with a 2% stake, while Mirae Asset, despite a slight reduction, retained a substantial 4.2%, reflecting continued trust in the company’s fundamentals. Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) also contributed to this upward trend, with their shareholding increasing by 0.7%. FPI holdings rose from 115 million to 119 million shares, while the number of FPI entities investing in Paytm grew by 20 to reach 237. This uptick underscores the growing global interest in Paytm’s scalable and innovative approach to financial services. Bernstein’s report India Payments: From Disruption to Monetization – Can Payments Be Profitable? positions Paytm as a leader in India’s transition from a disruptive payments ecosystem to one focused on monetisation. The report credits Paytm’s ability to monetise its ecosystem through strategies like device-driven revenues, credit-based payment innovations, and increasing operating leverage as factors that set it apart in the industry. With UPI adoption continuing to grow, alongside innovations such as UPI Lite and credit-linked UPI transactions, Paytm is expected to sustain its profitability and competitive edge in the rapidly evolving fintech market. Paytm’s progress toward achieving EBITDA before ESOP breakeven by Q4 FY2025 further reinforces its strong fundamentals and appeal to institutional investors. The rising shareholding from both domestic mutual funds and FPIs reflects increasing trust in Paytm’s ability to innovate and adapt while delivering long-term value in India’s expanding digital economy.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Looking back at tax relief measures for senior citizens in 2024Senior citizens seek tax relief and reforms in Budget 2025 to tackle inflation, income challenges and enhance their qulity of life.
Content: As Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman prepares to present her eighth Union Budget on February 1, 2025, senior citizens are hopeful for meaningful tax reforms. With inflation and the rising cost of living eroding their fixed incomes, this group anticipates measures to ease financial pressures and enhance their quality of life.CHALLENGES FACED BY SENIOR CITIZENS Senior citizens often rely on fixed-income investments or rental income to sustain themselves. However, these sources fall short of keeping pace with inflation, leading to financial struggles. Restricted incomes necessitate targeted tax relief and financial support to help this vulnerable group manage their expenses effectively.NOTABLE REFORMS IN BUDGET 2024 Last year’s budget introduced several changes tailored to senior citizens. The standard deduction for family pensioners increased from Rs 15,000 to Rs 25,000, providing much-needed relief. Salaried employees and pensioners also benefited from an increased deduction limit of Rs 75,000 under the new tax regime. Senior citizens continue to enjoy higher exemption limits in both the old and new tax regimes. For instance, the new regime exempts income up to Rs 3 lakh, compared to Rs 2.5 lakh for regular taxpayers under the old regime.ITR FILING MADE SIMPLER Section 194P, introduced in Budget 2024, simplified the tax filing process for senior citizens aged 75 and above. Those meeting specific conditions—such as receiving income solely from pensions and interest—are exempt from filing income tax returns. Specified banks handle tax deductions, ensuring compliance without the need for additional filings.TAXATION OF PENSION INCOME Pension taxation varies based on its nature. While uncommuted pensions are fully taxable as salary, commuted pensions enjoy exemptions. For government employees, the commuted pension is entirely tax-free. Private-sector retirees benefit from partial exemptions depending on gratuity receipts.WHAT TO EXPECT FROM BUDGET 2025? With inflationary pressures mounting, senior citizens hope the upcoming budget will introduce broader exemptions and enhanced benefits. Measures to reduce tax liabilities and increase deductions could significantly alleviate financial strain. As Budget 2025 approaches, the hope is clear: a financial framework that not only addresses immediate challenges but also ensures long-term security for India’s senior citizens. The promise of ageing with dignity and stability is one that cannot be overlooked.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 10, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why IRCTC share price jumped up to 5% todayIRCTC share price: The stock rose nearly 5% to hit a day's high of Rs 800.65 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), compared to the previous close of Rs 763.50.
Content: Shares of Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation Ltd (IRCTC) surged nearly 5% on Friday after global brokerage firm Macquarie initiated coverage on the stock with a bullish 'Buy' rating and a target price of Rs 900. The stock rose nearly 5% to hit a day’s high of Rs 800.65 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), compared to the previous close of Rs 763.50. At around 2:51 pm, shares of the company were up 2.53% to Rs 782.80 on the BSE. However, despite today’s gain, the stock has fallen nearly 17% in the past year. Macquarie’s optimism stems from India's railway modernisation drive and the faster rollout of premium trains. The brokerage anticipates a potential twofold return for the stock, citing IRCTC’s monopoly in e-ticketing and catering services for Indian Railways. It also highlighted the company’s robust free cash flow margin of 30% and over 30% return on equity. In the September 2024 quarter, IRCTC reported a 4% year-on-year increase in net profit to Rs 308 crore, while consolidated revenue from operations rose 7% to Rs 1,064 crore.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 10, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Don't expect these tax changesBudget 2025 is likely to prioritise fiscal discipline, minor tax tweaks, and cautious consumption boosts over bold reforms.
Content: As Budget 2025 draws near, economic experts are weighing in on what this year's financial blueprint might deliver. While hopes run high for transformative announcements, many believe this budget may tread a cautious and familiar path.NO MAJOR CHANGES IN THE OLD TAX REGIME Taxpayers hoping for substantial alterations in the old tax regime may need to temper their expectations. While the government has consistently pushed for tax rationalisation, significant modifications have already been introduced in previous budgets, particularly in capital gains tax. This year, only minor adjustments are anticipated, leaving the old tax slabs largely untouched. The focus, instead, might lean towards encouraging taxpayers to migrate to the new tax regime.STANDARD DEDUCTION LIKELY TO REMAIN SAME  One of the most discussed aspects of the new tax regime is the standard deduction of Rs 75,000. Despite its popularity amongst taxpayers, there’s little indication that this amount will see an increase in Budget 2025. The government’s approach appears to balance providing relief to taxpayers while maintaining its fiscal prudence. As a result, any significant hike in this deduction seems unlikely.NO MAJOR CHANGES IN TAX STRUCTURE Tax rationalisation has been a recurring theme in recent budgets, with notable updates to capital gains tax in the previous year. This time, however, significant tax reforms or overhauls seem unlikely. Instead, taxpayers can anticipate minor adjustments aimed at fine-tuning existing policies rather than introducing sweeping changes. This aligns with the government's focus on maintaining stability while gradually optimising revenue streams.FOCUS ON FISCAL DISCIPLINE OVER BIG BANG ANNOUNCEMENTS The government is likely to prioritise fiscal consolidation, continuing its commitment to maintaining a disciplined approach to public finances. Alekh Yadav, Head of Investment Products at Sanctum Wealth, anticipates a largely conservative approach. He said, “We anticipate this budget will largely mirror previous ones, with few significant changes expected. The government is likely to maintain its focus on fiscal consolidation, as seen in prior budgets. While capital expenditure will remain a priority, we foresee limited potential for substantial growth in this area.” He added, “The government has also emphasised tax rationalisation, with notable changes to capital gains tax last year. We expect only minor adjustments this time around, rather than any major shifts. Additionally, there may be measures aimed at boosting consumption.”CONSUMPTION BOOSTS WITH CAUTION Although measures to spur consumption could make their way into the budget, these are expected to be incremental rather than transformative. The focus will likely be on targeted incentives and sector-specific support rather than widespread stimulus packages. Sheetal Malpani, CIO & Head of Equity, Tamohara Investment Managers, mentioned, “Given the cyclical slowdown in the economy and possible uncertainty on US policies under the Trump presidency, the budget takes more importance. On one hand, we anticipate fiscal measures to push growth, but on the other hand, given the slowdown in GDP growth and rupee depreciation, the fiscal deficit may overshoot, so a fine balance needs to be made." As the countdown to February begins, it’s clear that Budget 2025 is shaping up to be steady rather than sensational. By prioritising fiscal discipline and measured reforms, the government aims to strike a balance between stability and progress. While bold announcements may be off the table, the budget’s focus on gradual, strategic initiatives could still pave the way for long-term economic resilience. In other words, as Budget 2025 unfolds, it may prove to be a steady yet uneventful affair, prioritising fiscal stability over bold reforms.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Rupee hits all-time low, nears 86 mark against US dollarRupee hits all-time: Closing at 85.9650, the rupee marked its tenth consecutive weekly loss, slipping 0.2% this week amid a strong dollar and persistent capital outflows.
Content: The rupee tumbled to a historic low of 85.97 against the US dollar on Friday, surpassing its previous record of 85.9325 reached just a day earlier. Closing at 85.9650, the rupee marked its tenth consecutive weekly loss, slipping 0.2% this week amid a strong dollar and persistent capital outflows. The rupee has been under pressure for weeks due to a surging dollar index, which remained above the 109 mark on Friday, and investor concerns over U.S. labour market data. Traders are bracing for the psychologically significant breach of the 86 level, with one foreign bank trader suggesting it could happen “sooner rather than later.”WILL RUPEE'S WEAK RUN CONTINUE? The dollar's strength is largely attributed to expectations of slower rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve, reported news agency Reuters. ING Bank noted that strong jobs data could push markets to delay pricing in rate cuts, further strengthening the greenback. The US non-farm payrolls data, released later on Friday, is expected to provide crucial cues for the Fed’s next moves, keeping global markets on edge. The Reuters report also added that The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) stepped in to curb excessive volatility, with state-run banks reportedly selling dollars on behalf of the central bank. These routine interventions have helped moderate the rupee’s decline but have not been enough to prevent its steady slide. In addition to the stronger dollar, foreign investors have withdrawn over $3 billion from Indian stocks and bonds this month, contributing to the rupee's depreciation. The sell-off has been driven by concerns over the new US President’s policies, which have boosted U.S. bond yields and increased the appeal of dollar-denominated assets. The rupee's volatility has also climbed in recent weeks, coinciding with the change of leadership at the RBI. With mounting external and domestic challenges, analysts remain cautious about the rupee’s near-term trajectory.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty close lower amid earnings concerns; TCS gains 6% The S&P BSE Sensex lost 241.30 points to end at 77,378.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 95 points to end at 23,431.50.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices closed lower for the third straight session, marking weekly losses due to concerns over corporate earnings. However, IT stocks rose after TCS hinted at a potential recovery in demand. The S&P BSE Sensex lost 241.30 points to end at 77,378.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 95 points to end at 23,431.50.  Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd said that markets continued its downward trajectory as rupee scaling new lows due to the strengthening dollar, which has further dampened investors’ sentiment. "Amid concerns of subdued economic growth and expectations of a slowdown in the quarterly earnings, investors cut their bet on banking and mid & small cap stocks. With expensive valuations of Indian markets at large still a concern, investors would mostly resort to stock specific activities," he added.  The decline was broad-based, with all sectoral indices in red except IT stocks, which continued to rise following top IT firm TCS meeting its quarterly profit estimates. Midcap and smallcap indices were also stressed.  "Investor sentiment was impacted by global cues, including concerns over U.S. economic data and continued selling by foreign institutional investors. Despite a brief recovery during the day, the overall market breadth remained weak, with significantly more stocks declining than advancing," said Vaibhav Vidwani, Research Analyst, Bonanza.  In today's trading session, technology stocks showed remarkable strength with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) leading the gains, surging 5.60%, followed by Tech Mahindra which jumped 3.59%. HCL Technologies maintained the positive momentum with a 3.22% rise, while Infosys advanced 2.53%, and Wipro gained 2.51%. On the declining side, Shriram Finance faced the steepest fall, dropping 5.30%, while IndusInd Bank declined 4.29%. Adani Enterprises slipped 3.95%, followed by NTPC which fell 3.79%. Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) rounded out the major losers with a decline of 3.72%. "The market remains under strain, with even minor pullbacks attracting selling pressure. In the absence of any clear signs of a trend reversal, particularly in the banking index, traders are advised to use rebounds as shorting opportunities. Caution should remain a priority, with a focus on robust risk management. Additionally, as the earnings season kicks off, erratic market swings are likely to intensify. Adopting a hedged approach and maintaining disciplined position sizing is recommended for navigating the current conditions," said jit Mishra – SVP, Research, Religare Broking Ltd. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Supreme Court gives big relief for online gaming sector. Details hereThe Supreme Court has stayed Rs 1.12 lakh crore GST notices against online gaming firms, with a final hearing scheduled for March 18, 2025.
Content: In a significant turn of events, the Supreme Court has stayed show-cause notices for goods and services tax (GST) worth a staggering Rs 1.12 lakh crore issued to online gaming companies. The decision provides temporary relief to the gaming sector while safeguarding the interests of the revenue department. The next hearing on the matter is scheduled for March 18, 2025.advertisementRELIEF FOR GAMING SECTOR AND REVENUE DEPARTMENTThe stay has been welcomed by both online gaming companies and the revenue department, albeit for different reasons. For gaming platforms, the ruling shields them from immediate coercive actions, allowing a fair hearing to contest the hefty tax demands. The stay has been welcomed by both online gaming companies and the revenue department, albeit for different reasons. For gaming platforms, the ruling shields them from immediate coercive actions, allowing a fair hearing to contest the hefty tax demands. Meanwhile, the revenue department gains assurance that the notices will not become time-barred during the legal process. This case hinges on the interpretation of GST applicability to the online gaming industry. The government asserts that a 28% GST should be levied on the total contest entry amount, including the prize pool. However, gaming companies argue that the tax should only apply to platform fees or commissions, highlighting that many games are skill-based rather than chance-based.INDUSTRY AWAITS LEGAL CLARITY Abhishek A. Rastogi, founder of Rastogi Chambers and legal representative for gaming companies in the Supreme Court, highlighted the case's potential to reshape taxation in India's online gaming industry. He noted that the Supreme Court has ordered the consolidation of cases involving multiple gaming companies, with the next hearing scheduled for March 18, 2025. This timeline, he stated, allows stakeholders to present their arguments and enables the judiciary to address the key issues in this significant taxation dispute. The GST Council’s amendment effective October 1, 2023, has been a point of contention, with gaming companies asserting that retrospective application of the law is unjustified. Saurabh Agarwal, Tax Partner at EY, highlighted the importance of due process and transparency, noting that the March hearing will play a pivotal role in shaping a fair taxation framework for the burgeoning online gaming sector. As the online gaming sector awaits the Supreme Court’s final decision, this legal battle underscores the complexities of regulating a rapidly evolving industry. The March 2025 hearing promises to set a precedent that could redefine taxation norms for years to come, ensuring clarity for both businesses and policymakers.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Industry leaders call for up to 90-hour workweek. Are they willing to pay more? L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan made waves by suggesting employees should work on Sundays. Last year, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy proposed that millennials work 70-hour weeks to improve India's productivity.
Content: Ninety-hour workweeks, no Sundays and bosses continuing to push for more hours - sounds like a nightmare? Well, some top industry leaders believe it's the key to boosting productivity, and they’re not holding back in saying so. The latest entrant to that list is L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan. He fired a fresh controversy, saying that employees should work on Sundays too. "What do you do sitting at home? How long can you stare at your wife?” he asked, jokingly urging people to “get to the office.” The offhand comment turned into a full-blown debate on whether the 9-to-5 routine should be stretched and what it would mean for work-life balance. Subrahmanyan, though, is not the first one to have made such remarks. Infosys co-founder N Narayana Murthy said last year that millennials need to put in 70 hours of work a week to boost India's work productivity. His remarks sparked widespread criticism and a national discourse on work-life balance. PAY GAP AMONG CXOs AND EMPLOYEES While India Inc. leaders have advocated for an increase in working hours, none of them have talked about the pay gap and proposed linking wages to work hours.  SN Subrahmanyan earned Rs 51.05 crore for FY24, a figure that is 534.57 times the median salary of L&T employees, which stands at Rs 9.55 lakh. While his salary saw an increase of 43.11% from the previous year, there was an increase of 1.32% only in the median remuneration of L&T employees as per L&T’s Integrated Annual Report for 2023-24.  This reflects a huge pay disparity and the trend appears to be the same across the white-collar job industry in India.  The salaries of chief executives at India’s leading IT firms have skyrocketed by over 160% in the past five years, whereas entry-level employees have experienced only marginal pay growth of under 4% during the same time, as per data collected by Moneycontrol. In the financial year 2024 (FY24), the median annual salary of the CEOs at top IT companies such as TCS, Infosys, HCLTech, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra rose to nearly Rs 84 crore. In contrast, the median salary offered to freshers increased from Rs 3.6 lakh to Rs 4 lakh over the same period, reflecting a modest 4% rise. This contrast in pay begs the question - is the demand from top industry leaders justifiable? India Today Digital spoke with experts about laws in India on work hours and if there was a need for more pay on the table when work included more than the specified working hours. WHAT ARE THE LAWS ABOUT WORKING HOURS IN INDIA? There are no specific laws that protect or regulate white-collar/corporate job employees in India.  "Considering the statement made, India should establish specific laws and regulate working hours and pay linked to overtime for white collar/corporate employees, to prevent exploitation. Indians have been known to be exploited under the guise of work hours. This will align with the global standards work-life balance," said Alay Razvi, Managing Partner, Accord Juris.  However, there are certain labour laws crafted to protect the interests of both workers and employers, ensuring fairness and balance in the workplace. Rishi Agrawal, CEO and co-founder of Teamlease Regtech said that the current labour laws in India mandate a working individual not to work more than 9 hours a day and 48 hours a week, including one hour of rest or a meal break. Employees who work overtime should be paid twice the regular hourly wage. "The Factories Act, 1948 applies to all factories, Shops and Establishment Act regulates the payment of wages, hours of work, leave, holidays, terms of service and other work conditions of people employed in the shop and commercial establishments. The Minimum Wages Act, 1948 applies to the entire country and aims to protect the interests of workers by ensuring minimum wages are paid for scheduled employment. There are sectors to which only central rules are applicable and others are subjected to state-specific rules. For example sectors like railways, banking and insurance, telecommunications, airports and aviation, defense establishments come under the central jurisdiction," he added.  However, white-collar workers, including CXOs, follow the terms of their employment contracts, while others are covered by labour laws. Central government employees are excluded from these laws, and railway employees need central government approval for them to apply. A 70- or 90-hour work week would break India’s labour laws, which cap weekly work hours at 48 under the Factories Act, 1948, and the Shops and Establishments Act. Overtime is allowed but must be paid at double the regular wage, and total daily work hours, including overtime, can’t exceed 12. "The OSH Code of 2020, not yet implemented, also sticks to these limits but raises quarterly overtime to 125 hours from 50. Continuous work beyond five hours is prohibited without a break. Such long weeks would breach both national laws and international labour standards," said Agrawal. SHOULD EMPLOYEES BE PAID FOR EXTRA HOURS?  When work hours are over and above the norm, there must be a provision for such overtime and fair compensation or benefits for that. "Fairness and satisfaction are of the utmost importance, and overall well-being is improved, so the need is to compensate fairly for the extra hours, balance between pay and well-being, and keep it transparent and proper communication," said Tanya Parwani, Senior HR, Gradding.com.  She further added that in addition to this, ensuring fairness in job distribution requires longer working hours to be balanced by increases in pay or other forms of benefit. It's not just monetary rewards; it will also give them a sense of being valued. The debate over extended working hours in India's corporate sector has laid bare a stark reality: while industry leaders push for longer workweeks, the fundamental issues of fair compensation and work-life balance remain unaddressed.  As India aims to position itself as a global economic powerhouse, the path forward may not lie in stretching workdays to its limits, but in creating a workplace culture that values both productivity and employee wellbeing.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 10, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Explained: Why Infosys has filed counter lawsuit against CognizantInfosys vs Cognizant legal battle: The Bengaluru-based firm accused its US-based rival of contractually restricting clients from awarding IT services to competitors and withholding software training, which Infosys claims hindered its ability to compete.
Content: IT giant Infosys has filed a counterclaim against Cognizant in a Texas federal court, alleging anti-competitive practices and targeted poaching of its key executives, reported news agency Reuters. The Bengaluru-based firm accused its US-based rival of contractually restricting clients from awarding IT services to competitors and withholding software training, which Infosys claims hindered its ability to compete. The lawsuit comes after Cognizant's subsidiary TriZetto sued Infosys in August last year, accusing the Indian IT giant of misappropriating trade secrets related to its healthcare insurance software. TriZetto’s Facets and QNXT platforms, widely used by healthcare insurers to automate administrative tasks, were central to the initial legal dispute.WHY HAS INFOSYS FILED COUNTER LAWSUIT?  In its counterclaim, Infosys accused Cognizant of deliberately recruiting its senior executives, including S Ravi Kumar, who was appointed CEO of Cognizant in 2023. Infosys claims this slowed the development of its competing software, Infosys Helix. The counterclaim seeks three times the damages incurred, along with attorney fees, though the total amount has not been disclosed. Responding to the allegations, Cognizant stated it would take firm action, maintaining that Infosys had improperly used its intellectual property. “Cognizant encourages competition, but competitors cannot use Cognizant’s IP to unfairly compete, as Infosys has done,” the company said in a statement. Infosys declined to comment when approached by news agency Reuters. The dispute escalated with TriZetto’s claim that Infosys had repackaged its proprietary data into an Infosys product under the guise of “Test Cases for Facets.” Infosys countered by arguing that Cognizant’s anti-competitive actions, including restrictive contract clauses, were impeding fair competition in the IT services sector. The case, filed in the US District Court for the Northern District of Texas, has drawn attention due to its potential implications for the competitive landscape of the global IT industry. With both companies accusing each other of misconduct, the legal battle is expected to intensify as it unfolds.With inputs from ReutersPublished By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 11, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Union Budget 2025: High hopes as dark clouds loom over economyAmid fears of an economic slowdown, here's what key sectors are demanding from Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in Union Budget 2025.
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to present the Union Budget on February 1. While a slowdown in the ongoing financial year was anticipated, the steep downward revision in GDP growth for FY25 has surprised many. Concerns over economic growth have intensified, with India’s GDP projected to slow sharply to 6.4% in FY25, according to the government’s first advance estimates. This marks a significant drop from the 8.2% growth recorded in FY24 and represents the slowest expansion in four years.advertisementINDIA INC SEEKS MAJOR REFORMSThe corporate sector is pinning its hopes on the upcoming budget. Amit Modi, director of County Group, highlighted the real estate industry's pressing needs. The corporate sector is pinning its hopes on the upcoming budget. Amit Modi, director of County Group, highlighted the real estate industry's pressing needs. “One of the most long-standing demands is granting industry status to enable easier access to low-cost financing, which directly benefits consumers. Additionally, implementing single-window clearance is crucial for timely project completion and cost efficiency,” Modi said. He further added, “Reintroducing GST input credits for residential real estate will stabilise costs. We also expect the home loan interest exemption to be increased to Rs 8 lakh annually to support first-time buyers, while Section 80C should either exclusively cover housing loan principal deductions or have its limit raised to Rs 5 lakh.”REAL ESTATE AWAITS RELIEF The real estate sector, grappling with challenges, anticipates significant measures to aid the middle class and the industry. Sachin Gawri, founder and CEO of RISE Infraventures, addressed the sector’s expectations. “Real estate reflects India’s economic progress, yet significant untapped potential remains. Budget 2025 should address high input costs by extending input tax credits and reducing GST on materials,” Gawri said. He suggested revising the affordable housing definition to Rs 80 lakh, reintroducing a 100% tax holiday for such projects, and creating new land banks to boost supply. “Combining home loan principal and interest deductions with a Rs 5 lakh cap would ease homeownership. Additionally, reducing the long-term capital gains holding period to two years, raising Section 54EC exemptions to Rs 1 crore, and expanding REIT benefits will spur investments,” he added.STARTUPS SEEK SUPPORT The startup ecosystem, a critical driver of job creation, faces hurdles that need immediate attention. Sumit Singh, CEO and co-founder of DashLoc, outlined the sector’s expectations from the budget. “As the Union Budget 2025 approaches, it is crucial for the government to focus on bolstering the startup ecosystem by reducing regulatory complexities, which often hinder growth,” Singh said. He proposed establishing dedicated IT software parks to provide essential infrastructure and foster innovation. “Simplifying access to loans through banks and government-backed schemes will ensure startups can secure funding more efficiently, enabling them to scale and contribute significantly to the economy,” Singh added.HEALTHCARE DEMANDS INCREASED FOCUS Although the world has largely overcome the Covid-19 pandemic, HMPV infections have raised fresh alarms. The healthcare sector is calling for increased investments and policies to address systemic gaps. Dr Pravin Gupta, principal director and chief of neurology at Fortis Hospital, stressed the need for a roadmap. “We expect a clear plan to increase public healthcare spending. Strategic investments coupled with supportive policies can bridge the rural-urban divide and ensure access to critical care, especially in underserved regions,” he said. Dr Ashish Chaudhari, managing director at Aakash Healthcare, echoed similar sentiments. “Reinstating the 150% deduction under Section 35AD of the Income Tax Act for new healthcare projects and providing tax holidays for a minimum of 15 years for new projects, alongside a 10-year tax relief for existing facilities, are key demands,” Chaudhari said. “These measures will ease the financial burden on healthcare providers and ensure cost savings are passed on to patients, making healthcare more affordable,” he added. With stakeholders across sectors voicing their concerns and expectations, the Union Budget 2025 holds the promise of addressing critical issues and driving India’s economic recovery.Published By: Devika BhattacharyaPublished On: Jan 11, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Will the stock market recover next week? 4 things you should knowGlobal headwinds and FII outflows weigh on the Sensex and Nifty. Will Dalal Street see a recovery next week after the turbulent run?
Content: Benchmark stock market indices saw a sharp sell-off last week, with both the Nifty50 and BSE Sensex posting losses of over 2%, driven by global headwinds, sustained foreign outflows, and rising US bond yields. While the broader market struggled, the IT sector provided a silver lining on Friday, supported by optimism from sector-leader Tata Consultancy Services (TCS). Despite the IT sector’s performance, Sensex and Nifty ended in the red after encountering high volatility throughout Friday’s session. Will the turbulence continue to plague Dalal Street investors next week? Here are 4 things you need to know:NIFTY AND NIFTY BANK LIKELY TO BE UNDER PRESSURE The Nifty50 closed 573 points lower at 23,431.50 last week, slipping below its 21-week and daily EMAs. According to Puneet Singhania, Director at Master Trust Group, "The index now rests at a crucial support zone of 23,200–23,300, which has historically provided a strong floor. A breach below this could accelerate selling, potentially pulling the Nifty toward 22,900." On the upside, Singhania sees 23,850 as a critical resistance. “This level offers an ideal shorting opportunity, but a sustained move above it could trigger an upside rally toward 24,200,” he added. Bank Nifty, which plunged 4.42%, is also in a vulnerable position, having broken below the 50,000 mark. "The index is in a sell-on-rise trend, with Fibonacci support at 48,300," Singhania noted. "A breach below this could result in an additional 1,000-point drop. Traders can use 49,500 as a stop-loss for any short positions."GLOBAL FACTORS, FII SELLING Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have pulled $2.2 billion from Indian markets in January, driven by a strengthening dollar and rising US bond yields. These factors and subdued Q3 earnings expectations have dampened investor sentiment.IT SECTOR LIKELY TO GAIN Amid the sell-off, IT stocks emerged as an outlier, with the Nifty IT index gaining 2% last week. TCS surged 5.6% on Friday after expressing optimism about a demand revival in North America. According to analysts, the IT sector may continue to see a positive run due to the boost provided by the Q3 results of the country’s largest IT services firm.WHAT SHOULD BE YOUR TRADING STRATEGY?  Singhania advised that with the Nifty at a critical juncture, traders should closely monitor the 23,200–23,300 support zone. He noted that a breach below this could signal further downside, while any bounce near 23,850 may present a shorting opportunity. He added that Bank Nifty’s support at 48,300 will also be key. Simply put, investors should remain cautious and try for a risk-managed approach in the coming sessions. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 11, 2025Must Watch

Headline: 90-hour workweek: What India Inc thinks of L&T chief's suggestionL&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan recently expressed regret over not being able to make employees work on Sundays, suggesting that a 90-hour workweek is key to success.
Content: The debate over work-life balance has been reignited after Larsen & Toubro (L&T) Chairman SN Subrahmanyan sparked outrage with his comments advocating for a 90-hour workweek. His remarks, including, “how long can you stare at your wife,” drew massive criticism online and led to fresh discussions on the importance of work-life balance.  Following his comments, Subrahmanyan’s hefty remuneration package of Rs 51.05 crore in 2023-24 also came under the spotlight. This was because it was 534.57 times the median pay of L&T employees. It may be noted that even L&T issued a statement defending its chairman. However, prominent industry leaders have since voiced their opinions, opposing the idea of an excessively long workweek. RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka expressed his disapproval on X, stating, “90 hours a week? Why not rename Sunday to ‘Sun-duty’ and make ‘day off’ a mythical concept!” He also stressed the fact that success stems from working smart, not excessive hours, adding, “Work-life balance isn’t optional, it’s essential. Well, that’s my view! #WorkSmartNotSlave.” Marico Ltd Chairman Harsh Mariwala shared similar views. He said, "Undeniably, hard work is the backbone of success, but it is not about the hours clocked in. It’s about the quality and passion one brings to those hours.” Mariwala said young professionals thrive when placed in roles that foster growth and learning. “When an individual sees a path where hard work translates to a promising future, they are naturally inclined to give their best,” he said. He also spoke about the need for organisational cultures built on transparency and trust. “The ultimate objective should be to make work so invigorating and rewarding that the paradigm of work-life balance seamlessly integrates,” he added. Rajiv Bajaj, Managing Director of Bajaj Auto, joined the debate, suggesting, “Let it start from the top, and if [it works] as a Proof of Concept, then implement it further down.” He called the practice of measuring work hours “archaic and regressive.” The controversy follows similar comments from Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy, who last year suggested youngsters should work 70-hour weeks, an idea backed by Ola founder Bhavish Aggarwal. In contrast, the second-richest man in India, billionaire industrialist Gautam Adani, also shared his views on work-life balance recently. In an interview, Adani said, “Your idea of work-life balance should not be imposed on me, and my work-life balance shouldn’t be imposed on you.” Adani suggested that individuals find their own balance but recommended spending at least four hours with family. "The thing is, you should see how much time can you take out for family and if you are happy, and your family is happy with it, it should be fine," Adani said. Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 11, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Stricter US sanctions threaten Russia's oil trade with India and China: Report The new sanctions are likely to severely affect Russia's oil exports, as many tankers previously used for shipments to India and China will now face restrictions.
Content: New US sanctions on Russian oil producers and ships are expected to disrupt Russia’s oil trade with India and China, two of its largest customers, according to a report by news agency Reuters. This development may lead to higher oil prices and increased freight costs for both countries as they look to source oil from alternative markets. The US Treasury announced tougher sanctions on Friday, targeting major Russian oil producers Gazprom Neft and Surgutneftegas, as well as 183 ships involved in transporting Russian oil. These measures aim to cut into the revenues Russia uses to fund its war in Ukraine. The targeted ships played a huge role in shifting Russian oil exports from Europe to Asia after the Group of Seven countries imposed a price cap on Russian oil in 2022. Some of these ships were also used to transport oil from Iran, which is already under US sanctions. The new sanctions are likely to severely affect Russia’s oil exports, as many tankers previously used for shipments to India and China will now face restrictions. According to industry sources, Chinese independent refiners may be forced to cut their refining output due to supply disruptions. This development has already pushed global oil prices higher, with Brent crude trading above $81 a barrel on Monday, reaching its highest level in months. The sanctions cover 143 oil tankers that handled over 530 million barrels of Russian crude last year, amounting to 42% of Russia’s total seaborne oil exports. Of this, approximately 300 million barrels were shipped to China, with the majority of the remainder going to India, according to Kpler’s lead freight analyst, Matt Wright. A Singapore-based trader told Reuters that these tankers shipped about 900,000 barrels per day (bpd) of Russian crude to China over the past year, warning that this trade could see a significant drop. India and China have been major buyers of Russian oil, with India’s imports of Russian crude rising by 4.5% year-on-year to 1.764 million bpd for the first 11 months of last year. This accounted for 36% of India’s total oil imports. China’s imports, including pipeline supplies, increased by 2% to 99.09 million metric tonnes (approximately 2.159 million bpd), representing 20% of its total imports during the same period. While India mainly buys Russia’s Urals crude, China prefers ESPO Blend crude, which is often sold above the G7-imposed price cap. Analysts suggest that if the sanctions are strictly enforced, Russian ESPO Blend crude exports could halt entirely. The sanctions are expected to push India and China to source oil from other regions, such as the Middle East, Africa, and the Americas. This shift has already led to a rise in spot prices for oil grades from these regions. An Indian oil refining official said that the country may need to increase its reliance on oil from the Middle East and potentially the US. “There is no option but to go for Middle Eastern oil. Perhaps we may have to go for US oil as well,” the official told Reuters. Analysts also believe that Russian oil prices may drop below $60 a barrel to allow Moscow to continue using Western insurance and shipping services. Experts predict that the demand for Middle Eastern oil will intensify as Indian and Chinese refiners seek alternatives. This could lead to a tighter Brent-Dubai price spread, with prices for February-loading cargoes like Oman or Murban oil expected to rise due to aggressive bidding.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Standard Glass Lining IPO listing: Shares to make strong market debut? Check GMPStandard Glass Lining share price: The IPO was open for subscription from January 6 to 8, offering shares in a price band of Rs 133-140 with a lot size of 107 shares.
Content: Shares of Standard Glass Lining Technology are set to debut on the stock market on Monday after the allotment was completed on January 9, 2024. However, investors may need to lower their expectations due to a decline in the grey market premium (GMP) ahead of the listing. The correction in broader market trends has impacted sentiments, even though the IPO had seen strong subscription during its bidding phase. As of Monday morning, the shares of Standard Glass Lining Technology were commanding a grey market premium of Rs 50 in the unofficial market. This suggests potential listing gains of around 35.71% for investors, based on the upper price band of the IPO at Rs 140. This is a huge drop from the GMP of Rs 90-95 recorded on the final day of bidding, signalling reduced enthusiasm among investors. Standard Glass Lining share price IPO was open for subscription from January 6 to 8, offering shares in a price band of Rs 133-140 with a lot size of 107 shares.  The Hyderabad-based company raised Rs 410.05 crore through the IPO, which included a fresh issue of Rs 210 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of Rs 200.05 crore by existing shareholders. The issue received an overwhelming response, being subscribed 183.18 times overall. The allocation for qualified institutional bidders (QIBs) was subscribed 331.60 times. The non-institutional investors (NIIs) portion was subscribed 268.50 times. The retail investors’ portion was subscribed 64.99 times. This strong subscription indicates high demand for the shares, particularly from institutional investors. Incorporated in September 2012, Standard Glass Lining Technology is an engineering equipment manufacturer catering to the pharmaceutical and chemical sectors in India. The company provides turnkey solutions, which include design, engineering, manufacturing, assembly, installation, and preparation of standard operating procedures for its clients. Its expertise in engineering equipment makes it a key player in these sectors, which are critical to the country’s economy. Brokerage firms have been largely positive about the IPO. They advised investors to subscribe, citing the company’s strong fundamentals, robust demand in its target sectors, and growth potential. IIFL Securities and Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors were the book-running lead managers for the IPO, while Kfin Technologies acted as the registrar. The shares are set to list on both the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE).Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 13, 2025

Headline: Rupee falls to all-time low of 86 against US dollarRupee falls to all-time low of 86 against US dollar.
Content: Rupee hit a record low, crossing 86 against the US dollar on Monday, following stronger-than-expected US job data. The report hinted that the Federal Reserve might not reduce interest rates significantly this year, putting pressure on the rupee. It opened at 86.2050, weaker than Friday’s 85.9650.
