Headline: Sensex falls over 600 points: Why is stock market down today? 3 key reasonsStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 657.97 points to 76,720.94, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 199.60 points to 23,231.90 as of 9:20 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices tanked in early trade on Monday extending their downward momentum and continued to be under pressure, led by a decline in auto, banking and metal sector stocks.  The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 657.97 points to 76,720.94, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 199.60 points to 23,231.90 as of 9:20 AM.  IndusInd Bank emerged as the top gainer on Nifty50 in early trade, rising by 3.09%, while Shriram Finance moved up by 0.27%. Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) gained 0.25%, followed by Britannia Industries with a 0.12% increase, and Axis Bank which edged up by 0.10%. On the losing side, Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) led the declines with a drop of 2.38%, while Apollo Hospitals Enterprise fell 1.93%. SBI Life Insurance Company declined by 1.90%, followed by Mahindra & Mahindra which slipped 1.77%. Wipro rounded out the major losers with a decline of 1.61%. Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that market will continue to be under pressure from the many strong headwinds.KEY REASONS FOR STOCK MARKET FALL  Rupee hits a record low - The Indian rupee crashed 23 paise to a historic low of 86.27 against the US dollar in early trade. This drop came after stronger-than-expected US jobs data dampened hopes for significant interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve in 2025. The rupee opened at 86.2050 against Friday’s close of 85.9650. A weak rupee increases import costs, particularly for crude oil, and adds to inflationary pressures in the economy. US jobs data and rate concerns - The US added 2.56 lakh jobs in December, far exceeding expectations of 1.65 lakh. This pushed the US unemployment rate down to 4.1%. While this highlights a strong US economy, it has led to reduced expectations of rate cuts by the Federal Reserve. Dr V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, said, “The robust US jobs data means the Fed is unlikely to cut rates significantly this year. This good economic news for the US is turning out to be bad news for global markets, including India, which were hoping for rate cuts to boost liquidity.” Rising crude oil prices - Brent crude prices rose to $81 per barrel, creating concerns for India, a major importer of crude oil. Higher crude prices increase input costs for businesses and could lead to higher inflation, adding to the challenges for the Indian economy. Analysts suggest that while the near-term outlook remains challenging, there could be opportunities for long-term investors. Anand James, Chief Market Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, said, “The market is approaching critical levels, with Nifty near its recent low of 23,263. A break below this level could see the index falling to 23,000 or even 22,260. However, any recovery above 23,540 could signal strength and give bulls a chance to regroup.” Dr Vijayakumar added that the strength of the US economy could support IT stocks, which have been relatively resilient. He also said that healthcare and pharma sectors may remain stable due to steady demand.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Explained: Why Biocon share price climbed over 4% in early trade todayBiocon's share price climbed to an intraday high of Rs 377.50 per share in intraday trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). As of 10:23 am, Biocon's stock was trading at Rs 376.60 per share, up 4.34% on the BSE.
Content: Shares of Biocon surged over 4% in early trade on Monday, following positive developments at its subsidiary Biocon Biologics’ Johor Bahru facility in Malaysia.  The United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) classified the facility as "Voluntary Action Indicated" (VAI), boosting investor sentiment. Biocon’s share price climbed to an intraday high of Rs 377.50 per share in intraday trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). As of 10:23 am, Biocon’s stock was trading at Rs 376.60 per share, up 4.34% on the BSE. In a statement, the company confirmed that the USFDA had conducted a comprehensive cGMP inspection of Biocon Biologics’ insulins facilities between September 15 and 27, 2024. The inspection included several biologics manufacturing units, including a Drug Substance unit, a Drug Product unit, a Medical Device Assembly unit, and multiple quality control laboratories and warehouses. The VAI classification indicates that the issues identified do not warrant further regulatory action, providing relief to investors. Despite this positive regulatory update, Biocon's financial performance for the second quarter of FY25 revealed challenges. The company reported a sharp 84.3% year-on-year decline in net profit, amounting to Rs 27.1 crore, compared to Rs 172.7 crore in the same quarter of the previous year. Profit before tax also fell 54.08% to Rs 98.4 crore, down from Rs 214.3 crore in Q2FY24. Total revenue for the quarter marginally increased to Rs 3,623 crore from Rs 3,620.2 crore in Q2FY24. Earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) stood at Rs 718 crore, reflecting a 20% margin. Revenue from the biosimilars segment grew 10.8%, reaching Rs 2,182 crore, up from Rs 1,969 crore in the previous year. Headline: Budget 2025: Experts push for HRA inclusion, Rs 1 lakh standard deduction Amid rising costs and squeezed disposable incomes, the spotlight is on the new tax regime, with experts pushing the demands for HRA inclusion and a Rs 1 lakh standard deduction in Budget 2025.
Content: Will this year’s Budget rewrite the playbook for the new tax regime and ease the financial burden on taxpayers? As Budget 2025 approaches, taxpayers are hoping for a wishlist to come true that eases their tax burden. Individual taxpayers are looking at Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to deliver a financial masterstroke on February 1. Amid rising costs and squeezed disposable incomes, the spotlight is on the new tax regime, with experts pushing the demands for HRA inclusion and a Rs 1 lakh standard deduction in Budget 2025. Experts believe that the government is unlikely to make significant changes to the old tax regime, as it aims to encourage a shift towards the new, simplified structure. However, to draw more taxpayers to the new system, changes that offer better tax relief and align with rising living costs are being suggested. Kuldip Kumar, Partner at Mainstay Tax Advisors, said, “Last year, the Finance Minister raised the standard deduction and revised tax slabs under the new tax regime. This year, taxpayers are expecting further relief given high interest rates, rising living expenses, and the need to boost consumption. Any relief will increase disposable income for individuals, supporting economic growth.”HRA EXEMPTION One of the most common requests from taxpayers is the inclusion of HRA exemptions in the new tax regime. At present, this benefit is only available under the old system. Mayank Mohanka, Founder-Director of TaxAaram.com, explained, “Housing is a basic necessity, not a discretionary expense. Many taxpayers stick to the old regime to retain the HRA benefit. Including it in the new regime could encourage more people to make the switch.” HRA exemptions currently provide tax savings. The exemption amount is calculated as the lowest of: Actual HRA received. 50% of basic salary (40% for non-metro residents). Rent paid minus 10% of basic salary. Experts argue that incorporating this exemption would make the new regime more practical for taxpayers who incur significant housing costs.INCREASE IN STANDARD DEDUCTION The rise in inflation and household expenses has led to calls for an increase in the standard deduction. In Budget 2023, the deduction under the new regime was raised from Rs 50,000 to Rs 75,000. However, experts believe this amount is insufficient. Abhishek Soni, Co-Founder of Tax2Win, said, “The standard deduction should be raised to Rs 1 lakh to match the surge in living expenses. For instance, a salaried individual earning Rs 15 lakh may spend Rs 7-9 lakh annually on various expenses, which are already taxed through GST or VAT. A higher deduction would help offset this burden.” Tax experts are also calling for an easier income tax return (ITR) filing process, particularly for non-resident Indians (NRIs). Challenges faced by NRIs include difficulty in receiving refunds directly into overseas bank accounts and limited options for digitally verifying returns. Kumar highlighted the need for changes, stating, “NRIs are struggling with the 30-day time limit to submit the ITR-V in physical form to the tax department. Extending this period to 120 days or offering more e-verification options would address their concerns.”Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty fall for 4th straight session. Will stock market decline further? The Sensex hit an intraday low of 76,535.24 in early trade, and was down 437.23 points to 76,941.68 at around 11:22 am. At the same time, the Nifty50 was trading 161.85 points lower at 23,269.65.
Content:
Investors on Dalal Street faced more losses on Monday as the benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty fell for the fourth consecutive session. Weak global cues, including a strong US jobs report, led to higher selling pressure. The Sensex hit an intraday low of 76,535.24 in early trade, and was down 437.23 points to 76,941.68 at around 11:22 am. At the same time, the Nifty50 was trading 161.85 points lower at 23,269.65.advertisementWHY IS THE STOCK MARKET DOWN TODAY?The recent US nonfarm payrolls report showed the addition of 256,000 jobs in December, surpassing expectations of 160,000. The recent US nonfarm payrolls report showed the addition of 256,000 jobs in December, surpassing expectations of 160,000. The fresh data has reduced the likelihood of multiple rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve in 2025, further strengthening the dollar and weighing on emerging market currencies. Moreover, the dollar index neared 110, while the rupee plunged to a record low of 86.39, raising fears of continued foreign outflows.FII OUTFLOWS CONTINUE Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have pulled over $4 billion from Indian equities this month, following an $11 billion outflow in the last quarter. Concerns over US monetary policy and uncertainty about President-elect Donald Trump's economic strategies have intensified bearish sentiment. Additionally, Brent Crude's rise to over $81 per barrel has increased inflationary concerns, adding to market jitters.MORE PAIN AHEAD FOR INVESTORS? Market experts predict that volatility will persist in the near term and indicate that the stock market could fall further. Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, said, “Market will continue to be under pressure from the many strong headwinds.” “The blow out jobs data from the US with 2.56 lakh job creation in December against expectations of 1.65 lakhs means the rate cut expectations in 2025 is now down to one. With the unemployment in the US down to 4.1% the economy doesn’t need any stimulus. This good economic news is turning out to be bad news for markets which were discounting many rate cuts this year,” he added. Vijayakumar added that Brent Crude price rising to $81 is also a concern for India, and it seems to have weighed on market sentiments.

Meanwhile, Emkay Global has stated in a note that domestic markets might remain weak until March, with stability expected from April as earnings outlooks improve and FII selling subsides. The brokerage set a conservative Nifty target of 25,000 for 2025, projecting small and mid-cap stocks to outperform. "We see another year of moderate returns for the Nifty, but SMIDs could deliver stronger gains," the note added. ICICI Securities expressed similar concerns, suggesting that anxiety around Donald Trump’s policies and Budget 2025 could keep markets on edge. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Government may raise minimum EPS pension to Rs 7,500The government might consider raising the minimum EPS pension to Rs 7,500, potentially bringing long-awaited relief to retirees in Budget 2025.
Content: In a move that could significantly impact private sector employees, the government is reportedly contemplating a hike in the minimum monthly pension under the Employees’ Pension Scheme (EPS) to Rs 7,500. This proposal follows persistent appeals from EPS-95 pensioners, who currently receive a meagre Rs 1,000 per month. A delegation representing pensioners met Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on January 10, 2025, during a pre-budget consultation, urging an increase alongside additional benefits like a dearness allowance (DA) hike and free medical care for pensioners and their spouses, reported Financial Express.advertisementDIVIDED VOICES AMONGST STAKEHOLDERSWhile pensioners’ representatives, led by the EPS-95 National Agitation Committee, have strongly advocated for a Rs 7,500 pension, trade unions suggested a lower hike to Rs 5,000 per month. While pensioners’ representatives, led by the EPS-95 National Agitation Committee, have strongly advocated for a Rs 7,500 pension, trade unions suggested a lower hike to Rs 5,000 per month. This divergence has sparked criticism from pensioners, who argue that the proposed Rs 5,000 is insufficient to meet rising living costs. The committee also highlighted discrepancies in the current system, stating that despite the government’s 2014 announcement to set the minimum pension at Rs 1,000, over 36.60 lakh pensioners still receive less than this amount.UNDERSTANDING EPF CONTRIBUTIONS Under the Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO), both employees and employers contribute 12% of the employee’s basic salary to a retirement benefits corpus. Of the employer’s contribution, 8.33% is directed to the EPS, while the remaining 3.67% is allocated to the Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF). Pensioners argue that the current allocation system needs a comprehensive review to provide adequate post-retirement benefits. Finance Minister Sitharaman’s assurance to review the pensioners’ demands has rekindled hope amongst millions of retirees. If the proposed hike to Rs 7,500 is implemented, it could mark a new chapter in ensuring financial dignity for India’s elderly workforce. The upcoming Union Budget 2025 might just be the harbinger of this much-awaited reform.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Adani Wilmar share price falls 8% to hit 52-week low. Here's why Adani Wilmar stock: Market cap of Adani Wilmar stood at Rs 35,494.22 crore. The stock has fallen 15.88% in the past week, 18.31% in the last 6 months, and 24.94% in the past year.
Content: Adani Wilmar shares saw a sharp decline on Monday, falling over 8% to hit their 52-week low as the company’s second day of its Offer for Sale (OFS) kicked off. The shares had closed at Rs 291.60 in the last session and were trading at Rs 273.10, down 6.43% at the time the article was being written. Market cap of Adani Wilmar stood at Rs 35,494.22 crore. The stock has fallen 15.88% in the past week, 18.31% in the last 6 months, and 24.94% in the past year.  The decline in Adani Wilmar’s share price is primarily linked to its OFS, where shares are being offered at a discounted price. The company announced its plan to exercise the oversubscription option, offering an additional 1,96,29,910 shares, representing 1.51% of the total issued and paid-up share capital. This is on top of the 17,54,56,612 shares (13.50% of the issued share capital) that formed part of the base offer size. This brings the total number of shares in the offer to 19,50,86,522, which represents 15.01% of the company’s equity. Of these, 1,95,08,653 shares (1.50% of the share capital) are available for allocation on T+1 day. On Friday, the stock fell 10% as the floor price for the offer was set at Rs 275, a 15.11% discount to Thursday’s closing price of Rs 323.95. The discounted price has added selling pressure on the stock, as many investors see limited near-term upside. Adani Commodities LLP, a promoter group entity, has indicated plans to sell up to 8,44,79,110 additional shares, representing 6.50% of the company’s equity. This could bring the total shares sold to 20% of Adani Wilmar’s issued capital. Retail investors are participating in the OFS on Monday, while non-retail investors may carry forward unallotted bids to fill any unsubscribed portion in the retail category. Adani Enterprises aims to sell its entire 44% stake in Adani Wilmar, targeting a total deal value of $2.2 billion. Analysts suggest this sale will improve liquidity for Adani Enterprises, allowing it to address debt and fund future projects. Ventura Securities estimates that the sale proceeds could support Adani Enterprises in raising an additional Rs 35,000–36,000 crore in debt, creating a total corpus of Rs 50,000–52,000 crore.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 13, 2025

Headline: Rupee hits all-time low of 86/USD for first time. Will it decline further?The rupee slipped 0.4% to a record low of 86.39 per dollar. Check the key factors behind this decline and whether the Indian currency faces further challenges.
Content:
The Indian rupee plunged to an all-time low, breaching the 86 mark against the US dollar on Monday.  The rupee fell 0.4% to hit 86.39 per dollar, in line with the broader weakness in Asian currencies. The sharp decline came after a stronger-than-expected US jobs report, which further strengthened the dollar and pressured emerging market currencies, including the rupee.advertisementSTRONG US DATA, LOWER FED RATE CUT HOPESThe US nonfarm payrolls data revealed that 256,000 jobs were added last month, far exceeding expectations of 160,000. The US nonfarm payrolls data revealed that 256,000 jobs were added last month, far exceeding expectations of 160,000. Additionally, a strong performance in the US services and manufacturing sectors highlighted the resilience of the world’s largest economy. The fresh data diminished hopes of immediate rate cuts by the Federal Reserve, bolstering the dollar and weakening the rupee.FII EXODUS CONTINUES Another factor behind the rupee’s fall is continuous selling by foreign institutional investors. It has further exacerbated the rupee's decline.
It is worth mentioning that overseas investors have withdrawn over $4 billion from Indian stocks this month alone, following a $11 billion outflow last quarter. Concerns over US monetary policy and uncertainty surrounding US President-elect Donald Trump's planned policies have led to increased bearish bets on the rupee. All these factors, combined with higher hedging activity, seem to have intensified the pressure on the Indian currency.WILL THE RUPEE’S FALL CONTINUE? The rupee's downward trajectory has been ongoing for over three months, accompanied by heightened volatility. Brad Bechtel, global head of foreign exchange at Jefferies, told news agency Reuters that the rupee's continued depreciation aligned with its real effective exchange rate (REER). The rupee's 40-currency trade-weighted REER indicates it is at its most overvalued level in at least two decades, he added. Market analysts predict further depreciation in the rupee. Bechtel expects the rupee to weaken to 88 in the near-to-medium term, while ANZ Bank forecasts the rupee to reach that level by March. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Standard Glass Lining IPO lists at 23% premium over IPO price on Dalal Street Standard Glass Lining listing: Shares listed at Rs 172 per share on the NSE, marking a premium of 22.86% over the IPO price, which was set in the range of Rs 133 to Rs 140 per share.
Content: Standard Glass Lining IPO shares made a strong debut on the stock exchanges as shares listed with a 23% premium over the issue price on Monday, following a huge demand by the investors. Standard Glass Lining IPO aimed to raise Rs 410.05-crore through the public listing and was subscribed 183 times through its 3-day bidding process which began on January 6  and closed on January 8. However, the listing was a little below expectations as grey market premium trends suggested a listing of over 35% premium to the IPO price.  Standard Glass Lining IPO shares listed at Rs 172 per share on the NSE, marking a premium of 22.86% over the IPO price, which was set in the range of Rs 133 to Rs 140 per share. On the BSE, the shares opened even higher, starting at Rs 176 per share, reflecting a premium of 25.71% compared to the IPO price. Following the listing, the company's market capitalisation stood at Rs 3,511.05 crore. Allotment of shares for the IPO was completed on January 9.  Incorporated in September 2012, Standard Glass Lining Technology manufactures engineering equipment for the pharmaceutical and chemical industries in India. The company provides end-to-end solutions, including design, engineering, manufacturing, installation, and operational support for its clients. Brokerage firms were largely positive about the IPO. They advised investors to subscribe, citing the company’s strong fundamentals, robust demand in its target sectors, and growth potential. IIFL Securities and Motilal Oswal Investment Advisors were the book-running lead managers for the IPO, while Kfin Technologies acted as the registrar.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 13, 2025

Headline: HCL Tech to announce Q3 results today: What to expect from the IT giant HCL Tech Q3 results preview: Market analysts predict that HCL Tech will show robust growth in the December quarter, driven by its software business and recent acquisition of the Communications Technology Group (CTG).
Content: HCL Technologies Ltd is set to announce its Q3 FY25 financial results today, following market hours. Investors will be closely watching the IT giant’s performance, especially after Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) posted its Q3 FY25 results last week. TCS reported decent earnings and better-than-expected deal wins, which led to a rally in IT sector stocks, with TCS shares gaining over 5% the following day. Market analysts predict that HCL Tech will show robust growth in the December quarter, driven by its software business and recent acquisition of the Communications Technology Group (CTG). HCL Tech is projected to lead the Tier I IT companies in growth, with a sequential constant currency (CC) growth of 4.6-5.5%. This growth is attributed to the seasonality of its software segment and the one-month consolidation of CTG. However, wage hikes and furloughs are expected to slightly impact margins. Deal wins for the quarter are likely to range between $2-2.5 billion, and some analysts believe HCL Tech may upgrade its FY25 revenue guidance.WHAT TO EXPECT?  Net profit: Prabhudas Lilladher estimates a 3.9% year-on-year (YoY) rise in net profit to Rs 4,520 crore, compared to Rs 4,350 crore in the same quarter last year. JM Financial expects profit to rise 8.5% YoY to Rs 4,593.50 crore, while Nuvama forecasts a 13.1% YoY increase to Rs 4,790 crore. Revenue: Analysts project a 4.3-6% YoY increase in revenue, with estimates ranging from Rs 30,110 crore to Rs 30,393 crore. Earnings before interest and taxes (EBIT) margin: EBIT margin is expected to contract slightly on a YoY basis but improve sequentially. Prabhudas Lilladher estimates a margin of 19.2%, while JM Financial forecasts 19.1%. HCL Tech’s growth in Q3 FY25 is supported by strong contributions from its IT services and software businesses. Analysts at JM Financial have factored in a $20 million contribution from the CTG consolidation and expect quarter-on-quarter growth of 1.5% in IT services, engineering and R&D (ERS), and product and platform businesses. While engineering and manufacturing segments may face softness due to challenges in the German automotive sector, discretionary spending in the high-tech segment is expected to show signs of revival. This should provide long-term growth opportunities for the company. Brokerages are optimistic about HCL Tech slightly upgrading its FY25 revenue growth guidance. Nuvama predicts the company will raise its guidance to 4-5% CC YoY from its earlier 3.5-5%. Margins are likely to expand by 50 basis points (bps) sequentially, driven by a strong performance in the software business and operating leverage, despite headwinds from wage hikes and furloughs. HCL Tech’s management is also expected to announce a dividend along with its quarterly results. Post-results, the company’s senior leadership will hold an audio conference call at 7:30 PM. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Trading platform Groww plans IPO at $6-8 billion valuation: ReportIf successful, Groww's listing will mark the first IPO by a digital trading platform in India, adding a new chapter to the rapidly expanding fintech landscape.
Content: Trading platform Groww is preparing to file for its initial public offering (IPO) within the next 10 to 12 months, reported TechCrunch. Quoting sources familiar with the company’s plans, the report suggested that the Bengaluru-based trading platform aims to raise its valuation to between $6 billion and $8 billion. This marks a significant jump from its last funding round in October 2021, which valued the company at $3 billion. If successful, Groww’s listing will mark the first IPO by a digital trading platform in India, adding a new chapter to the rapidly expanding fintech landscape. The company has already begun discussions with investment banks and is expected to select advisors for the IPO soon, added the report. To strengthen its position, Groww also made strategic moves last year by shifting its domicile to India from the U.S., aligning itself with local market regulations in preparation for the public offering. Backed by major investors such as Peak XV, Tiger Global, and Alkeon, Groww has firmly established itself as a leader in India’s competitive retail investing market. The platform boasts 13.2 million active users as of December, significantly surpassing its closest rival, Zerodha, which has 8.1 million users, according to National Stock Exchange data. Groww’s growth trajectory has also been impressive, having added between 325,000 to 550,000 new users each month, which is more than double that of its competitors.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 13, 2025

Headline: Laxmi Dental IPO: Should you bid for the Rs 698.06 crore public listing? Laxmi Dental IPO will remain open for subscription until January 15, 2024 with allotment for shares expected to be completed on January 16, 2025.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Laxmi Dental Limited was booked fully a few hours after it opened for bidding on Monday looking to raise Rs 698.06.  Laxmi Dental IPO will remain open for subscription until January 15, 2024 with allotment for shares expected to be completed on January 16, 2025.  Laxmi Dental IPO was subscribed 2.39 times overall on its first day of bidding as of latest update. The retail portion of the issue saw the highest interest, being subscribed 7.2 times. Meanwhile, there was no subscription recorded from qualified institutional buyers (QIBs), and the non-institutional investor (NII) segment was subscribed 3.96 times.  The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 407 and Rs 428 per share. Retail investors can apply for a minimum of 33 shares, translating to an initial investment of Rs 14,124. For small non-institutional investors (sNII), the minimum application size is 15 lots, which equals 495 shares and requires an investment of Rs 2,11,860. Meanwhile, for large non-institutional investors (bNII), the minimum requirement is 71 lots, or 2,343 shares, amounting to Rs 10,02,804.SHOULD YOU SUBSCRIBE? Master Capital Services Ltd in its IPO report said that the global dental consumables market is expected to grow at a CAGR of 10.5% from USD 177.4 billion in 2023 to USD 356.8 billion in 2030, and emerging countries such as India and China are expected to witness higher growth compared to developed countries. It further added that the company is one of the very few organised players in dental laboratories segment having sufficient scale of operations, following quality standards, and catering to both domestic and international markets. "The company continues to scale up branded product offerings and undertake product enhancements of existing dental products and launch new dental products. Investors looking to invest can invest in the IPO for the long term," said Master Capital Services Ltd. LATEST GMP FOR LAXMI DENTAL IPO The latest grey market premium (GMP) for the Laxmi Dental IPO stands at Rs 145 as of January 13, 2025, at 10:55 AM. Given the IPO's price band of Rs 428, the estimated listing price is projected to be around Rs 573. This calculation is based on adding the cap price to the current GMP. If these projections hold, investors could see an estimated gain of 33.88% per share upon listing. Laxmi Dental IPO raised Rs 314.13 crore from anchor investors ahead of opening for subscription.  Laxmi Dental IPO is expected to be listed on both the BSE and NSE, with the tentative listing date scheduled for Monday, 20 January 2025. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 13, 2025

Headline: 'Boss bought a Lamborghini': Vijay Kedia's witty take on 90-hour workweekL&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan recently sparked controversy with his proposal of a 90-hour workweek and working on Sundays.
Content:
The suggestion of a 90-hour workweek by L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan has sparked widespread controversy, raising important questions about work-life balance. Subrahmanyan’s comments, which recommended employees work longer hours—including Sundays—have ignited strong reactions across the business world and beyond.VIJAY KEDIA’S SARCASTIC TAKE Veteran investor Vijay Kedia shared a sarcastic remark on X, humorously highlighting the disconnect between employee effort and employer reward.  He wrote, “A heartfelt moment at the office today: Our boss just bought a Lamborghini! We gathered to congratulate him, and his words truly inspired us: "Thank you all for this achievement. Without you, it wouldn't have been possible. Your relentless 90-hour weeks made this Lamborghini a reality. Today, I promise you all...... if you continue to work this hard, I'll buy another one next year!"
 


INDUSTRY TITANS AND CELEBRITIES SPEAK UP While Subrahmanyan’s remarks drew support from some, industry giants like Anand Mahindra and Harsh Goenka offered a contrasting perspective. During the Viksit Bharat Young Leaders Dialogue 2025, Mahindra stated that impactful change can happen in just 10 hours, highlighting that productivity stems from effective time management rather than extended work hours. Goenka, chairperson of RPG Enterprises, responded humorously, “Why not rename Sunday to ‘Sun-duty’ and make ‘day off’ a mythical concept?” He stressed the importance of work-life balance, warning against turning life into a “perpetual office shift.” Adar Poonawalla, CEO of Serum Institute of India, echoed Mahindra’s views, highlighting the value of “work-life balance.” Poonawalla jokingly added, “Even my wife loves staring at me on Sundays.” Bollywood star Deepika Padukone, known for her advocacy of mental health, also voiced her concern. Sharing a screenshot of Subrahmanyan’s statement on Instagram, she remarked, “And they just made it worse,” pointing to the detrimental effects of overworking employees.THE CALL FOR A SMARTER APPROACH TO WORK The 90-hour workweek debate has illuminated a broader conversation about the need for smarter work strategies, not longer hours. As industry leaders and celebrities continue to speak out, the message is clear: work-life balance is vital, not just for personal well-being, but also for long-term success. The question remains—can companies afford to ignore this truth?Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: HCLTech share price flat ahead of Q3 earnings. What to expect?HCLTech share price and Q3 results: The IT giant is set to report its quarterly results with expectations of a modest rise in profit and revenue despite challenges in key business segments.
Content: Shares of HCL Technologies fell slightly ahead of its Q3 earnings announcement later in the day. At 12:34 pm, HCLTech shares were trading marginally lower by 0.17% at Rs 1,992.20. The IT giant is set to report its quarterly results with expectations of a modest rise in profit and revenue despite challenges in key business segments. As investors wait for the results, here’s a look at what brokerages are forecasting for the company.advertisementWHAT TO EXPECT FROM HCLTECH Q3? Brokerage firm Prabhudas Lilladher predicts a 3.9% year-on-year (YoY) increase in HCL Tech’s net profit, which is expected to reach Rs 4,520 crore, up from Rs 4,350 crore in the same quarter last year. Revenue is anticipated to rise 6% YoY to Rs 30,200 crore, compared to Rs 28,450 crore in Q3 FY24. However, the brokerage expects a slight contraction in the EBIT margin, projecting a decrease of 54 basis points to 19.2%, down from 19.7% in the previous year. Despite this, the brokerage firm forecasts a sequential improvement in the margin, which should grow by 62 basis points from the 18.6% recorded in the September quarter. JM Financial is more optimistic, projecting an 8.5% YoY increase in profit to Rs 4,593.5 crore, along with a 5.3% rise in revenue to Rs 30,393 crore. The brokerage expects the EBIT margin to reach 19.1%. It notes that the quarter’s results will benefit from a $20 million contribution from the one-month consolidation of CTG, along with anticipated 1.5% growth in IT Services and ERS/Product & Platform businesses in USD terms. However, wage hikes are expected to be a headwind, potentially impacting margins. Brokerage firm Nuvama anticipates a 13.1% YoY increase in profit to Rs 4,790 crore and a 4.3% YoY rise in revenue to Rs 30,110 crore for Q3. It also expects the company to slightly upgrade its FY25 revenue growth guidance to 4-5% CC YoY growth, from the earlier forecast of 3.5-5%. Along with its earnings, HCLTech’s management will consider declaring a dividend. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 13, 2025

Headline: Sensex nosedives 900 points. Decoding today's stock market bloodbathThe Sensex was down 879.56 points to 76,499.35 at 1:56 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 300 points lower at 23,131.50. All the other broader market indices were trading in negative territory as volatility skyrocketed during the afternoon trading session.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices nosedived on Monday, with the Sensex falling over 900 points and the Nifty falling over 300 points. The stock market witnessed widespread selling, pushing investor wealth down by over Rs 5 lakh crore.  The Sensex was down 879.56 points to 76,499.35 at 1:56 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 300 points lower at 23,131.50. All the other broader market indices were trading in negative territory as volatility skyrocketed during the afternoon trading session.  All Nifty sectoral indices also traded deep in negative territory, with Nifty Realty falling nearly 6%. Nifty Auto and Nifty Metal were also top losers in percentage terms.  However, the trigger was a sharp decline in banking, financial and IT stocks, which failed to hold gains as the session progressed.  The stock market’s fall was driven by losses across major banking stocks such as HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank. Only three of the 50 Nifty50 constituents were trading in negative territory, reflecting the weakness on Dalal Street. WHAT'S BEHIND THE MARKET BLOODBATH?  The stock market’s dismal performance today has been primarily attributed to a mix of factors that severely hit investor sentiments.  VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, highlighted that the market is facing significant headwinds. The strong US jobs report for December, showing 2.56 lakh job additions, has reduced expectations for multiple rate cuts by the US Federal Reserve in 2025.  According to him, this shift in the US economic outlook, coupled with a strengthened dollar, has weighed heavily on emerging market currencies, including the rupee, which plummeted to a record low of 86.39 against the dollar. Additionally, the rise in global crude oil prices, with Brent crude breaching $81 per barrel, has reignited inflationary concerns, further dampening market sentiment. The global macroeconomic environment, coupled with continued foreign outflows, has made it more challenging for Indian equities to attract investments. Additionally, foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) have been key drivers of market volatility, pulling over $4 billion from Indian equities this month alone. This follows an outflow of $11 billion in the previous quarter. The continued uncertainty surrounding US monetary policy and the potential impact of President-elect Donald Trump's economic strategies have exacerbated bearish sentiment in global markets, contributing to further outflows from emerging markets like India. Despite the foreign sell-off, domestic investors have shown resilience. As per provisional data from the NSE, Domestic Institutional Investors (DIIs) purchased Rs 3,961.92 crore worth of shares on Friday, offsetting some of the FII selling pressure. However, analysts are cautious about the outlook for the short term.WHAT'S NEXT?  As volatility continues to haunt the market, experts predict that the bearish trend could persist in the near term. Vijayakumar noted that the US job data, while positive for the US economy, could lead to fewer rate cuts, further impacting emerging market sentiments. The ongoing global uncertainties, including concerns about inflation and crude prices, add to the challenges.  Looking forward, analysts suggest that markets could remain weak until March, with stability expected to return around April. Emkay Global, in a recent note, projected that the Nifty could remain subdued, with a conservative target of 25,000 for 2025. However, it noted that small and mid-cap stocks could outperform, offering a glimmer of hope for investors seeking opportunities beyond the large-cap index. While the short-term outlook remains challenging for the stock market, with continued foreign outflows and global macroeconomic pressures, a potential recovery could take shape as earnings outlooks improve and FII selling subsides in the coming months.  (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Want to get your credit card's annual fee waived? Follow these stepsMany banks offer ways to waive credit card annual fees by meeting specific spending thresholds, allowing you to enjoy benefits without extra costs.
Content: Owning a credit card often comes with perks, but the annual fee can feel like a hidden cost. What if you could enjoy all the benefits without paying this fee? Surprisingly, many banks offer ways to get your credit card’s annual fee waived—if you meet specific spending criteria.SPEND MORE, SAVE MORE Some banks allow you to waive your annual fee by crossing a pre-defined spending threshold. For instance, several cards, like the Axis Bank Rewards Credit Card, waive a Rs 1,000 fee if you spend Rs 2 lakh annually. Similarly, the Axis Bank Freecharge Plus Credit Card removes fees for spending Rs 50,000 in a year, while the Axis Bank Cashback Credit Card waives its Rs 1,000 fee if you spend Rs 4 lakh. For those who want to avoid annual fees altogether, there are options like ICICI Bank’s Platinum Credit Card, which has no joining or annual fees.HOW TO ENSURE FEE WAIVERS To maximise your chances: Leverage regular spending: Use your card for groceries, dining, travel, or other everyday expenses to reach the threshold. Check eligibility: Before applying, confirm if the card offers a fee waiver on specific spending levels. Contact the bank: If you’ve hit the spending mark but still see a fee, call customer service to request a waiver. Be a loyal customer: Banks often reward long-standing customers with fee waivers, even if you don’t meet the exact criteria.SMART SPENDING PAYS OFF While fee waivers are attractive, it’s essential to evaluate whether the card’s benefits justify its costs. Cards offering rewards, cashback, or travel perks may be worth the fee if the returns outweigh the expense. Owning a credit card is about more than convenience—it’s about making smart financial choices. By understanding your card’s features and utilising them wisely, you can save money and enjoy the full suite of benefits without paying extra.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: NPCI issues clarification on 'Jumped Deposit Scam.' 3 key things to knowNPCI debunks 'Jumped Deposit Scam' fears, urging UPI users to stay alert and trust in the platform's robust security.
Content: As digital payments revolutionise India, fraudsters are devising new tactics to exploit unsuspecting users. The latest concern, dubbed the 'Jumped Deposit Scam,' has sparked fears amongst Unified Payments Interface (UPI) users. However, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has assured users of UPI's robust security and clarified misconceptions surrounding the alleged scam.HOW THE SCAM OPERATES In the Jumped Deposit Scam, fraudsters transfer small amounts of money to a victim's account to build trust. They then send payment collection requests, urging the victim to refund the amount. The scam escalates when users, in their haste, authorise these requests by entering their UPI PIN, mistakenly believing it’s required for verifying account balances. NPCI stated that a UPI PIN is never needed to receive funds and is only used to authorise outgoing payments. Cyber experts reveal that scammers manipulate victims by creating urgency and using emotional appeals, such as claims of mistaken transfers or fabricated emergencies. These tactics exploit human psychology, making even financially savvy individuals vulnerable to fraud.NPCI’S CLARIFICATIONS AND SAFETY TIPS NPCI has reiterated that no cases of this scam have been observed on the UPI platform. The organisation emphasises that UPI transactions are device-based and require explicit user authorisation with a PIN. Merely opening a UPI app or entering a PIN does not initiate or approve any transaction. To protect yourself, NPCI advises scepticism towards unexpected deposits. Avoid clicking on suspicious links or responding to unverified requests. If you receive an unsolicited deposit, consult your bank or UPI service provider. Educating yourself about digital payments and staying alert are key to preventing fraud.STAY VIGILANT While scams like the Jumped Deposit Scam highlight the need for vigilance, NPCI’s clarifications reaffirm UPI’s security and reliability. By understanding how UPI works and being cautious, users can confidently embrace the convenience of digital payments without falling prey to cybercriminals.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 13, 2025

Headline: Activate your UAN for EPFO's ELI scheme benefits before January 15. Here's howThe deadline for UAN activation has been extended to January 15, 2025, urging employees to complete the process to avail ELI scheme benefits.
Content:
In a move to encourage job creation and streamline employment benefits, the Employee Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has extended the deadline for activating the Universal Activation Number (UAN) and linking it with Aadhaar to January 15, 2025. Initially set for November 30, 2024, the deadline was first extended to December 15, 2024, before granting this latest extension. Employees are urged to complete the process promptly to enjoy the benefits of the Employment Linked Incentive (ELI) scheme.advertisementWHY UAN ACTIVATION MATTERSThe Universal Activation Number (UAN) is a crucial 12-digit identifier for managing provident fund accounts. It acts as a single platform for tracking and accessing funds, simplifying financial transactions for employees. The Universal Activation Number (UAN) is a crucial 12-digit identifier for managing provident fund accounts. It acts as a single platform for tracking and accessing funds, simplifying financial transactions for employees. For employees keen on availing themselves of EPFO’s ELI scheme, UAN activation is mandatory. The ELI scheme, introduced by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in Budget 2024, focusses on job creation and incentivising employment in formal sectors. To access these benefits, employees must also seed their Aadhaar with their bank accounts. The EPFO wrote on X, “It is mandatory to seed your Aadhaar with your Bank Account to avail the benefits of the Employment Linked Incentive (ELI) Scheme, an employment-centric scheme focusing on job creation in the country. Do it timely to avoid last-minute hassle!"
 


STEPS TO ACTIVATE UANActivating your UAN is a simple online process: Activating your UAN is a simple online process: Visit www.epfindia.gov.in and navigate to the ‘For Employees’ section under ‘Our Services.’ Click on ‘Member UAN/Online Services’ and choose ‘Activate your UAN.’ Enter your details, such as UAN, name, date of birth, and mobile number, and complete the CAPTCHA. Use the OTP sent to your registered mobile number to activate your UAN.UNDERSTANDING THE ELI SCHEME The ELI scheme offers incentives in three categories: Provides a month’s wage in three instalments for first-time employees earning up to Rs 15,000. Encourages job creation in manufacturing through EPFO-linked incentives for the first four years. Supports employers by reimbursing up to Rs 3,000 per month per additional employee for two years.ACT NOW TO SECURE YOUR BENEFITS With only days left until the January 15, 2025, deadline, employees and employers must act swiftly. Don’t let this golden opportunity slip away—secure your employment benefits under the ELI scheme today!Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 13, 2025

Headline: Monday mayhem on Dalal Street as Sensex tanks 1,100 pointsThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1048.90 points to end at 76,330.01, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 345.55 points to close the day at 23,085.95.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices lost over 1% to end the day in red for the fourth consecutive session as stock markets witnessed a bloodbath on Monday.  The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 1048.90 points to end at 76,330.01, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 345.55 points to close the day at 23,085.95.  "The sell-off was broad-based, with realty, metal, and energy sectors taking the biggest hits. The broader indices also experienced significant losses, plunging nearly 4% each," said Ajit Mishra – SVP, Research, Religare Broking Ltd.  In today's trading session, only a handful of stocks managed to stay in the green, with Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) leading the gainers with a rise of 0.78%, followed by IndusInd Bank which advanced 0.58%. Axis Bank moved up by 0.46%, while Hindustan Unilever showed a modest gain of 0.12%. "What we are seeing is extreme pessimism going into the earnings and budget as investors are still not comfortable with the valuations, despite the recent fall, given the poor earnings outlook and weak global sentiment," said Satish Chandra Aluri, Lemonn Markets Desk.  On the declining side, Adani Enterprises saw a sharp fall of 6.21%, making it the day's biggest loser. Trent Limited also faced significant pressure, dropping 5.40%, while Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) declined 4.39%. Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) fell 4.37%, and Power Grid Corporation rounded out the major losers with a decline of 4.09%. In a broad market selloff, Nifty Realty faced the steepest decline of 6.47%, while Nifty Media tumbled 4.54%. Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom fell sharply by 4.20%, and Nifty Consumer Durables dropped 3.94%. Nifty Metal declined 3.77%, while Nifty Midsmall Healthcare slipped 3.19%. Nifty PSU Bank fell 3.09%, and Nifty Auto declined 2.76%. Nifty Oil & Gas decreased by 2.67%, while Nifty Midsmall Services dropped 2.68%. The financial sector also faced pressure, with Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank falling 2.61%. Nifty Healthcare Index declined 2.45%, and Nifty Pharma dropped 2.13%. The banking indices showed relatively smaller losses, with Nifty Financial Services falling 1.45% and Nifty Private Bank declining 0.87%. Other sectors also ended in red with Nifty FMCG down 1.22% and Nifty IT falling 1.37%. Notably, this was a rare session where all sectoral indices traded in negative territory, reflecting widespread selling pressure across the market. "Several factors contributed to the market crash. Profit booking by foreign investors, weak capital expenditure from the government, and rising food inflation as primary drivers of the sell-off. Additionally, concerns about US economic data, particularly a robust jobs report that diminished expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts in 2025, have heightened market volatility," said Vaibhav Vidwani, Research Analyst, Bonanza.  "We could expect Nifty to gain support between 22,950 and 22,800 and face resistance between 23,050 and 23,100 in the next trading session. The current price suggests bearish sentiment and could fall more in the upcoming sessions," said VLA Ambala, Co-Founder of Stock Market Today. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: 5 important things government needs to addressGoldman Sachs outlines five key questions on fiscal deficit, spending, and growth ahead of Budget 2025.
Content: As India gears up for its Union Budget 2025, Goldman Sachs has posed five crucial questions, offering a glimpse into the financial challenges and opportunities that lie ahead. Amidst a cyclical growth slowdown and ongoing fiscal consolidation, these questions reflect the focus on managing public debt, fiscal deficit targets, and key government spending priorities. Let’s dive into Goldman Sachs' expectations and the critical issues they foresee. Will the government meet its FY25 fiscal deficit target? The first question revolves around the government's ability to meet its fiscal deficit target of 4.9% of GDP in FY25. Goldman Sachs predicts that despite slower nominal GDP growth, the government will likely achieve this target. They expect higher income tax collections and increased non-tax revenues to offset shortfalls in corporate taxes and excise duties. Additionally, a reduction in capital expenditure is anticipated, which should help balance out the rising food subsidy costs. What will be the fiscal deficit target for FY26? Looking forward, Goldman Sachs anticipates a more ambitious fiscal deficit target of 4.4-4.6% of GDP for FY26. The firm highlighted that fiscal consolidation remains critical to maintaining long-term debt sustainability. The government’s fiscal actions in FY25 will set the tone for FY26 and beyond, with the goal of bringing down the fiscal deficit further to around 4.5%. How will the government prioritise spending? A key concern is the government’s spending priorities. Goldman Sachs forecasts a slowdown in capital expenditure (capex) growth to around 13% YoY in FY26, compared to over 30% in the previous years. They also predict a shift towards welfare schemes and rural transfers, especially post the 2024 elections, with an expected focus on rural development and welfare spending. Will the government fully utilise supplementary expenditures? Goldman Sachs questions whether the government will fully utilize the additional funds allocated through supplementary grants. Historically, the government has spent only 80% of the approved budget, and while the shortfall has reduced post-pandemic, FY25 might still see underutilization of the allocated budget. Will the RBI be a net buyer of government bonds in FY26? Lastly, Goldman Sachs wonders if the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) will need to step in as a net buyer of government bonds in FY26. This action could inject necessary liquidity into the banking system and counter the impact of foreign exchange sales. As India prepares for the 2025 Union Budget, these questions highlight the government's delicate balancing act between fiscal discipline, spending priorities, and long-term economic stability. The answers will shape India’s path toward sustained growth in the coming years, as policymakers navigate an increasingly complex economic landscape.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Market crash wipes out Rs 13 lakh crore. Will D-Street's losing streak continue? Stock Market Crash: Dalal Street faced another sharp decline on Monday, with key indices tumbling and investors suffering heavy losses. Is this a temporary dip, or the start of a prolonged bear run?
Content:
The mood on Dalal Street remained tense after another stock market crash in which investors lost nearly Rs 13 lakh crore. At the closing bell on Monday, the Sensex fell sharply by over 1,000 points and the Nifty50 barely managed to stay above the 23,000 mark.  The Sensex ended 1048.90 points lower at 76,330.01, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 344.20 points to settle at 23,087.30. Most of the heavyweight stocks also ended in negative territory, with heavyweight sectoral indices registering significant declines.  But is this just a temporary setback, or are investors staring at a prolonged bear run? It is worth mentioning that the Sensex and Nifty have already fallen over 2% in the calendar year and over 7% in a month. Analysts anticipate the domestic stock markets to remain volatile and even decline further in the near term. WHAT TRIGGERED TODAY'S MARKET CRASH?  The answer lies in a complex web of negative global events. Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd, highlighted that the US imposing sanctions on Russian oil exports pushed the rupee to a fresh low against the dollar, which in turn triggered a "massive correction in domestic equity markets as overseas investors continued to desert the local share market". "Wide-spread selling across the sectors fuelled along with massive exits in mid and small-cap stocks further worsened the sentiment. Rising crude oil prices would raise concerns of a spike in domestic inflation, which could further delay any rate cut hopes from the RBI in the near to medium term," Tapse added. Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services, highlighted similar points. He said, "The global markets witnessed a significant sell-off, prompting a similar response in domestic markets due to strong US payroll data suggesting fewer rate cuts in 2025. This has strengthened the dollar, driven up bond yields, and made emerging markets less attractive."He also added that recent GDP downgrades and slowing earnings amid higher valuations are weighing heavily on market sentiment."Expect volatility in the near term, with the 2025 budget, Q3 results, RBI policy, and Trump's policies as key factors to define the trend in the short-term," Nair said. Ajit Mishra, SVP (Research) at Religare Broking Ltd, shared details outlining the market's technical weakness. "The sell-off was broad-based, with realty, metal, and energy sectors taking the biggest hits. The broader indices also experienced significant losses, plunging nearly 4% each," he said. "The Nifty has decisively broken below the November 2024 low of 23,263.15, accompanied by a noticeable rise in the volatility index, signaling further downside risks. The next significant support is at the 22,700 level, although oversold conditions in select heavyweight stocks may lead to brief pauses in the downtrend," he explained. WHAT'S NEXT?Prashanth Tapse pointed out that the rise in global crude oil prices, with Brent Crude breaching $81 per barrel, has reignited inflationary concerns, further dampening market sentiment. He warned that the global macroeconomic environment, coupled with continued foreign outflows, has made it more challenging for Indian equities to attract investments.It is worth noting that foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have been key drivers of market volatility, pulling over $4 billion from Indian equities this month alone. This follows an outflow of $11 billion in the previous quarter. Looking forward, analysts suggest that markets could remain weak until March, with stability expected to return around April. Emkay Global, in a recent note, projected that the Nifty could remain subdued, with a conservative target of 25,000 for 2025.However, it noted that small and mid-cap stocks could outperform, offering a glimmer of hope for investors seeking opportunities beyond the large-cap index.Ajit Mishra advised traders to maintain a "sell on rise" approach for the index while prioritising risk management. "Among sectors, IT, FMCG, and select pharma stocks are relatively stable, while others remain under considerable pressure. Headline: Retail inflation eases to 4-month low of 5.22% in DecemberIndia's inflation eased to 5.22% in December 2024 as food prices slowed, with the RBI maintaining a cautious policy stance.
Content: India’s retail inflation dipped to a four-month low of 5.22% in December 2024, driven by a slowdown in food price increases, according to data released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI). This marks a steady retreat within the Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) target range of 2–6%.EASING FOOD INFLATION LEADS THE WAY The moderation in retail inflation was primarily attributed to a decline in food inflation, which fell to 8.39% in December from 9.04% in November. Seasonal factors and improved supply chains contributed to the slowdown. However, certain categories such as meat, fish, eggs, and fruits saw prices rising faster than in the previous month. Food prices had remained elevated for over a year, crossing 7% between November 2023 and June 2024, largely due to uneven monsoon rains. Despite the easing, food price volatility remains a concern for economists and policymakers.STATE-WISE INFLATION TRENDS Inflation rates varied across states, with 13 out of 22 states reporting inflation above the national average of 5.22% in December. States like Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, and Maharashtra reported lower inflation than the national average, reflecting regional variations in price pressures.RBI HOLDS STEADY ON INTEREST RATES The RBI maintained its benchmark repo rate at 6.5% during its December 2024 Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting, signalling a cautious approach to monetary policy. The central bank reiterated its commitment to aligning inflation with its medium-term target of 4% while fostering economic growth. Looking ahead, the RBI expects CPI inflation to average 4.8% for FY25, up from its earlier estimate of 4.5%, largely due to persistent food price pressures and weaker consumption demand. As India steps into 2025, the easing inflation brings some relief to households, but challenges remain with volatile food prices and economic headwinds. The RBI’s calibrated approach to interest rates and the government’s policy interventions will play a critical role in maintaining this delicate balance.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 13, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Stocks to watch today: JSW Cements, HDFC AMC, HCLTech, BEL, Adani WilmarStocks such as JSW Cements, HDFC AMC, HCLTech, Delta Corp, United Spirits, and BEL are expected to remain in focus.
Content:
After a sharp decline on Monday that saw the stock market lose over 1.5%, investors are closely monitoring key developments and quarterly results that could impact today’s trading session. Stocks such as JSW Cements, HDFC AMC, HCLTech, Delta Corp, United Spirits, and BEL are expected to remain in focus. The Nifty 50 index is under pressure, with technical indicators suggesting further weakness. While RSI indicates near-term oversold conditions, 23,000 will act as a psychological support level, with the next support around 22,800." Vaibhav Vidwani, a research analyst at Bonanza, attributed the sell-off to multiple factors, including profit booking by foreign investors, weak government spending on capital expenditure, and rising food inflation. He further added that concerns over US economic data, particularly a strong jobs report that reduced the likelihood of Federal Reserve rate cuts in 2025, have also contributed to market volatility. Additionally, the rupee hitting a lifetime low against the dollar has further added to investor concerns.Stocks in focus HDFC AMC and Network18 Q3:
HDFC Asset Management Company (HDFC AMC) and Network18 will be under the spotlight as both firms are set to announce their Q3 FY25 results today. JSW Cements:
JSW Cements, part of the Sajjan Jindal-led JSW Group, has received approval to raise Rs 4,000 crore through an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO will consist of a fresh issue worth Rs 2,000 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of Rs 2,000 crore by existing shareholders. HCL Technologies reported a 6% year-on-year increase in consolidated net profit for the December quarter, reaching Rs 4,591 crore. The IT services giant’s results reflect consistent growth in its business operations. Delta Corp:

JSW Energy emerged as the successful applicant in acquiring KSK Mahanadi Power Company, which owns thermal power plants with a capacity of 3,600 MW. The acquisition was completed under insolvency proceedings. United Spirits:
Hina Nagarajan, the current managing director and CEO of United Spirits, has announced her resignation effective 31 March 2025. Praveen Someshwar will take over as MD and CEO starting 1 April 2025. Bartronics India:
Promoter Kinex India is expected to sell a 6.29% stake in Bartronics India through an offer for sale on 14 and 15 January 2025. BEL (Bharat Electronics Limited):
BEL has secured new orders worth Rs 561 crore since 23 December 2024. The orders include communication equipment, electro-optics, radar upgrades, and spares. With these additions, BEL’s order book for the current fiscal has reached Rs 10,362 crore.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 14, 2025

Headline: Red alert on Dalal Street: Should investors worry?Sensex, Nifty today: While the sharp decline may cause concern, historical data suggests that market corrections are not uncommon.
Content: The stock market took a huge hit on Monday, leaving investors concerned as nearly Rs 13 lakh crore of wealth was wiped out in a sharp market decline. The Sensex tumbled over 1,000 points, while the Nifty50 struggled to hold above the key 23,000 mark. This extended the ongoing downtrend, with both indices losing over 7% in the past month and more than 2% since the start of the year. Vaibhav Vidwani, a research analyst at Bonanza, explained the reasons for the market crash and said, "Profit booking by foreign investors, weak government spending on capital expenditure, and rising food inflation were major drivers of the sell-off. Concerns about U.S. economic data, particularly a strong jobs report, have reduced the chances of Federal Reserve rate cuts in 2025, increasing global market volatility. Additionally, the rupee hitting an all-time low against the dollar has further impacted investor sentiment." Another key factor weighing on the markets is the rise in global crude oil prices. Brent Crude recently crossed $81 per barrel, which has reignited fears of higher inflation. Prashanth Tapse noted that this, combined with foreign investor outflows, has made it difficult for Indian equities to attract new investments. Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have been net sellers this month, pulling out over $4 billion from Indian equities. This follows an outflow of $11 billion in the previous quarter, highlighting the pressure on domestic markets.SHOULD INVESTORS PANIC?  Nilesh D Naik, Head of Investment Products at Share.Market, explained, "A 10-12% drop from the peak should not be a cause for panic. Over the last 20 years, the market has traded more than 10% below its peak on 34.73% of trading days, more than 20% lower on 16.45% of days, and over 30% lower on 6.73% of days." He added, "Stopping systematic investment plans (SIPs) during such corrections is counterproductive. It’s like a batsman leaving the crease when an easy bowler comes to bowl. Continuing SIPs through downturns often pays off in the long term." Radhika Gupta, the Managing Director and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, shared valuable insights, stressing the need for investors to remain composed and focus on long-term goals. Gupta acknowledged the day’s market challenges, calling it one of the most significant declines, with midcap indices dropping by 4%. She pointed out that the markets have seen a cumulative fall of about 14-15% since their peak last September. In response to the volatility, Gupta advised investors to resist the urge to make hasty decisions. She said, "With times like this, all the news you see, there is a natural temptation to panic and take action that may not be good for your portfolio. My advice to you would be to embrace the volatility and try to hold on for the long term."WHAT NEXT FOR THE MARKET? Analysts expect the markets to remain weak in the short term. Emkay Global has projected a conservative Nifty target of 25,000 for 2025, with expectations of subdued performance until March. However, there is some optimism for smaller stocks. "Small and mid-cap stocks could outperform in the current environment, providing opportunities for investors willing to take a slightly higher risk," Emkay Global noted in its recent report. Ajit Mishra advised a "sell on rise" strategy for traders, suggesting they focus on relatively stable sectors like IT, FMCG, and select pharma stocks. He also highlighted the importance of managing risks and adjusting stock-specific positions as per market conditions. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 14, 2025Must Watch

Headline: TikTok US may go to Elon Musk as China explores potential sale: ReportChinese authorities want to keep TikTok under the control of its parent company, ByteDance. One potential scenario involves Elon Musk's social media platform, X, acquiring TikTok US and running it jointly with ByteDance.
Content: Chinese officials are considering selling TikTok's United States operations to billionaire Elon Musk if the app is unable to avoid an impending ban, reported Bloomberg.  The report suggests that Chinese authorities would rather keep TikTok under the control of its parent company, ByteDance. However, mounting pressure from US lawmakers over national security concerns may leave no option but to sell TikTok’s US division. One potential scenario involves Elon Musk’s social media platform, X, acquiring TikTok US and running it jointly with ByteDance. The report notes that no final decision has been made, and discussions remain inconclusive. ByteDance has consistently maintained that China’s stake in the company, often referred to as a "golden share," has no influence over TikTok's global operations outside of China. However, members of the US Congress have argued otherwise, claiming the "golden share" gives Beijing undue control, as per the report. A TikTok spokesperson dismissed the Bloomberg report, saying, “We can't be expected to comment on pure fiction.” It is unclear whether ByteDance or Elon Musk has been involved in any formal talks about a potential deal. TikTok has been under scrutiny for years over concerns that user data could be accessed by the Chinese government. The company has repeatedly denied these allegations, stating that data from US users is stored securely within the United States. The backdrop to these discussions is a US Supreme Court review of a law that could lead to a ban or forced sale of TikTok’s US operations by 19 January. US authorities argue that TikTok poses a national security risk due to its ties to China. China’s Cyberspace Administration and Ministry of Commerce, along with representatives from Elon Musk’s companies, have yet to comment on the Bloomberg report.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 14, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Stock market holiday: Are BSE, NSE open on January 14, Makar Sankranti?The holiday schedules for the BSE and NSE are determined based on national holidays and key religious and cultural festivals that are widely observed across the country.
Content: Amid the market downturn, a break on Dalal Street might have been welcomed, but the BSE and NSE holiday schedules indicate otherwise. India prepares to celebrate festivals like Makar Sankranti, Pongal, and Lohri on January 14. Many traders and investors are wondering whether the stock markets will remain closed for the festivities. However, according to the official holiday calendar released by the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE), the stock markets will remain open on this day. Despite the holiday mood across the country, January 14 is not listed as a trading holiday, meaning that both exchanges will operate as usual. Trading in equities, derivatives, bonds, commodities, and currencies will take place during regular market hours from 9.15 AM to 3.30 PM. The holiday schedules for the BSE and NSE are determined based on national holidays and key religious and cultural festivals that are widely observed across the country. While Makar Sankranti and Pongal are celebrated in many states, they are considered regional holidays and do not feature on the official list of trading holidays. For 2025, the BSE and NSE have announced a total of 14 holidays when the markets will remain closed. These include major festivals such as Diwali, Holi, and Eid, as well as national observances like Independence Day and Republic Day. However, regional festivals like Pongal, Ugadi, and Onam typically do not qualify for market holidays unless they coincide with other national events. While the stock markets will remain open, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has declared January 14 as a bank holiday in select states for Makar Sankranti and Pongal. This means that banking operations such as cheque clearing and branch services may be unavailable in some regions. Customers are advised to check with their local banks for specific details.Official stock market holidays for 2025 Here is the complete list of trading holidays for the Indian stock markets in 2025: February 26: Mahashivratri March 14: Holi March 31: Eid-Ul-Fitr (Ramzan Id) April 10: Shri Mahavir Jayanti April 14: Dr Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti April 18: Good Friday May 1: Maharashtra Day August 15: Independence Day August 27: Ganesh Chaturthi October 2: Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti October 21: Diwali (Laxmi Pujan) October 22: Diwali (Balipratipada) November 5: Prakash Gurpurb (Guru Nanak Jayanti) December 25: ChristmasPublished By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 14, 2025

Headline: Quadrant Future Tek listing: Shares make strong D-Street debut at 27% premium Quadrant Future Tek stock: The stock opened at Rs 370 on the NSE, reflecting a 27.5% premium over its IPO price of Rs 290.
Content: Quadrant Future Tek shares made an impressive debut on the stock market on Tuesday. The stock opened at Rs 370 on the NSE, reflecting a 27.5% premium over its IPO price of Rs 290. On the BSE, the listing was slightly higher at Rs 374, marking a 29% gain. Despite the strong start, the listing price did not quite align with the grey market trends ahead of the listing of the IPO. The company had raised Rs 130.50 crore from anchor investors in the lead-up to the public issue, which opened on 6 January 2024. Allotment of shares for Quadrant Future Tek IPO (initial public offering) was finalised on January 10, after the public listing saw massive interest from investors over its 3-day bidding process. Quadrant Future Tek IPO received a strong response from investors and was oversubscribed by 195.96 times by the end of its third day on January 9, 2025. The retail segment saw the highest demand with subscriptions soaring to 256.46 times. The qualified institutional buyers (QIB) category followed at 139.77 times, while non-institutional investors (NII) showed significant interest at 268.03 times. Quadrant Future Tek IPO opened for bidding on January 7, 2025 looking to raise Rs 290.00 crore through its listing. The price band for the IPO was set between Rs 230 and Rs 243 per share. Investors could apply for a minimum lot size of 61 shares, which required a retail investment of Rs 14,823. Quadrant Future Tek Limited, established in September 2015, specialises in developing advanced Train Control and Signaling Systems for the Indian Railways' KAVACH project. This initiative is designed to improve passenger safety and ensure greater reliability in railway operations. In addition to its focus on railway technology, the company operates a manufacturing facility for specialised cables, which includes an Electron Beam Irradiation Centre, enabling precision and durability in cable production.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 14, 2025

Headline: JSW Energy shares price rises 6% today. Here's why JSW Energy share price: The stock has lost 20.14% in the last month and 23.69% over the past six months. Despite the recent decline, JSW Energy has gained 16.15% over the past year.
Content: JSW Energy shares surged 6% in early trade on Tuesday, breaking its eight-day losing streak. The stock was trading at Rs 549.60, up 6.09%, as of the time this article was written. This surge boosted the company’s market capitalisation to Rs 96,057.35 crore. JSW Energy shares closed at Rs 518.05 in the previous session. The stock opened at Rs 528.15 on the BSE, signalling a positive sentiment among investors. This gain follows a month of declining performance, with the stock losing 20.14% in the last month and 23.69% over the past six months. Despite the recent decline, JSW Energy has gained 16.15% over the past year. The rise in JSW Energy's share price came a day after the company announced that its resolution plan for acquiring KSK Mahanadi Power Company Limited (KMPCL) had been approved by the committee of creditors. The acquisition is part of the corporate insolvency resolution process under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016. In an exchange filing post-market hours on Monday, JSW Energy confirmed that it had received a letter of intent from the resolution professional handling the insolvency process. KMPCL owns a 3,600 MW thermal power plant located in Chhattisgarh. Of this, 1,800 MW is currently operational, with 95% of the capacity tied up under long- and medium-term power purchase agreements (PPAs). The remaining 1,800 MW is under construction. One unit of 600 MW is 40% complete, while the remaining 1,200 MW has the necessary infrastructure in place. The plant has firm arrangements for water and coal transportation for its full capacity of 3,600 MW, which adds to its operational reliability. The acquisition of KMPCL strengthens JSW Energy’s position in the energy sector, particularly in the thermal power generation segment. It also increases the company’s total thermal generation capacity. Commenting on the development, Sharad Mahendra, Joint Managing Director and CEO of JSW Energy, said, “This strategic move positions the company to address India's increasing energy needs through a diversified energy mix, integrating both conventional and renewable sources. Strategically located near a coal block, the plant boasts PPA tie-ups and efficient operations, ensuring a reliable power supply." Mahendra added that JSW Energy is committed to exploring new opportunities and maintaining its leadership in the energy sector. The stock has shown volatility in recent months. Its 52-week high of Rs 804.95 was recorded on 24 September 2024, while its 52-week low of Rs 451.80 was hit on 17 January 2024. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 14, 2025

Headline: JSW Energy share price jumps nearly 7%. Why is it gaining today?JSW energy share price: The stock opened at Rs 528.15, and climbed to an intraday high of Rs 552.50 at around 11:07 am, marking a jump of 6.59% jump.
Content: JSW Energy shares surged over 6% in early trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) on Tuesday.  The stock opened at Rs 528.15, and climbed to an intraday high of Rs 552.50 at around 11:07 am, marking a jump of 6.59%. Today's gains come as a respite for JSW Energy’s stock, which has been on a downtrend since January 2, losing over 15% so far this month. A positive close today could break the stock’s eight-session losing streak. The rally in JSW Energy’s stock comes after the company announced that the committee of creditors had approved its resolution plan for KSK Mahanadi Power Company Limited (KMPCL). The acquisition, under the corporate insolvency resolution process of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code, 2016, marks a significant boost to JSW Energy’s thermal power generation capacity. “We wish to inform you that the resolution plan submitted by the company for KSK Mahanadi Power Company Limited has been approved by the committee of creditors. The company has received a letter of intent from the resolution professional on January 13, 2025,” JSW Energy stated in a post-market exchange filing on Monday. KMPCL owns a 3,600 MW thermal power plant in Chhattisgarh, of which 1,800 MW is currently operational. The remaining 1,800 MW is under construction, with one 600 MW unit 40% complete. The facility, which uses domestic coal, has firm water and coal transportation arrangements for its entire capacity, making it a strategically important asset. With the acquisition, JSW Energy’s total locked-in thermal capacity now stands at 7.5 GW, contributing to its total locked-in generation capacity of 28.2 GW. This positions the company well to achieve its target of 20 GW capacity well before 2030 and underscores its commitment to reaching net-zero emissions by 2050. Sharad Mahendra, Joint Managing Director and CEO, highlighted the strategic value of the plant. “Strategically located near a coal block, the plant ensures efficient operations and a reliable power supply,” he said, adding that the company will continue exploring new opportunities to meet India’s growing energy demands.
