Headline: Explained: Why HCLTech share price fell nearly 10% despite positive Q3 resultsHCLTech share price: At 10:46 am, HCLTech's shares were trading 9.02% lower at Rs 1,806.20 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, its shares hit an intraday low of Rs 1,798.40.
Content: Shares of HCL Technologies Ltd. fell nearly 10% on Tuesday despite the company meeting street expectations in its third quarter (Q3FY25) results. At 10:46 am, HCLTech's shares were trading 9.02% lower at Rs 1,806.20 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, its shares hit an intraday low of Rs 1,798.40.HCL Technologies Q3 results HCLTech reported a net profit of Rs 4,591 crore, a 5.5% year-on-year (YoY) increase from Rs 4,350 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Revenue from operations rose 5.07% YoY to Rs 29,890 crore. Earnings before interest and tax (EBIT) stood at Rs 5,821 crore, up 8.6% YoY, with EBIT margins improving by 90 basis points to 19.5%. The company raised its full-year constant currency revenue growth guidance to 4.5-5% but retained its EBIT margin guidance at 18-19%.WHY HCLTECH SHARES FELL TODAY? Despite healthy deal bookings worth $2.1 billion, muted management commentary on the near-term outlook weighed heavily on investor sentiment. Kotak Institutional Equities maintained a ‘reduce’ rating on the stock with a fair value of Rs 1,760, citing tepid large deal wins in recent quarters. The brokerage highlighted that HCLTech’s growth acceleration may lag peers due to its portfolio mix. “We expect HCL Tech to gain from opportunities during the recovery in discretionary spending but with slower growth compared to select peers,” the brokerage said. Nirmal Bang Institutional Equities issued a ‘buy’ rating, with a target price of Rs 2,282, citing the company’s strong deal pipeline in areas like GenAI and ERP automation. “While near-term growth appears muted, HCL Tech’s stable leadership and favorable business mix make it a solid long-term bet,” it noted. Global brokerage Nomura retained its ‘buy’ rating, setting a target price of Rs 2,000, while Morgan Stanley maintained an ‘equal-weight’ stance with a target of Rs 1,970. Simply put, HCLTech’s near-term performance faces hurdles, but analysts remain divided on its long-term prospects. While some highlight strong fundamentals, others flag valuation concerns and a sluggish large-deal pipeline. For now, investors seem wary of its subdued guidance despite stable financial metrics. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 14, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty rebound: What's driving today's gains, and will the recovery last?Despite today's rally, the stock market remains under pressure due to several factors, especially the impact of Q3 earnings and sustained selling by foreign institutional investors.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices rebounded on Tuesday after falling sharply to 7-month lows in the previous session. The S&P BSE Sensex was up over 400 points in early trade, while the NSE Niffty50 witnessed a similar rebound. Despite today’s rally, the stock market remains under pressure due to several factors, especially the impact of Q3 earnings and sustained selling by foreign institutional investors. While volatility has declined today, it also remains on the higher side, reflected by the wild swings that the broader market is encountering. Here are three reasons you need to know about today’s stock market rally and whether it will last:RETAIL INFLATION EASES TO 4-MONTH LOW Retail inflation eased to a four-month low in December, which is among the factors contributing to today’s market rally. A fall in retail inflation is likely to provide a boost to most sectors, especially FMCG. Though FMCG shares are down today due to the broader Q3 impact, the lower inflation is likely to provide a boost in the near-term.HEAVYWEIGHT SECTORS GAIN All Nifty sectoral indices rose except for IT, which fell nearly 2%. Heavyweight Nifty Bank and Nifty Financial Services indices also gained and added more steam to today’s recovery on Dalal Street. Nifty Metal also gained sharply after falling in the previous session. The index was up 2.48%, with Adani Enterprises jumping over 5% and Hindustan Zinc gaining nearly 4%.MAJOR STOCKS GAIN Some major stocks such also gained in early trade due to high trade volume. They are Adani Enterprises, Bajaj Finance, SBI and HDFC Bank. This also provided a boost to the stock market today, even as information technology stocks capped gains after a sharp fall in HCLTech’s share price following its Q3 results.WILL STOCK MARKET RECOVER IN NEAR TERM? Despite today's recovery in the Sensex and Nifty, analysts expect the stock market to remain under pressure in the near term due to continued FII selling, a stronger US dollar, and diminished hopes of rate cuts. So far, the Q3 earnings season has offered little cheer to the market, aside from a few bright spots like TCS, which posted stronger-than-expected results. Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd, said, “Investors are on edge ahead of the US inflation reports and the Federal Reserve meeting later this month. Persistent FII selling and rising crude oil prices continue to pressure the market.” Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, offered a broader view on the ongoing correction in domestic stocks. "The constant refrain from many saner voices that the broader market is overpriced and may correct sharply is now playing out. Reversion to mean valuations are happening in large caps, too,” he said,. “Strengthening dollar, 10-year US bond yields rising to above 4.7%, uncertainty regarding Trump’s actions after January 20, slowdown in India’s economy and poor corporate earnings, sharp surge in crude – all have combined to cause this market correction,” he added. However, Vijayakumar also noted that the market appears a “bit oversold” and added that this “favours a bounce back in the near term”. “But that trend, if it plays out, is unlikely to sustain. There is more pain likely in mid and small caps. There is a message from the net institutional activity in the market yesterday. DII buying was Rs 3,174 crore higher than FII selling,” he explained. “This means that smart money like HNIs are also selling in the market. The FII strategy of continuously adding to short positions this month has been successful. The sensible option for retail investors is to buy beaten down quality largecaps and wait patiently,” Vijayakumar said. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 14, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Truly disheartening: L&T HR head defends chairman amid 90-hour workweek rowL&T Chairman S N Subrahmanyan's 90-hour workweek remark made last week has triggered debate on work-life balance.
Content:
Larsen & Toubro (L&T), one of India’s leading conglomerates, found itself at the center of a heated debate after Chairman SN Subrahmanyan’s comments about employees working a 90-hour workweek sparked widespread backlash. The remarks, which quickly gained attention on social media, drew criticism from celebrities and industry leaders. However, L&T’s Head of HR, Sonica Muraleedharan, has stepped forward to defend the Chairman, urging a deeper understanding of his intent.advertisementHR HEAD CLARIFIES REMARKS WERE ‘CASUAL IN NATURE’In a LinkedIn post addressing the uproar, Muraleedharan expressed disappointment over what she termed as the misinterpretation of Subrahmanyan’s statements. “It’s truly disheartening to see how the words of our MD & Chairman, SN Subrahmanyan (SNS), have been taken out of context, leading to misunderstandings and unnecessary criticism,” she wrote.
 


 In a LinkedIn post addressing the uproar, Muraleedharan expressed disappointment over what she termed as the misinterpretation of Subrahmanyan’s statements. “It’s truly disheartening to see how the words of our MD & Chairman, SN Subrahmanyan (SNS), have been taken out of context, leading to misunderstandings and unnecessary criticism,” she wrote.
 


 She clarified that the Chairman’s remarks were casual and not intended as directives or policies. The controversy has reignited discussions about work-life balance in corporate India. Muraleedharan concluded her post by urging critics to look beyond isolated comments. “Leaders like SNS inspire positive change and growth, and it’s vital to recognise their efforts rather than misinterpret them,” she said. Headline: Adani Power, Adani Green: Why Adani Group shares jumped up to 18% todayAdani Group shares: At 12:05 pm, Adani Power soared 18.05% to Rs 531.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), while Adani Green Energy climbed 14.15% to Rs 1,015.80. Adani Enterprises, the group's flagship company, was trading 8% higher at Rs 2,401.75.
Content: Adani Group shares surged up to 18% during Tuesday’s trading session, with Adani Power and Adani Green Energy leading the rally. At 12:05 pm, Adani Power soared 18.05% to Rs 531.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), while Adani Green Energy climbed 14.15% to Rs 1,015.80. Adani Enterprises, the group’s flagship company, was trading 8% higher at Rs 2,401.75. Other Adani Group stocks also saw significant gains. Adani Energy Solutions rose 13.21% to Rs 779.40, while Adani Total Gas gained 12.30% to Rs 705.50. Adani Ports and SEZ was up 5.79% at Rs 1,128.50. Meanwhile, Adani-owned companies like ACC, Ambuja Cements, and NDTV registered gains of 4-8%.WHY ARE ADANI GROUP STOCKS RISING TODAY? The rally in Adani Group stocks followed a sharp increase in trading volumes, with Adani Power witnessing intraday gains of over 18%. The surge was also fuelled by a broad market rebound, as banking, auto, realty, and energy sectors led gains in early trade. Market sentiment was also boosted by renewed optimism about potential fundraising by the group. A report by Livemint, quoting Anshul Jain, Head of Research at Lakshmishree Investment and Securities, suggested that the market is buzzing with speculation regarding the group’s plans to raise capital. Adding to the bullish sentiment, Jain highlighted that former US President Donald Trump’s potential return to the White House could ease access to overseas funding for the Adani Group. This prospect has likely spurred fresh buying interest in the group’s stocks. The Adani Group’s performance comes as a relief after the recent downturn, where its shares struggled amid global and domestic market volatility. With today’s gains, the group’s stocks have regained some lost ground, offering a positive outlook for investors. For now, the market remains optimistic about the group’s ability to capitalise on emerging opportunities, supported by its diversified business portfolio and strong growth prospects. Headline: Explained: Why Biocon shares surged 7% today Biocon share price: The stock has gained 9.66% in the last month, 7.99% over the past six months, and an impressive 37.98% in the last year.
Content: Shares of Biocon surged over 6% in early trade on Tuesday, marking their second consecutive day of gains. The stock was trading at Rs 388.50, up 6.50%, at the time this artice was being written, with its market capitalisation standing at Rs 46,643.31 crore. It had closed at Rs 364.80 in the previous session. The stock opened at Rs 370 on the BSE, reflecting strong investor sentiment. The rise in Biocon's share price was primarily driven by an upgrade from global brokerage firm HSBC, which changed its rating on the stock to a "buy" and raised the price target to Rs 430, up nearly 50%. HSBC’s revised outlook is based on expectations of an operational turnaround for the company, supported by key developments and regulatory clearances. Biocon’s recent success in resolving regulatory issues at its manufacturing facilities played a major role in boosting investor confidence. Over the weekend, the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) reclassified Biocon’s Malaysia facility status to "Voluntary Action Indicated" (VAI), a significant improvement from the earlier "Official Action Indicated" (OAI) status issued in October 2023. The clearance of Biocon’s Malaysia facility is a key development, as it paves the way for the company to seek approvals and launch its insulin biosimilar, Aspart. This product, manufactured at the Malaysia unit, is considered a critical driver of Biocon’s growth in the coming years. Previously, the Malaysia plant had faced challenges, including five observations from the US FDA during a September 2023 inspection. The reclassification to VAI has now removed a major regulatory bottleneck for the company. The regulatory improvement has also had a positive impact on Biocon’s biosimilar pipeline, boosting market confidence in the company’s ability to launch new products and expand its market share.BROKERAGE VIEWS In addition to HSBC, Bank of America Securities also raised its price target for Biocon to Rs 435, an increase of nearly 9%. The brokerage reiterated its "buy" rating, citing the resolution of issues at Biocon’s manufacturing facilities in Bengaluru and Malaysia as a major confidence booster. Bank of America also highlighted the company’s growth potential, projecting an increase in annualised revenue from $1 billion in the first half of FY25 to $1.2 billion in FY26. The brokerage believes Biocon’s focus will now shift to reducing debt and delivering strong performances with its new launches. Biocon’s stock has shown resilience over the past year, despite facing challenges. The stock hit its 52-week high of Rs 395.65 on September 17, 2024 and a 52-week low of Rs 244.40 on March 20, 2024. The stock has gained 9.66% in the last month, 7.99% over the past six months, and an impressive 37.98% in the last year. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 14, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: What NRIs are expecting from Nirmala SitharamanAll eyes are on the Union Budget 2025, set to be announced in February, for key reform announcements.
Content: Non-Resident Indians (NRIs) are vital contributors to India’s economic growth through remittances, investments, and entrepreneurship. As the Union Budget for 2025-26 nears, NRIs are keenly observing the potential reforms and incentives that could bolster their contributions while simplifying compliance. Experts from EY India have outlined key expectations that could significantly impact the NRI community.TREATY RELIEF AT SOURCE Claiming tax relief under Double Taxation Avoidance Agreements currently involves tedious refund processes. Introducing provisions for treaty relief at the tax withholding stage, including necessary amendments to Form 16, could simplify this process, reduce administrative burdens, and ensure timely compliance.EXPANDING ESOP TAX BENEFITS India’s tax laws currently allow employees of eligible startups to defer taxes on ESOPs. Extending this benefit to all employees, including NRIs, regardless of the employer’s status, could enhance compensation structures and ease cash flow management for NRIs.SIMPLIFYING PROPERTY AND RENT TDS Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) procedures for property sales and rent payments can be complex for NRIs. Streamlined processes and enhanced digital infrastructure would make compliance more accessible and user-friendly.OVERCOMING E-VERIFICATION CHALLENGES NRIs often face hurdles in e-verifying tax returns due to the lack of Aadhaar or Indian bank accounts. Streamlining e-verification and ensuring seamless access to tax forms from overseas IP addresses could alleviate these challenges, making tax filing more efficient.EXTENDING SIMPLIFIED ITR-1 TO NRIs Given that many NRIs have limited income sources, expanding the eligibility of the simplified ITR-1 form to include them would significantly ease compliance.TAX REFUNDS AND PAYMENTS VIA OVERSEAS ACCOUNTS Delays in crediting refunds to overseas bank accounts and restrictions on tax payments through Indian accounts pose challenges for NRIs. Enabling smooth financial transactions through overseas accounts could resolve cash flow issues.REVISING DEADLINES FOR BELATED RETURNS Extending the deadline for filing belated or revised returns to 31 March of the assessment year would give NRIs more time to claim foreign tax credits, ensuring accurate and fair compliance. These proposed reforms promise to simplify tax compliance, enhance financial flexibility, and foster deeper engagement from the NRI community. As the government unveils the Union Budget, addressing these concerns could strengthen NRIs’ role in India’s growth story while ensuring a seamless tax ecosystem. The Budget is not just an announcement; it’s an opportunity to cement India’s position as a global economic powerhouse through inclusive policies.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 14, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: HCLTech shares tumble nearly 10% after Q3 results. What should investors do?Several brokerages have shared their views on the IT giant's Q3 results. Brokerage firm Morgan Stanley maintained an 'Equal-Weight' rating with a target price of Rs 1,970.
Content: HCL Technologies (HCLTech) shares fell 10% to hit an intraday low of Rs 1,798.40 on Tuesday, just a day after the release of its Q3FY25 results. At around 1:05 pm, shares of the company were trading 8.21% lower at Rs 1,822.30 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).  The company reported a nearly 6% increase in consolidated net profit to Rs 4,591 crore for the quarter ending December 2024, compared to Rs 4,350 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations rose 5% YoY to Rs 29,890 crore. Operating EBIT for the quarter stood at Rs 5,821 crore, reflecting a 4% YoY increase and a 9% QoQ jump. In constant currency terms, HCL Tech’s revenue grew 4% YoY, while USD revenues rose 3.5% YoY to $3.53 billion. C Vijayakumar, CEO and MD, highlighted broad-based growth and the company’s focus on digital and AI solutions. “We are positioning ourselves for a transformative future, with AI empowering businesses and employees,” he said. HCLTech also reported strong deal bookings of $2.1 billion for the quarter, with wins across its services and software businesses. Chairperson Roshni Nadar spoke about the potential of AI-led transformation. Nadar said, “We continue to deliver industry-leading performance with governance and sustainability at the core.” The company’s guidance for FY25 remains steady, with expected revenue growth of 4.5-5% YoY in constant currency and EBIT margins between 18-19%.BUY, SELL OR HOLD? Several brokerages have shared their views on the IT giant’s Q3 results. Brokerage firm Morgan Stanley maintained an 'Equal-Weight' rating with a target price of Rs 1,970. It said while services performance met expectations, software revenue fell short. The brokerage noted that the unchanged EBIT margin guidance offsets lower revenue growth projections. Nomura retained a 'Buy' rating on the HCLTech stock, setting a target price of Rs 2,000. The brokerage cited mixed results, but highlighted that FY25’s revenue growth guidance was raised to 4.5-5% YoY. It expects generative AI to drive future demand. Meanwhile, Nuvama downgraded the stock to 'Hold' with a target price of Rs 2,150. Despite decent growth in retail and telecom, analysts at Nuvama suggested that the valuation at 28.5x FY26 PE is stretched, though it praised HCL’s capital efficiency. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 14, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: How government can prioritise job creation and skill development The upcoming Budget 2025 is expected to focus on economic growth while addressing key challenges and leveraging opportunities.
Content: As India moves closer to its vision of becoming a 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047, all eyes are on the upcoming Budget 2025, which will play a pivotal role in shaping the country’s growth trajectory. With a focus on addressing key economic challenges while leveraging opportunities, the Budget is expected to prioritise long-term solutions aimed at economic growth, employment generation, and poverty alleviation.advertisementFOCUS ON SKILL DEVELOPMENT AND JOB CREATIONIndia’s demographic advantage, particularly its youthful population, holds immense potential. To harness this, the government is expected to continue its emphasis on skill development and job creation. India’s demographic advantage, particularly its youthful population, holds immense potential. To harness this, the government is expected to continue its emphasis on skill development and job creation. The Budget may announce measures to further bolster vocational training, encourage entrepreneurship, and incentivise businesses to employ the youth. This is likely to create a ripple effect, driving economic growth and enhancing consumption through higher incomes. Bharat Dhawan, Managing Partner, Forvis Mazars in India, has stated, “India’s strength lies in its people and the country has opportunities for the youth. We expect that the government will continue to prioritise skill development and job creation to tap into India's demographic advantage, which will drive economic growth and increase consumption through higher incomes.”TACKLING INFLATION AND STRENGTHENING INFRASTRUCTURE Inflation, especially food inflation, remains a concern for many households. The government is likely to introduce supply-side measures to alleviate the pressure, possibly through more efficient agricultural practices, improved storage facilities, and incentives for production. In the short term, direct benefit transfers (DBTs) could help support rural consumption, mitigating the impact of rising prices. Infrastructure development is also set to remain a key focus, with continued investments in roads, logistics parks, and multi-modal transport, strengthening the overall logistics sector.  “We expect to see a focus on long-term solutions to strengthen the agricultural value chain and incentivise production. In the short term, direct benefit transfers (DBTs) may help support rural consumption. Infrastructure development will also remain a key priority, with continued investment in roads, multi-modal logistics parks, and overall logistics,” mentioned Dhawan.PRIORITISING HEALTHCARE, EDUCATION, AND INNOVATION The Budget may also focus on strengthening key sectors such as healthcare, education, and skills development. Investments in these areas are essential for building a more inclusive and equitable society. Additionally, the government is likely to prioritise the integration of innovative technologies to foster inclusivity, formalisation, and transparent governance. Advancing digital infrastructure is also expected to be a key focus in policymaking. As India aims to build a sustainable and prosperous future, the 2025 Budget will be a key instrument in realising this vision. By focusing on inclusive growth and long-term solutions, it has the potential to unlock new avenues for development and economic transformation.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 14, 2025

Headline: Looking for an online personal loan? Check these 7 simple steps To avoid delays in your online personal loan application, ensure you meet the eligibility criteria and have all necessary documents ready.
Content: In today’s fast-paced world, applying for a personal loan has become a quick and hassle-free process. With a few clicks, you can raise a loan online through banks, non-banking financial companies (NBFCs), or fintech platforms. However, knowing the essential documents and steps is crucial to avoid delays and ensure smooth processing.REQUIRED DOCUMENTS To successfully apply for a personal loan online, you must provide the following key documents: Salary slips: Lenders require salary slips from the past three months to assess your repayment ability and financial stability. These slips help determine your net income after deductions. PAN card: This is a mandatory document for all income-tax-related transactions, ensuring compliance with legal requirements. Aadhaar card: Serving as both identity and address proof, your Aadhaar must be linked to your mobile number for eKYC verification. Employment proof: Documents such as an ID card or appointment letter validate your employment status. Some lenders might also request salary slips for the past six months. Bank statements: Statements from the last three to six months may be required to verify your financial transactions and liquidity. Address proof: Utility bills or other valid documents are necessary to confirm your current address.APPLICATION PROCESS Applying for a personal loan online is a streamlined and efficient process that saves time and effort. Here’s a detailed breakdown of the steps involved: Research: Start by researching various lenders, including banks, NBFCs, and digital fintech platforms. Compare their interest rates, loan terms, processing fees, and customer reviews to identify the lender that best suits your financial needs and repayment capacity. Check eligibility: Before proceeding, verify your eligibility using the tools provided on the lender's website or mobile app. This step helps you understand whether you meet the income, employment, and credit score criteria required for approval. Apply online: Once you have chosen the lender, navigate to their online portal or mobile app. Fill out the application form carefully, entering all required personal, professional, and financial details. Double-check for accuracy to avoid delays in processing. Submit documents: Upload the necessary documents as part of the application process. These typically include identity proof (Aadhaar), address proof (utility bills or similar), income proof (salary slips or bank statements), and employment proof (appointment letter or ID card). Ensure all documents are legible and up-to-date. Await approval: After submitting your application and documents, the lender will review them. Personal loan apps and digital platforms are known for their speedy processing, often providing approval decisions within hours. Accept terms: If your loan is approved, the lender will share the offer details, including the loan amount, tenure, interest rate, and repayment schedule. Take the time to thoroughly review these terms and conditions. If satisfied, accept the offer to proceed. Receive funds: Once you accept the terms, the approved loan amount will be directly credited to your registered bank account. The entire process, from application to disbursement, can often be completed within 24-48 hours. By following these steps, you can seamlessly apply for a personal loan online, ensuring a hassle-free experience and timely access to funds when you need them most.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 14, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Credit score check: Why and how often should you review it?A credit score is a numerical measure of your creditworthiness, based on payment history, debt, and credit history length.
Content: In today's financial world, your credit score plays a pivotal role in determining your ability to access loans, credit cards, and even housing. Regularly monitoring your credit score can help you maintain financial health and avoid surprises when applying for credit. But how often should you check your score, and what impact does it have?WHAT IS A CREDIT SCORE? A credit score is a numerical representation of your creditworthiness, calculated based on factors like your payment history, outstanding debt, and length of credit history. It helps lenders assess the risk of lending you money. Generally, the higher your score, the better your chances of securing favourable terms on loans or credit cards.HOW OFTEN SHOULD YOU CHECK YOUR CREDIT SCORE? It’s advisable to check your credit score at least once a year to ensure its accuracy. By doing so, you can spot any payment discrepancies, ensuring that all your recent payments, including credit card bills, are accurately reflected in your report. Additionally, if you identify any errors, correcting them promptly can prevent them from negatively impacting your score. Regularly checking your credit score also helps you plan your finances more effectively, as it allows you to assess your ability to qualify for loans at favourable interest rates. Contrary to the common misconception, checking your score frequently doesn’t harm it. There are two types of credit enquiries: soft and hard. A soft enquiry occurs when you or a company checks your score for informational purposes, and it doesn’t affect your score. A hard enquiry, on the other hand, happens when a lender checks your score to evaluate your loan application. While a hard enquiry may cause a temporary dip in your score, it doesn’t have long-term consequences unless there are too many hard enquiries.WHEN IS IT IMPORTANT TO REVIEW YOUR CREDIT SCORE Besides the annual check, it’s also wise to review your credit score before applying for a loan or credit card to ensure you qualify for the best terms. Additionally, if you pay off a large debt, clear errors, or go through a significant life event like a job loss, check your score to track any changes. In the fast-paced world of personal finance, understanding and monitoring your credit score is key to making informed financial decisions and maintaining a healthy credit profile. Checking it regularly empowers you to stay ahead of any issues and act before they affect your financial well-being.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 14, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty snap losing streak to end higher; Adani stocks gain up to 7%The S&P BSE Sensex gained169.62 points to close at 76,499.63, while the NSE Nifty50 added 90.10 points to end at 23,176.05.

"However, due to a lack of follow-through, the market remained rangebound and eventually settled at 23,176.05 with modest gains 90.10 points. Among sectors, PSU Banks and Metals were the top performers, while FMCG and IT were the only losers. The broader markets showed strong recovery, with Mid and Small Caps soaring by 2.45% and 1.98% respectively, outshining the benchmark index," he added.  In today's trading session, the consumer goods and technology sectors faced pressure and witnessed the most declines.  Adani Enterprises emerged as the top gainer with a substantial surge of 7.05%, followed by Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone which climbed 5.25%. Shriram Finance showed strong momentum with a 4.92% increase, while NTPC advanced 4.73%. Hindalco Industries rounded out the top gainers with a rise of 4.72%. On the losing side, HCL Technologies faced the steepest decline of 8.52%, while Hindustan Unilever dropped significantly by 3.35%. This current market has presented lucrative opportunities for the value stock investors."Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 14, 2025Must Watch

Headline: ITR filing: Why you should file belated, revised tax returns by January 15Taxpayers missing the original deadline must file a belated ITR to meet obligations.
Content: As the financial year 2024-25 nears its close, taxpayers must take note of the upcoming deadline for filing belated and revised income tax returns. The final date for submission is January 15, 2025, giving individuals a narrow window to comply and avoid penalties. This extension, granted by the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT), has already pushed the original deadline from December 31, 2024, by 15 days to provide taxpayers more time to complete their filings.advertisementWHO NEEDS TO FILE? Taxpayers who missed the original income tax filing deadline need to submit a belated Income Tax Return (ITR) to fulfil their tax obligations. On the other hand, those who have already filed but need to rectify errors or omissions in their returns can file a revised ITR to ensure accuracy. Under Section 139(5) of the Income Tax Act, 1961, taxpayers can revise their returns multiple times before the assessment is completed or up to three months prior to the end of the assessment year. However, revisions cannot increase refunds, reduce tax liabilities, or declare new losses. For those submitting a belated return, note that the default tax regime for FY 2023-24 is the new tax regime, limiting deductions to a Rs 50,000 standard deduction and NPS contributions.PENALTIES AND IMPORTANCE OF TIMELY FILING Filing belated returns under Section 139(4) attracts a penalty of Rs 5,000 for taxpayers with income exceeding Rs 5 lakh, while those with lower income face reduced penalties. Taxpayers with income below the Rs 3 lakh exemption limit incur no penalty. Missing the January 15, 2025, deadline will result in a Rs 10,000 penalty, underscoring the importance of timely filing.TIPS FOR LAST-MINUTE FILING For last-minute tax filing, use the Income Tax Department’s e-filing portal for a quick and hassle-free process. Ensure all details, such as income, deductions, and taxes paid, are accurate to avoid errors. Additionally, settle any pending tax dues, including interest and penalties, before filing to ensure compliance and avoid complications.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 14, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Mutual fund investors can now nominate up to 10 individuals. Details hereThe new rules enhance investor convenience while ensuring that the nomination process remains secure and transparent.
Content: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has revamped mutual fund nomination rules, introducing flexibility and transparency for investors. From March 1, 2025, Sebi’s revised guidelines allow mutual fund investors to nominate up to 10 individuals, aiming to address issues of unclaimed assets and improve asset management in cases of investor incapacity or death. This update enhances investor convenience while ensuring that the nomination process remains secure and transparent. Investors can now designate their assets amongst family members or associates with ease, fostering efficient wealth transmission.advertisementA QUICK LOOK INTO THE NEW GUIDELINES Under the new rules, investors must personally declare nominees, as Power of Attorney (PoA) holders are not authorised to complete this task. Each nominee’s details, including their Permanent Account Number (PAN), Aadhaar, or driving licence number, must be provided, along with their contact information and relationship with the investor. Nominees can hold joint accounts or maintain individual accounts for their respective shares. Sebi has also simplified the asset transmission process, requiring only essential documents such as a self-attested copy of the deceased investor's death certificate and updated Know Your Customer (KYC) details of the nominee. To promote transparency, regulated entities like mutual fund houses and depositories must offer online and offline nomination submission options. Online nominations will be verified using digital signatures or Aadhaar-based electronic signatures, with records retained for eight years after account transmission.ENHANCED INVESTOR PROTECTION The guidelines also aim to protect incapacitated investors by allowing nominees to manage portfolios and withdraw assets within set limits. Asset Management Companies (AMCs) must personally verify the investor’s approval using thumbprints or independently witnessed marks. Funds will only be transferred to verified bank accounts, and no changes to contact details or account information will be allowed, ensuring the legitimacy of transactions. Sebi's proactive measures pave the way for seamless wealth allocation and transmission. With increased flexibility and stringent security protocols, these changes empower investors to manage their assets confidently, ensuring their wealth is preserved for the future.Published By: Published On: Jan 14, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Are mutual funds risky in a turbulent stock market? Here's all you need to knowIs market turbulence shaking your mutual fund confidence? Find out why experts urge patience and see volatility as a buying opportunity, not a cause for alarm.
Content: The recent roller-coaster ride on Dalal Street has left many investors clutching their portfolios anxiously. With the Nifty 50 down nearly 12% from its September 2024 highs to touch lows near 23,250 in January 2025, the obvious question on investors’ minds is: Should I be worried about my mutual fund investments? The short answer, according to market experts, is a resounding no. In fact, experts from the industry indicate that despite the market turbulence, mutual funds have demonstrated resilience. December 2024 saw equity mutual funds attract inflows of Rs 41,155 crore, which marks a 14% increase from November. Even more telling is the record-breaking Rs 26,459 crore flowing into Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs), suggesting that experienced investors see this volatility as an opportunity rather than a threat. Following Monday’s stock market crash, Radhika Gupta, Managing Director and CEO of Edelweiss Mutual Fund, said, “Today has not been a very pretty day — it's one of the roughest falls, with midcap indices down 4%.” However, she explained that such market movements shouldn't trigger panic reactions. “With times like this, all the news you see, there is a natural temptation to panic and take action that may not be good for your portfolio,” she noted. "My advice to you would be to embrace the volatility and try to hold on for the long term.”STAY INVESTED OR CASH IN? For those tempted to halt their SIPs or switch to the perceived safety of fixed deposits, experts offer contrarian wisdom. Let SIPs continue because now you are buying units at cheaper levels, Gupta said. The strategy, known as cost averaging, often proves particularly effective during market downturns. “Generally, staggered investment is a good principle in these markets,” she added. Trivesh, COO of Tradejini, also pointed out some silver linings in the current market landscape. He noted that sectoral and thematic funds have attracted significant interest, pulling in Rs 15,331 crore in December alone. "Sectors like pharma and auto stood out, reinforcing the importance of aligning fund choices with sectoral strength," he said.DON'T PANIC For investors still struggling with market anxiety, there's a middle path. Instead of making dramatic moves to cash, Gupta recommended considering hybrid funds or balanced advantage funds, which offer a mix of equity and debt exposure. According to her, the balanced approach can help investors maintain their long-term investment journey while managing short-term market stress. Therefore, the key message from market experts is clear: Market cycles are natural, and current volatility, while unsettling, is not unusual. Rather than panicking, investors should view this period as an opportunity to accumulate units at lower prices. As Gupta put it, "Ups and downs are part of the market cycle. But what is very important is not to panic, to control our reactions and to go through our journey with emotional resilience." (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. Headline: 'We wouldn't do that': ITC chief Sanjiv Puri shares view on 90-hour workweekThe 90-hour workweek debate, triggered by L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan's comments, has faced criticism from industry leaders and celebrities.
Content: The ongoing debate about a 90-hour workweek, sparked by L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan’s recent comments, continues to stir reactions across the business world. While some leaders support longer working hours, ITC Chairman Sanjiv Puri mentioned the importance of aligning employees with the company’s bigger goals. Sanjiv Puri said on Tuesday that ITC focusses on having employees involved in the company's journey, rather than counting the hours they work, according to PTI.advertisementPURI ON EMPLOYEE EMPOWERMENTSpeaking at an event in Delhi, Puri made it clear that ITC does not believe in tracking the number of hours employees work but in helping them contribute to the company's larger journey. Speaking at an event in Delhi, Puri made it clear that ITC does not believe in tracking the number of hours employees work but in helping them contribute to the company's larger journey. "It’s about being part of the company's mission and feeling the drive to make a difference," Puri explained. Puri believes that personal empowerment and alignment with a company’s vision yield far better results than focusing on rigid work hours.INDUSTRY LEADERS AND CELEBRITIES REACT Subrahmanyan’s comments on the 90-hour workweek and his regret over not being able to make employees work on Sundays have caused a storm on social media. His statement, questioning employees' time at home, was met with criticism from celebrities and business leaders alike, including Anand Mahindra and Harsh Goenka, who voiced concerns about employee well-being and work-life balance. Bollywood actress Deepika Padukone also stressed the importance of mental health and personal time in maintaining long-term productivity.DEFENDING SUBRAHMANYAN’S REMARKS While Subrahmanyan's statements drew widespread criticism, L&T’s Head of HR, Sonica Muraleedharan, defended him, claiming that his words were misinterpreted. In a LinkedIn post, she urged the public to understand the context of his remarks, arguing that the intention behind his comments was to encourage a deeper commitment to work, not to undermine employees’ personal time. Moreover, Uma Srinivasan, Head of Talent Management at L&T, defended Chairman S.N. Subrahmanyan, and mentioned his empathy, commitment to employee well-being, and the company's dedication to its values, despite recent criticism.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 14, 2025

Headline: Meta layoffs: Decided to move out low-performers, says CEO Mark ZuckerbergThe decision, shared in an internal memo by CEO Mark Zuckerberg, focusses on improving overall performance by moving out those not meeting expectations more quickly than before.
Content: Meta Platforms Inc. has announced plans to cut about 5% of its lowest-performing employees this year, reported Bloomberg. The decision, shared in an internal memo by CEO Mark Zuckerberg, focusses on improving overall performance by moving out those not meeting expectations more quickly than before. In the memo, Zuckerberg said, “I’ve decided to raise the bar on performance management and move out low performers faster. We typically manage out people who aren’t meeting expectations over the course of a year, but now we’re going to do more extensive performance-based cuts during this cycle.” The planned reduction, according to the memo, is part of Meta's effort to achieve 10% "non-regrettable" attrition by the end of the current performance cycle. This includes around 5% from 2024 alone. Employees who have been with Meta long enough to receive a performance review and are deemed underperforming will be impacted. The company assured affected employees that they would receive “generous severance.” This announcement comes as Meta continues to restructure its policies and operations under Zuckerberg’s "Year of Efficiency" initiative, which was launched to optimise costs and streamline the organisation. Over the past year, Meta has already laid off thousands of employees, focusing on team realignment and cutting costs to enhance profitability. The layoffs coincide with several strategic and policy shifts at Meta, some of which have sparked internal and external discussions.  Meta recently made changes to its content moderation policies, loosening rules on posts related to controversial topics such as immigration and transgender rights. The company framed these changes as a step towards encouraging "free expression." However, the move faced criticism from employees and external groups, who expressed concerns about potential harm to marginalised communities. The company also announced the end of its third-party fact-checking programme in the United States. This decision raised fears about the possible spread of misinformation on Meta’s platforms, especially given its influence on public discourse. Meta has reduced internal programmes aimed at improving workforce diversity. The scaling back of these initiatives has drawn criticism, with some viewing it as a departure from its previously stated commitment to inclusivity.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 15, 2025Must Watch

Headline: PepsiCo enters bidding for Haldiram stake against Temasek, Alpha Wave: ReportPepsiCo has initiated discussions with the Aggarwal family, who own Haldiram, for a minority stake.
Content: PepsiCo has joined the race to acquire a stake in Haldiram Snacks Food, India’s largest ethnic snacks company, reported The Economic Times. The company has initiated discussions with the Aggarwal family, who own Haldiram, for a minority stake. This makes PepsiCo a late entrant in a competition that already includes global investment firms Temasek and Alpha Wave Global. Executives quoted in the report said PepsiCo’s leadership from its New York headquarters has started direct talks with the Aggarwal family in recent weeks. These discussions are still at an early stage and may not necessarily result in a deal. Unlike its Indian unit, the funding for this stake purchase will reportedly be led by PepsiCo’s US-based parent company. The Aggarwal family is seeking a valuation of Rs 85,000-90,000 crore for Haldiram as they look to bring in an external investor for the first time. Temasek and Alpha Wave Global have already submitted binding offers for a 10-15% stake in Haldiram. These offers were made last month, putting the firms in an advanced stage of negotiations. Temasek is said to be leading the discussions, with reports suggesting a potential investment of over $1 billion as per the report. Haldiram is a market leader in ethnic snacks, offering over 500 types of products, including namkeen, sweets, ready-to-eat meals, and pre-mixed food items. The company reported revenue of Rs 12,800 crore in FY24, more than double that of PepsiCo’s snacks business in India, which earned Rs 4,763.29 crore during the nine-month period from April to December 2023. For PepsiCo, which dominates the western snacks market with brands like Lay’s, Kurkure, and Doritos, this move could provide a foothold in the fast-growing ethnic snacks segment. PepsiCo holds a 24% market share in western snacks but has limited presence in traditional Indian snacks like namkeen and bhujiya. The Indian snacks market, worth Rs 42,694.9 crore in 2023 according to IMARC Group, is expected to grow to Rs 95,521.8 crore by 2032. However, it is highly fragmented, with numerous regional players such as Balaji, Bikanerwala, and Bikaji Foods competing alongside Haldiram. These regional brands often offer lower prices, direct distribution, and better retailer margins, challenging larger players like PepsiCo. PepsiCo India has been under pressure to expand its snacks division, especially as its beverages business is managed almost entirely by Varun Beverages Ltd (VBL), a listed company under RJ Corp.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 15, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: 3 key expectations of homebuyersThe housing sector plays an important role in India's GDP and employment generation, raising hopes for reforms to reduce costs and promote homeownership.
Content: Owning a home is a cherished dream for millions of Indians. With the Union Budget 2025 around the corner, home-loan borrowers are optimistic about policy changes that could make this dream more affordable and accessible. With the housing sector playing an important role in India’s GDP and employment generation, stakeholders anticipate reforms to ease financial burdens and boost homeownership.advertisementENHANCED TAX BENEFITSCurrently, borrowers can claim up to Rs 2 lakh per year as a deduction for interest paid on home loans under Section 24(b). However, this limit, unchanged since 2014, falls short of addressing the affordability gap, especially with soaring property prices even in smaller cities. Currently, borrowers can claim up to Rs 2 lakh per year as a deduction for interest paid on home loans under Section 24(b). However, this limit, unchanged since 2014, falls short of addressing the affordability gap, especially with soaring property prices even in smaller cities. Home loan borrowers hope for an increase in the deduction limits, making home loans more affordable. Similarly, introducing separate limits for principal repayment deductions or expanding existing ones can offer much-needed relief to borrowers, especially for salaried individuals constrained by other statutory contributions.EXPANDING SUPPORT MEASURES High interest rates remain a significant challenge for homebuyers, making monthly payments a financial strain. Reinstating earlier provisions that offered additional tax relief for first-time buyers could help offset these costs. Borrowers are also looking for changes in the new tax regime, such as including home-loan interest deductions, which could boost affordability and encourage more people to invest in housing.ADDRESSING CONSTRUCTION COSTS Rising construction costs and land prices have made housing increasingly expensive, particularly in urban areas. Supply-side measures like tax relief for builders, streamlined approvals, and incentives for affordable housing projects could reduce costs and make homes accessible to more buyers. Moreover, temporary reductions in stamp duty or state-level rebates for first-time buyers would significantly lower the overall cost of purchasing a home. With the Budget 2025, policymakers have a unique opportunity to address these concerns and make homeownership a reality for millions. By introducing thoughtful reforms, the government can ensure that housing is not just an aspiration but an attainable milestone in every Indian's journey. Headline: Budget 2025: Expectations for personal income tax reforms and moreThe middle-income group is looking forward to personal income tax revisions to ease their financial burden in the upcoming budget.
Content: With the Union Budget 2025 just around the corner, people are hopeful about measures that will boost disposable income and stimulate economic activity. The government’s fiscal policies are eagerly awaited, particularly by middle-income households, who play a pivotal role in driving India’s economy.FOCUS ON MIDDLE-INCOME HOUSEHOLDS There is growing anticipation for adjustments in personal income tax to alleviate the financial burden on middle-income taxpayers. Cutting tax slabs or raising exemption limits could greatly ease the financial strain on these households, helping them spend more while saving. This boost in consumption can play a key role in driving economic growth. Moreover, targeted tax benefits in forward-looking sectors, such as green energy, artificial intelligence (AI), and upskilling initiatives, could incentivise investments in these areas. Such measures not only align with India’s sustainable growth ambitions but also foster innovation and entrepreneurship in emerging fields. Dr. Suresh Ramanathan, Dean & Principal, Great Lakes Institute of Management, Chennai, stated, “A reduction in personal income tax slabs or raising the exemption limit could provide much-needed relief to middle-income households, who form the backbone of India’s economy.”SIMPLIFIED COMPLIANCE Simplifying the tax framework has been a longstanding demand of taxpayers. The Budget could introduce reforms that ease compliance, improve transparency, and make the filing process more user-friendly. Such measures would encourage more individuals and businesses to enter the tax net, ultimately broadening the tax base. Furthermore, it is important to establish a fair tax system where everyone contributes based on their income level. Policymakers must balance generating revenue with fairness to build trust amongst taxpayers. Dr. Ramanathan mentioned, “Policymakers must also consider measures that enhance taxpayer compliance through transparency and ease of filing, thus broadening the tax base.”BALANCING SHORT-TERM AND LONG-TERM GOALS The Budget presents an opportunity to strike a delicate balance between short-term economic needs and long-term structural reforms. While measures to boost consumption are crucial, investments in strategic sectors like renewable energy, technology, and education will ensure sustained growth. As Budget Day approaches, taxpayers and industry stakeholders alike await a financial plan that promotes prosperity and inclusivity. With well-thought-out policies, the government can pave the way for a robust and resilient economy while addressing immediate public concerns.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 15, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: LTCG tax relief in Budget 2025? What stock market investors are hoping forStock markets are buzzing with anticipation for the upcoming budget, especially after the Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced key changes to capital gains taxation in her seventh Budget.
Content: The stock market has emerged one of the most popular ways for people to grow their money, and has seen more and more Indians investing on the Dalal Street over the last few years. Yet, taxes on stock market gains are eating into investors' returns, making many think twice before investing. With rising inflation and taxes like the LTCG jumping from 10% to 12.5%, investors are finding their returns shrinking. As Budget 2025 approaches, market experts are strongly pushing for tax relief to keep stock market investments attractive. They say making taxes simpler and lighter could encourage more people to invest, helping both investors and the economy grow faster. The upcoming budget, which will mark Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's eighth presentation (including five annual and two interim budgets), is expected to have stock market investors on the hook.  Trivesh, COO of Tradejini, said, "Looking ahead to Budget 2025, I feel the government might propose a balance between addressing public expectations and sustaining economic stability amid evolving market conditions."  He further added that the impact of changes made in capital gains tax in budget 2024 has been notable. "For small investors, the new hike in Long-Term Capital Gains (LTCG) tax rates from 10% to 12.5%, mixed with the raised exemption limit to Rs 1.25 lakh, has had a measured effect," Trivesh said. He suggested that "streamlining the capital gains tax structure across asset classes by aligning rates and holding periods could reduce complexities and encourage broader participation in equity markets." Devarsh Vakil, Head of Prime Research at HDFC Securities, outlined key expectations for capital markets, including "stabilisation of capital gains taxation: Enhanced clarity and predictability, fostering greater confidence among investors." He also mentioned the possibility of "restoring indexation benefits, revising tax rates for long-term investments." VLA Ambala, Sebi Registered Research Analyst and Co-Founder of Stock Market Today, provided detailed insights into recent market performance. "According to the latest data, between April 1, 2024, and January 12, 2025, Securities Transaction Tax (STT) collections surged to Rs 44,538 crore, and other tax earnings amounted to an additional Rs 2,868 crores," she said.  Addressing current tax challenges, Ambala said, "The amount held in demat accounts has already been taxed or is not exempt from tax, creating a dual taxation structure that is detrimental to investors." He further notes that "the Long-Term Capital Gains (LTCG) tax burden was increased by 2.5%, inflating the rate to 12.50%, up from the previous 10%. Similarly, Short-Term Capital Gains (STCG) rose from 15% to 20% and are subject to tax at applicable income tax slab rates." Ambala advocated for tax relief and said, "I believe to ensure a more conducive investment environment, the government must consider offering relief to investors in the upcoming Union budget." She highlighted that "this mounting tax burden should be addressed urgently with suitable tax reliefs, particularly in STT, where the gains have already been taxed."Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 15, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Is merging old and new income tax regimes a good idea?Will merging the old and new tax regimes offer the best of both worlds for taxpayers? Experts weigh in on whether a unified system could simplify compliance or introduce new challenges.
Content: As the Union Budget 2025 approaches, the country’s vast middle class population is eagerly awaiting announcements related to income tax. As always, the air is thick with speculation about potential relief measures, including tax breaks for those earning up to Rs 15 lakh and an increased standard deduction under the new income tax regime. However, much like previous years, experts predict that the government is unlikely to introduce any major changes to the old income tax regime. This stagnancy has led to rising discussions about whether it’s time to scrap the old regime altogether. Yet, such a move would be risky, given the sizeable number of taxpayers who rely on benefits like home loan interest deductions. To avoid backlash, another option can be considered: merging the old and new tax regimes.WHY WAS NEW TAX REGIME INTRODUCED? The new tax regime was introduced in the Union Budget 2020 to simplify the taxation process. By offering lower tax rates with fewer deductions, the government aimed to encourage greater participation in tax compliance while streamlining operations for the tax department. “The government has prioritised the new tax regime to simplify the taxation process and enhance compliance. It was also aimed at letting individuals not having to make forced investments or donations for saving taxes, thereby making more cash available at their disposal,” said Kumarmanglam Vijay, Partner at JSA Advocates & Solicitors. The preference for the new tax regime is evident, as nearly two-thirds of individual taxpayers have opted for it. According to a recent report, over 67% of taxpayers now choose the new tax regime, underscoring its growing popularity. Merging the old and new tax regimes could potentially offer the best of both worlds. Taxpayers would retain the deductions available under the old regime while benefiting from the higher tax slabs of the new regime, leading to significant tax savings for eligible individuals. However, this comes with its own set of challenges. “The cost of compliance under the old tax regime is significantly higher. Merging the two would mean additional compliance burdens for taxpayers, companies, and the tax administration,” said Kumarmanglam Vijay. He further highlighted that simplification should not come at the expense of key taxpayer benefits. Subhash Chand Aggarwal, Chairman and Managing Director of SMC Global Securities Limited, added another perspective. “The old tax regime charges higher tax rates but provides more exemption and deduction benefits, while the new tax regime offers the opposite. Merging the two can simplify the tax structure but could disadvantage those who don’t invest enough to claim deductions under the old regime,” he said. Aggarwal added that the flexibility of two separate regimes allows taxpayers to choose based on their income levels and long-term financial goals. “There’s certainly a need to simplify the tax structure, but maintaining two regimes offers taxpayers the ability to make more informed decisions regarding their investments and spending,” he said. While merging the two regimes may seem like a step toward simplification, it could lead to unintended consequences. Taxpayers who rely heavily on deductions might face a loss of benefits, while the government risks a reduction in tax revenue. Additionally, the increased administrative burden on employers and tax authorities could outweigh the benefits of a unified regime. “The need of the hour is to raise the tax slabs with fewer unambiguous deductions to ensure ease of compliance for all,” said Vijay. He warned that merging the regimes could be counterproductive, as it might reintroduce the complexities the new tax regime sought to eliminate. As Budget 2025 approaches, the government’s focus is likely to remain on promoting compliance and simplifying tax administration. Whether it opts to merge the old and new regimes or continues to offer them separately, taxpayers can expect the ongoing debate to shape the future of India’s taxation system. For now, experts advise taxpayers to carefully evaluate their options under both regimes, considering their income levels, deduction claims, and long-term financial objectives. With clarity expected in the upcoming budget, all eyes will be on the Finance Minister’s announcements regarding income tax reforms.With inputs from Sonu Vivek Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 15, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: 10 key financial terms every taxpayer must knowThe Union Budget 2025 will be presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on February 1.
Content: With the Union Budget 2025 just around the corner, all eyes are on Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman as she prepares to unveil the financial roadmap for the nation. To fully grasp the announcements and their implications, understanding key budgetary terms is important. Let’s have a quick look at some of the 10 most important terms that every taxpayer should know.advertisementCAPITAL EXPENDITURE (CAPEX) Capital expenditure refers to the money allocated by the government for developing long-term assets such as roads, railways, and other infrastructure. This type of spending is aimed at boosting economic growth and creating employment opportunities.REVENUE EXPENDITURE Unlike capex, revenue expenditure involves day-to-day operational costs such as salaries, subsidies, and maintenance. It also includes interest payments on the government’s debt.REVENUE RECEIPT These are the earnings of the government through taxation, fees, and services. For instance, the money collected through income tax, GST, or fines forms part of revenue receipts.DIRECT TAXES These are taxes collected directly from individuals or entities, including income tax and corporate tax. They directly affect taxpayers and form a major part of the government's revenue.INDIRECT TAXES Indirect taxes are applied to goods and services, such as GST and excise duty. These are not paid directly by individuals but are included in the prices of goods and services consumed.TAX DEDUCTION A tax deduction reduces the amount of income that is subject to tax. Investments in schemes like PPF, ELSS, or fixed deposits make taxpayers eligible for these deductions.REBATE A rebate reduces the overall tax liability, offering relief to taxpayers. It encourages spending or investing, contributing to economic growth.FISCAL DEFICIT The fiscal deficit indicates the gap between the government’s total expenditure and revenue. It is filled through borrowing and reflects the financial health of the economy.FISCAL POLICY This is the government’s strategy for managing the economy through taxation and spending to control inflation and promote growth.INFLATION Inflation, which is marked by an increase in the general price level of goods and services, decreases the purchasing power of money. Managing it is critical for maintaining economic stability. Understanding these key terms can empower taxpayers to better grasp the budget’s impact. As Budget 2025 unfolds, these concepts will play a critical role in shaping the economic narrative, ensuring everyone stays informed and prepared.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 15, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Laxmi Dental IPO to close for bidding: Should you invest? Check latest GMPLaxmi Dental IPO is expected to be listed on both the BSE and NSE, with the tentative listing date scheduled for Monday, January 20, 2025.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Laxmi Dental Limited saw strong subscription numbers as investors showed huge interest, with the public issue subscribed over 90 times as of the latest update on Wednesday.  Laxmi Dental IPO will remain open for subscription until January 15, 2024 with allotment for shares expected to be completed on January 16, 2025. Breaking down the numbers, retail investors put in bids for 65.4 times more shares than were available in their category. Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs), which include mutual funds and foreign investors, bid for about 81 times their portion. The most enthusiastic response came from Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs), typically wealthy individuals and family offices, who bid for a massive 134 times their allocated shares as of 3:09 PM on the last day of the IPO.  The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 407 and Rs 428 per share. Retail investors can apply for a minimum of 33 shares, translating to an initial investment of Rs 14,124. For small non-institutional investors (sNII), the minimum application size is 15 lots, which equals 495 shares and requires an investment of Rs 2,11,860. Meanwhile, for large non-institutional investors (bNII), the minimum requirement is 71 lots, or 2,343 shares, amounting to Rs 10,02,804.SHOULD YOU SUBSCRIBE? Master Capital Services Ltd in its IPO report said that the global dental consumables market is expected to grow at a CAGR of 10.5% from USD 177.4 billion in 2023 to USD 356.8 billion in 2030, and emerging countries such as India and China are expected to witness higher growth compared to developed countries. It further added that the company is one of the very few organised players in dental laboratories segment having sufficient scale of operations, following quality standards, and catering to both domestic and international markets. "The company continues to scale up branded product offerings and undertake product enhancements of existing dental products and launch new dental products. Investors looking to invest can invest in the IPO for the long term," said Master Capital Services Ltd.LATEST GMP FOR LAXMI DENTAL IPO The latest grey market premium (GMP) for the Laxmi Dental IPO stands at Rs 125 as of January 13, 2025, at 10:55 AM. Given the IPO's price band of Rs 428, the estimated listing price is projected to be around Rs 553. This calculation is based on adding the cap price to the current GMP. If these projections hold, investors could see an estimated gain of 29.21% per share upon listing. Laxmi Dental IPO raised Rs 314.13 crore from anchor investors ahead of opening for subscription. Laxmi Dental IPO is expected to be listed on both the BSE and NSE, with the tentative listing date scheduled for Monday, January 20,  2025. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 15, 2025

Headline: EPF withdrawal: Why you should link Aadhaar and UAN todayLinking bank accounts with UAN simplifies EPF management for a seemless experience.
Content:
With the deadline for activating your Universal Account Number (UAN) and linking it with your bank account now extended to January 15, 2025, employees across India have one last chance to ensure they’re ready for the Employment Linked Incentive (ELI) Scheme benefits introduced in the Union Budget 2024. Initially set for November 30, the deadline has been extended twice to ensure maximum compliance and participation.advertisementBENEFITS OF LINKING YOUR BANK ACCOUNT TO UANEPFO (Employees Provident Fund Organisation) wrote on X, “Bank Account Seeding with UAN simplifies managing your EPF contributions and transactions! By linking your bank account to your Universal Account Number (UAN), you ensure seamless transfers, easy withdrawals, and quick access to your EPF balance.”
 


 EPFO (Employees Provident Fund Organisation) wrote on X, “Bank Account Seeding with UAN simplifies managing your EPF contributions and transactions! By linking your bank account to your Universal Account Number (UAN), you ensure seamless transfers, easy withdrawals, and quick access to your EPF balance.”
 


 Linking your bank account to your UAN offers several benefits, thus, making it easier to manage your EPF. Once your bank account is linked to your UAN, your monthly EPF contributions will be transferred directly to your account, giving you easy and immediate access to your money. This ensures that you won’t face delays when moving between jobs or planning for retirement. Moreover, linking your bank account to your UAN enhances security, as it ensures compliance with Know Your Customer (KYC) regulations. It makes the process more transparent, reducing the chances of fraud or unauthorised withdrawals. The EPFO has stated that bank account seeding with UAN simplifies EPF management, ensuring a smooth experience for employees.HOW TO LINK YOUR BANK ACCOUNT WITH UAN To activate your UAN and link your bank account, follow these simple steps: To link your bank account with your UAN, start by logging into the official EPFO member portal using your credentials. Once logged in, go to the ‘Manage’ tab and select ‘KYC’ from the dropdown menu. Check your current bank details, and if needed, update your account number and IFSC code. An OTP will be sent to your Aadhaar-linked mobile number for verification. After entering the OTP, your bank account will be successfully linked to your UAN. Completing the process today will not only help you benefit from the ELI Scheme but also streamline the management of your EPF for years to come.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 15, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty climb as IT stocks shine ahead of US inflation dataThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 224.45 points to close at 76,724.08, while the NSE Nifty50 added 371.5 points to end at 23,213.20.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices saw a brief respite on Wednesday as they closed higher, fuelled by a rise in IT sector stocks which were helped amid anticipation of US inflation data.  The S&P BSE Sensex gained 224.45 points to close at 76,724.08, while the NSE Nifty50 added 371.5 points to end at 23,213.20.  Persistent Systems emerged as the top performer on the NIfty50 IT index with a robust gain of 3.74%, followed by L&T Technology Services which rose 3.47%. Tech Mahindra advanced by 1.67%, while LTI Mindtree gained 1.36%. HCL Technologies moved up by 0.67%, and Infosys climbed 0.60%. Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) showed a modest increase of 0.53%, while Coforge edged up by 0.09%. However, Mphasis and Wipro bucked the trend, declining marginally by 0.08% and 0.09% respectively. Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services said that the domestic market continues to be volatile on account of elevated US bond yields, strengthening dollar, and increasing FIIs outflows. "Global markets are cautious ahead of the US December CPI inflation data, which is anticipated to be in the elevated range in the short-term, limiting FED’s ability to cut rates. Also, a rise in oil prices & dollar appreciation is likely to affect domestic inflation in the near future," he added.  NTPC led the gainers on Nifty50 with a strong surge of 4.01%, followed by Trent Limited which rose 3.86%. Power Grid Corporation showed robust momentum, climbing 2.88%, while Kotak Mahindra Bank advanced 2.14%. Maruti Suzuki India rounded out the top gainers with a gain of 1.91%. On the declining side, Mahindra & Mahindra faced the steepest fall of 2.90%, while Axis Bank dropped 2.53%. Bajaj Finserv declined 2.26%, followed by Bajaj Finance which fell 2.21%. Shriram Finance completed the list of major losers with a decline of 1.77%. Vaibhav Vidwani, Research Analyst, Bonanza, said, "A mix of sector performances, characterised the day’s trading with Pharma and auto stocks facing pressure, while realty and Infra sectors showed resilience. Anticipation of the Union Budget and forthcoming quarterly earnings of listed companies bolstered investor optimism." VLA Ambala, Co-Founder of Stock Market Today said that Nifty formed a Spinning Top candlestick pattern in the latest session. "Considering the prevailing market sentiment, the benchmark index could gain support at 23,080, 23,010, or 22,970 and expect resistance between 23,350 and 23,410 in the next session," she added.
