Headline: Global bond sell-off: What's going on, and will it have any impact on India?As the global bond sell-off continues to accelerate, here's how rising yields and higher borrowing costs may impact the Indian economy and stock markets.
Content: The recent bloodbath in global bond markets has sent shivers down investors' spines. While bond yields and market dynamics might sound like distant concerns to many Indians, the truth is that this sell-off hits closer to home than most realise. Recent data paint a concerning picture of what's really happening and why it matters to all Indians. Remember that last home loan application? Well, the same basic principle applies to governments – they need to borrow money too. Right now, we're watching a dramatic exodus from government bonds worldwide. The US Treasury yields have shot up to 4.8% this January, and it's not just another number on the financial news ticker. Think of it this way: when neighbourhood property rates surge, it affects everything from rent to shop prices. Similarly, when government borrowing costs spike, it creates a domino effect across the entire economy.WILL GLOBAL BOND SELL-OFF IMPACT INDIA? Most likely. Domestic markets have taken some hard punches lately. And India's 10-year bond yield has climbed to 6.9%, and foreign institutional investors (FII) are heading for the exit. Many fund managers and experts have indicated that foreign investors are chasing safer returns in developed markets, and that is the reason behind the FII exodus from emerging markets like India. But here's where it gets interesting. Unlike previous market storms, India has not been caught completely off-guard this time. The country's forex reserves are healthy, and its recent inclusion in JPMorgan's GBI-EM index isn't just another feather in the cap – it's a potential game-changer that could bring billions in steady, long-term investments.SHOULD INVESTORS BE WORRIED? Let's cut through the jargon and get to what matters. Anyone planning to take a home loan or expand their business with borrowed money might want to crunch those numbers again. Banks aren't in a generous mood when their own borrowing costs are rising. For stock market investors, especially those heavily invested in infrastructure or real estate companies, it's time to put on the thinking cap. These sectors typically struggle when borrowing costs rise. But before hitting the panic button, remember that India's consumption story remains comparatively strong and recent inflation data suggests that it could get better. In fact, recent data also made it clear that the middle class isn't going to stop buying cars or homes just because bond yields are up.WHAT NEXT? The reality is this: While global markets are throwing a tantrum, India's position isn't as precarious as during previous crises. Sure, the nation will feel the heat – the currency might take some hits, and import bills could pinch more. But the economic fundamentals tell a different story. For the average investor, this isn't the time for radical portfolio surgery. Instead, consider it a wake-up call to review financial plans, as indicated by experts. A more balanced approach between stocks and fixed-income investments might be worth considering. And for those sitting on the fence about that big-ticket loan? That decision might be better made sooner rather than later. Market cycles come and go. What matters is having a clear head when others are losing theirs. Keeping an eye on interest rates, staying informed about market movements, but not letting daily market noise drive long-term financial decisions – that's the key to navigating these choppy waters. The bond market drama might seem like a complex puzzle, but its pieces directly connect to our daily financial lives. Understanding these connections is the first step toward making smarter money choices in these uncertain times.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 15, 2025

Headline: 3 must-know sections under old tax regime to save moneyThe old regime offers several tax-saving opportunities under several sections.
Content: As the financial year draws to a close, taxpayers opting for the old tax regime must gear up to make the most of the available deductions. The old regime offers several tax-saving opportunities that can significantly reduce your taxable income, but the key lies in timely investments. Taxpayers must complete these investments by March 31 to claim benefits in their 2025 ITR, as the 2024–25 fiscal year comes to a close.advertisementSECTION 80C Section 80C of the Income Tax Act is one of the most widely utilised sections for tax deductions. It allows individuals to claim deductions up to Rs 1.5 lakh on investments made in various financial products. Some popular choices include life insurance premiums, Employee Provident Fund (EPF) contributions, Public Provident Fund (PPF), National Savings Certificate (NSC), and tax-saving fixed deposits with a 5-year lock-in period. In addition, home loan principal repayments and children’s tuition fees are also eligible for deductions under this section. For those aiming to boost their retirement savings, contributions to the National Pension Scheme (NPS) are another smart choice under Section 80C, while contributions to the Sukanya Samriddhi Account for a girl child also qualify.EXTRA DEDUCTIONS: SECTION 80D AND 80CCD Taxpayers can benefit from Section 80D, which allows deductions of up to Rs 25,000 for health insurance premiums. For senior citizens, the limit is enhanced to Rs 50,000. An additional deduction is available for health insurance premiums paid for parents, providing a comprehensive way to reduce tax burdens. Section 80CCD (1B) offers a further opportunity to save Rs 50,000 on NPS investments, making it a highly attractive option for taxpayers looking to secure their retirement while enjoying additional tax benefits.OTHER DEDUCTIONS: SECTION 24(B) AND 80G Section 24(b) provides relief for homeowners by allowing a deduction of up to Rs 2 lakh on interest paid on home loans for self-occupied property. Similarly, Section 80G encourages charitable donations by offering tax exemptions on contributions made to specified organisations. Act early and make use of these deductions before the financial year ends—you might save more on taxes than you might think.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 15, 2025Must Watch

Headline: How to prevent and report credit card fraud: A complete guideCustomers must know how to handle unauthorised credit card transactions.
Content: Credit card fraud has become increasingly common, with fraudsters continuously finding new ways to exploit unsuspecting individuals. With banks and regulators like the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) working hard to mitigate the risks, it's crucial for customers to understand their liabilities and the steps to protect themselves. Here's everything you need to know about dealing with unauthorised credit card transactions.advertisementLIABILITY FOR FRAUDULENT TRANSACTIONSCustomers may be fully liable for unauthorised transactions if they are negligent. The RBI guidelines state that if a customer shares payment details or fails to report a transaction promptly, they will bear the loss. Customers may be fully liable for unauthorised transactions if they are negligent. The RBI guidelines state that if a customer shares payment details or fails to report a transaction promptly, they will bear the loss. However, if fraud occurs without customer negligence and is reported within three days, the customer holds zero liability. If the report is delayed beyond three days, the customer’s liability will be capped at either Rs 10,000 (for credit cards with a limit of Rs 5 lakh) or Rs 25,000 (for credit cards with a limit over Rs 5 lakh). The bank has to prove the customer’s liability in such cases.WHAT HAPPENS AFTER REPORTING FRAUD? Once a fraudulent transaction is reported, banks are required to reverse the charge within 10 working days. Even if the fraud results from customer negligence, banks may choose to waive the liability. In case of unresolved complaints, the bank must resolve the issue within 90 days. If they fail to do so, the customer will be liable only for a minimal amount, and any interest incurred from the fraud will not be charged.HOW TO PREVENT AND REPORT FRAUDULENT TRANSACTIONS The first step if you suspect unauthorised transactions is to block your card immediately. Call the credit card helpline or customer care, and be ready to provide your card details for verification. After blocking the card, request a replacement. Submit any necessary documents to report the fraud. Prompt reporting and action are key to minimising the damage. By being vigilant and knowing your rights, you can ensure that you are protected from credit card fraud.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 15, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: ShareChat to cut 5% of its workforce amid performance reviews: ReportShareChat has announced slashing 5% of its headcount to enhance operational efficiency.
Content: Social media platform ShareChat, backed by Google and Temasek, plans to lay off around 20-30 employees, or about 5% of its workforce, following its annual performance review, reported Moneycontrol. This marks the fourth round of layoffs in two years as the company focusses on improving operational efficiency and maintaining profitability. ShareChats workforce has already shrunk significantly from its peak of 2,800 employees to the current 530-550. A company spokesperson clarified that these job cuts are not related to financial troubles but are part of a strategy to ensure a high-performing team.PROFITABILITY AMID CHALLENGES ShareChats parent company, Mohalla Tech, which also operates the short video app Moj, conducts two performance reviews every year. The company has made substantial financial improvements, with its adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) losses reducing by 67% to Rs 793 crore in FY24 from Rs 2,400 crore in FY23. The livestreaming business showed impressive growth, with revenue rising by 41% year-on-year to Rs 402 crore during the same period.EXPANDING WHILE DOWNSIZING Despite the layoffs, ShareChat is actively hiring for key roles. It recently appointed former TikTok executive Nitin Jain as its Chief Technology Officer and is expanding its acquisition marketing team by 50%. The company maintains that its current layoffs are part of regular performance reviews rather than cost-cutting.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 15, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Nate Anderson's Hindenburg Research to shut shop. Here's whyNate Anderson, the man behind Hindenburg Research, announced the decision in a detailed post, explaining that the firm's work is complete, and it is time to move on.
Content: Known for sending shivers down corporate giants to their core and claiming to uncover billions in alleged frauds, Nate Anderson, the man behind Hindenburg Research, has decided to close the curtains on his short-selling saga. From triggering a $150 billion storm in Adani Group shares to taking down titans like Nikola and Eros International, Hindenburg was synonymous with financial accountability or controversy, depending on which side youre on. Anderson announced the decision in a detailed post, explaining that the firms work is complete, and it is time to move on. "As Ive shared with family, friends and our team since late last year, I have made the decision to disband Hindenburg Research," he said in a blog post titled 'Personal Note From Our Founder' on Hindenburg's website.WHY HINDENBURG RESEARCH IS CLOSING Anderson clarified that there was no single reason behind his decision. There is no external threat, personal health issue, or any other pressing matter forcing this move. Instead, he described it as a natural conclusion to a chapter of his life. The closure comes after Hindenburg completed its final cases of alleged financial fraud, which have been shared with regulators. And as of the last Ponzi cases we just completed and are sharing with regulators, that day is today, Anderson said. Reflecting on his career, Anderson shared that his intense focus on the firm came at the expense of other aspects of life. He explained that his motivation in the early years stemmed from a need to prove himself, but over time, he began to see Hindenburg Research as just one chapter in his life. In the next six months, Anderson plans to create and release materials and videos to openly share the firm's investigative methods. He hopes this will inspire others to continue similar work. Hindenburg Research operated with a small but dedicated team of 11 members. Anderson described the teams commitment to precision, evidence-based reporting, and taking bold steps to uncover financial fraud. He highlighted the significant impact of their work, with nearly 100 individuals facing civil or criminal charges as a result of their investigations. "Nearly 100 individuals have been charged civilly or criminally by regulators at least in part through our work, including billionaires and oligarchs. We shook some empires that we felt needed shaking," saidAnderson.MAJOR HINDENBURG CASES Hindenburg gained global attention in January 2023 when it released a report alleging fraud and stock manipulation by the Adani Group. The report triggered a massive selloff in Adani Group shares, wiping out over $100 billion of Gautam Adanis personal wealth. The market capitalisation of 10 Adani Group companies fell from Rs 19.19 lakh crore on 24 January 2023 to below Rs 7 lakh crore by February 27. While Adani stocks eventually recovered, the Supreme Court later said that allegations by organisations like Hindenburg or others, without proper verification, cannot serve as evidence. Hindenburgs earlier work included exposing Nikola Corporation in 2020, accusing it of fraud. The electric vehicle companys founder, Trevor Milton, resigned soon after. In 2019, the firm alleged financial mismanagement at Eros International, predicting its stocks would become worthless. Anderson is focused on helping his team transition into their next roles. Some team members plan to establish their own research firms, while others are exploring new opportunities. "For now, I will be focused on making sure everyone on our team lands where they want to be next. Some are going to start their own research firm, which I will strongly and publicly encourage, even as I will have no personal involvement," the Hindenburg founder said. He expressed confidence in his team, describing them as brilliant, focused, and easy to work with. He also invited interested organisations to reach out to him if they are looking for talented professionals.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 16, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Explained: Why HDFC Life shares climbed nearly 11% after Q3 resultsHDFC Life shares were up 10.28% to Rs 655.35 at around 10:17 am. Earlier, the stock had reached a day's high of Rs 657.80.
Content: The share price of HDFC Life Insurance Company surged almost 11% on January 16 after the insurer announced its October-December quarter results, which was much better than what Dalal Street had expected. HDFC Life shares were up 10.28% to Rs 655.35 at around 10:17 am. Earlier, the stock had reached a days high of Rs 657.80. The company posted a 14% rise in net profit in Q3 FY25 at Rs 415 crore, higher than Rs 365 crore in the same period last year, driving positive investor sentiment. HDFC Lifes net premium income rose by 10% year-on-year to Rs 16,771 crore, as per its stock exchange filings. The better-than-expected performance boosted investor confidence in growth momentum and its capacity to meet rising demand for insurance products. The Annualised Premium Equivalent (APE), which is a crucial industry metric, grew 15.5% to Rs 3,686 crore. The Value of New Business (VNB) increased by 17.8% to Rs 1,009 crore, well ahead of projections, while its VNB margin improved to 27.4%, underlining enhanced profitability.WHAT BROKERAGES SAID Following the Q3 results, leading brokerages were optimistic about the companys future growth trajectory. HSBC reiterated its buy rating with a target price of Rs 750, citing improved margins and the companys push to expand its distribution network and attract new customers. The brokerage said the shift away from low-margin products and stronger credit protection sales could further boost profitability. Jefferies, which also has a Rs 750 price target, praised HDFC Lifes diverse product mix and resilience, despite challenges in the regulatory landscape. Headline: 7 last-minute investment strategies to save taxes before FY 2024-25 endsTax-saving investments help you save on taxes while securing your financial future.
Content: As the financial year 2024-25 draws to a close, many taxpayers find themselves scrambling for ways to save on taxes. While experts recommend early tax planning, there are still some smart last-minute strategies to reduce your tax burden and boost your savings. Lets have a look at seven reliable options to consider:INVEST IN EQUITY LINKED SAVINGS SCHEME (ELSS) ELSS funds are a popular choice for tax-saving investments, offering exemptions of up to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act. With a minimum investment of just Rs 500 and a three-year lock-in period, ELSS provides an excellent blend of tax benefits and potential financial growth.NATIONAL PENSION SYSTEM (NPS) The NPS not only secures your retirement but also provides tax savings. Contributions are eligible for deductions up to Rs 50,000 under Section 80CCD (1B), in addition to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C. This makes NPS a dual-benefit scheme for wealth accumulation and future pension security.PUBLIC PROVIDENT FUND (PPF) PPF offers a winning combination of tax benefits and risk-free returns. Contributions qualify for deductions under Section 80C, and both interest earned and maturity proceeds are tax-free, making it a favorite for long-term savers.UNIT LINKED INSURANCE PLANS (ULIPS) ULIPs offer the triple advantage of life insurance, investment returns, and tax benefits. With a five-year lock-in period, investments in ULIPs are tax-free, and premiums paid qualify for deductions under Section 80C.TAX SAVER FIXED DEPOSITS Tax Saver FDs come with a five-year lock-in period and provide tax exemptions up to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C. While early withdrawals are restricted, they remain a low-risk option for conservative investors.SENIOR CITIZEN SAVINGS SCHEME (SCSS) For senior citizens, SCSS is a lucrative option with an annual interest rate of 8.2%. Investments up to Rs 30 lakh are eligible for tax deductions under Section 80C, ensuring both security and returns.SUKANYA SAMRIDDHI YOJANA Schemes like Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana allow tax deductions up to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C, with tax-free returns. Accounts can be opened for girls under 10 years, encouraging financial security for daughters. Tax-saving investments help you save money and secure your future. Pick options that match your goals and act quickly to make the most of the time left for a tax-efficient year-end.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 16, 2025Must Watch

Headline: RVNL share price up 9% today. Why did multibagger railway stock gain? RVNL stock price: Shares of the company opened higher at Rs 388 and surged to an intraday high of Rs 406.10 in early trade. At around 11 am, RVNL shares were still trading 7.76% higher at Rs400.75.
Content: Shares of Rail Vikas Nigam Ltd (RVNL) climbed over 9% in early trading on January 16 after the company announced a significant order win from Bharat Sanchar Nigam Ltd (BSNL). Shares of the company opened higher at Rs 388 and surged to an intraday high of Rs 406.10 in early trade. At around 11 am, RVNL shares were still trading 7.76% higher at Rs400.75. The development brings some relief to investors, as the multibagger stock has faced a decline of over 35% over the past six months and over 14% in the past month. RVNL informed the stock exchanges late on January 15 about receiving a Letter of Acceptance (LoA) from BSNL. The order involves the creation, upgradation, operation, and maintenance of the Middle Mile Network under the BharatNet project. The projects construction phase is expected to be completed in three years. Additionally, the agreement includes a maintenance contract spanning 10 years, with compensation set at 5.5% of the capital expenditure for the first five years and increasing to 6.5% for the following five years. The entire contract is valued at 3,622.14 crore. RVNL will lead the execution of the project as the principal partner, collaborating with HFCL and ATS as part of a consortium. The ambitious nature of the contract is expected to strengthen RVNL's position in the infrastructure and communication sectors, further diversifying its project portfolio. The order win marks another milestone for RVNL, which has delivered strong returns to investors in recent years. Analysts believe this latest project will boost the companys revenue visibility and earnings potential over the long term. The BharatNet initiative aims to enhance digital connectivity across Indias rural and semi-urban areas, making RVNLs role in the project crucial to its success. Investors will likely keep a close watch on the progress of this project and its impact on RVNL's financials in the quarters to come. Headline: Sensex, Nifty continue winning streak: 3 reasons why stock market gained todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 308.61 points to77,032.69, while the NSE Nifty50 added 105.75 points to23,318.95 as of 10:25 AM.
Content: The stock markets have shown signs of recovery after falling almost 12% from it's September high as it continued its winning streak, extending gains for the third starlight session on Thursday. Sensex gained over 400 points in early trade while Nifty was up nearly 150 points. The S&P BSE Sensex was up 308.61 points to77,032.69, while the NSE Nifty50 added 105.75 points to23,318.95 as of 10:25 AM. Rise in the stock market could be attributed to several factors, of which the positive US inflation data was the biggest trigger for Sensex and Nifty.WHY DID STOCK MARKET GAIN TODAY US stocks rose on Wednesday night after new numbers showed US core inflation grew less than what experts had thought it would. This good news spread to Asian stock markets on Thursday, pushing them higher too. The US dollar and interest rates on US government bonds have come down a bit in the last few days. Some market watchers think the recent rise in stocks tied to Donald Trump might have reached its peak. Adding to the positive market sentiment in markets, Israel and Hamas agreed to stop fighting in Gaza, which helped calm worries about the conflict. This made investors feel better about putting money into stocks. Many think this could slow down the recent trend of foreign investors taking their money out of markets. Closer to home, investors were waiting eagerly for three big Indian companies - Reliance Industries, Infosys, and Axis Bank - to share their latest earnings reports later in the day. Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that macro indicators from the US suggest that as the swearing-in of Mr Trump nears, the Trump trade has peaked. "The decline in US bond yields and the dollar index are indications of this. This downshift in the dollar index and bond yields has been assisted by the lower-than-expected CPI inflation in the US, again igniting hopes of more rate cuts by the Fed this year. Hope of an end to the conflict in Gaza is another major relief. This global backdrop is positive for the market," he added.He also said that a relief rally in India is certainly on the cards, but the sustainability of the rally will depend on the Indian macros, particularly the revival of GDP and earnings growth. "Budget expectations can aid a rally in the market but it will soon give way to the trends in GDP and earnings growth.Investors should focus on largecaps which have been more stable than the mid and small caps. Broadly speaking, segments with growth visibility like Pharma and health care, IT and discretionary consumption will remain resilient," saidVijayakumar. The share price of HDFC Life Insurance Company surged almost 11% on January 16 after the insurer announced its October-December quarter results, which was much better than what Dalal Street had expected. HDFC Life shares were up 10.28% to Rs 655.35 at around 10:17 am. Earlier, the stock had reached a days high of Rs 657.80. The company posted a 14% rise in net profit in Q3 FY25 at Rs 415 crore, higher than Rs 365 crore in the same period last year, driving positive investor sentiment.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 16, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Israel-Hamas ceasefire: What does it mean for global and Indian stock markets?The impact of the ceasefire agreement in Gaza between Israel and Hamas could be huge on financial markets, particularly for sectors tied to global trade and energy.
Content: Stock markets around the world, including India's Dalal Street, gained on Thursday as news broke about a ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas in Gaza. Indian stock markets extended gains for the third straight session on Thursday. Sensex gained over 400 points in early trade while Nifty was up nearly 150 points. He particularly highlighted the potential benefits for energy markets, and said, "For global markets, it reduces geopolitical risks that often create volatility, especially in energy sectors. Stability in the Middle East could help ease concerns about oil supply disruptions, which we feel is a positive development for inflation and broader economic conditions."IMPACT ON DALAL STREET For Indian markets, the impact could be felt across several sectors. "Oil and gas, logistics and manufacturing sectors likely to get some relief." However, he cautions investors to remain vigilant: "But investors shouldn't let down their guard because this geopolitical environment is still evolving, it's a fluid situation," said Trivesh. Headline: Can drain bank accounts in minutes: Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warns of new scamIn today's digital age, protecting your phone is essential for securing finances, personal data, and daily tasks.
Content: What if helping someone in need could put your finances at risk? Imagine a stranger approaches you, claiming their phone battery is dead and asking to borrow your phone for an urgent call. While it seems harmless, this act of kindness could lead to a financial disaster. Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has issued a warning about a new scam that exploits such situations. Sharing a video on X, he cautioned, Imagine this: A stranger approaches you and asks to use your phone to make an emergency call. Most well-meaning people would probably hand over their phone. But this is a new scam.    The video explains how scammers operate, their intended targets, and ways to safeguard yourself from falling victim.HOW THE SCAM WORKS The scam starts with a simple request to borrow your phone. While it may appear harmless, scammers use this opportunity to tamper with your device. They can install malicious apps or exploit existing ones, change settings to forward calls and messages to their own number, and intercept critical banking notifications and one-time passwords (OTPs). Even after returning the phone, these changes allow scammers to access your financial accounts and make unauthorised transactions without raising suspicion.TIPS TO STAY SAFE To safeguard yourself from such scams, always avoid handing over your phone to strangers. If you wish to help, make the call yourself and put it on speaker. Regularly check your phone settings to ensure that call forwarding or divert options are disabled. Never share sensitive information, such as one-time passwords (OTPs), with anyone. If you suspect a scam, act immediately by reporting the incident to the national cybercrime helpline at 1930. Your phone holds the key to your finances and personal life in todays world. Helping others is good, but being careful is just as important. A little caution can protect you from big financial losses.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 16, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Adani Group shares rise as Hindenburg Research shuts down. Details hereIn January 2023, Hindenburg Research published a report alleging financial irregularities within the Adani Group, leading to a massive decline in the conglomerate's market valuation.
Content: Adani Group stocks witnessed a decent rally on Thursday, with shares rising as much as 9% following the announcement that US-based short-selling firm Hindenburg Research has shut down operations. Adani Power was the top gainer, rising nearly 9% in early trade; Adani Green also climbed nearly 9%. Adani Enterprises, which has pared most of the gains, was up nearly 7.7% as investors reacted to the news of Hindenburg. Adani Total Gas, Adani Energy Solutions, and Adani Ports also rose as much as 6.6% in early trade.WHY IS HINDENBURG RESEARCH SHUTTING DOWN? The rally in Adani Group stocks comes in the wake of an official statement by Hindenburg Researchs founder, Nate Anderson, who announced the firms closure. Anderson shared that the decision was part of a long-term plan to wind down operations after completing their investigative projects, including those targeting Ponzi schemes. In January 2023, Hindenburg Research published a scathing report alleging financial irregularities within the Adani Group, leading to a massive decline in the conglomerate's market valuation. While Adani Group has strongly denied the allegations, the fallout from Hindenburgs report is something that traders and investors will remember for a long time. In his statement, Anderson dismissed any specific trigger for the closure, saying, There is not one particular threat, health issue, or personal matter, and highlighted a desire to prioritise family, travel, and personal interests after years of intense focus on his career. The timing of Hindenburgs closure coincides with increasing scrutiny from US lawmakers regarding the firms activities, adding intrigue to the announcement. Anderson also expressed support for his former team, some of whom plan to start their own research ventures. For Adani Group, the end of Hindenburg Research marks the conclusion of a turbulent chapter, as investors turn their focus back to the companys operational performance and growth prospects.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 16, 2025

Headline: 3 common UPI myths busted: What's true and what's notThe NPCI has cleared up common UPI myths to help users make secure and informed digital transactions.
Content: In recent times, the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has issued a clarification regarding the Jumped Deposit scam and underlying the importance of safe Unified Payments Interface(UPI) practices. As more people use UPI for its ease, several myths have popped up that could put the security of digital payments at risk. Its important to debunk these myths and ensure that UPI remains a safe and efficient mode of payment.advertisementMYTH 1: PAYMENT REQUESTS GET APPROVED AUTOMATICALLY One of the most common misconceptions is that simply opening a UPI or bank app will automatically approve a payment request. This is far from true. To initiate a transaction, users must navigate to the payment request and explicitly click on the Pay option. Additionally, the user must enter their UPI PIN to authorise the payment. Without these steps, the transaction would not proceed, ensuring that only authorised users can make payments.MYTH 2: EXTERNAL PARTIES CAN INITIATE WITHDRAWALS Another prevalent myth is that an external party can initiate a withdrawal from the users account directly. This is false. UPI and other banking apps are designed to ensure that only the account holder can initiate a transaction. No unauthorised person can access your funds without your direct involvement, making UPI transactions secure as long as the user is vigilant.MYTH 3: ENTERING THE PIN FOR BALANCE ENQUIRY AUTHORISES PAYMENTS Some users believe that simply entering their UPI PIN to check their balance can authorise a payment request. This is not the case. The PIN is required even for balance checks, but it does not authorise any payment or withdrawal transactions. For a payment to be processed, a separate action must be taken by the user. As more people use digital payments, it's important to understand these myths to keep transactions safe. By following the right steps and staying informed, users can make payments confidently, without worrying about fraud or errors.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 16, 2025Must Watch

Headline: 8th Pay Commission for revising salaries of central government employees approved8th Pay Commission for revising salaries of central government employees approved
Content:
The Union Cabinet has approved the 8th Pay Commission to revise the salaries of central government employees and pensioners. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced the decision on Thursday, 16 January. While the Cabinet has given its approval, the date for setting up the commission has not been disclosed. This development comes just ahead of the Union Budget 2025 and is expected to bring a salary hike for government employees and retirees.advertisementWHAT THE 8TH PAY COMMISSION MEANS The 8th Pay Commission is expected to build upon the reforms introduced by the 7th Pay Commission, which was implemented in January 2016 and will conclude its recommendations by the end of 2025. A committee has been set up by the Central government to oversee its implementation. Reports suggest a possible increase in the fitment factor from 2.57 to 2.86, a key parameter in calculating revised salaries. If implemented, this change could result in a rise in the basic salaries of government employees. The fitment factor determines how much the basic pay is multiplied to calculate revised salaries and pensions.SALARY REVISION UNDER PREVIOUS PAY COMMISSIONS The transition from the 6th Pay Commission to the 7th Pay Commission marked a significant change in the pay structure for government employees.

 7th Pay Commission (2016)

Minimum monthly pay: Rs 18,000
Maximum monthly pay: Rs 2.5 lakh (for Cabinet Secretaries)
Introduced a simplified pay matrix, replacing the older pay bands and grade pay system.
Fitment factor: 2.57 times the basic pay.
Gratuity ceiling increased to Rs 20 lakh with a provision for periodic hikes based on dearness allowance (DA).
Allowances, including HRA, were rationalised.



 6th Pay Commission (2006)

Minimum monthly pay: Rs 7,000
Maximum monthly pay: Rs 80,000 (for Secretary-level officers)
Introduced the pay band and grade pay system.
Fitment factor: Approximately 1.86 times the basic pay.
Gratuity ceiling increased to Rs 10 lakh.
Rationalisation of allowances, with more focus on housing rent allowance (HRA) and other benefits.


IMPACT ON EMPLOYEES AND THE ECONOMY The approval of the 8th Pay Commission is likely to have a positive impact on millions of government employees and pensioners. The expected salary hike will increase their disposable income, potentially boosting consumer spending.Published By: Poorva JoshiPublished On: Jan 16, 2025

Headline: Global economy to weaken over next year, Europe braces for slowdown: WEF report While the global economy braces for subdued growth in 2025, the United States and South Asia, particularly India, emerge as bright spots in an otherwise gloomy outlook.
Content: The World Economic Forum's latest Chief Economists Outlook paints a picture of contrasting economic fortunes across regions in 2025, with India and the US projected to grow, while Europe is expected to face challenges. The January 2025 edition of the report highlights overall subdued global growth. "The outlook remains subdued, with a majority of chief economists (56%) expecting the global economy to weaken over the next year, compared to 17% anticipating improvement," the report said.   Global economic outlook (Source: WEF Report)advertisementINDIA EMERGES AS BRIGHT SPOT However, the report highlighted two bright spots amid the gloomy global economic outlook in the US and South Asia. "South Asia continues to stand out, with 61% of chief economists expecting strong or very strong growth in 2025," the report said. The region's exceptional performance is attributed largely to India, which "remains the world's fastest-growing major economy." However, the report does note some potential challenges for India, observing that "there are now signs of some momentum being lost." Recent national accounts data indicates a moderation in growth, though this appears to be a temporary adjustment rather than a fundamental weakness in the economy.EUROPE TO BEAR THE BRUNT In stark contrast to India's robust outlook, Europe faces a particularly challenging period ahead. T The report reveals that "the outlook for Europe remains gloomy, with 74% of respondents predicting weak or very weak growth this year." This dramatic divergence between regions highlights the shifting dynamics of global economic power and the increasing importance of emerging economies in driving global growth. Individual European economies show varying degrees of weakness, with Germany contracting by 0.3%, Italy growing at 0.4%, 1.2% in France and Spain managing 3.4% growth. The severity of Europe's situation was highlighted by Mario Draghi, the former Italian prime minister and governor of the European Central Bank, who warned that "annual investment equivalent to 5% of GDP would be required to revive economic dynamism."US TO PLAY KEY ROLE The United States presents another interesting dimension to this global economic narrative. According to the report, "The chief economists expect US policy to have a significant impact on the global economy in the years ahead." "A majority (61%) characterise this impact as a long-term shift rather than a short-term disruption," said the WEF report. Under the incoming administration, economists anticipate "significant changes across trade, migration, deregulation, fiscal policy, industrial policy and foreign policy." These changes are expected to have far-reaching implications, including potential "increases in inflation and public debt levels, as well as stock-market gains." China's outlook also remains concerning, with growth "projected to slow gradually in the years ahead." This slowdown in the world's second-largest economy adds another layer of complexity to the global economic landscape. The global context remains complex and challenging, as the report highlights. "Downside risks have intensified, not least because of heightened uncertainty around the economic implications of November's US presidential election."Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 16, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Infosys Q3 Results: Net profit surges 11% to Rs 6,806 crore, revenue up 8%Infosys Q3 Results: The Bengaluru-based tech giant also revised its revenue guidance for the current fiscal year upward to 4.5%-5%, signaling optimism in its growth trajectory despite global economic uncertainties.
Content: IT giant Infosys reported its third quarter results on Thursday, posting an 11% year-on-year (YoY) rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 6,806 crore. Revenue from operations grew by 8% YoY, reaching Rs 41,764 crore. The Bengaluru-based tech giant also revised its revenue guidance for the current fiscal year upward to 4.5%-5%, signalling optimism in its growth trajectory despite global economic uncertainties. Operating profit for the quarter surged 12% YoY to Rs 8,912 crore, with operating margins expanding by 80 basis points to 21.3%. The company expects operating margins for FY25 to remain in the range of 20-22%.GOOD DEALS DRIVE POSITIVE Q3 GROWTH Infosys clocked a total contract value (TCV) of $2.5 billion in large deals during the December quarter, slightly higher than the $2.4 billion recorded in the previous quarter. This steady deal momentum underlines the company's robust market positioning and client confidence. Constant currency revenue growth stood at 6.1% YoY, reflecting solid business traction across segments, with a sequential growth of 1.7% quarter-on-quarter. Salil Parekh, CEO and MD of Infosys, attributed the strong performance to the company's differentiated digital offerings and strategic initiatives. "Our strong sequential revenue growth in a seasonally weak quarter, coupled with broad-based YoY growth and robust operating parameters, is a testament to the success of our strategies," he said. The company is also sharpening its focus on enterprise AI capabilities, particularly generative AI, which has garnered significant client interest. Infosys highlighted that this technological edge has bolstered its large deal pipeline and contributed to another quarter of robust wins. With its updated revenue guidance, strengthened AI focus, and consistent deal wins, Infosys remains optimistic about navigating the challenges of a dynamic global market.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 16, 2025

Headline: 8th Pay Commission formation: What it means for central government staffThe 8th Pay Commission is expected to be formed by 2026 as the 7th Pay Commission's recommendations, implemented in January 2016, conclude at the end of 2025.
Content: The Union Cabinet on Thursday paved the path for the formation of the 8th Central Pay Commission, which will benefit over one crore central government employees and pensioners. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw made the announcement, which has been eagerly awaited by many, as the commission is expected to revise salaries, allowances, pensions, and other benefits.advertisementHOW WILL IT BENEFIT CENTRAL GOVERNMENT EMPLOYEES?The 8th Pay Commission is expected to be formed by 2026 as the 7th Pay Commission's recommendations, implemented in January 2016, conclude at the end of 2025. The 8th Pay Commission is expected to be formed by 2026 as the 7th Pay Commission's recommendations, implemented in January 2016, conclude at the end of 2025. "Since 1947, seven pay commissions have been constituted, with the last one implemented in 2016. As the 7th Pay Commission's term concludes in 2026, initiating the process in 2025 ensures sufficient time to receive and review recommendations before its completion," Vaishnaw said.  The new commission will focus on reviewing pay structures while considering inflation, economic conditions, and employee welfare. The 7th Pay Commission, which was constituted in 2014 and implemented in 2016, introduced significant changes such as replacing pay bands with a simplified pay matrix, increasing the minimum monthly salary to Rs 18,000, and capping the maximum monthly pay at Rs 2.5 lakh for top government officials. It also raised the fitment factor to 2.57, ensuring a notable boost to basic pay. The fitment factor is a multiplier used to calculate the revised basic pay of government employees under a Pay Commission. HIGHER SALARY Some reports suggest that the 8th Pay Commission may propose an increase in the fitment factor from 2.57 to 2.86, potentially raising the minimum basic salary to Rs 51,480. Such a move could have a big impact on employees’ financial well-being, fostering increased spending power. It could also lead to higher consumer spending . It may be noted that the Central Pay Commissions are set up every 10 years to address the evolving needs of government employees.  Over the years, these commissions have played a crucial role in adjusting pay scales, allowances, and pensions, ensuring they align with inflation and changing economic realities. While further details about the commission’s structure and timeline remain awaited, the announcement has sparked optimism among employees and retirees alike. Many hope the 8th Pay Commission will address longstanding concerns and bring in reforms that improve their quality of life while contributing to the country’s economic growth.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 16, 2025

Headline:
Budget 2025: 5 key expectations from India's insurance sectorIndia's insurance sector expects reforms in the upcoming budget to make insurance more accessible, affordable, and innovative.





India's insurance sector anticipates reforms in the upcoming budget to make insurance more accessible, affordable, and innovative.
Content: The Union Budget 2025 is expected to play an important role in shaping India’s insurance sector. With the government’s goal of achieving “Insurance for All” by 2047, this budget could bring changes to make insurance easier to access, more affordable, and innovative. Here are some key hopes from the insurance industry for this year’s budget.ENHANCED TAX BENEFITS Taxes play a big role in how people choose insurance products. Right now, life insurance premiums are included under Section 80C of the Income Tax Act, which has a shared limit with other investments. Having a separate limit for life insurance premiums could encourage more people to save for the long term and secure their future. Aftab Chaz, Associate Director and Business Head, Elephant.in, mentioned that increasing the deduction limit under Section 80D of the Income Tax Act for health insurance premiums from Rs 25,000 to Rs 50,000 would provide major financial relief to individuals. By raising this limit, more people would be encouraged to invest in health insurance, ensuring better medical coverage and financial security.GST REFORMS Reducing the Goods and Services Tax (GST) on insurance premiums could lower costs and make insurance more affordable for more people. Mr. Nitin Mehta, Chief Distribution Officer - Partnership Distribution and Head of Marketing at Bharti AXA Life Insurance, says, “The current GST rate on life insurance premiums is 18%. Any reduction in this rate will significantly lower the cost of insurance, thereby making life insurance more affordable and accessible for buyers.” He added, “Streamlining GST compliance procedures will help to reduce administrative burdens on insurance companies. This can allow them to focus on product innovation and customer service.”FDI REFORMS The insurance sector hopes for simplified procedures for Foreign Direct Investment (FDI), as increasing FDI limits could bring in more capital. "The Union Budget 2025 presents a significant opportunity for growth in India’s insurance sector through targeted reforms. Easing procedural hurdles for Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) beyond the current 74% cap could attract more capital, allowing insurers to underwrite larger risks, expand into underserved areas, and invest in technology,” says Aftab Chaz.INCLUSION OF TECHNOLOGICAL INNOVATIONS Encouraging technology adoption in the insurance sector can improve customer experiences, simplify operations, and drive product innovation. Aftab Chaz mentions that promoting tools like AI and blockchain can boost efficiency and meet changing customer needs.ADDRESSING CLIMATE RISKS Climate change poses significant challenges, and tax incentives for catastrophe insurance can play a key role in protecting businesses and communities from natural disasters. Aftab Chaz mentions, “The inclusion of the insurance sector in the national priority list would enable concessional funding and encourage innovation, particularly in micro-insurance and rural outreach. As climate change exacerbates natural disasters, tax incentives for catastrophe insurance are also vital to safeguard vulnerable communities and businesses.” The Union Budget 2025 could bring big changes to India’s insurance industry. Reforms in taxes, foreign investments, technology, and disaster preparedness can help the sector grow steadily while providing financial security to millions.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 16, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: From tomatoes to tiramisu: India's most delivered items in 2024India's 2024 delivery trends reveal rising demand for food, fashion, and documents, as per Borzo.
Content: As 2024 draws to a close, India’s delivery landscape showcases a dynamic shift in consumer habits, driven by the rise of quick commerce and tech-savvy platforms. Borzo (formerly WeFast), a global courier service, analysed data from about 15 million deliveries in India to identify the top trends for 2024.TOP DELIVERY CATEGORIES OF 2024 Food emerged as the most delivered category in 2024, accounting for 35% of all orders. Popular items included tiramisu, fries, and roti, while packaged products like pesto sauce and noodles saw steady demand. Interestingly, Mumbai and Pune residents displayed a unique love for pav, dominating short-distance deliveries. Clothing ranked second amongst the top delivery categories, reflecting India’s growing preference for online fashion shopping. Meanwhile, documents have gained significant traction, especially in cities like Bengaluru and Delhi, indicating a rising need for quick and reliable document delivery within urban areas.PERISHABLES AND FESTIVE FAVOURITES Amongst perishables, tomatoes, cabbage, and milk tetra packs topped the list, with pudina, lemons, and green chilies being popular add-ons. Regional preferences stood out—Mumbai led in pudina orders, while Hyderabad favoured brinjal and lemons. The festive season brought a 25% surge in deliveries during Diwali, with mithai orders in Delhi marking a cultural highlight.EVOLVING CONSUMER HABITS The demand for quick deliveries extended to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs), which relied on courier services for spare parts, sample products, and gifting items. This trend underscores how small businesses are leveraging delivery platforms to drive growth. Gig workers played a crucial role, covering distances equivalent to circling the globe seven times to meet consumer needs. As technology continues to shape the q-commerce sector, businesses that adapt to these trends will thrive. The rise of delivery apps and Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) models promises a future where speed, convenience, and reliability redefine India’s shopping experience.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 16, 2025

Headline: 8 key expectations from Budget 2025With Budget 2025 approaching, people are expecting key reforms like simpler taxes and relief for the middle class.
Content: As February 1 approaches, all eyes are on Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, who will unveil the Union Budget 2025. With India’s growing economy and rising aspirations, this year’s budget is expected to bring major reforms and incentives aimed at boosting growth, empowering citizens, and simplifying taxation. Here are eight key expectations:TAX REFORMS TO EASE COMPLIANCE Simpler tax filing processes and reduced complexities in tax rules are anticipated. The government may focus on easing compliance for both individuals and businesses, ensuring a seamless experience with reduced paperwork.advertisementSIMPLIFIED GST FRAMEWORK Businesses, particularly the micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs), are hoping for rationalised GST slabs and faster refunds. A more straightforward GST system would enhance the ease of doing business and boost economic activity. Mr. Shaji Varghese, CEO, Muthoot FinCorp Limited (MFL), mentions, “The Union Budget 2025 presents a pivotal opportunity to bolster the MSME sector. We are optimistic about the government’s commitment to banking the underbanked and unbanked, including nano and micro enterprises.”AFFORDABLE HOUSING AND MIDDLE-CLASS RELIEF Housing loan interest exemptions are expected to increase, making homeownership more affordable. Additionally, tax benefits under Section 80C and higher exemptions may offer middle-class families much-needed financial relief. Mr. Dhruv Agarwala, Group CEO, Housing.com & PropTiger.com, says, “The Union Budget 2025 presents a crucial opportunity to address longstanding challenges and catalyse growth in the real estate sector. Raising the tax exemption limit on home loan interest, which has remained stagnant for years, is essential to easing the financial burden on homebuyers and enhancing housing affordability.”OVERHAUL OF CAPITAL GAINS TAX To encourage investments in equities and real estate, the capital gains tax framework may be simplified. Uniform tax rates across asset classes are likely to reduce confusion and attract more investors.CLARITY ON CRYPTOCURRENCY TAXATION The crypto sector awaits clearer rules and taxes. Budget 2025 may introduce well-defined regulations and a fair tax regime to bring transparency and legal stability to this growing digital asset market.INCREASED STANDARD DEDUCTION FOR SALARIED INDIVIDUALS To provide relief amid inflation, the government is expected to increase the standard deduction limit, offering more disposable income for the salaried class.FOCUS ON JOB CREATION The budget may allocate funds for infrastructure projects, skill development programs, and start-up support, aiming to generate employment across various sectors.INCENTIVES FOR WOMEN TAXPAYERS Special tax exemptions or deductions for women professionals may be introduced, empowering them financially and promoting gender inclusivity in the workforce. Budget 2025 holds the promise of driving India’s growth while addressing taxpayer concerns. With reforms catering to diverse needs, it could pave the way for a simplified and inclusive economic future. Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 16, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: 8th Pay Commission: Will pensions see a big jump? Here's what you need to knowThe Union Cabinet approved the 8th Pay Commission on Thursday to revise the salaries of central government employees and pensioners. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced the decision and said that the commission will likely be established soon.
Content: With rising inflation eating into the monthly budget of many, the announcement of the 8th Pay Commission comes as a relief for central government employees and pensioners just ahead of the Union Budget 2025. The Union Cabinet approved the 8th Pay Commission on Thursday to revise the salaries of central government employees and pensioners. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced the decision and said that the commission will likely be established soon. But the big question remains, will pensions witness a dramatic jump, or will it be a modest upgrade?  Currently, central government employees and pensioners receive their salaries and pensions based on the 7th Pay Commission's recommendations, which came into effect on 1 January 2016. POSSIBLE INCREASE IN PENSIONS Krishnendu Chatterjee, Vice President at TeamLease, told Economic Times (ET), “The average pension hike should be in line with the hike in salaries. It is expected to be in a fitment factor of 2.5-2.8, thus increasing the pension from the current Rs 9,000 to anywhere between Rs 22,500 and Rs 25,200.” Sumit Dhar, Partner at Fox Mandal & Associates LLP told ET that if the fitment factor of 2.86 is approved in the 8th Pay Commission by the government, the minimum salary and pension of government employees are expected to increase by 186%. “Though predicting the hike is practically not feasible, based on the average pension hike percentages from previous pay commissions, the 8th Pay Commission may provide an average pension hike in the range of 20% to 30%. However, the actual percentage increase depends on various factors considered by the commission, including economic conditions and budgetary constraints," said Ritika Nayyar, Partner at Singhania & Co.  Nihal Bhardwaj, Senior Associate at SKV Law Offices, said, “Pensions under the 8th Pay Commission are likely to increase in line with the salary revisions, with an average hike of 25-30% expected. Past commissions, such as the 6th and 7th, provided pension increases matching salary hikes, with the latter implementing a fitment factor of 2.57, raising pensions by 23-25%.” He further explained to ET, “Enhancements for retirees may include additional allowances for senior pensioners and higher dearness relief (DR) to offset inflation. Such measures are important to ensure that pensions remain adequate for meeting rising costs while aligning with employee expectations for equitable post-retirement benefits. The exact percentage increase for the 8th Pay Commission will only be known once the commission submits its report and the government approves its recommendations.” The fitment factor, a multiplier used to calculate the revised basic pay and pension, plays a key role in determining pension hikes. For example, if the fitment factor is set at 2.5 and the current basic pension is Rs 30,000, the revised basic pension would increase to Rs 75,000. At the start of the new pension structure, the dearness relief (DR) is usually reset to zero. Over time, pensioners will receive periodic DR increases to account for inflation, resulting in regular pension hikes.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 17, 2025

Headline: RIL shares in focus today post Q3 results: 5 things investors need to know RIL posted a 12% year-on-year (YoY) increase in consolidated net profit to a record Rs 21,930 crore for the third quarter of financial year 2024-25 (FY25).
Content: Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) shares gained nearly 2% during the latter part of Thursday’s trading session, closing at Rs 1,275. The stock is expected to witness further movement in Friday's session, following the announcement of its robust Q3 FY25 results. RIL posted a 12% year-on-year (YoY) increase in consolidated net profit to a record Rs 21,930 crore for the third quarter of financial year 2024-25 (FY25). The company’s performance was driven by growth in its key business segments, including digital services, retail, and the oil-to-chemicals (O2C) division.advertisementGOOD Q3 FY25Revenue for the quarter rose 7.7% YoY to Rs 2.67 lakh crore, while earnings before interest, tax, depreciation, and amortisation (EBITDA) increased 7.8% to Rs 48,003 crore. The EBITDA margin improved by 10 basis points to 18% compared to the same period last year, and by 1 percentage point from the previous quarter.RECOVERY IN O2C BUSINESS Revenue for the quarter rose 7.7% YoY to Rs 2.67 lakh crore, while earnings before interest, tax, depreciation, and amortisation (EBITDA) increased 7.8% to Rs 48,003 crore. The EBITDA margin improved by 10 basis points to 18% compared to the same period last year, and by 1 percentage point from the previous quarter.RECOVERY IN O2C BUSINESS The O2C segment, which had faced challenges in recent quarters, showed significant improvement in Q3. The division's EBITDA grew 2% YoY to Rs 14,402 crore, while revenue rose 6% YoY to Rs 1.49 lakh crore. Chairman Mukesh Ambani said, “The O2C business showcased its innate resilience, registering growth even in this prolonged period of volatility in the global energy markets.” The improvement in O2C performance was attributed to volume-led growth and higher polymer deltas, reflecting a recovery in the business amid challenging global energy conditions.JIO PLATFORMS DELIVERS STRONG GROWTH Reliance’s digital services arm, Jio Platforms, continued its strong performance. Profit for the segment increased 26% YoY, while EBITDA rose nearly 19% YoY. Growth in this segment was driven by sustained subscriber additions and higher customer engagement, with more users upgrading to 5G networks. Jio’s home broadband services also maintained their market-leading position, contributing to the strong performance.MIXED RESULTS FOR OIL AND GAS BUSINESS The oil and gas segment faced some challenges in Q3, with both operating profit and revenue declining. Lower volumes of gas and condensate from the KGD6 basin impacted earnings. However, this was partially offset by higher coal bed methane (CBM) gas volumes and a slight increase in KGD6 gas prices.BROKERAGE VIEW RIL shares have undergone correction over the last six months, falling as much as 20%. This decline has made the stock more attractive in terms of valuation, with several global brokerages maintaining a positive outlook. Emkay Global said that after a 24% decline, the stock is forming a base around the Rs 1,200 level and is currently in a sideways trend. The brokerage added, “Bullish momentum is expected above Rs 1,270.” Target prices from brokerages for RIL stock remain as high as Rs 1,690.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex drops 400 points: Markets tank as IT stocks fall; Infosys down 4%Stock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 430.02 points to 76,612.80, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 121.05 points to 23,190.75 as of 9:22 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices tanked in early trade on Friday, breaking off the positive momentum seen in the past few days. Headline: Donald Trump plans to make cryptocurrency a national priority: ReportThe order will designate cryptocurrency as a national imperative, encouraging government agencies to collaborate with the industry.
Content: Donald Trump, who is going to take office as the 47th US President on January 20, is planning to issue an executive order that will elevate cryptocurrency to a national priority in the United States, reported Bloomberg. The move is expected to signal a policy shift and provide the crypto industry with a more prominent role in shaping government decisions. According to sources mentioned in the report, the order will designate cryptocurrency as a national imperative, encouraging government agencies to collaborate with the industry. Additionally, it is likely to establish a cryptocurrency advisory council to advocate for the sector's policy needs. Bitcoin was trading at $101,021.39, with a market cap of $2 trillion at the time the article was being written. CRYPTO INDUSTRY’S INFLUENCE Donald Trump has received considerable support from the cryptocurrency industry, including donations from prominent companies such as Coinbase and Ripple to his inaugural committee. On Friday, just days before the beginning of his second term at the White House, the industry is set to host an "Inaugural Crypto Ball" in Washington, celebrating its ties with the incoming administration. This initiative would represent a huge shift for the crypto sector, which has faced numerous regulatory challenges under President Joe Biden's administration. Federal agencies, including the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), have launched more than 100 enforcement actions against crypto companies in recent years. The proposed executive order may include a directive requiring all government agencies to review their policies on digital assets. There is also discussion about pausing ongoing litigation involving cryptocurrency firms, sources told Bloomberg. This could potentially halt legal actions against major players such as Binance Holdings Ltd. and Ripple Labs Inc., a move seen as a top priority by the industry.CREATION OF NATIONAL BITCOIN STOCKPILE Another key aspect under consideration is the creation of a national Bitcoin stockpile, the report mentioned.  The US government currently holds nearly $20 billion worth of Bitcoin, confiscated during various investigations, according to analytics firm Arkham. Bitcoin's price has surged by nearly 50% since the November election, reaching over $100,000, partly due to speculation about the potential stockpile. The proposed stockpile would formalise the government's holdings of Bitcoin and reflect a strategic shift in how the US approaches cryptocurrency. Bitcoin has seen remarkable growth in 2024, with its value more than doubling over the year. Kara Calvert, Vice President for US Policy at Coinbase Global Inc., commented on the importance of Trump’s potential move. "What I think Donald Trump is going to do is signal that the United States is back and we are ready to lead in this industry. What it’s signaling to other countries is be careful, or you won’t keep up," she told Bloomberg. Trump has also made bold promises during his campaign, vowing to transform the US into the global capital of cryptocurrency. His administration is expected to issue several executive orders covering various industries within his first few days in office. Despite facing regulatory hurdles during the Biden administration, the cryptocurrency industry in the US has continued to grow. Prominent financial firms, including BlackRock Inc., have launched spot Bitcoin and Ether exchange-traded funds (ETFs).Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Explained: Why Infosys share price tumbled over 5% after strong Q3 resultsInfosys stock was down 5.40% at Rs 1,822.10 on the BSE at 10:15 a.m. The company's shares had hit a day's low of Rs 1,815.85.
Content: Shares of IT giant Infosys fell sharply on Friday, declining over 5% in early trade on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), following an overnight drop in its American Depositary Receipt (ADR) listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE). The ADR closed nearly lower at $21.57 after the company announced its third-quarter results during post-market hours on January 16. Infosys shares were down 5.40% at Rs 1,822.10 on the BSE at 10:15 am. Earlier, the company's shares had hit a day's low of Rs 1,815.85.  It may be noted that the country's second-largest IT services provider reported an 11% year-on-year (YoY) rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 6,806 crore. Revenue from operations grew by 8% YoY, reaching Rs 41,764 crore, with constant currency (CC) revenue growth of 6.1% YoY.  The company upgraded its FY25 CC revenue growth guidance to 4.5%-5% from 3.75%-4.5% and maintained its operating margin guidance of 20%-22%. Despite the positive YoY performance in Q3 and revenue guidance, the shares of Infosys failed to gain due to a possible slowdown in the fourth quarter, due to factors such as seasonality and fewer working days. Emkay Global Financial Services has slightly tweaked its FY25-27 earnings-per-share (EPS) by less than 1%, taking into account the performance of the company in the third quarter.  The brokerage has retained a 'Buy' rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 2,150.  Analysts like those at Nuvama Institutional Equities and Nomura Global Markets Research also remain optimistic about Infosys, citing improving discretionary demand and a strong deal pipeline. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Sensex drops nearly 500 points. Why did stock market fall in early trade?Stock market down today: The fall in IT stocks was a result of Infosys' shares falling over 5.3% after the company reported its Q3 results yesterday. The drop, however, came as a surprise as the company raised its revenue forecast.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices fell in early trade after gaining in all the sessions this week, triggered by a fall in shares of major companies such as Infosys and Axis Bank after their Q3 FY25 results. The S&P BSE Sensex fell 440.99 points to 76,601.83 at 9.51 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 107.60 points to trade at 23,204.20. Most of the other broader market indices also fell in early trade today, leading to a surge in volatility, which has been decreasing throughout the week.advertisementWHY DID STOCK MARKET FALL IN EARLY TRADE? The benchmark indices were pulled down by a sharp drop in banking and IT stocks, following the third quarter results of some major companies. The Nifty IT index was down 2.6% as 7 of the 10 constituents were trading in negative territory. The fall in IT stocks was a result of Infosys’ shares falling over 5.3% after the company reported its Q3 results yesterday. The drop, however, came as a surprise as the company raised its revenue forecast. On the other hand, Axis Bank dragged down banking stocks after the lender’s quarterly profit missed street estimates due to slower loan growth and rise in provisions for bad loans. In addition, sustained selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs) continues to disrupt the momentum on Dalal Street. On the brighter side, Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) has posted better-than-expected Q3 results, positing a 12% increase in y-o-y net profit to Rs 21,930 crore. Prathamesh Masdekar, Research Analyst, Stoxbox, said, “Reliance Industries has grown exponentially and set new benchmarks demonstrating strength and resilience across all businesses during the quarter.” “Overall, we believe RIL remains a strong long-term bet, given its scale, diversification, and execution capability,” he added.WHAT SHOULD INVESTORS DO? Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, said the correction in the market has made large-cap valuations reasonable. “Nifty is now trading at around 19 times estimated FY 26 earnings. Therefore, long-term investors, who can ignore the volatility caused by FII selling, can use the dips to buy high-quality large-caps. The bounce back of this segment is only a question of time,” he added. Headline: 8th Pay Commission: What is fitment factor that determines salary hikeThe salary and pension hikes under the 8th Pay Commission will be calculated by applying the fitment factor to the existing basic pay.
Content: The 8th Pay Commission, set to be implemented from January 1, 2026, promises a significant financial overhaul for central government employees and pensioners in India. With salary and pension revisions on the horizon, all eyes are on the fitment factor, a critical element determining the extent of these enhancements. Let's explore what the fitment factor is and how it affects the salaries of millions of people.advertisementWHAT IS THE FITMENT FACTOR? The fitment factor is a multiplier used to calculate revised salaries and pensions for government employees. It plays a pivotal role in determining the quantum of financial benefits. Under the 7th Pay Commission, the fitment factor was set at 2.57, resulting in a significant boost to salaries and pensions. The minimum basic pay jumped from Rs 7,000 to Rs 18,000 per month, while pensions saw a similar rise from Rs 3,500 to Rs 9,000. The maximum salary and pension were revised to Rs 2,50,000 and Rs 1,25,000, respectively.WHAT IS THE PROJECTED FITMENT FACTOR FOR 8TH PAY COMMISSION? Projections for the 8th Pay Commission suggest a fitment factor ranging between 2.28 and 2.86. If realised, the minimum basic pay could increase from Rs 18,000 to anywhere between Rs 41,000 and Rs 51,480, marking a substantial financial uplift for employees. If the fitment factor’s projections materialise, the revised salaries could significantly uplift the financial well-being of government employees and retirees.WHEN WILL THE 8TH PAY COMMISSION BE IMPLEMENTED? The salary and pension hikes under the 8th Pay Commission will be calculated by applying the fitment factor to the existing basic pay. With the commission’s implementation date set for January 2026, the government is expected to establish the commission by mid-2024. This timeline allows ample time for reviewing economic conditions, inflation rates, and feedback from employee unions and stakeholders.IMPACT OF 8TH PAY COMMISSION While the exact fitment factor will depend on prevailing economic and policy considerations, the 8th Pay Commission’s recommendations are poised to enhance the financial well-being of lakhs of people across the country.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 17, 2025

Headline: Reliance share price rises over 2% after Q3 results. Should you buy now? Reliance's share price was up 1.44% to Rs 1,287 at 10:51 am on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Content: Shares of Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) gained on Friday after the company reported better-than-expected third quarter results. RIL's share price was up 1.44% to Rs 1,287 at 10:51 am on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). RIL's consolidated earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortisation (EBITDA) for Q3FY25 stood at Rs 43,800 crore, a 4% beat compared to estimates, driven by robust performances in the retail and oil-to-chemicals (O2C) segments. Consolidated net profit came in at Rs 18,540 crore, exceeding expectations by 3%. Retail revenue grew 18% quarter-on-quarter, bolstered by festive season sales, while O2C reported a 9% year-on-year growth in revenue.GOOD TIME TO BUY?  Brokerages have responded positively, citing the stock's attractive valuation after a 19% decline over the past six months. Emkay Global upgraded its rating to 'Buy' from 'Add,' setting a target price of Rs 1,570, while Antique Stock Broking revised its target price to Rs 1,456, up from Rs 1,409. Both brokerages highlighted strong retail and O2C performance as key contributors to the earnings beat. Nuvama Institutional Equities also retained its 'Buy' rating, projecting a target price of Rs 1,677. Analysts at Nuvama highlighted RIL's long-term growth potential, noting its planned petchem expansions and ambitious clean energy ventures, which could contribute significantly to profits over the next 5-7 years. Morgan Stanley and CLSA echoed the optimistic sentiment, maintaining their 'Overweight' and 'Outperform' ratings with target prices of Rs 1,662 and Rs 1,650, respectively. Motilal Oswal Financial Services also reiterated its 'Buy' rating, assigning a target price of Rs 1,600, citing strong growth visibility in the company's core and emerging businesses.
