Headline: Axis Bank shares drop 6% to hit 52-week low. Should you buy? Axis Bank share price: The stock closed at Rs 1,040.20 in the previous session, opened at Rs 1,006.95 on Friday and slid further to Rs 974.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Content: Axis Bank shares fell by 6% to hit their 52-week low just a day after the private lender announced its third-quarter results for the financial year 2024-25 (FY25). The stock, which closed at Rs 1,040.20 in the previous session, opened at Rs 1,006.95 on Friday and slid further to Rs 974.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). This decline came after the bank reported a 3.8% rise in consolidated net profit for the quarter ending 31 December 2024, reaching Rs 6,304 crore, compared to Rs 6,071 crore in the same period last year. However, this growth fell short of market expectations, causing investor concerns.advertisementAXIS BANK Q3 FY25 RESULTS Axis Bank reported an interest income of Rs 30,954 crore for Q3FY25, marking an 11% increase from Rs 27,961 crore in the same quarter of the previous year. Despite this growth, the stock has struggled recently, with a 13.49% fall over the past month, a 24.93% decline in the past six months, and a 9.29% drop over the past year. The bank’s net interest income (NII) grew 9% year-on-year to Rs 13,606 crore, while the net interest margin (NIM) for Q3FY25 stood at 3.93%. The operating profit increased by 15% year-on-year to Rs 10,534 crore. Core operating profit rose 14% year-on-year to Rs 10,102 crore. Operating costs grew at a slower pace, increasing by just 1% year-on-year compared to a 9% rise in the previous quarter. Axis Bank’s provisions and contingencies for the quarter stood at Rs 2,156 crore, including specific loan loss provisions of Rs 2,185 crore. The bank holds cumulative provisions (standard and additional) of Rs 11,875 crore as of 31 December 2024. These provisions are above the non-performing assets (NPA) provisioning included in its provision coverage ratio (PCR) calculations. The total provision coverage ratio, including specific, standard, and additional provisions, was at 151% of gross non-performing assets (GNPA) as of the quarter’s end. The annualised credit cost for the quarter was reported at 0.80%. Amitabh Chaudhry, the Managing Director and CEO of Axis Bank, said that the bank concluded 2024 on a strong note. He highlighted efforts to strengthen its business operations, expand its reach, and add new branches across India.SHOULD YOU BUY? The sharp fall in Axis Bank’s shares has led to mixed reactions from analysts. While some see the stock as a buying opportunity after the recent correction, others have raised concerns about the bank’s performance in certain areas. Jefferies maintained a ‘Buy’ rating on Axis Bank with a target price of Rs 1,430. The firm noted that gross and net slippages were higher than expected, while deposit and loan growth remained within forecasts. However, higher provisioning costs and uniform income margins matched predictions. Bernstein also kept an ‘Outperform’ rating with a target price of Rs 1,300. The brokerage pointed to stagnant recoveries, rising credit costs, and slowing growth in operating expenses as key takeaways. Nuvama lowered its target price for Axis Bank from Rs 1,335 to Rs 1,220 but maintained a ‘Buy’ rating. The firm said that the stock is trading at 1.5 times its book value for FY26 estimates, offering some downside protection after the correction. Nuvama revised its earnings per share estimates down by 2% for FY25 and 5% for FY26 due to low growth and declining NIM, offset by lower operating expenses. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 17, 2025

Headline: Will India's growth story gain momentum or slow down in FY26?India's GDP, which clocked a stellar 9.7% in FY22 before settling at 7% in FY23 and 8.2% in FY24, has been on a roller-coaster ride.
Content: India's growth story has been a tale of resilience and steady strides over the past few years, but as the global economy faces increased turbulence, the big question now is—can the momentum hold, or will the pace falter in FY26? According to the latest World Bank report, India’s economic growth is projected to remain steady at 6.7% annually for the next two fiscal years, starting April 2025. The forecast is a silver lining to the broader South Asia region, which is expected to see growth rise to 6.2% in 2025-26. The report suggests that the services sector will continue to perform strongly, while manufacturing looks poised to benefit from government initiatives to enhance the business landscape. Private investment is set to get a boost, balancing a likely slowdown in public spending. However, there are some challenges. The World Bank has flagged a softer growth projection of 6.5% for 2024-25, citing sluggish manufacturing and a dip in investment activity. Still, private consumption remains the silver lining, thanks to improved rural incomes and better agricultural output. Closer to home, experts appear to echo this tempered optimism. The FICCI Economic Outlook Survey pegs India’s GDP growth at 6.4% for FY25, a step-down from earlier estimates of 7%. Ratings firms like Acuité and CareEdge also see growth in the range of 6.4-6.5%. Meanwhile, Nomura is more bullish with a 6.7% estimate, and the Reserve Bank of India recently revised its FY25 projection to 6.6%. India’s GDP, which clocked a stellar 9.7% in FY22 before settling at 7% in FY23 and 8.2% in FY24, has been on a roller-coaster ride. Looking ahead, GDP growth will depend on multiple factors, including announcements in the upcoming Budget 2025, global growth, interest rate trajectory, and more.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Is EPF to NPS transfer possible? Check the details hereThe decision to transfer EPF to NPS must align with your financial goals, liquidity needs, and risk appetite.
Content: Planning for retirement is a crucial financial goal, and the choice of investment avenues can make a significant difference in achieving it. For those looking to optimise returns, transferring funds from an Employee Provident Fund (EPF) account to a National Pension System (NPS) account could be a game-changer. But is it the right move for everyone? Let’s look into the process, tax implications, and factors to consider.advertisementHOW TO TRANSFER EPF FUNDS TO NPS Transferring funds from EPF to NPS is possible, but there are steps to follow. A one-time transfer of your EPF corpus to an NPS Tier 1 account is tax-exempt under Section 10(12), as it is not treated as a contribution to NPS for that year. To initiate the transfer, you need an active NPS Tier 1 account. The process can be completed through your employer or directly via a Point of Presence (POP) or the eNPS portal. Submit a transfer request to your current employer, who will forward it to the recognised EPF office. The funds will then be credited to your NPS account. However, keep in mind that this shift is irreversible, so evaluating its suitability is critical.SHOULD YOU MAKE THE SWITCH? The decision to transfer EPF funds to NPS depends on your financial goals, asset allocation, and risk tolerance. Here are some key considerations: For equity exposure: If you lack exposure to equity investments, moving funds to NPS can help diversify your portfolio. The ‘active’ NPS option allows up to 75% equity allocation until age 50, which reduces gradually as you age. However, the ‘auto’ option limits equity allocation, especially for those nearing retirement. Accessibility of funds: EPF provides more flexibility, as the entire corpus can be accessed tax-free at retirement. In contrast, NPS requires 40% of the corpus to be reinvested in an annuity, with the income taxed. Tax implications: While interest earned in NPS Tier 1 is tax-free, only 60% of the corpus is tax-exempt at maturity. The remaining 40% annuity income is taxable. In other words, transferring funds from EPF to NPS can enhance returns, especially for those seeking equity exposure. However, the decision must align with your financial goals, liquidity needs, and risk appetite. After all, a well-planned retirement isn’t just about returns—it’s about financial freedom and peace of mind.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Must Watch

Headline: 8th Pay Commission: How much salary increase can government employees expect?Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed the decision and said that the commission would be formed soon to revise the pay structure for central government employees and pensioners.
Content: For government employees, a salary hike often feels like a festive bonus, arriving just in time to ease financial pressures. The announcement of the 8th Pay Commission is no different. With rising inflation making it harder to manage monthly expenses, the news of the 8th Pay Commission brought hopes of a pay hike for central government employees.  The Union Cabinet approved the establishment of the 8th Pay Commission on Thursday. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw confirmed the decision and said that the commission would be formed soon to revise the pay structure for central government employees and pensioners.advertisementSALARY HIKE  One of the most pressing questions is the expected hike in salaries and how the hike will be calculated. According to experts, the fitment factor, which plays a key role in determining pay increases, may be set between 2.5 and 2.8 times the current basic pay. This means that government employees earning a basic pay of Rs 18,000 could see their salaries increase to Rs 45,000, providing a much-needed boost. Krishnendu Chatterjee, Vice President and Business Head at TeamLease, shared insights on the expected changes with India Today Digital. “Considering the inflation factor, there are indications that fitment factor for salary hike may stay between 2.5 - 2.8 times of their current salaries, which will give a significant boost to employee salaries between 40k - 45k at the current base of 18k" said Chatterjee. HOW TO CALCULATE SALARY HIKE? To estimate the revised salary, employees can multiply their current basic pay by the fitment factor. "Multiply the Basic Pay by 2.5 - 2.8 times," said Chatterjee. For example, if an employee’s basic pay is Rs 25,000 and the fitment factor is 2.7, the revised salary would be Rs 67,500. This formula helps employees gauge the potential increase in their pay under the 8th Pay Commission. The final salary hike will depend on various factors, including inflation adjustments and prevailing market rates. Inflation plays a significant role as the commission aims to ensure that the revised pay structure addresses the rising cost of living. The 8th Pay Commission will likely build upon the changes introduced by the 7th Pay Commission, which came into effect in January 2016. The 8th Pay Commission is expected to complete its recommendations by the end of 2025. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 17, 2025

Headline: Bad credit? Here's how you can still secure emergency fundsThough bad credit limits borrowing options and raises interest rates, some lenders still offer loans.
Content: Life’s unpredictability often leads to financial emergencies at the most inconvenient times. If you have a low credit score, getting a loan can feel challenging. But don’t worry—there are ways to get emergency loans even with bad credit. Here’s a simple guide to help you through the process.UNDERSTANDING THE CHALLENGE OF BAD CREDIT A credit score below 650 is typically considered poor, stemming from missed payments, high credit usage, or loan defaults. While such scores restrict borrowing options and result in higher interest rates, several lenders cater to individuals with bad credit. By focusing on factors like income stability, collateral, or even a guarantor’s backing, these lenders make emergency loans accessible.STEPS TO SECURE AN EMERGENCY LOAN Identify the right lender: Compare options and choose a lender offering competitive terms despite your low credit score. Prepare required documents: Ensure you have ID proof (Aadhaar/PAN), income evidence, and address verification ready for quick processing. Submit your application: Complete the application process online or offline, based on convenience. Evaluate offers carefully: High interest rates and hidden charges can make borrowing expensive, so scrutinise terms before accepting. Plan for repayment: Timely EMI payments can prevent further credit score deterioration and even help improve it.TIPS FOR BOOSTING YOUR LOAN APPROVAL CHANCES To improve your chances of getting a loan approved with a bad credit score, start by applying for a smaller loan amount, as this makes you less risky in the eyes of lenders. Providing collateral can further increase your approval chances, as it offers the lender security. Alternatively, applying with a guarantor who has a good credit score can make a significant difference. Demonstrating a stable income is also crucial, as it reassures lenders of your ability to repay the loan on time. Lastly, clearing any outstanding debts can enhance your financial profile and increase your credibility as a borrower. In other words, emergency loans are a viable option for managing unforeseen financial crises, even with a poor credit score. However, careful evaluation of terms and responsible repayment planning are essential. Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 17, 2025

Headline: How long before 8th Pay Commission benefits reach central government employees?The 7th Pay Commission took around 22 months from its formation to the implementation of its recommendations.
Content: The Union Cabinet approved the formation of the 8th Pay Commission to revise the salaries and allowances of nearly 50 lakh central government employees and close to 65 lakh pensioners. While this decision brings hope for improved pay scales, the government has not yet announced a specific timeline for establishing the commission or implementing its recommendations. This raises an important question, how long will it take before government employees actually see the benefits of the 8th Pay Commission? advertisementTIMELINE OF 7TH PAY COMMISSION The 7th Pay Commission was formed in February 2014. By November 2015, it submitted its recommendations, which were implemented in January 2016. The process took approximately 22 months from the commission’s formation to the implementation of its recommendations. If the 8th Pay Commission follows a similar pattern, government employees can expect to wait around two years after the commission is formed for the revised pay structure to take effect. However, as of now, no formal notification or timeline for the formation of the 8th Pay Commission has been released.HOW THE PAY COMMISSION WORKS The formation and operation of a Pay Commission involves several steps, which take considerable time. For instance, the 7th Pay Commission was chaired by Retd. Justice Ashok Kumar Mathur, with Vivek Rae and Dr Rathin Roy as members and Meena Agarwal as the Secretary. Their work included holding extensive consultations, collecting data, and analysing existing pay structures. "The commission conducts extensive consultations and holds multiple meetings to gather data, analyze existing pay structures, and consider input from various stakeholders, including employee associations. After thorough deliberation, the commission prepares a report detailing its recommendations regarding salary structures, allowances, and pension increments. The entire process can take around 2 years, depending on the complexity of the issues at hand and the commission's findings," said Nihal Bhardwaj, Senior Associate, SKV Law Offices told India Today Digital.  He further added that the 7th Pay Commission conducted over 76 meetings with different officers, stakeholders, and public service commissions of other countries before submitting its report. Once the report is prepared, it is submitted to the government, where the Finance Ministry and other authorities review the recommendations. After approval, the recommendations are implemented through resolutions issued by the Department of Expenditure under the Ministry of Finance.  Implementing a new pay commission involves  financial implications. The 7th Pay Commission estimated a financial impact of Rs 1,02,100 crore in FY 2016-17. Salary and pension changes took effect from January 1, 2016, while revised allowances, based on recommendations from a panel led by then Finance Secretary Ashok Lavasa, came into effect on July 1, 2017.FACTORS FOR SALARY & PENSION HIKE Pay Commissions consider various factors when making recommendations. "Inflation adjustment, state of the economy, the market pricing of essential commodities, current DA rate and employee expectations," said Teamlease Staffing.  Taking into account the above factors, ensures that the revised pay structure addresses both the financial realities of the government and the needs of its employees. To estimate the revised salary, employees can multiply their current basic pay by the fitment factor, which is expected to be between 2.5 - 2.8 for the 8th Pay Commission.  "Multiply the Basic Pay by 2.5 - 2.8 times," said Chatterjee. The Ministry of Finance and the Department of Expenditure play a crucial role in implementing the Pay Commission’s recommendations. The Department of Expenditure evaluates the proposals and issues orders for implementation. "The Prime Minister, as the head of the government, holds substantial influence over this process, ensuring that the recommendations align with broader governmental policies and fiscal capabilities," said Bhardwaj. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 17, 2025

Headline: Is artificial intelligence the new wolf of Wall Street?AI is reshaping Wall Street and industries, replacing jobs while creating new opportunities that require human and tech expertise.
Content: The marble halls of Manhattan's financial district once echoed the footsteps of legendary traders and bankers—those larger-than-life figures who turned market chaos into million-dollar deals. But a new force now dominates these corridors of power. It doesn't wear Armani. It doesn't drink martinis at lunch. It never sleeps. It keeps working. Artificial intelligence (AI) has arrived at Wall Street, and it's rewriting every rule in the book. AI is executing trades at speeds that make human reflexes look glacial. A recent report from Bloomberg Intelligence suggests 2,00,000 banking jobs on Wall Street could evaporate in the next few years—each one representing a desk that might soon gather dust—due to AI. What’s surprising is the fact that the same AI algorithms recommending tonight's Netflix binge are now analysing market trends, approving million-dollar loans, and chatting with high-net-worth clients. Yet beneath the surface of this AI takeover lies a more nuanced story.  This isn't just another tale of machines replacing humans—it's a forced evolution, as dramatic as Wall Street's leap from paper tickets to Bloomberg terminals. The trading floor's next chapter is being written in binary.AI’S GROWING FOOTPRINT  AI is not confined to disrupting the banking and financial sector alone. According to the World Economic Forum’s (WEF) Future of Jobs Report 2025, clerical and secretarial roles in various industries face the prospect of steep declines. Jobs like administrative assistants, ticket clerks, and cashiers are being replaced by AI-driven tools.  The report also warned that as many as 39% of existing skills could become outdated by 2030, making it necessary for workers to adapt to new realities. However, not all industries face job losses. Sectors requiring human oversight, creativity, and physical presence—such as healthcare, construction, and agriculture—are expected to experience job growth. The care economy, including nursing and social work, is also set to expand due to the irreplaceable human touch required in these professions.AI IS ALSO CREATING OPPORTUNITIES While AI is displacing certain roles, it is also opening doors to opportunities in emerging fields. According to a McKinsey & Company report, AI could create 20–50 million new jobs globally by 2030, spanning sectors like healthcare and technology. These new roles include AI trainers and teachers, who ensure AI systems are accurate and develop innovative applications. Data analysts and scientists are also in demand to interpret the vast amounts of data generated by AI systems, providing valuable insights for better decision-making. Additionally, human-machine teaming managers play a crucial role in ensuring smooth collaboration between AI systems and human workers. AI ethics and policy specialists are emerging as key professionals addressing ethical and regulatory challenges associated with AI implementation. So, are the wolves of Wall Street really in danger of being replaced by AI? Not entirely; they're adapting. And tomorrow's financial titans can't just be quantitative geniuses or smooth-talking deal-makers.  They’ll have to be a new breed of professionals—those who can wield the power of AI while retaining the human touch that no machine can replicate. The key is to develop skills machines can't match, build relationships algorithms can't forge, and find ways to make technology amplify their human insights rather than replace them.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Sensex ends over 400 points lower, Nifty falls as IT stocks tumbleThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 423.49 points lower at the closing bell, whil the NSE Nifty50 settled 108.60 points lower at 23,203.20.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices ended lower on Friday due to a fall in information technology (IT) stocks on continued worries over third-quarter earnings. The S&P BSE Sensex ended 423.49 points lower at the closing bell, whil the NSE Nifty50 settled 108.60 points lower at 23,203.20. Broader market indices were mixed, but volatility rose during the trading session. Major sectoral indices such as Nifty Bank, Nifty Financial Services and Nifty IT fell sharply, triggering today’s slide. Infosys shares slid nearly 6% at closing, Wipro and TechMahindra also fell sharply. Other top losers were Axis Bank, Shriram Finance and Kotak Mahindra Bank. On the other hand, the top gainers on the Nifty50 were BPCL, Reliance, Coal India, Nestle India and Hindalco. It may be noted that Reliance’s 2.65% jump during the session was a major factor behind limiting the losses on Dalal Street. The company’s shares jumped during the session after positing strong results in the third quarter. Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services, said, “Declines in the banking and IT sectors negatively impacted large caps, causing domestic markets to end lower following a volatile session.” “A cautious outlook on discretionary spending led to a decline in IT stocks while private banking stocks declined due to expectations of subdued deposit and credit growth, as well as tighter liquidity conditions. We expect investors to adopt a risk-averse stance on the ongoing Q3 results,” he added.  Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd, said, “Markets remained under pressure throughout the trading session as rising US bond yields continues to create uncertainty amongst local investors” “With FII fund outflows from domestic equities remaining strong, geo-political uncertainty and concerns over slow pace in US rate cuts going ahead is keep investors on the edge,” he added.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Must Watch

Headline: 5 simple tips to get personal loans at lowest interest ratesThis article guides you through five effective strategies to secure personal loans at the most competitive interest rates, ensuring you make informed financial decisions and reduce your overall borrowing costs.
Content: Personal loans are a quick solution to meet financial needs, whether for emergencies, weddings, or big-ticket purchases. However, securing these loans at high-interest rates can lead to a heavy financial burden. The good news is that, with some strategic planning, you can obtain a personal loan at a much lower interest rate. Let’s explore five effective ways to ensure you get the best deal possible.advertisementSTRENGTHEN YOUR CREDIT SCORE A good credit score is your ticket to lower interest rates. Lenders evaluate your creditworthiness primarily through this score. If your score is low, start improving it by paying off outstanding debts, maintaining a low credit utilisation ratio, and rectifying any errors in your credit report. A high score not only enhances your chances of approval but also secures better terms.LEVERAGE YOUR EMPLOYER’S REPUTATION The company you work for can influence the loan terms you receive. Employees of well-reputed organisations are often viewed as low-risk borrowers, which can result in better interest rates. If you work for a smaller company or are self-employed, you might face higher rates, but having a solid financial track record can still work in your favor.SKIP PRE-APPROVED OFFERS ON CREDIT CARDS Pre-approved personal loan offers on credit cards may seem convenient, but they often come with higher interest rates. Instead, consider applying directly to a lender. By doing so, the lender can assess your current credit score and financial status to offer a more competitive rate. This extra effort can translate into significant savings.ADD A CO-APPLICANT Applying with a co-applicant who has a strong credit profile can improve your eligibility for a loan at a lower rate. Lenders consider the combined creditworthiness and income of both applicants, reducing perceived risk.NEGOTIATE WITH THE LENDER Negotiation can be a powerful tool. Compare offers from multiple lenders and use competitive rates as leverage. Many lenders are open to matching or beating competitor rates to secure your business. While personal loans are a convenient financial tool, securing them at the lowest possible interest rate requires careful planning. By improving your credit score, avoiding pre-approved offers, and negotiating smartly, you can reduce your financial burden significantly. A little effort today can lead to substantial savings tomorrow.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 17, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Why 8th Pay Commission is spurring calls for income tax relief in BudgetWith government employees set to benefit from a pay hike from the 8th Pay Commission, private sector employees are demanding income tax relief to boost their disposable income. Experts argue that easing the tax burden on individuals is key to spurring consumption, the backbone of India's economic growth.
Content:
With the government announcing the setting up of the 8th Pay Commission, which would see the salaries of government employees go up substantially, there is a clamour for leaving more money in the hands of private sector workers, who make up a bulk of the tax-paying middle class. The demand is that the government must now provide tax relief to individuals in Budget 2025-26. The decadal pay commission, whose award would be implemented in 2026, and a relief for taxpayers in the Budget would help boost consumption, which accounts for 55-60% of India's GDP. "Government employees are getting the Pay Commission. Private sector employees are getting new taxes," reads a post from an X handle that comments on public policy and governance.   The demands to reduce taxes come as the government's bet on reducing corporate taxes to spur investment and consumption failed to work. Despite 15-year-high profits, corporates haven't increased wages, which beat inflation growth. Experts say the government now has to put more money in the hands of individual taxpayers to boost consumption-led growth. "There needs to be immediate relief for individual taxpayers in the Budget to boost consumption and the economy," political analyst and commentator Amitabh Tiwari tells India Today Digital. It isn't unusual for the government to plan consumption-led growth through pay commissions. Amid the global financial crisis in 2008, the government had gone for a higher fitment factor of 1.86 against the recommended 1.74 to boost consumption. "The 8th Pay Commission will see an increase in the pay scale for the central government employees, which in turn will help spur demand. A softening in consumption is being witnessed," Kranthi Bathini, equity strategist at WealthMills Securities, tells India Today Digital. He says the 8th Pay Commission's recommendations would increase demand and consumption growth.  Bathini says there has been a long-standing demand for tax relief from the middle class. "The middle class believes it has been paying taxes, but aren't getting enough sops from the government."  The 7th pay commission of India started trending on Google on January 16. It peaked on January 16 at around 3 pm. Other subcategories like fitment factor, expected salary in the 8th pay commission, and benefits of the 8th pay commission were also trending. Revealing the clamour around a reduction in taxes for individuals, the term income tax has also been trending on Google along with pay commission. WHY INCOME TAX STRUCTURE IS HURTING THE MIDDLE CLASS Amitabh Tiwari finds two main issues with the tax structure that is hurting the middle class, which is the main driver of consumption in India. "While the government has kept increasing the exemption limit over the years, the top income tax bracket of 30% kicks in at a low level of Rs 15 lakh," says Tiwari, adding that it is very low when compared to several countries, including the US. Central government employees numbering 49 lakh and pensioners at 65 lakh make a small portion of the actual taxpayers at 2.8 crore. Tiwari points to how though the number of those filing tax returns has increased from 3.35 crore in 2013-14 to 7.54 crore in 2023-24, those really paying tax has just gone up from 1.66 crore to 2.81 crore in 10 years. That's because individuals filing zero-income tax returns has seen a massive jump from 1.69 crore in 2013-14 to 4.73 crore in 2023-24. That's because the income tax exemption limit has gone up over the years. "Though this meets the government's socio-political objective, it doesn't meet the economic objective. In several countries, no income is exempt from tax," Tiwari tells India Today Digital.advertisementBUDGET 2025-26 MIGHT ADD INCOME TAX SLABS FOR RELIEFThe demand for relief comes amid rising inflation and at a time when the government's collection of income tax is higher corporate tax.For relief, Amitabh Tiwari suggests widening of the tax net and increasing tax slabs gradually, where the highest tax rate kicks in at a much higher income level of Rs 50 lakh, instead of the now Rs 15 lakh.Kranthi Bathini says there is great anticipation that income tax slabs are going to be increased in Budget 2025-26. "As per the initial feelers that are coming from this Budget, the slabs are going to be increased," he adds. Tiwari explains that such a move will prevent a small section of middle class taxpayers from doing the heavy lifting and give a boost to consumption, which is the main driver of the Indian economy, accounting for around 55-60% of our GDP.Bathini says there is a need to increase consumption by boosting disposable income. "At this point of time, any kind of pay hike will definitely spur growth in the economy," he says.While the government has constituted the 8th Pay Commission for government employees, relief for individual taxpayers will leave more cash in the hands of the middle class and help push consumption-driven growth of the economy.Published By: Sushim MukulPublished On: Jan 17, 2025
advertisement The demand for relief comes amid rising inflation and at a time when the government's collection of income tax is higher corporate tax. For relief, Amitabh Tiwari suggests widening of the tax net and increasing tax slabs gradually, where the highest tax rate kicks in at a much higher income level of Rs 50 lakh, instead of the now Rs 15 lakh. Kranthi Bathini says there is great anticipation that income tax slabs are going to be increased in Budget 2025-26.  "As per the initial feelers that are coming from this Budget, the slabs are going to be increased," he adds.  Tiwari explains that such a move will prevent a small section of middle class taxpayers from doing the heavy lifting and give a boost to consumption, which is the main driver of the Indian economy, accounting for around 55-60% of our GDP. Bathini says there is a need to increase consumption by boosting disposable income. "At this point of time, any kind of pay hike will definitely spur growth in the economy," he says. While the government has constituted the 8th Pay Commission for government employees, relief for individual taxpayers will leave more cash in the hands of the middle class and help push consumption-driven growth of the economy.Published By: Sushim MukulPublished On: Jan 17, 2025

Headline: 8th Pay Commission: What were the big changes in 7th and 6th Pay Commissions?The Government has approved the formation of the 8th Pay Commission for central government employees and pensioners. Here is a look at the salary hikes under the 7th and 6th Pay Commissions.
Content: The Union Cabinet recently approved the formation of the 8th Pay Commission, which is set to revise salaries for lakhs of central government employees and pensioners. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw suggested that the commission will likely be formed soon, and its recommendations will come into effect on January 1, 2026.  The announcement comes just days before the Union Budget 2025 and aims to align salaries with current economic conditions and inflation rates. As the anticipation around the 8th Pay Commission grows, here is a look at the major changes that were part of the 7th and 6th Pay Commissions. advertisementSALARY AND PENSION HIKE IN 7TH PAY COMMISSION The 7th Pay Commission came into effect on January 1, 2016. It introduced many major changes for central government employees.One of the most critical aspects was the fitment factor, which was set at 2.57.  What this meant was that the basic pay would be multiplied by 2.57, leading to increased salaries across all levels amongst central government staff. The 7th Pay Commission also recommended a minimum basic salary of Rs 18,000, marking an increase from the previous Rs 7,000 under the 6th Pay Commission. In addition, pensions saw a decent increase. For pensioners, the minimum basic pension rose to Rs 9,000, up from Rs 3,500 under the 6th Pay Commission.WHAT HAPPENED IN 6TH PAY COMMISSION? The 6th Pay Commission, which was implemented in January 2006, introduced modest changes but still improved salaries and pensions. The fitment factor under the 6th Pay Commission was 1.86. Therefore, the minimum basic salary was revised to Rs 7,000, up from Rs 2,750 in the 5th Pay Commission. Pensioners also benefited marginally, with the minimum basic pension increasing from Rs 1,275 to Rs 3,500 per month.WHAT TO EXPECT FROM THE 8TH PAY COMMISSION? As of now, nothing is clear about what exactly can be expected under the new pay commission. However, some reports suggest that it is expected to introduce a more major revision to salaries and pensions.  Unconfirmed projections for the 8th Pay Commission indicate that the fitment factor could range from 2.28 to 2.86. If this happens, the minimum basic pay may rise from Rs 18,000 to anywhere between Rs 41,000 and Rs 51,480, providing a big financial boost for central government employees.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 18, 2025

Headline: Donald Trump launches $TRUMP meme coin, crypto traders make millions in minutesDonald Trump, days before his presidential inauguration, shook the crypto market with the launch of $TRUMP meme coin, which surged 220 per cent in value and hit USD 4.25 billion in hours.
Content:
Two days ahead of his inauguration as the 47th United States President, Donald Trump on Saturday took the cryptocurrency market by storm after he announced the launch of his official meme coin -- $TRUMP.  Unveiling the new meme coin along with a link to purchase it on his social media platform, Truth Social, Trump wrote: "My NEW Official Trump Meme is HERE! It's time to celebrate everything we stand for: WINNING!"

 



Image shared by Donald Trump on Truth Social. (Screengrab)
 According to a report by Economic Times, the $TRUMP meme coin, soon after its launch, experienced a massive rise in market capitalisation, surging by an astounding 220 per cent to reach USD 4.25 billion within hours.  Launched on the Solana network, trading volumes of $TRUMP soared to nearly USD 1 billion during this period, while the coin's price skyrocketed from an initial USD 0.18 to USD 7.10. The token also garnered massive support on social media platform X, especially from Trump supporters.  According to Cryptotimes, a trader responded quickly to the opportunity and bought almost 6 million $TRUMP coins for approximately USD 1.1 million. Within a few minutes, the trader's investment became worth USD 23 million.  As per media reports, $TRUMP token has a fixed total supply of 1 billion tokens. Out of this, 200 million coins are available for initial distribution, while the remaining 800 million will be released in phases over the next three years. The coin takes its inspiration from Trump's presidential election slogan "Fight, Fight, Fight", which he notably shouted after surviving an assassination bid in Pennsylvania in July 2024.  Donald Trump is all set to take oath as the US President on January 20 in a high-profile event at the US Capitol's rotunda. The Capital One Arena is a sports venue in downtown Washington DC that can hold 20,000 people.Published By: Sahil SinhaPublished On: Jan 18, 2025

Headline: Trump 2.0: What the new US President means for Indian stock marketsBack in November, news of Donald Trump's return to the White House sent the Sensex soaring by over 900 points, sparking optimism across Dalal Street.
Content: Stock markets can be uncertain and thrive on surprises, and few figures are as unpredictable as Donald Trump. Much like the market's volatile swings, his policies have always kept the world guessing. Back in November, news of Trump’s return to the White House sent the Sensex soaring by over 900 points, sparking optimism across Dalal Street. But as January 20 approaches, bringing Trump 2.0 into focus, the euphoria has turned into uncertainty. Will Trump's second stint as US President steer the Indian stock markets to new highs, or will it lead to more downward bearish sentiment?UNCERTAINTY OVER DALAL STREET The initial stock market rally after Trump’s victory was driven by hopes for business-friendly policies and a stable global outlook. However, the volatility since then reflects growing concerns about his administration's approach to trade, geopolitical tensions, and economic policies. Ajit Mishra, Senior Vice President of Research at Religare Broking Ltd, highlighted the potential mixed effects of Trump’s return. He said, “The return of Donald Trump as US President could bring mixed implications for Indian stock markets, depending on his policies. His 'America First' agenda might tighten trade conditions, but stronger U.S.-India ties could benefit sectors like IT, pharmaceuticals, and defense. Mishra further added that a potential revival of H-1B visa restrictions might pressure Indian IT firms, while easing policies would be positive. Trump’s tough stance on China could position India as a strategic partner, attracting FDI into manufacturing and defense, but heightened geopolitical tensions might increase market volatility. "His pro-fossil fuel policies could stabilise or lower crude oil prices, benefiting India as an oil importer. Global volatility under Trump’s unpredictable style might lead to temporary market fluctuations. A stronger dollar could trigger foreign outflows, impacting the rupee and equities, while a weaker dollar would support FPI inflows. Investors should focus on domestic fundamentals to navigate potential volatility," Mishra told India Today Digital. KEY CONCERNS  Trump’s election has already caused significant adjustments in global markets. Satish Chandra Aluri from Lemonn Markets Desk said, “Trump's election as US President has already led to a sharp adjustment in global markets even before he took office. Expectations of business-friendly policies (lower taxes, less regulation, etc.) and strong US growth prospects have led to capital flows into US assets from elsewhere across the globe." "The threat of tariffs/trade war has also led to expectations of a rise in inflation, as tariffs can push prices higher, thereby undercutting the progress made so far by central banks, which could put brakes on further rate cuts. This, in turn, pushed the US yields and US Dollar higher, which is generally a headwind for emerging markets like India," he added.  The US Dollar index appreciated by approximately 9% since October last year, and benchmark US 10-year Treasury yield rose around 100 basis points to 4.8% levels, putting pressure on risk assets. "Indian markets are already reeling under this pressure. Foreigners have net sold Rs 27,889 crore so far in the new year, over and above the Rs 1 lakh crore in the October-December quarter last year. Apart from cross-asset implications, Trump’s actions as President, especially on trade/tariffs on Indian imports and the recent debate surrounding the H-1B visa programme, can have huge implications for exporters (engineered goods, electronics, gems and jewellery, and pharma) as well as IT sector names," Aluri said.  The strengthening US Dollar has pushed the Indian rupee to record lows, which, combined with foreign outflows from Indian markets, has created additional challenges.  Analysts expect the rupee to remain under pressure unless corporate earnings in India improve significantly.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 19, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Hindenburg's Nate Anderson could be charged with securities fraud: ReportAnderson is under scrutiny for colluding with hedge funds in preparing reports to target various companies, added the report based on a Canadian portal, which cited documents filed before a court in Ontario.
Content: Hindenburg Research founder Nate Anderson, who last week made the announcement about shutting down operations of the short-selling firm, could be charged with securities fraud, news agency PTI reported.  Anderson is under scrutiny for colluding with hedge funds in preparing reports to target various companies, added the report based on a Canadian portal, which cited documents filed before a court in Ontario.  The portal stated that documents filed in a defamation case at the Ontario Superior Court revealed that Moez Kassam, head of Canada’s Anson hedge fund, admitted to sharing research with various sources, including Hindenburg’s Nate Anderson. The Market Frauds portal, cited in the PTI report, said that the court documents "allegedly revealed" that Hindenburg Research "colluded with Anson" while preparing a report.  It also highlighted the fact that preparation of bearish report without disclosure of participation can be charged as securities fraud by the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Though it is common for short-sellers to borrow a security, sell it on the open market, and later repurchase it at a lower price following negative reports about companies, the involvement of hedge funds is something that raises concerns.  This is because such funds may place parallel bets that amplify downward pressure on stock prices. Anderson, Anson and Kassam are yet to issue any statement on the matter. The portal, quoted by PTI, said, "We know for a fact, from the email conversations between Anderson and Anson Funds, that he was indeed working for Anson and published whatever they told him to, from the price target to what should and shouldn't be in the report". "He asked them multiple times if they needed 'more'. From what we can see in the dozens of exchanges, at no time did he have editorial control. He was being told what to publish," the portal claimed. In addition, the Market Frauds portal also shared screenshots of some email interactions between Hindenburg and Anson to support its charge. It claimed to have accessed these screenshots through the documents available with the Ontario court.  "There are multiple counts of securities fraud for both Anson Funds and Nate Anderson, and we have only gone through 5% of what's in there as of the time of writing," the portal said. "From what we have read so far, it is almost a certainty that when the whole exchange between Hindenburg and Anson reaches the SEC, Nate Anderson will be charged with securities fraud in 2025,” it added.  The report added that when the association first emerged, Hindenburg Research said it received “hundreds of leads each year from diverse sources," such as industry experts, whistleblowers and other investors.  "We rigorously vet each lead and have always maintained full editorial independence over our work. The portal went on to highlight one such report published by Hindenburg Research about Facedrive, a Canadian company that went public through a reverse merger as an eco-friendly ride-sharing service. The short-seller had claimed that the company was overvalued and lavishly paying promoters. As per the portal, Anson had allegedly exchanged emails with Anderson over the report and added that court documents revealed that the hedge fund had knowledge of when the report was to be published.  Just last week, Anderson made an announcement about shutting down Hindenburg Research, which came under the spotlight in India after publishing a scathing report about billionaire Gautam Adani’s conglomerate, the Adani Group.  Anderson shared a detailed post, stating that the research firm’s work is complete, and it is time to move on.  "As I’ve shared with family, friends and our team since late last year, I have made the decision to disband Hindenburg Research," he said in a blog post.Published By: Vivek Published On: Jan 19, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Stocks to watch today: Wipro, Zomato, Paytm, IDBI Bank, Adani Enery In today's trading session, stocks of Zomato, Paytm, IDBI Bank will be in the spotlight as they will announce their Q3 FY25 results today. Wipro shares will also be in the focus as it reported a rise in consolidated net profit in Q3 earnings.
Content:

Headline: Laxmi Dental IPO listing: Shares to make strong market debut? Check GMP Laxmi Dental IPO saw bumper subscription numbers as investors flocked to bid for the public issue. The IPO received bids over 100 times.
Content: Shares of Laxmi Dental IPO (initial public offering) will make its market debut on the Dalal Street on Monday, after the allotment process was completed on January 16, 2024.  Laxmi Dental IPO saw bumper subscription numbers as investors flocked to bid for the public issue. The IPO received bids over 100 times.  Retail investors showed good interest, placing bids 75 times the number of shares allocated to them. Among institutional participants, qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) bid 110 times their share. High-net-worth individuals (NIIs) outdid both groups, bidding nearly 148 times the shares reserved for them. The IPO received good reviews from experts as they were mostly positive for an investment in the long run.  "The company continues to scale up branded product offerings and undertake product enhancements of existing dental products and launch new dental products. Investors looking to invest can invest in the IPO for the long term," said Master Capital Services Ltd. Laxmi Dental IPO opened for subscription on January 13, 2025 aiming to raise Rs 698.06 crore through a fresh issue of 32 lakh shares and an offer for sale of 1.31 crore shares.LATEST GMP FOR LAXMI DENTAL IPO The Grey Market Premium (GMP) for Laxmi Dental IPO has gone above in the past few days and stood at Rs 145 as of January 20, 2025, at 5:04 AM. With its price band capped at Rs 428, the projected listing price is estimated to be around Rs 573, which represents a potential gain of 33.88 % per share based on the current GMP. The price band for the IPO was set between Rs 407 and Rs 428 per share. Retail investors were required to apply for a minimum of 33 shares, translating to an initial investment of Rs 14,124. Laxmi Dental IPO raised Rs 314.13 crore from anchor investors ahead of opening for subscription. Headline: EPFO simplifies fund transfers, personal detail corrections for membersWith the introduction of the revised process, it is expected that in future over 1.20 crore out of 1.30 crore total transfer claims would be directly forwarded to EPFO without requiring the employer's intervention.
Content: The Employees Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has now made the transfer of provident funds for its members more easy and streamlined with its new update.  "To ensure ease of doing for its members, EPFO has simplified the process for the transfer of PF account on change of jobs wherein the requirement to route online transfer claims through either the previous or current employer has been removed in majority of cases. With the introduction of the revised process, it is expected that in future over 1.20 crore out of 1.30 crore total transfer claims i.e. 94% of the total claims would be directly forwarded to EPFO without requiring the employer’s intervention," said a press release from the Ministry of Labour & Employment.  Members whose e-KYC is fully compliant can now submit their PF transfer claims online directly through EPFO using an Aadhaar-based OTP. This streamlined process eliminates the need for any involvement from the employer. "It is expected that in future over 1.20 crore out of 1.30 crore total transfer claims i.e. 94% of the total claims would be directly forwarded to EPFO without requiring the employer’s intervention," the release said.  The EPFO has also removed the complexities associated with the joint declaration process for correction of personal information of its subscribers. "EPFO has introduced further simplification in the process of updating member profile. Under the revised procedure, the members whose Universal Account Number (UAN) has already been validated through Aadhaar can update their profile like name, date of birth, gender, nationality, father/mother’s name, marital status, spouse name, date of joining and date of leaving themselves without the requirement of uploading any document. Only, in certain cases where UAN was obtained prior to 1-10-2017, the updation would require certification of employer only," said a press release.  The streamlining and simplification of this process is expected on an average to eliminate a delay of nearly 28 days taken by employer to approve Joint Declarations (JDs). The request for change/correction of EPF Account holders not having a full e-KYC, shall get approved at employer level in approximately another 50% of the cases without requirement for any approval at EPFO. "This revision will immediately benefit around 3.9 Lakh members whose requests are pending at various stages," said Ministry of Labour & Employment. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 20, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher boosted by banking stocks. Kotak Bank gains 10%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 168.02 points to 76,787.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 31.55 points to 23,234.75 as of 10 AM.

Trump had announced that he had  a ‘very good’ telephone call with the Chinese President Xi Jinping and that the outcome is positive. This indicates that initially Trump would go slow on tariffs and would prefer to negotiate," he added.  The latest IMF report on Global Economic Outlook projects ‘solid’ growth of 6.5% for 2025 and 2026 for India despite the recent deceleration in growth. This is positive. There is a flurry of Q3 results this week and the market will respond to the results depending on, apart from the numbers, the outlook and management commentary."Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 20, 2025

Headline: UK's richest 10% took half of colonial India's wealth: ReportA report mentioned that colonialism was responsible for ruining Indian industrial output by imposing strict protectionist policies which prevented Asian textiles from competing in the global market.
Content: The colonial extraction of wealth from India during 1765 to 1900 by the British Empire amounted to $64.82 trillion. This wealth went in the hands of the richest 10% of Britons, who received $33.8 trillion of the wealth, says Oxfam's latest report, which was published on Monday. The report further mentioned that 52% of the above-mentioned wealth ended up in the hands of the UK’s richest individuals, followed by the UK’s emerging middle class, which gained 32% of the wealth. The Oxfam report also mentioned that colonialism was responsible for ruining Indian industrial output by imposing strict protectionist policies that prevented Asian textiles from competing in the market. In 1750, the Indian subcontinent accounted for 25% of global industrial output, which was drastically reduced to a mere 2% by 1900, mentioned the report. Oxfam further critiqued the British colonial regime as a “drug pusher,” for using the opium trade to gain advantage over its colonies. It alleged that the British used large-scale poppy cultivation in poorer regions of eastern India and exported the same to China, which led to the Opium War and subsequently deepened inequalities.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 20, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Paytm share price gains after reporting Q3 results. Check details herePaytm shares were up 1.44% to Rs 912.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:25 am.
Content: Shares of One97 Communication Limited (OCL), the parent company of digital payments firm Paytm, rose after the company reported its financial results for the third quarter. Paytm shares were up 1.44% to Rs 912.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 11:25 am. The company’s net loss narrowed to Rs 208 crore in Q3FY25, compared to Rs 219.8 crore in the same period last year. Consolidated revenue from operations fell 36% year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 1,828 crore, down from Rs 2,851 crore in Q3FY24. On a quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) basis, however, the company’s revenue rose 10%, supported by a rise in gross merchandise value (GMV), good growth in subscription revenues, and higher revenue from distribution of financial services. “We have been able to reduce our indirect cost by 7% QoQ and 23% YoY to Rs 1,000 crore. Going forward, we expect calibrated growth in marketing costs and sales employee expenses as we invest in customer and merchant acquisition,” Paytm said in its earnings release. “Our employee costs (excluding ESOP) for 9M FY 2025 is lower by Rs 451 Cr YoY, and will comfortably surpass our targeted annualised people cost savings of Rs 400-500 crore,” it added. Paytm also noted that it did not receive any UPI incentive during the quarter. Among other important takeaways, the company’s cash balance rose by Rs 2,851 on a QoQ basis to Rs 12,850 crore. The company’s merchant subscriber base for devices stood at 1.17 crore at the end of the December quarter, with the addition of 5 lakh subscribers. Last but not lease, the company said it continues to prioritise a compliance-first approach, with focus on innovation in its merchant payment solutions. Paytm also remains focused on regaining its UPI market share to levels seen in January 2024.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 20, 2025

Headline: Kotak Mahindra Bank share price up 10% after Q3 results. Buy, hold or sell?Kotak Mahindra Bank stock price: The private lender's shares have got several upgrades from brokerage firms following its strong third-quarter performance.
Content: Shares of private lender Kotak Mahindra Bank rose nearly 10% on Monday after displaying a strong performance in third quarter of the ongoing financial year. Kotak Mahindra Bank shares were up 9.31% to Rs 1,922.40 at 10:22 am on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The bank’s net profit grew 10% to Rs 3,305 crore, compared to Rs 3,005 crore in the same period last year. The lender’s net interest income (NII) for Q3FY25 also increased to Rs 7,196 crore, higher than Rs 6,554 crore in Q3FY24. This was also up 10% year-on-year (YoY). And the net interest margin stood at 4.93% for the third quarter. The interest earned by the bank during the period stood at Rs 13,427.58 crore, compared to Rs 11,799 crore in the year-ago period.SHOULD YOU BUY, HOLD OR SELL?  Multiple brokerages have shared positive views on the bank’s Q3FY25 performance, suggesting that the rally in its share price may continue in the near term. Brokerage firm Nuvama Institutional Equities said the bank’s earnings offer both growth and quality, and “shall turn out to be among the best in the sector in our view”. “A marginal uptick in NIM, healthy loan growth, strong deposit growth and a QoQ decline in slippage with a higher PCR are the key positives,” Nuvama added. It may be noted that Nuvama Institutional Equities has given the bank’s shares a ‘BUY’ rating, marking a double upgrade from its earlier ‘SELL’ call. It has also set a fresh target price of Rs 2,040 per share. Nomura Holdings said Kotak Mahindra Bank’s loan and deposit growth were healthy in the third quarter, especially in a tough macroeconomic environment. The Japanese brokerage called it encouraging. It has maintained its ‘BUY’ rating on the stock. "We believe [the bank] offers growth, quality and a safe place to hide in a milieu of weak deposits and high NPLs. The bank has done a particularly commendable job turning in a strong Q3 even as it weathered the RBI ban," said Nuvama. Motilal Oswal has also upgraded the Kotak Mahindra Bank stock price to ‘BUY’ from ‘NEUTRAL’. It has set a revised target price of Rs 2,100, compared to its earlier Rs 1,900. DAM Capital was another brokerage that upgraded the lender’s stock to ‘BUY’ from ‘NEUTRAL’, with a target price of Rs 2,020. Meanwhile, Bernstein maintained its market-perform rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 1,950. The most diverging view came from Emkay Global, which reiterated its ‘REDUCE’ call but bumped up the target price to Rs 1,750 from Rs 1,700. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 20, 2025

Headline: Laxmi Dental IPO listing: Shares open at 23% premium on D-Street. Hold or sell?  Laxmi Dental stock price: The shares of Laxmi Dental opened at Rs 528 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) reflecting a gain of 23.36% over its IPO price.
Content: Laxmi Dental IPO made a strong debut on the stock exchanges on Monday, listing at a premium of over 23% to its issue price of Rs 428.  The shares of Laxmi Dental opened at Rs 528 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) reflecting a gain of 23.36% over its IPO price. High-net-worth individuals (NIIs) outdid both groups, bidding nearly 148 times the shares reserved for them.HOLD OR SELL? Shivani Nyati, Head of Wealth at Swastika Investmart Ltd said that the company has demonstrated a positive financial trajectory, transitioning from losses to profitability. "The company is the Second largest player in the domestic laboratory business and the largest export laboratory. The company made a good stock market debut, listing for Rs. 542 per share, a significant 26.6% premium over its issue price of Rs. 428. Those who took part in the initial public offering (IPO) may book part profit and hold with stoploss of 480," she added. Headline: Paytm Q3 FY25 results: Revenue surges to Rs 1,828 crore, gets closer to profitabilityThe growth was propelled by the company's robust payments business and an expanding portfolio in financial services distribution.
Content: India’s leading payments and financial services company, Paytm, reported a strong performance in Q3 FY25, with its operating revenue climbing 10% quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) to Rs 1,828 crore. The growth was propelled by the company’s robust payments business and an expanding portfolio in financial services distribution. Paytm’s drive toward profitability showed marked progress, with its net loss improving by Rs 208 crore YoY. The company’s EBITDA also witnessed a significant improvement of Rs 181 crore QoQ, narrowing to Rs (223) crore. Its contribution margin, excluding UPI incentives, remained steady at 52%, contributing Rs 959 crore to profits. EBITDA before ESOP costs improved by Rs 145 crore QoQ to Rs (41) crore, with the company maintaining its target to achieve EBITDA profitability before ESOP costs by Q4 FY25. The revenues from Paytm’s payments services segment grew to Rs 1,059 crore, while financial services revenue rose 35% QoQ to Rs 502 crore. The platform processed a Gross Merchandise Value (GMV) of Rs 5 lakh crore during the quarter, reflecting a 13% QoQ increase. Merchant subscriptions for payment devices grew by 5 lakh during the quarter, reaching 1.17 crore. Meanwhile, the net payment margin stood at Rs 489 crore, driven by higher subscription revenue and stable payment processing margins. The company’s cost optimisation efforts continued to deliver results, with indirect costs dropping 7% QoQ and 23% YoY. Employee expenses for the first nine months of FY25 were reduced by Rs 451 crore YoY, surpassing Paytm’s annual cost-saving target of Rs 400-500 crore. Loan disbursements during the quarter totaled Rs 3,831 crore in Q3 FY25 versus Rs 3,303 Cr in Q2 FY 2025. More than 50% of these loans were issued to repeat borrowers, indicating strong customer retention. A substantial portion of the loans was distributed under Paytm’s Direct Lending & Guarantee (DLG) model, known for its higher upfront cost but enhanced long-term profitability. This model’s success has drawn increased interest from lenders, further strengthening the company’s financial services business. Paytm continues to prioritise a compliance-first approach and innovation in its merchant payment solutions, including new devices and payment aggregation tools. The company is also focused on regaining its UPI market share to January 2024 levels, scaling its financial services offerings, and leveraging AI-driven automation to enhance operational efficiency. With a cash reserve of Rs 12,850 crore as of Q3 FY25, the company is well-positioned to sustain its growth momentum. Paytm’s strategic execution and focus on profitability solidify its status as a leader in India’s fintech sector, driving the country’s ongoing digital transformation.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 20, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Bankrupt airline Go First's liquidation plea approved by law tribunalGo First's lenders decided to liquidate the bankrupt budget carrier's assets in August of last year after rejecting bids by interest suitors.
Content: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has ordered the liquidation of Go First airline, according to multiple media reports. A NCLT bench, led by Judicial Member Mahendra Khandelwal and Technical Member Dr Sanjeev Ranjan, granted the liquidation petition filed by the airline’s Committee of Creditors, reported Bar and Bench. Go First’s lenders decided to liquidate the bankrupt budget carrier’s assets in August of last year after rejecting bids by interest suitors. In May 2023, the airline had filed a plea under Section 10 of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC), requesting admission to the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP). It may be noted that the airline had received two bids as part of the bankruptcy process, and one of them even bumped up the offer after a push by lenders. However, the bids were ultimately rejected. Go First's total dues to creditors stand at Rs 6,521 crore. Some of the creditors are Central Bank of India, Bank of Baroda, IDBI Bank and Deutsche Bank. The approval of the liquidation plea is a welcome development for the lenders, as all hopes of the airline's revival were lost after Go First's foreign aircraft lessors were allowed to take back their planes after a prolonged legal tussle. Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 20, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why Vodafone Idea share price surged 15% todayVodafone Idea stock: The shares hit the day's high of Rs 10.48, rising close to 15% after it closed at Rs 9.12 in the previous session. 10.03
Content: Shares of Vodadone Idea surged in early trade on Monday to hit the day's high of Rs 10.48, rising close to 15%.  Vodadone Idea shares were trading at Rs 10, up 9.65%, with a market capitalisation of Rs 69,839.22 crore at the time the article was being written.  The rise in the Vodafone Idea stock has been witnessed after media reports surfaced that the government may waive 50% interest and 100% penalties related to the adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues.  The dues were imposed on telecom firms like Vodafone Idea and Bharti Airtel as per a 2019 ruling by the Supreme Court. Vodafone Idea shares had closed at Rs 9.12 and opened at Rs 10.03 on Monday.  The stock is trading very far from its 52-week high of Rs 19.15 which it reached on June 28, 2024. The shares of Vodafone Idea hit its 52-week low of Rs 6.60 on November 22, 2024.  If the plan to waive the AGR dues is actually implemented, it will result in a huge relief for the telecom industry.  Media reports also suggest that the government could announce the relief for the telecom industry in the upcoming budget, which could be the second such move since September 2021.  "We maintain SELL on VIL and HOLD on Indus as VIL’s long-term sustainability is still contingent on significant favourable government support," said JM Financial Institutional Securities Limited.  "The Supreme Court (SC) had closed the telcos’ last legal remedy on the AGR matter, after it dismissed their AGR curative petition in Sep’24. Hence, waiver of any AGR dues could be a huge positive for VIL and a significant positive for Indus; it is also positive for Bharti and neutral for Jio," it added.  Vodafone Idea shares have gained 35.14% in the past month but have fallen 37.07% in the last half year. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 20, 2025

Headline: Sensex jumps 600 points. While volatility on Dalal Street gained during the trading session, gains in major shares such as Kotak Mahindra Bank, Wipro, Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv, SBI and Reliance Industries contributed to the market gains. Analysts have also shared bullish views on the lender’s stock after the Q3FY25 results.WIPRO’S BETTER-THAN-EXPECTED Q3 PERFORMANCE IT giant Wipro’s share price also jumped sharply after it reported better-than-expected results in the December quarter. Although Wipro’s results were in line with estimates, brokerages still want investors to remain a bit cautious due to challenges in critical verticals and geographies.STOCK MARKETS IN ‘WAIT AND WATCH’ MODE Despite today’s gains, Dalal Street is likely to remain volatile as global stock markets will be in a wait and watch mode as Trump 2.0 unfolds today, said Dr. VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services. “Many executive actions, particularly on immigration, are expected from the President starting from day one. Markets will wait and watch for the nature of the decisions and their likely impact,” Vijayakumat added. On the brighter side, he highlighted that the latest International Monetary Fund (IMF) report on Global Economic Outlook projected India to register a solid growth of 6.5% for 2025 and 2026 for India. “This is positive.” He also noted that there is a flurry of Q3 results this week and the market will respond to the results depending on, apart from the numbers, the outlook and management commentary.
