It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 22, 2025

Headline: Zomato shares down over 23% in a month. Should you buy or avoid?Zomato share price: The food delivery giant's stock price has fallen over 14% in the previous two sessions and over 23% in the past month.
Content:
Shares of Zomato fell for the third straight session, continuing its poor run on Dalal Street after reporting Q3FY25 results. Zomato’s stock price has fallen 14% in the previous two sessions and over 23% in the past month. The fall in Zomato’s share price comes after a period of strong gains as its profit in the third quarter dipped sharply to Rs 59 crore. While analysts did acknowledge the drop in net profit in Q3FY25, they remain bullish about the company’s quick commerce division, Blinkit.SHOULD YOU BUY OR AVOID? Despite the fall in Zomato’s share price, brokerage firms remain optimistic about the company, albeit with rising competition. As mentioned earlier, most of the brokerages remain bullish on Zomato’s long-term performance due to Blinkit, which they say is well-positioned to retain a top spot in the quick commerce space. Brokerage firms such as Nomura, Jefferies, and Bernstein are all optimistic about Zomato’s long-term growth potential. However, most of the brokerages said the near-term losses may be higher due to the rapid expansion of dark stores. It is also worth noting that brokerages such as Nuvama Institutional Equities and Jefferies have trimmed their target price on Zomato’s stock. ZOMATO Q3 PERFORMANCE

In the third quarter, Zomato reported a 57% decline in consolidated net profit to Rs 59 crore, compared to Rs 138 crore in the year-ago period. It’s revenue from operations rose 64.39% to Rs 5,405 crore in the quarter, compared to Rs 3,288 crore in the year-ago period. It’s adjusted EBITDA also grew 128% year-on-year, but it fell 14% on a quarter-on-quarter basis. This was due to increased investments in new stores. At 10:53 am, shares of Zomato were trading 2.59% lower at Rs 209.10 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 22, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Will Donald Trump's tariff suspense hurt Indian stocks? All you need to knowDonald Trump has also threatened BRICS nations with up to 100% tariffs against taking a decision that could lead to de-dollarisation of the global economy.
Content: Donald Trump had signalled during his election camp that he would put tariffs on countries that impose higher tariffs on US goods, and he reiterated the same after taking charge as the 47th US President, sending global markets into a frenzy. "As a result of this inconclusive policy stance, Asian markets were mixed. Japan’s benchmark Nikkei 225 edged up 0.16% and Hong Kong’s Hang Seng index climbed 0.85%. Conversely, Mainland China’s CN50 Index slipped 1.23%, South Korea’s Kospi dipped 0.08%, and India’s Nifty 50 retreated 0.30%. This lack of definitive action on tariffs spurred caution among investors, who remain vigilant for further announcements that might reshape global trade," said Justin Khoo, Senior Market Analyst - APAC, VT Markets. Indian stock markets also faced the brunt, with the Sensex and Nifty crashing on Tuesday in a highly volatile trading day.  Trump, who took office on Monday, has pledged tariffs of 10% on global imports, 60% on Chinese goods and a 25% import surcharge on Canadian and Mexican products, Reuters reported. In the case of Canada and Mexico, Trump warned of imposing tariffs on these countries if they failed to stop illegal immigration into the US and crack down on drug cartels. Trump's pledge to implement a trade policy of 'tariff and tax' on other countries, also has implications for countries like India, which currently imposes tariffs on certain US products.HOW COULD TARIFFS IMPACT STOCK MARKETS?  The newly elected US President has not announced any tariffs on India, but how would Trump's tariff plans affect the stock market in India, if he actually did? "After this Trump tariff war, India will be neutral on this front. The impact on India but the domestic centric sectors are going to insulate it. As far as tariffs are concerned, by and large, India's trade with the US is more concerned about IT services and also with respect to pharma, is concerned. IT is going to benefit because of the strength in the US economy. The impact of the tariffs on India in the medium to short term is going to be neutral, but we need to wait and watch how the actual tariffs are going to come in the coming days," said Kranthi Bathini, Equity Strategist, WealthMills Securities Pvt Ltd. "One can look at stocks in defence, railways. These are the sectors one needs to keep on their watch list. And capital goods also. Investors can add on stocks names like BEML in the railway space, Afcon in the infrastructure and L&T for the medium to long term," he told India Today Digital, suggesting stocks that investors could add to their portfolio.  Donald Trump has also threatened BRICS nations with up to 100% tariffs over de-dollarisation.  Speaking to reporters upon assuming office, Trump said, “As a Brics nation, they'll face a 100% tariff if they so much as even think about doing what they thought, and therefore they will give it up immediately.” “If the Brics nations want to do that, that's okay, but we're going to put at least a 100% tariff on the business they do with the United States. It's not even a threat. In fact, since I made that statement, Biden said they have us over a barrel. I said, No, we have them over a barrel. And there's no way they're going to be able to do that.” Bathini, however, said that the newly elected President is focussed on countries like Canada, China, Canada, Brazil, tec and hence investors will have to wait and watch how the situation unfolds for India.  Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 22, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: 3 things government should focus on to tackle climate changeBudget 2025 expectations: Experts said climate action is the need of the hour and announcements related to clean energy will be crucial. There could be a push to boost green jobs as well.
Content: The government is expected to announce key measures to tackle climate change and boost green energy in the Union Budget 2025 to address rising concerns over environmental disasters. Experts who spoke to IndiaToday.in shared their expectations ahead of the budget, saying that climate action is the need of the hour. Announcements related to clean energy will be crucial, and there could be a push to boost green jobs as well.  Here are some key expectations from the government:FOCUS ON CLEAN ENERGY AND GREEN JOBS Manoj Bansal, Partner at Grant Thornton Bharat, said the government will be focused on meeting its climate goals while supporting development. He stressed that policies for clean energy and green technologies are important priorities and should find mention in the budget. “The budget may also include support for domestic carbon markets, set to launch next year. There is hope for incentives to encourage private companies to invest in climate solutions.” Green jobs, which focus on sustainability, clean energy, and eco-friendly practices, will also be in focus. Bansal wants the government to create more green jobs and industries.  “Collaboration between the government and industry is key. This budget could boost innovation, create green jobs, and help India move toward a low-carbon future while meeting global climate commitments," he added. REDUCE EMMISSIONS AND INCENTIVISE ESG FRAMEWORKS Other important expectations shared by experts were related to reducing carbon emissions and incentivising carbon accounting and ESG (environmental, social, and governance) frameworks.  Vivek Mehra, Co-founder & Chief Sustainability Officer, Onlygood.ai, said, "With India’s commitments to reducing emissions intensity and creating significant carbon sinks, this budget could drive transformative changes across sectors.”  “Industries require incentives to adopt carbon accounting and ESG frameworks, ensuring compliance with emerging regulations and global climate goals. Measures to promote investment in cleaner technologies, renewable energy, and energy efficiency will be crucial," he added. Mehra further mentioned that clear carbon pricing mechanisms and developing voluntary carbon markets could further encourage industries to actively reduce their emissions. In other words, the upcoming Budget 2025 could go a long way in shaping the country’s low-carbon and sustainable future and at the same time, make efforts to accelerate the country’s journey towards climate leadership.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 22, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Explained: Why ICICI Prudential shares tumbled 10% after Q3 resultsICICI Prudential share price: The company's share price decline came a day after Q3FY25 results, where it reported a 43% rise in net profit to Rs 326 crore.
Content: ICICI Prudential Life Insurance Company’s share price fell as much as 10% in early trade on Tuesday. The decline in the company’s share price came a day after Q3FY25 results, where it reported a 43% rise in net profit to Rs 326 crore. While the life insurance company beat analysts’ estimates, shares of the company declined as brokerages only maintained a neutral stance. Analysts at Goldman Sachs maintained a ‘neutral’ rating on the stock, with a target price of Rs 650, slightly lower than the earlier Rs 665. It acknowledged the company’s strong annual premium equivalent (APE) growth, but added that it came at the cost of margins. It also highlighted that the product mix has shifted towards lower-margin products, which is another negative factor. Brokerage firm Macquarie also maintained a ‘neutral’ rating on the stock, with a target price of Rs 725. It said that the growth in value of new business (VNB) remains disappointing. It also estimated VNB margin of 23.9% in FY25E in comparison to 22.8% in the nine months of FY25. The brokerage further highlighted that it will be challenging for ICICI Prudential to sustain the VNB margin at current levels, despite new surrender rules taking effect from the second half of FY25. It also projected VNB Compound Annual Growth Rate (CAGR) for FY25-27E is 14%. Emkay Global also noted that the life insurance company reported weak performance for the nine months of FY25, especially mentioning the VNB margin of 22.8%. Other brokerages such as Nuvama and Antique Stock Broking also highlighted the lower-than-expected VNB margin, which remains a concern. At around 11:36 am, shares of ICICI Prudential Life Insurance were trading 7.73% lower at Rs 586.75 on the Bombay Stock Exchange.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 22, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: How government can provide relief to taxpayersBudget 2025 and income tax: The country's vast middle-class population is also calling for the inclusion of tax-saving provisions and deductions under the new income tax regime.
Content: The Union Budget 2025 is just around the corner, and there are high expectations from citizens related to income tax relief. Though experts had earlier told IndiaToday.in that major tax relief measures are unlikely in the budget, taxpayers are still hoping for some incremental changes that will boost disposable income, given the fact that the government is also looking to boost consumption. Akhil Chandna, Partner at Grant Thornton Bharat, said that "new tax incentives for affordable housing could offer relief to first-time homebuyers and stimulate the real estate sector." The country’s vast middle-class population is also calling for the inclusion of tax-saving provisions and deductions under the new income tax regime. At present, the new income tax regime comes with lower tax slabs and a standard deduction of Rs 75,000, which is Rs 25,000 more than the old regime’s Rs 50,000. However, the new regime still lacks the benefit of key deductions that make the old regime so popular amongst salaried taxpayers in the country, especially those with home loans. The government can also look at rationalising capital gains taxation, as it will not only provide a boost to investors but also the broader economy. But that looks unlikely given the fact that an announcement on this was made in the previous budget. Pranav Haridasan, MD and CEO, Axis Securities, said, "Taxation expectations are centered around rationalising capital gains tax to simplify compliance and encourage broader market participation.” While there has been some speculation about a cut in the Securities Transaction Tax (STT), Haridasan said this seems unlikely given the government’s focus on revenue. “Instead, there could be targeted relief for individual taxpayers through higher deductions under section 80C and potential adjustments in the new tax regime to support consumption,” he added.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 22, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: HDFC Bank Q3 results: Net profit rises 2.2% to Rs 16,736 croreThe private lender reported a 7.6% increase in interest earned, which came to Rs 76,007 crore compared to Rs 70,583 in the same quarter of the previous financial year.
Content: HDFC Bank announced its financial results on Wednesday, declaring a 2.2% year-on-year growth for Q3 FY25 standalone net profit, totaling Rs 16,736 crore. The largest private lender of the country had reported a standalone net profit of to Rs 16,373 crore in the same period last year. Experts and analysts had projected a muted growth in the range of 0-3% in Q3 FY25 results for HDFC Bank.  The private lender reported a 7.6% increase in interest earned, which came to Rs 76,007 crore compared to Rs 70,583 in the same quarter of the previous financial year. HDFC Bank paid Rs 45,354 crore as interest in the third quarter of FY25 which is an increase of 7.7% from Rs 42,111 crore in Q3 FY24. Shares of HDFC Bank were trading at Rs 1,657.80, up 0.94% at the time the article was being written, post the announcement of the Q3 results. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 22, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Why financial services sector needs a 'digital lending' boostBudget 2025 would play a key role in driving the country's economic growth through enhanced credit access to the rural and underserved sectors of the economy.
Content: The growth of the financial services sector is an integral part of India's expanding economy, and this is why several experts have called for a better digital lending ecosystem to enhance credit access. With the Union Budget presentation on February 1, the financial services sector remains under the spotlight. Several experts told IndiaToday.in that they will watch out for announcements such as a better digital lending ecosystem along with an increased focus on non-banking financial companies (NBFCs). Firstly, experts have called for increased access to financial services, which would be crucial for accelerating economic growth. Yashoraj Tyagi, CEO, CASHe, said, “The lending sector expects some major changes in the upcoming Union Budget. Increased credit fraud, limited access to customer protection tools and cyber scams have temporarily disrupted the digital lending ecosystem.” He added, “This year's budget presents opportunities to introduce policies that can strengthen digital infrastructure and enhance access to financial services.” Shikhar Aggarwal, Chairman of BLS E-Services explained, “The Indian government has been actively promoting financial inclusion, especially in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities. These efforts aim to integrate underserved populations into the formal financial system, providing them with access to essential financial services.” Non-Banking Financial Companies (NBFCs) play an important role in an economy as they fill the gap between the conventional banking system and the underserved sectors of the country. Thomas John Muthoot, Chairman of Muthoot Pappachan Group noted, “Approve dedicated credit lines for NBFCs from banks to facilitate seamless digital lending to micro-retailers, addressing credit gaps in underserved sectors and promoting financial inclusion.” This would accelerate economic participation from the rural sectors, which in turn would contribute to the nation’s overall growth and development. Experts have also called for the adoption of policies that support digital literacy and strengthen the nation’s digital financial ecosystem, thus creating a more effective and secure financial environment. Dilip Modi, Founder and CEO, Spice Money said, “As we look forward to the Union Budget 2025-26, it is imperative to prioritise measures that strengthen the digital financial ecosystem, particularly in rural India, where initiatives like Aadhaar Enabled Payment System (AePS) and Bharat Connect have become lifelines for millions.”Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 22, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: TCS, Wipro, Infosys: Why IT stocks rose today despite high market volatilityIT Stocks: TCS shares were up 3.04% to Rs 4,158.45 at 3:00 pm, Wipro gained 3.37% to trade at Rs 308.40, and Infosys jumped 3.11% to Rs 1,856.70.
Content: On a day when most sectors are struggling on Dalal Street, information technology (IT) stocks defied the odds to register strong gains. In fact, gains in heavyweight stocks such as Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Wipro, Infosys, Tech Mahindra and HCLTech played a big role in providing support to the benchmark indices after they suffered a massive crash in the previous session. TCS shares were up 3.04% to Rs 4,158.45 at 3:00 pm, Wipro gained 3.37% to trade at Rs 308.40, and Infosys jumped 3.11% to Rs 1,856.70. Most other IT stocks such as HCLTech, Tech Mahindra were also trading 1-3% higher during the session despite rising volatility and negative sentiments on the stock market. And this was reflected in the Nifty IT index, which rose over 2%.WHY DID IT STOCKS GAIN TODAY? IT stocks are trading in positive territory today due to a mix of positive developments. For starters, US President Donald Trump did not go for stringent tariff measures right after he returned to White House. While it has led to some volatility in global markets, it seems to have provided temporary relief to IT firms. Dr. VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, said that the stock markets may have taken Trump’s tariff threat too seriously. Trump’s orders and announcements have been disruptive so far, but he has steered away from announcing tariffs like he had stated before. Other than that, IT stocks also benefitted from gains in US markets. The Dow Jones Industrial Average ended 1.24% higher, while Nasdaq Composite also rose 0.64%. This was another factor behind the positive performance of IT stocks on Dalal Street. Positive Q3 results from IT companies have also contributed to today’s rally. Large-cap IT companies such as TCS, Infosys, Wipro have delivered strong Q3 results, and the same is expected from Coforge and Persistent Systems today. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 22, 2025Must Watch

Headline: IT rally saves the day on Dalal Steet; Wipro, Infosys among top gainersThe biggest gainers during the session were IT stocks, with the Nifty IT index rising 2.14%, the highest among all other sectoral indices.
Content: A sharp rally in information technology (IT) stocks provided much-needed support to the benchmark stock market indices amid a volatile session. The S&P BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty50 ended higher after swinging between gains and losses for most parts of the session. The Sensex settled 566.63 points higher at 76,404.99, while the Nifty50 rose 130.70 points to end at 23,155.35. The biggest gainers during the session were IT stocks, with the Nifty IT index rising 2.14%, the highest among all other sectoral indices. Even as volatility eroded gains across most sectors, IT heavyweights such as Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Infosys, Wipro and HCLTech and Tech Mahindra registered strong gains. According to experts, IT stocks benefitted from the overnight rally on Wall Street and also no immediate action by US President Donald Trump on his tariff threats. Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services, said, "The IT sector led gains, recovering from recent losses. Apart from Banking and IT, most sectors posted losses, with the realty sector being the hardest hit for consecutive days." Other than that, positive Q3 momentum of IT companies also helped in today’s rally, with two big companies – Coforge and Persistent Systems – set to report third quarter results today. Despite today’s gains, which came during the last hour of trading, the situation remains volatile on Dalal Street. However, some analysts are of the view that the ongoing correction provides an opportunity to investors to accumulate specific large-cap stocks that have been performing well, and are expected to gain in the long term.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 22, 2025Must Watch

Headline: What is UPI Circle? 5 things you need to know UPI Circle is a solution where a primary user authorises a secondary user to make payments from their account.
Content: Managing finances for family and friends has always been tough, but with the introduction of UPI Circle last year, the same is now much simpler and easier. In fact, this feature allows one to make payments on their behalf, which is both safe and secure.WHAT IS UPI CIRCLE UPI Circle is a solution where a primary user authorises a secondary user to make payments from their account. It must be noted that a primary user is the one who is delegating the UPI authentication to make payment to a secondary user, while the secondary user is the one who is making UPI payments with appropriate authorisation of the primary user.TRANSACTION LIMIT The primary user can set a transaction limit of up to Rs 15000 per day, with Rs 5000 per transaction in the case of full delegation. A primary user can also authorise payments to up to five people while maintaining control over their spending.WHICH APP OFFERS UPI CIRCLE As of now, UPI Circle is available on BHIM UPI app.  Other platforms like PhonePe and Google Pay are yet to roll out this feature. Several banks, including SBI, HDFC, and ICICI support this feature. The feature ensures financial security by sending SMS alerts for every transaction, keeping users informed.WHAT IS PARTIAL AND FULL DELEGATION UPI Circle offers two modes of delegation, i.e., partial and full. With partial delegation, primary users must approve every transaction using their UPI PIN. On the contrary, full delegation allows secondary users to complete transactions within set limits.HOW TO ACTIVATE UPI CIRCLE FEATURE To activate the UPI Circle, download the BHIM UPI app and link the same with your bank account. Go to the UPI Circle section within the app. Now add family members or friends by entering their UPI IDs or phone numbers. Next, choose the type of delegation you want to give to them- a full or partial delegation. Now, set the transaction limit if opting for a full delegation.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 22, 2025

Headline: Should you convert your credit card bills into EMIs? Check hereConverting credit card bills into EMIs offers immediate relief by breaking big payments into smaller and manageable amounts.
Content: Managing huge credit card bills can be stressful. In fact, several credit card issuers offer the option of converting your bills into Equated Monthly Instalments (EMIs), thereby providing immediate relief. But will it impact your credit score and financial health? Let us understand in this article. Credit card users can opt for smaller, monthly instalments spread over a fixed period instead of paying the entire purchase amount in one go. However, while using this option, one needs to pay the processing fees as well as the interest charges.advertisementWILL IT IMPACT CREDIT SCORESwitching to EMI will not have an adverse effect on your credit score as the lender considers it a structured repayment strategy. However, the impact on your score depends on how well you manage the EMIs. Switching to EMI will not have an adverse effect on your credit score as the lender considers it a structured repayment strategy. However, the impact on your score depends on how well you manage the EMIs. Timely payments can improve your credit score over a period of time, thus, giving a boost to your creditworthiness. However, any default or delay in the EMI payment can impact your credit score adversely.WHAT ARE THE PROS AND CONS OF EMI CONVERSION Interestingly, converting credit card bills into EMIs comes with both benefits and drawbacks. It offers immediate relief by breaking big payments into smaller and manageable amounts. Also, the interest rates on EMIs are usually lower than the charges on unpaid balances when only a minimum amount is paid. Moreover, giving a fixed monthly payment makes it much easier to plan your finances. On the contrary, EMIs come with an extra cost, including interest and processing fees.  Missing or not paying EMIs regularly can impact your credit score.   In other words, converting your credit card bill into EMIs requires careful planning and regular monthly repayments.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 22, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: India least vulnerable but Trump unpredictable person: Martin Wolf Martin Wolf, speaking on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos, said that India is least vulnerable to Donald Trump's tariff threat.

Headline: Sensex, Nifty start on a weak note; HUL falls 3% in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex declined 81.66 points to 76,323.33, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 17.55 points to 23,137.80 as of 9:32 AM.
Content: The stock market opened lower on Thursday as consumer goods, banking and energy sector stocks dragged the benchmark indices down despite IT stocks continuing to provide support and gaining in early trade.  The S&P BSE Sensex declined 81.66 points to 76,323.33, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 17.55 points to 23,137.80 as of 9:32 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that largecap financials, IT and pharma  can continue to support the market on declines. "There are two trends in the market that deserve attention. One, institutional activity is showing a consistent trend - sustained selling by FIIs and sustained buying by DIIs. Two, there is a trend towards quality - largecaps are resilient while the broader market is weakening. These two trends are likely to continue in the near-term. Since the dollar index and US bond yields remain high, FIIs are unlikely to turn buyers any time soon. This will cap a rally in the market even though the market is in an oversold zone," he added. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 23, 2025

Headline: Trump's tariff threat: India eyes lower tariffs, higher imports, says reportThe government is considering options such as reducing tariffs, trade deals, and importing more goods from the US to negate the tariff threat if it becomes a reality.
Content: Donald Trump's tariff threat has been the talk of the town ever since his campaign days. Now that Trump has been sworn in as the 47th US President, governments across the world are on the lookout for ways to deal with the tariff threat.  The Indian government is considering options such as reducing tariffs, trade deals, and importing more goods from the US to negate the tariff threat if it becomes a reality, reported Bloomberg.  The government is evaluating options to counter any trade actions a new US administration may take and officials have drawn out multiple scenarios to address a potential widening of India's $35.3 billion trade surplus with the US, as per sources cited in the report. Among the possibilities are boosting purchases of US whiskey, steel, and oil, as well as lowering tariffs on products like bourbon and pecan nuts. India was the US's largest trading partner last financial year, data from India's commerce ministry shows. The government is planning to reduce duties on the goods that are imported to India which are of political importance to the Republican Party, said the report citing one of the sources.  The government is looking to avoid any direct confrontation with the US while also positioning itself to capitalise on any opportunities arising from the US-China trade war. Bloomberg had earlier reported that the PM Modi-led government is planning to take back at least 18,000 illegal Indian immigrants from the US as a strategy to help pacify the Trump tariff threat.  India has always been open to the legitimate return of undocumented Indians to their country, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Wednesday, noting that New Delhi is still in the process of verifying those from the US who can be deported to India and the number of such individuals cannot be determined yet. "As a government, we are obviously very much supportive of legal mobility because we do believe in a global workplace. We want Indian talent and Indian skills to have the maximum opportunity at the global level. At the same time, we are also very firmly opposed to illegal mobility and illegal migration," Jaishankar told a group of Indian reporters in the US. The minister was responding to a query on news reports that India is working with the Trump administration for the deportation of some 1,80,000 Indians in the US who are either undocumented, or have overstayed their visas.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 23, 2025

Headline: Perplexity AI CEO calls Nandan Nilekani 'awesome' but his AI stance 'wrong' Aravind Srinivas called Nandan Nilekani "awesome" for his contributions to India's IT sector, but disagreed with the Infosys co-founder's stance on AI development.
Content:
Perplexity AI CEO and co-founder Aravind Srinivas recently shared a post on social media platform X, saying he does not agree with Infosys co-founder and entrepreneur Nandan Nilekani regarding the approach Indian startups must take in artificial intelligence (AI) development. Srinivas called Nilekani "awesome" for his contributions, such as co-founding Infosys and playing a key role in the development of the United Payments Interface (UPI). However, he has called Nilekani's stance on AI development in India "wrong". In a post on X, Aravind Srinivas wrote: “To be clear: Nandan Nilekhani is awesome, and he's done far more for India than any of us can imagine through Infosys, UPI, etc. But he's wrong ihttps://x.com/AravSrinivas/status/1881978296675762632n pushing Indians to ignore model training skills and just focus on building on top of existing models. Essential to do both.”
 


 It may be noted that last year, Nandan Nilekani advised Indians to avoid creating LLMs and focus more on building practical AI applications. Srinivas even went on to say that he is ready to invest $1 million personally for AI development in India.  "I am ready to invest a $1 million personally and 5 hours/week of my time into the most qualified group of people that can do this right now for making India great again in the context of AI," he said. "Consider this as a commitment that cannot be backtracked. The team has to be cracked and obsessed like DeepSeek team and has to open source the models with MIT license," he added.
 


 Earlier, Srinivas had said, "Re India training its foundation models debate: I feel like India fell into the same trap I did while running Perplexity. Thinking models are going to cost a s*** ton of money to train. But India must show the world that it's capable of ISRO-like feet for AI. Moreover, he said, "So, I hope India changes its stance from wanting to reuse models from open-source and instead trying to build muscle to train their models that are not just good for Indian languages but are globally competitive on all benchmarks."  Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 23, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why HUL share price fell in early trade today HUL Stock price fell over 3% in early trade as investors reacted negatively to its Q3 results despite a 19% rise in net profit.
Content: Shares of FMCG major Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) fell in early trade on Thursday after the company reported as investors reacted to its third quarter results. HUL shares fell over 3% during intraday trade and were trading 1.40% lower at Rs 2,310.10 at around 10:09 am. On Wednesday, the company reported a 19% rise in consolidated net profit to Rs 2,989 crore, aided by the sale of its Pureit business. In the same quarter last year, the company had posted a net profit of Rs 2,508 crore. The company’s consolidated revenue stood at Rs 15,559 crore during the quarter, slightly lower than Rs 15,259 crore in the same period last year. Following the Q3 results, analysts and brokerages have shared mixed views on HUL’s stock. Brokerage firm ICICI Securities cut target price to Rs 2,500 from the previous Rs 2,950. While it continues to maintain an ‘Add’ rating on the stock, the brokerage firm has reduced its earnings estimates for HUL to 6%/8% for FY25E/FY26E largely. "Though HUL is taking strategic actions to contemporise these mass brands along with a portfolio shift towards premium in beauty with the announcement of the acquisition of a Minimalist at a pre-money enterprise value of Rs 3,000 crore, implying a valuation of 6x EV/sales, time period during this transformation is likely to be tough for their growth performance given the macroeconomic context," noted ICICI Securities. Mehul Desai from brokerage firm JM Financial said in a post-earnings note that HUL’s earnings print was “below our muted expectation”. “Key negative was flat UVG (on low base) impacted by weaker mix – a function of higher growth in smaller packs (downtrading and slowdown in urban) and Home Care business (which has lower realisation/tonne),” Desai noted. "Near-term outlook remains challenging – Urban slowdown & weaker mix likely to continue. Although management believes the latter is more transient in nature and doesn’t expect trends to worsen from current levels. The pace of recovery will be contingent on how macro factors (food inflation, real wage growth, etc.) shape up,” JM Financial’s post-earnings note added. The brokerage also noted that the stock is likely to remain under pressure owing to a lack of visibility on double-digit earnings growth. “Valuations below LT avg. provides some cushion to downside. We cut estimate by c.3-4% and multiple to 50x (vs 53x earlier), retain ‘BUY’ with revised target price of Rs 2,600 (earlier INR Rs 2,807),” the brokerage note said. On the other hand, Akriti Mehrotra, Research Analyst, StoxBox, said, “Hindustan Unilever Limited reported a subdued performance in Q3FY25, with key metrics declining due to moderating demand in the FMCG sector, particularly from urban consumption.” Mehrotra said while rural markets are gradually recovering, volume growth across segments remained low to negative, impacted by inflation and stiff competition. “HUL strategically focuses on growth areas, combined with easing consumer price inflation and expected improvements in rural wages, positioning HUL favourably for future demand recovery,” she explained. “Additionally, the company's current valuation remains attractive compared to historical averages, suggesting the potential for medium- to long-term recovery. We will closely monitor the gradual recovery in consumer demand moving forward,” Mehrotra said. However, brokerages such as Goldman Sachs and CLSA indicated in their research notes that the company could face margin pressure due to weak near-term demand. HUL’s Q3 results therefore signal a more concerning picture for the entire FMCG sector too.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 23, 2025

Headline: Stallion India share price: Stock lists at 33% premium over IPO price Stallion India shares opened at Rs 120 on both the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), translating to a premium of 33%.
Content: Stallion India Fluorochemicals Limited made a strong debut on the stock exchanges on Thursday, listing at a premium of over 30% over its IPO price of Rs 90.  Stallion India shares opened at Rs 120 on both the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), translating to a premium of 33%.  "Trading Members of the Exchange are hereby informed that effective from January 23, 2025, the equity shares of Stallion India Fluorochemicals Ltd (Scrip Code: 544342) are listed and admitted to dealings on the Exchange in the list of ''T'' Group Securities. For further details please refer to the notice no. 20250122- dated January 22, 2025," Stallion India Fluorochemicals Limited said in an exchange filing.  The IPO got an overall subscription of 188.32 times. The bidding was led by the NII category, which subscribed the IPO 422.35 times. QIB category saw bids of 172.93 times while the retails section was booked 96.81 times for Stallion India IPO. Stallion India IPO opened for subscription on January 16 and closed for bidding on January 20 and aimed to raise Rs 199.45 crore. Allotment for the IPO was finalised on January 21, 2025. SHOULD YOU HOLD OR SELL?  Stallion India Fluorochemicals Limited is engaged in the business of selling Refrigerant and Industrial Gases and related products. The company's primary business includes debulking, blending and processing refrigerant/industrial gases, and selling pre-filled cans and small cylinders/ containers. "The company has strong market recognition, and it has a track record of strong financial performance. The company made a good stock market debut, listing for Rs. 120 per share, a significant 33% premium over its issue price of Rs. 90. Those who took part in the initial public offering (IPO) may book profit and hold with a stoploss of 105," said Shivani Nyati, Head of Wealth at Swastika Investmart Ltd. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 23, 2025

Headline: Very well placed: Aryaman Birla bullish on Aditya Birla GroupAryaman Vikram Birla said that the economy of the country is growing and there's an opportunity for everyone to be a part of it.
Content: Aryaman Vikram Birla, Director of Aditya Birla Management Corporation said that the businesses under the conglomerate are "well-placed' while making his first appearance at the World Economic Forum, Davos.  "I think all our businesses are very well placed. I'm excited about the opportunities ahead for almost all of them," said Birla while speaking to India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal.  "We are making more investments in consumer-facing services/businesses. We have done that in 2024. We invested very deeply in 2 new consumer businesses. One was obviously jewellery retail, and the second one was at the intersection of consumer and manufacturing, which is paints. We, you know, generally feel like there's going to be long-term buoyancy in consumerism in India," he added, talking about investment in consumer-centric businesses.  When asked about the competition among some of the business tycoons, like Ambanis, Adanis, Goenkas, Birla said that some competition is really good.  "I think there's a long legacy that we've come up with, and I think there's an appreciation and understanding that we need to work very hard to be able to not only grow that legacy, but even just sustain that legacy. We're competing in the market. So I don't think there's competition, personally, between us. They're all great friends of mine, and I look up to all of them for what they do," said Birla.  He further said that the economy of the country is growing and there's an opportunity for everyone to be a part of it.  "I think you should shoot for the moon, and if you don't reach there, you'd at least land on the stars. And that I truly believe will happen. And I don't think that anything that we've seen over the last 10 years indicates otherwise. So I think, you know, the pie is getting bigger. Our pie, the economy is growing, and we all want to be significant actors in that journey," he said, answering about the vision laid by Prime Minister Narendra Modi of Viksit Bharat by 2047. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 23, 2025

Headline: Trump blows up with everybody: Martin Wolf on US President's ties with Elon MuskFinancial Times' Martin Wolf explained Donald Trump's leadership approach and how he is an unpredictable person.
Content: Chief economic commentator at the Financial Times Martin Wolf explained the unpredictability in global politics and said that the partnership between President Donald Trump and Elon Musk ‘will blow up’ in an exclusive conversation with India Today and Aajtak News Director Rahul Kanwal on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum 2025 in Davos Switzerland. During the interview, Martin Wolf talks about Trump’s leadership approach and how he is an unpredictable person. He said, “Trump is an unpredictable person. He could be a best buddy of you one day and you're out the following day.” Citing Elon Musk's immense popularity across the globe, Wolf says that the long-term stability of Trump- Musk alliance seems doubtful. He noted, “I've tended to assume there will be a blow up because Trump blows up with everybody, Musk, sort of overshadowing him. But Trump may field, this guy's so big and so successful, so much richer than I am that I have to genuflect to him.” Wolf also shared his stance on US economic policies under the Trump administration and said that deregulation and aggressive fiscal policies might overheat the already well-performing US economy. “It's very plausible that inflation will return and, obviously, the Fed is a bit concerned about that already. That could mean higher interest rates, and then you'll have 2 risks. Higher interest rates could slow the economy rather dramatically, but that may be less likely than that you get a you can get real financial tensions,” Wolf explained. He further added, “US will remain a hyper capitalist society.” When asked about how Trump views BRICS, Wolf mentioned that Trump hates countries getting together against the US. “He sees the BRICS as a vehicle for Russian and bubble Chinese power and influence. And the more they coordinate because together they're big, the more it weakens the American position. So he wants to fragment these.” Wolf explained.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 23, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Is Donald Trump bluffing about his tariff threats?Donald Trump has been vocal about imposing 10% tariffs on imports from China, 25% on neighbouring Mexico and Canada, and the European Union (EU). He has even threatened to impose a 100% tariff on BRICS nations, including India.
Content: Over the past few days, global markets have been on the edge as uncertainty rises over US President Donald Trump’s plans to impose trade tariffs on some countries. The question now is whether Trump’s tariff threats are genuine or merely a strategic bluff. Trump has been vocal about imposing 10% tariffs on imports from China, 25% on neighbouring Mexico and Canada, and the European Union (EU). He has even threatened to impose a 100% tariff on BRICS nations, including India. The 78-year-old had vowed to implement his tariff plans immediately after taking office, but, interestingly, that hasn’t happened yet. And although Trump recently said his administration was aiming to introduce the tariffs on February 1, the delay has got many experts thinking: Will Trump risk a full-blown global disruption by hitting important nations with trade tariffs?REALITY OR BLUFF? Going by what global economists and experts are saying, Trump is in “wait and watch mode” and may aim for a more transactional approach, eying favourable deals on immigration and other fronts. For instance, World Economic Forum President Borge Brende exclusively told India Today that Donald Trump is a dealmaker, suggesting that the US President could be using tariffs as a strategy to gain leverage. “Sometimes they (the US) put tariffs out there and see what happens down the road,” Brende said. In fact, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro recently told CNBC that Trump’s tariff threat on Canada and Mexico was solely to pressure the two countries to stop illegal migrants and illicit drugs from entering the US. And Trump’s recent tariff threat against the EU suggests that he wants to strike better deals rather than impose any actual tariffs. "The European Union is very, very bad to us," Trump said. "So they're going to be in for tariffs. It's the only way ... you're going to get fairness,” he added.TRUMP'S UNPREDICTIBILITY  However, economists have also not gone ahead to say clearly that Donald Trump is bluffing, thanks to his sheer unpredictability. Given the fact that Donald Trump actually believes that hitting other countries with tariffs will actually be good for the US economy, the situation remains not only unpredictable but critical for the global economy. Kranthi Bathini, Director, Equity Strategy, WealthMills Securities, said, “President Trump's statements have been creating tremors across the globe and leading to uncertainty with respect to trade across the globe.” Bathini noted how Donald Trump's statements, like the one where he said tariff is the “most beautiful word in the dictionary," have added to fears in global markets. IMPACT OF TRADE TARIFFS  Experts have already warned that the planned tariffs could blow out into a full-blown trade war, triggering a negative impact on all nations. The tit-for-tat trade war between the US and China during his first term led to severe disruptions, and the effects are bound to be more pronounced this time with the global economy going through a slowdown. The fallout of a trade war could be high inflation, losses across global stock markets, and possible recessions in several countries. And this could be the reason why the Trump administration is weighing its options before announcing any concrete tariffs.IS INDIA AT RISK FROM TRUMP TARIFFS? Many global experts have stated that India is not directly at risk if Donald Trump does decide to go ahead with his tariff action. Kranthi Bathini also made an important point. He noted that trades are bilateral agreements between two countries, where both parties are looking for the best deal. “President Trump is making deliberate statements, mostly targeting countries like China, Brazil, and Canada, where the US has larger bilateral trades, and they are happening in favour of these countries,” Bathini explained. “With respect to India, our bilateral trade is limited at this point in time in terms of the exchange of goods,” he said, indicating that the impact of tariffs on India will be limited.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 23, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Reliance signs Rs 3 lakh crore MoU with Maharashtra; to create lakhs of jobsReliance signs MoU with Maharashtra: The MoU spans across different sectors, with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis calling it a landmark investment, poised to boost Maharashtra's growth.
Content:
Reliance Industries Limited has signed an MoU (memorandum of understanding) with the Maharashtra government, valued at approximately Rs 3.05 lakh crore and is projected to create more than 300,000 jobs at World Economic Forum in Davos. The MoU spans across different sectors, with Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis calling it a landmark investment, poised to boost Maharashtra’s growth. CM Fadnavis said that the investment would span various sectors such as petrochemicals, polyester, renewable energy, bio-energy, green hydrogen, green chemicals, industrial area development, retail, data centres, telecommunications, hospitality, and real estate. "A groundbreaking moment for Maharashtra as the GoM and RIL signed a historic MoU worth Rs 3,05,000 crore, with over 3,00,000 employment opportunities across diverse sectors, including new energy, retail, hospitality, and high-tech manufacturing, under the leadership of Anant Ambani," said a tweet shared by the office of the Chief Minister of Maharashtra.
