Headline: Budget 2025: Startups seeks extended tax holidays, access to affordable creditSeveral experts have shared their Budget 2025 expectations for the startup sector, seeking reforms to help this sector maintain its growth momentum and scale globally.
Content: India’s startup sector, which has been a driving force for innovation and job creation, is hoping for certain measures and policies that can help maintain its growth trajectory. Several experts have shared their Budget 2025 expectations for the startup sector, seeking reforms to help this sector maintain its growth momentum and scale globally. Lalit Kumar, Partner, JSA Advocates & Solicitors, praised the government for extending relief through the introduction of tax holidays and deductions. However, he suggested simplifying the compliance processes and ensuring affordable credit access. “The start-up ecosystem will largely benefit from further simplification of compliance and due processes, saving in operational costs," KUmar added.  “There is a need for enhanced affordable credit access for startups, especially in the fintech sector, as Indian innovation in fintech goes global. NBFCs have become more crucial during this changing business environment, and government support for easier credit norms would facilitate a circular business economy," he added.  Apoorva Ranjan Sharma, Co-Founder & MD of Venture Catalysts, said the scrapping of the Angel tax in the previous budget boosted early-stage investments. “For starters, a simplified tax regime for startups could be of great help, particularly for enterprises in Tier 2 and 3 cities. These emerging hubs of innovation need more support to compete globally," she said.  Sharma added that prioritising emerging technologies is the need of the hour, and the upcoming budget should provide funds for AI research and development, which could position the country as a global leader in tech innovation. Abhishek Saxena, MD and Founder of Omnicard, has called for tax relief as the key budget expectation. He urged extending tax holiday periods under the Startup India initiative and ensuring the creation of export opportunities for this sector, enabling them to compete globally. “Strengthening the ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’ initiative by reducing import dependencies will further support self-reliance while helping bridge the trade deficit," he further added.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 23, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty gain ground as IT, pharma sectors shine; Wipro gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 115.39 points to close at 76,520.38, while the NSE Nifty50 added 50 points to end at 23,205.35.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices ended with marginal gains on a rangebound day helped by a rise in IT, pharma, and auto sector stocks.  The S&P BSE Sensex gained 115.39 points to close at 76,520.38, while the NSE Nifty50 added 50 points to end at 23,205.35.  Ajit Mishra – SVP, Research, Religare Broking Ltd, said that the session began on a subdued note, but selective buying in heavyweights triggered a gradual recovery in the first half, followed by a range-bound phase until the close.  "Sectoral trends were mixed, with IT and pharma sectors closing higher, while banking and energy remained subdued. After two consecutive days of decline, the broader indices also saw a breather, gaining between 1% and 1.7%," he added.  UltraTech Cement climbed 6.67% to be the biggest gainer on Nifty50, Grasim advanced 2.96%, and Wipro rose 2.78%. Shriram Finance and Sun Pharmaceutical Industries also showed strong momentum at 2.38% and 2.23% respectively. Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited (BPCL) fell 2.14%, followed by Kotak Mahindra Bank and HCL Technologies which dropped 1.28% and 1.14% respectively. SBIN and Reliance Industries also faced some pressure, declining 0.96% each. "Uncertainty lingers whether the trade tariff measures will affect global trade, instigate higher inflation, and currency volatility. The trend holds a declining momentum YTD with a pause today contemplating the upcoming 2025 budget, which has a muted expectation. Meanwhile, in-line Q3 results showcase QoQ growth to the indices, suggesting that Q4 will be much better," said Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services.  The Nifty IT index led the gains, rising 1.79%. Nifty Healthcare Index also showed strength, advancing 1.28%. Nifty Consumer Durables climbed 1.97%, while Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom surged 5.00%. On the other hand, Nifty Oil & Gas fell 0.51%, and Nifty Midsmall Healthcare declined 1.41%. Nifty Private Bank decreased 0.40%. Vaibhav Vidwani, Research Analyst, Bonanza, said, "Overall, investor sentiment remains cautious ahead of upcoming economic indicators and potential policy announcements from the government."Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 23, 2025Must Watch

Headline: EPFO simplifies personal profile updation process. Check steps hereEPF members can update their personal details like name, gender, date of birth, nationality and marital status without the need to submit any documents.
Content: The Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has announced a simpler process for members to update their personal profile. The change is expected to benefit nearly 3.9 lakh members with a pending request. Now members can update their personal details like name, gender, date of birth, nationality and marital status without the need to submit any documents. Earlier, any updates made to these would require documentation, which caused delays. Other service updates include introduction of the Centralised Pension Payment System (CPPS), a joint declaration process, and clarifications on pension policy, etc. According to PIB, 27% of the member grievances are related to profile/ KYC (Know Your Customer) issues. With the implemention of the revised profile update functionality, a reduction in the number of member grievances filed in the future is expected. Earlier, changes in personal information required verification from the employer, causing delays of up to 28 days.STEPS TO UPDATE LATEST PROFILE DETAILS To update EPF member details, log into the EPFO Unified Member Portal. Now submit your Universal Account Number (UAN), password and captcha to go to your account. Next, go to ‘Manage' Tab and select 'Modify Basic Details' option to update personal information like name, date of birth, nationality, etc. Make sure that the information filled matches with the details on your Aadhaar card. Moreover, EPFO has made it easier to transfer PF accounts when members change their employers. Now, certain online transfers can be approved without the need for approval from the former or current employer, as long as your UAN is linked to Aadhaar and the details match.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 23, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why Dr Reddy's share price cracked 6% in early tradeDr Reddy's Laboratories Stock Price: Dr Reddy's shares tumbled up to 6% in early trade and at 9:46 am, they were trading 4.35% lower at Rs 1,233.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
Content: Shares of Dr Reddy's Laboratories fell sharply in early trade as investors turned cautious after the company reported its third quarter results. The pharma company's shares tanked up to 6% in early trade, and at around 9:46 am, they were trading 4.35% lower at Rs 1,233.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The drop in the company's share price came despite earnings managing to marginally beat street expectations. It's worth noting that the concerns largely centered on declining revenue from Revlimid, which is a cancer drug that has been a strong growth driver for the company in recent years. Revlimid’s revenue contribution has slowly started declining, with its patent expiry set for January 2026. This means Dr Reddy's will need to find new revenue streams soon. Another factor that led to today's decline was the drug's shrinking margins.  While the management outlined long-term growth strategies, analysts remained divided on their future strategy.WHAT DO BROKERAGES SAY?  Analysts at brokerage firm HSBC said they remain cautious about Dr Reddy's. While the launch of Semaglutide in Canada in early 2026 might provide some relief, HSBC said it may not be enough to fully compensate for the anticipated loss of Revlimid revenue. The brokerage maintained a ‘Hold’ rating with a price target of Rs 1,250. Nuvama Institutional Equities shared a more optimistic view, adding that a combination of Abatacept and Semaglutide could help the company retain a big chunk of its Revlimid earnings. The brokerage reiterated its ‘Buy’ call with a price target of Rs 1,533. Meanwhile, JM Financial pointed out that the market may be underestimating Semaglutide’s potential. With its launch slated for Canada and 18 other markets by CY26, JM Financial sees Dr Reddy’s as well-positioned among generic players to capitalise on this opportunity. The brokerage set a target price of Rs 1,753 on Dr Reddy's stock. Dr Reddy’s Q3 Results For the October-December quarter, Dr Reddy’s reported a 2% year-on-year rise in net profit to Rs 1,413 crore. Revenue surged 16% year-on-year to Rs 8,359 crore. However, operational challenges rose as pricing pressure in the US market and the fall in Revlimid revenue took a toll on margins, with the EBITDA margin shrinking to 27.5% from 29.3% a year ago.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 24, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher tracking Asian markets; energy stocks gainShare Market Today, 24 January 2025: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 204.76 points to 76,725.14 at 9:17 am, while the NSE Nify50 traded 64.15 points higher at 23,269.50.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened higher on Friday due to gains in Asia, but modest Q3 earnings have kept the volatility intact on Dalal Street. The S&P BSE Sensex was up 204.76 points to 76,725.14 at 9:17 am, while the NSE Nify50 was trading 64.15 points higher at 23,269.50. The other broader market indices were trading marginally higher as high volatility continued to keep investors on the edge. While most of the Nifty sectoral indices were trading in positive territory, none registered a big gain in early trade. On the other hand, Nifty Pharma was down over 1.5%. The top gainers on the Nifty50 were BPCL, Powergrid, Shriram Finance, Coal India, NTPC and Tata Steel. Pharma stocks such as Dr Reddy’s, Apollo Hospitals, Sun Pharma, Cipla were among the top losers. Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd, said, “Nifty may face a volatile session today, with a strong chance of closing below the psychological 23000 mark as uncertainty around President Donald Trump’s tariff plans persists.” “Technically, Nifty is trading well below its 200-day moving average of 23982, and a bearish pattern continues to emerge on the daily charts. Major headwinds include record outflows from Foreign Institutional Investors, amounting to Rs. 66,321.70 crores this January, and ongoing tariff threats,” he added. He advised market investors to keep an eye on key upcoming events, like the FOMC meeting and the Union Budget as they can influence market direction. “Among stocks, UltraTech Cement surged 7% despite a 17% profit decline, while KEI Industries reported strong earnings. Also, watch out for Q3 results from JSW Steel, DLF, and Indigo today,” he added. Meanwhile, Dr VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, indicated that foreign institutional investors (FIIs) will continue to sell, putting pressure on large-cap banking stocks. “The irrationality in the market characterised by fair and even low valuations for largecaps like banking and excessive valuations in the broader market will have to reverse at some point of time. But we don’t know when that will happen,” Vijayakumar said. “The Q3 results of IT companies and the management commentary indicating improving prospects for the sector suggest that the sector is a safe bet now,” he added.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 24, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Why did Cyient CEO Karthikeyan Natarajan resign?The resignation of Cyient's CEO Karthikeyan Natarajan was a major reason that led to the sharp decline in the company's share price.
Content: Shares of Cyient tumbled as much as 20% to hit a 52-week low after it reported Q3FY25 results. At around 11:08 am, the IT stock was down 18.54% to Rs 1,427.90 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). A major reason that contributed to the sharp decline in its share price was the resignation of its CEO Karthikeyan Natarajan, which led to greater concerns among brokerages. HDFC Institutional Equities said the resignation of Natarajan as CEO came as a “negative surprise”.WHY DID KARTHIKEYAN NATARAJAN RESIGN? In an exchange filing, the company informed about the resignation of Natarajan and attached his letter addressed to the board of directors. “I am writing to formally tender my resignation after careful consideration as Executive Director and Chief Executive Officer of the company...to explore new challenges and opportunities that align with my personal and professional goals,” Natarajan said. Natarajan said he is proud of the company’s achievements over the last five years, both financially and in the direction of pivoting the company towards “technology solution-led innovation.” He went on to say that the company is “stronger than ever before,” highlighting the key milestones achieved set during his tenure. “I feel it is the right time to hand over the reins for the next phase of growth. I am truly thankful for the trust and support extended to me by the board, my colleagues, and all stakeholders,” he said.CYIENT Q3 RESULTS Cyient reported a 16.92% year-on-year (YoY) drop in net profit and a sharper 31.71% decline quarter-on-quarter (QoQ), raising concerns among investors about its financial performance. The IT company's revenue from operations increased marginally by 4.2% YoY to Rs 1,926.4 crore. While operating income rose slightly by 0.81% YoY, it fell 8.37% QoQ, signalling stable year-on-year performance but some amount of quarterly pressure. Earnings per share (EPS) for Q3 stood at Rs 11.02, marking a decline of 34.29% YoY.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: HUL to acquire stake in Minimalist for Rs 2,670 crore; Peak XV bags 10X gainsHUL has acquired a 90.5% stake in Minimalist for Rs 2,670 crore, making it one of the biggest acquisitions in the country's startup ecosystem.
Content: HUL (Hindustan Unilever Limited) announced the acquisition of Minimalist, the D2C skincare brand, for Rs 2,670 crore, making it one of the biggest acquisitions in the country's startup ecosystem.  Mohit Yadav and Rahul Yadav, founders of Minimalist said, “Now, with HUL’s robust offline distribution network, we look forward to making our products even more accessible across the country. This partnership also paves the way for our expansion into international markets helping us realise our dream of taking Minimalist to the world”. Venture capital firm Peak XV Partners is set to receive a return on investment of ten times, as per various media reports. The VC giant acquired a 27.5% stake in Minimalist in 2019, and is expected to earn a profit amounting to Rs 800 crore from its Rs 80 crore investment in the firm. HUL is purchasing a 90.5% stake in the starup for Rs 2670 crores, valuing Minimalist at Rs 2,955. Further, HUL will invest approximately Rs 45 crore directly into Minimalist. After the deal is completed in the first quarter of FY26, the startup will see multiple exits.  Minimalist's founders, Rahul Yadav and Mohit Kumar Yadav, Peak XV, and Surge, which provided the seed investment, along with Twenty Nine Capital Partners will exit the startup. It is expected that the co-founders of Minimalist will sell 57.35% of their stake for nearly Rs 1,500 crore. Also, in two years, the remaining 9.5% of Minimalist would be purchased by HUL. Minimalist's founders will supervise the startup’s operations for the next two years.  Minimalist was founded in 2020, and carries out its sales through its own online platform and e-commerce platforms such as Amazon, Nykaa, Flipkart, and Myntra. "Minimalist has been built on robust fundamentals and has delivered profitable growth since inception. The business has rapidly scaled to cross an Annual Revenue Runrate (ARR) of Rs 500 cr in a short span of 4 years," said HUL.  Rohit Jawa, CEO and Managing Director, HUL said, “We are delighted to welcome Minimalist into the HUL family. This acquisition is another key step to grow our Beauty & Wellbeing portfolio in high-growth premium demand spaces. Mohit, Rahul and the team have created a great brand built on science, product efficacy and transparency.”Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 24, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Cyient share price falls 20% to hit 52-week low. What triggered Friday's crash?Cyient stock price: At around 10:21 am, shares of Cyient were down 17.96% to Rs 1,438 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). In early trade, shares of the IT company fell as much as 20% to hit a 52-week low of Rs 1,402.25.
Content: Information technology (IT) company Cyient’s share price tumbled sharply in early trade on Friday to hit a 52-week low as brokerages cut estimates after its Q3FY25 results. At around 10:21 am, shares of Cyient were down 17.96% to Rs 1,438 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). In early trade, shares of the IT company fell as much as 20% to hit a 52-week low of Rs 1,402.25. Today’s crash in its share price comes after the company cut its FY25 revenue growth guidance again to minus 2.7%. It net profit also dropped 32% quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) in the third quarter. The stock was also hit by the resignation of CEO Karthikeyan Natarajan. Following the developments, analysts have also cut earnings estimates and target prices for Cyient. Brokerage firm Nuvama noted that the Cyient management started off FY25 with a high single-digit revenue growth guidance. However, it has repeatedly cut the guidance, which is now at minus 2.7%. "The weak exit rate also impacts growth prospects for FY26. We remain negative on Cyient even as inexpensive valuations limit the downside potential," the brokerage said. Nuvama has also cut its FY25 and FY26 earnings per share (EPS) estimates for Cyient sharply by 10.8% and 4.5%, respectively, citing lower growth and margins. The brokerage firm has revised its target price to Rs 1,660 from Rs 1,700 earlier. HDFC Institutional Equities also raised concerns about the cut in revenue guidance, weak exit margin and CEO’s resignation. The brokerage cut its revenue estimate by 2% and earnings per share (EPS) by 5%, citing slower growth and weak margins. However, the brokerage maintained its ‘Add’ rating with a target price of Rs 1,790. It may be noted that Cyient shares have been going through a rough patch due to multiple guidance cuts. The share price of the company has fallen over 20% since the beginning of 2025, over 24% in the past six months and over 30% in a year. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why Paytm share price tumbled nearly 9% todayPaytm share price: The shares of the company fell nearly 9% to hit a day's low of Rs 773.90. At 12:18 pm, shares of the fintech company stabilised a bit to trade 2.27% higher at Rs 829.70.
Content: Shares of One97 Communication Limited (OCL) fell sharply during Friday’s trading session after media reports indicated that the fintech company and seven other payment gateways were being investigated by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a cryptocurrency scam. The shares of the company fell nearly 9% to hit a day’s low of Rs 773.90. At 12:18 pm, shares of the fintech company stabilised a bit to trade 2.27% higher at Rs 829.70. Following the reports, the stock exchanges (BSE and NSE) have sought a clarification from Paytm. In its response, the company confirmed that it has not received any new notice, communication or query from the ED regarding the matter. “The information published is factually incorrect and misleading, and we had not received any query from the media prior to the publishing of this news article,” Paytm added. The shares of the fintech company have been on a poor run, falling nearly 14% in the past five trading sessions. Shares of Paytm are down over 32% since the beginning of 2025. A few days ago, the digital payments firm reported its Q3 results, in which its net loss narrowed to Rs 208 crore, compared to Rs 222 crore in the same period a year ago. Revenue during the quarter dropped 36% year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 1,828 crore from Rs 2,850 crore in the corresponding period a year ago. Following the Q3 results, several brokerages remained optimistic about the company’s stock price. Brokerage firm JM Finance said, “Paytm reported FY21-24 revenue CAGR of 53%, with the company delivering adjusted EBITDA of Rs 560 crore in FY24 (vs Rs 1,650 crore loss in FY21), implying marginal incremental profitability of 30%.” “We expect the company's mid-fifties contribution margin to expand further by 500 basis points (bps) in 5 years, driven by take-rates rising across its commission/subscription based revenue income,” it added. "We value Paytm at 70X FY27E PER (in-line with trading multiples of our consumer internet coverage), resulting in Mar'26 target price of Rs 1,250. We reinitiate 'Buy'," the brokerage added.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: Why are markets volatile, and should you be worried? 3 things to know Sensex scaled to 76,985.95, reaching the day's high, a jump of over 500 points, but was trading at 76,621.03 as of 1 PM. Nifty has also gone about in the same manner.
Content: Dalal Street has been riding a roller coaster lately, swinging between losses and gains, leaving stock market investors in a cloud of uncertainty. Volatility has been a recurring feature in the past few days owing to various developments across the globe.  The same trend was witnessed today as well. The Sensex and Nifty opened marginally higher but rose quickly within a few minutes, only to come down later and gain again. Sensex scaled to 76,985.95, reaching the day's high, a jump of over 500 points, but was trading at 76,621.03 as of 1 PM. Nifty has also gone about in the same manner.  Kranthi Bathini, equity strategist at WealthMills Securities Pvt Ltd said that the Indian markets are going through a roller-coaster ride.WHAT IS CAUSING MARKET VOLATILITY? "Foreign portfolio investors continue to be net sellers from the last fortnight. So that's creating some kind of extra volatility coupled with the global, cues," said Bathini.  He further explained that India Inc's Q3 results for FY25 have not been enticing the market, which has led to a roller-coaster ride for the stock market.  "The big major event for Indian markets going ahead is the budget which is scheduled on February 1. And, and the other event is the Monetary Policy Committee meeting in the first week of February. These are the big events for the market. But due to the budget, markets are rangebound at this point of time in consolidation," said Bathini.  "Even though headline indices are in positive territory, we are witnessing some kind of profit booking in them. Mid cap space is concerned. So, overall, Indian markets are in a consolidation phase. And ahead of the budget, some kind of extra volatility is getting created in the markets," he added.  Amid this turbulence, one sector has emerged as a steady anchor and has provided support; IT stocks. While the broader markets have been hit by global uncertainties and weak sentiment, the resilience of IT giants has been the only silver lining. But with this unpredictability, should you be worried about your investments?  "As far as long term investors are concerned, any dip in the Indian market is a good opportunity for investors who want to invest for a time horizon of more than 1 year," said Bathini.  (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 24, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Paytm denies ED probe in crypto scam, calls reports 'factually incorrect'Paytm Latest News: Paytm's clarification came after a few media reports claimed that the ED is investigating the fintech firm and other payment gateways in a cryptocurrency scam.
Content: Digital payments firm Paytm has denied media reports that indicated it is being investigated by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a Rs 2,200 crore cryptocurrency scam. In a stock exchange filing, the company said it had not received any new notice or communication from the ED and termed the reports as “factually incorrect and misleading.” A few media reports have claimed that the ED is investigating eight payment gateways, including Paytm, Razorpay, and PayU, in a scam involving 10 Chinese nationals across 20 states. Reports also indicated that the ED has frozen Rs 500 crore in connection with the case. In response, Paytm said, “We confirm that we have not received any such new notice, communication, or query from the Enforcement Directorate regarding the matter mentioned in the media articles.” “The information published is factually incorrect and misleading and we had not received any query from the media prior to the publishing of this news article,” it added.PAYTM SHARES IN RED Paytm shares fell up to 9% during Friday’s session, hitting a low of Rs 773.90, before recovering slightly to trade 3.36% lower at Rs 820.40 around 12:55 pm. It is worth mentioning that the fintech stock has been under pressure, declining 10% over the past five trading sessions and losing 17% since the beginning of 2025. Paytm’s recent Q3 results have also hurt investor sentiment on Dalal Street. The company reported a 36% year-on-year decline in revenue to Rs 1,828 crore, while its net loss narrowed to Rs 208 crore from Rs 222 crore a year ago.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: Tata Electronics buys 60% controlling stake in Pegatron IndiaTEPL, which is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Tata Sons, said the latest acquisition aligns with Tata Sons' Chairman N Chandrasekaran's vision of investments by the Tata Group in electronics manufacturing.
Content: Tata Electronics Private Limited (TEPL) has acquired a controlling 60% stake in Pegatron Technology Private Limited. The move is aimed at expanding TEPL’s local iPhone manufacturing footprint in India. Less than a year ago, the company had acquired Winstron India’s operation. TEPL, which is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Tata Sons, said the latest acquisition aligns with Tata Sons’ Chairman N Chandrasekaran’s vision of investments by the Tata Group in electronics manufacturing. "As part of this deal, in addition to acquiring a majority stake in PTI, TEPL and PTI will work on integrating their teams to work seamlessly. PTI will undergo rebranding to reflect its new ownership structure and business direction while continuing to deliver high-quality electronics manufacturing services,” the company statement read. “This acquisition solidifies TEPL’s position as a key player in the Indian electronics manufacturing sector," it added. Pegatron India is the subsidiary of Taiwanese company Pegatron Corporation, which provided contract-based electronic manufacturing services to companies such as Apple. It also exports products across North America, Asia and Europe. Randhir Thakur, CEO and MD of Tata Electronics, said, "The acquisition of a majority stake in Pegatron Technology India Private Limited fits into Tata Electronics’ strategy of growing our manufacturing footprint.” “We look forward to a new era of AI, digital, and technology-led manufacturing as we bring up these new facilities and expand our operations in India,” Thakur added.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: Adani Green Energy shares fall as Sri Lanka cancels power purchase dealAdani Green Energy shares fell after the news of Sri Lanka cancelling the power purchase deal to hit the day's low of Rs 1,008, crashing over 6% from the day's high.
Content: Adani Green Energy's share price fell as reports emerged of Sri Lanka cancelling the conglomerate's over $400 million project. Adani Green Energy shares opened the day at Rs 1039.45 after having closed at Rs 1021.45. The stock gained initially and reached a day's high of Rs 1065.45.  However, Adani Green Energy shares fell after the news of Sri Lanka cancelling the power purchase deal to hit the day's low of Rs 1,008, crashing over 6% from the day's high.  The island nation cancelled the power purchase agreement with the Adani Group following an investigation into allegations by the US that executives from the conglomerate paid bribes to win power supply contracts, as reported by AFP and published in the Economic Times on Friday.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: Sensex, Nifty fall amid volatility; energy and pharma lead lossesThe S&P BSE Sensex shed 329.92 points to close at 76,190.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 113.15 points to end at 23,092.20.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices closed lower on Friday to end the week with losses fuelled by a decline in energy, auto and pharma sector stocks. The S&P BSE Sensex shed 329.92 points to close at 76,190.46, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 113.15 points to end at 23,092.20.  Ajit Mishra – SVP, Research, Religare Broking Ltd said that markets slipped nearly half a percent, extending the ongoing consolidation phase after a two-day rebound. "The Nifty index witnessed volatile swings following a flat opening and eventually closed near the day’s low at 23,092.20. Sectoral performance was mixed, with realty and pharma emerging as the top losers, while FMCG and IT saw marginal gains. After a brief pause, the broader indices resumed their decline, shedding between 1.6% and 2.4%," he added.  This movement in the index aligns with expectations, and we anticipate further downside pressure in the coming sessions towards the 22,700-22,900 zone in Nifty. However, the greater concern lies in the pronounced selling in the midcap and smallcap segments, which is unlikely to ease in the near term. On a positive note, select pockets across sectors are showing signs of resilience and could emerge as potential outperformers during the next phase of recovery. For now, participants are advised to align their positions with the prevailing trend and avoid adding to losing trades.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: Amul cuts milk prices by Re 1 per litre across IndiaThe reduction will only be applicable to 1-litre packs. Previously, in June 2024, Amul had increased milk prices by Rs 2 per litre.
Content: Amul has reduced the price of its 1-litre packs of Gold, Taaza, and Tea Special milk by Re 1. This reduction will only be applicable to 1-litre packs. The news of the price cut of 1-litre Amul milk packs was announced by Jayen Mehta, the Managing Director of the Gujarat Co-operative Milk Marketing Federation (GCMMF). After the change in prices, the price of a one-litre pouch of Amul Gold milk will decrease from Rs 66 to Rs 65. The price of a one-litre pouch of Amul Tea Special milk will drop from Rs 62 to Rs 61. Similarly, the rate of Amul Taaza milk will be reduced from Rs 54 per litre to Rs 53. Previously, in June 2024, Amul had increased milk prices by Rs 2 per litre. Mother Dairy had also announced a hike in milk prices by Rs 2 per litre after Amul increased prices of milk by the same margin.Published By: Anuja JhaPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: InterGlobe Aviation Q3 results: IndiGo operator's net profit falls by 18%Indigo Q3 results: The net profit for the aviation company dropped by 18% to Rs 2,449 crore when compared to Rs 2,998 crore in the same quarter a year ago.
Content: InterGlobe Aviation, the parent company of low-cost carrier IndiGo, announced its third-quarter results for financial year 2025 on Friday. The net profit for the aviation company dropped by 18% to Rs 2,449 crore when compared to Rs 2,998 crore in the same quarter a year ago. Revenue from operations increased by almost 14% to Rs 22,111 crore compared to Rs 19,452 crore in the same period in FY24.  Unit passenger revenue (PRASK) for Indigo increased by 0.3% to Rs 4.72 as per an exchange filling shared on the BSE platform.  During the quarter, the company reported passenger ticket revenues of Rs 19,267.8 crore, reflecting a 12.3% year-on-year growth. Ancillary revenues also saw a significant increase, rising by 22.3% to Rs 2,153.1 crore compared to the same period last year. Available seat kilometres grew by 12% year-on-year to reach 40.8 billion, while revenue passenger kilometres rose 13.5% to 35.5 billion over the same period. The no-frills airline's load factor improved to 86.9% at the end of the December quarter, up from 85.8% in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. By the end of the quarter, IndiGo's fleet had expanded to 437 aircraft, compared to 410 in the preceding quarter. The airline also operated at a peak of 2,200 daily flights during the period, including non-scheduled operations. As of December 31, 2024, IndiGo's total cash reserves stood at Rs 43,781 crore, marking a 35% increase from the same time last year. Pieter Elbers, CEO, said, “We delivered a strong third quarter of financial year 2025, both operationally and financially. Results were driven by robust demand in the market and our ability to cater to that demand supported by lower fuel prices. We touched new milestones as we operated a peak of 2,200 daily flights and served a record 31.1 million passengers during the quarter. We will continue the growth path to offer our customers with options to conveniently fly to the destination of their choice.”Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 24, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: EV sector pushes for tech investments and smart mobility solutionsExperts anticipate that Budget 2025 would introduce policies that would boost EV sales across the country and help India achieve its goal of reducing carbon emissions by one billion tonnes by 2030.
Content: As the unveiling of Budget 2025 approaches, the country’s electric vehicle (EV) sector is hopeful for measures and initiatives to make EVs more affordable and accessible to consumers. Industry leaders and experts anticipate that this budget would introduce policies that would accelerate EV adoption across the country, and help India achieve its goal of reducing carbon emissions by one billion tonnes by 2030.   Akshit Bansal, Founder & CEO, Statiq urged the expansion of EVs for broader penetration across the Tier II cities. “To facilitate this transition, robust infrastructure is paramount, particularly in the form of widespread EV charging stations. Establishing a reliable charging network will instil trust amongst consumers and encourage greater adoption of electric vehicles,” he said. Bansal also suggested the need to convert heavy commercial vehicles to eco-friendly alternatives to address the issue of growing pollution in cities. Ishaan Parwanda, Director, Trinity Touch suggested lowering GST rates on lithium-ion batteries to boost EV sales. “Measures such as reducing the GST on EV batteries, upgrading the infrastructure status for charging stations, and implementing performance-linked incentives for manufacturing are essential. These steps would make the EV market more affordable and accessible to a broader audience,” he mentioned. “There is an urgent need to focus on the domestic production of key EV components, rather than relying on imports. Promoting Atmanirbhar Bharat by introducing special Production Linked Incentives (PLI) and incentives for manufacturing EV components will boost production, reduce the cost of EV vehicles, and make them more affordable for Indian consumers. Such measures will not only advance the EV sector but also position India as a leader in sustainable mobility,” Parwanda said. Furthermore, experts believe that technology development will play a key role in driving the growth of the EV ecosystem in India. Raghav Arora, Co-Founder & CTO, Statiq suggested leveraging the use of artificial intelligence (AI) and Internet of Things (IoT), to optimise charging networks and improve battery efficiency. “Innovations in battery technology, charging infrastructure, and smart mobility solutions are essential to overcoming existing challenges and enhancing the overall EV experience,” he said. “We hope that the upcoming budget will prioritise investments in technology-driven initiatives that support startups and established players alike in their quest to innovate within the EV space. This focus on technological advancement is crucial for positioning India as a global leader in sustainable mobility,” Arora added.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 24, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Stuck in middle-income trap: Fareed Zakaria decodes China's economic crisisFareed Zakaria said that China's economy is not going to grow any time at the six, seven, eight percent that it was growing at previously.
Content: Fareed Rafiq Zakaria, an Indian-born American journalist, political commentator, and author, said that China is facing an economic crisis as it is stuck in the "middle-income trap".  In a conversation with India Today News Director Rahul Kanwal at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Zakaria said, "It does seem to be stuck in the middle income trap. You know, the number of countries that have made it past the middle-income trap to first-world status are very few. Japan, Korea, maybe you could say Malaysia is getting on the way, Chile in Latin America, Israel. That's it." Zakaria also said that China's economy "is not going to grow any time at the six, seven, eight percent that was growing at." He mentioned poor private sector and consumer sentiment as short-term issues, but warned of larger structural problems especially in President Xi Jinping's policy shifts. "Xi's philosophy has been a turn away from the model that frankly made China rich, which was to unleash the private sector, unleash openness, innovation," he explained. He highlighted China's crackdown on tech giants like Alibaba and Tencent as examples of the government's shift towards a "government-led, government-first policy." "Xi wants China to do very well in artificial intelligence. But how is America doing well in artificial intelligence? By allowing companies like Google and Amazon and Meta and Microsoft to scale up, and become what they call these hyperscalers, have massive capacity. What China is doing is they're killing Alibaba and Tencent and Baidu, their equivalents of those great internet digital companies," he said.  Zakaria said that it departs from the private sector-driven growth that propelled China's rapid development, where companies were allowed to "scale up" and become "hyperscalers" similar to Google, Amazon, and Microsoft in the US.  He mentioned the need for India to learn from China's experience as it walks its own path towards higher-income status. Regarding the broader implications, Zakaria cautioned that China's economic troubles could complicate its geopolitical calculus, including its dealings with the US under the Trump administration. He noted that China's economic slowdown comes at a time of increased global uncertainty and trade tensions.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 24, 2025Must Watch

Headline: How to achieve minimum credit score for getting personal loan? Details hereThe higher the credit score, the greater are the chances for the approval of your loan requests.
Content: Rahul, a 30-year-old budding entrepreneur, faced rejection when he applied for a personal loan to start his business. The reason for rejection? His credit score was low. Like Rahul, thousands of people face similar rejections when applying for a personal loan without realising how important it is to have a good credit score when securing a personal loan. So, in this article we will talk about what a credit score is and how you can improve it to secure a personal loan.advertisementWHAT IS A CREDIT SCORE? A credit score is an indicator of your creditworthiness and tells how consistent you are with repaying your loans and debts. It is a three-digit number usually ranging from 300 to 850. Lenders take into account credit scores to assess the probability of you repaying loans on time. The higher the credit score, the greater are the chances for the approval of your loan requests. In India, there are four credit bureaus that generate credit scores for individuals. They are - Credit Information Bureau (India) Limited (CIBIL), CRIF Highmark, Equifax, and Experian. Usually, a credit score of 700 and above is considered good for securing a personal loan, while a credit score of 750 and above is considered an excellent score to get a personal loan with attractive interest rates. Hence, maintaining a good credit score is essential for those individuals who are planning to apply for a personal loan. Now, let us look at some common tips to ensure that your credit score remains high. To begin, monitor your credit report regularly. In the event of any discrepancy or error, report the same to the credit information company like CRIF Highmark. Further, maintaining a low credit utilisation ratio (CUR) reflects responsible financial behaviour. Pay your credit card bills regularly and on time. Avoid paying the minimum due amount, as this could negatively impact your creditworthiness in the long run.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 24, 2025Must Watch

Headline: 8th Pay Commission may give a 186% boost to pensions. Find out how The fitment factor plays an important role in calculating the updated pay and benefits and is likely to be in the range between 2.28 and 2.86 for the 8th Pay Commission.
Content: Many in their professional career want to have a relaxed retired life. Imagine you have put in decades of hard work and upon retiring you find that the pension you are getting is hardly covering the rising cost of living and inflationary trends. For several central government employees, this has been the case for years. But the announcement of the 8th Pay Commission which is set to be implemented from January 1, next year, promises to bring the much-needed relief for the lakhs of central government employees and retirees. One of the highly anticipated changes is the fitment factor which plays an important role in calculating the updated pay and benefits. As per various media reports, the fitment factor for the 8th Pay Commission is likely to be in the range of 2.28 and 2.86. If the fitment factor is considered at the higher side, i.e. at 2.86, it could result in a rise in monthly pensions. As of now, under the existing system, Rs 9000 is the minimum monthly pension and, on the other hand, the maximum pension amount is capped at Rs 1,25,000. Now, with the introduction of the 8th Pay Commission and the projected fitment factor being 2.86, the minimum pension would hike to Rs 25,740, which is, a surge of 186%. Moreover, the maximum monthly pension might exceed Rs 3,57,500. Apart from this, the 8th Pay Commission may also witness a revision in other pensionary benefits, which would include, Dearness Relief (DR), gratuity limits and family pensions, which aim to further improve the financial well-coming of retirees and maintain their standard of living amid inflationary pressures.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 25, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: 5 top middle-class expectations for tax relief and savings growthExperts suggest scrapping the old tax regime and rationalising the income tax slabs under the new regime, would go a long way in making income tax simpler.
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is just a few weeks away for tabling Budget 2025 and there is a growing anticipation amongst the middle class regarding the announcement of policies and measures by the government to curb inflation, increase purchasing power and ease financial burden. Dr. Manoranjan Sharma, Chief Economist, Infomerics Ratings has pointed out several areas where the middle-class household may benefit. “Taxes for individuals in the Rs 3 lakh – Rs 7 lakh tax slab under the new tax regime could be reduced. Further, the exemption limit under this regime could be raised beyond Rs 3 lakh. Also, given high inflation and the compelling need to shore up consumption, the government may provide some relief to taxpayers in the Rs 10 lakh – Rs 15 lakh income tax slab,” he said. Meanwhile, Vivek Jalan - Partner Tax Connect Advisory Services LLP, suggested doing away with the old tax regime and streamlining the new one. “Scrapping the Old Regime totally and rationalising the Income Tax slabs under the new regime – It is a fact that today under the new tax regime, Income Tax has become simpler. Further an exemption of Rs 7 lakh means that taxpayers have to pay NIL tax on the same level of income where they were previously taxed. Hence, the Government should consider and make the new regime the only regime as the Income Tax Act goes for a comprehensive review on 1st Feb 2025,” he said. Sharma hinted that retirement savings might get a boost in this upcoming budget announcement. “The tax-free limit for investments in the National Pension System (NPS) could be hiked from the present limit of Rs 50,000 and withdrawal rules made more flexible. This would help taxpayers enhance their retirement savings,” he mentioned. “Complementary measures such as increased rural employment spending through the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme (MGNREGS), agricultural income support, and rationalised GST rates on essential goods could also figure in the Budget,” added Dr. Manoranjan Sharma. The country’s middle class anticipates that Budget 2025 would introduce a range of measures that would promote savings and address the issues of rising costs, especially given the slowdown in the GDP. Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 25, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: 70-hour workweek: Are Indians working more or less than the world?70-hour workweek: It started with Infosys founder Naryana Murthy's statement that young Indians should work 70-hour workweeks for India to develop, which was met with a lot of flak.
Content:
India's corporate leaders in the past few months have ignited a heated debate about work culture, suggesting that achieving developed nation status requires employees to work up to 70 hours per week. It started with Infosys founder Naryana Murthy's statement that young Indians should work 70-hour workweeks for India to develop, which was met with a lot of flak.  Another comment came from the L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan, advocating a 90-hour workweek. His remarks, including, “how long can you stare at your wife,” drew massive criticism online and led to fresh discussions on the importance of work-life balance. "Nation-building is at the core of our mandate," said L&T defending its chairman. It further said that achieving extraordinary results requires extraordinary effort, particularly in a time when India is striving for progress.

But amid all this talk of nation building, are other fast-developing countries put in the hard yards and extending their working hours? A comprehensive report by Dr. Shamika Ravi, a member of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister, provides a data-driven perspective on this controversial claim. The report reveals that Indians currently spend an average of 422 minutes (approximately 7 hours) per day on paid economic activities, translating to 42 hours per week. This is lower than the proposed 70-hour benchmark, but not as far off as some might assume. The report shows that India's work hours are comparable to other emerging economies. Countries like Vietnam, China, Malaysia, and the Philippines report similar working patterns, while developed OECD (Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development) countries average just 33 hours per week.

 



Annual working hours around the globe
advertisementThe study shows variations within India itself. Union Territories like Daman & Diu lead with over 10 working hours daily, while Northeastern states and Goa report less than 6 hours. Urban workers clock 7.8 hours compared to rural workers' 6.65 hours.Gender disparities are particularly notable. Women spend considerably less time on paid work – about 2 hours less in urban areas and 1.8 hours less in rural regions. "Women who work outside the household have the least amount of leisure time compared to all other demographics," the report highlights.The economic implications are compelling. The research found that a 1% increase in working time correlates with a 1.7% rise in per capita Net State Domestic Product. For large states, this relationship is even stronger, with a 3.7% NSDP increase.Sector-wise differences are also huge. Tertiary and secondary sectors report longer working hours compared to the primary sector. Government employees work 45 minutes less per day than the national average, while private company employees tend to work longer hours.Gujarat leads in the proportion of people working over 70 hours weekly at 7.21%, while Bihar has the lowest at 1.05%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 26, 2025
 The study shows variations within India itself. Union Territories like Daman & Diu lead with over 10 working hours daily, while Northeastern states and Goa report less than 6 hours. Urban workers clock 7.8 hours compared to rural workers' 6.65 hours. Gender disparities are particularly notable. Women spend considerably less time on paid work – about 2 hours less in urban areas and 1.8 hours less in rural regions. "Women who work outside the household have the least amount of leisure time compared to all other demographics," the report highlights. The economic implications are compelling. The research found that a 1% increase in working time correlates with a 1.7% rise in per capita Net State Domestic Product. For large states, this relationship is even stronger, with a 3.7% NSDP increase. Sector-wise differences are also huge. Tertiary and secondary sectors report longer working hours compared to the primary sector. Government employees work 45 minutes less per day than the national average, while private company employees tend to work longer hours. Gujarat leads in the proportion of people working over 70 hours weekly at 7.21%, while Bihar has the lowest at 1.05%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 26, 2025

Headline: Will bears dominate stock market next week? 5 things investors should knowCorporate earnings and key economic data from around the world will likely shape the direction of the stock market, keeping investors on their toes.
Content: The stock market has seen a largely volatile trend in the past few trading sessions, swinging between gains and losses. Dalal Street is getting ready for another week of trading with several global and domestic factors expected to influence investor sentiment. Corporate earnings and key economic data from around the world will likely shape the direction of equities, keeping investors on their toes. The week will begin with China’s NBS Composite PMI for January on Monday, which will provide insights into the health of China’s manufacturing and non-manufacturing sectors. On Tuesday, the US Durable Goods Orders for December will indicate consumer spending patterns. Japan’s Consumer Confidence Index for January is scheduled to be released on Wednesday, offering a glimpse into consumer sentiment in the country. The US Federal Reserve will announce its interest rate decision on Thursday, January 30, which is widely expected to remain at 4.5%. Alongside this, the US GDP growth rate for the fourth quarter, forecasted at 3.1%, will provide a clearer picture of the country’s economic performance. On Friday, January 31, the U.S. Core PCE Price Index for December, a measure of consumer price changes, will be released, along with the UK Nationwide Housing Price Index, which reflects trends in UK house prices. "The interplay of rising inflation, global price trends, and corporate performance will be crucial for market participants. Robust performances from these corporate heavyweights could catalyze positive investor sentiment, while any earnings misses may exacerbate market volatility," said Puneet Singhania, Director at Master Trust Group. The stock market continued its losing streak last week, marking the third consecutive week of declines Both the Nifty and Sensex breached key psychological levels of 23,000 and 76,000, respectively, before recovering slightly. Despite the modest recovery, the indices ended the week with losses of approximately 0.50%. "All major indices are now trading below their crucial 200-day EMA, underscoring sustained bearish momentum. FIIs have remained consistent net sellers, with outflows exceeding â‚¹69,000 crore in the cash segment so far this month," said Singhania.  Corporate earnings have added to the market’s volatility, with lacklustre third-quarter results from some of the largest companies failing to provide the boost investors had hoped for. Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) remained net sellers, with outflows exceeding Rs 69,000 crore in January. However, Domestic Institutional Investors (DIIs) stepped in, providing net inflows of Rs 17,577 crore, which helped mitigate some of the impact of FII selling. Alternative asset classes, such as Bitcoin and gold, reached record highs last week, drawing attention and funds away from equities. On a positive note, crude oil prices declined, and the Indian rupee strengthened slightly, offering some support to investor sentiment. The Nifty index ended the week with a 0.48% decline, its third straight weekly loss. The index is now trading below key support levels, including the horizontal zone, the ascending trendline, and the 21-day, 55-week, and 200-day EMAs, confirming a bearish trend. The resistance zone at 23,350–23,450 continues to act as a barrier, with strong selling pressure observed at these levels. On the downside, the market may target 22,850 and 22,600 if the bearish trend persists. "A 'sell on rise' strategy is advisable until the index sustains above 23,450. However, a breach above 24,450 could indicate a potential recovery toward 23,750," said Singhania.  He further said that Bank Nifty followed a similar trend, closing lower for the third consecutive week. It is trading below its horizontal support zone and moving averages, including the 21-day EMA and 55-week EMA. "The resistance zone at 48,900–49,000 remains a key hurdle, and a breakout above this level could push the index to 49,700. On the downside, support is placed at 47,900, and a breach below this could result in further losses, with 47,200 being the next target," said Singhania.  Global trends will be a critical factor in determining market direction next week. Economic data from the U.S., China, Japan, and the UK will offer insights into global economic conditions and their impact on Indian markets. The continued selling by FIIs and the ability of DIIs to absorb the selling pressure will also play a significant role. In addition, corporate earnings results from major companies will be closely watched, as they could either lift investor sentiment or deepen the bearish outlook.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 26, 2025

Headline: Sensex, Nifty extend losses; IT and metal stocks drag markets downThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 378.29 points to 75,812.17, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 92.40 points to 22,999.80 as of 9:45 AM.
Content:
Benchmark stock market indices opened lower, extending their losses this month led by a decline in IT and metal sector stocks.  The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 378.29 points to 75,812.17, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 92.40 points to 22,999.80 as of 9:45 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that the market sentiment has turned weak. Headline: Unified Pension Scheme: Check eligibility, benefits and other details hereThe UPS was approved by the Union Cabinet on August 24, 2024 for nearly 23 lakh central government employees and aims to provide an assured pension benefit for the employees.
Content: The central government has announced the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS), offering it as an option under the National Pension System (NPS). The said scheme is set to be implemented from April 1, 2025. As per the official notification of the government released on January 24, “The Unified Pension Scheme shall be applicable to such central government employees who are covered under the National Pension System and who choose this option under the National Pension System.” It must be noted that the UPS was approved by the Union Cabinet on August 24, 2024 for nearly 23 lakh central government employees and aims to provide an assured pension benefit for the employees. In other words, the UPS promises a monthly pension equivalent to 50% of the average basic pay drawn by a central government employee during the 12 months before retirement, if 25 years of service are completed. Moreover, the UPS also offers periodic hikes in dearness relief to keep up with the inflationary trends. Additionally, the scheme also ensures a family pension equal to 60% of the government employee’s pension in the event of their death and other benefits like gratuity and a lumpsum superannuation payout at the time of retirement. The scheme is applicable to both existing and future central government employees under the NPS who choose to opt for the Unified Pension Scheme. It is pointed out that those who do not opt for the UPS will continue under the National Pension System.WHO ARE ALL ELIGIBLE UNDER THE UPS?  The following central government employees are eligible for assured benefits under the UPS: If an employee retirees after completing 10 years or more of service. If the government retires an employee under FR 56 If an employee takes up voluntary retirement after serving at least 25 years and the service duration has continued to be the same.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 27, 2025

Headline: Who will succeed Madhabi Puri Buch? Applications open for new Sebi chiefThe Ministry of Finance has invited applications for the post, with the last date for submission being February 17.
Content:
The government has officially started the process to appoint a new Chairperson for the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), as the tenure of the current chief, Madhabi Puri Buch, is set to end on February 28. The Ministry of Finance has invited applications for the post, with the last date for submission being February 17.

 



Government invites application for new Sebi chief
 In a public notice issued by the Minsitry of Finance, Department of Economic Affairs (Financial Markets Division), the government said, "Government of India invites applications from eligible candidates for filling up the post of Chairman in the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), Mumbai. The appointment shall be made for a maximum period of five years from the date of assumption of charge or till attaining the age of 65 years, whichever is earlier." The role of the Sebi Chairperson comes with two salary options: either pay equivalent to that of a Secretary to the Government of India or a consolidated monthly salary of Rs 5,62,500, without provision for a house or car. Madhabi Puri Buch took charge as Sebi Chairperson on March 2, 2022, becoming the first woman to head the market regulatory body. Her three-year term will conclude on February 28, 2025. Prior to her appointment as chairperson, Buch served as a whole-time member of Sebi from April 2017 to March 2022, overseeing various regulatory functions and reforms. The position of Sebi chief traditionally comes with a tenure of three years, though exceptions have been made in the past. For instance, U K Sinha served as Sebi Chairperson for six years, from February 18, 2011, to March 1, 2017, while his successor, Ajay Tyagi, held the post for five years, from March 1, 2017, to February 28, 2022. Madhabi Puri Buch’s tenure as Sebi chief has not been without challenges. Among the key issues was the controversy surrounding allegations of regulatory lapses in matters linked to the Adani Group. This followed claims made by short-seller Hindenburg Research and later criticisms raised by the Congress party. Questions were raised about Sebi’s handling of investments in offshore funds linked to the Adani Group and potential code-of-conduct violations. Buch also faced internal concerns as a group of Sebi employees accused her of creating a “toxic work environment” during her tenure. However, the matter was later resolved. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex tanks over 800 points. 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayShare market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex fell 818.36 points to 75,372.10, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped by 257.35 points to 22,834.85 as of 10:35 AM.
Content: Bears took control of Dalal Street as the stock market saw another session of losses as the benchmark indices extended their downward movement, with weak sentiment prevailing across sectors. Sensex fell over 800 points to hit the day's low of 75,348.06, while Nifty fell below the 23,000 mark.  Sensex opened at 75,700.43 after having closed at 76,190.46 in the previous session.  The S&P BSE Sensex fell 818.36 points to 75,372.10, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped by 257.35 points to 22,834.85 as of 10:35 AM. The fall was driven by several global and domestic factors that have been weighing on investor sentiment. The weakness in the market was primarily seen in IT and metal stocks, while mid-cap and small-cap stocks also witnessed significant selling pressure. Analysts believe that a mix of global uncertainty, persistent foreign portfolio investor (FPI) selling, and domestic concerns has led to the downturn. Foreign Portfolio Investor (FPI) selling pressures One of the key reasons for today’s market fall is the sustained selling pressure from FPIs. In January alone, FPIs have pulled out Rs 69,000 crore from the Indian market. This continuous outflow has overshadowed the strong buying by domestic institutional investors (DIIs), who have invested Rs 67,000 crore during the same period. Kranthi Bathini, Equity Strategist at WealthMills Securities, said, “Nifty is trading below the crucial 23,000 level. Anything below this creates panic and leads to furious selling. Today, we are witnessing visible pressure in mid-cap and small-cap stocks. Investors are also being cautious due to the upcoming Union Budget and the Reserve Bank of India’s monetary policy decision next week.” Global uncertainties and trade tensions Global factors are also playing a significant role in dampening market sentiment. The US Federal Reserve is set to announce its monetary policy decision, and investors are concerned about further tightening of liquidity. Additionally, rising trade tensions have added to the uncertainty. There are fresh fears regarding the US imposing a 25% tariff on Colombia for its refusal to accept deported illegal immigrants. Similar threats of tariffs on Canada and Mexico have heightened concerns about global trade disruptions. These issues have created volatility in economic and market circles, leading to risk aversion among investors. Dr V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, said, “Sustained FPI selling is impacting the market. Concerns about new tariffs and global trade tensions are weighing heavily on sentiment. Markets are now looking forward to fiscal stimulus through income tax cuts in the Budget. If these expectations are not met, the market may continue to face pressure.” Profit booking and pre-Budget nervousness Another factor contributing to the market’s decline is profit booking by investors ahead of the Union Budget 2025. Markets are hoping for measures like income tax cuts or other fiscal stimulus to boost growth, but the uncertainty surrounding these expectations has added to the volatility. Trivesh, COO of Tradejini, said, “The market is nervous about the global liquidity tightening and the upcoming Budget. Profit booking ahead of the Budget is creating additional pressure. Quarterly earnings have also been subdued, adding to the overall weakness. Additionally, global risk aversion has triggered capital flight, while crude oil prices remain under pressure due to concerns about slowing demand.” The rise of China’s DeepSeek AI technology has raised fears about intensifying competition in the global technology sector. This has added to the cautious sentiment among investors, particularly in IT stocks. Crude oil prices have declined due to demand concerns tied to slowing global growth, but this has not been enough to counter the negative sentiment in equities. The markets are expected to remain volatile in the coming days due to key global and domestic events. Investors are eagerly awaiting the Union Budget on Saturday, as well as the Reserve Bank of India’s monetary policy decision in the first week of February. Market experts suggest that any disappointment in Budget announcements could trigger further selling, while positive measures such as tax cuts or fiscal incentives could lead to a relief rally. However, the overall sentiment is likely to remain cautious until there are clearer signs of earnings revival and economic growth.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Must Watch

Headline: 8th Pay Commission: Check expected salary hike, and key FAQsThe government will soon appoint a chairman and two members to the panel to recommend changes in the pay structure of central government employees.
Content:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi approved the constitution of the 8th Pay Commission to review and recommend reforms in both pay and pensions for central government employees. He shared on X, “We are all proud of the efforts of all government employees who work to build a Viksit Bharat. The Cabinet's decision on the 8th Pay Commission will improve quality of life and give a boost to consumption.”

We are all proud of the efforts of all Government employees, who work to build a Viksit Bharat. The Cabinet's decision on the 8th Pay Commission will improve quality of life and give a boost to consumption. https://t.co/4DCa5skxNG
— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) January 16, 2025
 We are all proud of the efforts of all Government employees, who work to build a Viksit Bharat. The Cabinet's decision on the 8th Pay Commission will improve quality of life and give a boost to consumption. https://t.co/4DCa5skxNG
— Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) January 16, 2025 The 8th Pay Commission is set to be implemented from January 1, 2026, till then the 7th Pay Commission which came into being in 2016 will remain valid. Information and broadcasting minister Ashwini Vaishnaw mentioned that the government will soon appoint a chairman and two members to the panel to recommend changes in the pay structure of central government employees. That said, let us look into some of the important FAQs related to it.WHY ARE PAY COMMISSIONS IMPORTANT? Pay Commissions are set up by the government to address the issues faced by government employees related to their pay and pensions, while addressing the rising cost of living. Moreover, they have a broader impact on the economy and consumer sentiment.WHY IS FITMENT FACTOR CRUCIAL? The fitment factor is vital in determining the extent of financial benefits. It is a multiplier used to calculate revised salaries and pensions for government employees. The projected fitment factor for the 8th Pay Commission is said to be in the range of 2.28 and 2.86. On the other hand, under the 7th Pay Commission, the fitment factor was set at 2.57. For the 6th Pay Commission, introduced in 2006, the fitment factor was set at 1.86WHAT IS THE PROJECTED PAY UNDER 8TH PAY COMMISSION? The 8th Pay Commission is expected to increase the minimum basic pay from Rs 18,000 to anywhere between Rs 41,000 and Rs 51,480, offering a substantial financial boost for the central government employees.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 27, 2025

Headline: Stock market crash: Investors lose Rs 10 lakh crore. What's ahead for D-Street? Investors on Dalal Street faced losses as stock markets continued to decline, bringing the market capitalisation of all listed companies on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) down.
Content: Bears took control of the stock market as Dalal Street bled on Monday, extending its losses into 2025. Sensex and Nifty fel over 1%, resulting in a loss of nearly Rs 10 lakh crore for stock market investors.  The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 677.78 points to 75,512.78, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 217.45 points to 22,874.75 as of 12:42 AM.  Investors on Dalal Street faced losses as stock markets continued to decline, bringing the market capitalisation of all listed companies on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) down by Rs 9.48 lakh crore, settling at Rs 410.03 lakh crore. Experts attributed the sstock market crash to a mix of factors, including weak market sentiment, global uncertainty, and selling pressure from foreign portfolio investors (FPIs). Persistent FPI outflows and profit bookings have added to the volatility, with concerns about key upcoming events weighing on investor confidence.WHAT NEXT FOR DALAL STREET? Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, commented, "This 6-day week is likely to be highly volatile with other major events like the Fed decision and the Budget in India. The market is looking forward to fiscal stimulus through income tax cuts in the Budget. If the expectations are met, there can be a relief rally in the market. But if a rally is to sustain, we need data indicating growth and earnings revival." The weak sentiment has been compounded by sustained FPI selling. FPIs have pulled out Rs 69,000 crore from Indian markets in January so far, further contributing to the downward pressure. Although domestic institutional investors (DIIs) have bought shares worth Rs 67,000 crore during the same period, their efforts have not been enough to counterbalance the losses.GLOBAL CUES RAISE CONCERN Global uncertainties have also played a significant role in dampening investor sentiment. Trivesh, COO of Tradejini, said, "Markets today have declined due to a mix of global and domestic concerns. The market appears to be nervous about the impact of tightening on global liquidity, as the US Federal Reserve is set to announce its next monetary policy decision." Adding to these worries are trade tensions and geopolitical risks. "The rise of China’s DeepSeek AI has raised alarms about the growing competition in the global technology race. Moreover, there is an additional burden of global uncertainty as trade tensions have risen due to tariffs on Colombia," Trivesh added. The prospect of new tariffs by the United States is another area of concern. President Trump has reportedly threatened a 25% tariff on Colombia for refusing to take back deported illegal immigrants. Similar tariffs on Canada and Mexico are expected to come into effect from February 1, raising questions about the broader implications of these policies on global trade and economic stability. The prices of crude oil have remained under pressure, reflecting concerns about slowing demand as global growth tapers off. This has added to the challenges for Indian markets, as the country is a major importer of crude oil. Meanwhile, quarterly corporate earnings have been another source of disappointment, failing to provide any relief to the markets. Persistent FII outflows, combined with global risk aversion, have triggered capital flight, adding to the pressure on domestic equities. Domestic investors are also closely watching the Union Budget, which will be presented soon. Market participants are hoping for fiscal stimulus measures, including income tax cuts, to support growth and boost investor sentiment. However, uncertainty around the budget has heightened market volatility, with many investors adopting a cautious stance. Kranthi Bathini, Equity Strategist at WealthMills Securities, said, “Nifty is trading below the crucial 23,000 level. Anything below this creates panic and leads to furious selling. Today, we are witnessing visible pressure in mid-cap and small-cap stocks. Investors are also being cautious due to the upcoming Union Budget and the Reserve Bank of India’s monetary policy decision next week.”Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Will government prioritise infrastructure and supply-chain reforms? Budget 2025 Expectations: Experts hope that Budget 2025 might announce key reforms to strengthen the infrastructure sector, which is the backbone of the country.
Content: The Union Budget 2025, which is scheduled to be presented on February 1, 2026, has raised hopes for substantial reforms for the country’s infrastructure sector. With India’s GDP projected to grow between 6.5% and 6.8% in FY25, experts hope that the upcoming budget will introduce key reforms to strengthen the infrastructure sector, which is the backbone of the country. Amrutesh Reddy, Director, NDR InvIT Managers, has urged the government to modernise the country’s infrastructure and supply chain systems. “With India’s GDP growth forecasted at 6.5% for FY25, the emphasis must be on fortifying the nation’s economic backbone through the modernisation of infrastructure and the establishment of efficient, future-ready supply chain systems. These sectors are indispensable to fostering sustained economic growth and enhancing India’s competitiveness on the global stage,” he said. “The budget must focus on addressing systemic challenges and unlocking the sector's full potential. Simplifying land acquisition processes and expediting approvals for logistics and warehousing projects can significantly reduce lead times and enable the timely delivery of critical infrastructure,” Amrutesh Reddy mentioned. Additionally, Reddy has called for the need for simplifying the land acquisition process across the country and accelerating approvals for warehousing projects, to enable timely delivery of key infrastructure. “Incentives for green warehousing and sustainable building practices are essential to align with global environmental standards and future-proof the sector. Supporting the development of integrated industrial parks and export hubs tailored to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) can play a transformative role in boosting India’s manufacturing and export capabilities,” Reddy added. Amit Tandon, CEO & Managing Director, Asia Shipping India is hopeful for substantial budget allocation to key infrastructure projects. “As India strives to become a $7 trillion economy by 2030, we urge the government to focus on infrastructure development, policy consistency, and technology adoption aligned with the National Logistics Policy and PM Gati Shakti,” he remarked. “Key expectations from the upcoming Budget include increased investments in port modernisation, multi-modal logistics parks, and seamless connectivity across transport networks,” Tandon said.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Are Shark Tank India judges losing money? Harsh Goenka shares insightsHarsh Goenka, Chairman of RPG Group, recently shared insights about financial data that revealed losses in companies owned or co-founded by some of the Shark Tank India judges.
Content:
Shark Tank India judges have become household names for backing inventive ideas and inspiring budding entrepreneurs. They have become posterboys of risk-taking, often betting big on startups. But as they invest crores in promising ventures they come across in the show, a curious question comes to mind, how well are their own businesses performing? Harsh Goenka, Chairman of RPG Group, recently shared insights to the above question. In a social media post, he shared financial data that revealed losses in companies owned or co-founded by some of the show’s judges.  Known for his witty and candid posts, Goenka praised the show for encouraging entrepreneurship but highlighted the financial struggles faced by some of its investors. "I still love watching #SharkTankIndia. But it seems some of our sharks are still navigating choppy waters. There’s more ‘bleeding’ in the tank than I thought!" Goenka wrote, alongside data highlighting losses incurred by companies linked to the show’s panellists. The investors in Shark Tank India include well-known entrepreneurs Aman Gupta (boAt), Peyush Bansal (Lenskart), Anupam Mittal (Shaadi.com), Namita Thapar (Emcure Pharmaceuticals), Vineeta Singh (SUGAR Cosmetics), Amit Jain (CarDekho), and Kunal Bahl (Snapdeal). Goenka’s post included a table showing financial losses reported by some of their businesses, reigniting a conversation about entrepreneurial risks. The figures shared in Goenka's post were as below: boAt, led by Aman Gupta, recorded a loss of Rs 54 crore in FY24. Lenskart, co-founded by Peyush Bansal, reported a Rs 10 crore loss in FY24. Shaadi.com, founded by Anupam Mittal, posted a Rs 18 crore loss in FY23. Acko General Insurance, helmed by Varun Dua, reported a loss of Rs 456 crore. Azhar Iqubal’s InShorts recorded a loss of Rs 228 crore. Ritesh Agarwal's Oyo Rooms also showed a loss of R 184 crore (PBT before exceptional items). 

 



Harsh Goenka shares a post highlighting financial performance of businesses owned by Shark Tank India judges
 This is not the first time Goenka has shared his perspective on the Sharks’ financial standings. A similar post by him in January 2023 prompted a response from Anupam Mittal, the founder of Shaadi.com. While acknowledging Goenka’s remarks, Mittal offered a defence of entrepreneurship and the risks it entails. "I know you meant it in jest, so with all due respect, sir, I think you reacted to what appears to be superficial, biased, and incomplete data," Mittal wrote on X (formerly Twitter). He also added, "The Sharks don’t bleed red, we bleed blue, and that’s why we do what we do."Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Dalal Street bleeds: Sensex tanks 824 points, Nifty below 23,000The S&P BSE Sensex was down 824.29 points to close at 75,366.17, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 263.05 points to end at 22,829.15.
