Headline: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu to take new role, steps down as CEOSridhar Vembu resigns as Zoho CEO: As part of the leadership transition, Sridhar Vembu has handed over the role of group CEO to Shailesh Kumar Davey, a co-founder of the company.
Content: Sridhar Vembu, the founder of Zoho Corp, has announced that he is stepping down as the CEO of the software company and taking up a new role. In a post shared on social media platform X (formerly Twitter), Vembu said that he would now focus on research and development as the "chief scientist" of Zoho. "A new chapter begins today. In view of the various challenges and opportunities facing us, including recent major developments in AI, it has been decided that it is best that I should focus full-time on R&D initiatives, along with pursuing my personal rural development mission," said Vembu.  As part of the leadership transition, Vembu has handed over the role of group CEO to Shailesh Kumar Davey, a co-founder of the company. "Our co-founder Shailesh Kumar Davey will serve as our new group CEO," Vembu stated in his post. In addition to this, Vembu announced that another co-founder, Tony Thomas, would lead Zoho's US operations. Meanwhile, Rajesh Ganesan will take charge of the company’s ManageEngine division, and Mani Vembu will oversee the Zoho.com division. Vembu mentioned that the future of Zoho depends on its ability to navigate challenges in research and development, particularly with advancements in artificial intelligence (AI). "The future of our company entirely depends on how well we navigate the R&D challenge, and I am looking forward to my new assignment with energy and vigour," he wrote. Vembu, who has been a key figure in Zoho's growth since its inception, expressed excitement about returning to hands-on technical work. "I am also very happy to get back to hands-on technical work," he added. Zoho Corp, headquartered in Chennai, India, is known for offering a suite of software products for businesses, including customer relationship management (CRM), project management, and enterprise tools. Under Vembu's leadership, the company has grown into a global brand, with millions of users across the world.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Indian Oil turns to sweet crude as Russian oil supplies tighten: ReportThe United States recently imposed sweeping sanctions on Russia, targeting its oil producers and shipping networks. This has made it difficult for many countries, including India, to continue sourcing Russian crude oil.
Content:
Indian Oil Corporation (IOC), India’s largest oil refiner, has purchased 6 million barrels of sweet crude oil through a tender for April delivery, reported news agency Reuters.  The company’s decision comes as fresh US sanctions on Russian oil producers and tankers disrupt shipments, creating challenges for importers to secure supplies from the world’s second-largest oil producer, trade sources told Reuters. The United States recently imposed sweeping sanctions on Russia, targeting its oil producers and shipping networks. This has made it difficult for many countries, including India, to continue sourcing Russian crude oil at the scale seen earlier. As a result, Indian refiners like IOC are turning to alternative sources of oil to meet their domestic demand. In the latest tender, IOC secured crude oil from a mix of African and American sources. The breakdown of the purchases is as follows:
2 million barrels of Nigerian Okwuibome crude from Vitol.
1 million barrels each of Nigerian Akpo and Angolan Mostarda grades from Shell.
2 million barrels of US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) Midland crude from Equinor.
 Sweet crude is preferred due to its low sulphur content, which makes it easier and cheaper to refine into fuel products like petrol and diesel. The recent tender comes just a week after IOC bought 7 million barrels of spot crude from the Middle East and Africa. This included a rare procurement of Abu Dhabi’s Murban crude, showcasing IOC’s ongoing efforts to diversify its sources of crude oil amid global supply challenges. In a related development, Mangalore Refinery and Petrochemicals Ltd (MRPL), another Indian refiner, issued its first crude import tender in over a year but chose not to award the tender. The reasons for this decision remain unclear, although market observers speculate it could be linked to pricing or supply concerns. Indian refiners have traditionally relied on a mix of Russian, Middle Eastern, and African crude oil to meet domestic fuel demand. However, with the sanctions limiting access to Russian oil, IOC and other refiners are now focusing on alternative sources. Sweet crude oil grades, particularly from Africa and the US, are emerging as key options, even though they may come at a higher price compared to earlier deals for Russian crude.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Must Watch

Headline: This CEO's 4-month salary beats Sunder Pichai and Tim Cook's annual pay. Who is he?Niccol, who was earlier the CEO of Chipotle, joined Starbucks in September 2024. He was granted a $5 million sign-on bonus within the first month of stepping into his new role as revealed in company filings.
Content: Starbucks CEO, Brian Niccol, has received one of the highest compensation packages in the US, Bloomberg reported. Niccol, 50, was awarded an amount of nearly $96 million in 2024 as his pay package for just four months of work, making him one of the highest-paid executives in corporate America. His earnings even left behind the compensation awarded to the CEOs of tech giants like Apple and Google. Both Tim Cook and Sundar Pichai earned about $75 million each last year, according to several media reports. Niccol, who was earlier the CEO of Chipotle, joined Starbucks in September 2024. He was granted a $5 million sign-on bonus within the first month of stepping into his new role as revealed in company filings. 94% of his earnings came from stock awards, tied to the company’s performance over a three-year period. Brian Niccol was not required to relocate to Seattle, Starbucks’ headquarters. Starbucks gave him a corporate jet for commuting between his California home and Seattle. The company paid $143,000 on housing expenses, including tax-related payments, and $72,000 for flights between California and Seattle for Niccol. It also paid $19,000 for his personal use of the company jet. Niccol’s total annual pay package is estimated to be $113 million, says Bloomberg, thereby placing him amongst the top 20 highest paid CEOs in the world. It must be noted that Brian Niccol was recruited as Starbucks' new CEO, after the coffee giant showed the door to its previous CEO over declining sales.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 27, 2025

Headline: How business loan differs from a personal loan?Personal loans can be taken for almost anything, be it meeting medical expenses, buying a car or house, for marriage of a son or daughter, etc.
Content: Rahul, a young entrepreneur, wanted to expand his business but lacked funds. So he decided to look for a bank loan but was not sure whether to opt for a personal loan or a business loan. Like Rahul, many people face this dilemma when choosing the right type of loan. In this article we will talk about what personal and business loans are and what is the difference between the two. Personal loans, as the name suggests, help in meeting the personal financial requirements of the borrower. They can be taken for almost anything, be it meeting medical expenses, buying a car or house, for marriage of a son or daughter, etc. On the other hand, business loans are typically designed for entrepreneurs for supporting their business needs, be it purchasing business equipment, expanding business operations, funding salaries, etc. However, business loans must be used exclusively for business purposes and one is not allowed to use the business loan for personal use. Personal loans are usually unsecured loans, while business loans are secured loans that may require collateral. One may not get any tax exemption on personal loans. The loan amount for a personal loan is usually less than a business loan and depends on the borrower’s creditworthiness and credit rating. On the contrary, business loans depend on the size of business, income and credit rating of the borrower. Banks may ask business owners to submit profit and loss statements, balance sheets, business plans, and other reports, while granting business loans. They offer tax benefits to the borrowers. Hence, before applying for a bank loan, one must figure out the exact purpose of the loan and decide what suits his/her personal or business requirements.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 27, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher despite global tech sell-off sparked by DeepSeek Share Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 366.45 points to 75,732.62 at around 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 111.25 points to trade at 22,940.40.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened higher on Tuesday despite the global selloff in artificial stocks (AI) sparked by China’s Deepseek AI. The S&P BSE Sensex was up 366.45 points to 75,732.62 at around 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 111.25 points to trade at 22,940.40. Most of the other broader market indices also recovered after Monday’s sharp selloff, sparked by concerns over US President Donald Trump’s trade tariffs. Major heavyweight sectoral indices such as Nifty Bank, Nifty Financial Services and Nifty IT also gained, defying global market trends. Shares of Axis Bank, Wipro, Shriram Finance, Tata Steel and IndusInd Bank were the top gainers on the Nifty50. The top drags were Sun Pharma, Dr Reddy’s, Coal India, M&M and Cipla. Globally, the focus of investors has shifted to Chinese startup DeepSeek, with the emergence of its free AI assistant. The firm said it uses less data and at a fraction of the cost of services available currently. The rising popularity of DeepSeek led to a sharp selloff in US tech stocks yesterday, especially AI-focused companies such as Nvidia, which fell 17%. Dr VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, said, "The DeepSeek impact on the US stock market in general, and the tech stocks in particular, has turned out to be a reality check for the overvalued stock market. In the medium-term this is likely to have a sobering effect on markets, globally.” On the Indian market, Vijayakumar said that it appears to be oversold and is set for a rebound. “The RBI’s announcement of measures to boost the liquidity in the banking system by around Rs 1.5 lakh crore is positive for the market. This raises the prospects of a rate cut by the MPC in the February policy meeting. Banks are likely to benefit,” he explained. “After the correction the market is now trading at fair valuations which are in line with long-term (10-year) averages. Investors can utilise the opportunity to buy fundamentally strong high quality stocks. The outperformance of largecaps over mid-and smallcaps is a healthy trend,” he added.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Nvidia plunges $593 billion as DeepSeek soars, biggest market loss in historyUS chipmaker Nvidia dived 17 per cent, wiping off nearly USD 593 billion in the biggest market capitalisation loss in history, following a wave of selling as China's DeepSeek developed a free AI assistant using lower-cost chips.
Content: US stock futures steadied, the dollar ticked higher and tech stocks in Asia slid on Tuesday following a wave of selling as apparent advances by a Chinese AI startup cast doubt on US dominance and spending in one of the market's hottest sectors. Overnight, chipmaker Nvidia dived 17 per cent, wiping off nearly USD 593 billion in the biggest market capitalisation loss in history. "We are on the front edge of an urgent re-evaluation of a narrative that has gripped the market for almost two years. That makes it hard to shrug off after 36 hours," said Brent Donnelly, president of trading and analytics firm Spectra Markets. Nvidia stock was up slightly in after-hours trading. Nasdaq 100 futures rose 0.1 per cent and S&P 500 futures were broadly flat. Nvidia supplier Advantest was down 10 per cent in Japan on Tuesday, taking losses for the week so far to nearly 19 per cent. There were further sharp falls for AI-backer SoftBank Group, down 5.5 per cent, and data-centre cable maker Furukawa Electric, down 8 per cent. Both had already fallen heavily on Monday, with SoftBank now 13 per cent lower after two days and Furukawa down 20 per cent. Data centre landlords tumbled in Australia. Tech heavy markets in Taiwan and South Korea were closed for a holiday. Nvidia accounted for most of the 3 per cent drop in the Nasdaq on Monday, though selling extended from Tokyo to New York and hit everything with a slice of the AI supply chain, from cable makers to data centres, power utilities and software firms. The CBOE Volatility Index, known as Wall Street's fear gauge, leapt and safe-haven assets such as government bonds, the yen and the Swiss franc all rallied. Ten-year US Treasury yields fell 9.5 basis points, and were last steady at 4.55 per cent in Asia. Fed fund futures have put in an extra 9 bps of easing by year-end. Even oil prices dropped 2 per cent on worries about energy demand. DeepSeek, a little-known startup from Hangzhou, China, has a free AI assistant it said was developed very cheaply using lower-cost chips and less data than US rivals. "The narrative that's concerning people here is that DS has delivered performance-topping models on a shoestring budget," said JP Morgan sector specialist Josh Meyers in a note to clients. "This has been seen by some as egg-on-the-face of the big, multi-billion dollar operations like OpenAI, Google and Anthropic. And it's calling into question whether we're going to need multi-billions of dollars in compute capex when DeepSeek's leading distilled models can run natively on an iPhone."BROAD RISK-OFF MOOD On Wall Street, the S&P 500, dropped 1.5 per cent. Chipmaker Broadcom, fell 17.4 per cent and the Philadelphia semiconductor index dropped 9.2 per cent - its biggest loss since March 2020. Gold prices declined more than 1 per cent as investors liquidated bullion to cover losses elsewhere. Google parent Alphabet fell 4.2 per cent and Microsoft fell 2.1 per cent, with both steadying in after-hours trade. In Europe, the STOXX Europe 600 technology index fell more than 3 per cent and ASML, which makes chip manufacturing equipment, fell 7 per cent. Bitcoin, lately a barometer of markets' risk appetite, dropped below USD 100,000 for the first time in a week before steadying around USD 101,700. The dollar fell nearly 1 per cent against the yen overnight and 0.4 per cent against the Swiss franc  - two currencies that often gain during periods of market unease. Early on Tuesday it ticked higher against both, trading at 155.36 yen and making modest gains elsewhere, holding the euro to USD 1.0454. Markets in China were closed to usher in the Lunar New Year and Hong Kong trade closes at noon. Both the US Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank meet to set interest rates later in the week.Published By: Prateek ChakrabortyPublished On: Jan 28, 2025ALSO READ |  Chinese AI chatbot DeepSeek hit by 'malicious attacks' amid popularity surgeALSO READ |  Mukesh Ambani buys Nvidia AI chips, plans to build largest data centre in India: Report

Headline: Explained: Why China's DeepSeek triggered a slide in global AI stocksChinese startup DeepSeek has turned up the heat in the global AI race and its new models have raised hard questions about whether US companies can keep their edge as the landscape shifts beneath their feet.
Content: Last night's trading session on Wall Street left tech and artificial intelligence (AI) companies reeling, with investors scrambling to make sense of the damage. Leading AI chipmaker Nvidia saw its market value nosedive, while shares of tech giants such as Microsoft, Alphabet, and Dell Technologies also faced sharp declines. The tremors weren't just limited to Wall Street; AI stocks worldwide felt the impact, all thanks to a Chinese startup called DeepSeek and the buzz around its AI models, DeepSeek-R1 and DeepSeek-V3.advertisementDECODING THE DEEPSEEK DISRUPTION DeepSeek rattled the global tech landscape with its low-cost AI chatbot. Its arrival poses a serious challenge to industry-leading AI models in the US, given the fact that it does it at a fraction of the cost. The Chinese startup's impact hit Wall Street hard during the overnight trading session. The Nasdaq Composite plunged 3.07% while the S&P 500 dropped nearly 1.5%. Tech giants led the fall, with Nvidia's shares dropping nearly 17% to close at $118.58. This marked a staggering $593 billion market-cap loss in a single day—doubling its previous record. The damage spread further as the Philadelphia Semiconductor Index tumbled 9.2%, marking its steepest drop since March 2020, with chipmakers facing heavy selling pressure.DEEPSEEK'S 'SPUTNIK MOMENT' DeepSeek's breakthrough has people questioning the worth of industry leaders like OpenAI. Silicon Valley venture capitalist Marc Andreessen didn't mince words, calling DeepSeek's R1 model AI's "Sputnik moment." The comparison hits home—just as the Soviet Union's Sputnik launch kicked off the space race in the 1950s, DeepSeek's breakthrough could reshape the AI landscape. The startup's secret? Cost efficiency. DeepSeek claims its AI assistant needs less data than competitors like OpenAI's ChatGPT. It runs on just 2,000 Nvidia H800 chips, making it cheaper to operate. Better yet, the company says its new DeepSeek-R1 costs 20-50 times less than OpenAI's offerings. It may be noted that DeepSeek’s app surpassed ChatGPT in downloads on Apple’s App Store by Monday. Moreover, the lower chip requirement raises eyebrows for another reason: it could help sidestep US export restrictions meant to slow China's AI progress.BROADER MARKET FALLOUT The damage wasn't limited to Nvidia. Other tech heavyweights like Microsoft, Alphabet, and Dell Technologies took serious hits. Semiconductor giant Broadcom's shares sank 17.4%, while AI-focused infrastructure companies like Digital Realty and Vertiv Holdings also got hammered. The selling spree spread overseas, with Japan's SoftBank and Europe's ASML joining the downward spiral.HOW DID NVIDIA, OPENAI RESPOND? After watching its share price tank, Nvidia acknowledged DeepSeek's achievement but stood its ground, saying that its chips remain crucial to AI development. The chipmaker pointed out that DeepSeek's growing user base will still need substantial processing power, adding that that only high-performance Nvidia GPUs can provide. DeepSeek's AI model even received a word of praise from OpenAI CEO Sam Altman. He called that Chinese startup's R1 AI model impressive.  "DeepSeek's R1 is an impressive model, particularly around what they're able to deliver for the price," Altman said on X.WHAT NEXT? DeepSeek's arrival has investors rethinking the AI-fuelled demand for chips, data centers, and power infrastructure that drove markets to record highs over the past two years. Brian Jacobsen, chief economist at Annex Wealth Management, told Reuters this could upend the "entire AI narrative." Dr VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, put it bluntly: "The DeepSeek impact on the US stock market, especially tech stocks, is a reality check for the overvalued market." "This will likely have a sobering effect on markets globally," he added. Some experts see opportunity in the chaos. Daniel Morgan of Synovus Trust Company told Reuters that Nvidia and other chipmakers remain essential for data centers, where the "real money" in AI lies. But one thing's clear. DeepSeek's new models have turned up the heat in the AI race. They've raised hard questions about whether US companies can keep their edge as the landscape shifts beneath their feet. For now, DeepSeek has everyone talking about what comes next for AI.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex jumps 800 points: 3 things to know about today's stock market rally Share Market: While global markets were hit due to a slide in AI and tech stocks, Sensex and Nifty displayed resilience and surged sharply, supported by a rally in heavyweight banking and financial services stocks.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices registered a strong recovery on Tuesday after falling sharply in the previous trading session. The S&P BSE Sensex was up 779.85 points to 76,146.02 at 12:09 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 198.15 points to trade at 23,027.50. In contrast, most of the other broader market indices fell during the session. However, the overall mood on Dalal Street was much better than yesterday, despite the highly volatile environment.  Here are three points to know about today's stock market rally: BANKING AND FINANCIAL STOCKS GAIN While global markets were hit due to a slide in AI and tech stocks, Sensex and Nifty displayed resilience and surged sharply, supported by a rally in heavyweight banking and financial services stocks. The Nifty Bank index was up nearly 2% and Nifty Financial Services surged over 2%. Banking and financial stocks such as Axis Bank, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Bajaj Finance and Bajaj Finserv rose sharply during the trading session.RBI MEASURES TO BOOST LIQUIDITY The sharp rise came after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announced several measures to boost liquidity in the banking section. Mahesh Agarwal, National Head, Wealth, AUM Capital, said, “RBI announced bold measures to address the liquidity crunch in the domestic financial markets that have been prevailing for a while now.” The announcements by the central bank have also raised hopes of an interest rate cut in February—something that has been pending for a prolonged period. This also provided a boost to realty stocks, with the Nifty Realty index rising 1.8%.MARKET REMAINS VOLATILE The rally in banking and financial services stocks has provided a much-needed boost to the benchmark indices, but the situation remains volatile ahead of Saturday’s Union Budget presentation. “Key upcoming catalysts include the Federal Open Market Committee’s meeting on January 28-29 and the Union Budget 2025 on February 1,” said Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd. Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, further pointed out earlier that the Indian market “appears to be oversold and set for a rebound”. “The RBI’s announcement of measures to boost the liquidity in the banking system by around Rs 1.5 lakh crore is positive for the market. This raises the prospects of a rate cut by the MPC in the February policy meeting. Banks are likely to benefit,” he added.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 28, 2025

Headline: 200 UK companies sign up for 4-day workweek amid '70-hour debate' in IndiaThe 4 Day Week Foundation campaign director, mentioned that the traditional 9-5, five-day working week which was invented 100 years ago, is now outdated.
Content: Nearly 200 UK companies with more than 5,000 people have signed a permanent four-day working week to reinvent the country’s working week, reported The Guardian. The 4 Day Week Foundation spearheaded the campaign which witnessed several companies spanning across various sectors, including charities, marketing and technology firms, etc., taking part. The foundation’s campaign director, Joe Ryle, mentioned that the traditional 9-5, five-day working week which was invented 100 years ago, is now outdated and no longer serves the purpose in modern times.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 28, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why SpiceJet shares rose 4% todaySpiceJet shares were trading 3.94% higher at Rs 45.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange at around 12:54 pm.
Content: Shares of budget carrier SpiceJet rose as much as 4% during Tuesday’s trading session. SpiceJet shares were trading 3.94% higher at Rs 45.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange at around 12:54 pm. The low-cost airline’s stock price gained after it announced that the first of its four grounded Boeing 737 MAX aircraft would resume operations on Wednesday. SpiceJet also aims to restart the other three 737 MAXs and 10 other aircraft by mid-April. It is worth noting that several SpiceJet aircraft have been grounded or deregistered over unpaid dues to lessors. Earlier, the carrier had completed a series of fund raises to settle dues, which has helped it bring its grounded jets back in operation. This comes as a welcome development for the carrier that has been struggling with a rising financial burden.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 28, 2025

Headline: UBS to lay off nearly 3,000 employees post Credit Suisse takeover: Report The impacted employees have been given an option to join a program that allows up to a year to find a new role within the bank.
Content: Switzerland-based UBS Group AG has started a series of job cuts impacting nearly 3,000 jobs as a part of its integration with Credit Suisse, cited sources familiar with the situation. The said job cuts have impacted both higher management levels and lower ranks, reported Bloomberg. The planned job cuts come at a time when the company is trying to slash its staff post-integration with former rival Credit Suisse. UBS took over Credit Suisse in an emergency rescue in 2023. It had earlier mentioned that it would be slashing nearly 3000 jobs in Switzerland as a part of this integration. However, the bank is trying to minimise the impact of jobs cuts both domestically and globally, mentioned a spokesperson for UBS. Both UBS Group AG and Credit Suisse employed nearly 35,000 people in Switzerland at the end of 2023. The impacted employees have been given an option to join a program that allows up to a year to find a new role within the bank, and is also offering additional assistance in finding a new role outside the bank, if necessary. The bank is also providing a comprehensive social plan, combining the best features of the previous UBS and Credit Suisse plans, said the spokesperson. These job cuts are occurring during the time when UBS is trying to remove Credit Suisse’s logo from its Zurich headquarters and is working on migrating domestic client data to its own IT systems. Chief Executive Officer Sergio Ermotti told Bloomberg that the reduction in headcount would continue in the wake of the acquisition, adding that the redundancies are "inevitable" even as the bank is trying to rely on voluntary leavers wherever possible.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 28, 2025

Headline: Stock market rebounds but remains volatile. What should investors do? Indian Share Market: Should the increased stock market volatility prompt investors to exit the market, or is it better to stay calm and stick with their investments? Should they even consider adding more to their portfolios?
Content: Dalal Street has been going through a turbulent phase. From sudden bull runs to shocking crashes, the benchmark indices seem to be on a relentless rollercoaster ride. For instance, the 30-share Sensex jumped 900 points today, recovering sharply from the steep fall in the previous session. The broader Nifty and other small-and mid-cap indices are also facing the same situation. With some key events lined up— the US Fed’s policy decision, expiry of F&O contracts for the January series, Union Budget 2025, Delhi Elections, and RBI’s Monetary Policy—it’s almost certain the stock markets will experience periods of volatility till mid-February. Should the increased volatility prompt investors to exit the market, or is it better to stay calm and stick with their investments? Should they even consider adding more to their portfolios? While analysts have acknowledged that domestic stock markets remain extremely volatile, they have advised investors to stay calm and invested. Most of them remain bullish on the stock market in terms of long-term growth. The focus of investors, therefore, should be on remaining cautious and avoiding rash decisions. Dr VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, explained the stock market is “now trading at fair valuations” after the prolonged correction. He went on to say that the valuations at present are in line with long-term (10-year) averages, adding that it could be an ideal time for investors to utilise the opportunity to buy “fundamentally strong and high-quality” stocks. “The outperformance of largecaps over mid-and smallcaps is a healthy trend,” he added. Meanwhile, Sameet Chavan, Head Research, Technical and Derivative - Angel One, takes on a more cautious approach. “The beginning of the eventful week was quite dreadful, as the benchmark slipped convincingly below the 23,000 mark to challenge the supporting trendline of the ‘Falling wedge’, making it worse from a technical point of view,” he said “We have been maintaining our bearish stance since the last 2 - 3 months and have been repeatedly advocating against catching the falling knife. Now, since we are about to enter a crucial and major support zone of 22800 - 22400, we would change our stance from bearish to cautious now,” he added. He also mentioned that from here on, it would be “very difficult to anticipate what the Union Budget has to offer” and other global developments. Chavan noted that unless there is any major disappointment from the budget or any other global aberration, markets are likely to see some respite in the mentioned support zone any time soon. “This certainly does not mean one should start buying throttle; but yes, accumulation in a staggered manner in the coming days is advisable with no leveraged positions. The anticipated increase in volatility presents opportunities to capitalise on market movements, whether they trend upward or downward. Staying alert and adaptable will be crucial for navigating the twists and turns that lie ahead,” he added. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty end higher but volatility caps gains. All you need to knowThe S&P BSE Sensex closed 535.24 points higher at 75,901.41, while the NSE Nifty settled 146.90 points higher at 22,976.05.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices recovered on Tuesday to snap a 2-day losing streak, but volatility capped gains to a large extent. The S&P BSE Sensex closed 535.24 points higher at 75,901.41, while the NSE Nifty settled 146.90 points higher at 22,976.05. Earlier in the session, the Sensex had surged as much as 1,100 points to 76,512.96 and the Nifty rose to a day’s high of 23,137.95. The key factors behind today’s stock market rally were gains in banking and financial services stocks as Dalal Street investors welcomed the RBI's liquidity-boosting measures. Realty stocks also gained due to increased optimism about quicker rate cuts. However, pharma and healthcare stocks fell sharply, leading to a decline in the stock market. Other than that, modest Q3 results continue to drive the bearish sentiments on Dalal Street. Vinod Nair, Head of Research, Geojit Financial Services, said, "The national benchmark indices demonstrated optimism today, primarily driven by gains in the banking sector following the RBI's announcement of open market interventions to address liquidity concerns." "Large-cap stocks outperformed, as their valuations have now reached fair levels and are further supported by expectations that the market correction is nearing its bottom. In contrast, mid- and small-cap stocks continued to decline, as they remain overvalued. However, volatility is expected to remain elevated in the near term in anticipation of the upcoming Union Budget, the FOMC meeting, and the F&O expiry," he added.  Aditya Gaggar, Director of Progressive Shares, said, "Realty was the best-performing sector, followed by PSU Banks, while Pharma and Energy lagged. The broader markets extended their underperformance as Mid and Smallcaps corrected by 0.51% and 1.81% respectively. The Nifty index shows a potential trend reversal with a long-legged DOJI candlestick pattern, and there could be a bullish divergence in the RSI." "A close above 23,100 would confirm this. Immediate resistance is at 23,100 and support at 22,800," he added. Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Must Watch

Headline: RBI's big liquidity boost: What it means for the economy The RBI has announced OMO purchase auctions of Government of India securities for an aggregate amount of Rs 60,000 crore in three tranches of Rs 20,000 crore each.
Content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has announced several important measures to increase liquidity in the country’s banking system, via a notification dated 2024-2025/2013. These measures are: OMO purchase auctions of Government of India securities for an aggregate amount of Rs 60,000 crore in three tranches of Rs 20,000 crore each to be held on January 30, 2025, February 13, 2025, and February 20, 2025. 56-day Variable Rate Repo (VRR) auction for a notified amount of Rs 50,000 crore to be held on February 7, 2025. USD/INR Buy/Sell Swap auction of USD 5 billion for a tenor of six months to be held on January 31, 2025. Detailed instructions for each operation shall be issued separately. The Reserve Bank will continue to monitor evolving liquidity and market conditions and take measures as appropriate to ensure orderly liquidity conditions. Rajeev Radhakrishnan, CIO – Fixed Income, SBI Mutual Fund said that the central bank has undertaken the above measures to tackle the existing liquidity issues. “A host of measures have been announced today that clearly lays out the immediate and pressing task facing the RBI i.e., providing adequate liquidity support to the financial markets. With core liquidity being negative close to about Rs. 80,000 crores, there was clearly a need to add durable liquidity beyond the daily VRR auctions that largely addresses the frictional liquidity tightness in the banking system,” he said. “Starting with the CRR cut announced in the last review, the daily VRR auctions announced a couple of weeks ago and the screen-based OMO purchase conducted over last 2 weeks, the incremental measures announced provide confidence in returning normalcy to the money markets. These incremental actions would add about Rs. 1 trillion of core liquidity infusion and another Rs. 50,000 crores through a slightly longer-term repo auction crossing the quarter,” Rajeev Radhakrishnan added. Upasna Bhardwaj, Chief Economist, Kotak Mahindra mentioned that the central bank’s easing liquidity measures are in line with expectations. “However, we expect more easing will be needed given the continued pressure over the next few months,” she said. Upasna Bhardwaj mentioned that the above measures raise the probability of a dip in Repo rate in the upcoming February policy.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Must Watch

Headline: ITC Hotels to list on BSE, NSE tomorrow. Check eligibility and other key details Earlier this month, ITC Ltd allotted equity shares of ITC Hotels amounting to Rs 125.11 crore to its shareholders and the latter ceased to be a subsidiary of ITC ltd.
Content: ITC Ltd announced in a recent exchange filing that ITC Hotels is set to be listed on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and National Stock Exchange (NSE) on Wednesday, January 29.  Last year, ITC Ltd decided to demerge its hotel division into an independent entity. It set the demerger ratio at 1:10. This means that those shareholders who, as of January 6, 2025, owned 10 shares of ITC, will get one share of ITC Hotels. In order to qualify for the above, investors had to purchase ITC shares on or before January 3, 2025. Those who purchase ITC shares after January 3 will not be eligible for the ITC Hotel shares. On January 11, ITC Ltd. allotted equity shares of ITC Hotels amounting to Rs 125.11 crore to its shareholders and the latter ceased to be a subsidiary of ITC ltd. As a part of the demerger agreement, ITC will hold 40% of the hotel shareholding, while the rest 60% will be divided equally among the current ITC shareholders. The market had anticipated the ITC Hotels listing to occur around mid-February. However, the announcement was made today after the closure of the market. On January 28, ITC shares closed 1.08% lower at Rs 435.25 on the BSE. In FY23-24, ITC Ltd’s revenue stood at nearly Rs 70,105 crore, while its net profit was recorded at over Rs 20,421 crore. ITC Hotels is India’s leading chain of luxury hotels, operating nearly 140 hotels in over 90 locations. It operates under brands, namely, ITC Hotels, Welcomhotel, Fortune, Storii, WelcomHeritage, and Mementos.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Boeing reports $11.8 billion in annual loss, largest since 2020Boeing posted an annual loss of $11.83 billion owing to problems at its commercial and defense units, reported Reuters.
Content: Boeing on Tuesday reported an annual loss of $11.83 billion, its largest since 2020, as it grappled with problems at its commercial and defense units and the fallout from a crippling strike by U.S. West Coast factory workers. The loss demonstrates the challenges facing CEO Kelly Ortberg in turning around the planemaker as it cedes more ground to rival Airbus  in the delivery race and comes under the crosshairs of regulators and customers following a series of missteps. Shares of Boeing fell marginally in trading before the bell on Tuesday. Ortberg, who took the reins of the planemaker in August, however, said the company was making progress on restoring stability to its struggling production lines after a harrowing mid-air accident in 2024 raised concerns about the safety of its jets. The company reported a loss of $3.86 billion in the fourth quarter due to what Ortberg called "disappointing" charges in several fixed-price defense programs. He, however, added Boeing was "now more proactive and clear-eyed on the risks" to the programs. Revenue for the quarter through December fell 31% to $15.24 billion, missing analysts' expectation of $16.21 billion, according to data compiled by LSEG. Quarterly adjusted loss per share was $5.9, compared with expectations of a loss of $3 per share. Cash burn was $14.3 billion in 2024, compared with a cash flow of $4.43 billion in 2023. Ortberg reiterated the company's four-part plan to turn the business around including undertaking a "multi-year journey" to fix Boeing's culture, "perhaps the most important change we need to make." After banking record-high profits in the 2010s, Boeing has bled more than $30 billion since 2019 after two fatal crashes of its best-selling 737 MAX jet triggered production quality and safety concerns and worries that it had misled regulators during the plane's certification process. The COVID-19 pandemic further squeezed the company, while the mid-air panel blowout on a nearly new 737 MAX in early 2024 dragged Boeing into another crisis. "We have completed deep dives on all of our challenging fixed-price development programs," Ortberg said on Tuesday in a letter to employees. The company's Defense, Space & Security business lost $5.41 billion in 2024. Ortberg added Boeing has made progress with its supply chain and has returned to an output rate of five 787 jets per month at the end of 2024, despite delays in areas like seats. Boeing's commercial planes division, now focused on getting three of its models certified, has a good handle on fixing a thrust link issue uncovered on its 777X widebody, which resumed flight tests earlier this month, he added. Ortberg was guarded in his message about the status of solving problems with anti-icing systems on the 737-7 and -10 models. The company is "still working through the testing phase focusing on finalization of the anti-icing design solution," he said. The company continues to invest in "core businesses while streamlining our portfolio in areas that are not core to our future," he said.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 28, 2025

Headline: Is linking your credit card with UPI a risky habit? Know hereUPI payments reached Rs 2.34 lakh crore in October 2024, recording a rise of 37% from last year, as per the RBI's latest report.
Content: UPI payments are surging more than card payments. UPI payments reached Rs 2.34 lakh crore in October 2024, recording a rise of 37% from last year, according to the latest RBI data. So is it a wise move to link his credit card to UPI payments? Let us try to understand the same as we discuss both the advantages and the disadvantages of linking credit cards with UPI. A credit card enables users to make use of a credit line whenever one is short on cash. While a UPI payment debits your savings account instantly, a credit card offers more flexibility while making purchases.  When one makes payment for each transaction through a savings account, the bank records every transaction. On the other hand, if one pays via UPI linked credit card, the bank records only the payment to the credit card, thus decluttering your bank statement to a large extent. Generally, people use credit cards for making big payments and depend on bank accounts for day-to-day transactions. But by linking UPI to your credit card one can make all the payments using one method. On the contrary, people tend to overspend when using credit cards, as the amount is not instantly debited from the saving account. Relying only on a UPI-linked credit card may backfire when any technical glitch or error occurs. Lastly, not every bank offers UPI activation through credit cards. One may miss out any scheme, reward or benefits offered by other credit cards when solely being dependent on a particular credit card because of its UPI feature. In other words, it is advisable to use UPI-linked credit cards responsibly and without overspending.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Will 80C and standard deduction be available under new tax regime?Under the old tax regime, a standard deduction of Rs 50,000 is available for the salaried class, while under the new tax regime, the same has been increased to Rs 75,000.
Content: Many taxpayers are wondering if the government is going to scrap the old tax regime and whether popular tax deductions and tax benefits like HRA, Section 80C, and standard deduction, etc. will find their place in the new tax regime. The new tax regime was introduced in Budget 2020 offering lower taxes and to simplify the tax structure. However, this regime removes some of the popular deductions which are available in the old tax regime. While under the old tax regime a standard deduction of Rs 50,000 is available for the salaried class, under the new tax regime, the same has been increased to Rs 75,000. However, Santhosh Sivaraj, Partner, Global Employer Services, Tax & Regulatory Services, BDO India urged the government to raise this deduction amount in lieu of rising costs and inflationary pressures. "Owing to inflation and an increase in prices for both transport and medical since FY 2018-19 when standard deduction was reintroduced, the Hon’ble FM should look at bringing in parity for those opting for either the old or the new tax regime and increase the standard deduction to a minimum of Rs 1.20 lah a year. This would seem practical as any salaried taxpayer would be incurring Rs 10,000 a month / Rs 1.20 lakh a year collectively towards transport and medical expenses,” he said. Another popular deduction under the old tax regime is Section 80C, which covers contributions to LIC and PPF. This section offers a maximum deduction of Rs 1.5 lakh.  Deepashree Shetty, Partner, Global Employer Services, Tax & Regulatory Services, BDO India has called for the inclusion of Sector 80C under the new tax regime. “Allow deductions up to Rs 2 lakh for life insurance premiums, employees’ Provident Fund contribution, etc.,” she said. Another popular request from taxpayers is the inclusion of the House Rent Allowance (HRA) into the new tax regime. This would ease the financial burden on the taxpayers to a great extent. Deepashree Shetty pointed out that the HRA exemption will provide much-needed relief to taxpayers, especially those residing in cities with high rental costs.  “The government must extend the scope of House Rent Allowance (HRA) to include high-rental cities of Bengaluru, Gurugram, Hyderabad, and Pune under ‘metro cities’ to provide relief to salaried taxpayers in these areas,” she said, adding to raise the deduction limit for housing loan interest repayment from the existing Rs 2 lakh to Rs 3 lakh. Will the government include these popular deductions and tax benefits under the new tax regime for the convenience of the taxpayers? One will get to know on February 1.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 28, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Wall Street tech stocks recover a day after DeepSeek selloff hit NvidiaNvidia, which lost 17% in Monday's session, the biggest one-day loss in market history, rose 8.9% on Tuesday as investors looked for buying opportunities.
Content: Technology stocks on Wall Street saw some recovery on Tuesday, after the losses suffered the previous day when Nvidia saw its market value fall by $593 billion. The massive selloff in Nvidia's stock was triggered by the rise of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek, which introduced a low-cost AI assistant that investors feared could disrupt the dominance of US companies in the artificial intelligence sector. Nvidia, which lost 17% in Monday’s session, the biggest one-day loss in market history, rose 8.9% on Tuesday as investors looked for buying opportunities. Other tech stocks, including semiconductor, power, and infrastructure companies linked to AI, also regained ground after collectively losing over $1 trillion in market value a day earlier.US TECH STOCKS GAIN GROUND  Much of Tuesday’s gains in the tech sector were driven by major companies like Apple and Microsoft. Apple rose 3.7%, making it the second-biggest boost for the Nasdaq after Nvidia. Microsoft gained 2.9%, recovering from losses earlier in the week. Meta Platforms, the parent company of Facebook, added 2.2%, marking its seventh straight day of gains despite the AI-driven market turmoil. The overall technology sector rose 3.6% on Tuesday after falling 5.6% the day before. The Philadelphia semiconductor index, which tracks major chip companies, gained 1.1% after suffering a 9.2% drop on Monday, the steepest one-day percentage fall since March 2020. Investors began to question whether DeepSeek’s AI model could truly live up to its claims of lower costs and efficiency. “Yesterday was an initial reaction. Today investors are asking if anybody did any sort of homework and made sure DeepSeek is exactly what they say it is. Can we have more proof that they really built it for so much less?” said JJ Kinahan, president of brokerage firm Tastytrade, in an interview with Reuters. Nvidia closed Tuesday at $128.99 per share, still lower than its Friday close of $142.62. Other major tech stocks also showed signs of recovery. Oracle, which had dropped 13.8% on Monday, ended the session up 3.6%. Marvell Technology, which had fallen 19%, rose 3.5%, while chipmaker Broadcom recovered 2.6% after Monday’s 17.4% drop.EXPERTS BULLISH ON AI STOCKS Despite Monday’s selloff, some investors see the rise of DeepSeek as a positive sign for the AI industry. Steven Cohen, founder of Point72 Asset Management, said at a conference in Miami on Tuesday that DeepSeek’s breakthrough is “actually bullish because it advances the move to artificial intelligence," as reported by Reuters.  Traders also showed renewed interest in Nvidia. While the stock suffered a historic drop, options traders quickly returned, betting on a recovery. Cody Acree, a semiconductor industry analyst at Benchmark Company, told Reuters that the emergence of cheaper AI models would not reduce the need for high-performance chips. While companies like DeepSeek may develop cost-effective AI software, they still require powerful hardware to train and operate their models. OpenAI CEO Sam Altman called DeepSeek’s model “impressive” but added that competition is a good thing. “We will obviously deliver much better models, and also it's legit invigorating to have a new competitor!” Altman said in a social media post. US President Donald Trump commented on DeepSeek, calling it “a wake-up call for our industries.”Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Former Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger bets on this AI stock amid DeepSeek's riseThe rise of Chinese artificial intelligence (AI) startup DeepSeek caused a huge reaction in the stock market, leading to a $600 billion drop in Nvidia's market value.
Content: The AI revolution is taking place at an astronomical pace, and investors are scrambling to place their bets on the right stocks.  The Chinese artificial intelligence (AI) startup DeepSeek has made headlines and grabbed eyeballs with its latest AI model, which is said to be 20 to 50 times cheaper to train and operate than OpenAI’s models, as per media reports. The announcement caused a huge reaction in the stock market, leading to a $600 billion drop in Nvidia’s market value. Investors feared that cheaper AI models would reduce the demand for Nvidia’s high-performance processors. However, Pat Gelsinger, the former CEO of Intel and an industry veteran, believes that this reaction is misplaced. In a LinkedIn post, Gelsinger shared his view that DeepSeek’s breakthrough is actually a positive development for the AI industry. He also said that he is buying Nvidia and other AI stocks, taking advantage of the lower prices caused by the market’s reaction. "The market reaction is wrong, lowering the cost of AI will expand the market. Today I’m an nVidia and AI stock buyer and happy to benefit from lower prices," he said in an LinkedIn post.  Gelsinger used DeepSeek’s success as an opportunity to reflect on broader trends in computing. He outlined three key takeaways, based on his decades of experience in the technology sector. Gelsinger dismissed concerns that DeepSeek’s cheaper AI models would reduce the demand for computing power. Instead, he compared the situation to the rise of personal computers and mobile devices. In both cases, making technology more affordable has led to wider adoption and massive industry growth. According to Gelsinger, more affordable AI will lead to deeper integration into various applications, increasing the overall demand for computing power rather than shrinking it. DeepSeek’s success comes despite challenges such as export restrictions and limited access to cutting-edge hardware. Gelsinger pointed out that some of the most crucial breakthroughs in computing have emerged under similar constraints. He said that necessity often drives innovation, and DeepSeek’s ability to create a competitive AI model under difficult conditions is proof of this. Gelsinger also addressed the shift towards proprietary AI models, warning that closed ecosystems could slow down progress and limit transparency. He praised DeepSeek for taking an open-source approach, encouraging collaboration and scrutiny from the wider AI community. “Open wins every time it is given a proper shot,” he wrote. “AI is much too important for our future to allow a closed ecosystem to ever emerge as the one and only in this space.” “The real money in AI is providing the chips for the data centres,” said Daniel Morgan, senior portfolio manager at Synovus Trust Company, in an interview with Reuters. “Overall, I view the AI tech selloff today as an opportunity to add high-quality tech shares on weakness.” (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: ITC Hotels share price: Stock lists at 30% discount on NSE ITC Hotels shares opened at Rs 188 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), listing at a discount of 31% to the discovered price.
Content: Shares of ITC Hotels listed at a discount of 30% on Thursday, opening at Rs 180 on the national stock exchange (NSE), to the discovered price of Rs 260 per share.  ITC Hotels shares opened at Rs 188 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), to the discovered price of Rs 270 per share.  "Trading Members of the Exchange are hereby informed that effective from Janaury 29, 2025, the equity shares of ITC Hotels Ltd (Scrip Code: 544325) are listed and admitted to dealings on the Exchange in the list of ''T'' Group Securities," said ITC Hotels in a stock exchange filing.  After making its stock market debut, ITC Hotels saw its shares drop further, hitting the 5% lower circuit on the BSE. The stock was trading at Rs 178.60 at the time the article was being written.  The company, which was recently spun off from ITC Ltd—a conglomerate spanning cigarettes, FMCG, and other sectors—was officially listed on January 29.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 29, 2025

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open in green as IT and auto stocks rise; Bajaj Auto gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 221 points to 76,122.41, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 66.40 points to 23,023.65 as of 9:35 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened higher, extending their gains from the last trading session, helped by a rise in IT and auto sector stocks in early trade.  The S&P BSE Sensex added 221 points to 76,122.41, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 66.40 points to 23,023.65 as of 9:35 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that the recovery in the market witnessed yesterday can continue with resilience in fairly priced financials. "However, a sharp rally is unlikely since FIIs will sell at higher levels. The market will be looking forward to positive cues in the Budget. The Fed decision today is unlikely to influence the market since no change in policy is expected from this meeting," he added.  In today's early trade, auto and information technology stocks led the gainers while consumer goods faced some selling pressure. Bajaj Auto emerged as the top performer, surging 3.39%, while Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) showed strong momentum with a 2.58% rise. Trent Limited continued its upward trajectory, gaining 2.29%. Two-wheeler manufacturer Hero MotoCorp advanced by 1.89%, and Tata Steel rounded off the gainers with a 1.76% increase. On the losing side, Tata Consumer Products led the declines, dropping 1.30%, followed by Hindustan Unilever which slipped 0.62%. Britannia Industries dipped by 0.55%, while Axis Bank fell 0.51%. ITC shares saw a modest decline of 0.47%. "YTD Nifty is down 3.3% while Nifty Midcap is down 9.1% and Nifty Small cap is down 14.71%. The takeaway from this important data is that valuations are reverting to mean. This trend will make the market healthy and is likely to continue. Correction in the overvalued broader market is desirable," said Vijayakumar.  Almost all sectoral indices were trading in positive territory, with only one sector in the red. Bucking the trend, Nifty FMCG was the sole loser, declining 1.01% amid profit booking in consumer goods stocks. The Nifty Midsmall IT & Telecom sector led the gainers, jumping 2.53%, while Nifty Media showed strong momentum with a 2.07% increase. The technology sector had a good day as Nifty IT climbed 1.97%. Auto stocks maintained their strength with Nifty Auto rising 1.33%, matching the gains in Nifty Metal which also added 1.33%. The Nifty Consumer Durables index showed decene performance, gaining 1.51%, while Nifty Midsmall Financial Services advanced by 1.47%. The Nifty Financial Services Ex-Bank index rose 1.41%, and Nifty Realty moved up by 1.15%.  Banking indices showed modest gains with Nifty PSU Bank rising 0.80% and Nifty Bank adding 0.13%. Healthcare-related indices performed well, with Nifty Midsmall Healthcare up 0.89% and Nifty Healthcare Index gaining 0.66%. The oil and gas sector also participated in the rally with Nifty Oil & Gas rising 0.72%.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Why is the stock market rising today? 3 things to knowShare Market Today: The Sensex and Nifty50 gained in early trade and experts believe the conditions are favourable for more gains. However, it will depend on key developments, like the US Fed's policy decision and the Union Budget 2025.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices gained in early trade on Wednesday, extending the positive run for the second consecutive day. The S&P BSE Sensex was up 416.44 points to 76,317.85 at 10:27 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 128.10 points to trade at 22,957.25. All the other broader market indices also witnessed strong gains in early trade despite a decent increase in volatility. IT stocks gained during the session, providing a big boost to the benchmark indices. Banking, financial services, pharma and auto stocks also gained during the session. Here are three things to know about today’s stock market rally:US FED DECISION HOPES, RECOVERY IN US TECH STOCKS The US Federal Reserve’s policy stance remains an important factor for global markets, including India. While no rate cuts are expected, the recent pause in the dollar rally and US bond yields has provided some relief. According to experts, this is sentimentally positive for domestic equities, especially after foreign investors pulled out Rs 79,016 crore so far this month. Another positive factor is a recovery in US tech stocks after yesterday's bloodbath. This has provided a boost to domestic IT stocks. POSSIBILITY OF CONSUMPTION BOOST IN BUDGET 2025 Investors are keeping a close watch on the upcoming Union Budget as sources have indicated that the government will provide tax relief and growth-focused measures to boost consumption. While expectations remain tempered, any positive announcements could drive further market momentum. Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd, said, “The focus is now on the Federal Reserve's rate decision and the upcoming Union Budget 2025, where measures to boost consumption and growth are expected.”DALAL STREET REMAIN CAUTIOUS Despite the uptrend in frontline indices, broader market sentiment remains mixed. The Nifty Midcap and Smallcap indices have dropped 9.1% and 14.7% in January, respectively, signaling valuation corrections. Analysts see this as a healthy trend, with private financials offering a favorable risk-reward balance.  Dr. VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services, said, “YTD Nifty is down 3.3% while Nifty Midcap is down 9.1% and Nifty Small cap is down 14.71%. The takeaway from this important data is that valuations are reverting to mean.” “This trend will make the market healthy and is likely to continue. Correction in the overvalued broader market is desirable,” he added. He explained that the recovery in the market witnessed yesterday “can continue with resilience in fairly priced financials”.  “However, a sharp rally is unlikely since FIIs will sell at higher levels. The market will be looking forward to positive cues in the Budget. The Fed decision today is unlikely to influence the market since no change in policy is expected from this meeting,” he said.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Will DeepSeek's low-cost AI models benefit Indian IT firms like TCS, Infosys? Analysts at Motilal Oswal Financial Services suggested that a shift from high-cost AI infrastructure to more affordable alternatives could open new opportunities for Indian IT services firms.
Content: Chinese startup DeepSeek seems to have paved the path for the next artificial intelligence (AI) revolution by developing cost-efficient models. This could not only push  US tech giants to rethink their AI capital expenditure plans but also benefit Indian information technology (IT) companies.  Analysts at Motilal Oswal Financial Services (MOFSL) suggested that a shift from high-cost AI infrastructure to more affordable alternatives could open new opportunities for Indian IT services firms. MOFSL stated that services spending usually follows the investment cycles of big tech companies, much like it did during the cloud adoption phase. While Indian IT firms often play a limited role during heavy capex cycles, they become critical once the focus shifts to cost optimisation, explained the brokerage firm. "Indian IT can play a significant role in AI evolution by driving platform engineering and outsourced engineering capabilities, helping enterprises design, build, and scale AI-driven solutions. This could position Indian IT as a key player in the low-cost GenAI wave," MOFSL said.INDIAN IT FIRMS AND AI Major Indian IT companies such as Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Infosys, HCL Tech, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra are already strengthening their AI capabilities. TCS in its Q3 results commentary highlighted how "Agentic AI" enables it to integrate AI into transactions and workflows, improving efficiency and reducing costs. “Investments in AI, GenAI, and cloud services are driving cost optimisation while enabling business transformation," it said. Meanwhile, Infosys’ management said it was developing over 100 Generative AI agents for automation and productivity enhancements. HCL Tech noted that the cost of using large language models (LLMs) has dropped by over 85% since early 2023, making AI adoption more viable. Wipro described itself as an early adopter of Agentic AI, using it for customer service and supply chain optimisation. Meanwhile, Tech Mahindra is focusing on building smaller, enterprise-specific AI models.DEEPSEEK’S R1 DISRUPTS GLOBAL AI DeepSeek’s newly released AI model, R1, has outperformed many existing models in areas like mathematics and coding, and that too, at a fraction of the cost. If DeepSeek’s claims are accurate, AI infrastructure providers like chipmakers and cloud hyperscalers may face challenges, while IT services firms could see faster enterprise AI adoption, according to analysts.  Another brokerage firm, JM Financial, also believes reasoning models and smaller, distilled AI models could be game-changers for enterprise AI applications, which will align with IT firms' growing focus on cost-effective AI solutions. However, MOFSL also stressed the fact that while it’s too early to gauge the direct impact on IT stocks, the long-term outlook for the sector remains positive as AI demand grows.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: Sensex rises over 500 points: What's behind today's bull run on Dalal StreetShare Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex was trading 508.25 points higher at 76,409.66 at 1:10 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 170.15 points to trade at 23,127.40.

Headline: Budget 2025: Will taxpayers get relief? Income tax changes to watch out forThe current income-tax law is complex for average taxpayers due to its technical jargon and numerous provisos, circulars, and notifications.
Content: In the Union Budget 2024, the Finance Minister of India called for a comprehensive review of the Income Tax Act, 1961 (‘Act’). The purpose as cited in her speech was to make the Act concise, lucid, easy to read and understand. The endeavour was to reduce disputes and litigation, thereby providing tax certainty to the taxpayers.  To spearhead this initiative, the Central Board of Direct Taxes (‘CBDT’) established an internal committee. Recognizing the importance of public participation, the committee issued a press release on October 7, 2024, inviting valuable insights and suggestions from the public. The suggestions were invited for simplification of language, litigation reduction, compliance reduction and redundant/obsolete provisions. Since the issuance of this press release, there has been guarded silence from the Government regarding the progress of this crucial review. As Union Budget 2025 looms on the horizon, speculation is rife regarding the potential introduction of a new income tax law. This article discusses some of the key amendments that may be introduced in the upcoming budget to achieve the Finance Minister's vision of a more streamlined and taxpayer-friendly tax regime.Simplifying language of provisions The current income-tax law is complex for average taxpayers due to its technical jargon and numerous provisos, circulars, and notifications. This necessitates reliance on tax lawyers and consultants. Simplifying the language, especially for provisions concerning individual taxpayers like salary, house property, and other income is crucial. This can be achieved by making the provisions more comprehensible and by including illustrations to aid interpretation. Furthermore, rearranging and regrouping the sections in a manner to bring all connected provisions together may make it easier for taxpayers to understand their tax obligations and related compliance.Removal of old and redundant sections  Presently, there are 298 sections in the existing income-tax law. The same is further supplemented by various circulars and notifications. Repeal of various redundant provisions itself will considerably reduce the length of the law.  For instance, provisions such as section 10A, section 10B, section 10BA and section 10C provided for certain profit-linked deduction to specified businesses in the past. As of now, not only the sunset date for commencement of such specified businesses has expired but also the maximum period for which deductions could have been claimed under these sections stands expired. Accordingly, in today’s context, the provisions do not have any relevance and may end up creating unnecessary confusion in the minds of the taxpayers. Accordingly, the same can be omitted from the Act.Publication of income-tax compendium of clarifications One of the key reasons for the piling up of a plethora of cases before various forums is that the legal position which the taxman intends to take with respect to a particular legal provision is not informed to the taxpayers at the very inception. While steps have been taken by CBDT in the recent years to keep the taxpayers pre-informed about Taxman’s position by issuing guidelines such as for section 194O, 194R and 194Q, however, still there lies a huge gap.  In this relation, one of the steps which can be taken by Government is to mandate publication of a compendium of clarifications by the CBDT. The compendium can provide the tax department’s understanding of each provision and also its position on ambiguous issues. All the circulars which have already been issued should also get consolidated to form part of such compendium. Also, the clarifications issued and positions stated in the compendium must be binding on the tax department. The compendium shall act as a one-point reference for the taxpayers and provide them certainty regarding tax implications on their proposed businesses or transactions.Schemes to pay tax on gross basis instead of net basis A significant chunk of tax disputes which are pending before multiple forms in India are on account of allowability of deductions while computing income especially under the head ‘profits and gains from business and profession’. Also, considerable amendments are made each year to provisions which further adds to the complexity. In order to provide certainty to taxpayers and also reduce prolonged litigation, taxation on presumptive income or gross basis of taxation should be promoted. For instance, in the existing law, certain payments to non-residents such as royalty/ fee for technical services are taxable on a gross basis. Similar provisions can be introduced for taxation of certain categories of income earned by residents as well.  Also, in the existing law, there are provisions such as section 44AD and section 44ADA which provide for taxation of presumptive income. However, only limited taxpayers are able to obtain the benefit of said schemes considering the narrow eligibility criteria. The upcoming budget can consider expanding the coverage of such schemes by extending the same to more businesses and by increasing the monetary limits.  Inclusion of new transactions under the ambit of Transfer Pricing Safe Harbour Rules under Rule 10TD of the IT Rules Another welcome move would be rationalisation of safe harbour rules provided for transfer pricing purposes. In the existing rules, safe harbour criteria are provided only for 11 transactions. Amendments should be proposed to expand the list and also to make the safe harbour criteria more reasonable considering the existing business trends. Today, even though the taxpayers may wish to avail the benefit of safe harbour rules, they are discouraged due to significant margin requirement in the rules in comparison to the industry benchmarks. The aforementioned measures will enable the Government to move a step forward for achieving its overall objective of simplification of income tax law. It shall also enable the taxpayers achieve more certainty and reduce prolonged litigation. With Budget 2025 around the corner, the expectations are running high. Let us hope the revamped income tax law is worth all the wait. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 29, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Old tax regime vs new tax regime; which is better?Union Budget 2025: The new tax regime was first introduced in Union Budget 2020-21 by inserting a new section, 115BAC, in the Income Tax Act for individuals and Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs).
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to present the Union Budget 2025 on February 1. One of the key areas of focus is expected to be the new tax regime, which the government has been promoting in recent years. "The new tax regime was first introduced in Union Budget 2020-21 by inserting a new section, 115BAC, in the Income Tax Act for individuals and Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs). The Finance Minister, in her budget speech while introducing the new regime, said that this scheme shall bring relief in personal tax and simplify taxation. The new regime provides an option to avail concessional slab limits and tax rates if the taxpayer does not claim specified exemptions and deductions," said Kinjal Bhuta, Secretary, Bombay Chartered Accountants' Society (BCAS).WHY IS THE GOVERNMENT PRIORITISING NEW TAX REGIME? "The government has been clear about encouraging taxpayers to opt for the new regime. The tax statute includes several exemptions, deductions, and allowances, which make income tax return filing and processing complex. The main reason for introducing the new tax regime was to simplify the personal taxation framework with fewer deductions and simple tax rates," said Bhuta. He added that the new tax regime also helps the Income Tax Department in processing returns more efficiently, as it reduces subjectivity due to multiple deductions. Since its introduction, the government has made continuous efforts to make the new regime more attractive. "Improved rebates, modified tax structures and slab rates, reduced surcharges, and the extension of standard deductions are some of the changes made in the last couple of years to encourage taxpayers to transition from the old to the new tax regime," he said.DOES OLD TAX REGIME STILL HAVE AN ADVANTAGE? "The rates under the new tax regime are lucrative, but the non-availability of certain deductions, like interest on loans for acquisition or construction of self-occupied property, has led to its lower popularity," said Dipesh Jain, Partner at Economic Laws Practice. He explained that under the old tax regime, taxpayers had the benefit of setting off income earned under any other head with ‘loss from house property’ due to interest paid on home loans, up to a maximum of Rs 2,00,000. This benefit is not available under the new tax regime, increasing the overall tax burden. "The old tax regime may be more attractive than the new regime if the taxpayer is eligible and can claim higher tax benefits, deductions, and exemptions available under it. However, it is important to note that while the old tax regime offers flexibility for deductions, it involves significant time and cost for effective tax planning, filing, and compliance," said SR Patnaik, Partner (Head-Taxation), Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas. He added that with the government's focus shifting towards the new tax regime, taxpayers should consider transitioning to align with future policy changes.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Bajaj Auto share price rises 5% after Q3 results: Buy, hold or sell?Bajaj Auto stock price: The two-wheeler company's stock rose over 5% to hit a day's high of Rs 8,803.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At around 12:27 pm, shares of the company were trading 3.70% higher at Rs 8,702.90.
Content: Shares of Bajaj Auto shares rose sharply in early trade on Wednesday as investors reacted positively to the company’s Q3FY25 results. The two-wheeler company’s stock rose over 5% to hit a day’s high of Rs 8,803.70 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At around 12:27 pm, shares of the company were trading 3.70% higher at Rs 8,702.90.   Bajaj Auto posted a 3% year-on-year (YoY) increase in standalone net profit for the December quarter. Net profit stood at Rs 2,109 crore, while revenue from operations grew 6% YoY to Rs 12,807 crore. On a sequential basis, profit after tax (PAT) rose 5% from Rs 2,005 crore in the September quarter, though revenue fell 2% quarter-on-quarter. It may be noted that the YoY revenue growth was supported by strong exports and gains from the domestic green energy segment. Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation, and amortization (EBITDA) rose 6% YoY to Rs 2,581 crore, with operating margins improving 10 basis points to 20.2%. Overall, Bajaj Auto’s volumes grew 2% YoY to 12.24 lakh units, with exports playing a key role in offsetting domestic market weakness.WHAT DO BROKERAGES SAY? Brokerage firm Nuvama maintained a ‘Buy’ rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 10,700. The brokerage highlighted better-than-expected EBITDA, supported by pricing, scale, PLI incentives, and cost management. Analysts at the brokerage expect export growth of over 20% and domestic growth between 6-8%, with revenue and EBITDA likely to grow at a CAGR of 11% and 12%, respectively, over FY25-27E. On the other hand, Axis Capital retained a ‘Sell’ rating, cutting its target price to Rs 7,550 from Rs 8,000. While exports are improving, the brokerage noted that Bajaj Auto lost over 100 basis points in market share over the first nine months of FY25. Lower volume assumptions led to a 7% cut in its EPS estimates for FY25-27E. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Jan 29, 2025

Headline: Even Bihar beats Punjab, Andhra, Haryana in fiscal health, shows Niti reportPunjab, Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal, Kerala and Haryana are at the bottom of the Niti Aayog's list on fiscal health. Bihar, an earlier Bimaru state, has managed to outpace its richer counterparts in fiscal discipline. Odisha tops the list among states with the best fiscal management, and is followed by Jharkhand and Chhattisgarh, two surprise states.
Content:
In an age of competitive popularism, a report by the Niti Aayog on the fiscal health of 18 states shows Punjab, Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal, Kerala and Haryana at the bottom of the list that is topped by Odisha. The study for the Fiscal Health Index 2025 spans a nine-year period from 2014-15 to 2022-23, when most states are likely to have been governed by more than one political party. The Niti Aayog used data from the Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG) to prepare the Fiscal Health Index of 18 major states. It seeks to make it an annual practice.  Fiscal health refers to financial stability, measured by its ability to manage revenue, expenditure, debt, and deficits sustainably while supporting growth. The Niti Aayog's Fiscal Health Index 2025 ranking has factored in five parameters: quality of expenditure, revenue mobilisation, fiscal prudence, debt index, and debt sustainability. Odisha has emerged as the state with the best fiscal health and is followed by Chhattisgarh, Goa, Jharkhand and Gujarat. Not only have Chhattisgarh and Jharkhand emerged as surprises in the Top 5, even Uttar Pradesh, in seventh spot, has pulled off a good show. UP, like Bihar, which is in the 13th spot among the 18 states, was once among the Bimaru states, whose economies were on sickbeds. Also, Bihar (at 13), like Gujarat (at 5), is a dry state. It has chosen to forego excise collections from alcohol sales, which make up for a huge part of most state's earnings.

 



A heat map of 18 Indian major states and their standing featured in Niti Aayog's Fiscal Health Index 2025. (Image: Niti Aayog)
 The report lauds Odisha, which for the entire part of the study period had seen a government led by Naveen Patnaik's Biju Janata Dal.  Odisha excels in fiscal health with the highest overall index score of 67.8. It tops the Debt Index (99.0) and Debt Sustainability (64.0) rankings with better-than-average scores under Quality of Expenditure and Revenue Mobilisation, says the report. The Niti Aayog has flagged concerns regarding the economic state of the laggards. It says Punjab, Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal and Kerala face "significant fiscal challenges".   Kerala and Punjab are struggling with low quality of expenditure and debt sustainability, while West Bengal faces revenue mobilisation and debt index issues. Here is a table categorising states based on their rank in Niti Aayog's Fiscal Health Index Report 2025

 Poor quality of expenditure means that the states are investing less on capex to build infrastructure while more on refinancing debt and paying wages and pensions.  Andhra Pradesh has a high fiscal deficit, and Haryana has a poor debt profile, the Niti Aayog report says. In the case of Andhra Pradesh, the earlier YSRCP government of YS Jagan Mohan Reddy spent just 10% of its entire budget allocation on capital expenditure, while diverting money towards populist schemes. After bifurcation in 2014, Andhra lost Hyderabad, a major revenue source, to Telugu twin Telangana, which is in 8th spot compared to Andhra's 17th. Several states have gone on borrowing overdrive in recent years to fund their populist measures, prompting even Prime Minister Narendra Modi to warn them, citing the example of Sri Lanka and Pakistan, whose economies went bust. "See how reckless borrowing has left those countries reeling under debt burdens. If we follow the same example and spend recklessly, as some states have done, thinking that the burden is going to be borne by coming generations, then our country is also going to be ruined," Modi said in February 2023.
