Pravakar Sahoo, senior lead researcher of the report, also points out that sound fiscal health at the state level is important for the nation's economic resilience. State governments have been doling out freebies, especially in election years, which have hurt the fiscal health of the states. Several states have a deficit budget, which means their spending is way more than their income. The AAP-led Delhi government even went ahead with a Rs 2,100 cash sop for women despite two Delhi government departments warning against giving even Rs 1,000 a month. The coalition government in Maharashtra, which includes the BJP, returned to power on the steam of its Ladki Bahin Yojna, a direct cash transfer scheme.   "In recent years, fiscal management at the sub-national level has been a policy concern. Therefore, it has become imperative to monitor the fiscal health of states to ensure prudent fiscal management," Sahoo said, explaining the need for such a study.   The analysis covers 18 major states that drive the Indian economy in terms of their contribution to the national GDP, demography, total public expenditure, revenues, and overall fiscal stability, according to the Niti Aayog report.  Keeping tabs on the fiscal health of states is important given that they are responsible for approximately two-thirds of public spending and one-third of the total revenue. The country's economic stability hinges on these states to a great extent.Published By: Sushim MukulPublished On: Jan 29, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Will Mahila Samman Savings Certificate get an extension?Union Budget 2025: Mahila Samman Savings Certificate has played a key role in encouraging savings among women from the lower-income group and promoting women's empowerment.
Content: Mahila Samman Savings Certificate which was introduced as part of the "Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav" in the Union Budget 2023–2024, is a one-time small savings scheme. It is available for a two-year period for a maximum deposit facility of up to Rs 2 lakh.  This government-backed savings scheme carries a 7.5% interest rate and has a partial withdrawal option. It aims to promote financial independence among women. However, the scheme is scheduled to end on March 31, 2025, and it remains uncertain whether it will be extended or not. Though this scheme was launched for a limited period, it played a key role in encouraging savings among women from the lower-income group and promoting women's empowerment. Sneha Jain, Founder & CEO @ Wealth Trust Capital Services told The Economic Times that the government may not continue with the scheme. “It is not likely to get extended as the government has collected good responses & deposits from this scheme last year. There is more shift towards equity investments & mutual funds. So, the response to the scheme wouldn't be as much as seen last year,” she said. On the other hand, Rajani Tandale, Senior Vice President, Mutual Fund at 1 Finance told The Economic Times that an extension of this scheme in the upcoming budget would be a welcome move. “Primarily designed to encourage savings among women in the lower-income group, it serves as an important initiative to build financial security,” she said. “With the scheme set to end on March 31, 2025, an extension in Budget 2025 would be a welcome move to further strengthen women's financial independence. Given the government’s focus on women-centric financial policies, it may consider either extending the scheme or introducing a similar investment alternative to sustain its impact,” Rajani Tandale added.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: What is 'concert economy' that PM Modi mentioned after Coldplay's India showsRock band Coldplay set a new record for the largest stadium concert of the 21st century on January 25-26, drawing over 2 lakh fans in Ahmedabad, surpassing George Strait's Texas record of 1,10,905 attendees.
Content: Record crowds attended rock band Coldplay's concerts in Mumbai and Ahmedabad, giving the audiences a time to remember. But the concerts weren’t just about music lovers swaying to 'Lights will guide you home' or 'Fix You', they were an economic powerhouse in action. Hotels were fully booked, flight prices soared, restaurants overflowed with fans, and even local street vendors saw a windfall. What was once just a night of live music is now a thriving sector, something Prime Minister Narendra Modi recently highlighted as the growing ‘concert economy.’ Live music is no longer just about the experience, but is a full-fledged industry. Much like Taylor Swift’s ‘Swiftonomics,’ concerts in India have shown how they can be economic boosters as well.  "Today, the concert economy sector is also growing in India. A country which has such a huge legacy of music, dance, and storytelling, India is a huge consumer of concerts. There are many possibilities for the concert economy. The trend of live events and concerts has increased in the last 10 years," PM Modi said at the ‘Utkarsh Odisha – Make in Odisha Conclave 2025’ in Bhubaneswar. But what exactly is the 'concert economy' that PM Modi talked about?WHAT IS THE ‘CONCERT ECONOMY’? The 'concert economy' refers to the economic impact of live music events, which generate revenue for multiple industries, including hospitality, transport, food & beverages, merchandise, and event management. The sector has gained attention globally, with studies showing how concerts boost spending across different sectors. For example, the term 'Swiftonomics' was coined to describe the economic effect of Taylor Swift’s record-breaking world tour. The pop star’s concerts provided a major boost to local economies in the US, Europe, Singapore, and the UK. Estimates suggest her tour generated over $4.6 billion in North America alone and added nearly $1 billion to the British economy. The economic impact of concerts extends beyond just ticket sales. It includes increased bookings in hotels, flights, and trains, higher food and drink sales, merchandise purchases, and employment generation in event management and security services. The impact of such concerts is so huge that countries are making exclusive deals.  Taylor Swift’s exclusive deal to perform only in Singapore during her Eras Tour sparked outrage among neighbouring countries. Officials in Thailand, Indonesia, and the Philippines criticised Singapore for securing the concerts with financial incentives, arguing it deprived them of tourism revenue. Thailand’s Prime Minister claimed Singapore paid millions per show to block other Southeast Asian stops, as per media reports, while Filipino lawmakers called the deal unfair. Indonesia’s tourism minister even apologised to fans, saying Singapore had "bought out" the concerts.HOW BIG IS INDIA’S CONCERT ECONOMY? India is rapidly becoming a major market for live music events. A report by EY predicts that the number of large concerts, those with over 5,000 attendees, will reach 300 by 2025, marking a 50% increase from 2018. The revenue from concerts is also expected to reach Rs 1,000 crore, up 25% from current levels. Data from Statista places India at the 7th position globally for revenue from live events, ahead of countries like South Korea, France, and Australia. A Bank of Baroda Research report estimated that between Rs 1,600 crore and Rs 2,000 crore was spent on live events in just three months. The report also mentioned that if the concert sector continues to grow, annual private spending on concerts could reach Rs 6,000-8,000 crore.HOW CONCERTS IMPACT THE ECONOMY Live concerts do not just provide entertainment; they create a ripple effect across various industries: Hospitality: Hotels in concert cities experience near-full occupancy, with increased bookings at premium rates. Food delivery services also see a rise in orders. Transport: Flight bookings to concert locations have jumped as much as 350% for major events. Train bookings have also risen significantly. Employment: Large-scale events create job opportunities in event management, security, and logistics. Coldplay’s concerts are part of a larger trend of global artists choosing India as a key tour destination. International stars like Ed Sheeran, Cigarettes After Sex, and Shawn Mendes are expected to perform in India this year, continuing the trend of major artists performing for Indian audiences and further boosting the 'Concer Economy'.  Indian artists are also capitalising on the growing demand for live events. Punjabi singers Diljit Dosanjh and Karan Aujla have sold out multiple concerts across cities. Diljit’s ‘Dil-Luminati Tour’ saw tickets sell out within seconds, showing the massive demand for live performances. Other international artists have also drawn large crowds in India. Bryan Adams, 65, performed in front of 15,000 fans in Gurugram in December 2024. Dua Lipa and Maroon 5 have also held successful concerts in Mumbai.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty gain 1% as IT stocks lead market recovery; ITC Hotels fall 4%The S&P BSE Sensex surged 631.55 points to end at 76,532.96, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 205.85 points to close at 23,163.10.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices added almost 1%, extending their run for the second consecutive day, fuelled by a rise in information technology (IT) sector stocks.  The S&P BSE Sensex surged 631.55 points to end at 76,532.96, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 205.85 points to close at 23,163.10.  Aditya Gaggar, Director of Progressive Shares, said that after a long duration, Bulls have shown their power right from the word go; the Index seen compounding its gains, which was well-supported by the strong performance of Mid and Smallcap stocks. In today's session, leading the gainers was Shriram Finance with a surge of 3.98%, while Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) climbed by 3.72%. Tata Motors continued its strong run, advancing 3.65%, followed by SBI Life Insurance which gained 3.27%. Trent Limited completed the top gainers list with a solid rise of 3.11%. On the flip side, Indian Hotels Company faced the steepest decline, dropping 3.53%. Maruti Suzuki India fell by 1.41%, while Asian Paints slipped 0.81%. Bharti Airtel shares declined by 0.76%, and Britannia Industries dipped 0.60%. Ajit Mishra - SVP, Research, Religare Broking Ltd, said, "Markets managed to inch higher despite volatility, gaining nearly 1% amid mixed cues. Nifty saw sharp fluctuations in early trade but gradually strengthened, closing near the day’s high at 23,163.10. Most key sectors contributed to the recovery, with realty, IT, and energy leading the gains. However, the highlight of the session was the strong rebound in broader indices, which surged between 2.3% and 3.4%." "In this current market condition, Nifty could gather support levels between 23,000 and 22,860 and meet resistance levels between 23,260 and 23,380 in the next session. While market participants can consider buying on dips at key support levels, I would recommend maintaining a neutral stance in the current situation," said VLA Ambala, Co-Founder of Stock Market Today. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Does it make sense to have a unified tax slab?Experts urge government to take the best of both the old and new tax regimes and introduce a unified tax regime that would benefit the taxpayers.
Content: With rising expectations from Budget 2025 on tax reforms and policies, one of the most debated topics is whether there should be a unified tax regime across the country. Experts are hoping for the merging of both the old and new tax regimes to simplify the tax structure and avoid confusion. As of now, taxpayers need to choose between the old tax regime and the new tax regime, each having its own benefits and challenges. The old tax regime includes a host of exclusions and deductions, including HRA, Section 80C, 80E,80CCC, 80CCD, 80D and Leave Travel Allowance, etc. However, under the new tax regime, which was introduced in Budget 2020, the tax rates were reduced significantly. But, those who choose the new system cannot claim various exemptions and deductions, including HRA, LTA, 80C, 80D, etc. Hence, experts believe that taking the best of both the tax regimes and introducing a unified tax regime would benefit the taxpayers. Deepashree Shetty, Partner, Global Employer Services, Tax & Regulatory Services, BDO India, urged the government for a unified tax structure, which would bring much-needed clarity and enhanced tax benefits. "The introduction of two tax regimes - the old tax regime and the new tax regime - was intended to offer taxpayers flexibility, allowing them to choose the system that best suits their investments, savings habits, and preferences. However, the reality is far more complex. Many taxpayers find themselves confused between the two regimes, often reassessing their choice not only during the year but also while filing their tax returns,” she said. “In light of these complexities, the upcoming Budget should focus on simplifying the tax structure for individual taxpayers by consolidating the current dual regimes into a single, cohesive tax framework,” she added. Kulraj Ashpnani, Partner, Dhruva advisors noted that a unified tax structure would reduce compliance costs. "The Budget 2025 presents an opportunity to create a tax system that is simpler, more efficient, and conducive to business growth. By addressing these challenges, India can continue on its path toward a “Good and Simple Tax” framework,” he added.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 29, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty open flat as market awaits cues from Budget, US Fed's next moveThe S&P BSE Sensex was up by 33.36 points to 76,566.32, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 34.50 points to 23,197.60 as of 9:30 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened flat on Thursday with IT and auto stocks declining in early trade, reacting to the statement made by US Fed Chair Jerome Powell.  The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 33.36 points to 76,566.32, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 34.50 points to 23,197.60 as of 9:30 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that the recovery in the market is healthy since it is being led by fairly valued largecaps. "The rally can sustain if the Budget comes up with some strong growth stimulating measures that can improve the market sentiments too. However, a sustained rally can happen only if the FII selling stops and we get some leading indicators suggesting growth and earnings recovery," he added.  Globally, the stock markets remain strong mainly due to the resilient US economy and the down trending interest rate cycle in the US. The Fed’s decision to pause yesterday was on expected lines. The Fed chief Powell’s statement yesterday that “the central bank will need to see real progress on inflation or easing of labour conditions before making further adjustments” is a clear message that further cuts will be data-dependent.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: Dr Agarwals Healthcare IPO: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPDr Agarwals Healthcare IPO aims to raise Rs 3,027.26 crore through a combination of fresh issue of 75 lakh shares and an offer for sale of 6.78 crore shares.
Content: The initial public offering of Dr Agarwals Healthcare has seen a muted response from investors as it enters its second day of bidding process.  Dr Agarwals Healthcare IPO aims to raise Rs 3,027.26 crore through a combination of fresh issue of 75 lakh shares and an offer for sale of 6.78 crore shares. Dr Agarwals Healthcare IPO subscribed 0.07 times. The public issue subscribed 0.12 times in the retail category, 0 times in QIB, and 0.06 times in the NII category by January 29.  Dr Agarwals Healthcare has set the price band for its IPO between Rs 382 and Rs 402 per share. Retail investors need to apply for at least one lot, which consists of 35 shares, requiring a minimum investment of Rs 14,070. For small non-institutional investors (sNII), the minimum application size is 15 lots (525 shares), translating to an investment of Rs 2,11,050. Meanwhile, large non-institutional investors (bNII) must apply for at least 72 lots (2,520 shares), amounting to Rs 10,13,040.SHOULD YOU SUBSCRIBE?  "We believe its organic growth strategy and focus on expanding the primary facility network position it well to capture this growing demand. Hence, looking at all attributes we recommend our investors to “SUBSCRIBE” the Dr. Agarwal’s Health Care Ltd IPO for long term perspective only," said Rajan Shinde, Research Analyst, Mehta Equities Ltd.  "At the upper price band of Rs.402,DAHL is available at a P/E of 133.6x (FY24), which appears expensive compared to peers. However, considering the company's plans to expand its presence across India by establishing new facilities, strengthening its brand image, and its consistent revenue growth over the years, we recommend ‘subscribe’ on a long-term basis," said an IPO report from Geojit.  The initial public offering (IPO) of Dr Agarwal’s Healthcare opened for subscription on January 29, 2025, and will remain open until January 31, 2025.LATEST GMP  The grey market premium (GMP) for Dr. Agarwal's IPO has seen a decline in the official market. The latest GMP was Rs 5 as of January 30, 2025, at 8:32 AM. Given the price band of Rs 402, the estimated listing price is around Rs 407, factoring in the latest GMP. This suggests a potential gain of approximately 1.24% per share. The allotment of shares is expected to be finalised on Monday, February 3, 2025. The company's shares are set to be listed on the BSE and NSE, with the tentative listing date scheduled for Wednesday, February 5, 2025. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: Shares of Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports to be in focus today. Here's whyAdani Enterprises reported a rise in profit in Q3 FY24. The company posted a 2.3 times year-on-year (YoY) jump in consolidated net profit.
Content: Shares of Adani Enterprises and Adani Ports will be in focus today as both companies are set to announce their third-quarter (Q3) financial results for the financial year 2024-25. Shares of Adani Enterprises closed at Rs 2,318.75, gaining 1.39% in the previous trading session. The company had a market capitalisation of Rs 2,67,625.66 crore. However, despite the recent gain, the stock has seen a decline over a longer period. It has dropped 10.44% in the past month and is down 24.89% over the past year. In a filing to the stock exchanges, Adani Enterprises said, "Pursuant to Regulation 29 and other applicable provisions of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, we would like to inform you that the Meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company will be held on Thursday, 30th January, 2025, inter-alia, to consider and approve the Unaudited Financial Results of the Company for the quarter ended 31st December, 2024." The company also informed investors that as per insider trading regulations, the trading window closure period will remain in place until 48 hours after the financial results are made public. Dr Agarwals Healthcare IPO: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMP Adani Enterprises has scheduled a post-results conference call on 30th January 2025 to discuss the financial performance of the company with investors. In the same quarter last year, Adani Enterprises reported a rise in profit. The company posted a 2.3 times year-on-year (YoY) jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 1,888 crore, compared to Rs 820 crore in Q3 FY24.ADANI PORTS Q3 Shares of Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) closed at Rs 1,098.00, up 1.60% in the previous session. The stock is expected to bein the spotlight today as the company announces its Q3 FY25 results. Adani Ports is expected to report strong earnings growth, driven by steady cargo volumes and expansion through acquisitions. According to a Bloomberg poll of analysts, the company is projected to post a net profit of Rs 2,589.4 crore, a 17.3% increase YoY and a revenue of Rs 7,496.6 crore, 10.8% YoY growth. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: Axis Bank launches Devanagari PIN for safer banking. Here's how it worksAxis Bank has unveiled the Devanagari PIN, blending technology and tradition to create a banking PIN that's as personal as your favourite memory, but much harder for cyber criminals to crack.
Content: Axis Bank has come up with a unique solution to increasing digital security. In a first of its kind move, they’ve unveiled the Devanagari PIN, blending technology and tradition to create a banking PIN that’s as personal as your favourite memory, but much harder for cyber criminals to crack. "Your banking PIN can be as memorable as your favourite book, movie, or dish and yet almost impossible for scammers to guess because with Devanagari PIN you can create a secure and unique PIN! The possibilities are endless when it comes to creating your PIN! Devanagari PIN lets you turn any word into a secure and personalised banking PIN. Head to http://devanagaripin.com, type any word and create a strong banking PIN," Axis Bank said on X. Instead of predictable numbers, this innovation hides digits within the Devanagari script, allowing users to turn familiar words into ultra-secure PINs. Whether it’s your favourite mantra, a childhood nickname, or even a beloved dish, your PIN can now be personal, memorable, and almost impossible to guess.STEPS TO GET YOUR DEVANAGARI PIN  Visit www.devanagaripin.com Enter a word of choice in Devanagari Generate a secure PIN for banking transactions One of the most common ways fraudsters gain access to accounts is by guessing weak PINs or using phishing techniques to trick users into revealing their banking details. This is why experts suggest using strong passwords and PINs that are not easily predictable.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: Explained: Why Tata Motors share price fell 9% today Tata Motors stock price: The stock hit the day's low of Rs 684.25. Jefferies downgraded Tata Motors from 'buy' to 'underperform'. The firm also reduced its price target to Rs 660 from Rs 930.
Content: Tata Motors share price tanked over 9% in early trade on Thursday, plunging to its 52-week low of Rs 684.25.  Tata Motors share price opened at Rs 715 after having closed at Rs 752.45 in the previous session. The shares were trading at Rs 703.90, down 6.45% at the time the article was being written. It had a market cap of Rs 2,59,132.79 crore.  The fall in share prices came after the company reported its third-quarter (Q3 FY25) financial results, which missed market expectations on Wednesday. The weaker-than-expected earnings led to a correction in the stock, with several brokerage firms downgrading their ratings and cutting price targets. The company’s profit fell 22% year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 5,451 crore for the October-December quarter. However, revenue from operations rose 3% YoY to Rs 1.13 lakh crore. The company's Earnings Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation, and Amortisation (EBITDA) declined 15% YoY to Rs 13,032 crore, while its EBITDA margin contracted by 240 basis points (bps) to 11.5%.  The weaker earnings prompted Jefferies, a global brokerage firm, to downgrade Tata Motors from "buy" to "underperform". The firm also reduced its price target to Rs 660 from Rs 930. The downgrade signalled that Jefferies expected the stock to face further pressure in the coming months. Nuvama Institutional Equities also lowered its price target for Tata Motors by 4% to Rs 720, while maintaining a "reduce" call on the stock. Nuvama stated that it had cut its FY25 EBITDA estimate for Tata Motors by 4%. The brokerage firm said it expects muted revenue and EBITDA growth of 2% annually between FY25 and FY27. For Jaguar Land Rover (JLR), Tata Motors' luxury car unit, Nuvama predicted volume contraction due to a decline in the order book, the discontinuation of Jaguar models, and weaker demand in key markets. Morgan Stanley retained its "equal-weight" rating on Tata Motors, setting a price target of Rs 853. The firm pointed out that the company’s lower revenue and return on capital employed (RoCE) guidance for JLR was a key concern. It noted that Tata Motors' Q3 numbers were weaker than expected, raising doubts about its near-term performance. UBS, another global brokerage, maintained a "sell" rating on Tata Motors, with a price target of Rs 760. The firm stated that the company’s guidance for the fourth quarter appeared ambitious, given the uncertainty in financial years 2026 and 2027. UBS highlighted that China’s economic recovery would play a crucial role in helping JLR achieve a 10% EBIT (Earnings Before Interest and Taxes) margin in the next financial year. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Will defence, railway sectors get a big boost?Union Budget 2025 is likely to provide enhanced support for modernisation of the defence forces, strengthening naval assets and promoting domestic manufacturing.
Content: Experts are optimistic about the government’s balanced efforts at fiscal planning which could boost consumption and promote the growth and development of the nation. Puneet Singhania, Director at Master Trust Group stated that the government is expected to support military modernisation, strengthen naval assets and give a boost to domestic manufacturing. "In the realm of defence, we foresee budgetary allocation towards capital expenditure to hover around 7% to 8% in FY26; shall this be given effect, it would amount to approximately Rs 1.9 lakh crore. The modernisation of the defence forces, the strengthening of naval assets, and the promotion of domestic manufacturing would pave the way towards the realisation of an Aatmanirbhar Bharat and a successful Make in India," he said. “On the tax front, continuity would be important. Significant alterations in securities transaction tax or long-term capital gains tax would not be contemplated, as maintaining consistency in policymaking is crucial for regaining the confidence of investors during times of economic risks,” he mentioned. Naresh Kumar, COO, Lauritz Knudsen Electrical and Automation expects that the upcoming budget would promote innovation and strengthen business growth. “Sustained investments in infrastructure are imperative for India’s economic growth.  With capital spending on infrastructure now at 3.4% of GDP, we anticipate continued prioritisation of physical, digital, and social infrastructure as the nation works towards the vision of a Viksit Bharat by 2047,” he said. “Key initiatives such as the National Infrastructure Pipeline and Gati Shakti Master Plan, especially towards smart cities, road transport and railways, can unlock opportunities for long-term sustainable growth,” added Naresh Kumar. Puneet Singhania anticipates a rise in capex allocation for the railways sector. “We think a record increase in capital spending for the railways, with increments reaching 15%-20%, amounting to about Rs 3 lakh crore. Priorities may include the rollout of the Vande Bharat train service to deliver long-desirable enhancements in the freight sector, juxtaposing contributory multi-modal cargo terminals, while incorporating advanced technologies such as AI into operations,” he added.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 30, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: These 5 popular deductions are not available under new tax regime  Budget 2025: Interest incurred on home loans is a popular deduction available under Section 24(b) in the old tax regime. However, the same is not included under the new tax regime.
Content: With only two days to go for the announcement of Union Budget 2025, taxpayers are still confused about the new tax regime. Though the new tax regime which was introduced in Budget 2020, offers concessional tax rates, it removes several popular tax benefits that are  otherwise availble under the old tax regime. Some of these deductions that are not available include:advertisementHOUSE RENT ALLOWANCE (HRA)This is given by the employer to employee for expenses incurred toward rented accommodation. While caluclationg taxable income under the old regime, the sum of HRA exemption is deducted from taxable income, thereby allowing individuals to save on taxes.INTEREST INCURRED ON HOME LOAN This is given by the employer to employee for expenses incurred toward rented accommodation. While caluclationg taxable income under the old regime, the sum of HRA exemption is deducted from taxable income, thereby allowing individuals to save on taxes.INTEREST INCURRED ON HOME LOAN It is another popular deduction availble under Section 24(b) in the old tax regime. A tax exemption of up to Rs 2 Lakh can be claimed towards interest incurred on home loan.LEAVE TRAVEL CONCESSION (LTC) This allowance under the old tax regime is given by the employer to th employee to travel anywhere within India. A maximum of Rs 36,000 per individual can be availed for exemption from taxes. No international travel can be claimed by the employee under LTC.CHILDREN'S EDUCATION ALLOWANCE  This allowance under the old tax regime is given to the employees to cover their child's educational expenses, thus easing their financial burden. However, the same is not availble under the new tax regime.DONATIONS MADE TO A POLTICAL PARTY  Under the old tax regime, Section 80GGB provides exemption for any donations or contributions made to a political party. However, donations made in cash are not eligible for tax deductions under this section.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 30, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Why did Sebi cancel registration of 4 stock brokers? Check hereIn four separate orders, Sebi (Securities and Exchange Board of India) explained the main reason for the cancellation of the four stock brokers.
Content: Sebi (Securities and Exchange Board of India) has cancelled the registration of four stock brokers. The entities whose registration has been revoked are Single Window Securities, Sunness Capital India, GACM Technologies, and Infotech Portfolio. The capital markets regulator said that these entities could have misused their registration without being members of a recognised stock exchange, which could have misled investors. In four separate orders, Sebi explained the main reason for the cancellation, saying that these stock brokers were no longer fulfilling the conditions required for their registration.advertisementWHY SEBI CANCELLED THEIR REGISTRATION Sebi took this step because these brokers failed to meet the necessary registration requirements. Sebi has strict rules regarding the registration of stock brokers. A stock broker must be a member of a recognised stock exchange to hold a valid registration. These four entities lost their stock exchange membership, which meant they no longer qualified to remain registered under Sebi’s Broker Regulations, 1992. The regulator said, “Since the entities are no longer holding membership of any recognised stock exchange, they no longer fulfil the conditions stipulated under Regulation 9(a) of the Broker Regulations, 1992, by which Certificate of Registration was granted to them.” Since the stock exchanges had already expelled these brokers, Sebi decided to cancel their registration. The information regarding their expulsion was communicated to Sebi by the respective exchanges. Even though their registration has been cancelled, these stock brokers remain responsible for any past actions taken when they were active. They also must pay any outstanding fees, dues, or interest owed to Sebi, as per the regulator’s orders. Sebi followed the proper legal procedures under the Intermediaries Regulations, 2008, before revoking their registration. This ensures that the process was transparent and in line with regulatory requirements.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 30, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Will government raise basic exemption limit and cut income tax?With inflation and the rising cost of living affecting household budgets, many are expecting the government to introduce income tax cuts, higher deductions, and a more simplified tax structure.
Content:
Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget 2025 on February 1, and one of the most awaited announcements will be the tax relief measures for salaried individuals and middle-class taxpayers. With inflation and the rising cost of living affecting household budgets, many are expecting the government to introduce income tax cuts, higher deductions, and a more simplified tax structure. Experts believe the budget could bring changes in income tax slabs, raise the basic exemption limit, and deductions under the new tax regime, and deadlines for tax filing, making the system more beneficial for taxpayers.MIDDLE-CLASS EXPECTATIONS: A LONG-STANDING DEMAND India’s middle class, which plays a key role in the country’s economy, has been waiting for meaningful tax relief for several years. Many taxpayers feel the current system does not offer enough benefits, especially when compared to rising expenses. Sandeep Bhalla, Partner, Dhruva Advisors, said, "Revision of Tax Slabs: Increasing the basic exemption limit from Rs 2.5 lakh to Rs 5 lakh and raising the threshold for the 30% tax rate from Rs 10 lakh to Rs 20 lakh would provide substantial relief." Many financial experts believe that raising the exemption limit and adjusting tax rates will increase disposable income, encouraging people to spend more, which could help boost economic growth.INCOME TAX RELIEF EXPECTATIONS According to Deepashree Shetty, Partner, Global Employer Services, Tax & Regulatory Services, BDO India, several key tax reforms should be considered in Budget 2025 to simplify income tax and reduce the burden on taxpayers. Shetty said that the current income tax slabs are inconsistent, with differences of Rs 2 lakh or Rs 3 lakh between various tax brackets. She suggested a more uniform approach with a consistent gap between slabs. She also recommended the introduction of a new 25% tax slab, which would provide further relief for middle-income earners. Currently, tax rates stand at 5%, 10%, 15%, 20%, and 30%, and restructuring these slabs could make taxation fairer. Another key expectation is increasing the income limit for the highest 30% tax rate from Rs 15 lakh to Rs 20 lakh, which would benefit many taxpayers by lowering their tax liability.INCLUSION OF POPULAR DEDUCTIONS UNDER THE NEW TAX REGIME The new tax regime, introduced as an alternative to the old system, does not allow many popular deductions. Experts believe that including key deductions will make it more attractive for taxpayers.
Section 80C: Allow deductions up to Rs 2 lakh for expenses such as life insurance premiums and Employees' Provident Fund contributions.
Section 80D: Extend deductions up to Rs 1 lakh for health insurance premiums, helping families manage rising medical costs.
Section 80TTB: Provide a deduction of up to Rs 50,000 for senior citizens earning interest from bank deposits, post office savings, etc.
Section 10(13A): Allow salaried taxpayers to claim House Rent Allowance (HRA) under the new tax regime, which would provide relief to those paying rent.
HRA RELIEF FOR HIGH-RENT CITIES Currently, House Rent Allowance (HRA) exemptions are different for metro and non-metro cities. Shetty suggested that cities such as Bengaluru, Gurugram, Hyderabad, and Pune should be included under the ‘metro cities’ category, as they have high rental costs similar to Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, and Chennai. This change would help salaried individuals get a higher tax exemption on their rent, reducing their tax burden.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 30, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty end higher but IT, auto stocks limit gains; Tata Motors down 7%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 226.85 points to close at 76,759.81, while the NSE Nifty50 added 86.40 points to end at 23,249.50.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices closed higher on a volatile trading day, with IT and auto sector stocks dragging the market down.  The S&P BSE Sensex gained 226.85 points to close at 76,759.81, while the NSE Nifty50 added 86.40 points to end at 23,249.50.  Aditya Gaggar, Director of Progressive Shares, said that the word expiry is always accompanied by volatility; seen in the Index that showed a steady start before trending upwards and oscillating within a defined range for most of the session. "However, a sharp decline in the afternoon erased all of its earlier gains. In the final hour of trade, a strong recovery helped the Index close higher at 23,249.50, marking a gain of 86.40 points," he added.  Bharat Electronics Limited (BEL) emerged as the top performer on Nifty50, surging 4.87%, while Power Grid Corporation of India gained 2.80%. Hero MotoCorp showed positive momentum with a 2.76% increase, followed by Bharti Airtel which rose 2.63%. Cipla completed the top gainers list with a solid 2.53% uptick. Tata Motors witnessed heavy selling pressure, plunging 6.98%. Indian Hotels Company also saw significant losses, dropping 5.00%, while Adani Enterprises fell 3.05%. Shriram Finance declined by 2.29%, and Bajaj Finserv rounded off the losers with a 2.26% decrease. Ajit Mishra - SVP, Research, Religare Broking Ltd, said, "Sectoral performance remained mixed, with realty, energy, and pharma outperforming, while IT, media, and auto lagged. Broader indices pared early gains and ended flat." "With the budget countdown underway, we anticipate continued market fluctuations. Nifty is encountering resistance around its 20-day EMA at 23,300, and a decisive close above this level is crucial for further recovery. Otherwise, the index may face renewed pressure and again inch toward the 23,000–22,700 zone. In this environment, traders should emphasize selective stock picking and robust risk management," he added. The Nifty Smallcap100 index managed to eke out gains of 0.12%, while the Nifty Midcap100 ended marginally lower with a slight dip of 0.01%. Market anxiety continued as the India VIX, which measures volatility, rose by 6.70%.  "I would advise market participants to remain cautious in their approach and hedge their short positions. Amid the expected developments, Nifty could gather support between 23,050 and 22,920 and face resistance between 23,320 and 23,460 in the next session. On the other hand, Bank Nifty is expected to gain support between 49,000 and 48,550 and notice resistance between 49,700 and 54,850," said VLA Ambala, Co-Founder of Stock Market Today. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 30, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: 5 exemptions that are available under new tax regimeUnion Budget 2025: To make the new tax regime more attractive for the taxpayers, the government has raised the standard deduction to Rs 75,000 from Rs 50,000.
Content: The new tax regime was introduced to simplify the tax filing process and offer lower tax rates. However, it does not include some of the common and popular tax exemptions available under the old tax regime, like house rent allowance (HRA), Section 80C, and medical insurance premiums, etc, making it less popular among the taxpayers. Sudhir Kaushik, Co-Founder & CEO of Taxspanner said, "The new tax regime was introduced in the financial year 2020-21 to offer a simplified tax structure with lower tax rates. However, it eliminates many exemptions and deductions available in the old regime, such as HRA, LTA, meal coupons, car lease benefits, Section 80C, 80D, 80E deductions, and home loan interest on self-occupied houses. The primary goal was to remove the compulsion of investment for tax-saving purposes, encourage higher consumption to boost economic growth, and simplify compliance by reducing the need for investment proof submissions." Nonetheless, there are still a few deductions that can be claimed under the new tax regime. They are:STANDARD DEDUCTION  To make the new tax regime more attractive for the taxpayers, the government has raised the standard deduction to Rs 75,000 from Rs 50,000. Under the old tax regime, Rs 50,000 is available.EMPLOYER'S CONTRIBUTION TO NPS  Under Section 80CCD(2), deduction is available on an employer's contribution to the National Pension Scheme (NPS). However, the taxpayer's contribution to NPS is not available under the new regime, instead it can be claimed under the old regime.TRANSPORT ALLOWANCES FOR SPECIALLY-ABLED PERSON  Specially-abled persons are eligible for deductions on transport allowance under the new tax regime. It covers the commuting expenses from their residence to their workplace.EXEMPTION ON GRATUITY  Gratuity is the lump sum amount received at the time of leaving an organisation after completing a minimum of five years of service. The entire gratuity amount received by the government employee is exempted under the new tax regime. However, for non-government employees, the gratuity amount of maximum Rs 20 lakh is tax-exempt under the new regime.EXEMPTION ON LEAVE ENCASHMENT  Most employers allow employees to carry forward any paid or privilege leave that has not been utilised by them during the year. These leaves can be encashed at the time of resignation or retirement. Under the new tax regime, leave encashment is tax exempted, but, the exemption limit differs for a government and a non-government employee.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 30, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Can AI and better financing transform education sector?Union Budget 2025: Experts anticipate that Budget 2025 would focus on AI-driven academic programs along with increased allocations for student loans and decreasing rates on education loans.
Content: As the nation gears up for Union Budget 2025, the education sector is hoping for transformative reforms in the country’s education landscape. Experts hope for the government's efforts to improve the overall quality of education, greater allocations for student loans and integrating artificial Intelligence (AI) into advanced academic programs. Ashutosh Upadhyay, Founder, Cognio Labs believes that AI will be a game-changer in the field of education. "The education sector is ripe for AI-driven transformation, with global EdTech AI solutions expected to reach $80 billion by 2030. We anticipate budget allocations for developing personalised learning platforms powered by adaptive AI algorithms. Key focus areas should include funding for AI-enabled student assessment tools, virtual learning environments, and automated content generation systems,” he said. “These measures will democratise quality education while creating a future-ready workforce equipped with digital skills,” Upadhyay added. Bhupender Kumar Som, Director, GNIOT Institute Of Management Studies urged increased financial support for students by way of loans and scholarships. “The government should present greater flexibility in education financing through increased allocations for student loans and decreasing rates on education loans, thereby making them accessible to aspiring students across the country,” he mentioned. “We urge the budget to introduce policies that make it much easier for foreign universities to open campuses in India and enable students to receive some of the best education in the world without the need to go abroad,” Bhupender Kumar Som said. Jaskiran Arora, Dean Education Quality, BML Munjal University urged upgrading the country’s education infrastructure and called for increased global partnerships. “To foster development, enhancing foreign investments and enabling foreign currency loans for educational institutions is crucial, particularly to upgrade infrastructure and adopt cutting-edge technology solutions,” he said. “The Budget should also focus on expediting clearances for foreign grants and donations, streamlining regulatory processes, and creating an environment conducive to global partnerships and digital learning capabilities to shape the future of India’s higher education system,” Arora mentioned.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 30, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Will 25% tax rate and fresh deductions be announced under new regime?The government might extend the tax exemption for individual contributions to NPS under the new tax regime, along with several other projected deductions.
Content: In order to simplify the tax system, the government introduced a new tax regime in 2020, with concessional tax rates and removal of certain deductions. Nearly 72% of taxpayers opted for the new tax regime for filing income tax returns for fiscal year 2023-24. Below are some of the tax proposals for the new regime which may find place in Budget 2025. Taxpayers could witness a raise in the basic exemption limit from Rs 3,00,000 to Rs 3,50,000, which would offer a much-needed relief to individuals by increasing their disposable income and raising consumption levels. While the employer’s contribution to NPS is tax-exempt under the new tax regime, the same is not the case with individual contributions to NPS. The latter is exempted only under the new tax regime. The government may now extend this exemption under the new tax regime too. Currently, rebate under Section 87A is applicable for income levels up to Rs 7 lakh. The government might extend this to Rs 8 lakh. Apart from the existing tax slabs, the government might announce a new tax slab with a 25% tax rate for income above Rs 15,00,000 to Rs 18,00,000, while income above Rs 18,00,000 may be levied with a 30% tax rate. Meanwhile, as 28% of the taxpayers continue to opt for the old tax regime, the government may also announce a few changes to the old tax regime.  The basic exemption limit may be raised from Rs 2,50,000 to Rs 3,00,000 by the government. Owing to the rising cost of living and increased educational expenses, the existing limit for children's education allowance and hostel allowance might be raised to Rs 2,500 per month and Rs 5,000 per month respectively from the earlier Rs 100 per month and Rs 500 per month. The government might consider extending leave travel concession exemption to international destinations under the old tax regime. Cities like Bangaluru, Gurugram, Noida, Pune, and Hyderabad may be considered for a 50% capping limit under the HRA exemption. The government may extend the house loan interest deduction from Rs 2,00,000 to Rs 2,50,000 and is likely to extend the eligibility period from five years to seven years from the date of acquisition of the property.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 30, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty rise as markets bet on Budget 2025 for growth push; L&T up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 161.56 points to 76,921.37, while the NSE Nifty added 64.60 points to 23,314.10 as of 9:25 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened on a positive note on Friday, a day before Budget 2025, helped by a rise in auto and IT sector stocks in early trade.  The S&P BSE Sensex was up 161.56 points to 76,921.37, while the NSE Nifty added 64.60 points to 23,314.10 as of 9:25 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that the Budget - expectations and actuals - will influence the market today and tomorrow. "Since we are going into the Budget without a pre-Budget rally, the probability of a rally, post Budget, will be high if the Budget delivers on growth stimulating initiatives like cuts in personal income tax. But it is important to understand that the impact of the Budget will last only for a few days, at best. The medium to long-term trend of the market will be dictated by GDP and earnings growth. Therefore, investors should look for cues on these crucial macro trends," he added.  Market is strongly reacting to results with good results being rewarded and poor results getting punished. This has spiked the market volatility. Fairly-valued high quality largecap financials continue to be a safe sector for investors.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 31, 2025

Headline: Nirmala Sitharaman to present Economic Survey today. Check key detailsUnion Budget 2025: The Economic Survey is an important document that reviews the country's financial health over the past year and provides insights into economic trends, challenges, and opportunities.
Content: The Budget session in Parliament will begin on Friday, January 31, with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman set to present the Union Budget 2025 on February 1. Ahead of this, the Finance Minister will present the Economic Survey 2024-25 in Parliament today. The Economic Survey is an important document that reviews the country’s financial health over the past year and provides insights into economic trends, challenges, and opportunities. The Economic Survey 2024-25 will be presented in Parliament between 12:00 PM and 1:00 PM. Later in the day, Chief Economic Adviser V. Anantha Nageswaran will brief the media at 2:30 PM, where he is expected to highlight the key findings and recommendations of the report. The Economic Survey is prepared by the Economic Division of the Department of Economic Affairs under the guidance of the Chief Economic Adviser (CEA). This report is not just a collection of numbers but also offers insights into how different sectors of the economy have performed and what policy measures could be introduced. The survey covers GDP growth, inflation, fiscal deficit, employment trends, foreign exchange reserves, and other critical aspects of the economy. One of the most important elements of the Economic Survey is its focus on emerging economic trends. It provides a roadmap for addressing key issues such as job creation, infrastructure development, financial sector reforms, and climate change policies. The document also looks at global economic factors that could impact India, including oil prices, trade relations, and currency fluctuations. The Economic Survey was first introduced in 1950-51 as part of the Budget documents. In the 1960s, it was separated from the Budget and is now presented a day before the Union Budget. Over the years, the survey has gained importance as it highlights economic strengths and weaknesses, helping the government plan its financial policies. This year, the survey is expected to address concerns such as economic slowdown, inflation, rupee depreciation, and the impact of global uncertainties on India’s economy. It may also suggest steps for boosting domestic consumption, encouraging private investment, and supporting key sectors like agriculture, manufacturing, and services. Every year, economists, investors, and policymakers closely follow the Economic Survey as it gives a detailed picture of India’s economic performance and sets expectations for the Union Budget. The document includes key economic indicators, sectoral growth analysis, and forecasts for the coming year.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Budget session 2025: Where to watch Finance Minister's speech live Budget 2025: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is set to present the Union Budget 2025 on February 1. This will be her eighth consecutive Budget speech.
Content:
The Budget session in Parliament will begin on Friday, January 31, with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman set to present the Union Budget 2025 on February 1. This will be her eighth consecutive Budget speech. The Budget session will be held in two parts. The first part will run from January 31 to February 13, while the second part will begin on March 10 and end on April 4. Budget 2025 is expected to bring important changes to the country's tax system and help boost its overall growth with the GDP showing signs of a slowdown. Where to Watch Budget 2025 Live The Budget speech will be broadcast live from 11:00 am on February 1. It can be watched on the official Union Budget website (indiabudget.gov.in) and on Sansad TV. For live updates, you can also tune in to India Today TV and visit Indiatoday.in for the latest news and coverage. This will be Nirmala Sitharaman's second full Budget under the current BJP-led government which is in its third term. She has already tabled six full Budgets and two interim ones. She has now given more Budget speeches than former finance ministers like Manmohan Singh, Arun Jaitley, P. Chidambaram, and Morarji Desai. In 2019, Sitharaman brought a new change by using a 'bahi-khata' (traditional account book) instead of the usual leather briefcase. Now, the Budget has gone fully digital - no paper is used, and this will continue this year too.  The Union Budget is one of the key financial documents for India. It outlines the government’s expected income and spending for the coming year. More than just a financial statement, the Union Budget helps guide the country’s economic plans and strategies.
Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Will stock market open for trading on budget day? Check hereSensex, Nifty on budget day: Investors are on their toes looking for cues to tell them if market bulls will be dominant or will bearish sentiments take over.
Content: Budget day is like a high-stakes earnings call for the entire economy, with every word from the Finance Minister so crucial that it can send stocks soaring or crashing. Investors are on their toes looking for cues to tell them if market bulls will be dominant or will bearish sentiments take over. The announcements made during the Budget can have an impact on Dalal Street, with positive measures boosting investor confidence and negative ones causing market corrections. But will Sensex and Nifty open for trading on February 1, which is a Saturday? The National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) have confirmed that the stock market will remain open for trading on Budget day. In a circular issued on Monday, both exchanges announced that trading will take place as per regular market hours. This means the equity market will function from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM, while commodity derivatives trading will continue until 5:00 PM. However, the T+0 settlement session will remain suspended due to the settlement holiday. The decision to keep the markets open aligns with past instances where trading was allowed on Saturdays for Budget announcements. Similar special trading sessions were held in 2020 and 2015 when the Union Budget was presented on a non-working day. This step ensures that investors can respond immediately to the government’s fiscal policies, tax reforms, and sectoral allocations that often influence market trends. Pre-market trading will take place between 9:00 AM and 9:08 AM, and the benchmark indices Nifty 50 and Sensex will update live throughout the session. Market participants will closely track Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman’s Budget speech for policy changes that could impact different sectors. The Union Budget is a crucial event for the stock market as it sets the economic direction for the year ahead. Investors will be looking for key announcements related to infrastructure, banking, manufacturing, and healthcare, which are expected to experience significant movement based on policy measures. Tax reliefs, fiscal deficit targets, and government spending plans will also play a vital role in shaping market sentiment. Historically, the Budget was presented on the last working day of February. However, in 2017, then-Finance Minister Arun Jaitley shifted the date to February 1 to allow more time for policy implementation within the financial year. Since then, the Union Budget has been presented on February 1 each year.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 31, 2025

Headline: India's GDP growth projected at 6.3-6.8% for fiscal 2025-26: Economic SurveyThe Economic Survey said that the manufacturing sector faced pressures due to weak global demand and domestic seasonal conditions.
Content: India's GDP growth for the financial year 2025-26 (FY26) is expected to be between 6.3% and 6.8%, as per the Economic Survey 2024-25. The projection indicates that economic growth may remain slow in the coming year. "The fundamentals of the domestic economy remain robust, with a strong external account, calibrated fiscal consolidation and stable private consumption. On balance of these considerations, we expect that the growth in FY26 would be between 6.3 and 6.8 per cent," said the economic survey released by the government.  The survey further said that the manufacturing sector faced pressures due to weak global demand and domestic seasonal conditions. "Private consumption remained stable, reflecting steady domestic demand. Fiscal discipline and strong external balance supported by a services trade surplus and healthy remittance growth contributed to macroeconomic stability. Together, these factors provided a solid foundation for sustained growth amid external uncertainties," said the economic survey. Published By: sharangee Published On: Jan 31, 2025

Headline: Sensex jumps 800 points: 5 reasons why stock market is rising ahead of BudgetThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 766.21 points to 77,526.02, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 275.10 points to 23,524.60 as of 1:30 pm.
Content: The stock market surged in the afternoon session on Friday, a day before Budget 2025, with the Sensex and Nifty gaining almost 1%. While the S&P BSE Sensex surged nearly 800 points to reach a day's high of 77,537.12, Nifty gained almost 300 points, both extending their gains for the 4th consecutive day. The S&P BSE Sensex was up 766.21 points to 77,526.02, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 275.10 points to 23,524.60 as of 1:30 pm. Below are the reasons behind the market rally on Dalal Street ahead of the Union Budget 2025 presentation: Investor Optimism on Growth Measures Investors are hopeful that the government will announce policies to support economic growth.  Expectations of tax relief, higher spending on infrastructure, and incentives for key industries have boosted market sentiment. A strong push towards manufacturing and job creation could further improve the economic outlook.Strong Performance of IT, Auto, and Consumer Stocks Shares of IT, auto, and consumer durable companies have been among the biggest gainers. Trivesh, COO of Tradejini, said, "Investor optimism is driving market sentiment, fueled by expectations of policy measures that could support economic growth. Historically, Budget Day has been volatile, but data shows that Nifty has closed positively after the Budget in 12 out of the last 18 years since 2010. While initial reactions may be mixed, markets often recover if key measures align with expectations."Hopes of Tax Cuts for Individuals and Businesses Market experts believe that possible tax relief for individuals and businesses could boost spending and investments. Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services, said, "Since we are heading into the Budget without a major pre-Budget rally, the chances of a post-Budget rally are higher if the government introduces growth-boosting measures like cuts in personal income tax. However, it is important to note that the Budget's impact on the market will be short-lived. In the long run, stock market trends will depend on GDP growth and corporate earnings."Slower Selling by Foreign Investors Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) have been selling stocks in recent weeks, but the pace of selling has slowed down. Kranti Bathini, Director of Equity Strategy at WealthMills Securities, said, "Foreign portfolio investors continue to be sellers, but the volume of selling has reduced significantly. If the Budget offers favourable policies, we may see more buying from both domestic and foreign investors."Market Looking for Strong Corporate Earnings As corporate earnings for the quarter are being announced, investors are looking for companies with strong profits. Stocks of companies that have reported good results are rising, while those with weaker numbers are facing pressure. Analysts suggest that investors should focus on long-term opportunities rather than short-term movements around the Budget.Will the rally continue after the budget? Market direction in the coming days will depend on the Budget announcements. If the government presents policies that meet investor expectations, the rally could continue. However, unexpected changes or concerns over fiscal spending could lead to volatility. Experts advise investors to remain cautious and wait for the Budget before making major investment decisions. (Disclaimer: The views, opinions, recommendations, and suggestions expressed by experts/brokerages in this article are their own and do not reflect the views of the India Today Group. It is advisable to consult a qualified broker or financial advisor before making any actual investment or trading choices.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: 5 top expectations of middle class from new tax regimeUnion Budget 2025: Taxpayers are anticipating that the government may raise the basic exemption limit from Rs 3,00,000 to Rs 5,00,000 under the new regime, offering more disposable income and increased savings.
Content: The new tax regime was announced in Budget 2020 to simplify the tax structure, ensuring taxpayers benefit from lower rates. However, several popular exemptions and deductions offered in the old tax regime, like house rent allowance (HRA) and leave travel allowance (LTA), etc. are not available under the new tax regime, making it less attractive to individuals. Can the middle class get more tax relief under the new regime? Here's a look at their top five expectations from the government.advertisementRAISING BASIC EXEMPTION LIMITCurrently, the basic exemption limit under the new tax regime is Rs 3,00,000. It is anticipated that the government may increase this threshold to Rs 5,00,000. Currently, the basic exemption limit under the new tax regime is Rs 3,00,000. It is anticipated that the government may increase this threshold to Rs 5,00,000. This would provide the taxpayers with more disposable income.INCLUSION OF INDIVIDUAL CONTRIBUTION TO NPS As of now, only the employer’s contribution to the National Pension Scheme (NPS) is included under the new regime, while self-contribution to NPS is not included. The government may consider extending the tax benefits under the new regime, which otherwise is already included in the old tax regime.ENHANCING SECTION 87A REBATE LIMIT Currently, tax rebate under Section 87A on income up to Rs 7,00,000 is 100%. Expectations are there that the income limit may be raised to Rs 8,00,000 under the new tax regime.CHANGE IN TAX SLABS Experts expect that the government may revise the tax slabs under the new regime, especially shifting the 30% tax slab to income above Rs 20,00,000 instead of the existing income level up to Rs 15,00,000.INCREASE IN STANDARD DEDUCTION LIMIT Last year, the government increased the standard deduction limit from Rs 50,000 to Rs 75,000. Experts believe that the government may further expand this limit to Rs 1,00,000 to make the new tax regime more lucrative to the taxpayers.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Budget 2025: Why middle class can expect tax relief tomorrowThe government is likely to roll out schemes that focus on offering economic and tax relief to the middle class, poor and women.
Content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his speech ahead of Union Budget 2025 invoked the country’s middle class, poor and women, signalling that the government may introduce several reforms and measures aimed at these groups. He started his speech with, “I pray to Goddess Lakshmi to shower the poor and middle class with blessings,” and referred to the terms 'innovation, inclusion and investment', hinting that the government is likely to roll out schemes that focus on offering economic and tax relief to these targeted groups. The country’s middle class can expect changes in tax slabs under the new income tax regime. The government may introduce an additional 25% tax rate for income levels between Rs 15,00,000 to Rs 18,00,000, while income above Rs 18,00,000 can be charged with a 30% tax rate, according to sources. It is also expected that the government might include a tax exemption for individual contributions to the National Pension Scheme (NPS) under the new tax regime. This would help reduce the financial burden of the middle class while giving a boost to their consumption levels. Moreover, the basic exemption limit of Rs 3,00,000 is likely to be extended to Rs 5,00,000 under the new regime. Today, President Droupadi Murmu announced expanding the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana to an additional three crore famililies. The scheme offers affordable housing to eligible families belonging to the economically weaker section (EWS), lower income group (LIG) and middle income group I (MIG-I). In his speech, PM Modi referred to women empowerment. Hence, it is expected that Budget 2025 will introduce a range of schemes, initiatives and welfare programs targeting women. In other words, if the proposed tax changes, welfare schemes and measures are implemented in Budget 2025, they would provide the much-needed relief for the middle class, poor and women.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Sensex, Nifty rally as markets ride consumer goods wave ahead of BudgetThe S&P BSE Sensex surged 740.76 points to end at 77,500.57, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 258.90 points to close at 23,508.40.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices witnessed a rally ahead of the budget, riding on gains seen in consumer goods sector stocks on Friday, ending the month on a high.  The S&P BSE Sensex surged 740.76 points to end at 77,500.57, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 258.90 points to close at 23,508.40.  Aditya Gaggar, Director of Progressive Shares, said that the last day of the month belongs to the Bulls as from the beginning itself, the Index progressed towards the north and at regular intervals compounded its gains to close at 23,508.40 with gains of 258.90 points. India's GDP growth for the financial year 2025-26 (FY26) is expected to be between 6.3% and 6.8%, as per the Economic Survey 2024-25. This news added to the already positive sentiment on the stock market.  The survey's positive outlook has positively impacted the market momentum. On technical charts, Nifty 50 is trading at 23,469.45, reflecting a moderate increase of 0.94% from the previous session. The India VIX declined by nearly 5% today to trade at 16.36 after the Economic Survey was tabled," said VLA Ambala, Co-Founder of Stock Market Today.  All the sectors ended the day in green with energy and FMCG sector stocks being the major outperformers. "Mid and Smallcap space advanced by 1.89% & 2.11% and outshined the Frontline Index. With a strong bullish candle, the Index has confirmed its Falling Wedge Formation breakout but with the Union Budget announcement tomorrow, there could be high volatility. The undertone will remain positive with the downside being protected at 23,400 while on the higher side, 23,740-23,860 will be considered as a strong resistance zone," said Gaggar.  Coming to individual stocks, Tata Consumer Products surged 6.24%, BEL jumped 5.47%, Trent gained 4.61%, Coal India rose 4.49%, and ITC added 4.18%. Among losers, Bharti Airtel fell 0.82%, Indian Hotels Company shed 0.77%, JSW Steel declined 0.65%, ICICI Bank shed 0.21%, and Bajaj Finserv edged down 0.16%. "Traders should consider pullback trading opportunities to capitalise on the emerging trend. However, I would advise keeping short portfolios hedged to spread out potential risks and explore companies that are posting decent results and have strong order books. Meanwhile, the upcoming budget is expected to focus on core capex investments, particularly in infrastructure, renewable energy, defense, manufacturing, and technology, as highlighted in the Economic Survey. This could generate significant interest in these sectors and impact the broader market momentum. Amid these developments, Nifty could gather support between 23,380 and 23,150 and meet resistance between 23,650 and 23,800 in the next session," said Ambala. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Must Watch

Headline: What Economic Survey has to say on office hours amid work-life balance debateThe pre-Budget Economic Survey's findings come amid an ongoing debate over extended workweeks, sparked by recent remarks from business leaders advocating 70-to 90-hour workweeks.
Content: The pre-Budget Economic Survey 2024-25 has highlighted the adverse health effects of working over 60 hours a week, citing multiple studies to caution against long work hours. The survey merely scratches the surface when it comes to workweek duration but comes amid a heated debate fuelled by recent remarks from business leaders advocating 70- to 90-hour workweeks. According to the survey, spending excessive time at work can be detrimental to mental well-being, with individuals working 12 or more hours a day experiencing significantly higher levels of distress. The report mentions studies by the WHO and the International Labour Organisation (ILO), which link working over 55–60 hours per week with increased health risks. "While the hours spent at work are informally considered a measure of productivity, a previous study has documented adverse health effects when hours exceed 55-60 per week," the survey said, referencing findings by Pega F, Nafradi B (2021) and a WHO-ILO joint study on the work-related burden of disease and injury. The report also highlighted a study by the Sapien Labs Centre for Human Brain and Mind, which found that individuals working 12 or more hours a day had significantly lower mental well-being, significantly lower than those spending two hours or less at a desk. "Spending long hours at one's desk is equally detrimental to mental well-being," the survey stated.BUSINESS LEADERS ON WORK-LIFE BALANCE  The discussion around work hours intensified after Larsen & Toubro Chairman and Managing Director SN Subrahmanyan recently remarked that employees should work 90-hour weeks, including Sundays, instead of staying at home. "How long can you stare at your wife," Subrahmanyan had previously said, while expressing "regret" over being unable to ask employees to work on Sundays.  Subrahmanyan came under fire for his remark, with many calling his statement "shocking".  He was following in the footsteps of Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy, who suggested a 70-hour workweek, and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani, who quipped, "Biwi bhaag jayegi (wife will run away)" if one spent more than eight hours at home. However, these remarks have drawn criticism from within the business community. RPG Group Chairman Harsh Goenka pushed back against the idea, warning, "Longer working hours is a recipe for burnout, not success." Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra also chimed in, stating, "It's not the number of hours you put in but the quality of work that counts." Similarly, ITC Ltd Chairman Sanjiv Puri emphasised that empowering employees to perform effectively was more important than merely increasing work hours.WORK CULTURE NOT SOLE FACTOR INFLUENCING PRODUCTIVITY AND WELL-BEING "Even in jobs with the best managerial relationships, about five days per month are lost because workplace culture is but one factor (among several) in determining productivity and mental well-being," it noted. Globally, the impact of mental health on productivity is significant. Citing WHO data, the survey stated that around 12 billion workdays are lost annually due to depression and anxiety, resulting in a financial loss of nearly USD 1 trillion. "In rupee terms, this translates to about Rs 7,000 per day," the report estimated. The work-life balance debate in India mirrors a similar controversy in China, where the so-called "996 culture"-working from 9 am to 9 pm, six days a week-has faced criticism for its impact on employee health and productivity. The Economic Survey emphasised that if India is to achieve its economic ambitions, immediate attention must be given to the lifestyle choices made during childhood and youth. "Hostile work cultures and excessive hours at the desk can adversely affect mental well-being and ultimately put the brakes on the pace of economic growth," it warned. While fostering a better workplace culture can enhance mental well-being, lifestyle choices and family dynamics also play a crucial role. The survey results indicate that individuals who seldom consume ultra-processed or packaged junk food tend to have better mental well-being compared to those who do so regularly. Likewise, those who rarely exercise, frequently spend their free time on social media, or have distant relationships with their families exhibit poorer mental well-being.Published By: Nakul AhujaPublished On: Jan 31, 2025

Headline: India must grow at 8% for at least 10 years for 'Viksit Bharat': Economic SurveyThe Indian economy is expected to grow between 6.3% to 6.8% in FY26, according to the Economic Survey.
Content: India to achieve its goal of 'Viksit Bharat by 2047' will need to grow at around 8% at constant prices for nearly a decade or two, according to the Economic Survey 2024-25. The survey presented by the Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman cited the country’s opportunities as well as challenges. The Indian economy is expected to grow between 6.3% to 6.8% in FY26, according to the survey. Strong domestic economic fundamentals coupled with steady inflation, stable private consumption and a decreasing inflation rate will help the country sustain its growth momentum. However, geopolitical and trade uncertainties could impact the nation’s growth. The World Economic Outlook (WEO) of the International Monetary Fund projects the Indian economy to reach $5 trillion by FY28 and $6.307 trillion by FY30. In order to achieve these projected rates, the country must grow at an annual rate of about 10.2% in USD terms for FY25-FY30. In order to become a competitive and innovative economy, the country must attract major investments, according to the survey. The survey also mentioned China's impact on shaping India’s economic future. Since China dominates the global economy for energy transition and supply chains and India has ambitious clean energy goals, the latter’s reliance on Chinese imports could pose economic and strategic challenges, particularly potential supply chain disruptions, currency risks and price fluctuations.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Jan 31, 2025Tune InMust Watch

Headline: Commercial LPG cylinder rates slashed by Rs 7 ahead of Union BudgetAhead of the Union Budget 2025-26, oil marketing companies have reduced the rate of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders by Rs 7 with effect from today.
Content: Ahead of the Union Budget 2025-26, oil marketing companies have reduced the rate of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders by Rs 7 with effect from today. This is the second consecutive month that the rate of commercial LPG cylinders has been slashed. As of today, the retail sale price of a 19 kg commercial LPG cylinder in Delhi will be available at Rs 1,797 instead of Rs 1,804. This comes ahead of the Union Budget which will be presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman for the eighth consecutive time. On January 1, commercial LPG cylinders' price was reduced by Rs 14.50 from Rs 1,818.50 to Rs 1,804. In December last year, the rate of commercial LPG cylinders was hiked by Rs 16.50. However, the prices of 14.2 kg domestic LPG cylinders have remained unchanged. A domestic LPG cylinder is priced Rs 803 in Delhi, Rs 829 in Kolkata, Rs 802 in Mumbai and Rs 818 in Chennai. The prices for both commercial and domestic LPG cylinders are revised on the first day of every month.Published By: sharangee Published On: Feb 1, 2025

Headline: Budget 2025: Is stock market open for trading today?Stock market today: The Budget is one of the most important events for the stock market, with policy changes and fiscal measures often leading to sharp movements in stock prices.
Content: The Union Budget 2025 will be presented on Saturday by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, outlining the government's financial plans for the coming year. Investors and traders will be closely watching the announcements, as they can impact market sentiment. The Budget is one of the most important events for the stock market, with policy changes and fiscal measures often leading to sharp movements in stock prices. But since today is a Saturday, many are wondering whether the stock market will remain open for trading. The National Stock Exchange (NSE) and the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) have confirmed that the stock market will be open for trading on Budget day. In a circular issued earlier this week, both exchanges said that trading would continue as per regular market hours. The equity markets will operate from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM, while commodity derivatives trading will be available until 5:00 PM. However, the T+0 settlement session will remain suspended due to a settlement holiday. Stock exchanges usually remain closed on weekends, but special trading sessions have been conducted in the past when the Budget was presented on a non-working day. Similar instances occurred in 2020 and 2015, ensuring that investors could react immediately to the government’s fiscal decisions. Keeping the market open on Budget day allows investors and traders to respond in real time to key announcements, such as changes in tax policies, government spending plans, and incentives for different industries.STOCK MARKET TIMING TODAY Before regular trading begins, a pre-market session will be held from 9:00 AM to 9:08 AM to help determine opening prices. The benchmark indices Nifty 50 and Sensex will be updated live throughout the day, reflecting market reactions to Budget announcements. The stock market often sees increased volatility on Budget day as investors react to announcements. If the government introduces policies that promote economic growth, markets may rise. On the other hand, unexpected fiscal measures or concerns about high spending could trigger market corrections. Historically, markets have shown mixed reactions on Budget day, with some years bringing strong gains and others seeing sharp declines. Earlier, the Union Budget was presented on the last working day of February. However, in 2017, the date was moved to February 1 to allow more time for the implementation of financial policies within the financial year. Since then, the Budget has been presented on February 1 every year.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Feb 1, 2025

Headline: Budget day jitters: Sensex, Nifty open flat as investors await key announcementsStock market today: The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 31.61 points to 77,468.96, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 19.30 points to 23,489.10 as of 9:20 AM.
