Headline: How much can you save with maximum deductions under old income tax regime?Old tax regime: What if someone earning above Rs 12.75 lakh annually chooses the old regime and claims the maximum deductions? Will it result in tax savings? This article explores the key deductions available under the old income tax regime and the maximum amount one can claim.
Content:
The new income tax regime has become better than before after the fresh proposals in the Union Budget 2025. With no tax payable up to Rs 12.75 lakh, many taxpayers are expected to shift to the new tax regime.  In contrast, the budget had nothing for the old income tax regime, which had been the preferred choice for salaried individuals with more annual income and investments. While the government does not have any plans to shut it down, the old income tax regime could see a massive drop in adoption from the next financial year. But what if someone earning above Rs 12.75 lakh annually chooses the old regime and claims the maximum deductions? Will it result in tax savings? This article explores the key deductions available under the old income tax regime and the maximum amount one can claimKEY DEDUCTIONS THAT REDUCE TAXABLE INCOME Under the old income tax regime, taxpayers can claim deductions under different sections of the Income Tax Act, 1961, to lower their taxable income. These include: Standard Deduction: Salaried individuals and pensioners can claim a standard deduction of Rs 50,000 under Section 16. Investments under Section 80C: Contributions to instruments like Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF), Public Provident Fund (PPF), Equity-Linked Savings Schemes (ELSS), National Savings Certificates (NSC), tax-saving fixed deposits, and life insurance premiums qualify for a deduction of up to â‚¹1,50,000. Additional Deduction for NPS: Under Section 80CCD(1B), an additional â‚¹50,000 deduction is available for contributions to the National Pension System (NPS), over and above the Section 80C limit. Employer contributions to NPS under Section 80CCD(2) are also deductible, up to 10% of salary (or 14% for government employees). House Rent Allowance (HRA): Taxpayers living in rented accommodation can claim HRA deductions under Section 10(13A). The deductible amount is the least of:
Actual HRA received
50% of salary (for metro cities) or 40% (for non-metro cities)
Rent paid minus 10% of salary
 Home loan interest deduction: A deduction of up to Rs 2,00,000 is allowed under Section 24(b) on interest paid for a home loan on a self-occupied property. For rented properties, there is no upper limit on the interest deduction, but the maximum loss that can be set off against other income in a year is Rs 2,00,000.CHECK ADDITIONAL TAX BENEFITS Beyond these common deductions, taxpayers can claim additional benefits under specific sections: Medical Insurance (Section 80D):
Up to Rs 25,000 for self, spouse, and children
An additional Rs 50,000 for senior citizen parents
Maximum deduction: Rs 1,00,000
 Education Loan Interest (Section 80E): Interest on education loans for higher studies is fully deductible without an upper limit, but only for eight years from the start of repayment. Savings Interest (Sections 80TTA & 80TTB):
Rs 10,000 deduction for savings account interest (for non-senior citizens).
â‚¹50,000 deduction for senior citizens (includes fixed deposit interest).
 Donations to Charities (Section 80G): Donations to specified funds and institutions are eligible for a 50% or 100% deduction, subject to conditions. For example, contributions to the PM CARES Fund and the National Defence Fund qualify for a 100% deduction without a limit.WHAT IS THE MAXIMUM DEDUCTION POSSIBLE? Pallav Pradyumn Narang, Partner at CNK, suggested that deductions of up to Rs 8.50 lakh can be claimed under the old tax regime.  "The old tax regime is beneficial if the exemptions and deductions such as HRA, LTA, and Chapter VI-A deductions are more than Rs 8 lakh and the total income is up to Rs 5 crore. In these instances, the taxpayer will pay less tax under the old regime compared to the new tax regime," Narang said.  Consider a salaried individual earning Rs 25 lakh per year. If they maximise their deductions, the taxable income could be significantly reduced:


Deduction Component
Maximum Deduction (â‚¹)




Standard Deduction
50,000


Section 80C (EPF, PPF, ELSS, etc.)
1,50,000


NPS (80CCD(1B))
50,000


Home Loan Interest (Self-Occupied)
2,00,000


Medical Insurance (Self & Senior Citizen Parents)
1,00,000


Education Loan Interest (80E)
No limit (assume Rs 1,00,000)


HRA (for a metro city)
2,50,000


Savings Interest (80TTA/TTB)
50,000


Total Deduction
Rs 8,50,000


 With these deductions, the taxable income reduces to Rs 16.5 lakh. However, a simple calculation shows that the new income tax regime is still better for someone earning Rs 25 lakh. Therefore, even after claiming Rs 8.50 lakh in deductions under the old regime, the tax outgo will slighlty more in comparison to the new tax regime. OLD VS NEW REGIME: WHICH ONE TO CHOOSE? For taxpayers who have minimal deductions, the new tax regime with lower slab rates is the obvious option. And for individuals with high investments, home loans, and eligible expenses, the old regime may lead to lower tax outgo. However, with the reduced tax slabs and rates under the new regime, only a handful of individuals with very high annual incomes and investments may benefit slightly.  Simply put, the new income tax regime seems to be the easier and better choice for most taxpayers after the massive changes in the Union Budget 2025.Published By: Koustav DasPublished On: Feb 6, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Zomato board approves renaming company to Eternal Ltd: CEO Deepinder GoyalThe renaming announcement comes weeks after Zomato entered the BSE Sensex on December 23, which coincides with the 17th anniversary of its founding.
Content: Zomato will soon be known as Eternal Ltd., with the company's board approving the name change, CEO Deepinder Goyal announced in a letter to shareholders. The food delivery brand, however, will continue to be called Zomato. Goyal said the decision marks a new chapter for the company as it expands beyond food delivery. "When we acquired Blinkit, we started using ‘Eternal’ internally to distinguish between the company and the brand/app. We also thought that we would publicly rename the company to Eternal, the day something beyond Zomato became a significant driver of our future. Today, with Blinkit, I feel we are there," he wrote. The renaming comes weeks after Zomato entered the BSE Sensex on December 23, which coincides with the 17th anniversary of its founding. "Becoming the first tech startup in India to make it to the Sensex is a moment of pride and also a moment of reflection, bringing with it a heightened sense of responsibility," Goyal said. Eternal Ltd. will house four businesses—Zomato, Blinkit, District, and Hyperpure. Once shareholders approve the change, the company will transition its corporate website from zomato.com to eternal.com, and its stock ticker will shift from ZOMATO to ETERNAL. Calling "Eternal" a powerful yet daunting name, Goyal said, "It is a tall order to live up to. Because ‘Eternal’ carries both a promise and a paradox. True permanence isn’t built on bold claims of invincibility or the swagger of success."  Goyal said this is not just a name change but a mission statement. "A reminder etched into our identity that we will endure—not because we are here, but because we need to get there," he said. Published By: Anuja JhaPublished On: Feb 6, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: What if you default on personal loan? Check consequencesPersonal loan default consequences: Banks or lenders impose hefty penalties, or late fee charges in case of a missed EMI amount. They may even impose higher interest charges and additional charges for collection efforts.
Content: Personal loans can be a lifesaver during an emergency and financial crisis. However, defaulting on personal loans can have serious consequences, including immediate and long-term consequences. It also negatively impacts one’s credit score. That said, this article explores what happens when a borrower defaults on a personal loan. Generally, banks or lenders impose hefty penalties, or late fee charges in case of a missed EMI amount. They may even impose higher interest charges and additional charges for collection efforts. Eventually, the total amount due gradually increases, making it even more challenging to repay the loan amount. A default on a personal loan amount will have a negative impact on your credit score. This damage will be reflected on your credit report, making it difficult to secure a loan in future. In case of multiple instances of missed repayments or EMIs, the lender will issue a notice for repayment and can even initiate legal action against the borrower. In an event of genuine financial hardship, the borrower can approach the lender for modification of the loan amount or payment deferral and may even negotiate a one-time settlement amount. However, this reduced amount to close the loan, will adversely impact your credit score. In other words, taking a personal loan involves huge financial responsibility. One must weigh one’s repaying capacity before availing a personal loan and must not borrow more than needed. Take proactive measures to avoid being a loan defaulter and ensure timely payments of the loan amount.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Feb 6, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Want to redeem credit card points? Check these 2 simple ways How to redeem credit card points: The number of credit card points one earns depends on the type of card, whether basic or premium, and the amount spent.
Content: Nowadays, countless people use credit cards and enjoy the rewards they offer. These rewards can be freebies, gifts, discounts and even credit card points. However, not many people know about credit card points. These are a type of rewards that credit card holders earn when they make purchases through a credit card. These points can then be redeemed later for a wide range of gifts or perks. Users can use these credit card points for paying utility bills, shopping, dining and even travel. In fact, the number of credit card points one earns depends on the type of card, whether basic or premium, and the amount spent.HOW TO REDEEM CREDIT CARD POINTS Reward points can be redeemed in several ways. Users must link the credit card through a bank’s online portal. Submit your credentials for accessing the account. Review the reward points and check the reward catalogue for gifts or merchandise. Choose your preferred reward and place the order. Users can also contact the customer service helpline for redemption of the reward points. Download the redemption form, fill it out, select your gift from the available options and send an email requesting your choice of gift. Also, these days, most of the credit card issuers have partnerships with several retail stores. One can shop at any of these partner shops and make purchases via the rewards points. However, credit card points generally come with an expiration date and must be redeemed within a specific period. Users must be aware of these and must keep an eye on their point balance and reap the maximum benefits.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Feb 6, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: HDFC Bank UPI services unavailable on this date. Get details hereDuring the downtime, the UPI transactions on HDFC Bank's current and savings accounts and RuPay credit cards will be affected.
Content: HDFC Bank has alerted its customers about the non-availability of Unified Payments Interface (UPI) services on February 8, 2025, owing to system maintenance. The bank’s UPI service will be impacted for three hours, i.e., from 12.00 AM to 3.00 AM on Saturday. During this downtime, the UPI transactions on HDFC Bank’s current and savings accounts and RuPay credit cards will be affected. The downtime would also impact HDFC Mobile Banking app and TRAPs (Third Party Application Providers) apps supported by HDFC Bank. Moreover, merchant UPI transactions through HDFC Bank would also be temporarily affected. Customers, particularly those who rely on UPI payments, are advised to complete essential transactions related to fund transfers, bill payments, etc. prior to the start of the downtime. This would help negate any inconvenience or disruptions during the system maintenance period.  WHAT IS UPI?  UPI, developed by National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) in 2016, is an instant payment protocol and system that powers several bank accounts into a single mobile application. It allows easy fund transfers though a unique UPI ID which is linked to one’s bank account. It requires two-factor authentication, which makes it safe and secure to use. Customers wanting to register for UPI service through HDFC mobile banking app must download the bank’s mobile app and submit the login credentials. Enter the desired UPI PIN and add your bank account.  Now start using UPI services with the click of a button.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Feb 6, 2025Tune InTrending Reel

Headline: Home loans to get cheaper as RBI cuts rates. Check detailsThe RBI MPC reduced key lending rates by 25 basis points to 6.25%, the first rate cut in nearly five years under the leadership of newly appointed RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra.
Content: The Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) has cut the repo rate by 25 basis points to 6.25%. The announcement, made on Friday, marks the first rate cut since May 2020 and comes under the leadership of newly appointed RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra. This decision means home loan interest rates will come down, bringing relief to homebuyers. The repo rate is the rate at which the RBI lends money to commercial banks. When the repo rate is reduced, banks can borrow funds at a lower cost, which often leads to cheaper loans for customers. With this latest cut, home loan EMIs are expected to decrease, making property purchases more affordable. "Lower home loan interest rates will provide much-needed relief to homebuyers, making property purchases more affordable by reducing EMIs. This move is expected to drive demand for housing, boosting market activity and encouraging more people to invest in real estate. It also enhances confidence among both buyers and developers, leading to a stronger and more dynamic sector. Developers will benefit from easier access to funds, helping them complete projects faster and meet the rising demand," said Manju Yagnik, Vice Chairperson of Nahar Group and Senior Vice President of NAREDCO- Maharashtra.  Before the announcement, analysts were uncertain about whether the RBI would lower the rate or keep it unchanged to manage inflation and maintain currency stability. However, with inflation appearing to be under control and economic growth remaining steady, the central bank decided to lower rates.advertisementPublished By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Feb 7, 2025

Headline: RBI reduces key lending rate by 25 basis points to 6.25%The rate cut announced by the committee is the first since 2020. This was also the first policy meeting of Sanjay Malhotra as RBI Governor.
Content: The Reserve Bank of India’s (RBI) Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) announced a rate cut by 25 basis points to 6.25% on Friday under the leadership of newly appointed Governor Sanjay Malhotra.   After assessing the current and evolving macroeconomic situation, the MPC unanimously decided to reduce the policy repo rate under the liquidity adjustment facility (LAF) by 25 basis points to 6.25 per cent with immediate effect," said RBI governor Sanjay Malhotra.  The rate cut announced by the committee is the first since 2020. This was also the first policy meeting of Sanjay Malhotra as RBI Governor. "The RBI’s decision to reduce the repo rate by 25 basis points to 6.25% supplements recent announcements in the budget aimed at boosting spending and spurring economic growth," said Boman Irani, President, CREDAI National. This supportive monetary policy was imperative, especially after the recent 50-basis-point reduction in the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR), which has already injected significant liquidity into the banking system. As inflations continues to remain a notch higher than the medium-term target of 4%, the central bank has its task cut out - Contain inflation, inject liquidity into banking system and cut repo rates in the coming quarter too. "On the domestic front, as per the First Advance Estimates (FAE), real gross domestic product (GDP) is estimated to grow at 6.4 per cent (y-o-y) in 2024-25 supported by a recovery in private consumption," said Malhotra.  The next meeting of the MPC is scheduled from April 7 to 9, 2025.Published By: sharangee Published On: Feb 7, 2025

Headline: Stock markets open flat as investors await RBI policy decision; ITC down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 23.98 points to 78,034.18, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 7 points to 23,596.35 as of 9:35 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices opened flat on Friday as investors waited for key policy decision announcements by the RBI Monetary Policy Committee (MPC).  The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 23.98 points to 78,034.18, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 7 points to 23,596.35 as of 9:35 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that today the market will be focused on the policy response from the MPC, particularly the message from the new RBI chief. "Even though the INR depreciation doesn’t provide the favourable macro construct for a rate cut, the market expects the MPC to vote for a rate cut today, providing a monetary stimulus complementing the fiscal stimulus given in the Budget. Since a 25 bp rate cut is partly discounted by the market, there can be a sell off if the rate cut doesn’t materialise," he added.  There is only limited upside for the market since the FIIs have gone back to selling mode after one day of symbolic buying. Apart from financials, IT and pharma stocks will continue to be the focus of DIIsPublished By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Feb 7, 2025

Headline: RBI introduces 'bank.in' domain for Indian banks to tackle financial fraudThe move aims to strengthen the digital security framework and tackle growing financial fraud.
Content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has announced an exclusive internet domain 'bank.in' for Indian banks. Sanjay Malhotra, RBI’s newly appointed Governor, made this announcement at the Monetary Policy Committee meeting on Friday. The central bank would also roll out ‘fin.in’ for the financial sector later. The said move aims to strengthen the digital security framework and tackle growing financial fraud. The central bank in its latest notification mentioned, "The Reserve Bank shall implement the 'bank.in' exclusive Internet Domain for Indian banks. Registration of this domain name will commence from April this year. This will help avoid banking frauds. This will be followed by the ‘fin.in’ domain for the financial sector." Starting April 2025, all the Indian banks will be mandated to operate under ‘bank.in’ domain. This will help customers to differentiate legitimate banking websites from lookalike and fraudulent websites, thereby reducing digital fraud. The RBI has also introduced Additional Factor of Authentication (AFA) for domestic digital payments, thus enhancing stricter measures for online banking. "The Reserve Bank has been taking various measures to enhance digital security in the banking and payments system. Introduction of Additional Factor of Authentication (AFA) for domestic digital payments is one such measure. It is proposed to extend AFA to online international digital payments made to offshore merchants, who are enabled for such authentication,” stated the central bank. The bank further mentioned in its notification,"Banks and NBFCs must continuously improve preventive and detective controls to mitigate cyber risks. They must develop robust incident response and recovery mechanisms, reinforced through periodic testing, for operational resilience." The said move would help combat cybercrime, prevent malicious activities, and strengthen the country’s financial ecosystem.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Feb 7, 2025Must Watch

Headline: RBI cuts repo rate: 6 key takeaways from MPC announcementThe central bank has announced a reduction in the repo rate by 25 basis points for the first time in nearly five years.
Content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has declared a reduction in the repo rate. The announcement was made by Sanjay Malhotra, in his first key address after being appointed as the RBI Governor in December last year. That said, the following are the six key announcements from the MPC meeting:REPO RATE CUT The central bank has announced a cut in the repo cut by 25 basis points to 6.25% from 6.5%. As a result, the standing deposit facility (SDF) rate stands at 6%, while the marginal standing facility (MSF) rate and the Bank Rate are now at 6.50%. Radhika Rao, Executive Director and Senior Economist, DBS Bank said, "The RBI monetary policy committee voted unanimously for a 25 bps rate cut, backed by a cautious view on growth while winter disinflation in food is expected to limit price stability risks." "Notably, an emphasis on the flexibility of the inflation targeting framework suggests the MPC might be more tolerant of intermittent modest supply driven volatility. The GDP forecasts point to growth staying below 7% this year and the next," she added.GDP OUTLOOK With a reduction in the repo rate and an expected recovery in industrial activity and robust household consumption, along with positive business sentiments, the RBI has projected the real gross domestic product (GDP) at 6.7% for 2025-26. Quarterly projections for GDP growth are enumerated as follows: Q1: 6.7% Q2: 7% Q3: 6.5% Q4: 6.5%CHEAPER HOME LOANS With a reduction in the repo rate, the rate of interest on home loans will witness a dip, thereby bringing much-needed relief to the homebuyers. This would give a boost to demand for housing and encourage investment in the real estate sector, benefitting both end-users and investors.INFLATION OUTLOOK The RBI mentioned that headline inflation eased during November-December 2024, as compared to 6.2% in October.  The central bank anticipates core inflation to remain moderate. However, uncertainty in global financial markets and adverse weather conditions coupled with volatility in energy prices may pose a risk. Anticipating a normal monsoon in the coming year, the central bank has projected consumer price index (CPI) inflation for 2025-26 to be at 4.2%. CPI inflation projections for the upcoming quarters are as follows: Q1: 4.5% Q2: 4.0% Q3: 3.8% Q4: 4.2%RBI'S STANCE ON INDIAN ECONOMY The central bank will continue with its neutral monetary policy stance owing to the global economy’s slow pace of disinflation, ongoing geopolitical tensions, and policy uncertainties.WOMEN EMPOWERMENT The RBI in its endeavour to enhance women’s role in financial decision-making and household budgeting, will launch a campaign titled "Financial Literacy: Women’s Prosperity,” commencing from February 24. It has urged banks across the country to actively participate in the above-mentioned campaign to promote women’s financial inclusion in the broader economic growth and stability.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Feb 7, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Who is Mohini Mohan Dutta? Rs 500 crore surprise in Ratan Tata's willRatan Tata also left behind a share for his siblings, his butler Subbiah and German Shepherd Tito have also been provided for in his will.
Content: When a man as private as Ratan Tata leaves behind a will, it’s expected to be carefully planned with philanthropy, family, and legacy expected to be a part of it. But what no one saw coming was a Rs 500 crore twist, with one name standing out like an unsolved puzzle, Mohini Mohan Dutta. Dutta, a businessman from Jamshedpur, has reportedly been left over Rs 500 crore, reported The Economic Times. His name in the will has sparked curiosity, as Ratan Tata, who passed away in October 2024, was known to be a private person. Ratan Tata also left behind a share for his siblings, his butler Subbiah and German Shepherd Tito have also been provided for in his will as per media reports.  Ratan Tata, the former Chairman of Tata Sons, the parent company of Tata Group companies, died on October 9. He was 86.WHO IS MOHINI MOHAN DUTTA? Mohini Mohan Dutta, now in his 80s, is a businessman who first met Ratan Tata in the early 1960s. Their first meeting reportedly took place at the Dealers’ Hostel in Jamshedpur when Tata was 24 years old as per media reports and still finding his way in the family business. Dutta has said that meeting Tata changed the course of his life. Dutta’s career has had close links with the Tata Group. He began his journey with the Taj Group and later founded Stallion Travel Agency. His company eventually merged with Taj Services, a division of the Taj Group of Hotels, in 2013. Tata Industries had an 80% stake in the business before Tata Capital acquired and later sold it to Thomas Cook (India). Dutta remains a director at the rebranded TC Travel Services and holds shares in Tata Group companies, including Tata Capital, which is preparing for a stock market listing. Dutta was not just a business associate—his relationship with Ratan Tata appears to have been deeply personal. A report by ToI describes him as “more than an associate, an adopted son,” though legally, Tata never married or had children. Dutta’s daughter also has ties to the Tata Group, having worked with Tata Trusts for nearly a decade after starting her career at Taj Hotels. He was present at Ratan Tata’s birth anniversary event at the NCPA in Mumbai in December 2024, which was attended by Tata’s closest associates.WHAT WILL MOHINI MOHAN DUTTA GET? According to The Economic Times, Dutta has been left one-third of Ratan Tata’s residual estate. This includes bank deposits worth over Rs 350 crore and proceeds from the auction of Tata’s personal belongings, such as paintings and watches.  However, media reports suggest that Dutta believes his inheritance will be worth Rs 650 crore, a figure that does not match the executors’ current estimates. The remaining two-thirds of Ratan Tata’s residual estate have been left to his half-sisters, Shireen Jejeebhoy and Deanna Jejeebhoy. The will is being executed by Tata Trusts trustees Darius Khambata and Mehli Mistry, along with Tata’s half-sisters. Ratan Tata’s half-brother, Noel Tata, and his children have not been included in the will. Meanwhile, Tata’s brother Jimmy Tata has been left Rs 50 crore, as per reports.  (NOTE - India Today digital has not been able to verify the details of the will.)Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Feb 7, 2025

Headline: Sensex tanks 500 points after RBI MPC: Why is stock market falling todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 539.72 points to 77,516.79, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 147.50 points to 23,455.60 as of 2:43 PM.
Content:
The stock market reacted sharply after the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) announced a 25 basis point rate cut, reducing the key lending rate to 6.25%. The markets saw a volatile session, initially falling nearly 200 points, then gaining over 200 points before dropping more than 500 points later in the day. PSU banks and FMCG sector stocks were the worst hit, as most sectoral indices traded in the red. But why did the market react this way? The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 539.72 points to 77,516.79, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 147.50 points to 23,455.60 as of 2:43 PM.  Despite expectations of a rate cut, investors seemed disappointed with the RBI’s decision and its stance on future rate cuts.WHY IS STOCK MARKET FALLING TODAY?Rate cut already priced in The RBI’s rate cut was widely expected, so markets had already factored it in. Experts say this is why the announcement did not boost sentiment. "It was widely anticipated that the RBI would deliver a rate cut, so the market has not reacted much to it. In fact, India’s 10-year bond yields have spiked as the committee unanimously voted to continue with a neutral stance. We believe that this rate cut is a step in the right direction. However, the size and timing of further rate cuts will depend on how the US Federal Reserve moves forward," said Apurva Sheth, Head of Market Perspectives at SAMCO Securities.Profit booking after recent rally In the past few days, markets had rallied in anticipation of the rate cut. The Nifty had surged 500-700 points recently, meaning investors took the opportunity to book profits after the announcement. "Over the last few days, in anticipation of the rate cut, the markets have rallied. After the announcement, we saw profit booking during the intraday session. Once the Nifty broke the 23,500 support level, we saw some selling pressure. However, as long as the market stays above 23,000, the medium to short-term outlook remains positive," said Kranthi Bathini, Director - Equity Strategy, WealthMills Securities. "Right now, we are seeing technical adjustments in the market. Breaking below 23,500 led to more profit booking, but overall, market sentiment remains positive in the medium term," Bathini added.
Banking stocks: PSU banks were among the worst performers today as rate cuts generally impact their net interest margins.
FMCG stocks: Fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) companies also saw declines as investors booked profits after recent gains.
Bond market impact: India’s 10-year bond yields rose, indicating that bond investors were not fully convinced by the RBI’s move.
Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Feb 7, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Activate UAN to avail EPFO's ELI scheme benefits before February 15. Check detailsEPFO ELI: UAN or Universal Account Number is a unique 12-digit number allotted by EPFO which is necessary for managing provident fund accounts.
Content: The Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has announced the extension of the deadline to activate the Universal Account Number (UAN) from January 15 to February 15. The EPFO mentioned in its circular dated February 2, 2025, “Please refer to the circulars mentioned under references. In this connection, the competent authority has granted an extension of the timeline for UAN activation and Aadhaar seeding in bank accounts till 15th February 2025.” The activation of UAN and linking the bank account with Aadhaar is essential for availing benefits under the EPFO's Employment Linked Incentive (ELI) Scheme.WHAT IS UAN? UAN or Universal Account Number is a unique 12-digit number allotted by the EPFO which is necessary for managing provident fund accounts. It links all EPF accounts from different employers into one account and helps in the easy transfer of funds when switching jobs. The UAN also enhances security by protecting both account information and transactions through secure authentication. Moreover, it helps in streamlining the retirement savings process for employees as it does away with the hassle of consolidating multiple PF accounts created under various employers. The documents required to generate a UAN include PAN Card, Aadhaar card, identity proof (passport, voter ID, driving licence, etc.), address proof and bank account details, etc.UNDERSTANDING ELI SCHEME Employee Linked Incentive (ELI) schemes, introduced in Budget 2024, aims to boost employment in the formal sector and offers benefits to both employers and first-time employees. To seek benefits, one must enrol with the EPFO. Currently, there are three Employee Linked Incentive (ELI) schemes. Scheme A caters to first-time employees, Scheme B is for the manufacturing sector, while Scheme C aims to provide support to employers.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Feb 7, 2025

Headline: Sensex, Nifty end lower after volatile session; FMCG, energy drag marketThe S&P BSE Sensex fell by 197.97 points to end at 77,860.19, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 43.40 points to close at 23,559.95.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices closed lower on Friday amid a hghly volatile session ending the week in a decline. Metal and auto sector stocks gained, but they were offset by the decline in FMCG, public banking and the energy sector.  The S&P BSE Sensex fell by 197.97 points to end at 77,860.19, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by 43.40 points to close at 23,559.95.  Ajit Mishra, SVP-Research, Religare Broking Limited said that markets remained volatile and ended slightly lower, extending the recent decline in the index. "After a flat start, the index saw sharp swings in both directions during the first half but lacked a clear directional move, reacting largely to the MPC’s review meeting, which delivered a rate cut in line with expectations. Eventually, it settled at 23,566. Among sectors, metals and auto showed strength, while FMCG and energy slipped. Broader indices also traded mixed, closing flat to marginally lower," he added.  With major events now behind us, the focus will shift back to earnings for further cues. On the benchmark front, Nifty held its crucial short-term support at the 20 DEMA, and sustaining this level will be key for a potential rebound towards 23,900. Otherwise, the bias may turn sideways. Meanwhile, traders should maintain a stock-specific approach with a strong emphasis on risk management.advertisementPublished By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Feb 7, 2025

Headline: Infosys 'forcefully' lays off 700 trainees in Mysuru: ReportMost of the affected recruits were from the engineering batch of 2022, who were onboarded after a wait of about 2.25 years, said sources.
Content: Infosys is laying off nearly 700 campus recruits at its Mysuru campus just months after onboarding them in October 2024. The move has been condemned by the Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES), reported The Economic Times. About 400 employees were called in batches and issued ultimatum letters after failing to meet the minimum qualifying requirements, several employees told The Economic Times. However, Infosys said the actual number of layoffs is less than 350. The company also stated, “At Infosys, we have a rigorous hiring process where all freshers, after undergoing extensive foundational training at our Mysuru campus, are expected to clear internal assessments. All freshers get three attempts to clear the assessment, failing which they will not be able to continue with the organisation, as is also mentioned in their contract. This process has been in existence for over two decades and ensures a high quality of talent availability for our clients.” Nearly 2,000 graduates from that year's batch faced delays in their onboarding process after Infosys extended offer letters for system engineer (SE) and digital SE positions, with annual salaries ranging from Rs 3.2 lakh to Rs 3.7 lakh, as per report. "The company has deployed bouncers and security personnel to intimidate employees, ensuring that they cannot carry mobile phones and are left with no way to document the incident or seek help," ET quoted NITES as saying. “Today, in a completely undignified manner, Infosys has summoned these employees to meeting rooms at its Mysore campus, where they are being coerced into signing "mutual separation" letters under duress,” said NITES President, Harpreet Singh Saluja in a statement. He said that the affected employees have been given ultimatum to leave the company premises by the evening with no support or severance package offered to them. NITES is filing an official complaint to the Labour Ministry Government of India regarding the matter and has urged the government to intervene and look into the matter urgently, as per the report.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Feb 7, 2025Trending Reel

Headline: 5 things about Mohini Mohan Dutta: The man named in Ratan Tata's willWhile most anticipated that Ratan Tata's wealth would go towards philanthropy, family members, and other charitable causes, Mohini Mohan Dutta's mention in his will has surprised many.
Content: Until recently, not many people had heard about Mohini Mohan Dutta. But following the unsealing of Ratan Tata’s will, Dutta's name has raised many eyebrows and has become a topic of interest. While most people anticipated that Tata’s wealth would go towards philanthropy, family members including his brother and his half sisters, and other charitable causes, Dutta’s mention in his will surprised many. Mohini Mohan Dutta is reportedly set to receive Rs 500 crore from Tata's willl, as per The Economic Times.   That said, this article will cover five things about Mohini Mohan Dutta. Mohini Mohan Dutta, who is in his 80s, is an entrepreneur from Jharkhand. He started his career with the Taj Group. Dutta first met Ratan Tata in the early 1960s at Jamshedpur’s Dealers’ Hostel. At that time, Tata, who was just 24 years old, was carving out his place in the vast Tata empire. That meeting changed the course of his life, said Dutta. Mohini Mohan Dutta founded Stallion Travel Agency, which merged with Taj Services in 2013. Tata Industries owned 80% of the stake in the company, which was later acquired by Tata Capital. Thereafter, the company was sold to Thomas Cook (India). Presently, the company operates as TC Travel services, with Dutta as director. Dutta’s connection with Ratan Tata extended beyond his career. Even his daughter worked for almost a decade with Tata Trusts. Mohini Mohan Dutta was both a business associate and a close confidant of Ratan Tata. Dutta considered himself an adopted son of Tata, as per Times of India. However, according to official documents, Rata Tata never married throughout his life and never adopted a son or daughter.Published By: Jasmine anandPublished On: Feb 7, 2025

Headline: Cabinet clears new income tax bill, likely to be tabled in Lok Sabha Monday: SourcesThe new legislation, which is often referred to as the Direct Tax Code, is aimed at overhauling the existing tax structure, making it more streamlined and transparent.
Content: The Union Cabinet on Friday approved the new income tax bill, which is likely to be presented in the Lok Sabha on Monday, sources told India Today. The bill is part of a broader push to reform the taxation system. The new legislation, which is often referred to as the Direct Tax Code, is aimed at overhauling the existing tax structure, making it more streamlined and transparent. While presenting the Union Budget 2025, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the government’s intent to bring a new Direct Tax Code. The bill is likely to be referred to the Standing Committee for further discussion and refinement of its provisions.WHAT WILL IT FOCUS ON? The government has already made it clear that the bill will not introduce any new taxes and just focus on simplifying tax laws, removing ambiguities, and ensuring ease of compliance for taxpayers. In addition, several amendments are expected to be introduced to the existing law, with a focus on reducing litigation. One of the provisions could include a reduction in penalties for certain offences, making the tax framework less punitive and more taxpayer-friendly. A crucial aspect of the new bill will be the simplification of legal language, ensuring that even ordinary taxpayers can easily understand tax provisions and their implications. The bill would reflect the government’s decade-long efforts focused on enhancing taxpayer convenience. During her Budget speech on February 1 in the Lok Sabha, the Finance Minister mentioned the tax department’s approach of "trust first, scrutinise later," assuring the government’s continued commitment to ease compliance. "It will be simple to understand for taxpayers and reduce litigation," said Nirmala Sitharaman. Sandeep Chilana, Managing Partner, CCLaw, said, “A complete overhaul of the Income Tax Act is a bold step, but the real question is whether it will truly simplify compliance or just reorganise complexities.” “If the new law can bring predictability, reduce disputes, and ease tax administration, it will be a game-changer. However, businesses and professionals will be watching closely to see how it handles legacy issues like retrospective taxation, complex exemptions, and litigation-heavy provisions. The success of this reform will depend on how effectively it balances revenue needs with a taxpayer-friendly approach,” Chilana added.Published By: Anuja JhaPublished On: Feb 7, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Meta plans to lay off 'lowest performance' staff next week, internal memo revealsNotices will go out to employees losing their jobs starting at 5 am local time on Monday in most countries, including in the US, according to one of the posts, authored by Meta's Head of People Janelle Gale.
Content: Facebook owner Meta Platforms META.O plans to carry out its expected company-wide layoffs next week while pushing ahead with the expedited hiring of machine learning engineers, it told staffers in internal memos seen by Reuters on Friday. Notices will go out to employees losing their jobs starting at 5 am local time on Monday in most countries, including in the US, according to one of the posts, authored by Meta's Head of People Janelle Gale. Employees in Germany, France, Italy and the Netherlands will be exempt from the cuts "due to local regulations," while those in more than a dozen other countries across Europe, Asia and Africa will receive their notifications between February 11 and February 18, it said. A Meta spokesperson declined to comment on the posts. The company confirmed last month that it was planning to trim about 5% of its "lowest performers" and backfill at least some of the positions. The Friday memo, in which Gale referred to the cuts as "performance terminations," was first reported by The Information. Unlike with previous company-wide layoffs, Meta was planning to keep its offices open on Monday and would not issue any updates providing further details on the decisions, Gale said in her post. A separate memo, posted by VP of Engineering for Monetization Peng Fan also on Friday, asked staffers to assist with an expedited hiring process for machine learning engineers and other "business critical" engineering roles. That process would take place between February 11 and March 13, Fan said in that post. "Thank you for your continued support in helping us achieve our accelerated hiring goals, and better align with our company's priorities for 2025."Published By: sharangee Published On: Feb 8, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Hope to introduce new income tax bill in Lok Sabha next week: Nirmala SitharamanAfter introduction in the Upper House, the bill, which was approved by the Union Cabinet chaired by PM Modi, will be sent to a parliamentary standing committee for scrutiny.
Content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday said she is likely to introduce the new income tax bill, which will replace the six-decade-old I-T Act, in the Lok Sabha in the coming week. After introduction in the Upper House, the bill will be sent to a parliamentary standing committee for scrutiny. The Union Cabinet, chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, approved the bill on Friday. "Yesterday, the Cabinet cleared the New Income Tax proposal, I hope to have it introduced in the Lok Sabha in the coming week. Post that it will go to a committee," Sitharaman said in a media briefing after addressing the post-Budget customary meeting with the central board of directors of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI). The bill will again go to the Cabinet after the parliamentary committee gives its recommendations on it. After Cabinet approval, it will again be introduced in Parliament. "I still have three critical stages to pass through," Sitharaman said to the query regarding rollout of the new income tax law. Sitharaman had first announced a comprehensive review of the Income-Tax Act, 1961 in the July 2024 Budget. The CBDT had set up an internal committee to oversee the review and make the Act concise, clear, and easy to understand, which will reduce disputes, litigations, and provide greater tax certainty to taxpayers. Also, 22 specialised sub-committees have been established to review the various aspects of the Income Tax Act. To another question, the Finance Minister said last week's Budget announcement on customs duty rationalisation is a work that has been on since the last two years. "So we had rationalised some even two years ago. We also set certain norms saying evergreening is not going to happen on anti-dumping duties, which had played a big role in giving some kind of a protection for India's own manufacturing capabilities," she said. Sitharaman further said with every such expiry date getting closer, the government will review it thoroughly, and only in exceptional cases duties will be extended, but most often they should be concluded so that the protection does not become a perpetual protection. "So, this is an ongoing process. We want to make India a lot more investor-friendly, trade friendly, and at the same time, balance it with Aatmanibhar Bharat where we need to have production, particularly through the MSMEs. We will provide the tariff protection as required by the industry," the Finance Minister, who presented her eighth straight Budget on February 1, said. In her Budget speech, Sitharaman had announced rationalisation of customs tariff structure for industrial goods. As part of comprehensive review of customs rate structure announced in July 2024 Budget, on February 1, 2025 she proposed to remove seven tariff rates. This was over and above the seven tariff rates removed in the 2023-24 Budget. There will be now only eight remaining tariff rates, including 'zero' rate.Published By: Vivek Published On: Feb 8, 2025Must Watch

Headline: Who is Asmita Patel, the 'she-wolf of stock market' under SEBI scanner?SEBI has directed Patel, her firm Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Pvt Ltd (APGSOT), and several affiliated entities to return over Rs 53 crore collected as course fees.
Content:
Asmita Jitesh Patel, widely known as the “she-wolf of the stock market” or “options queen,” is now facing action from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) for alleged “ill gains.” The popular YouTube finfluencer has been barred from the capital markets. Sebi has directed Patel, her firm Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Pvt Ltd (APGSOT), and several affiliated entities—including Jitesh Jethalal Patel, King Traders, Gemini Enterprise, and United Enterprises—to return over Rs 53 crore collected as course fees.  The regulator initiated its investigation following complaints from 42 investors who alleged that APGSOT was engaged in unauthorised investment advisory activities. Additionally, the complainants claimed that Patel had amassed assets worth Rs 140 crore using her proprietary system. Sebi’s comprehensive 129-page order details these violations and permanently prohibits the accused from accessing the securities market.WHAT IS SEBI ACTION? Sebi has banned six entities—including Asmita Patel Global School of Trading (APGSOT), Asmita Patel, Jitesh Jethalal Patel, King Traders, Gemini Enterprise, and United Enterprises—from the capital markets for allegedly offering unregistered investment advisory services. According to a PTI report, the regulator has impounded over Rs 53 crore, which was collected as fees from course participants for various programmes. In an interim order-cum-show cause notice issued on February 6, Sebi also directed the six entities to explain why an additional Rs 104.63 crore—collected as fees for various programmes—should not be seized. The order stated, "Students/investors/participants were encouraged to leave the job and join MPAT (a course run by her institute) to make something big."WHO IS ASMITA PATEL?
Asmita Jitesh Patel is the director of Asmita Patel Global School of Trading Private Limited (AGSTPL), a company based in Navi Mumbai.
She was born into a traditional Gujarati family, according to her company's website. 
She has 17 years of trading experience and over a decade of teaching expertise, winning several awards for her contributions to financial education.
On her website, Patel offers “educational courses” on Options Multiplier (OM), Master’s in Price Action Trading (MPAT), and Let’s Make India Trade (LMIT). 
The website also describes Patel as “A woman who is on a mission to uplift the lives of people”, adding that she “seeks to empower people with the right knowledge when it comes to finance, stock market and investing one’s wealth in a responsible and mindful manner”.
She brands herself as the "She Wolf of the Stock Market" and the "Options Queen." 
She has claimed to have mentored over one lakh students worldwide.
Patel is a financial influencer and maintains a strong digital presence through her website, asmitapatel.com. 
She has a substantial following across social media platforms, with 5.26 lakh subscribers on YouTube, 2.9 lakh followers on Instagram, 73,000 followers on Facebook, 1,900 followers on LinkedIn, and 4,200 followers on Twitter X.
Patel's husband, Jitesh Patel, is also a director of AGSTPL.
Published By: Priya PareekPublished On: Feb 9, 2025

Headline: Sensex, Nifty tumble as rupee hits record low; metal, energy stocks dragThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 394.07 points to 77,466.12, while the NSE Niftt50 fell by 130.10 points to 23,429.85 as of 9:40 AM.
Content: Benchmark stock market indices tumbled in early trade on Monday as the rupee fell to a record low against the US dollar. Decline in metal and energy stocks also weighed on the market.  The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 394.07 points to 77,466.12, while the NSE Niftt50 fell by 130.10 points to 23,429.85 as of 9:40 AM.  Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services said that the Delhi election results, particularly the emphatic nature of the BJP win, though positive from the market perspective, are unlikely to trigger a sustained rally in the market. "With the dollar index above 108 and the 10-year US bond yield above 4.4%, FIIs will continue to sell the rally, restricting any potential upside. It is important to understand that valuations in India continue to be on the higher side, particularly in the broader market. The market needs fundamental triggers like indications on GDP growth and earnings rebound. Until then the market is likely to move only in a range. Investors should stick to fairly valued high quality largecaps," he added. Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Feb 10, 2025

Headline: Rupee tumbles 44 paise to record low of 87.94 against US dollar in early tradeIn early trade, the rupee weakened to 87.95 per U.S. dollar, surpassing its previous record low of 87.5825 from last week. It was last trading at 87.9325, down 0.6% for the day.
Content: The rupee hit a new all-time low on Monday as concerns over potential U.S. trade tariffs triggered losses across most regional currencies. Traders told Reuters that the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) would likely intervene to stabilise the currency. In early trade, the rupee weakened to 87.95 per U.S. dollar, surpassing its previous record low of 87.5825 from last week. It was last trading at 87.9325, down 0.6% for the day. Market participants noted that state-run banks were seen selling dollars before the spot market opened, possibly acting on behalf of the RBI. The rupee was expected to breach the 88 level at the open, but dollar sales helped it stay above this psychologically significant mark. Meanwhile, former US President Donald Trump announced plans on Sunday to impose a 25% tariff on steel and aluminium imports, along with reciprocal tariffs on all countries based on their respective trade policies. The dollar index strengthened to 108.3, while Asian currencies declined between 0.1% and 0.6%.Published By: Devika BhattacharyaPublished On: Feb 10, 2025

Headline: Ajax Engineering IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPThe bidding process will close on February 12, 2025. Before the IPO opened for public subscription, Ajax Engineering raised Rs 379.32 crore from anchor investors.
Content: The initial public offering (IPO) of Ajax Engineering Limited opened for bidding on Monday, February 10, 2025. The company aims to raise Rs 1,269.35 crore through the IPO, which is an offer for sale (OFS) of 2.02 crore shares.  The bidding process will close on February 12, 2025. Before the IPO opened for public subscription, Ajax Engineering raised Rs 379.32 crore from anchor investors. The price band for the IPO has been set between Rs 599 and Rs 629 per share. Retail investors need to apply for a minimum lot size of 23 shares, which requires an investment of Rs 14,467. Small non-institutional investors (sNII) must invest in at least 14 lots, amounting to Rs 2,02,538, while big non-institutional investors (bNII) need to invest in at least 70 lots, which equals Rs 10,12,690. The IPO is managed by ICICI Securities, Citigroup Global Markets India, JM Financial, Nuvama Wealth Management, and SBI Capital Markets. Link Intime India Private Ltd is the registrar for the issue.SHOULD YOU SUBSCRIBE?  Many investors are now wondering whether they should subscribe to this IPO. Several brokerage firms have analysed the offer and provided their recommendations. Reliance Securities said that Ajax Engineering Limited (AEL) has successfully expanded its business and increased its market share in non-SLCM (Self-Loading Concrete Mixers) equipment. The company is also growing its exports and looking for acquisition opportunities. Reliance Securities said that Ajax Engineering is expected to maintain its leadership in the large and growing SLCM market while also expanding its concrete equipment segment. The firm serves a diversified customer base and has strong financials. With an experienced management team and a focus on capital efficiency, Reliance Securities has recommended subscribing to the IPO. KRChoksey Research, BP Equities, and Ventura Securities have also given a positive recommendation for the IPO and advised investors to subscribe.LATEST GMP The latest grey market premium (GMP) for Ajax Engineering IPO is Rs 52 as of February 10, 2025. Based on this, the estimated listing price is Rs 681, which is calculated by adding the upper price band of Rs 629 and the latest GMP of Rs 52. This suggests a possible gain of 8.27% on listing. The IPO allotment process is expected to be completed on February 13, 2025. The shares are scheduled to be listed on the BSE and NSE on February 17, 2025.Published By: Sonu VivekPublished On: Feb 10, 2025

"With the blessings of Almighty God, Jeet and Diva got married today (Friday). It was a small and extremely private function, so we could not invite all the well-wishers even if we wanted to, for which I apologise," the billionaire tweeted.
